accomplysshed fynysshed dyuers hystoryes wel contemplacyon hystoryal worldly actes grete conquerours prynces also certeyn bookes ensaumples doctryne many noble dyuers gentylmen thys royame englond camen demaunded many oftymes wherfore haue made enprynte noble hystorye saynt greal moost renomed crysten kyng fyrst chyef thre best crysten worthy kyng arthur whyche ought moost remembred emonge v englysshe men tofore al crysten kynges notoyrly knowen thorugh vnyuersal world ix worthy best euer wete thre paynyms thre iewes thre crysten men paynyms tofore incarnacyon cryst whiche named fyrst hector troye whome thystorye comen bothe balade prose second alysaunder grete thyrd iulyus cezar emperour rome whome thystoryes ben wel kno thre iewes whyche also tofore thyncarnacyon lord whome fyrst duc iosue whyche brought chyldren israhel londe byheste second dauyd kyng iherusalem thyrd iudas machabeus thre byble reherceth al theyr noble hystoryes actes sythe sayd incarnacyon haue ben thre noble crysten men stalled admytted thorugh vnyuersal world nombre ix beste worthy whome fyrst noble arthur who noble actes purpose wryte thys present book folowyng second charlemayn charles grete whome thystorye many place bothe frensshe englysshe thyrd last godefray boloyn who actes lyf made book vnto thexcellent prynce kyng noble memorye kyng edward fourth sayd noble ientylmen instantly requyred temprynte thystorye sayd noble kyng conquerour kyng arthur knyghtes wyth thystorye saynt greal deth endyng sayd arthur affermyng ouy rather tenprynte actes noble feates godefroye boloyne ony eyght consyderyng man borne wythin royame kyng emperour ben frensshe dyuers many noble volume actes also knyghtes whome answerd dyuers men holde oppynyon suche arthur alle suche bookes maad hym ben fayned fable cause somme cronycles make hym mencyon ne remembre hym noo thynge ne knyghtes wherto answerd one specyal sayd hym shold say thynke neuer suche kyng callyd arthur myght wel aretted grete folye blyndenesse sayd many euydences contrarye fyrst ye may see sepulture monasterye glastyngburye also polycronycon v book syxte chappytre seuenth book xxiij chappytre body buryed founden translated sayd monasterye ye shal se also thystorye bochas book de casu principum parte noble actes also falle also galfrydus brutysshe book recounteth lyf dyuers place englond many remembraunces ben yet hym shall remayne perpetuelly also knyghtes fyrst abbey westmestre saynt edwardes shryne remayneth prynte seal reed waxe closed beryll whych wryton patricius arthurus britannie gallie germanie dacie imperator item castel douer ye may see gauwayns skulle cradoks mantel wynchester rounde table place launcelottes swerde many thynges thenne al thynges consydered man resonably gaynsaye kyng thys lande named arthur al place crysten hethen reputed taken one ix worthy fyrst thre crysten men also spoken beyonde see moo boookes made noble actes englond wel duche ytalyen spaynysshe grekysshe frensshe yet record remayne wytnesse hym wale toune camelot grete stone meruayllous werkys yron lyeng vnder grounde ryal vautes dyuers lyuyng hath seen wherfor meruayl nomore renomed owne contreye sauf onelye accordeth word god whyche sayth man accept prophete owne contreye thene al thynges forsayd aledged coude wel denye suche noble kyng named arthur reputed one ix worthy fyrst chyef cristen men many noble volume made hym noble knyytes frensshe haue seen redde beyonde see maternal tongue walsshe ben many also frensshe somme englysshe wher nygh alle wherfore suche haue late ben drawen oute bryefly englysshe haue symple connyng god hath sente vnder fauour correctyon al noble lordes gentylmen enprysed enprynte book noble hystoryes sayd kynge arthur certeyn knyghtes copye vnto delyuerd whyche copye syr thomas malorye dyd take oute certeyn bookes frensshe reduced englysshe accordyng copye haue doon sette enprynte entente noble men may see lerne noble actes chyualrye ientyl vertuous dedes somme knyghtes vsed tho dayes whyche came honour vycious punysshed ofte put shame rebuke humbly bysechyng al noble lordes ladyes wyth al estate estate degree shal see rede sayd book werke take good honest actes remembraunce folowe wherin shalle fynde many ioyous playsaunt hystoryes noble renomed actes humanyte gentylnesse chyualryes herein may seen noble chyualrye curtosye humanyte frendlynesse hardynesse loue frendshyp cowardyse murdre hate vertue synne doo good leue euyl shal brynge good fame renommee passe tyme thys boook shal plesaunte rede gyue fayth byleue al trewe conteyned herin ye lyberte al wryton doctryne beware falle vyce synne texcersyse folowe vertu whyche may come atteyne good fame renomme thys lyf thys shorte transytorye lyf come vnto euerlastyng blysse heuen whyche graunte v reygneth heuen blessyd trynyte amen thenne procede forth thys sayd book whyche dyrecte vnto alle noble prynces lordes ladyes gentylmen gentylwymmen desyre rede redde noble ioyous hystorye grete conquerour excellent kyng kyng arthur somtyme kyng thys noble royalme thenne callyd brytaygn wyllyam caxton symple persone present thys book folowyng whyche haue enprysed tenprynte treateth noble actes feates armes chyualrye prowesse hardynesse humanyte loue curtosye veray gentylnesse wyth many wonderful hystoryes aduentures vnderstonde bryefly contente thys volume haue deuyded xxj bookes euery book chapytred shal goddes grace folowe fyrst book shal treate vtherpendragon gate noble conquerour kyng arthur conteyneth xxviij chappytres second book treateth balyn noble knyght conteyneth xix chapytres thyrd book treateth maryage kyng arthur quene gueneuer wyth mater conteyneth fyftene chappytres fourth book merlyn assotted warre maad kyng arthur conteyneth xxix chappytres fyfthe book treateth conqueste lucius themperour conteyneth xij chappytres syxthe book treateth syr launcelot syr lyonel meruayllous aduentures conteyneth xviij chapytres seuenth book treateth noble knyght called syr gareth named syr kaye beaumayns conteyneth xxxvj chapytres eyght book treateth byrthe syr trystram noble knyght hys actes conteyneth xlj chapytres ix book treateth knyght named syr kaye le cote male taylle also syr trystram conteyneth xliiij chapytres x book treateth syr trystram meruayllous aduentures conteyneth lxxxviij chappytres xj book treateth syr launcelot syr galahad conteyneth xiiij chappytres xij book treateth syr launcelot madnesse conteyneth xiiij chappytres xiij book treateth galahad came fyrst kyng arthur courte quest sangreall begonne conteyneth xx chapytres xiiij book treateth queste sangreal conteyneth x chapytres xv book treateth syr launcelot conteyneth vj chapytres xvj book treateth syr bors syr lyonel brother conteyneth xvij chapytres xvij book treateth sangreal conteyneth xxiij chapytres xviij book treateth syr launcelot quene conteyneth xxv chapytres xix book treateth quene gueneuer launcelot conteyneth xiij chapytres xx book treateth pyetous deth arthur conteyneth xxij chapytres xxj book treateth last departyng syr launcelot came reuenge dethe conteyneth xiij chapytres somme xxj bookes whyche conteyne somme v hondred vij chapytres playnly shal folowe herafter p table rubrysshe contente chapytres shortly fyrst book kyng arthur fyrst vtherpendragon sente duke cornewayl igrayne wyf departyng sodeynly ageyn ca primo vtherpendragon made warre duke cornewayl moyane merlyn laye duchesse gate arthur capitulo ij byrthe kyng arthur nouryture deth kyng vtherpendragon arthur chosen kyng wondres meruaylles swerde taken stone sayd arthur capitulo iij iiij v kyng arthur pulled oute swerde dyuers tymes vj kyng arthur crowned made offycers vij kyng arthur helde wale pentecost grete feest kynges lordes came feste viij fyrst warre kyng arthur wanne felde capitulo ix merlyn counceylled kyng arthur sende kyng ban kyng bors theyr counceyl taken warre x grete tornoye made kynge arthur ij kynges ban bors wente ouer see capitulo xj xj kynges gadred grete hoost ayenst kyng arthur xij dreme kyng wyth hondred knyghtes xiij xj kynges wyth theyr hoost fought ayenst arthur hoost many grete feates warre capitulo xiiij yet batayll capitulo xv yet said batayl ended merlyn xvij kyng arthur kyng ban kyng bors rescowed kyng leodegraunce incydentes xviij kyng arthur rode garlyon dreme sawe quostyng beest capitulo xix kyng pellynore took arthur hors folowed questyng beest merlyn mette wyth arthur xx vlfyns apeched quene igrayne arthur moder treason knyght came desyred haue deth hys mayster reuengyd capitulo xxj gryflet made knyght iusted knyyt xxij xij knyghtes came rome axed truage thys londe arthur arthur faught wyth knyght xxiij merlyn saued arthur lyf threwe enchauntement vpon kyng pellynore made hym slepe xxiiij arthur meane merlyn gate excalybur hys swerde lady lake capitulo xxv tydynges cam arthur kyng ryons ouercome xj kynges desyred arthus berde purfyl mantel capitulo xxvij phow al chyldren sente fore borne may day mordred saued xxviij pthe second book damoysel whyche came gyrde wyth swerde fynde man suche vertue drawe oute scabard ca primo balen arayed lyke poure knyght pulled swerde whyche afterward cause deth capitulo ij lady lake demaunded knyytes heed wonne swerde maydens hede iij merlyn tolde thaduenture damoysel capitulo iiij balyn pursyewed syr launceor knyght irelonde iusted slewe hym v damoysel whiche loue launceor slewe hyr self loue balyn mette wyth brother balan vj dwarfe repreuyd balyn deth launceor kyng marke cornewayl founde maad tombe ouer capitulo vij merlyn prophecyed two best knyghtes world shold fyght whyche syr launcelot syr trystram capitulo viij balyn broder counceyl merlyn toke kyng ryons brought hym kyng arthur ix kyng arthur bataylle ayenst nero kyng loth orkeney kyng loth deceyued merlyn xij kynges slayne capitulo x entyerement xij kynges prophecye merlyn balyn shold gyue dolorous stroke xj sorouful knyyt cam tofore arthur balyn fet hym knyght slayn knyght inuysyble xij balyn damoysel mette wyth knyght whych lyke wyse slayn damoysel bledde custom castel capitulo xiij ho balyn mette wyth knyght named garbon feest slewe hym haue blood hele therwith sone hoost capitulo xiiij balyn fought wyth kyng pelham swerde brake gate spere wherewyth smote dolorous stroke capitulo xv balyn delyuerd merlyn sauyd knyght wold haue slayn hym self loue capitulo xvj knyght slewe loue knyght lyeng hyr slewe hym self wyth owne swerde balyn rode ward castel lost lyf capitulo xvij balyn mette wyth brother balen eche theym slowe vnknowen tyl wounded deth xviij merlyn buryed hem bothe one tobe balyns swerd capitulo xix phere folowen chapytres thyrd book kyng arthur took wyf wedded gueneuer doughter leodegran kyng londe camelerd wyth whome rounde table capitulo primo knyghtes rounde table ordeyned theyr syeges blessyd bysshop caunterburye capitulo ij poure man rydyng vpon lene mare desyred kyng arthur make sone knyght capitulo iij syr tor knowen sone kyng pellynore gawayn made knyght capitulo iiij atte feste weddyng kyng arthur gueneuer whyte herte came halle thyrty couple houndes brachet pynched herte whiche taken awaye v syr gawayn rode fetche ageyn berte ij brethern fought eche ageynst herte capitulo vj herte chaced castel slayn gauwayn slewe lady capitulo vij iiij knyytes faught ayenst sir gawayn gaheryse ouercom lyues saued atte request iiij ladyes capitulo viij phow syr tor rode knyght wyth brachet aduenture waye capitulo ix syr tor fonde brachet wyth lady knyght assaylled hym sayd brachet capitulo x syr tor ouercame knyght losth y heed requeste lady capitulo xj kyng pellenore rode lady knyght ladde awaye lady desyred helpe hym faught wyth ij knyghtes lady whome slewe one fyrst stroke capitulo xij kyng pellynore gate lady brought hyr camelot courte kyng arthur capitulo xiij waye herde two knyghtes laye nyght valeye aduentures capitulo xiiij whan comen camelot sworne vpon book telle trouthe queste capitulo xv phere folowen chapytres fourth book merlyn assotted dooted one ladyce lake shytte roche vnder stone deyed capitulo primo v kynges came londe warre ayenst kyng arthur counceyl arthur ayenst capitulo ij kyng arthur adoo ouerthrewe slewe v kynges made remenaunte flee iij batayl fynysshed came kyng founded abbay batayl capitulo iiij syr tor made knyght rounde table bagdemagus dyspleased capitulo v kyng arthur kyng vryens syr accolon gaule chaced hert theyr meruayllous aduenture vj arthur took vpon hym fyght delyuerd oute pryson also delyuer twenty knyghtes pryson capitulo vij accollon fonde hym self welle toke vpon hym doo bataylle ayenst arthur capitulo viij bataylle bytwene kyng arthur accolon ix kyng arthur swerde faught wyth brake recouerd accolon owne swerde excalibur ouercame enemye capitulo x accolon confessyd treason morgan le fay kyng arthur syster wold haue doon slee hym ca xj arthur accorded two brethern delyuerd xx knyghtes syr accolons deyed capitulo xij morgan wold haue slayn syr vryens hyr husbond syr ewayn hir sone saued hym capitulo xiij quene morgan le fay made grete sorowe deth accolon stale awaye scawbard fro arthur xiiij morgan le fay saued knyght shold haue drowned kyng arthur retorned home ageyn capitulo xv damoysel lake saued kynge arthur mantel shold haue brente hym capitulo xvj syr gawayn syr ewayn mette xij fayr damoyselles compleyned syr marhaus ca xvij syr marhaws iusted syr gawayn syr ewayn ouerthrewe bothe capitulo xviij xix syr marhaus syr gawayn syr ewayn mette damoyselles eche toke one capitulo xx knyght dwarf stroof lady capitulo xxj kyng pelleas suffred hym self taken prysoner cause wold haue syght lady syr gawayn promysed hym gete hym loue lady xxij syr gawayn came lady ettard laye hyr syr pelleas fonde slepyng capitulo xxiij syr pelleas loued nomore ettard moyan damoysel lake whome loued euer ca xxiiij syr marhaus rode damoysel came duke south marchis capitulo xxv syr marhaus faught wyth duke vj sone made yelde capitulo xxvj syr ewayn rode wyth damoysel lx yere age gate pry tornoyeng capitulo xxvij syr ewayn fauyt ij knyytes ouercam hem xxviij yeres ende alle thre knyghtes wyth theyr thre damoyselles metten fontayne capitulo xxix pof fyfthe book chapytres folowen xij aged ambassyato rome came kyng arthur demaunde truage brytayne capitulo primo kynges lordes promysed kyng arthur ayde helpe ageynst romayns capitulo ij kyng arthur helde parlement yorke ordeyned royame shold gouerned abscence iij kyng arthur beyng shypped lyeng caban meruayllous dreme thexposycion therof capitulo iiij man contreye tolde hym meruayllous geaunte faught conquerd hym capitulo v kyng arthur sente syr gawayn lucius assaylled escaped wyth worshyp capitulo vj lucius sente certeyn espyes busshement ue taken hys knyghtes beyng prysonners letted capitulo vij senatour tolde lucius dyscomfyture also grete batayl betwene arthur lucius capitulo viij arthur achyeued batayl ayenst romayns entred almayn ytalye capitulo ix bataylle doon gauwayn ayenst sarasyn whiche yelden became crysten capitulo x sarasyns came oute wode rescowe theyr beestys grete bataylle capitulo xj syr gauwayn retorned kyng arthur wyth prysoners kyng wanne cyte crowned emperour capitulo xij phere folowen chappytres vj book syr launcelot syr lyonel departed fro courte seek auentures syr lyonel lefte hym slepyng taken capitulo primo syr ector folowed seek syr launcelot taken syr turquyne capitulo ij iiij quenes fonde launcelot slepyng enchauntement taken ledde castel capitulo iij syr lancelot deliuerd meane damosel iiij knyght founde syr launcelot lyeng lemmans bedde syr launcelot faught knyght ca v sir launcelot receyued kyng bagdemagus doughter made complaynte hir fader capitulo vj syr launcelot byhaued hym tournement mette wyth syr turquyn ledyng syr gaheris capitulo vij syr launcelot sy turquyn faught gyders ca viij r turquyn slayn syr launcelot bad syr gaheris delyuer al prysoners capitulo ix syr launcelot rode damoysel slewe knyght distressid al ladyes also vylayn yt kept bridge x syr launcelot slewe ij geauntes made castel free xj syr launcelot rode dysguysed syr kayes harnoys smote doun knyght capitulo xij syr launcelot iusted ayenst four knyytes rounde table ouerthrewe theym capitulo xiij syr launcelot folowed brachet castel fonde dede knyght requyred damoysel hele hir brother capitulo xiiij sir launcelot cam chapel peryllous gate dede corp pyece cloth swerde capitulo xv syr launcelot request lady recouerd fawcon whiche deceyued capitulo xvj syr launcelot ouertoke knyght chased hys wyf haue sleyn hyr e sayd hym capitulo xvij syr launcelot came kyng arthur court recounted al noble feates actes capitulo xviij phere folowen chappytres seuenth boook beaumayns came kyng arthur courte demaunded thre petycyons kyng arthur capitulo primo syr launcelot syr gauwayn wroth cause syr kaye mocqued beaumayns damoysel whyche desyred knyght fyght lady capitulo ij beawmayns desyred batayl graunted hym desyred made knyyt sir launcelot iij beaumayns departed gate syr kaye spere shelde iusted faughte wyth syr launcelot capitulo iiij beaumayns tolde syr launcelot name dubbed knyght syr launcelot ouertooke damoysel capitulo v beaumayns fought slewe ij knyghtes passage vj beaumayns faught knyght blacke laundes faught hym tyl fyl doun deyed capitulo vij brother knyght slayn mette wyth beaumayns fauyt beaumayns tyl yelden viij damoysel euer rebuked beaumayns wold suffre hym syt hir table callyd hym kychyn boye ix iij brother callyd rede knyght iusted faughte ayenst beaumayns beaumayns ouercame hym ca x syr beaumayns suffred grete rebuke damoysel suffred pacyently capitulo xj beaumayns faughte wyth syr persaunt ynde made hym yelden capitulo xij godelye comynycacyon bytwene syr persaunt beaumayns tolde hym name syr gareth xiij lady bysyeged worde fro hyr syster brought knyght fyght hyr bataylles achyeued capitulo xiiij damoysel beaumayns came syege came sys amor tree beaumayns blewe horne thenne knyyt rede laundes cam yght wyth hym ca xv two knyghtes mette gyders talkyng began theyr batayl capitulo xvj longe fyghtyng beaumayns ouercame knyght wold haue slayn hym atte request ordes saued lyf made hym yelde hym lady capo xvij knyyt yelded hym beaumayns made hym goo vnto kyng arthur court c ye sir lancelot mercy xviij beaumayns came lady whan came castel yates closed ageynst hym wordes lady sayd hym capitulo xix syr beaumayns rode rescowe dwarfe came castel capitulo xx syr gareth otherwyse callyd beaumayns cam ye presence lady toke acqueyntance loue xxj nyght cam armed knyght faught sir gareth sore hurt thyghe smote knyghtes heed ca xxij sayd knyght came ageyn next nyght beheded ageyn foste pentecost al knyytes syr gareth ouercome cam yelded hem kyng arthur xxiij kyng arthur pardoned demaunded syr gareth capitulo xxiiij quene orkeney came feste pentecoste sir gawayn brethern cam aske hir blessyng xxv xxvj kyng arthur sente lady lyonas lete crye tournoye hir castel came many knyghtes capitulo xxvij kyng arthur wente tornoyment knyghtes lady receyued hym worshypfully knyghtes encountred capitulo xxviij knyghtes bare batayl capitulo xxix yet sayd tornoyment capitulo xxx syr gareth espyed herowdes escaped oute felde capitulo xxxj syr gareth came castel wel lodged iusted knyght slewe hym capitulo xxxij syr gareth fought wyth knyght helde within castel xxx ladyes slewe hym capitulo xxxiij syr gowayn syr gareth fought eche ayenst knewe eche damoysel lynet ca xxxiiij syr gareth knowleched loued eche kyng arthur thappoyntement weddyng xxxv grete ryalte offycers made feste weddyng iustes feest capitulo xxxvj phere folowen chappytres eyght book syr trystram de lyones borne moder deyed byrthe wherfore named hym tristram primo stepmoder syr trystram ordeyned poyson haue poysened syr trystram capitulo ij syr trystram sente fraunce one gouerne hym named gouernayle lernyd harpe hawke hunte capitulo iij syr marhaus came irelonde aske trewage cornewayle ellys wold fyght therfore capitulo iiij trystram enterprysed bataylle fyght trewage cornwayl made knyght capitulo v syr trystram arryued ilond furnysshe bataylle wyth syr marhaus capitulo vj hoow syr tristram faught ayenst syr marhaus hyeued batayl syr marhaus fledde shyppe ca vij syr marhaus arryued irelonde dyed stroke syr trystram gyuen hym trystram hurte capitulo viij syr trystram put kepyng la bele ysoude fyrst le helyd hys wounde capitulo ix syr trystram wanne degree tornoyment irelonde made palomydes bere harnoys yere x quene espyed syr tristram slayn hir broder syr marhaus swerde ieopardye xj syr trystram departed fro kyng la bele isoude irelonde come cornewayl capitulo xij syr trystram kyng marke hurted eche lone knyghtes wyf capitulo xiij syr trystram laye wyth lady husbond faught wyth syr trystram capitulo xiiij syr bleoberis demaunded fayrest lady kyng mark court toke awaye fouyten xv syr trystram faught wyth two knyghtes rounde table capitulo xvj syr tristcum faught syr bleoberis lady lady put choyse whome wold goo xvij lady forsoke syr tristram abode syr bleoberie desyred goo hyr husbond ca xviij kyng mark sent syr trystram la bele isoude toward irelond fortune arryued englond xix kyng anguysshe irelonde somoned come kyng arthur courte treason capitulo xx syr trystram rescowed chylde fro knyght gouernayle tolde ym kyng anguysshe ca xxj syr trystram faught syr anguysshe ouercame hys aduersarye aduersarye wold neuer yelde hym xxij syr blamor desyred trystram slee hym syr tristram spared hym took appoyntement xxiij syr tristram demaunded la bele isoude kynge mark syr trystram isoude dronken loue drynke xxiiij syr tristram isoude pryson faughte hir beaute smote another ladyes hede capitulo xxv syr trystram faught wyth syr breunor atte laste smote hede capitulo xxvj syr galahad faught wyth syr tristram syr tristram yelded hym promysed felaushyp lancelot xxvij syr launcelot met e wi h syr carados eryng awaye sir gawayn rescows syr gawayn capitulo xxviij weddyng kyng marke la bele isoude brangwayn hyr mayde palamydes xxix palamydes demaunded quene isoude lambegus rode rescowe hyr scape isoude xxx syr trystram rode palamydes fonde hym faught wyth hym moyne isoude batayl seced capitulo xxxj syr trystram brought quene isoude home debate kyng marke syr trystram capitulo xxxij syr lamerok iusted wyth xxx knyghtes syr tristram atte requeste kyng mark smote hors doun xxxiij syr lamerok sente horne kyng marke despyte syr trystram syr trystram dryuen chapel capitulo xxxiiij syr tristram holpen men quene isoude put lazarcote tristra hurt xxxv syr trystram serued warre kyng howel brytayn slewe hys aduersarye felde xxxvj syr suppynabyles tolde syr trystram deffamed courte kyng arthur syr lamerok xxxvij syr trystram wyf arryued wale mettr wyth syr lamerok capitulo xxxviij syr trystram faught wyth syr nabon ouercame hym made syr lamerok lord yle xxxix syr lamerok departed fro syr trystram mette wyth syr frolle wyth syr launcelot capitulo xl syr lamerok slewe syr frolle curtoyse fyghtyng wyth syr belleaunce hys brother capitulo xlj phere folowen chapytres ix book yonge man came courte kyng arthur syr kaye called hym scorne la cote male tayle primo damoysel came courte desyred knyght take hym enquest la cote male tayle emprised ij le cote male tayle ouerthrewe syr dagonet kynges fole rebuke damoysel ca iij le cote male tayle fought ayenst hondred knyghtes escaped meane lady capitulo iiij syr launcelot cam courte herde la cote male tayle folowed hym la cote male tayle prysoner capitulo v syr launcelot faught wyth vj knyghtes wyth syr bryan delyuerd prysonners vj syr launcelot mette wyth damoysel named maledysaunt named hyr damoysel bein pensaunt vij le cote male tayle taken prysoner rescowed syr launcelot syr launcelot ouercam iiij brethern viij syr launcelot maad le cote mayle lord castel pendragon made knyght rounde table ix la bele isoude sente letter syr trystram hir mayde brangwayn dyuers auentures syr trystram x syr tristram mette syr lamerok de gale faught accorded neuer fyght gyders xj syr palomydes folowed questyng beest smote doun syr trystram syr lamerock wyth one spere capitulo xij syr lamerok mette wyth syr molleagaunce faught gydre beaulte dame gueneuer capitulo xiiij syr kaye mette wyth syr trystram shame spoken knyghtes cornewayl iusted capitulo xv kyng arthur brought forest peryllous syr trystram saued lyf capitulo xvj syr trystram came la bele isoude kehydyou began loue bele isoude letter tristram fonde xvij syr tristram departed fro tyntagyl sorowed longe forest tyl mynde xviij syr trystram sowsed dagonet welle palamydes sente damoysel seche trystram palamydes mette wyth kyng mark capitulo xix noysed syr trystram dede la bele isoude wolde haue slayn hyr self capitulo xx kyng mark fonde syr trystram naked made hym borne home tyntagyl knowen brachet capitulo xxj kyng marke thauys counceyl bannysshed syr trystram oute cornewayl terme x yere xxij damoysel souyght helpe helpe sir laucelot ayenst xxx knyghtes syr trystram faught ca xxiij syr trystram syr launcelot came lodgyng must iuste wyth two knyghtes capitulo xxiiij syr trystram iusted wyth syr kaye syr sagramor le desyrous syr gawayn torned syr trystram fro morgan le fay capitulo xxv syr trystram syr gauwayn rode haue foughten ayenst xxx knyghtes durst come oute xxvj damoysel brangwayn fonde trystram slepyng welle delyuerd letter hym fro bele isoude xxvij syr trystram falle syr palomydes launcelot ouerthrewe two knyght capitulo xxviij syr launcelot iusted palomydes ouerthrewe hym assaylled xij knyghtes xxix syr trystram byhaued hym fyrst day tournement pry capitulo xxx syr trystram retourned ayenst kyng arthur partye cause sawe syr palomydes partye capitulo xxxj syr trystram fonde palomydes welle broughte hym wyth hym lodgyng capitulo xxxij syr trystram smote doun syr palomydes iusted wyth kyng arthur feates xxxiij syr launcelot hurte syr trystram syr trystram smote doun syr palomydes capitulo xxxiiij pry thyrd day gyuen syr launcelot syr launcelot gaf syr trystram ca xxxv palomydes came castel syr trystram queste syr launcelot x knyghtes made syr trystram capitulo xxxvj syr trystram syr palomydes syr dynadan taken put pryson capitulo xxxvij kyng marke sory good renommee syr tristram somme arthur knyghtes iusted wyth knyghtes cornewayl capitulo xxxviij treason kyng marke syr gaheris smote hym doun andred cosyn capitulo xxxix syr trystram syr palomydes syr dynadan longe pryson delyuerd ca xl syr dynadan rescowed lady fro syr breuse sauns pyte syr trystram receyued shelde morgan le fay xlj syr trystram took wyth hym shelde also slewe paramour morgan le fay capitulo xlij morgan le fay buryed hyr paramour syr tristram preysed syr launcelot hys kynne ca xliij syr trystram tornoyment bare shelde morgan le fay delyuerd hym capitulo xliiij phere folowen chapytres tenth book syr trystram iusted smote doun kyng arthur bycause tolde hym cause bare shelde ca j syr trystram saued syr palomydes lyf promysed fyght gyder wythin fourtenyght capitulo ij syr trystram sought stronge knyght smyton hym doun many knyghtes rounde table ii syr trystram smote doun syr sagramor le desyrous syr dodynas le sauage capitulo iiij syr trystram mette perron wyth syr launcolot faught gyder vnkuowen capitulo v syr launcelot brought syr trystram courte ioye kyng made comyng syr trystram capitulo vj despyte syr trystram kyng marke came wyth ij knyghtes englond ewe one knyghtes capitulo vij kyng came fontayne fonde syr lamerock complaynyng loue kyng lot wyf viij kyng marke syr lamerok syr dynadan came castel kyng mark knowen capitulo ix syr berluses mette wyth kyng marke syr dynadan toke partye ca x phow kyng marke mocked syr dynadan mette wyth vj knyytes ronnde table xj phow vj knyytes sente sir dagonet iuste kyng marke kyng marke refused hym ca xij syr palomydes aduenture mette kyng marke fleyng ouerthrewe dagonet knyghtes xiij kyng marke syr dynadan herde syr palomydes makyng grete sorowe mornyng la bele isoude xiiij kyng slayn syr amant wrongfully tofore kyng arthur syr launcelot fette kyng marke kyng arthur xv syr dynadan tolde syr palamydes batayl betwene syr launcelot syr trystram capitulo xvj syr lamerok iusted wyth dyuers knyghtes castel wherin morgan le fay capitulo xvij syr palamydes wold haue iusted syr lamerock wyth knyghtes castel capitulo xviij syr lamerock iusted wyth syr palomydes hurte hym greuously capitulo xix tolde syr launcelot dagonet chaced kyng marke knyght ouerthrewe hym vj knyghtes xx kyng arthur lete crye iustes syr lamorak came ouerthrewe syr gawayn many xxj kyng arthur made kyng marke accorded syr trystram departed toward cornewayll xxij syr percyuale made knyght kyng arthur dombe mayde spack brouyt hym roude table xxiij syr lamerock laye wyth kyng lot wyf syr gaheris slewe hir whiche owne mod r ca xxiiij syr agrauayn syr mordred mette wyth knyght fleyng bothe ouerthrowen syr dynadan capitulo xxv kyng arthur quene launcelot receyued letter oute cornewayle ansuer ageyn ca xxvj syr launcelot wrothe wyth letter receyued kyng marke dynadan whiche made laye kyng marke capitulo xxvij syr trystram hurte warre maad kynge marke syr trystram promysed rescowe hym capitulo xxviij syr trystram ouercame batayl elyas desyred man fyght body body capitulo xxix syr elyas syr trystram faught gyder truage syr trystram slewe elyas felde xxx grete feste kyng marke made harper came sange lay dynadan made capitulo xxxj kyng marke slewe treason brother bowdyn good seruyce done hym capitulo xxxij anglydes boudyns wyf escaped hir yonge sone alisaunder le orphelyn came castel arondel xxxiij anglydes gaf blody doblet alysaunder hir sone day made knyyt charge withal xxxiiij tolde kyng marke alysaunder wold haue slayn syr sadok sauyng lyf xxxv syr alysaunder wanne pryce tournoyment morgan le fay faught wyth syr maulgryn slewe hym capitulo xxxvj quene morgan le fay alysaunder hyr castel heelyd woundes capitulo xxxvij alysaunder delyuerd fro quene morgan le fay moyane damoysel capitulo xxxviij alysaunder mette wyth alys la beale pylgrym iusted wyth two knyghtes hym syr mordred capitulo xxxix sir galahalt dyd crye iustes surluse quene gueneuers knyytes shold iuste ayenst wold come xl syr lancelot fought tournoyment syr palomydes dyd armes damoysell ca xlj syr galahault syr palomydes faught gyder syr dynadan syr galahault capitulo xlij syr archade appeled syr palamydes treason syr palamydes slewe hym capitulo xliij thyrd day syr palomydes iusted wyth syr lamerok thynges capitulo xliiij iiij day many grete feates armes ca xlv v day syr lamerok bybaued hym ca xlvj palamydes fought wyth corsabtyn lady palamydes slewe corsabryn xlvij vj day thenne doon ca xlviij vij batayll syr launcelot beyng desguysed lyke mayde smote doun syr dynadan capitulo xlix treson syr tristram brought turnoyment haue slayn put pryson l kyng marke lete counterfete letter pope syr percyual delyuerd syr tristram oute pryson lj syr trystram la bele isoude came englond syr launcelot brought ioyous garde capitulo lij counceyl bele ysoude trystram rode armed mette wyth syr palomydes capitulo liij syr palomydes mette wyth syr bleoberys wyth syr ector syr percyuale capitulo liiij syr trystram mette wyth syr dynadan deuyses sayd syr gauwayns brethern lv syr trystram smote doun syr agrauayn syr gaheris syr dynadan sente fore la bele isoude lvj syr dynadan mette wyth syr trystram wyth iustyng wyth syr palamydes syr dynadan knewe hym lvij approched castel lonazep deuyses deth syr lamerok capitulo lviij came humberbanke fonde shyppe wherin laye body kyng hermaunce lix syr trystram wyth felawshyp came hoost whyche faught wyth syr trystram mater capitulo lx palamydes wente fyght wyth two brethern deth kyng hermaunce capitulo lxj copye letter wryton reuenge kynges deth syr palamydes faught haue bataylle lxij preparacyon syr palamydes ij brethern shold fyght wyth hym capitulo lxiij batayl betwene syr palamydes two brethern two brethern slayn capitulo lxiiij syr trystram syr palamydes mette breuce sauns pyte syr tristram la beale ysoude wente vnto lonazep capitulo lxv syr palamydes iusted wyth syr galyhodyn wyth syr gawayn smote doun lxvj syr trystram felaushyp cam vnto tournement lonezep dyuers iustes mater capitulo lxvij syr trystram hys felaushyp iusted noble feates dyd tournoyeng lxviij syr trystram vnhorsed smyten doun syr launc lot syr tristram smote doun kyng arthur lxix syr trystram chau ged harnoys al reed demenyd hym syr palamydes slewe launcelottes hors capitulo lxx syr launcelot sayd syr palamydes pry day gyuen syr palamydes lxxj syr dynadan prouoked syr trystram wel lxxij kyng arthur syr launcelot came see la bele ysoude palamydes smote doun kyng arthur capitulo lxxiij second day palamydes forsoke syr trystram wente contrarye partye ayenst hym capitulo lxxiiij syr trystram departed felde awaked sir dynadan chaunged araye blacke ca lxxv syr palamydes chaunged shelde armour hurte sir tristram syr launcelot dyd sir tristram lxxvj syr trystram departed wyth la bele isoude palomydes folowed excused hym capitulo lxxvij kyng arthur syr launcelot came theyr pauelyons satte souper palomydes lxxviij syr trystram syr palamydes dyd nexte day kyng arthur vnhorsed capitulo lxxix syr trystram torned kynge arthur syde syr palomydes wolde capitulo lxxx syr bleoberis syr ector reported quene gueneuer beaute la bele isoude capitulo lxxxj palomydes complayned welle epynogris came fonde hym theyr bothe sorowes lxxxij syr palomydes brouyt r epynogris lady sir palomydes syr safer assaylled ca lxxxiij lxxiiij syr trystram made hym redy rescowe syr palomydes syr launcelot rescowed hym came capitulo lxxxv syr trystram syr launcelot wyth palomydes came ioyous garde palomydes syr trystram ca lxxxvj day sette bytwene syr trystram syr palomydes fyght sir trystram hurte lxxxvij syr palomydes kepte day haue foughten syr trystram myght come thynges ca lxxxviij phere folowen chapytres xj book syr launcelot rode aduenture helpe dolorous lady fro hyr payne faught wyth dragon capitulo primo syr launcelot came pelles sangreal begate galahad elayn kyng pelles douyter ij syr launcelot dyspleasyd whan knewe layen elayn desyuerd galahad iij syr bors came dame elayn sawe galahad fedde wyth sangreal capitulo iiij syr bors made syr pedyuer yelde hym meruayllous aduentures achyeued ca v syr bors departed syr launcelot rebuked quene gueneuer excuse capitulo vj dame elayn galahad moder came grete estate camelot launcelot byhaued hym capitulo vij dame brysen enchauntement brought syr launcelo te elayns bedde quene gueneuer rebuked hym viij dame elayn commaunded quene gueneuer voyde courte syr launcelot becam madde ix sorowe quene gueneuer made syr launcelot sought knyghtes kynne capitulo x seruaunte syr aglouals slayn vengeaunce syr aglouale syr percyuale dyd therfore xj syr percyuale departed secretelye fro brother losed knyght bounden chayne thynges xij syr percyuale mette wyth sir ector faught longe eche almoost slayne capitulo xiij myracle bothe made hole comyng holy vessel sangreal capitulo xiiij phere folowen chapytres xij book syr launcelot hys madnes took swerde faughte knyght lepte bedde capitulo primo syr launcelot wa caryed hors lytter syr launcelot rescowed syr blyaunte hoost capitulo ij syr launcelot faught ayenste ore slewe hym hurte brought hermytage capitulo iij syr launcelot knowen dame elayn borne chambre helyd sangreal iiij syr launcelot hole mynde ashamed elayn desyred castel hym capitulo v syr launcelot came ioyous yle named hym self la chyualer malfet capitulo vj grete tournoyeng ioyous yle syr percyuale syr ector came thyder syr percyuale fought wyth hym capitulo vij eche knewe curtosye brother ector came hym theyr ioye viij syr bors syr lyonel came kyng brandegore syr bors toke sone helyne le blank sir launcelot ix syr launcelot wyth syr percyuale syr ector came courte grete ioye hym capitulo x la bele ysoude counceylled syr trystram goo vnto courte grete feste pentecoste capitulo xj syr trystram departed vnarmed mette syr palomydes smote eche palomydes forbare hym capitulo xij syr trystram gate hym harnoys knyght whyche hurte ouerthrewe syr palomoydes xiij syr trystram syr palamydes fought longe gyders accorded syr trystram maad hym crystened capitulo xiiij phere folowen chapytres xiij book vygyle feste pentecoste entred halle kyng arthur damoysel desyred syr launcelot come dubbe knyght wente wyth hyr capitulo primo letter founde wryton syege peryllous meruayllous aduenture swerde stone ij syr gawayn assayed drawe oute swerde olde man brought galahad capitulo iij olde man broght galahad syege peryllous sette hym therin al knyghtes meruaylled iiij kyng arthur shewed stone houyng water galahad drewe oute swerde v kyng arthur al knyghtes gyder iuste medowe besyde wynchester departed vj quene desyred see galahad al knyghtes replenysshed wyth holy sangreal owed enqueste capitulo vij grete sorowe made kyng ladyes departyng knyghtes departed viij galahad gate hym shelde spedde presumed take doun sayd shelde capitulo ix galahad departed shelde kyng ne lake receyued thys shelde ioseph armathye x ioseph made crosse whyte shelde blode galahad monke brought tombe xj meruayle syr galahad sawe herde tombe made melyas knyght capitulo xij thaduenture melyas galahad reuenged hym melyas caryed abbey xiij galahad departed commaunded goo castel maydens destroye wycked custome xiiij syr galahad faught wyth knyghtes castel destroyed wycked custome capitulo xv syr gawayn came thabbey folowe galahad shryuen heremyte capitulo xvj syr galahad mette syr launcelot syr percyuale smote hem doun departed fro xvij syr launcelot halfe slepyng halfe wakyng sawe seek man borne lytter heled sangreal capitulo xviij voys spake syr launcelot fonde hi hors helme borne awaye wente fote xix syr launcelot shryuen sorowe made good ensauamples whyche shewed hym ca xx phere folowen chapytres xiiij book syr percyuale came recluse asked hyr counceyl tolde hym hys aunte ca primo merlyn lykened rounde table world knyghtes shold achyeue sangreal shold knowen capitulo ij syr percyuale came monasterye fonde kyng enelake whyche olde man capitulo iij syr percyuale sawe many men armes beryng dede knyght fauggt ageynst capitulo iiij yeman desyred hym gete ageyn hors syr percyualles hakenay slayn gate hors capitulo v grete daunger syr percyual hys hors sawe serpent lyon fyght vj aduysyon syr percyual sawe hys aduysyon expowned hys lyon capitulo vij syr percyuale sawe shyppe comyng hym warde lady shyppe tolde hym hir disherytaunce viij syr percyual promysed hir helpe requyred hir loue saued fro fende ca ix syr percyual penaunce roof hym self thorugh thyghe knowen deuyl x phere folowth xv book whyche syr launcelot syr launcelot came chapel fonde deed whyte sherte man relygyon hondred wynter olde capitulo primo dede man men wold haue hewen hym wolde syr launcelot toke hayr dede man ij aduysyon syr launcelot tolde heremyte desyred counceyll hym capitulo iij heremyte expowned syr launcelot aduysyon tolde hym syr galahad hys sone capitulo iiij syr launcelot iusted wyth many knyghtes taken capitulo v syr launcelot tolde hys aduysyon woman expowned hym capitulo vj phere folowen chapytres xvj book syr gawayn nyghe w ry queste sangreal meruayllous dreme capitulo primo aduysyon syr ector iusted wyth syr ewayn le auoultres hys sworne brother ca ij syr gawayn syr ector cam hermytage confessyd tolde hermyte theyr aduysyons iij heremyte expowned theyr aduysyon capitulo iiij good counceyl heremyte gaf v syr bors mette wyth heremyte confessyd hym penaunce enioyned hym vj syr bors lodged wyth lady took hym fyght ageynst champyon hyr lande vij vysyon whyche syr bors nyght faught ouercame hys aduersarye capitulo viij lady restored hyr londes bataylle syr boor departyng mette syr lyonel taken beten wyth thornes also mayde shold haue ben deuoured capitulo ix syr boor lefte rescowe brother rescowed damoysel tolde hym lyonel dede x syr boor tolde dreme preest whiche dremed counceyl preest gaf hym xj deuyl woman lykenes wold haue syr bors haue layen hir goddes grace escaped xij holy comynycacyon abbot syr boor abbot counceylled hym capitulo xiij syr boor mette wyth brother syr lyonel syr lyonel wolde haue slayn syr boor capitulo xiiij syr colgreuaunce fought ayenst syr lyonel saue syr boor heremyte slayn ca xv syr lyonel slewe syr colgreuaunce wold haue slayn syr bors capitulo xvj came voys whyche charged syr bors touche hym cloude came bytwene capitulo xvij phere folowen chapytres xvij bo k syr galahad faught turnement knowen syr gawayn syr ector de marr capitulo j syr galahad rode damoysel came shyp syr boor syr percyuale capitulo ij syr galahad entryd shyp fayr bedde therin wyth meruayllous thynges swerde iij meruayles swerde scaubard iiij kyng pelles smyton thorugh bothe thyes cause drewe swerde meruayllous hystoryes v salamon toke dauyds swerde counceyl hys wyf mater meruayllous capitulo vj wonderful tale kyng salamon wyf vij galahad hys felowes came castel foughten wyth al slewe theyr aduersaryes mater capitulo viij iij knyghtes wyth percyuals syster came waste forest herte iiij lyon thynges ix desyred strauge custom wolde obeye wherfore faught slewe many knyghtes x percyuals syster bledde dysshe ful blood hele lady wherfore dyed body put shyppe capitulo xj galahad percyuale fonde castel many tombes maydens bledde dethe capitulo xij syr launcelot entred shyppe syr percyuales syster laye deed mette wyth syr galahad hys sone capitulo xiij knyght brought syr galahad hors bad hym come fader syr launcelot capitulo xiiij launcelot tofore dore chambre wherin holy sangreal capitulo xv syr launcelot layen xiiij dayes many nyghtes dede man dyuers mater capitulo xvj syr launcelot retorned toward logres aduentures whyche sawe waye capitulo xvij galahad came kyng mordrayns mater aduentures capitulo xviij syr percyuale syr boor mette wyth syr galahad came castel carbonek mater xix galahad felowes fedde holy sangreal lord apperyd thynges xx galahad enoynted wyth blood spere maymed kyng aduentures capitulo xxj fedde wyth sangreal whyle pryson galahad made kyng capitulo xxij sorowe percyuale boor made whan galahad dede percyuale dyed mater xxiij phere folowen chapytres xviij book ioye kyng arthur quene thachyeuement sangreal launcelot fyl hys olde loue ageyn capitulo primo quene comaunded syr launcelot auoyde court sorowe launcelot made capitulo ij dyner quene made knyght enpoysoned whyche syr mador layed quene iij syr mador appeched quene treason knyght wold fyght hyr fyrst tyme iiij quene requyred syr boor fyght hyr graunted vpon condycyon warned syr launcelot therof capitulo v day syr boor made hym redy fyght quene whan shold fyyt another dyscharged hym vj syr launcelot fought ayenst syr mador quene ouercame syr mador dyscharged quene vij trouthe knowen mayden lake dyuers mater capitulo viij syr launcelot rode astolat receyued sleue bere vpon helme requeste mayde capitulo ix tornoye began wynchester knyghtes iustes thynges capitulo x sir launcelot syr lauayn entred felde ayenst kyng arthur court launcelot hurte xj syr launcelot syr lauayn departed oute feldo ieopardye launcelot capitulo xij launcelot brought hermyte helyd wounde mater capitulo xiij syr gawayn lodged wyth lord astolat knowlege hit syr launcelot bare rede sleue capitulo xiiij sorowe syr boor hurte launcelot angre quene cause launcelot bare sleue capitulo xv syr boor sought launcelot fonde hym hermytage lamentacion bytwene capitulo xvj syr launcelot armed hym assaye yf myght bere armes woundes brest oute ageyn capitulo xvij syr boor retorned tolde tydynges syr launcelot tournoye whome pry gyuen xviij grete lamentacyn fayr mayde astolat whan launcelot shold departe dyed loue xix corp mayde astolat arryued tofore kyng arthur buryeng syr launcelot offryd masse peny capitulo xx grete iustes doon alle crystemasse grete iustes tournoye ordeyned kyng arthur syr launcelot capitulo xxj launcelot hurt gentylwoman came hermyte mater capitulo xxij syr launcelot byhaued hym iustes men also capitulo xxiij kyng arthur meruaylled moche iustyng felde rode fonde syr launcelot capitulo xxiiij trewe loue lykened sommer capitulo xxv phere folowen chapytres xix book quene gueneuer rode mayeng certeyn knyghtes rounde table clad al grene capitulo primo syr mellyagraunce toke quene al hyr knyghtes whyche sore hurte fyghtyng capitulo ij syr launcelot word quene taken syr mellyagraunce layed busshement launcelot iij syr launcelots hors slayn syr launcelot rode carte rescowe quene capitulo iiij syr mellyagraunce requyred foryeuenes quene appeased syr launcelot mater v syr launcelot came nyght quene laye wyth hyr syr melyagraunce appeched quene treson capitulo vj syr launcelot answerd quene waged bataylle ayenst syr melyagraunce syr launcelot taken trappe capitulo vij syr launcelot delyuerd pryson lady toke whyt courser came kepe hys day viij syr launcelot cam tyme syr mellyagrauce abode hym felde dressyd hym bataylle ix syr vrre came arthur courte heled woundes kyng arthur wold begyn handle hym x kyng arthur handled syr vrre hym many knyghtes rounde table capitulo xj syr launcelot comanded arthur handle hys woundes anone al hool thanked god xij party made hondred knyghtes ayenst hondred knyghtes mater capitulo xiij phere foloweth book pyteous hystorye whyche morte deth kyng arthur chapytres twenty book syr agrauayn syr mordred besy vpon syr gawayn dysclose loue bytwene syr launcelot quene gueneuer capitulo primo syr agrauayn sclosed theyr loue kyng arthur kyng arthur gaf lycence take hym ij syr launcelot espyed quenes chambre syr agrauayn syr mordred came wyth twelue knyghtes slee hym capitulo iij syr launcelot slewe syr colgreuance armed hym harnoys slewe syr agrauayn xij felawes iiij syr launcelot came syr bors tolde hym spedde aduenture ben escaped v counceyl aduys whiche taken syr launcelot hys frendes saue quene capitulo vj syr mordred rode hastely kyng telle hym thaffray deth syr agrauayn knyghtes vij syr launcelot hys kynnesmen rescowed quene fyre slewe many knyghtes viij sorowe lamentacyon dethe hys neuewes good knyghtes also quene wyf ix kyng arthur requeste syr gawayn concluded make warre ayenst syr launcelot layed syege castel called ioyous garde capitulo x comynycacyon bytwene kyng arthur syr launcelot kyng arthur repreuyd hym capitulo xj cosyns kynnesmen syr launcelot excyted hym goo oute batayl made redy xij syr gawayn iusted smote doun syr lyonel syr launcelot horsed kyng arthur ca xiij pope sent doun bulles make pee syr launcelot brought quene kyng arthur xiiij delyueraunce quene kyng sir launcelot langage syr gawayn syr launcelot xv comynycacyon bytwene syr gawayn syr launcelot wyth moche langage capitulo xvj syr launcelot departed fro kyng fro ioyous garde ouer see warde knyghtes wente wyth hym xvij syr launcelot passed ouer see made grete lordes knyghtes wente wyth hym capitulo xviij kyng arthur syr gawayn made grete hoost redy goo ouer see make warre syr launcelot capitulo xix message syr gawayn sente syr launcelot kynge arthur layed syege benwyck mater xx syr launcelot syr gawayn dyd batayl togyder syr gawayn ouerthrowen hurte capitulo xxj sorowe kyng arthur made warre batayl also syr gawayn werse xxij phere folowen chapytres xxj book syr mordred presumed toke hym kyng englond wold haue maryed quene faders wyf ca j kyng arthur tydynges retorned came douer syr mordred mette hym lette landyng deth syr gawayn capitulo ij syr gawayns ghoost apperyd kynge arthur warned hym shold fyght day capitulo iij mysaduenture adder batayl began mordred slayn arthur hurte deth iiij kyng arthur comanded caste swerd excalybur water delyuerd ladyes barge v syr bedwere fonde hym morne deed hermytage abode wyth hermyte capitulo vj thoppynyon semme men deth kyng arthur quene gueneuer made hir nonne almesburye vij whan syr launcelot herde deth kynge arthur syr gawayn mater came englond viij syr launcelot departed seche quene gueneuer fonde hir almesburye capitulo ix syr launcelot came thermytage tharchebysshop caunterburye toke thabyte hym x syr launcelot wente wyth seuen felowes amesburye fonde quene gueneuer deed brought glastynburye capitulo xj syr launcelot began sekene dyed who body borne ioyous garde buryed capitulo xij syr ector fonde syr launcelot hys brother dede constantyn reygned next arthur ende thys book capitulo xiij pexplicit table pcapitulum primum hit befel dayes vther pendragon kynge englond regned myyty duke cornewaill helde warre ageynst hym long tyme duke called duke tyntagil meanes kynge vther send duk chargyng hym brynge wyf hym called fair lady passynge wyse name called igrayne whan duke wyf comyn vnto kynge meanes grete lordes accorded bothe kynge lyked loued lady wel made grete chere oute mesure desyred haue lyen passyng good woman wold assente vnto kynge thenne told duke husband said suppose sente shold dishonoured wherfor husband counceille yow departe hen sodenly maye ryde nyghte vnto oure owne castell lyke wyse saide departed neyther kynge none counceill ware departyng also soone kyng vther knewe theire departyng soo sodenly wonderly wrothe thenne called hym pryuy counceille told sodeyne departyng duke wyf p thenne auysed kynge send duke wyf grete charge yf wille come somos thenne may ye best thenne haue ye cause make myghty werre vpon hym soo done messagers hadde ansuers thys shortly neyther wyf wold come hym thenne kyng wonderly wroth thenne kyng sente hym playne word ageyne badde hym redy stuffe hym garnysshe hym within xl dayes wold fetche hym oute byggest castell hath p whanne duke hadde thys warnynge anone wente furnysshed garnysshed two stronge castels whiche one hyght tyntagil castel hyyt terrabyl wyf dame igrayne putte castell tyntagil hym self putte castel terrabyl whiche many yssues posternes oute thenne haste came vther grete hoost leyd syege aboute castel terrabil ther pyght many pauelyons grete warre made bothe partye moche peple slayne thenne pure angre grete loue fayr igrayne kyng vther felle seke came kynge vther syre vlfius noble knyght asked kynge seke shall telle said kynge seke angre loue fayre igrayne may hool wel lord said syre vlfius shal seke merlyn shalle yow remedy youre herte shalbe pleasyd vlfius departed aduenture mette merlyn beggar aray ther merlyn asked vlfius whome soughte said lytyl ado telle hym well saide merlyn knowe whome thou sekest thou sekest merlyn therfore seke ferther yf kynge vther wille wel rewarde sworne vnto fulfille desyre shall honour profite tha myn shalle cause hym haue alle desyre alle wyll vndertake said vlfius ther shalle nothyng resonable thow shalt haue thy desyre well said merlyn shall haue entente desyre therfore saide merlyn ryde wey wille long behynde capitulum secundum thenne vlfius glad rode paas tyll came kynge vtherpendragon told hym met merlyn said kyng sir said vlfius wille dwelle long ther al vlfius ware merlyn stood porche pauelions dore thenne merlyn bounde come kynge whan kyng vther sawe hym said welcome syr said merlyn knowe al hert euery dele ye wil sworn vnto ye true kynge enoynted fulfille desyre ye shal haue desyre thenne kyng sworne vpon iiij euuagelistes syre said merlyn desyre first nyyt yt ye shal lye igrayne ye shal gete child whan borne shall delyuerd nourisshe wille haue shal worship childis auaille mykel child worth wylle wel said kynge thow wilt haue make redy said merlyn nyght ye shalle lye igrayne castel tyntigayll ye shalle lyke duke husband vlfyus shal lyke syre brastias knyghte duke lyke knyghte hyghte syr iordanus knyghte duke wayte ye make many question men saye ye diseased soo hye yow ledde ryse morne tyll come yow castel tyntygaill x myle hen soo done deuysed duke tyntigail aspyed hou kyng rode fro syege tarabil therfor nyghte yssued oute castel posterne haue distressid kynges hooste thorowe owne yssue duke hym self slayne euer kynge cam castel tyntigail deth duke kyng vther lay igrayne thre houres deth begat nygy arthur day cam merlyn ca kyng hym make hym redy kist lady igrayne departed hast whan lady herd telle duke husbad record dede euer kynge vther came thenne merueilled myghte laye lykenes lord mourned pryuely held hir pee thenne alle baron one assent prayd kynge accord betwixe lady igrayne hym kynge gaf hem leue fayne wold haue hen acoorded soo kyng put alle trust vlfyus entrete bitwene entrete last kyng met gyder wille doo wel said vlfyus kyng lusty knyghte wyueles lady igrayne passynge fair lady grete ioye vnto v hit myghte please kynge make quene vnto well acoordd meued kynge anone lyke lusty knyghte assentid therto good wille alle haste maryed mornynge grete myrthe ioye kynge lott lowthean orkenay thenne wedded margawse gaweyns moder kynge nentres land garlot wedded elayne al done request kynge vther thyrd syster morgan efey put soole nonnery ther lerned moche grete clerke nygromancye wedded kynge vryens lond gore syre ewayns le blaunche maynys fader capitulum tercium thene quene igrayne waxid dayly gretter gretter befel within half yere kyng vther lay quene asked hir seith ouyt hym who child within body thene sore abasshed yeue ansuer desmaye said kyng telle trouthe shall loue better feythe body syre saide shalle telle trouthe nyghte yt lord dede houre deth knyytes record ther came castel tyntigaill man lyke lord speche countenaunce two knyghtes hym lykenes two knyghtes barcias iordans soo went vnto led hym ouyt lord nyght shal ansuer vnto god child begoten vpon trouthe saide kynge ye say self cam lykenesse therfor desmay fader child ther told alle cause merlyns counceil thenne quene made grete ioye whan knewe fader child sone come merlyn vnto kyng said syr ye must puruey yow nourisshyng child thou wolt said kyng wel said merlyn knowe lord land passyng true man feithful shal haue nourysshyng child name sir ector lord fair lyuelode many partyes englond walys lord sir ector lete hym sent come speke desyre hym self loueth put owne child nourisshynge another woman wyf nourisshe whan child borne lete delyuerd yoder pryuy posterne vncrystned like merlyn deuysed done whan syre ector come made fyauce kyng nourisshe child lyke kynge desyred kyng graunted syr ector grete rewardys thenne lady delyuerd kynge commaunded ij knyghtes ij ladyes take child bound cloth gold ye delyuer hym poure man ye mete posterne yate castel child delyuerd vnto merlyn bare forth vnto syre ector made holy man crysten hym named hym arthur sir ectors wyf nourysshed hym owne pappe thenne within two yeres kyng vther felle seke grete maladye meane whyle hys enemyes vsurpped vpon hym dyd grete bataylle vpon men slewe many peple sir said merlyn ye may lye ye doo ye must feld though ye ryde hors lyttar ye shall neuer haue better enemyes yf persone thenne shall ye haue vyctory done merlyn deuysed caryed kynge forth hors lyttar grete hooste towarde enemyes saynt al ons ther mette kynge grete hoost north day syre vlfyus sir bracias dyd grete dedes armes kyng vthers men ouercome northeryn bataylle slewe many peple putt remenaunt flight thenne kyng retorned vnto london made grete ioye vyctory thene fyll passynge sore seke thre dayes thre nyghtes specheles wherfore alle baron made grete sorow asked merlyn counceill best ny none remedye said merlyn god wil haue wille loke ye al baron bifore kynge vther morne god shalle make hym speke morne alle baron merlyn came fore kyng thene merlyn said aloud vnto kyng vther syre shall sone arthur kyng dayes realme appertenaunce thenne vtherpend agon torned hym said herynge alle gyue hym god blissyng myne byd hym pray soule righteuously worshipfully clayme ye croune vpon forfeture blessyng therwith yelde vp ghost thenne enterid longed kyng wherfor quene fayre igrayne made grete sorowe alle baron thenne stood reame grete ieopardy long whyle euery lord myghty men maade hym stronge many wende haue ben kyng thenne merlyn wente archebisshop caunterbury counceilled hym sende alle lordes reame alle gentilmen armes shold london come cristmas vpon payne cursynge cause yt ihu borne nyghte wold grete mercy shewe myracle come kynge mankynde shewe somme myracle shold rightwys kynge reame archebisshop aduys merlyn send alle lordes gentilmen armes shold come crystmasse euen vnto london many hem made hem clene lyf prayer myghte acceptable vnto god soo grettest chirch london whether powlis frensshe booke maketh mencyon alle estate longe day chirche praye whan matyns first masse done sene chircheyard ayest hyhe aulter grete stone four square lyke vnto marbel stone myddes therof lyke anuylde stele foot hyghe theryn stack fayre swerd naked poynt letter wryten gold aboute swerd saiden thus pulleth oute swerd stone anuyld rightwys kynge borne enlond thenne peple merueilled told archebisshop commande said tharchebisshop ye kepe yow within chirche pray vnto god still man touche suerd tyll hyhe masse done whan mass done lordes wente beholde stone swerd whan sawe scripture som assayed suche wold haue ben kyng none myght stere swerd meue hit said archebisshop shall encheue swerd doubte god make hym knowen counceill said archebisshop lete puruey x knyytes men good fame kepe swerd ordeydeyned thene ther made crye yt euery shold assay yt wold wynne swerd vpon newe yeersday baron lete maake iustes tournement alle knyytes shat wold iuste tourneye myyt playe ordeyned kepe lordes gyders comyns archebisshop trusted god wold make hym knowe shold wynne swerd vpon newe yeresday whan seruyce done baron rode vnto feld iuste som torney happed syre ector grete lyuelode aboute london rode vnto iustes hym rode syr kaynus sone yong arthur hys nourisshed broder syr kay made knyyt al halowmas afore rode ye iustes ward sir kay lost suerd lefte faders lodgyng prayd yong arthur ryde swerd wyll wel said arthur rode fast yt swerd whan cam home lady al see ioustyng thenne arthur wroth saide hym self ryde chircheyard take swerd stycketh stone broder sir kay shal without swerd day whan cam chircheyard sir arthur aliyt tayed hors style wente tent found knyytes atte iustyng handled swerd handel liytly fiersly pulled stone took hors rode way vntyll came broder sir kay delyuerd hym swerd sone sir kay saw swerd wist wel swerd stone rode fader syr ector said sire loo swerd stone wherfor must kyng thys land syre ector beheld swerd retorned ageyne cam chirche aliyte al thre wente chirche anon made sir kay swere vpon book came swerd syr said sir kay broder arthur brought gate ye swerd said sir ector arthur sir telle cam home broders swerd fond body home delyuer swerd thought broder syr kay shold swerdles cam hyder egerly pulled stone withoute ony payn found ye ony knyytes swerd seid sir ector nay said arthur said sir ector arthur vnderstade ye must kynge land wherfore sayd arthur cause sire saide ector god wille haue hit soo ther shold neuer man haue drawen oute swerde shal rightwys kyng land lete see whether ye putte swerd ther pulle hit oute ageyne maystry said arthur soo put stone therwith alle sir ector assayed pulle oute swerd faylled pcapitulum sextum assay said syre ector vnto syre kay anon pulled swerd alle myghte wold shal ye assay said syre ector arthur wyll wel said arthur pulled easily alle syre ector knelyd doune erthe syre kay allas said arthur myne dere fader broder knole ye nay nay lord arthur neuer fader blood wote wel ye hyher blood wende ye thenne syre ector told hym bitaken hym nourisshe hym whoos commandement merlyns delyuerauce pthenne arthur made grete doole whan vnderstood syre ector fader sir said ector vnto arthur woll ye good gracious lord ye kyng el blame said arthur ye man world holdyng good lady moder wyf wel owne hath fostred kepte yf euer hit goddes kynge ye say ye shall desyre may doo shalle faille yow god forbede shold faille yow sir said sire ector aske yow ye wille make sone foster broder syre kay seu alle landes shalle done said arthur feith body neuer man shalle haue office whyle ly e wente vnto archebisshop told hym swerd encheued whome twelfth day alle baron cam thyder assay take swerd wold assay afore hem alle ther myghte none take arthur wherfor ther many lordes wroth saide grete shame vnto reame ouer gouernyd boye hyghe blood borne fell oute tyme put tyll candelmas thenne alle baron shold mete ageyne alwey x knyghtes ordeyned watche swerd day nyyt sette pauelione ouer stone ye swerd fyue alwayes watched soo candalmasse many moo grete lordes came thyder haue wonne swerde myghte none preuaille right arthur dyd cristmasse dyd candelmasse pulled oute swerde easely wherof baron sore agreued put delay till hyghe feste eester arthur sped afore dyd eester yet grete lordes indignacion arthur shold kynge put delay tyll feest pentecoste thenne archebisshop caunterbury merlyns prouydence lete purueye thenne best knyghtes myghte gete suche knyghtes vtherpendragon loued best moost trusted dayes suche knyghtes put aboute arthur syr bawdewyn bretayn syre kaynes syre vlfyus syre barsias many alweyes arthur day nyghte till feste pentecost pcapitulum sextimum feste pentecost alle maner men assayed pulle swerde wold assay none myghte preuaille arthur pulled oute afore lordes comyns wherfore alle comyns cryed one wille haue arthur vnto kyng wille put hym nomore delay alle see goddes wille shalle kynge holdeth ageynst wille slee hym therwith knelyd one ryche poure cryed arthur mercy cause delayed hym longe arthur foryaf hem took swerd bitwene handes offred vpon aulter archebisshop made knyghte best man anon coronacyon made ther sworne vnto lordes comyns true kyng stand true iustyce fro then forth dayes lyf also thene made alle lordes helde croune come seruyce oughte doo many complayntes made vnto sir arthur grete wronges done syn dethe kyng vther many londes hereued lordes knyghtes ladyes gentilmen wherfor kynge arthur maade londes yeuen ageyne vnto oughte hem pwhanne done kyng stablisshed alle countreyes aboute london thenne lete make syr kay sencial englond sir baudewyn bretayne made constable sir vlfyus made chamberlayn sire brastias maade wardeyn wayte vpon northe fro trent forwardes ye tyme yt party kynges enemyes within fewe yeres arthur wan alle north scotland alle vnder obeissannce also walys parte helde ayenst arthur ouercam hem al dyd remenaunt thurgh noble prowesse hym self knyghtes round table pcapitulum octauum thenne kyng remeued walys lete crye grete feste shold holdyn pentecost incoronacion hym cyte carlyon vnto fest come kyng lott lowthean orkeney fyue c knyytes hym also ther come feste kynge vryens gore four c knyytes hym p also ther come feeste kyng nayntres garloth seuen c knyghtes hym also ther came feest kynge scotland sixe honderd knyghtes hym yong man also ther came feste kyng called kyng honderd knyghtes men passyng wel bisene al poyntes also ther cam kyng cardos fyue honderd knyghtes kyng arthur glad comynge wende al kynges knyghtes come grete loue haue done hym worship feste wherfor kyng made grete ioye sente kynges knyghtes grete presentes kynges wold none receyue rebuked messagers shamefully said ioye receyue yeftes berdles boye come lowe blood sente hym word wold none yeftes come gyue hym yeftes hard swerdys betwixt neck sholders therfore came thyder told messagers playnly grete shame see suche boye haue rule soo noble reaume land ansuer messagers departed told kyng arthur ansuer wherfor aduys baron took hym strong towre v c good men hym kynges afore said maner leyd syege tofore hym kyng arthur well vytailled xv dayes ther came merlyn amonge hem cyte carlyon thenne kynges passyng gladde merlyn asked hym cause boye arthur made kynge syres said merlyn shalle telle yow cause kynge vtherpendragons sone borne wedlok goten igrayne duke wyf tyntigail thenne bastard said al nay said merlyn deth duke thre houres arthur begoten xiij dayes kyng vther wedded igrayne therfor preue hym bastard saith nay shal kyng ouercome alle enemyes deye shalle long kynge englond haue vnder obeyssaunce walys yrland scotland moo reames reherce kynges merueyl merlyns wordes demed well shold said som hem lough hym scorne kyng lot mo called hym wytche thenne accorded merlyn kynge arthur shold come oute speke kynges come sauf goo sauf suche suraunce ther made merlyn went vnto kynge arthur told hym done badde hym fere come oute boldly speke hem spare hem ansuere kynge chyuetayn ye shal ouercome hem whether wille nylle pcapitulum ix thenne kynge arthur came oute tour vnder gowne iesseraunte double maylle ther wente hym archebisshop caunterbury syr baudewyn bretayne syr kay syre brastias men moost worship hym whan mette mekenes stoute wordes bothe sydes alweyes kynge arthur ansuerd said wold make bowe lyued wherfore departed wrath kynge arthur badde kepe hem wel bad kynge kepe hym wel soo kynge retornyd hym toure ageyne armed hym alle knyytes ye said merlyn kynges ye better stynte ye shalle preuaille though ye x many wel auysed aferd dreme reder said kyng lot merlyn vanysshed aweye came kynge arthur bad hym set hem fiersly mene whyle thre honderd good men best kynges wente streyghte vnto kynge arthur comforted hym gretely syr said merlyn arthur fyghte swerde ye myracle til ye see ye go vnto wers thenne drawe best forth alle kynge arthur sette vpon hem lodgyng syre bawdewyn syre kay syr brastias slewe right hand lyfte hand merueylle alweyes kynge arthur horsback leyd swerd dyd merueillous dedes armes many kynges grete ioye dedes hardynesse thenne kynge lot brake bak syde kyng honderd knyghtes kyng carados sette arthur fiersly behynde hym syre arthur torned knyghtes smote behynd euer sir arthur formest prees tyl hors slayne vndernethe hym therwith kynge lot smote doune kyng arthur four knyghtes receyued hym set hym horsback thene drewe swerd excalibur bryght enemyes eyen gaf light lyke xxx torchys therwith put hem bak slewe moche peple thenne comyns carlyon aroos clubbis stauys slewe many knyghtes alle kynges helde gyders knyghtes lefte lyue fled departed merlyn come vnto arthur counceilled hym folowe hem pca x feste iourneye kynge arthur drewe hym vnto london soo counceil merlyn kyng lete calle baron couceil merlyn told kynge sixe kynges made warre vpon hym wold al haste awroke hym landys wherfor kyng asked counceil hem al coude counceil gyue said bygge ynough ye saye wel said arthur thanke good courage wil ye al loueth speke merlyn ye knowe wel hath done moche knoweth many thynges whan afore wold ye prayd hym hertely best auyse alle barone sayd wold pray hym desyre hym soo merlyn sente fair desyred al baron gyue best counceil shall say said merlyn warne yow al enemyes passyng strong yow good men armes ben lyue thys tyme haue goten four kynges mo myghty duke onlesse kyng haue chyualry hym may make within ye boundys reame fyghte hem batail shal ouercome slayn best doo cause said al baron shal telle said merlyn myne aduys ar two bretheren beyond see kynges bothe merueillous good men handes one hyghte kynge ban benwic hyght kyng bors gaule fraunce two kynges warrith myghty man men kynge claudas stryueth hem castel grete werre betwixt claudas myghty goodes wherof geteth good knyytes putteth two kynges moost parte werse wherfor counceil kyng souerayne lord sende vnto kynges ban bors two trusty knyghtes letter wel deuysed wil come see kynge arthur courte helpe hym warrys wil sworne vnto helpe warrys ageynst kynge claudas saye ye vnto counceill said merlyn thys wel counceilled said kynge alle baron right alle haste ther ordeyned goo two knyghtes message vnto two kynges soo made letter plesaunt wyse accordyng vnto kyng arthur desyre vlfyus brastias made messagers rode forth wel horsed wel armed gyse tyme passed see rode toward cyte benwyck besydes viij knyghtes aspyed strayt passage mette vlfyus brastias wold haue taken hem prysoners prayd hem myght passe messagers vnto kyng ban bors sent kynge arthur therfor said viij knyghtes ye shalle dye prysoners ben knyghtes kyng claudas therwith two dressid sperys vlfyus brastias dressid theire speres ranne gyder grete raundon claudas knyghtes brack speres ther hylde bare two knyghtes sadels erthe lefte hem lyeng rode wayes sixe knyghtes rode afore passage mete wyth hem ageyne vlfyus brastias smote two doun past wayes fourth passage mette two two bothe leid vnto erthe ther none viij knyghtes sore hurte brysed whan come benwick fortuned ther kynges ban bors whan told kynges come messagers sente vnto ij knyghtes worship one hyghte lyons lord countrey payarne sir phariaunce worshipful knyght anone asked whens came said kynge arthur kyng englond took theyre armes made grete ioye eche anon ij kynges wist messagers arthur ther made taryenge forthwith spak knyghtes welcomed hem feythfullest wyse said welcome vnto alle kynges lyuynge ther kyst letter delyuerd hem whan ban bors vnderstood letter thenne welcome hast letter gaf hem ansuer wold fulfille desyre kynge arthur wrytyng vlfyus brastias tary longe wold shold haue suche chere myghte made tho marchys thenne vlfyus brastias told kyng adueture passage eyghte knyytes ha said ban bors good frendes wold wyst hem shold haue escaped vlfius brastias good chere grete yeftes moche myghte bere awey hadde ansuere mouthe wrytynge tho two kynges wold come vnto arthur hast myyte two knytes rode fore passed see come lord told hym spedde wherof kynge arthur passyng gladde tyme suppose ye ij kynges wol syr said afore halowmasse thenne kynge lete puruey grete feeste lete crye grete iustes halowmasse two kynges come ouer see thre honderd knyytes wel arayed pee werre kyng arthur mette hem x myle oute london ther grete ioye coude thouyt made al halowmasse grete feeste sate halle thre kynges syre kay sencial serued halle syr lucas bottelere duke corneus sone sir gryflet sone cardol iij knyytes rule alle seruyse serued kynges anon wasshen rysen al knyytes wold iuste made hem redy redy horsbak vij c knyghtes arthur ban bors archebisshop caunterbury syre ector kays fader place couerd clothe gold lyke halle ladyes gentilwymmen behold dyd best theron gyue iugement pcapitulum xj kynge arthur two kynges lete departe vij c knyghtes two partyes iij c knyghtes reame benwick gaule torned syde dressid sheldes beganne couche speres many good knyghtes gryflet first mette knyghte one ladynas mett egerly al men hadde wonder soo faughte sheldes felle pyeces hors man felle erthe bothe frensshe knyghte englysshe knyghte lay longe alle men wend ben dede whan lucas botteler sawe gryflet soo lye horsed hym ageyne anon two dyd merueillous dedes armes many bachelers also syre kay came oute enbusshement fyue knyghtes hym sixe smote sixe doune syr kay dyd day merueillous dedes armes ther none dyd wel day thenne ther come ladynas grastian two knyghtes fraunce dyd passynge wel men preysed thenne come syre placidas good knyghte mette syr kay smote hym doune hors man wherfore syre gryflet wrothe mette syre placidas soo harde hors man felle erthe whan v knyghtes wyst syr kay falle wrothe wyt therwith eche v bare doune knyghte whanne kyng arthur two kynges sawe hem begyn waxe wrothe bothe partyes lepte smale hakeneis lete crye men shold departe vnto lodgynge wente home vnarmed euen songe souper thre kynges wente gardyn gaf pryce vnto syre kay lucas bottelere vnto syre gryflet thenne wente vnto connceil hem gwenbaus brother vnto syr ban bors wyse clerk thyder wente vlfyus brastias merlyn ben counceill wente vn bedde morne herde masse dyner counceille made many argumentis best doo last concluded merlyn shold goo token kyng ban rynge vnto men kynge bors gracian placidas sholde goo ageyne kepe theire castels countreyes kynge ban benwick kynge bors gaules ordeyned hem passed see came benwyck whan peple sawe kyng ban rynge gracian placidas glad asked kynges ferd made grete ioye welfare cordyng accordynge vnto souerayne lordes desyre men warre made hem redy al hast possyble soo xv hors foot grete plente vytaylle hem merlyns prouysyon gracian placidas lefte furnysshe garnysshe castels drede kynge claudas ryght merlyn passed see wel vytailled bothe water land whan came see sente home foote men ageyne took mo hym x men horsbak moost parte men armes shypped passed see englond londed douer thorow wytte merlyn lad hoost northward pryuyest wey coude thoughte vnto foreist bedegrayne valey lodged hem secretely pthenne rode merlyn vnto arthur two kynges told hem sped wherof grete merueylle man erthe myghte spede soone goo come merlyn told x forest bedegrayne wel armed al poyntes thenne saye horsbak wente hoost arthur afore purueyed xx passed nyghte day ther made suche ordenauce afore merlyn ther shold man werre ryde go countrey syde trent water yf token kynge arthur thorow kynges enemyes durste ryde dyd fore aspye pcapitulum xij soo within lytel space thre kynges came vnto castel bedegrayne fond passynge fayr felauship wel sene wherof grete ioye vytaille wanted none cause northeren hoost rered despyte rebuke syx kynges carlyon tho vj kynges meanes gate vnto hem fyue kynges thus beganne gadre theyr peple p sware wele woo shold leue tyl destroyed arthur thenne made oth fyrst beganne othe duke candebenet wold brynge hym v men armes redy horsbak thenne sware kynge brandegoris stranggore wold brynge v men armes horsbak thenne sware kynge claryuaus northumberland wold brynge thre thousand men armes thenne sware kyng c knyghtes passynge good man yonge wold brynge four thousand men armes horsbak thenne ther swore kynge lott passyng good knyyt syre gawayns fader wold brynge v men armes horsbak also ther swore kynge vryence syr vwayns fader lond gore wold brynge vj men armes horsbak also ther swore kyng idres cornewalle wold brynge v men armes horsbak also ther swore kyng cardelmans brynge v horsbak also ther swore kyng agwysaunce irelond brynge v men armes horsbak also ther swore kyng entres brynge v men armes horsbak also swore kynge carados brynge v men armes horsbak soo hool hoost clene men armes horsbak fyfty thousand foot x thousand good mennes bodyes thenne soone redy mounted vpon hors sente forth fore rydars xj kynges wayes leyd syege vnto castel bedegrayne departed drewe toward arthur lefte fewe abyde syege castel bedegrayne holden kynge arthur men theryn arthur pcapitulum xiij soo merlyns aduys ther sente fore rydars skumme countreye mette fore rydars north made hem telle whiche wey hooste cam thenne told arthur kyng ban bors counceill lete brenne destroye alle contrey afore shold ryde p kynge honderd knyghtes mette wonder dreme two nyghtes fore bataille ther blewe grete wynde blewe doun castels townes cam water bare hit awey alle herd sweuen said token grete batayll thenne counceill merlyn whan wist whiche wey xj kynges wold ryde lodge nyghte mydnyght sette vpon theyr pauelyons scoute watche hoost cryed lordes att armes enemyes hand pcapitulum xiiij thenne kynge arthur kynge ban kynge bors good trusty knyghtes set hem fyersly made ouer throwe pauelions hedys xj kynges manly prowesse armes tooke fayre champayne slayne morowe tyde x good mennys bodyes afore hem strong passage yet fyfty hardy men thenne drewe toward day shalle ye doo myne aduys said merlyn vnto thre kynges wold kynge ban kynge bors felauship x men put wood besyde enbusshement kepe preuy leid lyght daye come stere tyll ye knyghtes haue foughte hem longe whanne hit daye lyght dresse bataille euen afore passage maye see alle hooste thenne wyl hardy see yow aboute xx cause hem gladder suffre yow youre hoost come ouer passage thre kynges hoole baron sayde merlyn said passyngly wel done anone merlyn deuysed soo mo n whan eyther hoost sawe hoost north well comforted thenne vlfyus brastias delyuerd thre thowsand men armes sette fyersly passage slewe ryght hand lyft hand wonder telle pwhanne enleuen kynges sawe fewe felauship dyd suche dedes armes ashamed sette hem agayne fyersly ther syr vlfyus hors slayne vnder hym dyd merueyllously well foote pbut duke eustace cambenet kynge claryaunce northumberland alweye greuous vlfyus thenne brastias sawe felawe ferd al smote duke spere hors man fell doune sawe kyng claryaunce retorned vnto brastias eyther smote soo hors man wente erthe lay long astonyed hors knee brast hard bone thenne cam syr kay sencyal syxe felawes hym dyd passyng wel cam xj kynges ther gryflot put erthe hors man lucas bottelere hors man kynge brandegorys kyng idres kyng agwysaunce thene waxed medle passynge hard bothe partyes whan syre kay sawe gryflet foote rode kyng nentres smote hym doun lad hors vnto syr gryflet horsed hym ageyne also syr kay spere smote doun kyng lott hurt hym passyng sore sawe kyng c knyytes ran vnto syr kay smote hym doune toke hors gaf hym kyng lott wherof said gramercy whan syr gryflet sawe syr kay lucas bottelere foote took sharp spere grete square rode pynel good man armes smote hors man doune thenne tooke hors gaf hym vnto syr kay thenne kynge lot saw kyng nentres foote ranne vnto melot de la roche smote hym doune hors man gaf kyng nentres hors horsed hym ageyne also kyng c knyytes sawe kynge idres foot thenne ran vnto gwymyart de bloy smote hym doune hors man gaf kynge idres hors horsed hym ageyne kyng lot smote doun claryaunce de la foreist saueage gaf hors vnto duke eustace whanne horsed kynges ageyne drewe hem al xj kynges gyder said wold reuenged dommage taken day meane whyle cam syr ector egyr countenaunce found vlfyus brastias foote grete perylle deth fowle defoyled vnder horsfeet thenne arthur lyon ranne vnto kynge cradelment north walys smote hym thorowe lyfte syde hors kynge fylle doune thenne tooke hors rayne ladde hym vnto vlfyus said haue hors myn old frend grete nede hast thow hors gramercy said vlfyus thenne syre arthur dyd merueillously armes men wondyr whan kynge c knyghtes sawe kyng cradelment foote ranne vnto syre ector wel horsed syr kayes fader smote hors man doune gaf hors vnto kynge horsed hym ageyne kyng arthur sawe kyng ryde syr ectors hors wroth swerd smote kynge helme quarter helme shelde fyll doune swerd carf doune vnto hors neck kyng hors fyll doune gronnd thenne syr kay cam vnto syr morganore sencial kyng c knyghtes smote hym doun hors man lad hors vnto fader syre ector thenne syr ector ranne vnto knyght hyghte lardans smote hors man doune lad hors vnto syr brastias grete nede hors gretely defoyled whan brastias beheld lucas botteler lay lyke dede man vnder horse foot euer syr gry flet dyd merueillously rescowe hym alweyes xiiij knyghtes syr lucas thenne brastias smote one hem helme wente treth rode another smote hym arme flewe feld thene wente third smote hym sholder sholder arme flewe feld whan gryflet sawe rescowes smote knyght tempils hede helme wente erthel gryflet took hors knyght lad hym vnto syr lucas bad hym mounte vpon hors reuenge hurtes brastias slayne knyghte fore horsed gryflet pcapitulum xv thenne lucas sawe kyng agwysaunce late hadde slayne morys de la roche lucas ran hym short spere grete gaf hym suche falle hors felle doun erthe also lucas found fote bloyas de la flaundres syr gwynas ij hardy knyytes woodenes lucas slewe ij bachelers horsed hem ageyn thene waxid batail possyng hard partyes arthur glad yt knyytes horsed ayene thene foughte gyders noyse sowne rang water wood wherfor kyng ban kyng bors made redy dressyd theyr sheldes harneys couragyous many knyghtes shoke beuerd egrenes whyle lucas gwynas bryaunte bellyas flaundrys helde strong medle ayenst vj kynges kynge lott kynge nentres kyng brandegorys kyng idres kyng vryens kyng agwysaunce soo helpe syre kay syr gryflet helde vj kynges hard vnnethe ony power defend whan syr arthur sawe batail wold endyd maner ferd wood lyon stered hors right hand lyft hand stynte tyl slayne xx knyytes also wounded kyng lot sore sholder made hym leue ground syre kay gryflet dyd kyng arthur grete dedes armes thenne vlfyus brastias sir ector encountred ageynst duke eustace kyng cradelment kyng cradelmat kynge claryaunce northumberland kyng carados ageynst kyng c knyytes knyytes encountred kynges made auoyde grounde thene kyng lott made grete dool dommagis felawes said vnto x kynges yf ye wil deuyse shalle slayn destroyed lete haue kynge c knyytes kyng agwysaunce kyng idres duke canbene v kynges wol haue xv men armes v wille go parte wyle ye vj kynges holde medle xij see ye haue fouyten hem long thene come fyersly ellys shall neuer matche hem said kynge lot meane departed deuysed vj kynges made party strong ageynst arthur made grete warre longe meane whyle brake enbusshement kynge ban kynge bo lyons pharyaunce aduant garde two knyghtes mette
