kyng idres felauship began grete medele brekyng speres smytynge swerdys sleynge men horse kynge idres nere discomforture sawe agwysannce kynge put lyons pharyaunce poynte dethe duke canbenek came grete felauship soo two knyghtes grete daunger lyues fayn retorne alweyes rescowed hem self felauship merueillously whan kynge bors sawe tho knyghtes put bak greued hym sore thene cam fast felauship semed blak inde whan kyng lot aspyed kynge bors knewe hym wel thenne said ihesu defende v fro deth horryble maymes see wel ben grete perylle dethe see yonder kynge one worshipful lest men one best knyytes world ben enclyned vnto felauship said kynge c knyytes said kyng lot kyng bors gaul merueile come countreye without wetynge v merlyns auyse said knyghte hym sayd kynge carados wylle encountre kynge bors ye wil rescowe whan myster go said al wil may thenne kyng carados hoost rode softe pace tyl come nyghe kynge bors bowe draughte thenne eyther bataill lete hors renne fast myghte bleoberys godson vnto kynge bors bare chyef standard passynge good knyghte shall see said kyng bors hou northeren breton bere armes kyng bors encountred knyght smote hym thorow spere fel dede vnto erthe drewe swerd dyd merueillous dedes armes partyes grete woder therof knyytes failled dyd part kyng carados smyten erthe came kyng c knyytes rescued kyng carados myytely force armes passyng good knyght kynge yong man pcapitulum xvj come feld kynge ban fyers lyon bandys grene therupon gold ha said kyng lot must discomfyte yonder see moste valyaunt knyght world man renoume suche ij bretheren kyng ban kyng bors ar lyuynge wherfore must nedes voyde deye yf auoyde manly wysely ther dethe whanne kynge ban came bataill cam fiersly stroke redounded ageyne fro woode water wherfor kynge lott wepte pyte doole sawe many good knyytes take theyr ende thorowe grete force kyng ban made northeren bataylles departed hurtled gyders grete drede thre kynges knyghtes slewe euer pyte behold multitude people fledde kynge lott kynge honderd knyytes kynge morganore gadred peple gyders passyng knyghtly dyd grete prowesse armes helde bataill daye lyke hard pwhanne kynge honderd knyghtes beheld grete damage kynge ban dyd threst vnto hym wyth hors smote hym hyhe vpon helme grete stroke stonyed hym sore thenne kynge ban wroth hym folowed hym fyersly sawe cast vp sheld spored hors forward stroke kynge ban felle doune carfe cantel sheld swerd ode doune haulerk behynde back cut thorow trappere stele hors euen two pyeces swerd felte erthe thenne kynge c knyghtes voyded hors lyghtly swerd broched hors kyng ban thorow thorow kynge ban voyded lyghtly deede hors thenne kynge ban smote egrely smote hym helme felle erth also yre feld kyng morganore grete slaughter good knyghtes moche peple come prees kynge arthur fond kynge ban stondynge among dede men dede hors fyghtynge foote wood lyon ther came none nyghe hym fer myght reche swerd caughte greuous buffet wherof kynge arthur grete pyte arthur blody shelde ther myght man knowe hym blood braynes swerd arthur loked hym sawe knyght passyngly wel horsed therwith syre arthur ranne hym smote hym helme swerd wente vnto teeth knyght sanke doune erthe dede anon arthur tooke hors rayne ladde hym vnto kynge ban said fair broder haue hors ye haue grete myster therof repenteth sore grete dammage hit shall soone reuengid said kynge ban truste god myn eure suche may sore repente thys wol wel said arthur see dedes full actual neuertheles myghte come yow tyme whanne kynge ban mounted horsbak thenne beganne newe bataill whyche sore hard passyng grete slaughter thurgh grete force kynge arthur kynge ban kynge bors made knyghtes litel withdrawe alwey xj kynges chyualrye neuer torned bak withdrewe hem lytil woode ouer lytyl ryuer therethey rested hem nyghte myghte haue rest feld ne xj kynges knyghtes put hem hepe gyders men adrad comforte ther man myghte passe helde hem hard gyders bothe behynde kynge arthur merueille dedes armes passynge wrothe syr arthur said kynge ban kynge bors blame hem noughte doo good men ouyt doo feith said kyng ban best fyghtyng men knyghtes moost prowesse euer sawe herd speke tho xj kynges men grete worship yf longyng vnto yow kynge vnder heuen hadde suche xj knyghtes suche worship may loue hem said arthur wold destroye wote wel said kynge ban kynge bors mortal enemyes hath ben preued afore hand day haue done theire parte grete pyte theire wilfulnes thenne alle xj kynges drewe hem gyder thenne said kynge lott lordes ye must wayes ye el grete losse behynde ye may see peple haue lost good men lese cause waytte alweyes foote men euer sauynge one foote men lese x horsmen hym therfore myne aduys lete v put foote men v nere nyghte noble arthur wille ry foote men maye saue hem self woode nerehand whan horsmen gyders loke eueryche yow kynges lete make suche ordinaunce none breke vpon payne dethe seeth ony man dresse hym flee lightly slayne better slee coward thorow coward alle slayne saye ye said kynge lott ansuere ye kynges wel said quod kynge nentres said kynge honderd knyghtes saide kynge carados kyng vryence dyd kynge idres kyng brandegorys dyd kyng cradulmas ke ca debenet said kyng claryaunce kyng agwysaunce sware wold neuer faille neyther lyf dethe fledde dyd shold slayne thenne amended harneys ryghted theire sheldes tooke newe sperys sette hem theire thyes stode stille hit ben plompe wood pcapitulum xvij whanne syre arthur kynge ban bors byhelde knyghtes preysed hem moche noble chere chyualrye hardyest fyghters euer herd sawe dressyd hem xl noble knyghtes saide vnto thre kynges wold breke bataille name lyons pharyaunce vlfyus brastias ector kaynes lucas bottelere gryflett la fyse de dieu mariet de la roche gwynas de bloy briat de la foreyst saueage bellaus moryans castel maydyn fla nedreus castel ladyes annecians kynge bors godsone noble knyght ladynas de la rouse emerause caulas gracyens le casteleyn one bloyse de la caase syre colgreueaunce de gorre knyytes rode fore sperys thyes spored horse myghtely horse myyte renne xj kynges parte knyytes russched horse fast myyte spe e ther dyd partyes merueillous dedes armes soo came thycke prees arthur ban bors slewe doune right handes horse went bloood vp fytlokys euer xj kynges hooste euer vysage arthur wherfore ban bors grete merueille consyderyng grete slauyter last dryuen abak ouer lytil ryuer came merlyn grete black hors said vnto arthur thow hast neuer done hast thou ne ynough thre score thousand day hast thow lefte lyue xv tyme saye ho god wrothe thow wolt neuer haue done yonder xj kynges tyme ouerthrowen thow tary ony lenger thy fortune wille torne shall encreace therfor withdrawe yow vnto lodgyng reste yon soone ye may rewarde good knyytes gold syluer haue wel deserued hi may rychesse dere fewe men ye haue ther neuer men dyd prowesse haue done day ye haue matched day beste fyghters world trouthe said kyng ban bors also said merlyn withdrawe yow ye lyst thre yere dar vndertake shalle dere yow ye shalle newe tydynges thenne merlyn said vnto arthur xj kynges haue hand ware sarasyns ar londed countreyes mo xl brenne lee haue leid syege att castel wandesborow make grete destruction therfore drede yow thre yere palso syre al goodes ben goten bataill lete serched whanne ye haue handy lete gyuen frely vnto two kynges ban bors may rewarde theyr knyghtes shalle cause straungers better wyll yow seruyse nede also ye able reward youre owne knyghtes owne goodes whan someuer lyketh wel said qd arthur thow hast deuysed shal done whanne delyuerd ban bors gaf goodes frely knyytes frely yeuen thenne merlyn took leue arthur ij kynges go see mayster bleyse dwelde northumberland departed cam maister passyng glad comynge tolde arthur two kynges sped grete batayll ended told name euery kyng knyght worship soo bleyse wrote bataill word word merlyn told hym began whome lyke wyse endyd werre batails done arthur dayes merlyn dyd maister bleyse wryte also wryte batails euery worthy knyght dyd arthur courte merlyn departed mayster came kynge arthur castel bedegrayne one castels stondyn forest sherewood merlyn disguysed kynge arthur knewe hym al furred black shepe skynnes grete payre bootes bowe arowes russet gowne broughte wild gyse morne candelmas day kyng arthur knewe hym syre said merlyn vnto kynge wil ye gyue yefte wherfor said kyng arthur shold gyue yefte chorle sir said merlyn ye better gyue yefte hand lese grete rychesse place grete bataill grete tresour hyd erthe told chor e said arthur merlyn told said thenne vlfyus brastias knew hym wel ynough smyled syre said two knyghtes merlyn speketh vnto yow thenne kyng arthur gretely aba ed merueyll merlyn kynge ban kynge bors soo grete dysport hym soo meane whyle cam damoysel erlys doughter name sanam name lyonors passynge fair damoysel cam thyder dohomage lordes dyd grete bataill kyng arthur sette loue gretely vpon dyd vpon hym kyng adoo gat child name borre good knyghte table round thenne ther cam word kyng ryence northen walys maade grete werre kynge lodegreance camylyard whiche thyng arthur wroth loued hym wel hated kyng ryence alwey ageynst hym ordenaunce thre kynges sente home vnto benwyck alle wold departe drede kynge claudas pharyaunce antemes grasians lyons payarne leders tho shold kepe kynges landys pcapitulum xviij thenne kynge arthur kynge ban kyng bors departed felauship xx came within vj dayes countrey cmyliarde rescowed kynge lodegreaunce ewe ther moche people kynge ryence vnto nombre x men put hym flyghte thenne thre kynges grete kyng lodegreaunce thanked grete goodnesse wold reuenge hym enemyes hadde arthur fyrst syght gweneuer kynges doughter camylyard euer loued weddyd telleth booke soo breuely make ende took theyr leue goo theyre owne countreyes kynge claudas dyd grete destruction landes thenne said arthur wille goo yow nay said kynges ye shalle tyme ye haue moche doo yet landes therfore wille departe grete goodes haue goten landes youre yeftes shalle wage good knyghtes withstande kynge claudas malyce grace god haue nede wille sende yow youre socour yf ye haue nede sende v wille tary feythe bodyes hit shalle saide merlyn nede two kynges come ageyne wey werre knowe wel kynge arthur maye longe yow within yere two ye shalle haue grete nede thenne shalle reuenge yow youre enemyes ye haue done xj kynges shal deye day grete myghte prowesse armes ij valyaunt knyghtes telleth name ben balyn le saueage balan broder ben merueillous good knyghtes ben ony lyuyng pnow torne xj kynges retorned vnto cyte hyghte sorhaute whiche cyte within kynge vryens ther refresshed hem wel myght made lech serche theyr woundys sorowed gretely dethe peple ther came messager told ther comen landes people lau e wel sarasyns xl haue brent slayne al peple may come withoute mercy haue leyd syege castel wa disborow allas sayd xj kynges sorow vpon sorou yf warryd ageynst arthur haue done wold soone reuenge v kyng lodegryaunce loueth arthur better v kyng ryence hath ynough doo lodegreans hath leyd syege vnto hym soo consentyd gyder kepe alle march cornewayle walys northe soo fyrst putte kynge idres cyte nauntys brytayne iiij thowsand men armes watche bothe water land also put cyte wyndesan kynge nauntres garlott four thousand knyghtes watche water lond also men werre moo eyght thousand fortyfye alle fortress march cornewaylle also put moo knyytes alle march walys scotland many good men armes soo kepte hem gyders space thre yere euer alyed hem myghty kynges duke lordes felle kynge ryence north walys whiche myghty man men new myghty man men whyle furnysshed hem garnysshed hem good men armes vytaille alle maner abylement pretendith werre auenge hem bataille bedegrayne telleth book auentures folowynge capitulum xix thene departyng kyng ban kyng bors kynge arthur rode vnto carlyon thyder cam hym kyng lot wyf orkeney maner message sente thyder aspye courte kynge arthur cam rychely bisene four sone gawayn gaherys agrauaynes gareth many knyghtes ladyes possynge fayr lady wherfore kynge cast grete loue vnto desyred lye agreed begate vpon mordred syster moder syde igrayne ther rested moneth last departed thenne kyng dremed merueillous dreme wherof sore adrad al tyme kyng arthur knewe kyng lot wyf syster thus dreme arthur hym thought ther come land gryffons serpentes hym thoughte brente slough alle peple lad thenne hym thoughte faughte hem dyd hym passynge grete harme wounded hym ful sore last slewe hem whanne kynge awaked passynge heuy dreme put oute thoughtes made hym redy many knyghtes ryde huntynge soone forest kynge sawe grete hert afore hym herte wille chace said kynge arthur spored hors rode longe fyne force ofte lyke haue smyten herte kynge chaced herte soo long hors loste hys brethe fylle doune dede thenne yoman fette kynge another hors kyng sawe herte enbusshed hors dede sette hym doune fontayne fell grete thoughtes satte hym thoughte herd noyse houndes somme xxx kynge sawe comyng toward hym straungest best euer sawe herd best wente welle drank noyse bestes bely lyke vnto questyng xxx coupyl houndes alle whyle beest dranke noyse bestes bely therwith best departed grete noyse wherof kyng grete merueyll grete thoughte therwith fell slepe ryght ther came knyght foote vnto arthur sayd knyght full thought slepy telle yf thow sawest straunge best passe waye suche one sawe said kynge arthur past two myle wold ye best said arthur syre haue folowed best long tyme kyld myne hors wold god another folowe quest ryyte came one kynges hors whan knyght sawe hors prayd kyng yeue hym hors haue folowed quest xij moneth shal encheue hym blede best blood body pellinore tyme kynge folowed questynge best deth sir palamydes folowed hit pcapitulum xx syr knyghte said kynge leue quest suffre haue hit wyll folowe another xij moneth foole said knyghte vnto arthur veyne thy desyre shalle neuer ben encheued next kyn sterte vnto kynges hors mounted sadel said gramercy hors myn owne wel said kynge thow mayst take myn hors force myyte preue whether thow better horsbak wel said knyght seke whan thow wolt nygh wel thow shalt fynde soo passyd weye thenne kyng sat study bad men fetche hors faste euer myghte ryght soo came hym merlyn lyke child xiiij yere age salewed kyng asked hym pensyf may wel pensyf sayd kynge haue sene merueyllest syyt euer sawe knowe wel said merlyn wel thy self thy thoughtes thow art foole take thought wylle amend also knowe thow arte thy fader whome thow begoten kynge vtherpendragon thy fader begat igrayne fals said kyng arthur sholdest thou knowe thow arte old yeres knowe fader yes sayd merlyn knowe better ye ony man lyuynge wille bileue said arthur wroth child soo departed merlyn came ageyne lykenes old man iiij score yere age wherof kynge ryght glad semed ryghte wyse thenne saide old man ye sad maye wel heuy said arthur many thynges also chyld told many thynges semeth shold knowe age knowe fader yes said old man child told yow trouthe wold haue tolde yow ye wolde haue suffred hym ye haue done thynge late god displeasyd yow ye haue layne syster ye haue goten chyld shalle destroye yow knyghtes realme ye said arthur telle tydynges merlyn childes lykenes sayd kyng arthur ye merueillous man merueylle moche thy wordes mote dye bataille merueylle said merlyn god wyll youre body punysshed fowle dedes may wel sory said merlyn shalle dye shameful deth put erthe quyck ye shall dye worshipful deth talked cam one kynges hors kyng mounted hors merlyn another rode vnto carlyon anone kynge asked ector vlfyus bigoten told hym vtherpendragon fader quene igrayn moder thenne sayd merlyn wylle moder sente may speke yf saye self thene wylle byleue hit hast quene sente cam broughte morgan le fay doughter fayre lady ony myghte kynge welcomed igrayne best maner pcapitulum xxj ryght soo cam vlfyus saide openly kynge myyt fested day ye falsest lady world traitresse vnto kynges person beware saide arthur thow saist thow spekest grete word wel ware said vlfyus speke gloue preue hit vpon ony man seye contrary quene igrayne causar af grete domage grete werre wold haue vtterd lyf kyng vtherpe dragon byrthe yow ye begoten ye neuer mortal werrys ye haue moost party baron realme knewe neuer who sone ye whome ye begoten bare yow body shold haue made knowen openly excusyng worship lyke wyse alle reame wherfor preue fals god yow al realme wyll saye contrary wyll preue body thenne spak igrayne sayd woman may fyghte rather shold dishonoured ther wold good man take quarel sayd merlyn knoweth wel ye syr vlfyus kynge vther cam castel tyntagaill lykenes lord dede thre houres fore therby gat child nyght vpon viij day kynge vther wedded commaundement whan child borne delyuerd vnto merlyn nourysshed hym sawe child neuer wote name knewe hym neuer yet vlfyus saide quene merlyn blame ye wel wote said quene bare child lord kyng vther wote become thenne merlyn toke kynge hand sayeng moder therwith syr ector bare wytnes nourysshed hym vthers commaundement ther kynge arthur toke moder quene igrayne armes kyst eyther wepte vpon thenne kyng lete make feest lasted eyght dayes thenne day ther come courte squyer hors back ledynge knyght hym wounded dethe told hym ther knyght forest rered vp pauelione well hath slayne mayster good knyght name mylis wherfor byseche yow mayster maye buryed somme knyyt maye reuenge maysters deth thenne noyse grete knyghtes dethe court euery man said aduys thenne came gryflett squyer yonge age kyng arthur soo besoughte kyng alle seruyse done hym gyue hym ordre knyghthode pcapitulum xxij thou arte full yong tendyr age sayd arthur take hyghe ordre sir said gryflet byseche yow make knyyt syr said merlyn grete pyte lese gryflet wille passynge good man whanne age abydynge yow terme lyf yf auenture body yonder knyght fontayne grete peryll yf euer come ageyne one best knyghtes world stre gyst man armes wel said arthur desyre gryflet kynge made hym knyght said arthur vnto syre gryflet sythen haue made yow knyghte thow must yeue gyfte ye said gryflet thou shalt promyse feythe thy body whan thou hast iusted knyght fontayne whether falle ye foote horsbak ryght ye shal come ageyne vnto withoute makynge ony debate wyll promyse yow said gryflet yow desyre thenne toke gryflet hors grete haste dressyd sheld toke spere hand rode grete wallop tyll cam fontayne ther sawe ryche pauelion ther vnder clothe stode fayr hors wel sadeled brydeled tree shelde dyuerse colour grete spere thenne gryflet smote sheld bott spere shylde felle doune ground knyght cam oute pauelione sayd fair knyght smote ye doune sheld wil iuste yow said gryflet better ye doo sayd knyghte ye yong late made knyght myghte nothyng myn saide gryflet wylle iuste yow loth said knyght sythen muste nedes wille dresse therto whens ye sayd knyyte syre arthur courte two knyghtes ranne gyder gryflets spere al sheuered ther smote gryflet thorowe sheld lyfte syde brake spere troncheon stack body hors knyghte fylle doune pcapitulum xxiij knyght sawe hym lye soo ground alyght passynge heuy wende slayne hym thenne vnlaced helme gate hym wynde troncheon set hym hors gate hym wynde bytoke hym god seid myghty hert yf myght lyue wold preue passynge good knyyt syr gryflet rode court grete doole made hym thorowe good lech heled saued ryght cam courte xij knyytes aged men cam themperour rome asked arthur truage realme el themperour wold destroye hym land wel said kyng arthur ye messagers therfor ye may say ye wil el ye shold dye therfore myn ansuer owe themperour noo truage none hold hym fayr felde shall yeue hym truage shal sharp spere el sharp swerd shall long faders soule vtherpendragon therwith messagers departed passyngly wroth kyng arthur wroth euyl tyme cam thenne kyng passyngly wroth hurte sir gryflet soo commaunded pryuy man chambre hit day best hors armour longeth vnto persone withoute cyte morowe daye ryght morow day met man hors mounted vp dressid sheld toke spere chamberlayne tary tyll came ageyne arthur wode softe paas tyll day thenne ware thre chorles chacynge merlyn wold haue slayne hym thenne kyng rode vnto flee chorles thenne ferd whan sawe knyght fled merlyn said arthur haddest thou slayne thy craftes byn nay said merlyn soo coude saue self wold thou arte nere thy deth thow gost deth ward god thy frend wente thus talkyng came fontayne ryche pauelione hit thenne kyng arthur ware sat knyght armed chayer syr knyght said arthur cause abydest thow ther maye knyght ryde wey yf iuste wyth said kynge rede leue custome said arthur customme saide knyght haue vsed wille vse magre saith nay greued custome lete hym amende hit wol wil amende said arthur shal defende said knyyt anon toke hors dressid shylde toke spere met hard either others sheldes al sheuered sperys ther anone arthur pulled oute swerd nay said knyght fayrer sayd knyyt tweyne renne gyders sharp sperys wille wel said arthur ony mo sperys haue ynow said knyyt ther cam squyer brouyt ij good sperys arthur chose one another spored horse cam gyders al myghtes eyther brak speres handes thenne arthur sette hand swerd nay seid knyght ye shal better ye passynge good iuster euer mette al one loue hyghe ordre knyythode lete v iuste one ageyn assente said arthur anone brought two grete sperys euery knyght gat spere therwith ranne gyders arthur spere al sheuered knyghte hyt hym hard myddes shelde horse man felle erthe ther arthur egre pulled oute swerd said assay syr knyghte foote haue lost honour horsbak horsbak said knyght thenne arthur wrothe dressid sheld toward hym swerd drawen whan knyght sawe lyghte hym thought worship haue knyght suche auaille horsbak foot alyght dressid sheld vnto arthur ther bega strong bataille many grete stroke soo hewe swerdes cantels flewe feldes moche blood bledde bothe al place faught ouer bledde blood thus fought long rested hem thenne wente batayl ageyne hurt led gyders lyke two rammes eyther felle erthe last smote gyders swerdys met euen gyders swerd knyght smote kyng arthur swerd two pyeces wherfor heuy thenne said knyghte vnto arthur thow arte daunger whether lyst saue slee thou yelde ouer come recreaunt thow shalt deye deth said kyng arthur welcome whan cometh yelde vnto recreaunt leuer deye soo shamed ther al kynge lepte vnto pellinore tooke hym myddel threwe hym doune raced helme whan knyght felt adrad passynge bygge man myghte anone broughte arthur vnder hym reaced helme wold haue smyten hede pcapitulum xxiiij ther came merlyn sayd knyghte hold thy hand thow slee knyghte thow put test r ame grettest dammage euer reame knyght man worship thou wotest said knyghte kyng arthur thenne wold haue slayn hym drede wrathe heue vp swerd therwith merlyn cast enchauntement knyghte felle erthe grete slepe thenne merlyn tooke vp kyng arthur rode forth knyytes hors allas said arthur hast thou done merlyn hast thow slayne good knyghte thy craftes lyueth soo worshipful knyghte leuer stynte land yere lyue care ye sayd merlyn holer ye slepe awake within thre houres told said merlyn knyghte ye slayn ben also ther lyueth bygger knyght one shal yow ryght gaod seruyse name pellinore shal haue two sone shal passyng good men sauf one shalle haue felawe prowesse good lyuynge name shal persyual walys lamerak walis shal telle yow name sone bygoten syster shal destruction alle royame pcapitulum xxv ryghte kyng departed wente vn tyl ermyte good man grete leche soo heremyte serched woundys gaf hym good salues kyng thre dayes thenne woundes wel amendyd myght ryde goo departed rode arthur said haue swerd force said merlyn swerd shalle may soo rode tyl came lake whiche fayr water brood myddes lake arthur ware arme clothed whyte samyte held fayr swerd hand loo said merlyn yonder swerd spak sawe damoisel goyng vpon lake damoysel said arthur lady lake said merlyn within lake roche theryn fayr place ony erthe rychely besene damoysell wylle come yow anone thenne speke ye fayre gyue yow swerd anone came damoysel vnto arthur salewed hym ageyne damoysel said arthur swerd yonder arme holdeth aboue water wold myne haue swerd syr arthur kynge said damoysell swerd myn yf ye gyue yefte whan aske yow ye shal haue feyth said arthur yeue yow yefte ye aske wel said damoisel go ye yonder large rowe self swerd take scaubart yow aske yefte whan see tyme syr arthur merlyn alyght tayed horse two tree went ship whanne came swerd hand held syre arthur toke vp handel toke hym arme went vnder water come vnto lond rode forth thene syr arthur sawe ryche pauelion sygnyfyeth yo der pauelion yt ye knyytes pauelion seid merlyn yt ye fouyt last syr pellinore hath doo knyght hyght egglame haue fouyten gyder last egglame fledde el ben dede hath chaced hym euen carlyon shal mete hym anon hygh wey wel sayd said arthur haue swerd wille wage bataill hym auenged hym sir ye shal said merlyn knyght wery fyghtyng chacyng ye shal haue worship haue hym also lyytly matched one knyyt lyuyng therfor counceil lete hym passe shal good seruyse shorte tyme sone dayes also ye shal see day short space ye shal riyt glad yeue sister wedde whan see hym wil doo ye aduyse sayd arthur thenne syre arthur loked swerd lyked passynge wel whether lyketh yow etter sayd merlyn suerd scaubard lyketh better swerd sayd arthur ye vnwyse sayd merlyn scaubard worth x swerdys whyles ye haue scaubard vpon yow ye shalle neuer lefe blood ye neuer sore wounded therfor kepe wel scaubard alweyes yow rode vnto carlyon wey met syr pellinore merlyn done suche crafte pellinore sawe arthur past withoute ony wordes merueylle sayd arthur knyght wold speke syr said merlyn sawe yow sene yow ye lyghtly departed soo come vnto carlyon wherof knyghtes passynge glad whanne herd auentures merueilled wold ieoparde persone soo al one alle men worship said mery vnder suche chyuetayne wolde put persone auenture poure knyghtes dyd pcapitulum xxvij meane whyle came messager kynge ryons northwalys kynge ireland many iles message gretynge wel kynge arthur manere wyse sayenge kynge ryons discomfyte ouercome xj kynges eueryche hem hym homage gaf hym berdys clene flayne moche ther wher messager came kyng arthur berd kyng ryons purfyled mantel kynges berdes lacked one place mantel wherfor sente berd el wold entre landes brenne slee neuer leue tyl haue hede berd wel sayd arthur thow hast said thy message whiche vylaynous lewdest message euer man herd sente vnto kynge also thow mayst see berd ful yong yet make purfyl hit telle thow thy kynge owe hym none homage ne none myn elder longe shall homage bothe kneys el shall lese hede feith body shamefullest message euer herd speke haue aspyed thy kyng met neuer yet worshipful man telle hym wyll haue hede withoute doo homage thenne messager departed pnow ony said arthur knoweth kyng ryons thenne ansuerd knyght hyght naram syre knowe kynge wel passyng good man body f ben lyuynge passyng prowde man sir doubte ye wille make warre yow myghty puyssaunce wel said arthur shall ordeyne hym short tyme pcapitulum xxviij thene kyng arthur lete sende al childre born may day begote lordes born ladyes merlyn told kynge arthur shold destroye hym shold borne may day wherfor sent hem vpon payn deth ther founde many lordes sone sente vnto kynge soo mordred sente kyng lotts wyf put ship see iiij wekes old lasse fortune shyp drofe vnto castel al ryuen destroyed part sauf mordred cast vp good man fonde hym nourysshed hym tyl xiiij yere olde thenne brought hym court reherceth afterward toward ende deth arthur many lordes baron reame displeasyd child lost many put wyte merlyn arthur drede loue helde pee whanne messager came kynge ryons thenne woode oute mesure purueyed hym grete hoost rehercyth book balyn e sa age foloweth next aduenture balyn gat swerd pexplicit liber primus pincipit liber secundus dethe vtherpendragon regned arthur sone whiche grete werre dayes gete al englond hand many kynges within realme englond walys scotland cornewaille soo befelle tyme whanne kyng arthur london ther came knyght tolde kynge tydynges kynge ryons northwalys rered grete nombre peple entryd land brente slewe kynges true liege peple yf true said arthur grete shame vnto myn estate myghtely withstand trouthe sayd knyghte sawe hoost self wel saide kynge lete make crye lordes knyghtes gentylmen armes shold drawe vnto castel called camelot tho dayes ther kynge wold lete make counceil general grete iustes whan kynge come thyder baronage lodged semed best ther come damoisel whiche sente message grete lady lylle auelyon whan came bifore kynge arthur told whome came sent message vnto hym cause thenne lete mantel falle rychely furred thenne gyrd noble swerd wherof kynge merueill said damoysel cause ye gyrd swerd bisemeth yow shall telle yow said damoysel swerd gyrd al doth grete sorowe comberaunce may delyuerd swerd knyghte must passyng good man handes dedes withoute vylonye trecherye withoute treason yf may fynde suche knyghte hath alle vertues may drawe onte swerd oute shethe haue ben kyng ryons told ther passyng good knyghtes alle knyghtes haue assayed none spede grete merueill said arthur yf sothe wille self assaye drawe oute swerd presumynge vpon self best knyghte begynne drawe swerd gyuyng example alle baron shall assay euerychone whan haue assayed thenne arthur toke swerd shethe gyrdel pulled egrely swerd wold oute psire seid damoysell ye nede pulle half hard shall pulle shal lytel myghte ye say wel said arthur assaye ye al baron beware ye defoyled shame trechery ne gyle thenne wille auaylle sayd damoysell must clene knyght withoute vylony gentil strene fader syde moder syde moost baron round table tyme assayed alle rewe ther myght none spede wherfor damoysel made grete sorow oute mesure sayd allas wende courte ben best knyghtes withoute trechery treson feythe sayth arthur good knyghtes deme ony ben world theyr grace helpe yow wherfor displeasyd pcapitulum ij thenne felle hit soo tyme ther poure knyght kynge arthur byn prysoner hym half yere sleynge knyghte whiche cosyn vnto kynge arthur name knyght called balen good meanes baron delyuerd oute pryson good man named body borne northumberland soo wente pryuely courte sawe aduenture wherof hit reysed herte wolde assaye knyghtes dyd poure pourely arayed put hym ferre prees herte fully assured doo wel yf grace happed hym ony knyght damoysel toke leue arthur alle baron departyng knyght balen called vnto sayd damoysel praye yow curtosy suffre wel assay lordes though po rely clothed herte semeth fully assured somme semeth herte spede ryght wel damoysel beheld poure knyght sawe lykely man poure arrayment thoughte shold worship withoute vylonye trechery thene sayd vnto knyght sir nedeth put payn labour semeth yow spede haue failled fayr damoysel said balen worthynes good tatches good dedes arrayment manhood worship hyd within man persone many worshipful knyghte knowen vnto alle people therfore worship hardynesse arayment god sayd damoysel ye say sothe therfor ye shal assaye ye may thenne balen took swerd gyrdel shethe drewe easyly loked swerd hit pleasyd hym moche thenne kynge alle baron grete merueille balen hadde done auenture many knyghtes grete despyte balen certes said damoysel passynge good knyght best euer found moost worship withoute treson trechery vylony many merueylles shalle gentyl curtois knyght yeue swerd ayene nay said balen swerd wylle kepe taken force wel saide damoysel ye wyse kepe swerd ye shalle slee swerd best frende ye haue man ye moste loue world swerd shalle destruction shal take aduenture sayd balen god wille ordeyne swerd ye shalle haue tyme feythe body ye shalle repente hit within short tyme sayd damoysel wold haue swerd auaylle myne passyng heuy sake ye wil byleue swerd shal youre destruction grete pyte damoysel departed makynge grete sorowe anone balen sente hors armour soo wold departe fro courte toke leue kynge arthur nay sayd kynge suppose ye wyll departe liytely fro felauship suppose ye displeased haue shewed yow vnkyndenes blame lasse mys senformed ageynst yow wende ye ben suche knyght ye worship prowesse yf ye wyll abyde courte among felauship shalle auaunce yow ye shalle pleased god thanke hyhenes said balen bounte hyhenes may man preyse half valewe tyme must nedes departe bysechyng yow alwey good grace truly said kynge ryght wrothe departyng pray yow faire knyghte ye tary long ye shal ryght welcome baron shalle amende mysse haue done ageynst yow god thanke grete lordship said balen therwith made hym redy departe thenne moost party knyghtes round table sayd balen auenture al myghte wytchecraft pcapitulum tercium meane whyle knyght makyng hym redy departe came court lady hyght lady lake came horsbak rychely bysene salewed kynge arthur asked hym yefte promysed whan gaf hym swerd sothe said arthur gyfte promysed yow haue forgoten name swerd ye gaue name said lady excalibur moche say cut stele ye saye wel saide kynge aske ye wil ye shall haue hit lye power yeue hit wel sayd lady aske heede knyghte hath wonne swerd el damoysels heede broughte hit take force though haue bothe hedes slewe broder good knyyte true gentilwoman causar faders deth truly said kynge arthur maye graunte neyther hedes worship therfor aske ye wille el shall fulfille desyre wil aske none thyng said lady whan balyn redy departe sawe lady lake menes slayne balyns moder soughte thre yeres whan told hym asked hede kynge arthur went streyte said euyl foude ye wold haue hede therfore ye shall lese hys swerd lyghtly smote hir hede kynge arthur allas shame sayd arthur haue ye done ye haue shamed al courte lady holden hyther came vnder sauf conduyte shalle neuer foryeue trespas sir said balen thynketh displeasyr lady vntruest lady lyuynge enchauntement sorssery hath ben destroyer many good knyghtes causer moder brente thorow falshede trechery cause soo euer ye said arthur ye shold haue forborne presence therfor thynke contrary ye shalle repente suche another despyte neuer courte therfor withdrawe yow oute courte al hast ye may thenne balen toke vp heed lady bare hym hostry met squyer sory displeasyd kyng arthur rode forth oute town said balen must departe take thow hede bere frendys telle hem haue sped telle frendys northumberland foo deed also telle hem oute pryson aueture befelle getyng swerd allas said squyar ye gretely blame displease kyng arthur said balen wylle hyhe al hast may mete kynge ryons destroye hym eyther el dye therfor yf may happe wynne hym thenne wille kynge arthur good gracious lord shall mete yow saide squyer kynge arthur court said balen squyer departed tyme thenne kynge arthur alle court made grete doole shame deth lady lake thenne kyng buryed rychely pcpitulum iiij tyme ther knyghte whiche kynges sone irelond name launceor whiche orgulous knyyt counted hym self one best courte grete despyte balen encheuynge swerd ony shold acounted hardy prowesse asked kynge arthur yf wold gyue hym leue ryde balen reuenge despyte done doo best said arthur right wroth said balen wold quyte despyte hath done courte thenne launceor wente hostry make hym redy meane whyle cam merlyn vnto court kyng arthur told hym aduenture swerd deth lady lake shall saye yow said merlyn damoysel standeth broughte swerde vnto court shalle telle yow cause comynge falsest damoysel lyueth say said hath broder passynge good knyght prowesse ful true man damoysel loued another knyght helde peramour good knyght broder mett knyght held peramour slewe hym force handes whan fals damoysel vnderstood thys wente lady lyle auelione besought help auengyd owne broder pcapitulum quintum lady lyle auelion toke swerd broughte told shold noo man pulle oute shethe yf one best knyghtes reame shold hard ful prowesse swerd shold slee broder cause damoysel came courte knowe wel ye wolde god nat comen thys courte came neuer felauship worship good alweyes grete harme knyght hath encheued suerd shal destroyed suerd whiche wil grete dommage ther lyueth knyyt prowesse shalle vnto yow lord arthur grete honour kyndenesse grete pyte shall endure whyle strengthe hardynesse knowe matche lyuynge soo knyght irelonde armed hym al poyntes dressid shelde sholder mounted vpon horsback toke spere hand rode grete paas moche hors myght goo within lytel space montayne syghte balyn lowde voys cryed abyde knyght ye shal abyde whether ye nyll sheld fore shalle helpe whan balyn herd noyse tourned hors fyersly saide faire knyghte wille ye wille ye iuste ye said iryss e knyghte therfor come yow parauenture said balyn ben better haue hold yow home many man weneth putte enemy rebuke ofte falleth hym self courte ye sente fro said balyn come fro courte kynge arthur sayd knyghte irlond come hyder reuenge despyte ye dyd day kyng arthur courte wel said balyn see wel must haue adoo yow forthynketh greue kyng arthur ony courte quarel ful symple said balyn vnto lady dede dyd grete dommage el wold haue ben lothe ony knyghte lyueth slee lady make yow redy sayd knyght launceor dresse yow vnto one shalle abyde feld thenne toke speres cam gyders moche horse myght dryue irysshe knyght smote balyn sheld alle wente sheuers spere balyn hyt hym thorugh sheld hauberk perysshed percyd thurgh body hors croppe anon torned hors fyersly drewe oute swerd wyste slayn hym thenne sawe hym lye dede corp pcapitulum vj thenne loked hym ware damoysel came ryde ful fast hors myghte ryde fayr palfroy whan aspyed launceor slayne made sorowe oute mesure sayd balyn two bodyes thou hast slayne one herte two hertes one body two soules thow hast lost therwith toke swerd loue lay ded fylle ground swowne whan aroos made grete dole mesure whiche sorowe greued balyn passyngly sore wente vnto haue taken swerd oute helde fast myghte take oute hand onles shold haue hurte sodenly sette pomell ground rofe self thorow body whan balyn aspyed dedes passynge heuy herte ashamed fair damoysell destroyed self loue deth allas said balyn repeteth sore deth knyght loue damoysel ther moche true loue betwixe bothe sorowe myght lenger behold hym torned hors loked toward grete forest ther ware armes broder balan whan mette putte helmes kyssed gyders wepte ioye pyte thenne balan sayd lytel wende haue met yow sodayne auenture ryght glad delyueraunce youre dolorous prysonement told castel four stone ye delyuerd man sene court kynge arthur therfor cam hyder countrey supposed fynde anon knyyt balyn told broder aduenture swerd deth lady lake kyng arthur displeasyd hym wherfor sente knyyt lyeth dede dethe damoysel greueth sore doth said balan ye must take aduenture god wil ordeyne yow truly said balyn ryght heuy lord arthur displeasyd moost worshipful knyght regneth erthe loue gete el wil put lyf auenture kyng ryons lyeth syege atte castel tarabil thyder drawe hast preue worship prowesse vpon hym wil wel said balan wil helpe eche bretheren ouyt pca vij go hen said balyn wel met mene whyle talked ther cam dwarf cyte camelot horsbak moche myght foud dede bodyes wherfor made grete dole pulled sorou saide knyytes haue done dede askest thou said balan wold wete said dwarfe said balyn slewe knyght defendaut hyder cam chaace must sle hym damoysel slewe self loue whiche repenteth sake shal owe al wymmen better loue allas said dwarf thow hast done grete dommage vnto thy self knyght dede one alyaunts men lyued trust wel balyn kynne knyght wille chace yow thorowe world tyl haue slayne yow sayd balyn fere gretely ryght heuy haue displeasyd lord kyng arthur deth knyght soo talked gyders came kynge cornewaille rydynge whi hyghte kynge mark pand whanne sawe two bodyes dede vnderstood hou dede ij knyghtes leyd hym hors lyttar merlyn vanysshed came kyng arthur afore hand told hym enemy taken discomfyted whome said kynge arthur two knyghtes said merlyn wold please lordship morowe ye shalle knowe knyghtes anone cam knyght two swerdes balan broder brought hem kynge ryons northwalys delyuerd hym porter charged hem hym soo two retorned ageyne daunyng day kynge arthur cam thenne kyng ryons said syr kynge ye welcome auenture come ye hyder syr said kyng ryons cam hyther hard auenture wanne yow said kyng arthur syre said kyng knyght two swerdes broder whiche two merueillous knyghtes prowesse knowe hem sayd arthur moche beholden said merlyn shal telle yow balen encheued swerd broder balan good knyght ther lyueth better prowesse worthynesse shal grettest dole hym euer knewe knyght shalle long endure allas saide kynge arthur grete pyte moche beholdyng vnto hym haue yll deserued vnto hym kyndenes nay said merlyn shal moche yow shal ye knowe hast syr ye purueyed said merlyn morne hooste new kynge ryons broder wille sette yow none grete hoost therfor make yow redy wyl departe yow pcapitulum x thenne kyng arthur made redy hoost x batails new redy felde afore castel tarabil grete hoost x batails many mo peple arthur thenne new vaward moost party peple merlyn cam kyng lot yle orkeney helde hym tale prophecye til new peple destroyed ther syr kay sencyal dyd passyngly wel dayes lyf worship went neuer fro hym sir heruys de reuel merueillous dedes kynge arthur kynge arthur slewe daye xx knyghtes maymed xl tyme cam knyyte two swerdys broder balan two merueillously kynge alle knyghtes merueilled alle behelde said sente heuen aungels deuyls helle kynge arthur said hym self best knyghtes euer sawe gaf suche stroke men woder hem meane whyle came one kynge lott told hym whyle taryed new destroyed slayne al peple allas sayd kynge lot ashamed defaute ther many worshipful man slayne ben gyders hadde ben none hooste vnder heuen ben abel haue matched v fayter prophecye hath mocked al dyd merlyn knewe wel kyng lot ben body fyrst bataille kynge arthur slayne alle peple destroyed wel merlyn knewe one kynges shold dede day loth merlyn ony sholde slayne tweyne leuer kyng lotte slayne kynge arthur best doo sayd kyng lot orkeney whether better treate kynge arthur fyghte gretter party oure peple slayne destroyed syr said knyght set arthur wery forfoughten fresshe sayd kyng lot wolde euery knyght wolde parte wold doo myn thenne auaunced baners smoten gyders al sheuered speres arthur knyghtes helpe knyght two swerdes broder balan put kyng lot hoost werre alweyes kyng lot helde hym formest frunte dyd merueillous dedes armes alle hooste borne vp handes abode al knyghtes allas myght endure whiche grete pyte worthy knyyt one shold ouermatched late tyme afore hadde ben knyght kyng arthur wedded sister kyng arthur kyng arthur lay kyng lot wyf whiche arthur syster gat mordred therfor kyng lot held ayest arthur ther knyght called knyghte straunge beeste tyme ryght name called pellinore whiche good man prowesse smote myghty stroke att kynge lot fought enemyes fayled stroke smote hors neck fylle grounde kyng lot therwith anon pellinore smote hym grete stroke thorow helme hede vnto browes thenne alle hooste orkeney fled deth kynge lott slayn many moders sone kynge pellinore bare wytte deth kynge lot wherfore syr gawayne reuenged deth fader x yere made knyght slewe kynge pellinore owne handes also slayne bataille xij kynges syde kyng lot new alle buryed chirche saynt steuyns camelot remenaunt knyghtes buryed grete roche pcapitulum xj enterement cam kynge lot wyf morgause foure sone gawayne agrauayne gaherys gareth also ther came thyder kyng vryens syr ewayns fader morgan le fay wyf kyng arthur syster alle cam enterement alle xij kynges kyng arthur lete make tombe kynge lot passyng rychely made tombe owne thenne arthur lete make xij ymages laton couper ouer gylt hit gold sygne xij kynges echon hem helde tapyr wax brent day nyyt kyng arthur made sygne fygure standynge aboue hem swerd drawen hand alle xij fygures countenaunce lyke vnto men ouercome made merlyn subtyl craf e ther told kyng wha dede taper shalle brenne lenger soone aduentures sangrayll shalle come among yow encheued also told arthur balyn worshipful knyght shal gyue dolourous stroke wherof shalle falle grete vengeaunce balen balan pellinore saide kynge arthur pellinore sayd merlyn wyl mete yow soone pand balyn wille longe yow broder wil departe ye shalle see hym feyth said arthur two merueyllous knyghtes namely balyn passeth prowesse ony knyghte euer found moche holden vnto hym wold god wold abyde syr sayd merlyn loke ye kepe wel scaubard excalibur ye shalle lese blood whyle ye haue scauberd vpon yow though ye haue many woundes vpon yow ye may haue soo grete trust arthur betoke scauberd morgan le fay syster loued another knyght better husband kynge vryens kynge arthur wold haue arthur broder slayne therfor lete make another scauberd lyke enchauntement gaf scauberd excalibur loue knyghtes name called accolon nere slayne kyng arthur merlyn told vnto kynge arthur prophecye shold grete batail besyde salysbury mordred owne sone sholde ageynste hym also tolde hym basdemegus cosyn germayn vnto kynge vryence pcapitulum xij wythm daye two kynge arthur somwhat seke lete pytche pauelione medowe leyd hym doune paylet slepe myght haue rest ryght herd grete noyse hors therwith kynge loked oute porche pauelione sawe knyght comynge euen hym makyng grete dole abyde fair syr said arthur telle wherfor thow makest sorowe ye maye lytel amend said knyghte soo passed forthe castel melyot none ther cam balen whan sawe kynge arthur alyght hors cam kynge foote salewed hym hede saide arthur ye welcome sire ryght cam rydynge way knyght makynge grete moorne cause telle wlerfor wold desyre yow curtosye gentylnesse fetche ageyne knyght eyther force el good wil wil lordship said balyn rode paas found knyght damoysel forest said sir knyyt ye must come vnto kynge arthur telle hym sorow wille sayd knyghte hit wylle scathe gretely yow none auaylle syr sayd balyn pray yow make yow redy ye must goo el must fyghte yow brynge yow force doo wylle ye waraunt said knyght goo yow ye saide balyn el wylle deye therfore made hym redy go balyn lefte damoysel stylle euen afore kynge arthur pauelione came one inuysybel smote thys knyghte wente balyn thorow oute body wyth spere allas sayd knyght slayne vnder youre co duyt knyght called garlon therfor take hors better ryde damoysel folowe quest wylle lede yow reuenge deth whan ye may shalle doo sayd balyn make vowe vnto knygthode departed thys knyghte grete sorowe soo kyng arthur lete berye thys knyght rychely made mensyon tombe slayne herlews le berbeus whome trechery done knyght garlon euer damoysel bare truncheon spere syr harlews slayn al pcapitulum xiij balyn damoysel rode forest ther met knyght ben huntynge knyght asked balyn cause made grete sorowe lyst telle yow saide balyn saide knyghte armed ye wolde fyghte wyth yow shold lytel nede sayd balyn aferd telle yow told hym alle cause sayd knyght al ensure yow feithe body neuer departe yow whyle lyf lasteth soo wente hostry armed hem rode forth balyn came heremytage euen chyrcheyerd ther cam knyghte garlon inuysybel smote thys knyghte peryn de mountebeliard thurgh body spere allas saide knyghte slayne traytoure knyghte rydeth inuysyble allas said balyn fyrst despyte hath done heremyte balyn beryed knyght vnder ryche stone tombe royal morne fond letter gold wryten syr gaweyn shalle reuenge faders deth kynge lot kynge pellinore anone balyn damoysel rode tyl came castel balyn alyghte damoysel wende goo castel anone balyn came within castels yate portroolys fylle doune bak felle many men damoysel wold haue slayne whan balyn sawe sore agreued myghte helpe damoysel thenne wente vp toure lepte ouer wally dyche hurte hym anone pulled oute suerd wold haue fouyten hem sayd nay wold fyghte hym dyd thyng thold custome castel told hym lady seke layne many yeres myghte hole yf dysshe syluer ful blood clene mayde kynges doughter therfore custome castel shalle damoysel passe way shal blede blood syluer dysshe ful wel said balyn shal blede moche may blede wille lese lyf whyles lyf lasteth soo balyn made blede good blood halpe lady rested al nyght ryght good chere morn passed wayes telleth sangraylle syre percyualis syster halpe lady blood wherof dede pcapitulum xiiij thenne rode thre foure dayes neuer mette aduenture happe lodged gentyll man ryche man well ease sat souper balyn herd ouer complayne greuously hym chayer noyse said balen forsothe said hoost wylle telle yow late att iustynge iusted knyghte broder vnto kynge pellam twyes smote hym doune thenne promysed quyte best frynde wounded sone hole tyll haue knyghtes blood rydeth alwey inuysyble knowe name sayd balyn knowe knyght name garlon hath slayne two knyghtes myn maner therfor leuer mete knyght alle gold realme despyte hath done wel said ooste shalle telle yow kynge pellam lystyneyse hath made crye countrey grete feest shal xx dayes knyght may come ther yf brynge wyf wyth hym peramour knyyte youre enemy myn ye shalle see daye thenne behote yow sayd balyn parte blood hele youre sone alle wille forward morne sayd oost morne rode thre toward pellam xv dayes iourney cam thyder day began greete feeste soo alyght stabled theyr horse went castel balyns oost myght lete cause lady thenne balyn wel receyued brought vnto chamber vnarmed hym brought hym robe pleasyr wold haue balen leue swerd behynde hym nay sayd balen doo customme countrey knyghte alweyes kepe wepen hym customme wylle kepe el wyll departe cam thenne gaf hym leue swerd wente vnto castel sette amonge knyghtes worship lady afore hym soone balyn asked knyght ther knyghte court who name garlon yonder goth sayd knyght blak face merueyllest knyyt lyuyng destroyeth many good knyghtes goth inuysyble wel said balen thene balyn auysed hym long yf slee hym shall scape yf leue hym perauentur shalle neuer mete hym ageyne suche steuen moche harme wille doo lyue ther garlon aspyed balen behelde hym thenne came smote balyn face bak hand sayd knyyt beholdest thow shame therfor ete thy mete doo thow cam thow sayst sothe said balyn fyrst despyte thow hast done therfor doo cam rose vp fyersly claue hede sholders gyue truncheon sayd balyn lady slewe knyghte anone gaf hym alwey bare troncheon therwith balyn smote hym thurgh body sayd openly truncheon thow hast slayn good knyghte stycketh thy body thenne balyn called vnto hym hoost sayenge may ye fetche blood ynough hele sone capitulum xv anone knyghtes aroos tabyl set balyn kynge pellam hym self aroos vp fyersly sayd knyyt hast thow slayn broder thow shalt dye therfor thou departe wel said balen self yi sayde kyng pella ther shall haue ado self loue broder thenne kyng pellam cauyt hand grym wepen smote egrely balyn balyn put swerd betwixe hede stroke therwith swerd brest sonder whan balyn wepenles ranne chamber seke somme wepen soo fro chamber chamber wepen coude fynde alweyes kynge pellam hym last entryd chambyr merueillously wel dyyte rychely bedde arayed clothe gold rychest myghte thought one lyenge theryn therby stode table clene gold four pelours syluer bare vp table vpon table stood merueillous spere straungely wrought whan balyn sawe spere gat hand torned hym kyng pellam smote hym passyngly sore spere kynge pellam felle doune swoune therwith castel roofe wally brake fylle erthe balyn felle doune myghte stere foote hand moost party castel falle doune thorugh dolorous stroke laye vpon pellam balyn thre dayes pcapitulum xvj thenne merlyn cam thyder toke vp balyn gat hym good hors dede bad hym ryde oute countrey wold haue damoysel sayd balyn loo sayd merlyn lyeth dede kynge pellam lay many yeres sore wounded myght neuer hole tyl galahad haute prynce heled hym quest sangraille place part blood lord ihesu cryst ioseph armathe broughte lond ther hym self lay ryche bed spere longeus smote oure lorde herte kynge pellam nyghe ioseph kynne moost worshipful man lyued tho dayes grete pyte hurte thorow stroke torned grete dole tray tene thenne departed balyn merlyn sayd world mete neuer nomore soo rode forth thorowe fayr countreyes cytees fond peple dede slayne euery syde alle lyue cryed balyn thow hast caused grete dommage co trayes dolorous stroke thow gauest vnto kynge pella thre contreyes destroyed doubte vengeaunce wil falle last whanne balyn past tho contrayes passyng fayne rode eyyt dayes met auenture last came fayr forest valey ware toure besyde sawe grete hors werre tayed treee ther besyde satte fayr knyght ground made grete mornynge lykely man wel made balyn sayd god saue yow ye heuy telle wylle amende may power syr knyghte said ageyne thow doest grete gryef mery thoughtes thou puttest payne balyn wente lytel hym loked hors thenne herd balyn hym saye thus fair lady haue ye broken promyse thow promysest mete none maye curse euer ye gaf swerd swerd slee self pulled oute therwith balyn sterte vnto hym took hym hand lete goo hand sayd knyght el shal slee shal nede said balyn shal promyse yow helpe gete yow lady ye wille telle name sayd knyght myn name balyn le saueage syr knowe yow wel ynough ye knyght two swerdys man moost prowesse handes lyuyng name sayd balen name garnysshe mount poure man sone prowesse hardynesse duke hath maade knyght gaf landes name duke hermel doughter loue demed houfer hen sayd balyn vj myle said knyghte ryde hen sayde two knyghtes rode paas tyll cam fayr castel wel wallyd dyched wylle castel sayd balen loke yf ther soo wente serched fro chamber cha bir fond bedde thenne balen loked fayr litil gardyn vnder laurel tre sawe lye vpon quylt grene samyte knyght armes fast halsynge eyther vnder hedes grasse herbes whan balen sawe lye fowlest knyghte euer sawe fair lady thenne balyn wente thurgh alle chamber ageyne told knyghte fond slepte fast brought hym place lay fast slepynge pcapitulum xvij whan garnyssh beheld hir lyeng pure sorou mouth nose brast oute bledynge swerd smote bothe hedes thenne maade sorowe oute mesure sayd balyn moche sorow hast thow brought vnto haddest thow shewed yght shold haue passed sorow forsoth said balyn entent sholde better thy courage ye myght see knowe falshede cause yow leue loue suche lady god knoweth dyd none wold ye dyd allas said garnysshe sorou doubel may endure haue slayne moost loued al lyf therwith sodenly roofe hym self swerd vnto hyltys balen sawe dressid hym then ward lest folke wold say slayne rode forth within thre dayes cam crosse theron letter gold wryte said knyght alone ryde toward castel thene sawe old hore gentylman comyng toward hym sayd balyn le saueage thow passyst thy bandes come waye therfor torne ageyne auaille vanysshed awey anone soo herd horne blowe ben dethe best blast said balyn blowen pryse yet dede anone al sawe honderd ladyes many knyghtes welcommed hym fayr semblaunt made hym passyng good chere vnto syght ledde hym castel ther daunsynge mynstralsye alle maner ioye thenne chyef lady castel said knyghte two suerdys ye must haue adoo iuste knyght hereby kepeth iland ther may man passe way must iuste passe vnhappy customme said balyn knyght may passe wey yf iuste ye shalle haue adoo one knyghte sayd lady wel sayd balyn syn shalle therto redy traueillynge men ofte wery horse though hors wery hert wery wold fayne ther deth shold syr said knyght balyn thynketh sheld good wille leue yew yggar therof pray yow tooke sheld vnknowen lefte owne rode vnto iland put hym hors grete boote whan came syde met damoysel said knyght balyn haue ye lefte owne sheld allas ye haue put self grete daunger sheld ye shold haue ben knowen grete pyte yow euer knyght thy prowesse hardynes thou hast felawe lyuynge repenteth said balyn euer cam within countrey maye torne ageyne shame auenture shalle falle lyf dethe wille take aduenture shalle come thenne loked armour vnderstood wel armed therwith blessid hym mounted vpon hors pcapitulum xviij thenne afore hym sawe come rydynge oute castel knyght hors trapped reed hym self colour whan knyghte reed beheld balyn hym thought shold broder balen cause two swerdys cause knewe sheld demed auentryd theyr speres came merueillously fast gyders smote sheldes theire speres theire cours soo bygge bare doune hors man lay bothe swoun balyn brysed sore falle hors wery trauaille balan fyrst rose foote drewe swerd wente toward balyn aroos wente ageynst hym balan smote balyn fyrste put vp shelde smote hym thorow shelde tamyd helme thenne balyn smote hym ageyne vnhappy swerd wel nyghe fellyd broder balan fought ther gyders tyl theyr brethes faylled thenne balyn loked vp castel sawe towres stand ful ladyes soo went vnto bataille ageyne wounded eueryche dolefully thenne brethed oftymes wente vnto bataille alle place fought blood reed att tyme ther none bothe hadde eyther smyten seuen grete woundes best myyt haue ben dethe myghtyest gyaunt world thenne wente batail ageyn merueillously doubte bataille grete blood shedynge hawberkes vnnailled naked euery syde atte last balan yonger broder withdrewe hym lytel leid hym doune thenne said balyn le saueage knyghte arte thow found neuer knyyt matched name said balan broder vnto good knyght balyn allas sayd balyn euer shold see day therwith felle backward swoune thenne balan yede al four foot handes put helme broder myght knowe hym vysage ful hewen bledde whan awoke sayd balan broder thow hast slayne wherfore alle wyde world shalle speke v bothe pallas sayd balan euer sawe day thorow myshap myght knowe yow aspyed wel two swerdys cause ye another shild demed ye ben another knyyt allas saide balyn maade vnhappy knyght castel caused leue myn owne shelde bothes destruction yf myyt lyue wold destroye castel ylle customes wel done said balan neuer grace departe fro hem syn cam hyther happed slee knyght kepte iland syn myght neuer departe nomore shold ye broder ye myght haue slayne ye haue escaped self lyf ryght cam lady toure iiij knyghtes vj ladyes vj yomen vnto herd made mone eyther sayd came bothe oute one tombe say one moders bely shalle lye bothe one pytte balan prayd lady gentylnesse true seruyse wold burye bothe place bataille done graunted hem wepynge shold done rychely best maner wille ye sende preest may receyue sacrament receyue blessid body lord ihesu cryst ye said lady shalle done sente preest gaf hem ryghtes sayd balen whan buryed one tombe mensyon made ouer v ij bretheren slewe eche wille neuer good knyght good man see tombe wille pray soules alle ladyes gentylwymen wepte pyte thenne anone balan dyed balyn dyed tyl mydnyghte buryed bothe lady lete make mensyon balan ther slayne broders handes knewe balyns name pcapitulum xix morne cam merlyn lete w yte balyns name tombe letter gold lyeth balyn le saueage knyyt two swerdes smote dolorous stroke also merlyn lete make bedde ther shold neuer man lye therin wente oute wytte yet launcelot de lake fordyd bed thorow noblesse anone balyn dede merlyn toke swerd toke pomel set pomel merlyn bad knyght stode afore hym handeld swerd assayed myght handle hit thenne merlyn lough laugh ye said knyghte cause said merlyn ther shalle neuer man handle suerd best knyght world shalle syr launcelot el galahad sone launcelot suerd shalle slee man world loued best shalle syr gawayne alle lete wryte pomel swerd thenne merlyn lete make brydge yron stele iland half foote brode shalle neuer man passe brydge haue hardynes goo ouer yf passyng good man good knyght withoute trechery vylonye also scaubard balyns swerd merlyn lefte syde iland galahad shold fynde also merlyn lete make subtylyte balyns swerd put marbel stone standyng vp ryght grete mylle stone stone houed alweyes aboue water dyd many yeres adue ture swam doun streme cyte camelot englysshe wynchestre day galahad haute prynce came kyng arthur soo galahad broughte wyth hym scaubard encheued swerde marbel stone houynge vpon water whytsonday encheued swerd reherced book sacgrayll soone done merlyn came kyng arthur told hym dolorous stroke balyn gaf kyng pellam balyn balan foughte gyders merueillous batail euer herd buryed bothe one tombe allas said kyng arthur grettest pyte ouer herd telle two knyytes world knowe suche two knyghtes pthus endeth tale balyn balan two bretheren born northuberlad good kniytes psequitur iij liber pcapitulum primum begynnynge arthur chosen kyng adueture grace party baron knewe vther pendragon sone merlyn made openly knowen yet many kynges lordes helde grete werre ayenst hym cause wel arthur ouercame hem alle mooste party dayes lyf ruled moche counceil merlyn soo fell tyme kyng arthur sayd vnto merlyn baron wille lete haue rest nedes muste take wyf wylle none take thy counceill thyne aduys wel done said merlyn ye take wyf man bounte noblesse shold without wyf ther ony ye loue another ye said kyng arthur loue gweneuer kynges doughter lodegrean land camelerd whiche holdeth hows table round ye told fader vther damoysel moost alyaunt fayrest lady knowe lyuynge yet euer coude fynde syre sayd merlyn beaute fayrenes one fayrest lyue ye loued wel ye doo shold fynde yow damoysel beaute goodenesse shold lyke yow plese yow herte sette man herte set wylle lothe retorne trouth said kyng arthur merlyn warned kynge couertly gweneuer holsome hym take wyf warned hym launcelot shold loue hym ageyne torned tale auentures sancgreal thenne merlyn desyred kynge haue men hym shold enquere gweneuer kyng graunted hym merlyn wente forth vnto kyng lodegrean camyllerd told hym desyre kyng wold haue vnto wyf gweneuer doughter sayd kyng lodegreans best tydynges euer herd worthy kyng prowesse noblesse wille wedde doughter o landes wylle gyue hym wy myght please hym hath londes ynowe hym nedeth none shalle sende hym gyfte shalle please hym moche shalle gyue hym table round whiche vtherpendragon gaue whan ful complete ther c knyghtes fyfty c good knyghtes haue self fawte l many haue ben slayne dayes ladegreans delyuerd doughter gweneuer vnto merlyn table round c knyghtes rode fresshly grete royalte water land tyl came nyghe vnto london pcapitulum secundum whanne kyng arthur herd comyng gweneuer c knyghtes table round thenne kynge arthur maade grete ioye comyng ryche presente said openly fair lady passyng welcome vnto haue loued longe therfore ther nothyng lyef knyghtes round table pleasen ryght grete rychesse alle hast kynge lete ordeyne maryage coronacyon moost honorable wyse coude deuysed merlyn said kyng arthur goo thow aspye al land l knyghtes whiche ben prowesse worship within short tyme merlyn founde suche knyytes shold fulfylle xx viij knyghtes mo conde fynde thenne bisshop caunterbury fette blessid syeges grete royalte deuocyon sette viij xx knyghtes syeges whan done merlyn said fayr syrs ye must al aryse come kyng arthur doo hym homage haue better wil mayntene yow arose dyd homage gone merlyn fond euery syeges letter gold told knyghtes name sytten therin two syeges voyde anone cam yong gawayn asked kyng yefte aske said kyng shal graunte yow syr aske ye make knyyt day ye shall wedde faire gweneuer good wil said kyng arthur vnto yow worship may must reson ye ar myn neuew susters sone pca iij forth alle ther cam poure man courte broughte hym fayre yonge man xviij yere age rydynge vpon lene mare poure man asked men met shall fynde kyng arthur yonder sayd knyghtes wylt thow ony thynge hym ye sayd poure man therfor cam hyder anone came kyng salewed hym sayd kyng arthur floure knyghtes kynges byseche ihesu saue syr told tyme maryage ye wolde yeue man yefte wold aske oute excepte vnresonable trouth said kynge suche cryes lete make holde apayre realme myne estate ye say wel graciously said poure man syre aske thyng el ye wil make sone knyghte grete thynge thow askest said kyng thy name said kyng poure man syr name aryes cowherd whether cometh thy sone said kyng nay syre said aryes desyre cometh sone shal telle yow haue xiij sone alle falle laboure put wille ryght glad doo labour child wylle laboure ony thyng wyf may doo alweyes wille shetynge castynge dartes glad see batailles behold knyghtes alweyes day nyghte desyreth made knyyt thy name sayd kynge vnto yonge man syre name tor kyng beheld hym fast sawe passyngly wel vysaged passyngly wel made yeres wel said kyng arthur vnto aryes cowherd fetche al thy sone afore may see poure man al shapen moche lyke poure man tor lyke none hem al shap ne contenaunce moche ony hem said kyng arthur vnto cowherd swerd shalle maade knyght al sayd tor take oute shethe sayd kynge requyre make yow knyght thenne tor alyght mare pulled oute swerd knelynge requyrynge kynge wold maake hym knyght myghte knyght table round knyyt make yow therwith smote hym neck swerd sayeg ye good knyyt pray god ye may yf ye prowesse worthynesse ye shalle knyght table round merlyn sayd arthur say whether tor shall good knyghte ye syre ought good knyght comen good man ony lyue kynges blood syr sayd kynge shalle telle yow sayd merlyn poure man aryes cowhe fader nothyng syb hym kynge pellinore fader suppose nay said cowherd fetche thy wyf afore said merlyn shalle say nay anon wyf fet fair houswyf ansuerd merlyn ful womanly told kynge merlyn whan maide went mylke kyen ther met sterne knyght half force maidenhede tyme bigat sone tor toke awey greyhound tyme saide wold kepe greyhound loue said cowherd wende thys may bileue wel neuer tatches sir said tor vnto merlyn dishonoure moder syr said merlyn worship hurte fader good man kyng may ryght wel auaunce moder ye begoten euer wedded trouth said wyf hit lasse gryef vnto sayd cowherd pcapitulum quartum morne kyng pellinore cam court kynge arthur whiche grete ioye hym told hym tor sone hadde made hym knyght request cowherd whan pellinore beheld tor pleasyd hym moche kyng made gawayne knyght tor fyrst made feest cause said kyng arthur ben two place voyde syeges syre said merlyn ther shalle man syt tho place shall moost worship sege perillous shall man sytte therin one yf ther ony hardy doo shall destroyed shalle sytte shalle haue felawe therwith merlyn tooke kynge pellinore hand one hand next two seges sege peryllous said open audyence place best ye worthy sytte ony sat syr gauayne grete enuy told gaherys broder yonder knyghte put grete worship whiche greueth sore slewe fader kynge lot therfor wille slee hym said gauayne swerd sente passyng trenchaunt ye shall soo said gaherys tyme tyme squyer whan made knyght wol auengyd hym therfor broder best ye suffre tyl another tyme may haue hym oute courte dyd shold trouble hyhe feest wyl wel said gauayn ye wylle pcapitulum quintum thenne hyghe feeste made redy kynge wedded att camelott vnto dame gweneuer chirche saynt steuyns grete solempnyte euery man set degree merlyn wente alle knyghtes round table bad hem sytte styll none hem remeue ye shalle see straunge merueillous aduenture ryght sat ther came rennyng whyte hert halle whyte brachet next hym xxx couple black rennyng houndes cam greete crye hert went aboute table round went boordes whyte brachet boot hym buttok pulled oute pee thurgh herte lepte grete lepe ouerthrewe knyght sat boord syde therwith knyyt aroos toke vp brachet went forth oute halle toke hors rode wey brachet right anone cam lady whyte palfrey cryed aloude kyng arthur syre suffre haue despyte brachet myn knyght lad aweye maye doo therwith said kynge pwith came knyght rydynge al armed grete hors tooke lady awey hym force euer cryed made grete dole whanne gone kynge glad made suche noyse nay said merlyn ye may leue aduetures lyghtely aduentures must brought agayne el wold disworship yow feest wyll said kynge al done aduys thenne saide merlyn lete calle syr gauayne must brynge ageyne whyte herte also syr ye must lete calle syre tor must brynge ageyne brachet knyght el slee hym also lete calle kynge pellinore must brynge ageyne lady knyght el slee hym thre knyghtes shalle doo merueillous auetures come ageyn thenne called al thre reherceth afore eueryche hem toke charge armed surely sir gauayne fyrst request therfore wille begynne hym pcapitulum vj syre gauayne roode paas gaheryse broder roode hym stede squyer doo hym seruyse soo rode sawe two knyytes fyghte horsbak passyng sore syr gauayn broder rode betwixe asked cause foughte one knyght ansuerd sayd fyghte symple mater two two bretheren born hegoten one man one woman allas said sir gauayn ye syr said eldar ther cam whyte hert way day many hou de chaced hym whyte brachet alwey next hym vnderstood auenture made hyhe feest kynge arthur therfore wold haue gone haue wonne worship yonger broder said wolde go herte better knyght cause felle debate thouyt preue whiche v bothe better knyyt symple cause said sir gauayn vncouth ye shold debate al broder broder therfor yf ye wil couceil wil haue ado yow ye shal yelde vnto ye go vnto kyng arthur yelde yow vnto grace sir knyyt said ij bretheren forfoughten moche blood haue loste thorow wilfulnesse therfore wolde loth haue adoo yow thenne haue yow said sir gauayne wille agree fulfylle wylle shalle saye thyder sente ye maye say knyyt foloweth quest herte whyte name sayd gauayne sorlouse forest said eldar name sayde yonger bryan forest soo departed wente kynges court syr gauayne quest gauayne folowed herte crye houndes euen afore hym ther grete ryuer hert swamme ouer syr gauayne wold folowe ther stode knyght ouer syde sayd syre knyghte come ouer herte yf thou wilt iuste wille faille said sir gauayn folowe quest soo maade hors swymme ouer water anone gat theire speres ranne gyder ful hard syre gauayne smote hym hors thenne torned hors hym yelde hym nay sayd knyght though thow haue better horsbak pray valyaunt knyght alyghte foote matche gyders swerdes youre name said sir gauayne alardyn ilys said thenne eyther dressid sheldes smote gyders sir gauayne smote hym hard thorow helme went braynes knyght felle doune dede said gaheryse myghty stroke yonge knyght pcapitulum septimum thene gauayne gaheryse rode paas whyte herte lete slyppe herte thre couple greyhoundes chace herte castel chyef place castel slewe hert syr gauayne gaheryse folowed ryght soo came knyght oute chamber swerd drawe hand slewe two greyhoundes euen syghte syre gauayne remenaunte chaced hem swerd oute castel whan cam ageyne sayd whyte herte repenteth thow art dede souerayne lady gaf euyll haue kepte thy deth shalle dere bought lyue anone wente chamber armed hym came oute fyersly mette syr gauayne haue ye slayne houndes said syr gauayn dyd kynde leuer ye wroken angre vpon vpon dom best thow saist trouth said knyght haue auengyd thy houndes wille thow goo thenne syr gauayne alyght soote dressid shelde stroke gyders myghtely clafe sheldes stoned helmes brak hawberkes blood ranne doune foot atte last syr gauayne smote knyght hard felle erthe thenne cryed mercy yelded hym besought hym knyghte gentylman saue lyf thow shalt dye said sir gauayne sleyng houndes wille make amendys said knyght vnto power syr gauayne wold mercy haue vnlacyd helme haue stryken hede ryght soo came lady oute chamber felle ouer hym soo smote hede mysauenture allas saide gaheryse fowle shamefully done shame shal neuer yow also ye shold gyue mercy vnto aske mercy knyyt without mercy withoute worship syr gauayne stonyed deth fair lady wiste dyd said vnto knyght aryse wille gyue mercy nay nay said knyght take force mercy thou hast slayne loue lady loued best alle erthely thynge sore repenteth said syr gauayn thoughte stryke vnto thow shalt goo vnto kyng arthur telle hym thyne aduentures thow arte ouercome knyghte wente queste whyte herte take force said knyyt whether lyue dye drede deth swore goo vnto kynge arthur made hym bere one greyhound hym hors another behynde hym name said sir gauayn departe name said knyght ablamor marise soo departed toward camelot pcapitulum octauum syr gauayne went castel made hym redy lye al nyght wold haue vnarmed hym wylle ye doo sayd gaheryse wylle ye vnarme yow countrey ye may thynke ye haue many enemyes sooner sayd word ther ca four knyghtes wel armed assaylled syr gauayne hard said vnto hym thou newe made knyght thow hast shamed thy knyghthode knyght withoute mercy dishonoured also thow hast slayne fayr lady thy grete shame worldes ende doubte thow thow shalt haue grete nede mercy thow departe v therwith one hem smote syr gauayne grete stroke nygh felle erthe gaheryse smote hym ageyne sore soo one syde syr gauayne gaheryse ieopardy lyues one bowe archer smote syr gauayne thury arme greued hym wonderly sore shold haue ben slayne cam four fair ladyes besought knyghtes grace syre gauayne goodely atte request ladyes gaf syr gauayne gaheryse lyues made hem yelde prysoners thenne gauayne gaheryse made grete dole allas sayd syre gauayne myn arme greueth sore lyke maymed made complaynt pytously erly morow ther cam syr gauayne one four ladyes herd alle complaynte said syr knyyte chere good said owne defaulte sayd lady ye haue doone passynge fowle dede sleynge lady whiche grete vylany vnto yow ye kynge arthur kyn saide lady yes truly sayd syr gauayne name saide lady ye must telle ye passe name gauayne kyng lott orkeney sone moder kynge arthur syster thenne ye neuewe vnto kyng arthur sayd lady shalle speke yow ye shall haue conduyte go kynge arthur loue soo departed told foure knyghtes theire prysoner kynge arthur neuewe name syr gauayne kyng lot sone orkeney gaf hym hertes hede cause quest pthenne anone delyuerd syr gauayne vnder promyse shold bere dede lady hym maner hede hanged aboute neck hole body hyr lay hym hors mane ryght soo rode forth vnto camelot anone come merlyn desyred kyng arthur yt syre gauayne shold sworne telle alle auentures slewe lady wold gyue mercy vnto knyght thurgh lady slayne thenne kynge quene gretely displeasyd syr gauayn sleynge lady ther ordenaunce quene ther set quest ladyes syr gauayn iuged hym euer whyle lyued ladyes fyyte quarels euer shold curteys neuer refuse mercy hym asketh mercy thus gauayne sworne vpon four euuangelystes shold neuer ageynst lady ne gentil woman yf fought lady aduersary fouyt another thus endeth auenture syr gauayn dyd maryage kyng arthur amen pcapitulum ix syre tor redy mounted vpon horsbak rode knyght brachet rode mette dwarf sodenly smote hys hors hede staf wente backward spere lengthe dost thou said syre tor thou shalt passe way yf thow iuste yonder knyghtes pauelions thenne tor ware two pauelions grete sperys stood oute two sheldes henge tree pauelions may tary said syr tor quest must nedes folowe thou shalt passe said dwarf therwith alle blewe horne thenne ther cam one armed horsbak dressyd shelde cam fast toward tor dressid hym ageynst hym ranne gyders tor bare hym hors anone knyght yeld hym mercy syr haue felawe yonder pauelione wille haue adoo yow anone shall welcome said syr tor thenne ware another knyght comyng grete raundon eche dressid merueille see knyght smote syre tor grete stroke myddes shelde spere sheuered syr tor smote hym thurgh sheld lowe sheld wente thorow coost knyyt stroke slewe hym therwith syr tor alyght smote hym helme grete stroke therwith knyght yelded hym besought hym mercy wille wel said syr tor thou thy felawe must goo vnto kynge arthur yelde yow prysoners vn hym whome shall say thyder sente ye shall say knyght wente quest knyght wente brachet ij name said syr tor name sayd one sire felot langduk name said sir petypase wynchylse go ye forth saide syre tor god spede yow thenne cam dwarf saide vnto syr tor praye yow gyue yefte wylle wel said syr tor aske aske nomore saide dwarf ye wille suffre doo yow seruyse serue rec eaunt knyghtes take hors said syr tor ryde wote ye ryde knyght whyte braclet shalle brynge yow said dwerf soo rode thorow oute forest last ware two pauelions euen pryory two sheldes one shylde enewed whyte shelde reed pcapitulum x ther syr tor alyghte toke dwarf glayue soo cam whyte pauelione sawe thre damoysels lye one paylet slepyng wente pauelione found lady lyeng slepyng ther ther whyte brachet bayed fast therwith lady yede oute pauelione damoysels anone syr tor aspyed whyte brachet took force took dwerf wille ye sayd lady take brachet ye sayd syr tor brachet haue sought kynge arthur courte hyder well said lady knyght ye shalle go fer ye shalle mette greued shall abyde auenture cometh grace god mounted vpon hors passed way towarde camelot nere nyght myyt passe lytel ferther knowe ye ony lodgyng said tor knowe none said dwarf besydes hermytage ye muste take lodgynge ye fynde within whyle cam heremytage took lodgyng gras otys breed horse soone sped full hard souper rested hem al nyght tyl morne herd masse deuoutely tooke leue heremyte syre tor prayed heremyte pray hym sayd wold betooke hym god soo mounted vpon horsbak rode towardes camelot long whyle herd knyyte calle lowde came hem sayd knyghte abyde yelde brachet thow took lady syr tor retorned ageyne behelde hym semely knyghte wel horsed wel armed al poyntes thenne syre tor dressyd shelde took spere handes cam fyersly vpon hym smote bothe hors man erthe anone aroos lyghtely drewe swerdes egrely lyon put sheldes afore smote thorow sheldes cantels felle bothe partyes also tamyd helmes hote blood ranne oute thyck maylles hawberkes carfe rofe sonder hote blood ranne erthe many woundes passyng wery syr tor aspyed knyght faynted thenne sewed fast vpon hym doubled stroke garte hym go erthe one syde thenne syre tor bad hym yelde hym wille said abilleus whyle lyf lasteth soule within body onles thou wilt yeue brachet wylle doo sayd syre tor quest brynge ageyne thy brachet bothe pcapitulum xj wyth cam damoysel rydynge palfrey fast myyt dryue cryed lowde voys vnto syre tor wille ye sayd syr tor byseche said damoysel kynge arthur loue gyue yefte requyre gentyl knyght thow arte gentilman said tor aske yefte wille gyue yow gramercy said damoy el aske hede fals knyght abelleus mooste outragyous knyght lyueth grettest murtherer seid syr tor gyfte haue gyuen yow lete hym make amendys hath trespaced vnto yow said damoysel may slewe myn owne broder afore myn owne eyen better knyght hadde grace kneled half houre afore hym myre saue broders lyf done hym dammage fought hym auenture armes al coude stroke hede wherfore requyre thow arte true knyght gyue yefte el shal shame al court kyng arthur falsest knyght lyuynge grete destroyer good knyghtes thenne whan abelleus herd aferd yelded hym asked mercy maye saide syr tor yf shold founde fals promesse whyle wold haue taken mercy ye wold none aske yf ye brachet ageyn quest therwith tooke helme aroos fled syr tor hym smote hede quyte pnow syr said damoysel nere nyght pray yow come lodge place fast wel said syr tor hors ferd euyll syn departed camelot soo rode passyng good hadde passyng fair old knyght husband made hym passynge good chere wel easyd bothe hors morne herd masse brake fast tooke leue knyghte lady besought hym telle hym name truly said name syr tor late made knyght fyrst queste armes euer dyd brynge ageyn knyght abelleus toke awey fro kyng arthur courte fayr knyght said lady husband ye come oure march come see oure poure lodgynge shalle alweyes commaundement soo syre tor departed came camelot thyrdde day noone kyng quene alle courte passyng fayne comyng made grete ioye come ageyne wente court lytel socour kyng pellinore fader gaf hym old courser kyng arthur gaf hym armour swerd el none socour rode forthe hym self alone thenne kyng quene merlyns aduys made hym swere telle auentures soo told made pryeues dedes afore reher ed wherfor kyng quene made grete ioye nay nay saide merlyn ben iapes shalle doo shalle preue noble knyght prowesse good ony lyuyng gentyl curteis good tatches passyng true promesse neuer shalle outrage thorow merlyns wordes kynge arthur gaf hym erldome bondes felle vnto hym endeth quest syr tor kynge pellenors sone pcapitulum xij thenne kynge pellinore armed hym mounted vpon hors rode paas lady knyyt ladde awey rode forest sawe valey damoysel sitte welle wounded knyght armes pellenore salewed whan ware hym cryed ouer lowde helpe knyghte crystes sake kynge pellinore wold tarye eger quest euer cryed c tymes help whanne sawe wold abyde prayd vnto god sende hym moche nede help myyt fele dyed soo book telleth knyght dyed wounded wherfor lady pure sorowe slewe self swerd kynge pellinore rode valey met poure man labourer sawest thow saide pellinore knyghte rydynge ledynge aweye lady ye said man sawe knyght lady made grete dole yonder bynethe valey ther shal ye see two pauelions one knyytes pauelions chalengyd lady knyght sayd cosyn nere wherfor shold lede ferther soo waged bataill quarel one saide wold haue force said wold haue rule cause kynnesman wold lede kyn quarel lefte fyghtynge yf ye wille ryde paas ye shalle fynde fyghtyng lady beleft two squyers pauelions god thanke sayd kynge pellenore thenne rode wallop tyll syght two pauelions two knyghtes fyghtyng anon rode vnto pauelions sawe lady quest sayd fayre lady ye must goo vnto court kynge arthur syr knyght
