said two squyers yonder two knyghtes fyghte thys lady goo thyder departe agreed hem thenne may ye haue pleasyr ye say wel sayd kyng pellenore anone rode betwixt departed hem asked hem cause fought sir knyght said one shalle telle yow lady kynneswoman nygh myn auntes doughter whan herd complayne hym maulgre hede waged bataille fyghte hym syre knyght sayd whoos name hontzlake wentland lady gat prowesse armes day arthur courte vntruly said said kynge pellenore ye cam sodenly ther hyghe feest tooke awey lady ony man myght make hym redy therfore hit quest brynge ageyne yow bothe el one v abyde felde therfor lady shalle goo wille dye haue promysed hit kynge arthur ther fyghte ye none yow shalle haue parte tyme yf ye lyst fyyte fyyte wille defende wel said knyghtes make redy shalle assaille yow al power kynge pellenore wold haue put hors fro fyr hontzlake roofe hors thorow swerd said art thow foote wel whan kynge pellinore aspyed hors slayne lyytely lepte hors pulled oute swerd put sheld afore hym sayde knyghte kepe wel thy heede thow shalt haue buffet sleyng hors kyng pellenore gaf hym suche stroke vpon helme clafe hede doune chynne fylle erthe dede pcapitulum xiij thenne torned hym knyyte sore wounded whan sawe others buffet wold fyghte kneled doune sayd take cosyn lady yow youre request requyre yow ye true knyghte put shame vylony sayd kynge pellenore wylle ye fyghte syr sayd knyghte wylle fyghte suche knyyte prowesse ye wel said pellenore ye say wel promyse yow shall haue vylony true knyght lacketh hors said mellinore wylle haue hontzlakes hors ye shalle nede sayd knyght shalle gyue yow suche hors shalle please yow ye wille lodge nere nyghte wille wel sayd kynge pellenore abyde yow al nyghte hadde hym ryght good chere faryd best passynge good wyne mery rest nyghte morne herd masse dyned thenne broughte hym fayre bay courser kynge pellenors sadel sette vpon hym shalle calle yow said knyyt moche ye haue cosyn desyre quest syr shalle telle yow name kyng pellenore ilys knyghte table round glad said knyght suche noble man shalle haue rule cosyn name said pellenore pray yow telle syr name syr meliot logurs lady cosyn hyght nymue knyghte pauelione sworne broder passynge good knyyte name bryan ilys ful loth wronge ful lothe fyghte ony man yf sore souyt shame may leue merueil said pellinore wille haue adoo syr wil haue adoo man yf request brynge hym courte said pellenore one dayes syr wylle come gyders ye shalle welcome said pellinore courte kynge arthur gretely allowed comynge departed lady brouyt camelot soo rode valey ful stone ladyes hors stumbled threwe doun arme sore brysed nere swouned payne allas syr sayd lady myn arme oute lythe wher thorow must nedes reste ye shall wel said kyng pellinore alyyt vnder fayr tree fayr grasse put hors therto leyd hym vnder tree slepte tyl nyghe nyght whan awoke wold haue ryden sir said lady derke ye may wel ryde backward forward soo abode styll made lodgyng thenne syr pellenore put armour thene lytel afore mydnyyt herd trottynge hors ye styll said kyng pellenore shalle somme auenture pcapitulum xiiij ther armed hym ryght euen afore hym ther met two knyghtes one cam froward camelot northe eyther salewed tydynges camelot sayd one hede saide ther haue ben aspyed courte kynge arthur ther suche felauship may neuer broken wel nyghe al world holdeth arthur flour chyualrye cause rydyng north telle chyuetayns felauship withholden kyng arthur said knyght haue brought remedy grettest poyson euer ye herd speke camelot wyll haue frend ryght nyghe kyng arthur wel cherysshed shal poysone kynge arthur hath promysed oure chyuetayns receyued grete yeftes beware said knyght merlyn knoweth alle thynges deuyls crafte therfore wille lete said knyghte departed sonder anone pellenore maade hym redy lady rode toward camelot cam wel wounded knyght lady fond knyghte lady eten lyon wylde beestes al sauf hede wherfor made grete sorowe wepte passynge sore said allas lyf myghte haue saued fyers quest therfore wold abyde wherfore make ye suche doole said lady wote said pellinore herte morneth sore deth passyng fayr lady yonge wylle ye doo myne aduys said lady take knyghte lete hym buryed heremytage thenne take ladyes hede bere yow vnto arthur soo kyng pellinore took dede knyght sholders broughte hym heremytage charged heremyte corp seruyse shold done soule take harneys payne shalle done said heremyte wille ansuer vnto god pcapitulum xv ther departed cam hede lady lay fair yelow greued kyng pellinore passyngly sore whan loked hit moche cast herte vysage soo none came camelot kynge quene passyng fayn comynge courte made swere vpon four euuangelystes telle trouth quest one syr pellinore sayd quene gweneuer ye gretely blame ye saued ladyes lyf madame said pellinore ye gretely blame ye wold saue owne lyf ye myyt sauf pleasir furyous quest wold abyde repenteth shal dayes lyf truly saide merlyn ye ouyt sore repente lady douyter begoten lady rule knyght dede loue shold haue wedded ryght good knyght yonge man wold haue preued good man court comyng name sir myles laudys knyyt cam behynde hym slewe spere name lorayne le saueage fals knyyt coward grete sorow dole slewe self swerd name eleyne cause ye wold abyde helpe ye shalle see youre best frende faylle yow whan ye grettest distresse euer ye shalle penauce god hath ordeyned yow dede ye shalle truste ony man alyue shalle leue yow ther ye shalle slayne forthynketh said kynge pellinore shalle betyde god may fordoo wel desteny thus whan quest done whyte herte whiche folowed syr gawayne quest brachet folowed syr tor pellenors sone quest lady knyghte tooke aweye whiche kyng pellinre tyme folowed thenne kyng stablysshed knyghtes gaf londes ryche gaf londes charged hem neuer doo outragyousyte mordre alweyes flee treason also meane cruel gyue mercy vnto hym asketh mercy vpon payn forfeture worship lordship kyng arthur euermore alweyes doo ladyes damoysels gentylwymmen socour vpon payne dethe also man take noo batails wrongful quarel noo lawe ne noo worldes goodes vnto knyghtes sworne table round old yong euery yere sworne hyghe feest pentecost pexplicit weddynge kynge arthur psequitur quartus liber pcapitulu primu soo questys syr gawyne syre tor kynge pellinore felle merlyn felle dottage damoisel kyng pellinore broughte courte one damoysels lake hyyte nyneue merlyn wold lete haue rest alweyes wold euer maade merlyn good chere tyl lerned hym al maner thynge desyred assoted vpon myghte soo tyme told kynge arthur sholde dure longe al craftes shold put erthe quyck told kynge many thynges shold befalle allewayes warned kynge kepe wel swerd scaubard told hym swerd scaubard shold stolen woman hym trusted also told kynge arthur shold mysse hym yet ye leuer al landes haue ageyne sayd kynge syn ye knowe aduenture puruey hit put awey craftes mysauenture nay said merlyn wylle soo departed kynge within whyle damoysel lake departed merlyn wente euermore euer wente oftymes merlyn wold haue pryuely awey subtyle craftes thenne made hym swere shold neuer none enchauntement vpon yf wold haue wylle sware merlyn wente ouer e vnto land benwyck kynge ban kynge grete warre ageynst kynge claudas merlyn spake kynge ban wyf fair lady good name elayne sawe yonge launcelot quene made grete sorowe mortal werre yt kyng claudas made lord landes take none heuynesse said merlyn child within xx yere shall reuenge yow kynge claudas crystendom shalle speke child shalle moost man worship world fyrst name galahad knowe wel said merlyn syn ye haue confermed hym launcelot trouthe said quene fyrst name galahad merlyn said quene shalle lyue see sone suche man prowesse ye lady parel ye shal see hit lyue many wynters soo soone lady merlyn departed waye merlyn shewed many wondres cam cornewaille alweyes merlyn lay aboute lady haue maydenhode euer passynge wery hym fayne wold haue ben delyuerd hym aferd hym cause deuyls sone coude beskyfte hym meane pand soo tyme happed merlyn shewed roche greete wonder wroughte enchauntement wente vnder grete stone subtyle wyrchynge maade merlyn goo vnder stone ete wete merueilles wroughte ther hym cam neuer oute alle crafte coude doo departed lefte merlyn pcapitulum secundum kynge arthur rode camelot helde ther grete feest myrthe ioye soone retorned vnto cardoylle cam vnto arthur newe tydynges kynge denmarke kynge ireland broder kynge vale kynge soleyse kynge yle longtaynse al fyue kynges grete hoost entrid lad kynge arthur brente slewe clene afore hem cytees castels pyte pallas sayd arthur yet neuer reste one monethe syn crowned kyng land shalle neuer reste tyl mete tho kynges fayre feld make myn auowe true lyege peple shalle destroyed defaulte goo wille abyde wylle thenne kynge lete wryte vnto kynge pellenore prayd hym alle haste make hym redy suche peple myght lyytlyest rere hye hym al hast baron pryuely wrothe kynge wold departe sodenly kynge meane wold abyde made wrytynge vnto bad hye hym suche tyme courte thenne kynge came quene gweneuer sayd lady make yow redy ye shall goo may longe mysse yow ye shal cause hardy auenture befalle wille wete lady ieopardy sire said commaundement shalle redy tyme ye redy morne kynge quene departed suche felauship hadde came northe forest besyde humber lodged hem pwhanne word tydynge came vnto fyue kynges aboue sayd arthur besyde humber foreste knyght broder vnto one fyue kynges gafe hem counceille ye knowe wel syre arthur hath floure chyualrye world hym preued grete bataille dyd xj kynges therfor hye vnto hym nyghte daye tyl nyghe hym lenger taryeth bygger euer waiker couragyous hym self come felde lytel peple therfore lete v set vpon hym day shalle slee doune knyghtes ther shal none escape pcapitulum tercium unto counceille fyue kynges assented passed forth hoost thorow northwalis came vpon arthur nyghte sett vpon hoost kynge knyghtes pauelions kynge arthur vnarmed leid hym rest hys quene gweneuer sir said syr kaynus good vnarmed shalle haue nede said syre gawayne syr gryflet laye lytel pauelione kynge herd grete noyse many cryed treson treson allas said kynge arthur ben bitrayed vnto armes felawes thenne cryed armed anone al poyntes thenne cam ther wounded knyghte vnto kynge saide syr saue self lady quene hooste destroyed moche peple slayne soo anone kynge quene thre knyghtes took horse rode toward humber passe ouer water rough aferd passe ouer may ye chese ayd kynge arthur whether ye wille abyde take aduentur syde ye taken wille slee yow leuer sayd quene dye water falle enemyes handes slayne stode soo talkyng syr kaynus sawe fyue kynges comynge horsbak hem self alone speres handes euen toward hem loo said syr kaynus yonder fyue kynges lete v go matche hem foly sayd sire gawayne thre ben fyue trouthe said syre gryflet force said syr kay wille vndertake two thenne may ye thre vndertake thre ther al syr kay lete hors renne fast myghte strake one thorow shelde body fadom kynge felle erthe stark dede sawe syr gawayne ranne vnto another kyng hard smote hym thurgh body ther kyng arthur ran another smote hym thurgh body spere fylle erthe dede thenne syr gryflet ranne vnto iiij kyng gaf hym suche falle neck brake anone syr kay ranne vnto fyfthe kynge smote hym hard helme stroke clafe helme hede erthe wel stryken sayd kynge arthur worshipfully hast thow hold thy promesse therfor shal honoure whyle lyue ther set quene barge humber alweyes quene gweneuer praysed syr kay dedes sayd lady ye loue loue yow ageyne gretely blame amonge ladyes said quene shalle bere youre noble fame ye spak grete word fulfylled worshipfully therwith quene departed thenne kyng thre knyghtes rode forest supposed escaped fond party peple told hem fyue kynges dede therfor lete v hold v gyders tyll day whan hoost haue spyed chyuetayns slayn wille make suche dole shalle mowe helpe hem self ryght kynge said whan fonde fyue kynges dede made suche dole fell fro horse ther cam kyng arthur fewe peple slewe lyfte hand ryght hand wel nyhe ther escaped man alle slayne nombre xxx whan bataille ended kynge kneled doune thanked god mekely thenne sente quene soone come maade grete ioye ouercomynge bataille pcapitulum iiij alle came one kynge arthur told hym kyng pellinore within thre myle grete hoost said go vnto hym lete hym vnderstande haue spedde soo within whyle kynge pellinore cam grete hoost salewed peple kyng ther grete ioye made euery syde thenne kyng lete serche moche people party ther slayne ther founde lytel past two honderd men slayne viij knyytes table round pauelions thenne kynge lete rere deuyse place batail done faire abbeye endowed wyth grete lyue ode lete calle abbey la beale aduenture whanne somme cam countreyes ther fyue kynges kynges told hem slayne ther made grete dole alle kynge arthur enemyes kynge northwales kynges north wyste bataille passynge heuy soo kynge retorned vnto camelot hast whan come camelot called kynge pellinore vnto hym sayd ye vnderstand wel haue loste viij knyghtes best table round aduys wille chese viij ageyne best may fynde courte syr said pellinore shal counceille yow conceyte best courte ful noble knyghtes bothe old yonge therfor myn aduys ye shal chese half old half yonge whiche old said kyng arthur syre said kynge pellinore semeth kynge vryence hath wedded syster morgan le fay kynge lake syr heruyse reuel noble knyght syr galagars iiij wel deuysed said kyng arthur right soo shal whiche four yong knyytes said arthur syre saide pellinore fyrst syr gawayne neuewe good knyght tyme ony lad second semeth best syre gryflet le fyse ne good knyght ful desyrous armes may see hym lyue shal preue good knyghte thyrd semeth wel one knyghtes round table syr kay senescha many tymes hath done ful worshipfully last bataille dyd full honourably vndertake slee two kynges hede said arthur best worthy knyght round table ony ye haue reherced done prowesse lyf dayes pcapitulum quintum said kynge pellenore shalle putte yow two knyghtes ye shalle chese whiche moost worthy syr bagdemagus syr tor sone cause syre tor sone may prayse hym el sone durst saye age ther land better knyghte better condycions lothe doo ony wronge loth take ony wronge hede said arthur passyng good knyght ony ye spak day wote wel said kyng haue sene hym preued seyth lytyll doth moche knowe none al courte wel borne moder syde syde lyke hym prowesse myghte therfor wille haue hym tyme leue syr bagdemagus tyll another tyme soo whan chosen assente alle baron soo founden syeges euery knyghtes name reherced set syeges wherof syr bagdemagus wonderly wrothe syr tor auaunced afore hym therfore sodenly departed courte toke squyer hym rode longe forest tyll came crosse alyyt sayd prayer deuoutely meane whyle squyer founde wryten vpon crosse bagdemagus shold neuer retorne vnto courte ageyne tyll wonne knyytes body round table body body lo syr said squyer fynde wrytyng yow therfor rede yow retorne ageyne courte shalle neuer said bagdemagus tyl men speke grete worship worthy knyghte round table soo rode forthe ther way founde brauche holy herbe sygne sancgraill knyght founde suche token good lyuer sir bagdemagus rode see many aduentures happed hym come roche ther lady lake put merlyn vnder stone herde hym make grete dole wherof fyre bagdemagus wold haue holpen hym wente vnto grete stone heuy c men myght lyfte hyt vp whan merlyn wyste leue labour al vayne myght neuer holpen put hym ther bagdemagus departed dyd many auentures preued full good knyght came ageyne courte made knyght round table morne ther felle newe tydynges auentures pcapitulum sextum thenne befelle arthur many knyghtes rode huntynge grete forest happed kyng arthur kynge vryens syr accolon gaulle folowed grete herte thre wel horsed soo chaced fast within whyle thre thenne x myle felauship last chaced sore slewe theyr horse vndernethe thenne al thre foote euer sawe herte afore passynge wery enbusshed wille doo said kyng arthur hard bestad lete v goo foote said kyng vryens tyl may mete lodgynge thenne ware herte lay grete water banke brachet bytynge throte mo houndes cam thenne kynge arthur blewe pryse dyghte herte thenne kynge loked aboute world sawe afore hym grete water lytel ship al apparailled sylke doune water shyp cam ryghte vnto hem la ded sandes thenne arthur wente banke loked sawe none erthely creature therin sir said kyng come then lete v see ship soo wente al thre founde hit rychely behanged clothe sylke thenne derke nyghte sodenly aboute c torch sette vpon alle sydes shyp bordes gaf grete lyghte ther cam twelue fayr damoysels salewed kynge arthur knee called hym name sayd ryght welcome suche chere shold haue best kynge thanked hem fayre lad kyng two felawes fair chambre ther clothe leyd rychely bysene al longed vnto tabel serued al wynes mete coude thynke kynge grete merueille ferd neuer better lyf one souper souped leyser kyng arthur ledde vnto chamber rycher besene chamber sawe neuer none soo kynge vryens serued ledde suche another cha byr syr accolon ledde thyrd chamber passynge rychely wel bysene layde theire beddes easyly anone felle slepe slepte merueillously sore nyght morowe kynge vryens camelott abed wyues armes morgan le fay whan awoke grete merueylle cam euen afore two dayes iourney fro camelot whan kyng arthur awoke found hym self derke pryson herynge aboute hym many complayntes woful knyghtes pcapitulum septimum ye soo complayne said kynge arthur ben xx knyghtes prysoners sayd v haue layne seuen yere somme somme lasse cause sayd arthur shalle telle yow said knyghtes lord castel name syr dama falsest knyght lyueth ful treason coward ony lyueth hath yonger broder good knyghte prowesse name syr ontzlake traytour dama elder broder wylle gyue hym noo parte lyuelode syre ontzlake kepeth thorow prowesse handes kepeth hym ful fair maner ryche therin syre ontzlake dwelleth worshipfully wel biloued al peple syre dama maister euyll beloued without mercy acoward grete werre hath ben betwyxe bothe ontzlake hath euer better euer profereth syre dama fyghte lyuelode body body wylle el fynde knyghte fyghte hym vnto syr dama hath graunted fynde knyghte euyll byloued hated ny neuer knyghte wylle fyghte hym whan dama sawe ther neuer knyght wold fyghte hym hath daily layn wayte many knyghtes hym taken alle knyghtes countrey see aspye auentures hath taken hem force broughte hem pryson tooke v seueratly rode oure auentures many good knyytes haue dyed pryson hongre nombre xviij knyghtes yf ony v alle hath ben wold haue foughten broder ontzlake wold haue delyuerd v cause dama fals ful treason wold neuer fyghte hym dye soo lene hongre vnnethe may stande oure feete god delyuer yow mercy sayd arthur anone alle ther cam damoysel vnto arthur asked hym chere say sayd sir sayd ye wylle fyghte lord ye shall delyuerd oute pryson el ye escape neuer lyf sayd arthur hard yet leuer fyghte knyght dye pryson said arthur may delyuerd alle prysoners wylle doo batail yes said damoysel redy sayd arthur hors armour ye shall lacke none said damoysel semeth damoysel shold haue sene yow courte arthur nay said damoysel cam neuer lordes doughter castel yet fals one damoysels morgan le fay anone wente vnto syr dama told hym wold doo bataille hym sente arthur whan cam wel coloured wel made lymmes al knyytes sawe hym said pyte suche knyghte shold dye pryson soo syr dama agreed shold fyghte hym vpon couenaut knyghtes shold delyuerd vnto syr dama sworne vnto arthur also doo bataille vttermost xx knyghtes brought oute derke pryson halle delyuerd abode see bataille pcapitulum octauum torne vnto accolon gaulle whanne awoke found hym self depe welle syde within half foote grete perylle dethe cam oute fontayne pype syluer oute pype ranne water hyhe stone marbel whan syre accolon sawe blessyd hym sayd ihesu saue lorde kyng arthur kynge vryens damoysels ship haue bitrayed v deuyls noo wymmen yf may escape misauenture shalle destroye may fynde fals damoysels vsen enchautementys pryght ther cam dwarf grete mouthe flat nose salewed syre accolon said came quene morgan le fay greteth yow wel byddeth yow strong herte ye shal fyyte morne knyghte houre pryme therfore hath sente yow excalibur arthur swerd scaubard byddeth yow ye loue ye doo batail vttermest without ony mercy lyke ye promysed wha ye spake gyder pryuete damoysel bryngeth knyghtes hede whiche ye shal fyghte al wille make quene vnderstand yow wel sayd accolon shalle holde haue promysed haue swerd whan sawe ye lady quene morgan le fay ryghte late sayd dwarf thenne accolon tooke hym armes said recommaunde vnto lady quene telle shal done haue promysed el wille dye hit suppose said accolon hath made alle craftes enchauntement bataille ye may wel bileue said dwarf ryyt cam knyghte lady syxe squyers salewed accolon prayd hym aryse come reste hym maner accolon mounted vpon voyde hors wente knyghte vnto fayre maner pryory passynge good chere thenne sir dama sente vnto broder syr ontzelake badde make hym redy morne houre pryme felde fyghte wyth good knyght founden good knyght redy doo bataill poyntes whan word cam vnto sir ontzelake passyng heuy wounded lytel fore thorow bothe thyes spere made grete dole wounded wold haue taken bataille hand soo happed tyme meanes morg n le fay accolon syr ontzelake lodged whan herd bataille ontzelake wou ded sayd wold fyghte hym cause morgan le fey sente hym excalibur shethe fyyte knyght morne cause syr accolon toke bataille hand thenne syre ontzelake passynge glad thaked syr accolon alle herte wold moche hym ther al syr ontzelake sente word vnto broder syre dama knyyte yt hym shold redy felde houre pryme soo morne syr arthur armed wel horsed asked syr dama whan shalle felde syr said syr dama ye shalle masse arthur herd masse whan masse done cam squyer grete hors asked syr dama yf knyght redy oure knyght redy felde thenne syre arthur mounted vpon horsbak alle knyghtes comyns countrey alle aduyses ther chosen xij good men countrey wayte vpon two knyghtes ryght arthur horsbak ther cam damoisel morgan le fey broughte vnto syr arthur swerd lyke vnto excalibur scaubard sayd vnto arthur morgan le fey sendeth swerd grete loue thanked wende ben fals swerd scaubard counterfeet brutyll fals pcapitulum ix thenne dressyd hem bothe partyes felde lete horse renne fast eyther smote myddes shelde speres hede bothe hors man wente erthe thenne sterte vp bothe pulled oute swerdys meane whyle thus bataille cam damoysel lake felde put merlyn vnder stone cam thydder loue kynge arthur knewe morgan le fay soo ordeyned kynge arthur shold haue ben slayne daye therfor cam saue lyf went egrely bataille gaf many grete stroke alweyes arthur swerd bote lyke accolon swerd party euery stroke accolon gaf wounded sore arthur merueylle stode alweyes blood fylle hym fast whan arthur beheld ground sore bebledde desmayed thenne demed treason swerd chaunged swerd boote styl wonte therfor dredde hym sore dede euer hym semed swerd accolons hand excalibur euery stroke accolon stroke drewe blood arthur knyghte said accolon vnto arthur kepe wel arthur ansuerd ageyne gaf hym suche buffet helme made hym stoupe nygh fallynge doune erthe thenne syr acoolon withdrewe hym lytel cam excalibur hyghe smote syr arthur suche buffet felle nyhe erthe thenne wroth bothe gaf eche many sore stroke alweyes syr arthur lost moche blood merueille stode foot soo ful knyghthode knyghtly endured payne syr accolon lost dele blood therfor waxt passynge lyghte syr arthur passynge feble wende veryly haue dyed al made countenaunce though myghte endure helde accolon shorte myght accolon bolde cause excalibur waxed passynge hardy alle men beheld hym sayd sawe neuer knyghte fyghte wel arthur dyd consyderyng blood bled soo peple sory hym two bretheren wold accorde thenne alweyes fought gyders fyers knyghtes syre arthur withdrewe hym lytel reste hym syre accolon called hym bataille said tyme suffre reste therwith cam fyersly vpon arthur syre arthur wrothe blood lost smote accolon hyhe vpon helme soo myytely made hym nyhe falle erthe therwith arthur swerd brast crosse felle grasse amonge blood pomel sure handel helde handes syr arthur sawe grete fere dye alweyes helde vp shelde lost ground bated chere pcapitulum x thenne syre accolon beganne wordes treason sayd knyghte thow arte ouercome mayste endure also thow arte wepenles thow hast loste moche thy blood ful bothe slee therfor yelde recreaunt nay saide syre arthur maye haue promysed doo bataille vttermest feythe body whyle lasteth lyf therfor leuer dye honour lyue shame yf possyble dye c tymes leuer dye ofte yelde though lacke wepen shalle lacke worship yf thow slee wepenles shalle thy shame wel sayd accolon shame wyl spare kepe thow arte dede therwith accolon gaf hym suche stroke felle n ghe erthe wolde haue arthur haue cryed hym mercy syre arthur pressed vnto accolon sheld gaf hym pomel hand suche buffet went thre strydes abak whan damoisel lake beheld arthur ful prowesse body fals treson wrouyt hym haue hym slayn grete pyte good knyyt suche worship shold destroyed next stroke syr accolon stroke hym suche stroke damoysels enchauntement swerd excalibur felle oute accolons hande erthe therwith alle syre arthur lyghtely lepte hit gate hit hand forthwith al knewe suerd excalibur sayd thow hast ben al long moche dommage hast thow done ther aspyed scaubard hangynge syde sodenly sterte hym pulled scaubard hym threwe hit fro hym fer myghte throwe hit knyghte saide arthur daye hast thow done grete dommage swerd ye come vnto dethe shalle waraunt yow ye shalle wel rewarded swerde euer departe thow hast rewarded moche payne haue ye made endure moche blood haue lost therwith syr arthur russhed hym alle myghte pulled hym erthe thene russhed helme gaf hym suche buffet hede blood cam oute eres nose mouthe wylle slee said arthur slee ye may wel said accolon please yow ye ar best knyghte euer fonde see wel god yow promysed doo batail said acoolon vttermest neuer recreaunt whyle lyued therfore shal neuer yelde mouthe god doo body wyll pthenne syr arthur remembrid hym thoughte shold haue sene knyghte telle said arthur wylle slee coutrey art thou courte syre knyghte sayd syr accolon courte kynge arthur name accolon gaulle thenne arthur desmayed hand thenne remembryd hym syster morgan le fay enchauntement ship syre knyght sayd pray yow telle gaf yow swerd ye pcapitulum xj thenne syre accolon bethouyte hym said wo worth swerd hit haue geten dethe may wel said kynge syre said accolon wil telle yow swerd hath ben kepynge moost party twelue moneth morgan le fay kynge vryens wyf sente yester daye dwerf entente shold slee kynge arthur broder ye shall vnderstand entente slee kyng arthur broder ye shal vnderstand kynge arthur man world moost hateth cause moost worship prowesse ony blood also loueth oute mesure paramour ageyne yf myghte brynge aboute slee arthur craftes wold slee husband kynge vryens lyghtely thenne hadde deuysed kyng land soo regne quene done saide accolon sure dethe wel sayd syre arthur fele yow ye wold haue ben kynge land ben grete dommage haue destroyed lord sayd arthur trouth said accolon haue told yow trouthe wherfore praye yow telle whens ye courte accolon sayd kynge arthur lete wete kynge arthur whome thow haste done grete dommage whanne accolon herd cryed lowde fayre swete lord haue mercy knewe yow syr accolon sayd kynge arthur mercy shalt thow haue cause fele thy wordes tyme thow knowest persone vnderstand wel thy wordes thow hast agreed dethe persone therfore thow arte traytour wyte lasse syster morgan le fay fals craftes made agree consente fals lustes shalle sore auengyd vpon lyue alle crystendome shalle speke god knoweth haue honoured worshipped alle kynne haue trusted myn owne wyf alle kynne pthenne syr arthur called kepars felde said syrs cometh hyder two knyghtes haue foughten vnto grete dommage vnto v lyke echone v haue slayne yf happed soo hadde ony v knowen ben bataille stroke stryken p thenne al lowde cryed accolon vnto alle knyghtes men thene gadred gyder sayd manere lordes noble knyghte haue foughten whiche sore repenteth mooste man prowesse manhode worship world hym self kynge arthur al ther liege lord myshap mysaueture haue done bataill kyng lord holden pcapitulum xij thenne alle peple felle doune knee cryed kynge arthur mercy mercy shalle ye haue sayd arthur maye ye see auentures befallen oftyme erraunte knyghtes haue foughten knyght myn owne vnto grete dommage bothe syrs cause sore hurte bothe grete nede lytel rest ye shalle vnderstande oppynyon betwixe yow two bretheren syre dama haue ben champyon wonne feld knyghte yet wylle iuge cause ye syre dama called org lous knyghte full vylony worthe prowesse youre dedes therfor wylle ye gyue vnto broder alle hole manoir appertenauce vnder thys forme sir ontzelake hold manoir yow yerely gyue yow palfrey ryde vpon wylle become yow better ryde vpon courser also charge syre dama vpon payne deth thow neuer destresse knyytes erraunte ryde aduenture also thow restore xx knyghtes thow hast longe kepte prysoners harneis content yf ony hem come court complayne hede thou shalt dye therfore also syre ontzelake yow cause ye named good knyghte ful prowesse true gentyl youre dedes shalle youre charge wylle gyue yow al goodely haste ye come vnto courte ye shalle knyghte myne yf dedes shall proferre yow grace god ye shalle shorte tyme ease lyue worshipfully broder syre dama god thanke largenesse goodenes bounte shall hen forward tymes commaundement syr said syr ontzelake god wold hurte late aduentures knyght thurgh thyes greued sore el done bataille yow god wold sayd arthur ben thenne ben hurte shalle telle yow cause ben hurte hadde ben myne owne swerd stolen treason bataille ordeyned afore hand haue slayne brouyte purpos fals treason fals enchauntement allas said syr ontzelake greete pyte euer soo noble man ye dedes prowesse ony man woman myyt fynde hertes worche ony treason ageynst yow shalle reward said arthur short tyme grace god telle said arthur f r camelot syr ye two dayes iourney ther fro wold fayn place worship said syr arthur myghte reste syre said syr ontzelake ryche abbey elder fou dacyon nonnes thre myle hen kynge took leue alle peple mounted vpon horsbak sir accolon hym whan come abbaye lete fetche leche serche woundes accolons bothe syr accolon dyed within four dayes bled soo moche blood myghte lyue kyng arthur wel recouerd soo whan accolon dede lete sende hym horsbere syxe knyghtes vnto camelot said bere hym syster morgan le fay say sende hym presente telle haue swerd excalibur scaubard soo departed body pcapitulum xiij meane whyle morgan le fay hadde wend kynge arthur ben dede soo day aspyed kynge vryens lay bedde slepynge thenne called vnto mayden counceyll said go fetche lordes swerd sawe neuer better tyme slee hym po madame sayd damoysel ye slee lord ye neuer escape care yow said morgan le fay see tyme whiche best doo hit therfor hye fast fetche suerd thene damoisel departed fonde syre vwayne slepynge vpon bedde another chamber soo wente vnto ire vwayne awaked hym badde hym aryse wayte lady youre moder wille slee kynge fader slepynge bedde goo fetche swerd wel said syr vwayne go waye lete dele anone damoysel brought morgan swerd quakynge handes lyghtely took swerd pulled wente boldely vnto beddes syde awayted myght sle hym best lyfte vp swerd smyte sir vwayne lepte vnto moder caughte hand sayd fende wilt thow thow moder swerd shold smyte thy hede sayd syr vwayn men saith merlyn begoten deuylle may saye erthely deuylle bare fayre sone vwayne haue mercy vpon tempted deuylle wherfore crye mercy wylle neuer doo soo saue worship discouer couenaunt said syr vwayne wille forgyue yow soo ye wille neuer aboute doo suche dedes nay sone said make yow assuraunce pcapitulum xiiij thenne came tydynges vnto morgan le fay accolon dede body brought vnto chirche kynge arthur swerd ageyne whanne quene morgan wyste accolon dede soo sorouful nere hir herte brast cause wold knowen oute ward kepte countece naun maade semblaunt sorowe wel wyste abode tyll broder arthur cam thyder shold gold goo lyf pthenne wente vnto quene gweneuer asked leue ryde countreye ye maye abyde sayde quene gweneuer tyll youre brother kynge come home maye sayde morgan le fay haue suche hasty tydynges maye tary wel saide gueneuer ye maye departe whanne ye wille soo erly morne hit daye tooke hors rode alle daye mooste parte nyghte morn none cam abbay nonnes lay kyng arthur knowyng asked ansuerd leyd hym bed slepe lytel reste thre nyghtes wel said charge yow none yow awake hym tyl doo thenne alyghte hors thoughte stele awey excalibur swerd soo wente streyghte vnto chamber noo man durste dysobeye commaundement fond arthur slepe bedde excalibur ryght hand naked whan sawe passynge heuy myghte swerd withoute awaked hym thenne wyst wel ben dede thenne tooke scaubard wente wey horsbak whan kynge awoke myssed scaubard wrothe asked ben said syster quene morgan ben ther put scaubard vnder mantel gone allas sayd arthur falsly ye haue watched syre sayd alle durste disobeye systers commaundement said kynge lete fetche best hors maye founde byd syre ontzlake arme hym al hast take another good hors ryde soo anone kynge ontzelake wel armed rode lady soo cam crosse found cowherd asked poure man yf ther cam ony lady late rydynge way syre said poure man ryght late cam lady rydynge xl horse yonder forest rode thenne spored theire horse folowed fast within whyle arthur syghte morgan le fay thenne chaced fast myghte whanne aspyed hym folowynge rode gretter paas thorowe forest tyl cam playne whanne sawe myghte escape rode vnto lake ther sayd soo euer come broder shall haue scaubard thenne lete throwe scauberd depest water soo sanke heuy gold precious stone p thenne rode valeye many grete stone whan sawe muste ouertake shope self hors man enchauntemet vnto grete marbyl stone anone al cam syr arthur syr ontzelake kynge myght knowe syster men one knyght another sayd kynge may ye see vengeaunce god sory mysauenture befalle thenne loked scaubard wold founde retorned abbeye came fro whan arthur gone torned alle lykenesse sayd syrs may goo wylle pcapitulum xv thenne said morgan sawe ye arthur broder ye said knyghtes ryght wel ye shold haue founde myghte haue stered one stede armyuestal contenaunce wold haue caused v haue fled byleue yow said morgan anone rode met knyght ledyng another knyyt hors hym bounde hand foote blyndefeld haue drouned hym fontayne whan sawe knyyt boude asked hym wylle ye doo knyght lady said wylle drowne hym cause asked fonde hym wyf shalle haue dethe anone pyte sayd morgan le fay saye ye knyyt trouthe yt saith yow said knyght shold drowned nay truly madame seith ryght whens ye sayd morgan le fay countre courte kynge arthur name manassen cosyn vnto acoolon gaulle ye say wel said loue hym ye shalle delyuerd ye shalle haue aduersary ye manessen losed knyght bounde anone manessen vnarmed hym armed hym self harneis soo mounted horsbak knyght afore hym soo threwe hym fontayne drowned hym thenne rode vnto morgan ageyne asked yf wold ony thyng vnto kynge arthur telle hym rescued loue hym loue acoolon telle hym fere hym whyle make ben lykenes stone lete hym wete doo moche whan see tyme departed countrey gorre rychely receyued maade castels townes passynge stronge alweyes drad moche kynge arthur whanne kynge wel rested hym abbey rode vnto camelot fonde quene baron ryght glad comynge whan herd straunge auentures afore reherced alle hadde merueille falshede morgan le fay many knyghtes wysshed brent thenne cam manessen courte told kyng auenture well said kynge kynde syster shalle soo auengid lyue alle crystendome shalle speke hit morne ther cam damoisel morgan kynge brought rychest mantel euer sene courte sette ful precious stone one myght stand another rychest stone euer kynge sawe damoysel saide youre syster sendeth yow mantel desyreth ye shold take gyfte thyng hath offended wille amende youre owne pleasyr whan kyng beheld mantel pleasyd hym moche said lytel pcapitulum xvj wyth came damoysel lake vnto kyng said syr must speke yow pryuyte say said kynge ye wille syr sayd damoysel put yow mantel tyl ye haue sene wyse lete come yow knyghte tyl ye commaunde brynger therof put vpon wel said kynge arthur shalle done ye counceille thenne said vnto damoysel cam fro sister damoisel mantel ye haue brought wille see vpon yow syr said wille biseme kynges garment hede said arthur ye shalle come bak ony man kyng made putt vpon forth al felle doune dede neuer spake word brente cole thenne kyng wonderly wrothe fore hand sayd vnto kynge vryens syster wyf alwey aboute bytraye wel wote outher ye neuewe youre sone counceille haue destroyed yow said kyng kynge vryens deme gretely ye counceill acoolon confessyd mouth wold haue destroyed yow wel ther hold yow excused sone syr vwayn hold hym suspect therfore charge yow put hym oute courte syr vwayne discharged whanne syr gawayne wyst made hym redy go hym said bannyssheth cosyn germayn shal bannysshe soo two departed rode grete forest soo came abbay monkes ther wel lodged whanne kynge wyst syr gawayne departed courte ther made grete sorowe amonge alle estat sayd gaherys gawayns broder haue lost two good knyghtes loue one morne herd mass abbay rode forth tyl came grete forest thenne syr gawayne ware valey turret xij fayre damoysels two knyghtes armed grete horse damoysels wente fro tree thenne syr gawayne ware henge whyte shelde tree euer damoysels cam spytte vpon threwe myre vpon sheld pcapitulum xvij thenne syr gawayne syr vwayne wente salewed asked dyd despyte shelde syrs saiden damoysels shalle telle yow knyght coutrey oweth whyte sheld passyng good man handes hateth al ladyes gentylwymmen therfor doo alle despyte shelde shal say yow said syr gawayne hit bysemeth euylle good knyghte despyse ladyes gentilwymmen parauentur though hate yow hath somme parauenture loueth somme place ladyes gentylwymmen loued ageyne suche prowesse ye speke name syr sayd name marhaus kynges sone irelond knowe hym wel sayd syre vwayne passynge good knyght ony lyne sawe hym one preued iustes many knyghtes gadered tyme ther myghte man withstande hym sayd syr gawayne damoysels thynketh ye blame hit suppose henge sheld ther wille longe ther fro thenne may tho knyghtes matche hym horsbak worship thus wille abyde lenger see knyghtes sheld dishonoured therwith syre vwayne gawayne departed lytel fro thenne ware syre marhaus cam rydynge grete hors streyghte toward whanne xij damoysels sawe syr marhaus fled turret wylde somme felle wey thenne one knyghtes toure dressid shelde said hyghe syr marhaus defende soo ranne gyders knyyt brake spere marhaus marhaus smote hym hard brake neck hors back sawe knyght turret dressyd hym toward marhaus mette egrely gyders knyhht turret soone smyten doune hors man stark dede pcapitulum xviij thenne syre marhaus rode vnto shelde sawe defowled sayd despyte parte auengyd loue gaf whyte shelde shalle hange myn thow soo hanged aboute neck thenne rode streyght vnto syr gawayn syr vwayne asked dyd ansuerd hym cam kynge arthur courte see auentures wel sayd syre marhaus redy auentures knyghte wille fulfylle ony aduenture ye wylle desyre soo departed fro fetche raunge lete hym goo seid syr vwayn vnto syre gawayne passynge good knyghte ony lyuynge wold wille ony v matched hym nay said sir gawayne shame v assayed neuer soo good knyghte wel said syr vwayne wylle assaye hym afore yow weyker ye yf smyte doune thenne may ye reuenge soo two knyghtes cam gyders grete raundon syr vwayne smote syr marhaus spere braste pyeces shelde syre marhaus smote hym sore hors man bare erthe hurte syre vwayne lyfte syde thenne syr marhaus torned hors rode toward gawayne spere syr gawayne sawe dressid sheld auentryd speres cam gyders alle myyte horse eyther knyght smote hard myddes theyr sheldes syr gawayns spere brak sir marhaus spere helde therwith syre gawayne hors russhed doune erthe lyghtly syr gawayne rose foot pulled swerd dressyd hym toward syr marhaus foote syr marhaus sawe pulled oute swerd beganne come syr gawayne horsbak syre knyght said syr gawayn alyyte foote el wylle slee thy hors gramercy sayd syr marhaus youre gentylnes ye teche curtosye hit one knyyt foote horsbak therwith syr marhaus sette spere ageyne tree alyghte tayed hors tree dressid shelde eyther cam vnto egerly smote gyders swerdes sheldes flewe cantels brysed helmes hauberkes wounded eyther syre gawayne fro passed ix clok waxed euer stronger stronger thenne hit cam houre noone thryes myghte encreaced alle aspyed syr marhaus grete wonder myghte encreaced wounded passynge sore thenne whan past noone whan drewe toward euensonge syre gawayns strengthe febled waxt passynge faynte vnnethes myght dure ony lenger syr marhaus thenne bygger bygger syre knyght said syr marhaus haue wel felt ye passynge good knyghte merueyllous man myghte euer felt ony whyle hit lasteth oure quarels grete therfor pyte doo yow hurte fele ye passynge feble said syr gawayn gentyl knyghte ye say word shold say therwith took theire helmes eyther kyssed swore gyders eyther loue bretheren syr marhaus prayd syr gawayn lodge hym nyghte toke theyr horse rode toward syr marhaus hous rode wey syr knyghte said syr gawayne haue merueylle valyaunt man ye loue ladyes ne damoysels syre sayd syr marhaus name wrongfully tho gyue name wel wote ben damoyseles turret name suche shalle telle yow cause hate sorceress enchaunters many knyyt neuer good body ful prowesse man may wille make hym sta k coward haue letter hym pryncipal cause hate al good ladyes gentyl wymmen owe seruyse knyght ouyte book reherceth frensshe ther many knyghtes ouermatched syr gawayne alle thryes myghte syr launcelot de lake syr trystrams syr bors de ganys syr percyuale syr pellias syr marhaus sixe knyytes better sir gawayn thenne within lytel whyle cam syr marhaus place whiche lytel pryory alyghte ladyes damoysels vnarmed hastely loked theyr hurtes thre hurte thre good lodgynge syr marhaus good whan wyst kynge arthur syster sone maade al chere lay power sciourned vij nyghte wel easyd woundes last departed said syre marhaus wylle departe soo lyytely wylle brynge thorow forest rode daye day wel seuen dayes fond ony auenture last cam grete forest named countreye foreste arroy countrey straunge auentures countrey sayd syr marhaus cam neuer knyghte syn crystened fonde straunge auentures soo rode cam depe valey ful stone ther sawe fayr streme water aboue ther hede streme fayr fontayne thre damoysels syttynge therby thenne rode eyther salewed eldest garland gold aboute hede thre score wynter age whyte vnder garland second damoysel thyrtty wynter age serkelet gold aboute hede thyrd damoysel xv yere age garland floures aboute hede knyghtes soo beholde asked hem cause sat fontayne sayd damoysels thys cause yf may see ony erraunt knyghtes teche hem vnto straunge auentures ye thre knyghtes seken auentures thre damoysels therfore eche one yow must chese one v whan ye haue done soo wylle lede yow vnto thre hyhe wayes eche yow shal chese wey damoysel hym day twelu monethe ye must mete ageyn god sende yow lyues ye must plyyte trouthe wel said sayd syr marhaus pcapitulum xx shalle eueryche v chese damoysel shalle telle yow sayd syre vwayne yongest moost weykest yow bothe therfor wyl haue eldest damoysel hath sene moche best helpe whan haue nede haue moost nede helpe yow bothe said syr marhaus wyll haue damoysel thyrtty wynter age falleth best wel sayd syre gawayne thanke yow ye haue lefte yongest fayrest moost leuest thenne euery damoysel took knyght raynes brydel broughte thre wayes othe made mete fontayne day twelue moneth lyuynge yst departed eueryche knyghte selte lady behynd hym syr vwayne took wey lay west syr marhaus took wey lay southe syr gawayne took weye laye northe wylle begynne syr gawayne helde wey tyll cam vnto fayre manoir dwellyd old knyghte good housholder syr gawayn asked knyght yf knewe ony auentures countrey shalle shewe yow somme morne sayd old knyghte merueyllous soo morne rode forest aduentures tyl cam launde ther fond crosse stode houed ther cam fayrest knyght semelyest man euer sawe makynge grettest dole euer man made thenne ware syr gawayn salewed hym praid god sende hym moche worship said syr gawayn gramercy also praye god send yow honour worship said knyghte may laye syde sorowe shame cometh worship pcapitulum xxj ther passed vnto one syde launde syde sawe syr gawayne x knyytes houed styll make em redy sheldes speres ageynst one knyght cam syr gawayn thenne one knyght auentryd grete spere one x knyghtes encountred hym woful knyght smote hym hard felle ouer hors taylle dolorous knyyt serued hem al lest way smote doune hors man alle dyd one spere soo whan x fote wente one knyght stode stone styll suffred hem pulle hym doune hors bound hym hande foote tayed hym vnder hors bely ledde hym hem ihesu sayd syr gawayne dooleful syghte see yonder knyghte entreted semeth knyght suffr th hem bynde hym soo maketh resystence noo said hoost trouthe wold al weyke soo doo hym syr said damoysel vnto syr gawayn semeth hit youre worship helpe dolorous knyghte thynketh one best knyghtes euer sawe wold doo hym sayd syre gawayn hit semeth wylle haue helpe thenne sayd damoysel thynketh ye haue luste helpe hym thus talked sawe knyyte syde launde al armed auf hede syde ther cam dwerf hors bak armed sauf hede grete mouthe shorte nose whan dwerf came nyghe said lady shold mete v ther came forth wood thenne began stryue lady knyghte sayd wold haue dwerf said wold haue wylle doo wel sayd dwerf yonder knyght crosse lete v put bothe vpon hym demeth shalle wylle wel said knyght wente thre vnto syre gawayn told hym wherfor strofe wel syrs said wylle ye put mater hand ye sayd damoysel sayd syr gawayn ye shal stande betwixe whether ye lyst better go shal haue yow whan sette bitwene left knyghte wente dwerf dwerf took wente waye syngynge knyghte wente hys wey grete mornyng thenne came ther two knyghtes armed cryed hyghe syre gawayn knyghte kynge arthur make redy al hast iuste soo ranne gyders eyther felle doune thenne foote drewe swerdes dyd ful actually mene whyle knyghte wente damoysel asked abode knyghte yf ye wold abyde wylle feythful knyghte yow wylle said damoysel syr gawayn may fynde myn herte hym one knyyt scomfyte x knyghtes laste cowardly led awey therfore lete v two goo whylest fyghte syre gawayn fought knyght longe last accorded thenne knyght prayd syr gawayn lodge hym nyghte soo syre gawayn wente knyghte asked hym knyghte countrey smote doune ten knyghtes whan done manfully suffred hem bynde hym hand foote soo ledde hym awey sayd knyghte best knyght trowe world moost man prowesse bath serued soo ene x tymes name hyghte syr pelleas loueth grete lady countrey name ettard loued cryed countrey greete iustes thre dayes alle knyghtes countrey gentylwymmen preued hym best knyght shold haue passyng good swerd serklet gold serklet knyght shold gyue hit fayrest lady iustes knyghte syre pelleas best knyghte fyue honderd knyghtes neuer man euer syre pelleas met al stroke hym doune el hors euery day thre dayes strake doune twenty knyghtes therfore gaf hym pryse forthe wente lady ettard gaf serklet said openly fayrest lady wold preue vpon ony knyghte wold say nay pca xxij soo chose souerayne lady neuer loue proude scorne ef hym sayd wold neuer loue hym thouy wold dye wherfor al ladyes gentylwymmen hadde scorne proude fayrer none ther sir pelleas wold haue proferd hem loue wold haue loued hym noble prowesse knyyt promysed lady ettard folowe coutrey nener leue tyl loued hym thus moost party nyghe lodged pryory euery weke sendeth knyghtes fyyte hym whan hath put hem wers wylle suffre hem wylfully take hym prysoner cause wold haue syghte lady alweyes doth hym grete despyte tyme maketh knyghtes taye hym hors taylle bynd hym vnder hors bely thus moost shamefullest wyse thynke broughte alle doth hyt cause hym leue countreye leue louynge make hym leue wold haue foughte foote myghte haue better ten knyghtes wel foote horsbak allas sayd syr gawayn grete pyte hym nyghte wylle seke hym morowe forest doo hym alle helpe morne syr gawayne tooke leue hoost syre carados rode forest last mette syr pelleas makyng grete moone oute mesure eche hem salewed asked hym made suche sorowe aboue reherced syre pelleas told syre gawayne alweyes suffre knyghtes fare soo ye sawe yesterdaye truste last wynne loue knoweth wel alle knyghtes shold lyghtely wynne lyste fyghte vttermest wherfore loued sore hadde leuer dye honderd tymes myght dye soo ofte rather wold suffre despyte truste wylle haue pyte vpon laste loue causeth many good knyght suffre haue entent allas vnfortunate ther maade soo grete dole sorowe vnnethe myghte holde hym horsback p sayd syre gawayne leue mornynge shalle promyse yow feythe body doo alle lyeth power gete yow loue lady ther wylle plyte yow trouthe sayd syr pelleas courte ye telle praye yow good frend thenne syr gawayne sayd courte kynge arthur susters sone kynge lott orkeney fader name syre gawayne thenne sayd name syre pelleas borne iles many iles lord neuer haue loued lady damoysel tyl vnhappy tyme syr knyghte syn ye soo nyghe cosyn vnto kynge arthur kynges sone therfor bytraye helpe may neuer come somme good knyghte stronge castel fast within four myle ouer countrey lady may neuer come presence suffre knyghtes take yf dyd myghte haue syghte ben dede long tyme yet fayre word neuer wha brought fore rebuketh fowlest maner thenne take hors harneis putten oute yates wylle suffre ete drynke alweyes offre prysoner wylle suffre wold desyre paynes euer soo myyte haue syghte dayly wel sayd syr gawayne al shalle amende ye wylle shal deuyse wylle haue hors armour wylle ryde vnto castel elle haue slayne yow soo shal come withynne cause cherysshe thenne shalle doo true parte ye shalle faylle haue loue pcapitulum xxiij syr gawayne plyghte trouthe vnto syr pelleas true feythful vnto hym soo eche one plyghte trouthe soo chaunged horse harneis sire gawayn departed came castel stoode pauelions lady withoute yate soone ettard aspyed syr gawayn fledde toward castel syre gawayn spak hyghe badde abyde syre pelleas another knyghte haue slayne syr pelleas doo youre helme said lady ettard maye see vysage soo whan sawe syr pelleas made hym alyghte ledde hym vnto castel asked hym feyth fully whether slayne syr pelleas sayd ye told name syre gawayn courte kynge arthur syster sone truly sayd grete pyte passynge good knyghte body al men lyue hated hym moost coude neuer quyte hym ye haue slayne hym shalle woman doo ony thynge myghte please yow soo made syr gawayne good chere thenne syr gawayn sayd loued lady meane wold loue hym blame sayd ettard wylle loue yow ye soo wel borne man suche man prowesse lady world good yow wylle ye sayd syre gawayne promyse doo alle ye maye feythe youre body gete loue lady ye syre sayd promyse yow feythe body sayd syre gawayne self loue wel therfore praye yow hold promyse maye chese sayd lady ettard yf shold forsworne soo graunted hym fulfylle alle desyre psoo thenne moneth may syre gawayn wente oute castel souped pauelione made bedde syre gawayne lady ettard wente bedde gyders another pauelione layd damoysels thyrd pauelione leyd parte knyghtes thenne drede syr pelleas syre gawayn lay pauelione two dayes two nyghtes thyrd day mornyng erly syr pelleas armed hym hadde neuer slepte syn syr gawayn departed hym syr gawayne promysed hym feythe hys body come hym vnto pauelione pryory within space daye nyghte pthenne syre pelleas mounted vpon horsbak cam pauelions stode without castel fonde fyrst pauelione thre knyghtes thre beddes thre squyers lyggynge theire foot thenne wente seconde pauelione fond four gentyl wymmen lyenge four beddes thenne yede thyrd pauelion fond syr gawayn lyggyng bedde lady ettard eyther clyppyng armes whan sawe herte wel nyghe brast sorou said allas euer knyyt shold founde fals thene took hors myyt abyde lenger pure sorowe whanne hadde ryden nyghe half myle torned ageyne thoughte slee hem bothe whanne sawe hem bothe soo lye slepynge faste vnnethe myght holde hym horsbak sorowe sayd thus hym self though knyght neuer soo fals wyl neuer slee hym slepynge wylle neuer destroye hygh ordre knygthode therwith departed ageyne hadde ryden half myle retorned ageyne thoughte thenne slee hem bothe makynge grettest sorou euer man made whanne came pauelions tayed hors vnto tree pulled oute swerd naked hand wente lay yet thought shame slee slepynge layd naked swerd ouerthwart bothe throtes soo tooke hors rode waye p whanne syre pelleas came pauelions told knyghtes squyers sped sayd thus true good seruyse ye haue done shall gyue yow alle goodes wylle goo vnto bedde neuer aryse vntyl dede whan dede charge yow ye take herte oute body bere betwyxe two syluer dysshes telle sawe lye fals knyght syr gawayne ryght soo syr pelleas vnarmed hym self wente vnto bedde makynge merueyllous dole sorowe pthenne syre gawayne ettard awoke slepe fonde naked swerd ouerthwart theire throtes thenne knewe wel syr pelleas swerd allas sayd sir gawayne ye haue bitrayed syr pelleas bothe ye told ye slayne hym knowe wel soo lyue yf syre pelleas ben vncurteis yow ye haue ben hym ye hadde ben dede knyghte ye haue deceyued bytrayd falsly al ladyes damoysels may beware yow ther syr gawayn made hym redy wente forest soo happed thenne damoysel lake nymue mette knyghte syr pelleas wente foote forest makyng grete dole asked hym cause soo woful knyghte told mayster lorde bitrayed thurgh knyghte lady wyll neuer aryse oute bed tyl dede brynge hym sayd anone wyl waraunt lyf shal dye loue hath caused hym loue shalle euyl plyte long ioy suche prowde lady wylle haue mercy suche valyaunt knyght anone knyyte broughte vnto hym whan sawe hym lye bedde thoughte sawe neuer lykely knyght ther threwe enchauntement vpon hym felle slepe ther whyle rode vnto lady ettard charged man awake hym tyl came ageyne soo within two houres broughte lady ettard thydder ladyes fonde hym slepe loo sayd damoysel lake ye oughte ashamed murdre suche knyght therwith threwe suche enchauntement vpon loued hym sore wel nyghe oute mynde lord ihesu saide lady ettard befallen vnto loue hym haue moost hated ony man alyue ryght wy iugement god sayd damoysel thenne anone syr pelleas awaked loked vpon ettard whan sawe knewe thene hated ony woman alyue said awey traitresse come neuer syyt whan herd hym say wepte made grete sorou oute mesure pcapitulum xxiiij syre knyhht pelleas sayd damoysel lake take hors come forthe oute countrey ye shal loue lady shal loue yow wylle wel said syr pelleas lady ettard hath done grete despyte shame told begynnynge endynge purposed neuer haue arysen tyll hadde ben dede suche grace god hath sente hate moche euer loued thanked lord ihesus thanke sayde damoysel lake anone syre pellas armed hym tooke hors commaunded men brynge pauelions stuffe damoysel lake wold assigne soo lady ettard dyed sorowe damoysel lake reioysed syr pellas loued gyders durynge lyf dayes pcapitulum xxv torne vnto syr marhaus rode damoysel xxx wynter age southard soo cam depe forest fortune nyyted rode longe depe way last came vnto courtelage asked herborow courtelage wold lodge treatyce coude treate thus moche good man sayd ye take aduenture youre lodgyng shal brynge ye shalle lodged auenture shal haue lodgynge sayd syr marhaus ye shalle wete whan ye come sayd good man syr auenture bryng thyder pray sayd syr marhaus wery damoysel hors good man wente opened gate within houre broughte hym vnto fayre castel thenne poure man called porter anon lete castel soo told lord brouyt hym knyght erraunt damoysel wold lodged hym lete hym said lord may happen shalle repente toke lodgyng syr marhaus lete torche lyghte goodely syghte yonge men welcomed hym thenne hors ledde stable damoysel broughte halle stode myghty duke many goodely men hym thene lord asked hym hyghte fro whens cam whome dwelt syre said knyghte kynge arthur knyght table round name syre marhaus borne irland thenne sayd duke hym sore repenteth cause loue thy lord none thy felawes table round therfor ease thy self nyghte wel thow mayst morne sixe sonnes shal matche yow ther remedy must haue doo yow vj sone one sayd syr marhaus sayd duke cause maade myn auowe syr gawayne slewe seuen sonnes recounter therfore made myn auowe shold neuer knyyt kynge arthur court lodge come myght haue adoo hym wold haue reuengyng sonnes dethe name said syr marhaus requyre yow telle please yow wete thow wel duke south marchys sayd sir marhaus haue herd saye ye haue ben longe tyme grete foo vnto lord arthur knyghtes shalle ye fele morne said duke shalle haue adoo yow sayd syr marhaus ye sayd duke therof shalt thow chese therfore take yow chambre ye shalle haue yow longeth syr marhaus departed led chamber damoysel led vnto chamber morn duke sente vnto syre marhaus bad make hym redy syr marhaus arose armed hym thenne ther masse songe afore hym brake fast mou ted horsback courte castel shold doo batail ther duke al redy horsbak clene armed syxe sonnes hym eueryche spere hand soo encountred duke two sone brak theyr speres vpon hym sir marhaus helde vp spere touched none pcapitulum xxvj thenne cam foure sone couple two brake speres soo dyd two alle whyle syre marhaus touched hem thenne sir marhaus ranne duke smote hym spere hors man felle erthe serued sone thenne syr marhaus alyghte doune bad duke yelde hym el wold slee hym thenne sone recouerd wold haue set vpon syr marhaus thenne syr marhaus sayd duke seace thy sone el doo vttermest yow thenne duke sawe myghte escape deth cryed sone charged yelde syr marhaus kneled al doune put pomels theire swerdes knyght soo receyued thenne halp vp fader soo comynal assente promysed syr marhaus neuer foe vnto kynge arthur therupon whytsontyde come sone putte kynges grace thenne syr marhaus departed within two dayes damoysel brought hym grete tornement lady de vawse cryed dyd best shold haue ryche serklet gold worthe thousand besauntes syr marhaus dyd nobly renomed somtyme doune fourty knyghtes soo serklet gold rewarded hym thenne departed fro then grete worship soo within seuen nyghtes damoysel brought hym erles place name erle fergus syre trystrams knyghte erle yonge man late come landes gyant fast hym hyyte taulurd another broder cornewaille hyghte taulas syr trystram slewe whanne oute mynde erle maade complaynte vnto syre marhaus gyaunt hym destroyed al londes durst nowhere ryde goo hym syr sayd knyghte whether vseth fyghte horsbak foote nay sayd erle maye hors hym wel said syr marhaus thenne wille fyghte hym foote soo morne syr marhaus prayd erle one men myghte brynge hym gyaut sawe hym sytte vnder tree hoolly many clubbes yron gysarms hym soo thys knyghte dressid hym gyant putiyng sheld afore hym gyant toke iron clubbe hande fyrste stroke clafe syre marhaus shelde ij pyeces grete peryl gyant wyly fyghter atte last syr marhaus smote ryght arme aboue elbowe thene gyant fledde knyght hym soo drofe hym water gyant soo hyghe myghte wade hym thenne sir marhaus made erle fergus man fetche hym stone tho stone knyghte gaf gyaunt many sore knockes tyl last made hym falle doune water dede thene syr marhaus wete vnto gyants castel delyuerd xxiiij ladyes twelue knyytes oute gyants pryson grete rychesse withoute nombre soo dayes lyf neuer poure man thenne retorned erle fergus whiche thanked hym gretely wold haue gyuen hym half la de wold none take soo syr marhaus dwellyd erle nyghe half yere sore brysed gyaunt laste took leue rode way mette syr gawayne syr vwayne aduenture mette foure knyghtes arthur courte fyrst syr sagramore desyrus syr ozanna syr dodynas le saueage syre felot lystynoyse syr marhaus one spere smote doune foure knyghtes hurte sore soo departed mete day afore sel e pcapitulum xxvij tourne vnto syr vwayne rode westwarde damoysel thre score wynter age broughte hym turnement nyghe marche walys tornement syre vwayne smote doune xxx knyghtes therfore gyuen hym pryse gerfaukon whyte stede trapped clothe gold soo thenne syr vwayn dyd many straunge auentures meanes old damoysel broughte hym lady called lady roche moche curtois countrey two knyytes bretheren called two peryllous knyghtes one knyghte hyght syre edward reed castel syr hue reed castel two bretheren disheryted lady roche baronry landes extorsion knyyt lodged lady made compleynt hym two knyghtes madame sayd syr vwayne blame doo ageynst hyghe ordre knygthode othe made yf hit lyke yow wille speke hem cause knyghte kynge arthur wylle entrete fayrenesse yf wylle shalle doo bataille deffense youre ryghte gramercy sayd lady maye acquyte yow god shalle soo morne two knyghtes sente shold come thyder speke lady roche wete ye wel fayled cam c hors whan lady sawe maner soo bygge wold suffre syr vwayne goo oute vpon surete ne fayr langage made hym speke ouer toure fynally two bretheren wold entreated ansuerd wold kepe wel said syr vwayne thenne wylle fyghte one yow preue ye doo lady wronge wille said doo bataille two wyl fyghte one knyyt one therfore yf ye wille fyghte soo wille redy houre ye wille assigne yf ye wynne v bataille lady shal haue landes ageyne ye say wel sayd sir vwayne therfor make yow redy ye morne defence ladyes ryght pcapitulum xxviij sykernesse made partyes treason shold wrought neyther partye soo thenne knyghtes departed made hem redy nyghte syr vwayn grete chere morne arose erly herd masse brake fast soo rode vnto playn withoute gate houed two bretheren abydynge hym soo rode gyders passynge sore syre edward syr hue brake speres vpon syr vwayne syr vwayne smote syre edward felle ouer hors yet spere brast thenne spored hors came vpon syr hue ouerthrewe hym soone recouerd dressid sheldes drewe suerdes bad syre vwayne alyghte doo bataill vttermest thenne syr vwayn deuoyded hors sodenly put shelde afore hym drewe swerde soo dressyd gyders eyther gaf suche stroke two bretheren wounded syr vwayne passyng greuously lady roche wende shold haue dyed thus fought gyders fyue houres men raged oute reason laste syr vwayne smote syr edward vpon helme suche stroke swerd kerued vnto canel bone thenne syr hue abated courage syr vwayn pressed fast haue slayne hym sawe syr hue kneled doune yelde hym syr vwayne gentilnesse receyued swerd took hym hand went castel gyders thenne lady roche passyng glad broder made grete sorowe broders dethe thenne lady restored al landes syr hue commaunded courte kynge arthur next feest penthecost sir vwayn dwelt lady nyghe half yere longe myghte hole grete hurtes soo whan drewe nygh terme day syr gawayn syr marhaus syre vwayne shold mete crosse way thenne euery knyght drewe hym thyder holde promyse made syr marhaus syr vwayne broughte damoysels sir gawayn lost damoysel afore reherced pcapitulum xxix ryght soo twelue monethes ende mette alle thre knyghtes fontayne damoisels damoysel syr gawayn coude saye lytel worship hym soo departed damoysels roode thurgh grete forest mette messager cam fro kynge arthur soughte wel nyhe xij moneth thorou oute al englond walys scotland charged yf euer myght fynde syre gawayn syre vwayn brynge hem courte ageyne thenne al gladde soo prayd syre marhaus ryde hem kynges courte soo within twelue dayes cam camelot kynge passyng glad comynge soo alle courte thenne kyng made hem swere vpon book telle hym alle theire aduentures befalle hem twelue monethe soo dyd sir marhaus wel knowen ther knyghtes matched afore tyme named one best knyghtes lyuyng ageyne feest pentecost cam damoysel lake broughte hir syr pelleas hyhe feest grete iustynge knyghtes al knyghtes iustes syr pelleas pryse syr marhaus named next syr pelleas soo stronge myght fewe knyghtes sytte hym buffet spere next feest sir pelleas syr marhaus made knyghtes table roud two seges voyde two knyghtes slayn twelue moneth grete ioye kynge arthur sire pelleas sire marhaus pelleas loued neuer sire gawayne spared hym loue kyng arthur oftymes iustes turnementes sire pelleas quyte sire gawayn reherceth book frensshe soo sire trystram many dayes faughte sire marhaus yland dyd grete bataylle last sire trystram slewe hym soo sire trystram wou ded vnnethe myght recouer lay nonnery halfe yere sire pelleas worshipful knyghte one four encheued sancgreal damoysel lake made meanes neuer adoo sire launcelot de lake sire launcelot ony iustes ony tornement wold suffre hym daye yf syde sire launcelot pexplicit liber quartus pincipit liber quintus whanne kyng arthur longe werre rested helde ryal feeste table rounde alyes kynges prynces noble knyghtes round table cam halle syttynge throne ryal xij au cyen men berynge eche braunche olyue token cam embassatours messager fro emperour lucyus whiche called tyme dictatour procutour publyke wele rome whiche sayde messagers entryng comyng presence kynge arthur dyd hym theyr obeyssauce makyng hym reuerence said hym wyse hyghe myghty emperour lucyus sendeth kyng bretayne gretyng comaudyng knouleche hym thy lord sende hym truage due royamme vnto thempyre whiche thy fader fore thy precessours haue paid record thou rebelle knowynge hym thy souerayne withholdest reteynest contrary statute decree maade noble worthy iulius cezar conquerour royame fyrst emperour rome yf thou refuse demaunde commaundement knowe thou certayne shal make stronge werre ageynst thy royames londes shall chastyse thy subgettys shal ensample perpetuel vnto alle kynges prynces denye truage vnto noble empyre whiche domyneth vpon vnyuersal world thenne whan shewed theffecte message kyng commaunded withdrawe said shold take auyce counceylle gyue ansuere thenne somme yonge knyghtes heryng message wold haue ronne haue slayne sayenge rebuke alle knyghtes beyng present suffre saye kynge anone kynge commaunded none vpon payne dethe myssaye ne doo ony harme commauded knyghte brynge lodgynge see haue alle necessary requysyte best chere noo deyntee spared romayns ben grete lordes though theyr message please ne court yet must remembre myn honour pafter kyng lete calle alle lordes knyghtes round table counceyl vpon mater desyred saye theire aduys thenne syr cador cornewaile spacke fyrste sayd syre message lyketh wel haue many dayes rested v haue ben ydle hope ye shalle make sharp warre romayns doubte shal gete honour byleue wel sayd arthur mater pleaseth wel ansuers may ansuerd demaunde greueth sore truly wyl neuer paye truage rome wherfore pray yow counceylle haue vnderstande bellinus brenius kynges bretayne haue thempyre handes many dayes also constantyn sone heleyne whiche open euydence owe noo trybute rome ryght ben descended haue ryght clayme tytle thempyre pcapitulum secundum thenne ansuerd kynge anguysshe scotland syr ye oughte ryght aboue al kynges vnto yow none lyke ne pareylle crystendome knyythode ne dygnyte counceylle neuer obeye romayns whan regned v destressyd oure elder putte land grete extorcions taylles wherfore make myn auowe auenge strengthe youre quarel shal furnysshe xy good men warre wage costes whiche shal awayte yow self whan shal please yow kyng lytel bretayne graunted hym xxx wherfor kynge arthur thanked thenne euery man agreed make warre ayde power wete lord westwalis promysed brynge xxx men syr vwayne syre ider sone cosyns promysed brynge xxx thenne syre launcelot alle promysed lyke wyse euery man grete multytude pand whan kynge arthur vnderstood theire courage good wylles thanked hertely lete calle thembassatours theire ansuere presence alle lordes knyghtes sayd thys wyse wylle ye retorne vnto lord procurour comyn wele romayns saye ye hym demaunde commaundement sette nothyng knowe truage ne trybute owe hym ne none erthely prynce crysten ne hethen pretende haue occupye soueraynte thempyre wherin entytled ryght predecessours somtyme kynges lond saye hym delybered fully concluded goo wyth myn armye strengthe power vnto rome grace god take possession thempyre subdue ben rebelle wherfore commaunde hym alle rome incontynent make homage knouleche emperour gouernour vpon payne shalle ensiewe thenne commaunded tresorer gyue grete large yeftes paye alle theyr dispencys assygned syre cador conueye oute land soo took theire leue departed tooke theyr shyppynge sandwyche passed forthe flaundrys almayn montayns ytalye vntyl cam vnto lucius reuerence made made relacyon ansuer lyke ye fore haue herd whan themperour lucyus wel vnderstonde theyre credence sore meued ben al araged sayd supposed arthur wold haue obeyed commaundement haue serued yow hym self hym wel bysemed ony kyng doo syre sayd one senatours late suche vayn wordes late yow wete felawes ful sore aferd beholde countenaunce fere ye haue made rodde self entendeth lord empyre whiche sore doubted yf come al another ye wene holdeth noble courte world alle kynges ne prynces maye compare vnto noble mayntene newe yeres daye sawe hym estate whiche ryallest euer sawe serued table ix kynges noblest felauship prynces lordes knyghtes ben world euery knyghte approued lyke lord holdeth table roud persone moost manly man lyueth lyke conquere alle world vnto courage lytel wherfore aduyse yow kepe wel youre march straytes montayns certaynly lord doubted wel sayd lucius bifore eester suppose passe moutayns soo forth fraunce byreue hym londes ianeweyes myghty warryours tuskane lombardye shall sende ben subgettys alyed thepyre rome come myn ayde forthwith sente old wyse knyghtes vnto countrayes folowynge fyrste ambage arrage alysaundrye ynde hermonye ryuer eufrates renneth asye auffryke europe large ertayne elamye arabye egypte damaske damyete cayer capadoce tarce turkye pounce pampoylle surrye gallacye alle subgette rome many moo grece cypre macydone calabre cateland portyngale many thousandes spaynardys thus alle kynges duke admyrals assembled aboute rome xvj kynges attones grete multytude peple whan themperour vnderstood comyng made redy romayns alle peple bytwene hym flaunders p also hadde goten wyth hym fyfty geaunts whiche ben engendred fendys ordeyned garde persone breke frounte bataylle kynge arthur thus departed fro rome came doune montayns destroye londes arthur conquerd cam vnto coleyne byseged castel wanne soone stuffed hit two honderd sarasyns infydeles destroyed many fayr countrees whiche arthur wonne kyng claudas thus lucius cam alle hoost whiche disperplyd lx myle brede commaunded mete hym burgoyne purposed destroye royame lytyl bretayne pcapitulo tercio leue lucius emperour speke kynge arthur commaunded alle retenue redy atte vtas hyllary holde parlement yorke parlement concluded areste alle nauye lond redy within xv dayes sand wyche shewed armye purposed conquere thempyre whiche ought haue ryght ordeyned two gouernours royame say syre bawdewyn bretayne counceille best syr constantyn sone syre cador cornewaylle whiche dethe arthur kyng royamme presence alle lordes resyned rule royame gweneuer quene wherfore syre launcelot wrothe lefte syre trystram kynge marke loue beal isoulde thenne quene gweneuer made grete sorowe departynge lord swouned suche wyse ladyes bare chambre thus kyng grete armye departed leuyng quene royamme gouernaunce syre bawduyn constantyn whan hors sayd hyhe voys yf dye iourney wyl syre constantyn myn heyer kyng crowned royame next blood departed entred see atte sandwyche alle armye greete multitude shyppes galeyes cogges dromoundes sayllynge see pcapitulum iiij kyng laye caban shyp fyll slomerynge dremed merueyllous dreme hym semed dredeful dragon dyd drowne moche peple cam fleynge oute west hede enameled asure sholders shone gold bely lyke maylles merueyllous hewe taylle ful tatter foot ful fyne sable clawes lyke fyne gold hydous flamme fyre flewe oute mouthe lyke londe water flammed fyre hym semed came oute thoryent grymly bore al blak clowde pawes bygge post rugged lokynge roughly foulest beest euer man sawe rored romed soo hydously merueill thenne dredeful dragon auaunced hym cam wynde lyke fawcon gyuynge grete stroke bore bore hytte hym ageyne grysly tuskes brest al blody hote blood made alle see reed blood thenne dragon flewe awey al heyyte came doune suche swough smote bore rydge whiche x foote large fro hede taylle smote bore powdre bothe flesshe bonys flytteryd al abrode see therwith kynge awoke anone sore abasshed dreme sente anone wyse philosopher commaundynge telle hym sygnyfycacion dreme syre sayd philosopher dragon thow dremedest betokeneth thyn owne persone sayllest colour wynges ben thy royames thow haste wonne taylle whiche al tatterd sygnefyeth noble knyghtes round table pand bore dragon slough comyng fro clowdes betokeneth tyraunt tormenteth peple el thow arte lyke fyghte somme geaunt thy self beynge horryble abhomynable whoos pere ye sawe neuer dayes wherfore dredeful dreme doubte thynge conquerour come forth thy self thenne soone syghte londe saylled tyl arryued atte barflete flaundres whanne fond many grete lordes redy ben commaunded awayte vpon hym p capitulum v thenne came hym husbond man countrey told hym countre constantyn besyde bretayne grete gyaunt whiche hadde slayne murthered deuoured moche peple countreye ben susteyned seuen yere child comyns land soo moche alle child ben alle slayne destroyed late hath taken duchesse bretayne rode meyne hath ledde lodgynge whiche montayne rauysshe lye lyues ende many people folowed moo v c alle myghte rescowe lefte shrykyng cryenge lamentably wherfore suppose hath slayn fulfyllynge fowle lust lechery wyf vnto thy cosyn syre howel whome calle ful nyhe thy blood thow ryghtful kynge haue pyte lady reuenge v al thow arte noble conquerour palas sayd kynge arthur grete meschyef leuer best royame haue hadde ben forlonge way fore hym haue rescowed lady pnow felawe sayd kynge arthur canst thou brynge thys gyaunt haunteth ye syre sayd good man oo yonder thow seest tho two grete fyres shalt thou fynde hym tresour suppose al fraunce whanne kynge hadde vnderstanden pyteous caas retorned tente pthenne callyd hym syre kaye syre bedewere commaunded secretely make redy hors harneis hym self tweyne euensonge wold ryde pylgremage two vnto saynt mychels mounte thenne anone maad hym redy armed hym alle poyntes tooke hors sheld soo thre departed then rode forthe faste euer myyt tyl cam forlond mount alyghted kynge commaunded tarye wold hym self goo vp mounte soo ascended vp hylle tyl came grete fyre fonde careful wydowe wryngynge handes makyng grete sorowe syttynge graue newe made thenne kynge arthur falewed demaunded wherfore made suche lamentacion whome ansuerd sayd syre knyghte speke softe yonder deuyll yf speke wylle come destroye hold vnhappy dost thow mountayne yf ye suche fyfty ye ye able make resystence ageynst deuyl lyeth duchesse deede whiche fayrest alle world wyf syre howel du bretayne hath murthred forcynge hath slytte vnto nauyl pdame sayd kynge come fro noble conqueroure kynge arthur treate tyraunt lyege peple fy suche treaty sayd setteth kynge ne man el yf thou haue broughte arthur wyf dame gweneuer shalle gladder thow haddest gyuen hym half fraunce beware approche hym nygh hath vaynquysshed xv kynges hath maade hym cote ful precious stone enbrowdred theyre erdes whiche sente hym haue loue sauacion theyr peple laste crystemasse yf thow wylt speke hym yonder grete fyre souper wel sayd arthur wyll accomplysshe message al ferdful wordes wente forth creast hylle sawe satte atte souper gnawynge lymme man bekynge brode lymmes fyre brecheles thre fayr damoysels tornynge thre broches wheron broched twelue yonge child late borne lyke yonge byrdes pwhanne kynge arthur beheld pyteous syyte grete compassion hert bledde sorowe hayled hym sayeng wyse alle world weldeth gyue shorte lyf shameful dethe deuyl haue thy soule hast thow murthred yonge innocent child murthred duchesse therfore aryse dresse thow gloton day shall thou dye hand thenne gloton anone starte vp tooke grete clubbe hand smote kynge coronal fylle erthe kynge hytte hym ageyn carf bely cutte genytours guttes entraylles fylle doune ground thenne gyaunt threwe awey clubbe caught kynge armes crusshyd rybbes thenne thre maydens knelyd doune callyd cryst helpe comforte arthur thenne arthur weltred wrong whyle vnder another tyme aboue weltryng walowynge rolled doune hylle tyl came see marke euer soo weltred arthur smote hym daggar fortuned came place two knyghtes kepte arthur hors thenne sawe kynge fast gyaunts armes came losed hym thenne kynge commaunded syr kaye smyte gyaunts hede sette vpon truncheon spere bere syre howel telle hym enemy slayne late hede bounden barby alle peple may see behold hit go ye two vp montayn fetche sheld suerd clubbe yron tresour take ye ye shalle fynde good oute nombre haue kertyl clubbe desyre fyerst gyaunt euer mette sauf one mount arabe whiche ouercame gretter fyerser thenne knyghtes fette clubbe kyrtyl tresour took self retorned ageyne host anone knowen thurgh alle countrey wherfor peple came thanked kynge sayd ageyne yeue thanke god departe goodes among yow kynge arthur sayd commaunded cosyn howel shold ordeyne chirche bylded hylle worship saynte mychel pand morne kynge remeuyd grete bataylle came champayne valeye pyght tentys kynge beynge set dyner ther cam two messagers whome one marchal frauce sayd kyng themperour entryd fraunce destroyed grete parte burgoyn destroyed made grete slaughter peple brente townes borowes wherfor yf thou come hastely must yelde vp bodyes goodes pcapitulum sextum thenne kynge dyd doo calle syre gawayn syre borce syr lyonel syre bedewere commaunded goo strayte syre lucius saye ye hym hastely remeue oute land yf wil bydde hym make hym redy bataylle distresse poure peple thenne anone noble knyghtes dressyd horsbak whanne came grene wood sawe many pauelions sette medowe sylke dyuerse colour besyde ryuer themperours pauelione myddle egle displayed aboue whiche tente knyghtes rode toward ordeyned syr gawayn syre bors doo message lefte busshement syre lyonel syre bedwere thenne syre gawayn syr borce dyd message commaunded lucius arthur name auoyde lond shortly adresse hym bataylle whome lucius ansuerde sayd ye shalle retorne lord saye ye hym shall subdue hym alle londes thenne syre gawayn wrothe sayde hadde leuer alle fraunce fyghte ageynste soo hadde saide syr borce leuer alle bretayne burgoyne pthenne knyght named syre gaynus nyghe cosyn emperour sayde loo breton ben ful pryde boost bragge though bare vp alle worlde thenne syre gawayne sore greued wordes pulled oute swerd smote hede therwith torned theyr horse rode ouer water thurgh woodes tyl came theyre busshement syr lyonel syr bedeuer houyng romayns folowed fast horsbak foote ouer cha payn vnto wood thenne syre boor torned hors sawe knyghte come fast whome smote thurgh body spere fylle dede doune erthe thenne cam callyburne one str ngest pauye smote doun many arthur knyghtes whan syr bors sawe hym soo moche harme adressyd toward hym smote hym thury brest fylle doune dede erthe thenne syr feldenak thought reuenge dethe gaynus vpon syre gawayn syre gawayn ware therof smote hym hede whiche stroke stynted tyl came breste thenne retorned came felawes busshement recountre busshement brake romayns slewe hewe doune romayns forced romayns flee retorne whome noble knyghtes chaced vnto theyr tentes thenne romayns gadred peple also foote men cam ther newe bataille soo moche peple syr bors syr berel taken whan syre gawayn sawe tooke hym syre idrus good knyght sayd wold neuer see kynge arthur yf rescued pulled galatyn good swerd folowed ledde tho ij knyghtes awaye smote hym lad syre bors took syr bors fro hym delyuerd hym felawes syre idrus lyke wyse rescowed syr berel thenne beganne bataill grete oure knyytes grete ieopardy wherfore syre gawayn sente kyng arthur socour hye hym sore wounded oure prysoners may paye good oute nombre messager came kyng told hym message anon kynge dyd doo assemble armye anone departed prysoners comen syre gawayn felawes gate felde put romayns flyght retorned came felauship suche wyse man worship loste sauf syr gawayn sore hurte thenne kynge dyd ransake woundes comforted hym thus begynnynge fyrst iourney brytons romayns ther slayne romayns moo ten thousand grete ioye myrthe made nyghte hoost kynge arthur morne sente alle prysoners parys vnder garde syre launcelot many knyghtes syr cador pcapitulum vij torne emperour rome whiche aspyed prysoners shold sente parys anone sente leye busshement certayne knyghtes prynces syxty thousand men rescowe knyghtes lordes prysoners morne launcelot syre cador chyuetayns gouernours conueyed prysoners sholde passe thurgh wode syr
