laucelot sente certayne knyghtes tespye yf ony woodes lette whanne said knyghtes cam wood anone aspyed sawe grete en busshement retorned told syr laucelot ther lay wayte thre score thousand romayns thenne syr launcelot suche knyghtes hadde men warre nombre x put araye met wyth foughte manly slewe dretenchid many romayns slewe many knyghtes admyrals party romayns sarasyns ther slayne kynge lylye thre grete lordes aladuke herawde heryngdale syr launcelot fought soo nobly man myght endure stroke hande came shewed prowesse myght slewe doune ryght euery syde romayns sarasyns fledde hym sheep fro wulf fro lyon putt alle abode alyue flyght longe fouyte tydynges came kynge arthur anone graythed hym came bataille sawe knyghtes vaynquysshed bataylle enbraced knyght knyyte armes said ye worthy welde honour worship neuer kynge sauf self noble knyghtes syre sayd cador none v failled prowesse manhode syre launcelot wonder telle also cosyns whiche dyd daye many noble feates werre also syre cador tolde knyghtes slayne syr beriel syr morys syr maurel two good knyghtes thenne kynge wepte dryed eyen keuerchyef sayd courage nere hand destroyed yow though ye retorned ageyne ye lost worship calle hit foly knyghtes abyde whan ouermatched nay sayd launcelot one shamed maye neuer recouerd pcapitul viij leue kynge arthur noble knyghtes whiche wonne felde brought theyre prysoners parys speke senatour whiche escaped fro bataille came lucius themperour sayd hym syre emperour aduyse withdrawe dost thow thow shalt wynne noo thynge march grete stroke oute al mesure day one arthur knyghtes worth batayll honderd fy sayd lucius thow spekest cowardly thy wordes greue alle losse day anone sende forth kynge whiche hyghte syr leomye grete armye badde hym hye hym fast fore wold folowe hastely kynge arthur warned pryuely sente peple sessoyne toke vp townes castels fro romayns thenne kyng commaunded syr cador take rereward take hym certayne knyghtes round table syre launcelot syre bors syr kay syre marrok syre marhaus shalle awayte persone thus kynge arthur disperplyd hoost dyuerse partyes thende enemyes shold escape whanne emperour entryd vale sessoyne myghte see kynge arthur enbatailled baner dysplayed bysette round aboute enemyes nedes must fyghte yelde hym myght flee sayd openly vnto romayns syrs admoneste day ye fyghte acquyte yow men remembre rome domyneth chyef hede ouer alle erthe vnyuersal world suffre breton thys day abyde ageynste v ther dyd commaunde hys tropettes blowe blody sownes suche wyse ground trembled dyndled thenne bataile approuched shoue showted bothe sydes grete stroke smyten bothe sydes many men ouerthrowen hurte slayn grete valyaunces prowess appertyces werre day shewed whiche ouer long recounte noble feates euery man shold conteyne hole volume especyal kynge arthur rode bataille exhortynge knyghtes doo wel hym self dyd nobly handes possyble man doo drewe oute excalibur swerd awayted euer romayns thyckest moost greued peple anone adressyd hym parte hewe slewe doune ryyt rescued peple slewe grete gyaunt named galapas whiche man huge quantyte heyghte shorted hym smote bothe legges knee sayenge arte thow better syse dele thou smote hede syre gawayn foughte nobly slewe thre admyrales bataill dyd alle knyghtes round table thus bataill bitwene kynge arthur lucius themperour endured longe lucius syde many sarasyns whiche slayn thus bataille grete oftsydes one party fordele anone afterdele whiche endured longe tyl last kyng arthur aspyed lucius themperour fought dyd wonder owne handes anon rode hym eyther smote fyersly atte last lucyus smote arthur thwart vysage gaf hym large wound whanne kyng arthur felte hym self hurte anon smote hym ageyne excalibur clefte hede fro somette hede stynted tyl cam breste thenne themperour fylle doune dede ended lyf whan knowen themperour slayne anone alle romayns hoost put flyght kynge arthur alle knyghtes folowed chaas slewe doune ryght alle myghte atteyne thus vyctory gyuen kynge arthur tryumphe slayne party lucius moo honderd thousand kyng arthur dyd doo ransake dede bodyes dyd doo burye slayne retenue euery man accordynge state degree hurte lete surgyens doo serche hurtes woundes commaunded spare salues ne medecynes tyl hole thenne kyng rode strayte place themperour lucius lay dede hym fond slayne sowdan surrey kynge egypte ethyope whiche two noble kynges xvij kynges dyuerse regyons also syxty senatours rome al noble men whome kynge dyd bawme gomme many good gommes aromatyk dyd cere syxty fold cered clothe sendale leyd chestys leed cause shold chauffe ne sauoure vpon alle bodyes sheldes theire armes baners sette thende shold knowen countrey fonde thre senatours whiche lyue whome sayd saue lyues wylle ye take dede bodyes carye yow vnto grete rome presente potestate behalue shewynge hym letter telle persone shal hastely atte rome suppose romayns shalle beware shal demaunde ony trybute commaunde yow saye whan ye shal come rome potestate counceylle senate sende dede bodyes trybute haue demaunded yf content shal paye comynge trybute owe none ne none wylle paye thynketh suffyseth bretayne irlond al almayne germanye ferthermore charge yow saye commaunde vpon payne theyre hedes neuer demaunde trybute ne taxe ne londes thenne charge commaundement thre senatours afore sayd departed alle sayd dede bodyes leynge body lucius carre couerd tharmes empyre al alone alwey two bodyes kynges charyot thenne bodyes senatours soo wente toward rome shewed theyr legacyon message potestate senate recountyng bataylle done fraunce feld lost moche people innumerable slayne wherfore aduysed wyse meue warre ageynste noble conqueroure arthur myght prowesse doubted seen noble kynges grete multytude knyghtes round table whome none erthely prynce may compare pcapitulo nono torne vnto kynge arthur noble knyghtes whiche grete bataylle acheued ageynste romayns entryd lorayne braban flaundres sythen retorned hault almayn ouer mo tayns lombardye tuskane wherin cyte whiche wyse wold yelde self ne obeye wher fore kynge arthur biseged lay longe aboute hit gaf many assaultes cyte within deffended valyauntly thenne tyme kynge called syr florence knyght sayd hym lacked vytaylle ferre hen ben grete forestes woodes wherin ben many myn enemyes moche bestyayl wyl thou make redy goo thyder foreyeng take syr gawayn neuew syre wysshard syre clegys syre cleremond captayn cardef brynge yow alle beestes ye gete anone knyghtes made redy rode ouer holtys hyllys thurgh forestes woodes tyl cam fayr medow ful fayre floures grasse rested theyr horse alle nyghte spryngynge day next morne syre gawayn took hors stale away felauship seke aduentures anon ware man armed walkynge hors easyly wodes syde sheld laced sholdre syttynge stronge courser withoute ony man sauyng page berynge myghty spere knyght bare sheld thre gryffons gold sable charbuncle chyef syluer whan syre gawayn aspyed gay knyght fewtryd spere rode strayt hym demauded hym whens ansuerd sayd tuscane demaunded syre gawayn profryst thow proude knyghte boldly getest thou praye thou mayst proue wha thou wylt thou shalt prysoner thou departe pthenne sayd gawayn thou auauntest gretely spekest proude wordes couceylle alle thy boost thou make redy take thy gere fore gretter grame falle pcapitulum x thenne took theyr speres ranne eche alle myghte smote eche thurgh sheldes theyr sholders wherfore anone pulled oute swerdes smote grete stroke syre sprange oute helmes thenne syre gawayne al abasshed galatyn good swerd smote thurgh shelde thycke hauberke made thyck maylles al russhed brake precious stone made hym large wounde men myghte see bothe lyuer long thenne groned knyght adressyd hym syre gawayn awke stroke gaf hym grete wound kytte vayne whiche greued gawayn sore bledde sore pthenne knyghte sayd syre gawayn bynde thy wounde thy blee chaunge thou bybledest al thy hors thy fayre armes alle barbours bretayne shal conne staunche thy blood someuer hurte blade shalle neuer staunched bledynge thenne ansuerd gawayn hit greueth lytyl thy grete wordes shalle feare ne lasse courage thow shalt suffre tene sorow departe telle hast maye staunche bledynge may doo sayd knyght yf wylle wyll yf thou wylt socoure ayde maye crystned byleue god therof requyre thy manhode shalle grete meryte thy soule graunte said gawayne god helpe tacomplysshe alle thy desyre fyrst telle thou soughtest thus allone londe legeaunce thou arte syre sayd name pryamus grete prynce fader hath ben rebelle vnto rome ouer ryden many theyr londes fader lyneally descended alysaunder hector ryght lygne duke iosue machabeus oure lygnage ryght enherytour alysaunder auffryke alle oute yles yet wyl byleue thy lord thow byleuest thy laboure shalle yeue tresour ynough soo elate hauteyn hert thought man pere ne semblable sente werre seuen score knyghtes haue encountred whiche hast gyuen fyghtyng fylle wherfore syr knyghte pray telle thow arte knyght sayd gawayn haue ben brought vp garderobe noble kynge arthur many yeres take hede armour araye poynte paltockes longen hym self yole last made yoman gaf hors harneys honderd pound money yf fortune frend doubte wel auaunced holpen lyege lord sayd pryamus yf knauys kene fyers knyytes ben passynge good kynges loue heuen whether thou knaue knyghte telle thou thy name god sayd syre gawayn wyl saye sothe name syre gawayn knowen courte chambre one knyghtes round table dubbed duke owne hand therfore grutche yf grace fortuned hit goodnesse god lente strengthe letter pleasyd sayd pryamus thou haddest gyuen al prouynce parys ryche leuer haue ben torn wylde horse ony varlet wonne suche loo ony page pryker shold haue pry syre knyghte warne duke lorayne armye noblest men dolphyne lordes lombardye garneson godard sarasyns southland nombred lx good men armes wherfore yf hye v hen wylle harme v bothe ben sore hurte neuer lyke recouer take hede page horne blowe yf doo ther ben houynge fast c knyytes awaytynge persone yf take ther shall raunson gold ne syluer acquyte thenne syre gawayne rode ouer water saue hym knyghte folowed hym soo rode forthe tyl came felawes whiche medowe ben al nyghte anone syre wychard ware syre gawayn sawe hurte ranne hym soroufully wepynge demaunded hym soo hurte hym gawayn told foughten man eche hadde hurte salues hele telle yow tydynges soone shal haue adoo many enemyes thenne syre pryamus syre gawayn alyghted lete theire horse grase medowe vnarmed thenne blood ranne fresshly fro theyre woundes pryamus toke fro page vyolle ful four water came oute paradys certayne baume enoynted theyr woundes wesshe water within houre hole euer thenne trompet alle assembled counceylle pryamus told vnto lordes knyghtes sworne rescowe hym without faill shold assailed many thousandes wherfor counceilled withdrawe thenne syre gawayn sayd grete shame auoyde withoute ony stroke wherfore aduyse take oure armes make v redy mete sarasyns mysbyleuyng men wyth helpe god shal ouerthrowe haue fayre day syre florens shall abyde styll thys felde kepe stale noble knyghte shal forsake yonder felawes sayd pryamus seasse wordes warne yow ye shal fynde yonder woodes many peryllous knyghtes wylle put forthe beestes calle yow nombre ye past vij c whiche ben ouer fewe fyght soo many neuertheles sayd syr gawayn shal one encountre see beste shalle haue vyctory pcapitulo xj thenne syre florence callyd hym syre florydas honderd knyghtes droofe forth herde bestes thenne folowed hym vij honderd men armes syr feraunt spayne fayr stede came spryngynge oute woodes came syre florence axyd hym fledde thenne syre florence teok spere rode ageynste hym smote hym forhede brake necke bone thenne thother meued thought auenge dethe syr feraunt smote emonge grete fyghte many slayne leyd doune grounde syr florence c knyghtes alwey kepte stale foughte manly pthenne whan pryamus good knyght perceyued grede fyght wente syre gawayn badde hym shold goo socoure felauship whiche sore bystad enemyes syr greue yow sayd syre gawayn theyr gree shall shall one meue hors ward yf see mo ther ben ben stronge ynough matche sawe erle called syre ethelwold duk duchemen cam lepyng wood many thousades pryamus knyytes cam strayte vn bataylle thene sir gawayn comforted knyghtes bad abasshed al shal thene began wallope mette enemyes ther slayn ouerthrowen euery syde thenne threstyd amonge knyghtes table round smote doune erthe alle wythstode soo moche made recuyelle flee god sayd syre gawayn gladeth herte ben lasse nombre xx thenne entryd bataylle iubaunce geaunt fought slewe doune ryght distressyd many knyghtes emonge whome slayne syre gherard knyght walys thenne oure knyghtes toke herte slewe many sarasyns thenne came syr priamus penon rode knyghtes round table fought manfully many enemyes lost theyr lyues ther syr pryamus slewe marquys moyses land syre gawayn felawes quytte hem feld stoure syr chestelayne chyld ward syre gawayne slayne wherfore moche sorou made deth wes soone auengyd thus bataille ended many lordes lombardye sarasyns left dede feld pthenne syre florence syre gawayne herberowed surely theyr peple token grete plente bestyal gold syluer grete tresour rychesse retorned vnto kyng arthur whiche lay styl syege whanne came kynge presented theyr prysoners recounted theyre aduentures vaynquysshed theyre enemyes pcapitulum xij thanked god sayd noble kynge arthur maner man standeth hym self hym semed prysoner syre sayd gawayne good man armes hath matched yolden vnto god bycome crysten haue shold neuer haue rotorned wherfore pray yow may baptysed sor ther lyueth nobler man ne better knyght handes thenne kyng lete hym anon crystned dyd doo calle hym fyrste name pryamus made hym duke knyghte table round pand thenne anon kynge lete crye assaulte cyte rerynge laddres brekyng wally dyche fylled men lytel payne myyt entre cyte thene cam duchesse clarysyn countesse many ladyes damoysels knelyng bifore kynge arthur requyred hym loue god receyue cyte take assaulte thenne shold many gyltles slayne thene kyng aualyd vyser meke noble coutenauce said madame ther shal none subgettys mysdoo ne maydens ne none yow longen duke shal abyde iugement thenne anone kyng commaunded leue assault anon duke oldest sone brought keyes knelyng delyuerd kyng bysouyt hym grace kyng seased toun assent lordes toke duc sent hym douer abyde prysoner terme lyf assigned certayn rente dower duchesse child thenne made lordes rule tho londes lawes lord ought owne countrey took iourney toward rome sent sir flory syr florydas fore v c men armes cam cyte vrbyne leid busshement semed best rode fore toune anon yssued moche peple scarmusshed fore rydars thene brake busshement wan brydge toun set vpon wallis kynges baner thene cam kynge vpon hille sawe cyte baner wally whiche knewe cyte wonne anone sente commaunded none lyege men shold defoule ne lygge lady wyf ne maide whan cam cyte passid castel comforted sorou ordeyned ther captayn knyyt coutrey whan melane herd thylk cyte wone sent kyng arthur grete somes money besouyt hym lord haue pyte promysyng subgettys euer yelde hym homage fealte lades plesauce pauye petersaynt port tremble gyue hym yerly melyon gold al lyf tyme thene rydeth tuskane wynneth tounes castels wasted al way hym wil obeye spolute viterbe fro then rode vale vycecoute emong vynes fro then sente senatours wete whether wold knowe hym theyr lord soone sater day came vnto kynge arthur alle senatours left lyue noblest cardynals ne dwellyd rome prayd hym pee profered hym ful large byfought hym gouernour gyue lycence vj wekes assemble alle romayns thenne crowne hym emperour creme bylongeth hyhe astate assente sayd kynge lyke ye haue deuysed crystemas crowned holde round table knyghtes lyketh thenne senatours maade redy intronysacyon day appoynted romaunce telleth came rome crouned emperour pope hand ryalte coude made sudgerned tyme establysshed londes rome fraunce gaf londes royammes vnto seruauntes knyghtes eueryche desert suche wyse none complayned ryche ne poure gafe syre pryamus duchye lorayne thanked hym sayd wold serue hym dayes lyf made duke erles made euery man ryche thenne alle knyghtes lordes assembled afore hym sayd blessyd god warre fynysshed conquest acheued soo moche knowe none soo grete ne myghty dar make warre ageynst yow wherfore byseche retorne homeward gyue v lycence goo home oure wyues fro whome haue ben longe reste v iourney fynysshed honour worship thenne sayd kyng ye saye trouthe tempte god wysedome therfore make redy retorne englond thenne trussyng harneis bagage grete caryage lycence gyuen retorned commaunded noo man payne dethe shold robbe ne take vytaylle ne thynge way shold paye therfore thus came ouer see londed sandwyche ageynste whome quene gweneuer wyf came mette hym nobly receyued alle comyns euery cyte burgh grete yeftes presented hym home comyng welcome hym p thus endeth fyfthe booke conqueste kynge arthur hadde ageynste lucius emperoure rome foloweth syxth book whiche syr launcelot du lake pcapitulum primum soone kyng arthur come fro rome englond thenne alle knyghtes table round resorted vnto kyng made many iustes turnementes knyytes whiche encreaced armes worship passed alle felawes prowesse noble dedes wel preued many especyal preued syre launcelot du lake al turnementys iustes dedes armes lyf deth passed al knyytes tyme neuer ouercome yf treson enchauntement syr launcelot encreaced soo merueyllously worship honour therfor fyrst knyyt frensshe book maketh mencyon kynge arthur came fro rome wherfore quene gweneuer hym grete fauour aboue al knyghtes certayne loued quene ageyne aboue al ladyes damoysels lyf dyd many dedes armes saued fyer thorou noble chyualry thus syre launcelot rested hym longe play game thenne thought hym self preue hym self straunge auentures thenne badde neuewe syre lyonel make hym redy two wylle seke aduentures mounted horse armed al ryghtes rode depe forest soo depe playne p thenne weder hote noone syre launcelot grete lust slepe thenne syr lyonel aspyed grete appyl tree stode hedge said broder yonder fayre shadowe maye reste v oure horse hit wel saide faire broder said syr launcelot vij yere slepy alyghted tayed horse vnto sondry tree syr launcelot layd hym doune vnder appyl tree helme layd vnder hede syre lyonel waked whyle slepte soo syre launcelot slepe passynge fast mene whyle came thre knyghtes rydynge faste fleynge euer myghte ryde folowed hem thre one knyghte whanne syr lyonel sawe hym hym thought sawe neuer soo grete knyghte soo wel farynge man neyther soo wel appara lled vnto al ryghtes soo within whyle strong knyyt ouertaken one knyghtes smote hym cold erth lay styll rode vnto second knyght smote hym soo man hors felle doune thenne streyghte thyrdde knyghte rode smote hym behynde hors spere length thenne alyghte doune arayned hors brydel bonde alle thre knyghtes fast raynes owne brydels whan syr lyonel sawe hym doo thus thought assay hym made hym redy stylly pryuely took hors thoughte awake syr launcelot whan mounted vpon hors ouertoke strong knyght bad hym torne smote syr lyonel hard hors man bare erthe alyght doun bound hym fast threwe hym ouerthwart owne hors soo serued hem al foure rode hem awey owne castel whan came garte vnarme bete hem thornys al naked put hem depe pryson many mo knyghtes made grete doloure pcapitulum secundum whan syre ector de mary wyst syre laucelot past court seke aduentures wroth hym self made hym redy seke syre laucelot ryden long grete forest mette man lyke foster fayre felaw said syre ector knowest thou thys countrey ony aduentures ben nyghe hand syr sayd foster countrey knowe wel within thys myle stronge manoir wel dyked manoir lyfte hand faire fourde horse drynke ouer fourde groweth fayr tree ronhangen many fayre sheldes welded somtyme good knyghtes atte hoole tree hangeth bacyn coper lat en stryke vpon bacyn thy spere thryes soone thou shalt newe tydynges ellys hast thou fayrest grace many yere euer knyght passed thorou forest gramercy sayd syre ector departed came tree sawe many fayre sheldes amonge sawe broders sheld syr lyonel many moo knewe felawes round table whiche greued herte promysed reuenge broder thenne none syr ector bete bacyn wood thenne gaf hors drynke fourde ther came knyghte behynd hym bad hym come oute water make hym redy syre ector anone torned hym shortly fewter cast spere smote knyghte grete buffet hors torned twyes aboute wel done said strong knyyt knyytly thou hast stryken therwith russhed hors syre ector cleyyte hym vnder ryght arme bare hym clene sadel rode hym awey owne halle threwe hym doune myddes floore name thys knyghte syre turquyne said vnto syre ector thou hast done day vnto ony knyghte dyd xij yeres wille graunte thy lyf thou wilt sworn prysoner thy lyf dayes nay said sir ector wylle neuer promyse myne auauntage repenteth sayd syre turquyne thenne garte vnarme hym bete hym thornys naked sythen putte hym doune depe dungeon knewe many felawes whan syre ector sawe syr lyonel thenne made grete sorowe allas broder sayd syr ector broder syre launcelot fayre broder lefte hym slepe whan hym yode vnder appel tree become hym telle yow allas said knyghtes syre launcelot helpe v may neuer delyuerd knowe noo knyght able matche oure mayster turquyn pcapitulum tercium leue knyghtes prysoners speke syre launcelott du lake lyeth vnder appyl tree slepynge euen aboute noone come hym foure quenes grete estate hete shold nyhe hem rode foure knyghtes aboute hem bare clothe grene sylke foure sperys betwixe sonne quenes rode foure whyte mule pthus rode herde grete hors grymly neye thenne ware slepynge knyghte laye alle armed vnder appyl tree anone quenes loked face knewe syre launcelot thenne byganne stryue knyghte euerychone sayd wold baue hym loue pwe shalle stryue sayd morgan fay kynge arthur syster shalle putte enchauntement vpon hym shalle awake syxe owres thenne wylle lede hym awey vnto castel whanne surely within hold shalle take enchauntement hym thenne lete hym chese whyche v wylle haue vnto peramour psoo thys enchauntement caste vpon syre launcelott thenne leyd hym vpon shelde bare hym soo horsback betwixt two knyghtes brought hym vnto castel charyot leyd hym chambyr cold att nyghte sente vnto hym fayre damoysel souper redy dyght enchauntement past whan came sale wed hym asked hym saye fayre damoysel said syre launcelot wote cam castel enchauntement syre sayd ye must make good chere yf ye suche knyyte sayd ye ben shalle telle morne pryme daye gramercy fayre damoysel sayd syre launcelot youre good wyl requyre yow soo departed laye alle nyght withoute comforte ony body p morne erly came foure quenes passyngly wel bysene alle byddyng hym good morne ageyne psyre knyghte foure quenes sayd thow must vnderstande thou arte prysoner knowe wel thou arte syre launcelot du laake kynge ban sone cause vnderstande worthynes thou arte noblest knyght lyuyng knowe wel ther la haue thy loue one quene gweneuer thow shalt lose euer therfore behoueth chese one v four quene morgan le fay quene land gorre quene northgalys quene eestland quene oute yles pnow chese one v whiche thou wylt haue thy peramour thou mayst chese ele thys pryson dye hard caaas sayd syre launcelot eyther muste dye el chese one yow yet leuer dye pryson worship haue one peramour maugre hede therfore ye ansuerd wylle none yow ye fals enchauntresses lady dame gwenener lyberte wolde preue hit truest lady vnto lord lyuyng wel sayd quenes ansuer ye wylle reffuse v ye lyf sayd syr lau celot reffused ye ben soo departed lefte hym alone made grete sorowe pcapitulum quartum ryght noone came damoysel vnto hym dyner asked hym chere truly fayre damoysel sayd syre launcelot lyf dayes neuer ylle sir sayd repentest ye wylle reulyd shal help distresse ye shal haue shame vylony soo ye hold promyse fayre damoysel wil graunte yow sore quenes sorceress aferd haue destroyed many good knyght syre sayd sothe renome bounte wold haue loue sir sayne name syre launcelot du laake floure knyghtes passynge wrothe yow ye haue reffused hem syre ye wold promyse helpe fader tewsdaye next comynge hath made turnement betwixe hym kynge northgalys last tewesdaye past fader lost felde thorugh thre knyghtes arthur courte ye wyll tewesday next comyng helpe fader morne pryme grace god shalle delyuer yow clene fayre mayden sayd syr launcelot telle faders name thenne shal gyue ansuer syre knyghte sayd fader kyng bagdemagus foule rebuked last turnement knowe fader wel said syre launcelot noble kyng good knyghte feythe body ye shalle haue body redy doo fader seruyse day syre sayd gra mercy morne awayte ye redy tymes shal e shal delyuer take armoure hors shelde spere within x myle abbey whyte monkes praye ye abyde thyder shal brynge fader vnto alle thys shal done saide syre launcelot true knyghte soo departed came morne erly found hym redy thenne brought hym oute twelue locke brouyt hym vnto armour whan clene armed brought hym vntyl owne hors lyghtely sadeled hym toke grete spere hand soo rode forth sayd fayre damoysel shal faile grace god soo rode grete forest day neuer coude fynde hyghe waye soo nyght felle hym thenne ware slade pauelione reed sendel feythe sayd syre launcelot pauelione wil bodge alle nyghte soo alyghte doune tayed hors pauelione vnarmed hym fond bedde layd hym theryn felle slepe sadly pcapitulum v thenne within houre came knyghte whome pauelione ought wende lema layne bedde soo laid hym doune besyde syr launcelot toke hym armes beganne kysse hym whanne syre launcelot felte rough berd kyssyng hym starte oute bedde lyghtely knyyt hym eyther hem gate swerdes theire handes oute pauelione dore wente knyghte pauelione syre launcelot folowed hym ther lytel slake syr launcelot wounded hym sore nyghe vnto deth thenne yelded hym vnto syre launcelot grau ted hym wold telle hym came bedde syre sayd knyght pauelione myn owne thys nyght assygned lady haue slepte lykely dye wounde repenteth sayd launcelot youre hurte adrad treson late begyled therfore come way pauelione take rest suppose shalle staunche blood soo wente bothe pauelione anone syre launcelot staunched blood al came knyghtes lady passynge fayre lady whanne aspyed lord belleus sore wounded cryed oute syre launcelot made grete dole oute mesure pee lady loue said belleus knyght goood man knyght aduenturous told cause wou ded whan yolde vnto hym lefte goodely hath staunched blood syre sayd lady requyre telle knyght ye youre name fayr lady sayd name syre launcelot du lake soo thought euer speche sayd lady haue sene yow ofte knowe better ye wene p ye wold promyse curtosy harmes ye haue done lord belleus whanne cometh vnto arthur courte cause hym made knyghte roud table passyng good man armes myghty lord landes many oute yles pfayre lady said syre launcelot lete hym come vnto courte next hyhe feest loke ye come hym shal doo power ye preue doughty handes ye shalle haue desyre pso thus within whyle thus talked nyghte passed daye shone thenne syre launcelot armed hym took hors taught hym abbaye thyder rode within space two owrys pcapitulum sextum soone syre launcelott came withyn abbeye yarde doughter kynge bagdemagus herd grete hors goo pauyment thenne aroos yede vnto wyndowe sawe syr launcelot anone made men fast take hors hym lete lede hym stabyl hym self ledde fayre chamber vnarmed hym lady sente hym longe goune anone came self thene made launcelot passyng good chere sayd knyyt world moost welcome thenne al haste sente fader bagdemagus within xij myle abbay afore euen came fayre felauship knyghtes wyth hym whanne kynge alyghte hors yode streyte vnto syr launcelots chamber fond hys doughter thenne kyng enbraced syr launcelot hys armes eyther made good chere anone syre launcelot made complaynt vnto kynge bytrayed broder syre lyonel departed hym nyst doughter delyuerd hym pryson therfor whyle lyue shal doo seruyse al kynred thenne sure youre helpe sayd kynge tewesday next comynge ye syr sayd syr launcelot shalle faylle yow soo haue promysed lady doughter syre knyghtes lord arthur kynge northgalys kyng sayd syre madore de laporte syr mordred syr gahalaytyne al fur fared knyghtes ageynst hem thre knyghtes myghte bere strengthe syre sayde syre launcelot say turnement shal within thre myle abbay ye shal sende vnto thre knyghtes suche ye trust loke thre knyghtes haue al whyte sheldes also paynture sheldes four come lytel wood myddes partyes shalle falle frounte oure enemyes greue hem may thus shal knowen knyght soo took rest nyght thys sonday soo kyng departed sente vnto syre launcelot thre knyghtes four whyte sheldes tewesday lodged hem lytyl leued wood besyde turnement shold scaffoldis hole lordes ladyes myghte beholde gyue pryse thenne came feld kyng northgalys eyght score helmes thenne thre knyghtes arthur stode self pthenne cam feld kyng bagdemagus four score helmys thenne fewtryd sperys cam gyders grete dasshe slayn knyghtes first recountre xij kyng bagdemagus parte syx kyng northgalys party kyng bagdemagus party ferre sette back pcapitulum septimum wyth came syr launcelot du lake threste spere thyckest prees smote doune one spere fyue knyghtes foure hem brake backes throng smote doune kynge northgalys brake thye falle alle thys doyng syre launcelot sawe thre knyghtes arthur yonder shrewde gest sayd syre madore de la port therfore haue one hym soo encountred syre launcelot bare hym doune hors man soo sholder wente oute lyth befalleth iuste sayd mordred syr mador hath asore falle syre launcelot ware hym gate grete spere hand mette hym syr mordred brake spere vpon hym syre launcelot gaf hym suche buffet arsson sadel brake soo flewe ouer hors taylle helme butte erthe foote nyhe neck broken lay longe swoune pthenne came syr gahalantyne grete spere launcelot ageyyst hym al theyre strength myyt dryue speres brast euen handes thenne flang swerdes gaf many grym stroke thenne syr launcelot wroth oute mesure thene smote syr galahantyne helme nose braste oute blood eerys mouthe bothe ther hede henge lowe therwith hors ranne awey hym felle doune erthe anone al syre launcelot gate greete spere hys hand euer grete spere brake bare doune erthe xvj knyghtes hors man man hors ther none hyt surely bare none armes day thenne gate another grete spere smote doune twelue knyghtes moost party hem neuer throfe thene knyytes kyng northgalys wold iuste nomore gr e gyuen kynge bagdemagus eyther party departed vnto owne place syr launcelot rode forth kynge bagdemagus vnto castel passynge good chere kyng doughter profred hym grete yeftes morne took leue told kynge wold goo seke broder syre lyonel wente hym whan slepte toke hors betaught hem alle god sayd vnto kynges doughter yf ye haue nede ony tyme seruyse praye lete haue knouleche shal faylle true knyght syr launcelot departed aduenture came forest take slepyng myddes hyhe way mette damoysel rydyng whyte palfroy eyther salewed fayre damoysel said syre launcelot knowe ye thi countray ony aduentures syre knyghte sayd damoysel aduentures nere hand thou durst preue hem shold preue aduentures said syre launcelot cause come hyder wel sayd thou semest wel good knyght yf thou dare mete good knyght shal brynge best knyght myghtyest euer thou fond thou wylt telle thy name knyght thou arte damoysel telle name take grete force truly name syre laucelot du lake syre thou bysemyst wel ben aduentures fallen duelleth knyght wylle ouermatched man knowe ye ouermatche hym name syre turquyne vnderstand hath pryson arthur courte good knyghtes thre score foure hath wonne owne handes whan ye haue done iourney ye shal promyse ye true knyght go helpe damoysels distressid dayly fals knyghte entente damoysel desyre wylle fulfylle soo ye wyl brynge vnto knyghte fayre knyght come waye soo broughte hym vnto fourde tre henge bacyn sir launcelot lete hors drynke sythen bete bacyn butte spere hard al myyt tyl bottom felle oute longe dyd soo sawe noo thynge thenne rode endlong gate manoyre nyghe half houre thenne ware grete knyyt dro e hors afore hym ouerthwarte hors lay armed knyght bounden euer came nere nere syre launcelot thouyt shold knowe hym thenne sir launcelot ware hit syre gaherys gawayns broder knyghte table round fayre damoysel sayd sir launcelot see yonder cometh knyght fast bounden felawe myne broder vnto syr gawayne att fyrst begynnyng promyse yow leue god rescowe knyght yf mayster sytte better sadel shal delyuer alle prysoners hath oute daunger sure hath two bretheren myne prysoners hym tyme eyther sene grypped theyr speres vnto fayre knyghte sayd syr launcelot put wounded knyghte hors lete hym reste whyle lete v two preue oure strengthes enformed thou doest hast done grete despyte shame vnto knyghtes round table therfor defende thow table round sayd turquyne defye alle thy felauship ouermoche sayd sayd syre launcelot pcapitulum viij thene put theyr speres restys cam gyders horse fast myght renne eyther smote myddes theyre sheldes bothe theyre horse backes braste vnder knyghtes bothe astonyed soone myghte auoyde theyre horse took theire sheldes afore drewe oute swerdes came gyder egerly eyther gaf many stronge stroke myght neyder sheldes harneis hold theyr stroke soo within whyle hadde bothe grymly woundes bledde passynge greuously thus ferd two houres mo trasyng rasyng eyther myght hytte ony bare place thenne last bretheles bothe stode lenyng theyre swerdes felawe sayd syr turquyne hold thy hand whyle telle shal aske say thenne turquyne sayd thou arte byggest man euer mette al beste brethed lyke knyyt hate aboue al knyghtes hit thou wyl lyghtly accorde thy loue wil delyuer al prysoners haue thre score foure soo thou wylt telle thy name thou wyl felawes gyders neuer fayle whyle lyue wel sayd sayd syr launcelot sythen hit soo may haue thy frendship knyght thou soo hatest aboue al feythfully sayd syr turquyne name syre launcelot du lake slewe broder syr caradus dolorous toure one best knyghtes lyue therfore hym excepte al knyghtes may one mete hym one v shal make ende make myn auowe sir launcelots sake haue slayne c good knyghtes many haue maymed al vtterly myght neuer helpe self many haue dyed pryson yet haue thre score foure al shal delyuerd thou wilt telle thy name thou syre launcelot pnow see wel sayd syre launcelot suche man myghte myght haue pea suche man myghte ther shold warre mortal betwyxte v syre knyghte thy request wyl thou wete knowe launcelot du lake kynge ban sone benwyck knyghte table round defye doe thy best sayd turquyne launcelot thou arte vnto moost welcome euer knyghte shalle neuer departe tyl one dede thenne hurtled gyders two wilde bulles rosshynge lasshyng sheldes swerdes somtyme felle bothe ouer theyr nose thus foughte stylle two houres neuer wolde haue reste syre turquyn gaf syre laucelot many woundes alle ground foughte al bespechled blood pcapitulum ix thenne last syr turquyn waxed faynte gaf somwhat bak bare shelde lowe werynesse aspyed syre launcelot lepte vpon hym fyersly gate hym bauowre helmet plucked hym doune knee anone racyd helme smote neck sondyr whanne syre laucelot done yode vnto damoysel sayd damoysel redy goo yow ye wylle haue haue hors fayre syre sayd taste wounded knyghtes hors sende hym manoyr commaunde hym delyuer alle prysoners soo syr launcelot wente vnto gaheryes praid hym agreued leue hym hors nay fayr lord said gaheryes wyll ye take hors atte owne commaundement ye haue bothe saued hors day saye ye best knyghte worlde ye haue slayne daye syghte myytest man best knyghte excepte yow euer sawe fore syre said gaheryes pray telle name syre name syr launcelot du lake ou te helpe ryghte kyng arthur sake especial lord sir gawayn sake owne dere broder whan ye come within yonder manoyr sure ye shal fynde ther many knyytes round table haue sene many sheldes knowe yonder tree k yes shelde sir braundeles sheld syr marhaus sheld syre galyndes shelde syre bryan de lystnoyse sheld syr alydukes sheld many mo auysed also two bretheren sheldes syre ector de mary syr lyonel wherfore pray yow grete al say bydde taste suche stuffe fynd ony wyfe bretheren goo vnto courte abyde tyl come feest pentecost cast tyme must ryde damoysel saue promyse soo departed gaheryse gaheryse yede manore ther fond yoman porter kepyng ther many keyes anone al syre gaheryse threwe porter vnto ground toke keyes hym hastely opened pryson dore lete oute prysoners euery man losed boundes whan sawe syre gaheryse alle thanked hym wend wounded soo sayd gaheryse hit launcelot slewe hym worshipfully owne handes sawe myn owne eyen greteth al wel prayeth haste courte vnto syr lyonel ector de mary prayeth yow abyde hym court shalle doo say bretheren wyll fynde hym may lyue shal sayd syr kay fynde hym come courte true knyghte thenne alle tho knyghtes sought hous armour thenne armed hem euery knyght fonde owne hors al thet euer longed vnto hym whan done ther softer foure horse lade fatte veneson anone syr kay sayd good mete v one meale many day good repast soo veneson rosted baken soden souper somme abode al nyghte syre lyonel ector de mary syre kay rode syre launcelot fynde hym yf myghte pcapitulum decimum torne vnto syre launcelot rode damoysel fayre hyghe waye syr sayd damoysel way haunteth knyght destressyd al ladyes gentylwymmen leest robbeth lyeth said sir launcelot theef knyght rauyssher wymmen doth shame vnto ordre knyghthode contrary vnto othe hit pyte lyueth fayr damoysel ye shal ryde afore self wylle kepe self couerte yf trouble yow distresse yow shalle rescowe lerne hym ruled knyghte soo mayde rode way soft ambelynge paas within whyle cam oute knyght horsbak oute woode page hym put damoysel hors thenne cryed came launcelot fast myghte tyl came knyght sayenge thou fals knyght traytour vnto knyghthode dyd lerne dystresse ladyes gentyl wymmen whanne knyghte sawe syre launcelot thus rebukynge hym ansuerd drewe swerd rode vnto syre launcelot syre laucelot threwe spere fro hym drewe oute swerd stroke hym suche buffet helmet clafe hede neck vnto throte hast thou thy payement long thou hast deserued trouthe sayd damoysel lyke syr turquyne watched destroye knyghtes soo dyde knyght attende destroye dystresse ladyes damoysels gentywymmen name syre perys de foreyst saueage damoysel sayde syre launcelot wylle ye ony seruyse nay syre sayd tyme almyghty ihesu preserue someuer ye ryde goo curteyst knyghte thou arte mekest vnto ladyes gentylwymmen lyueth one thyng syre knyghte thynketh ye lacke ye knyghte wyueles ye wyl loue mayden gentylwoman coude neuer say euer ye loued ony maner degree grete pyte hit noysed ye loue quene gueneuer hath ordeyned enchauntement ye shal neuer loue none ne none damoysel ne lady shall reioyse wherfor many land hyghe estate lowe make grete sorowe pfayre damoysel sayd syr launcelot maye warne peple speke pleaseth hem wedded man thynke hit thenne must couche leue armes turnementys batayls aduentures say take plesaunce peramours wylle refuse pryncypal drede god knyghtes ben auenturous lecherous shal happy ne fortunate vnto wereys outher shalle ouercome symplyer knyghte hem self outher el shal vnhap cursydnes slee better men ben hem self soo vseth peramours shalle vnhappy thyng vnhappy aboute hem soo syre launcelot departed thenne rode depe forest two dayes strayte lodgynge soo thyrdde day rode ouer longe brydge starte vpon hym sodenly passynge foule chorle smote hors nose torned aboute asked hym rode ouer brydge withoute lycence shold ryde way sayd syr launcelot may ryde besyde thou shalt chese sayd chorle lasshyd hym grete clubbe shod yron thenne syre laucelot drewe suerd put stroke abak clafe hede vnto pappys ende brydge fayre village al people men wymmen cryed syre launcelot sayd awers dede dydest thou neuer thy self thou hast slayn chyef porter oure castel syr laucelot lete say wold streyghte wente castel whanne cam castel alyghte tryed hors rynge walle sawe fayre grene courte thyder dressyd hym hym thought fayre place fyghte soo loked aboute sawe moche peple dores wyndowes sayd fayr knyghte thou arte vnhappy pcapitulum xj paragraph pcapitulum xij anone al cam vpon hym two grete gyaunts wel armed al sauf hedes two horryble clubbes theyr handes syre launcelot put sheld afore hym put stroke aweye one gyaunt swerd clafe hede sondre whan felaw sawe ran awey wood fere horryble stroke laucelot hym al myyt smote hym sholder clafe hym nauel thenne syre launcelot went halle came afore hym thre score ladyes damoysels kneled vnto hym thanked god hym delyueraunce syre sayd mooste party v haue ben seuen yere prysoners haue worched al maner sylke werkes oure mete al grete gentylwymmen borne blessyd tyme knyyte euer thou borne thou hast done moost worship euer dyd knyght world wyl bere recorde al pray telle v name maye telle frendes delyuerd v oute pryson fayre damoysel sayd name syre launcelot du lake syre sayde al wel mayst thou el saue self demed myghte neuer knyght haue better two gyaunts many fayre knyghtes haue assayed hit haue ended many tymes haue wysshed yow two gyaunts dredde neuer knyghte maye ye saye sayd syr launcelot vnto youre frendes hath delyuerd grete al yf come ony march shewe suche chere ye haue cause tresour castel gyue reward greuaunce lorde owner castel wold receyued ryght fayre syre saide name castel tyntygayl duke oughte somtyme wedded fair igrayn wedded vtherpendragon gate arthur wel saide sir launcelot vnderstande whome castel longeth soo departed bytaughte hem vnto god pand thenne mounted vpon hors rode many straunge wyld countreyes thorou many water valeyes euyl lodged laste fortune hym happend ageynst nyghte come fayr courtelage therin fond old gentylwoman lodged hym good wyl good chere hym hors whan tyme oost brought hym fayre garet ouer gate bedde syre launcelot vnarmed hym sette hys harneys hym wente bed anone felle slepe soone ther cam one horsback knocked gate grete haste whan syr launcelot herd arose vp loked oute wyndowe sawe mone lyghte thre knyghtes cam rydyng one man al thre lasshed hym one swerdes one knyyt tourned hem knyytly ageyne deffended hym truly saide syre launcelot yonder one knyyte shal helpe shame see thre knyytes one yf slayne partener deth ther took harneis went wyndowe shete doune four knyytes thenne syr launcelot sayd hyghe torne knyghtes vnto leue fyghtyng knyght thenne alle thre lefte syr kay torned vnto syr launcelot beganne grete bataylle alyghte al thre strake many grete stroke syr launcelot assaylled hym euery syde thenne syre kay dressid hym haue holpen syre launcelot nay syre sayd wylle none helpe therfor ye wylle haue helpe lete alone hem syre kay pleasyre knyghte suffred hym doo hys wylle soo stode syde thenne anon within vj stroke syre launcelot stryken hem erthe p thenne al thre cryed syre knyghte yelde v vnto man myght makeles said syr lau celot take youre yeldyng vnto ye wylle yelde vnto syr kay seneschal couenaunt wyl saue lyues el p fayre knyghte sayd lothe doo syr kay chaced hym hyder ouercome hym ye ben therfor yelde v vnto hym reson wel said laucelot auyse wel ye may chese whether ye wyll dye lyue ye yolden shal vnto syr kay pfayre knyght thenne sayd sauynge oure lyues wylle doo thou commaundys v thenne shal ye sayd syre launcelot whytsonday nexte comyng go vnto courte kynge arthur shal ye yelde vnto quene gueneuer put al thre grace mercy saye sir kay sente thyder prysoners syre said shalle done feythe oure bodyes ben lyuynge swore euery knyghte vpon swerd sir launcelot suffred hem soo departe thenne sir launcelot knocked yate pomel swerd came oost entred sir kay syre sayd hoost wende ye ben youre bedde sayd sire launcelot arose lepte oute atte wyndowe helpe old felawe myne whanne came nyghe lyghte sir kay knewe wel sir launcelot ther kneled doune thanked hym al kyndenesse holpen hym twyes deth syre sayd haue thynge done ought doo ye welcome shal ye repose yow take rest soo whan sir kay vnarmed asked mete soo mete fette hym ete strongly whan hadde souped went theyr beddes lodged gyders one bedde morne sir launcelot arose erly lefte syre kay slepynge sir launcelot toke sire kayes armour shelde armed hym wente stable toke hors toke leue oost soo departed thenne soone arose syr kay myssed sir launcelot thenne aspyed hie armoure hors seythe knowe wel wylle greue courte kynge arthur hym knyghtes wylle bolde deme wyll begyle cause armoure shelde sure shal ryde pee thenne soone departed sir kay thanked hoost pcapitulum xij torne vnto syre launcelot ryden long grete forest last came lowe countray ful fayre ryuers medowes fore hym sawe longe brydge thre pauelions stode ther sylke sendel dyuers hewe withoute pauelions henge thre whyte sheldes truncheon sperys grete longe sperys stode vpryght pauelions euery pauelions dore stode thre fresshe squyers soo syre launcelot passed spake worde whan paste thre knyghtes sayden hym hit proud kay weneth knyght soo good contrary oftyme preued feythe sayd one knyghtes name syre gaunter wylle ryde hym assaye hym alle pryde ye may beholde spede soo knyght syre gaunter armed hym henge shelde vpon sholder mounted vpon grete hors gate spere hand wallopt syre launcelot whanne came nyghe hym cryed abyde thou proude knyght syr kay thou shalt passe quyte soo syr launcelot torned hym eyther feutryd speres came gyders alle theyr myghtes syre gaunters spere brake syre launcelot smote hym doune hors man whan syr gaunter erthe bretheren sayd echone yonder knyght syre kay byggar dare laye heede sayd syre gylmere yonder knyghte hath slayne syr kay hath taken hors harneis whether soo sayd syr raynold thyrd broder lete v goo mounte vpon oure horse re owe oure broder sir gaunter vpon payne dethe alle shal haue werke ynouy matche knyght euer semeth persone syre launcelot syr trystram syr pelleas good knyght thenne anon toke theyr horse ouertook syr launcelot syre gylmere put forth spere ranne sir launcelot syre launcelot smote hym doune lay swoune syre knyght sayd syr raynold thou arte strong man suppose thou hast slayne two bretheren whiche rasyth herte sore ageynst yf myght worship wold haue doo yow nedes must take parte doo therfor knyghte sayd kepe thy self soo hurtled gyders alle theyr myghtes al sheuered bothe theyre speres thenne drewe swerdes lasshyd gyder egerly anone aroos syre gauter came vnto broder syre gylmere bad hym aryse helpe oure broder syr raynold yonder merueyllously matched yonder good knyght alle lepte theyr horse hurtled vnto syre launcelot p whanne sawe come smote sore stroke vnto syr raynold felle hors ground thenne stroke two bretheren two stroke strake doune erthe sir raynold beganne starte vp heede al blody came streyte vnto syre launcelot late sayd sir launcelot ferre whan thou maade knyght sir raynold also knowe thou arte good knyght lothe slee gramercy sayd syr raynold goodnes dare saye bretheren wyl lothe yelde v vnto yow knewe youre name wel knowe ye sire kay maye ye shal yelde yow vnto dame gweneuer loke ye whytsonday yelde vnto prysoners saye syre kay sente yow vnto thenne swore hit shold done passed forthe sire launcelot nd echone bretheren halpe wel myght pcapitulum xiij soo sir launcelot rode depe forest ther slade sawe four knyghtes houyng vnder oke arthur courte one sir sagramour le desyrus ector de mary sir gawayn sir vwayne anone four knyghtes aspyed sir launcelot wend armes hadde ben sir kay feythe sayd sir sagramour wylle preue sir kayes myghte gate spere hand came toward sir launcelot ther sir launcelot ware knewe hym wel feutryd spere ageynst hym smote syre sagramore sore hors man felle bothe erthe lo felaus sayd yonder ye may see buffet hath knyyt moche bygger euer syre kay shal ye see may doo hym soo syr ector gate spere hand wallopte toward syre laucelot syre launcelot smote hym thorou shelde sholder man hors went erthe euer spere held feythe sayd sir vwayne yonder strong knyghte sure hath slayne syr kay see grete strengthe wyll hard matche hym al syre vwayne gate spere hand rode toward syre launcelot syr launcelot knewe hym wel soo mette hym playne gafe hym suche buffette astonyed longe wyst see wel sayd syre gawayne must encoutre knyyt thenne dressid sheld gate good spere hand syre launcelot knewe hym wel thenne lete renne theyr horse theyr myghtes eyther knyght smote myddes shelde syre gawayns spere brast syre launcelot charged sore vpon hym hors reuersed vp doune moche sorowe syre gawayn auoyde hors syre launcelot passed paas smyled said god gyue hym ioye spere made came neuer better hand thenne four knyghtes wente echone comforted eche saye ye gest sayd syre gawayne one spere hath feld v al foure commaunde hym vnto deuyl sayd al man grete myght ye may wel saye sayd syre gawayne man myght dare lay hede syre launcelot knowe rydyng lete hym goo sayd syre gawayn whan come courte shal wete thenne moche sorowe gete theyr horse ageyne pcapitulum xiiij leue speke syr launcelot rode grete whyle depe forest saw black brachet sekyng maner ben feaute hurt dere ther rode brachet sawe lye ground large feaute blood thenne syre launcelot rode euer brachet loked behynd soo wente thorou grete mareyse euer syre launcelot folowed thenne ware old manoyr thyder ranne brachet soo ouer brydge soo syre launcelot rode ouer brydge old feble whan cam myddes grete halle ther sawe lye dede knyght semely man brachet lycked woundes al came oute lady wepyng wryngyng handes thenne sayd knyghte moche sorowe hast thou broughte saye ye soo sayd syr launcelot dyd neuer knyghte harme hyther feaute blood brachet broughte therfor fayre lady displeased ful sore agreued greuaunce truly syre sayd trowe hit ye hath slayne husband dyd dede sore wounded neuer lyckly recouer shal ensure hym husbandes name sayd syre laucelot syr sayd name called syre gylbert bastard one best knyghtes world hath slayne hym knowe name god sende better comforte sayd syre launcelot soo departed wente forest ageyne met damoysel whiche knewe hym wel sayd loude wel ye fond lord requyre thy knyghthode helpe brother sore wounded neuer stynteth bledyng day fought syre gylbert bastard slewe hym playn bataylle broder sore wounded lady sorceresse duelleth castel besyde day told broders woundes shold neuer hole tyl coude fynde knyght wold goo chappel peryllous ther shold fynde swerd blody clothe wounded knyght lapped pyece clothe swerd shold hele broders woundes woundes serched swerde clothe merueyllous thynge sayd syre launcelot broders name syre sayd name syre melyot de logurs repenteth said syre launcelott felawe table round helpe wylle doo power thenne syre sayd folowe euen hyhe waye wyl brynge vnto chappel peryllous shalle abyde tyl god send ageyne spede knowe knyyte lyuynge may encheue aduenture pcapitulum xv ryyght soo syr launcelot departed whan cam vnto chappel peryllous alyghte doune teyed hors vnto lytyl gate soone chirche yard sawe frount chappel many fayre ryche sheldes torned vp doune many sheldes syre launcelot sene knyghtes bere byfore hand wyth sawe hym stande xxx greete knyghtes yarde ony man euer sene tho greued gnasted syre launcelot whan sawe theyr countenaunce dred hym sore soo putte shelde afore hym toke swerd redy hand redy vnto bataylle al armed black harneis redy sheldes swerdes drawen whan syr launcelot wold haue gone thorou oute scateryd euery syde hym gaf hym way ther waxed al bold entred chappel thenne sawe lyght dymme lamp brennynge thenne ware corp hylled clothe sylke thenne syre launcelot stouped doune cutte pyece awey clothe thenne ferd vnder hym erthe quaked lytel al feryd thenne sawe fayre swerd lye dede knyghte gate hand hyed hym oute chapel anone euer chappel yarde alle knyghtes spak hym grymly wy sayd knyghte syr launcelot leye swerd ellys thou shalt dye whether lyue dye sayd syr launcelot noo grete word gete ye hit ageyne therfor fyghte ye lyst thenne ryght soo passed thorou yonde chappel yarde ther mette hym fayre damoysel sayd syr launcelot leue swerd behynde thou wil dye leue sayd syr launcelot treaty sayd thou dydest loue swerd quene gweneuer shold thou neuer see thenne foole wold leue swerd sayd launcelot gentyl knyghte sayde damoysel requyre kysse one nay sayd syr launcelot god forbede wel syr sayd thou haddest kyssed thy lyf dayes ben done allas said haue loste al labour ordeyned chappel thy sake syre gawayne one syr gawayne within tyme foughte knyghte lyeth dede yonder chappel syre gylbert bastard tyme smote lyfte hand sir gylbert bastard syre launcelot telle haue loued seuen yere may woman haue thy loue quene gweneuer syth n maye reioyce haue thy body lyue kepte ioye world haue thy body dede thenne wold haue baumed hit serued hit soo haue kepte lyfe dayes dayly shold haue clypped kyssed despyte quene gweneuer ye saye wel sayd syr launcelot ihesu preserue subtyle craftes ther al took hors soo departed book sayth whan syr launcelo departed took suche sorou dyed within fourten nyghte name hellawes sorceresse lady castel nygramous anone syre launcelot mette damoysel syre melyotis syster whan sawe hym clapped handes wepte ioye thenne rode vnto castel lay syr melyot anone syre launcelot sawe hym knewe hym passynge pale erthe bledyng whan syre melyot sawe syre launcelot kneled vpon knee cryed hyghe lord syr launcelot helpe anone syre launcelot lepte vnto hym touched woundes syr gylbertes swerde thenne wyped woundes part blody clothe sir gylbert wrapped anon holer man lyf neuer thenne ther grete ioye bytwene hem made syr launcelot chere myghte soo morne syre launcelot toke leue hadde syre melyot hye hym courte lord arthur draweth nyhe feest pentecoste grace god ye shal fynde therwith departed pcapitulum xvj soo syre launcelot rode thorou many straunge countreyes ouer mary valeyes tyl fortune came fayre castel paste beyonde castel hym thought herde two belly rynge thenne ware faucon came fleynge ouer hede toward hyghe elme longe lunys aboute foot flewe vnto elme take perche lunys ouer cast aboute bough whanne wold haue taken flyghte henge legges fast syre launcelot sawe henge byheld fayre faucon perygot sory meane whyle came lady oute castel cryed hyghe launcelot launcelot thou arte floure alle knyghtes helpe gete hauke hauke lost lord wyl destroye kepte hauke slypped yf lord husband wete hit soo hasty wyll slee lordes name sayd sir launcelot sir said name sire phelot knyghte longeth vnto kynge northgalys wel fayre lady syn ye knowe name requyre knygthode helpe yow wylle doo may gete hauke yet god knoweth ylle clymber tree passynge hyghe fewe bowes helpe alle ther sir launcelot alyyte teyed hors tree prayd lady vnarme hym soo whan vnarmed put alle clothes vnto sherte breche myghte force clamme vp faucon teyed lunys grete rotten boyshe threwe hauke doune alle anone lady gate hauke hand al came oute syre phelot oute greuys sodenly husband al armed naked swerd hand sayd knyghte launcelot haue fond wold stode bole tree slee hym lady sayd syre launcelot haue ye bytrayed hath done sayd syre phelot commaunded therfor ther ny none boote thyne houre come thou muste dye shame vnto sayd syr launcelot thou armed knyghte slee naked man treason thou getest none grace sayd syre phelot therfor helpe thy self thou canst truly sayde syre launcelot shal thy shame syn thou wylt doo none take myn harneys hange swerde vpon bough maye gete hit thenne doo thy best slee thou canst nay nay said sir phelot knowe better thou wenest therfor thow getest wepen may kepe ther fro allas said sir launcelot euer knyghte shold dye wepenles ther wayted aboue hym vnder hym ouer hede sawe rownsepyk bygge bough leueles ther brake body thenne came lower awayted owne hors stode sodenly lepte ferther syde hors froward knyghte thenne sir phelot lasshed hym egerly wenynge haue slayne hym syr launcelot putte aweye stroke rounsepyk ther smote hym one syde hede felle doune swoune ground soo thenne syre launcelot took swerd oute hand stroke neck fro body thenne cryed lady allas hast thou slayne husband causer sayd syre launcelot falshede ye wold haue slayne treson fallen bothe thenne souned though wold dye ther al syre launcelot gate al armour wel myght put hit vpon hym drede resorte dredde knyytes castel soo nygh soo soone myght took hors departed thanked god escaped aduenture pcapitulum xvij soo syre launcelot rode many wylde wayes thorou mareys many wylde wayes rode valey sawe knyght chacynge lady naked swerd haue slayn fortune knyyte shold haue slayne thys lady cryed syr launcelot prayd hym rescowe whan syre launcelot sawe meschyef took hors rode bytwene sayeng knyytely shame wolt thou slee lady thou dost shame vnto alle knyghtes haste thou doo betwyx wyf sayd knyght wylle slee maugre thy hede shalle ye sayd syr launcelot rather two wylle haue adoo gyders syre launcelot sayd knyght thow doest thy part lady hath bytrayed hit sayd lady truly sayth wronge cause loue cherysshe cosyn germayne ialous betwixe hym shalle ansuer god three neuer synne betwyxe v sir sayd lady thou arte called worshipfullest knyghte world requyre true knyythode kepe saue som euer ye saye wyl slee withoute mercy haue ye doubte sayd launcelot shal lye power syr sayd knyghte syghte wyl ruled ye wylle haue soo sir launcelot rode one syde ryden whyle knyghte badde sir launcelot torne hym loke behynde hym sayde syre yonder come men armes v rydynge soo sir launcelot torned hym thoughte treason wyth knyghte lady one syde sodenly swapped ladyes hede whan syr launcelot hadde aspyed hym done sayd called hym traytour thou hast shamed euer sodenly sir launcelot alyyte hors pulled oute h swerd slee hym al felle flat erthe gryped sir launcelot thyes cryed mercy fy sayd sir launcelot thow shameful knyght thou mayst haue mercy therfor aryse fyghte nay sayde knyghte wyl neuer aryse tyl ye graunte mercy wyl profer fayr said launcelot wyl vnarme vnto sherte wylle haue nothyng vpon sherte swerd hand yf thou canst slee quyte thou euer nay sir said pedyuere wille neuer wel said sir launcelott take lady hede bere vpon shalt thou swere vpon swerd bere alweyes vpon thy back neuer reste tyl thou come quene gueneuer syre sayd wylle doo feithe body said launcelot telle name sir name pedyuere shameful houre thou borne said launcelot soo pedyuere departed dede lady hede fond quene kynge arthur wynchestre told alle trouthe syre knyyt said quene horryble dede shameful grete rebuke vnto sire launcelott withstondynge worship knowen many dyuerse countreyes shalle gyue penaunce make ye good skyfte ye ye shal bere lady horsbak vnto pope rome hym receyue penaunce foule dedes ye shalle neuer reste one nyghte ye doo another ye goo ony bedde dede body shal lye othe made soo departed telleth frensshe book whan cam rome pope badde hym goo ageyne vnto quene gueneuer rome lady beryed pope commaundement sir pedyuere felle grete goodnesse holy man heremyte pcapitulum xviij torne vnto sir launcelot du lake came home two dayes afore feest pentecost kyng alle courte passynge fayne comynge whanne sire gawayne sir vwayne sire sagramore sir ector de mary sawe sire launcelot kayes armour thenne wist wel smote hem doune al one spere thenne laughyng smylyng amonge euer came alle knyghtes home sir turquyn hadde prysoners alle honoured worshipped syre launcelot p whanne sire gaheryes herd speke said sawe alle bataille begynnyng endynge told kyng arthur alle syre turquyn strongest knyghte euer sawe excepte syre launcelot many knyghtes bare hym record nyghe thre score thenne sire kay told kynge syr launcelot rescowed hym whan shold haue ben slayne made knyghtes yelde hem hym al thre bare record ihesu said syr kay cause syr launcelot took harneis lefte rode good pee man wold haue adoo panone alle ther came thre knyghtes fought syre launcelot longe brydge yelded hem vnto syr kay sir kay forsoke hem said foughte neuer hem shall ease herte said sir kay yonder syr launcelot ouercam whan wyst glad thenne syr melyot de logrys came home told kynge syr launcelot saued hym fro dethe dedes knowen foure quenes sorceress hym pryson delyuerd kynge bagdemagus doughter also told alle grete dedes armes syr launcelot dyd betwixe two kynges saye kynge north galys kynge bagdemagus alle trouthe syr gahalantyne dyd telle syre mador de la porte syre mordred turnement pthenne cam lady knewe syr launcelot whan wounded syr bellyus pauelione atte request syr lau celot syr bellyus made knyghte round table soo tyme sir launcelot grettest name ony knyghte world honoured hyhe lowe pexplicit noble tale syr launcelot du lake whiche vj book phere foloweth tale syr gareth orkeney called beaumayns syr kay seuenth book pcapitulum primum whan arthur held round table moost plenour fortuned commaunded hyhe feest pentecost shold holden cyte castel whiche tho dayes called kynke kenadonne vpon sondes marched nyghe walys psoo euer kyng hadde custom feest pentecost especyal afore feestes yere wold goo daye mete vntyl herd sene grete merueylle custome alle maner straunge aduentures came arthur feest alle feestes soo sire gawayne lytyl fore none daye pentecost aspyed att wyndowe thre men vpon horsbak dwarf foote soo thre men alighte dwarf kepte horse one thre men hyher tweyne foote half thenne sir gawayne wente vnto kynge sayd sire go mete hande comen straunge aduentures arthur wente vnto mete many kynges knyghtes round table tho prysoners slayn recountre thenne hyhe feest euermore shold fulfilled hole nombre c fyfty thenne round table fully complisshed ryght soo cam halle two men wel bisene rychely vpon sholders lened goodlyest yong man fairest euer al sawe large long brode sholders wel vysaged fayrest largest handed euer man sawe ferd though myght goo bere hym self yf lened vpon sholders anon arthur sawe hym made pee rome ryght yede hym vnto hyghe deyse sayeng ony wordes thenne moche yong man pulled hym bak easily stretched vp streyghte sayeng kynge arthur god blisse al fair felauship especial felauship table rounde thys cause come hyder praye requyre gyue thre yeftes shalle vnresonably asked ye may worshipfully honorably graunte hem grete hurte losse fyrst done gyfte wil aske two yeftes wylle aske daye twelue moneth someuer ye hold hyghe feest aske sayd arthur ye shalle haue askyng pnow syre petycyon thys feest ye wylle gyue mete drynke suffycyauntly twelue moneth day wylle aske myn two yeftes pmy fayr sone sayd arthur aske better counceille symple askynge herte geueth gretely thou arte come men worshyp gretely consayte fayleth thou shalt preue man ryghte grete worship syre sayd ther may haue asked wylle aske wel sayd kynge ye shal haue mete drynke ynouy neuer deffended yt none nother frende ne foo thy name wold wete telle sayd merueylle sayd kynge thou knowest thy name thou arte goodlyest yong man one euer sawe thenne kyng betook hym sir kay steward charged hym shold gyue hym al maner mete drynkes best also hadde al maner fyndynge though lordes sone shal lytel nede sayd syr kay doo suche cost vpon hym dare vndertake vylayne borne neuer make man come gentylmen wold haue axed hors armour suche asketh sythen hath name shall yeue hym name shal beaumayns fayre handes kechen shalle brynge hym shal haue fatte broweys euery day yt shall fatte twelue monethes ende porke hog ryght soo two men departed belefte hym syr kay scorned hym mocked hym pca ij sir gawayn wroth especyal sir launcelot bad sir kay leue mockyng dare laye hede shall preue man grete worship lete said sir kay may reason hath asked beware said syre launcelot ye gafe good knyyt brewnor syre dynadamys broder name ye called hym la cote male tayle tourned anger afterward sayd syr kay shall neuer preue none suche syr brewnor desyred euer worship thys desyreth breed drynke brothe vpon payne lyf fostred vp abbay someuer fayled mete drynke soo hyther come sustenaunce pand soo syre kay badde gete hym place sytte doune mete soo beaumayns wente halle dore sette hym doune amonge boyes laddys ete sadly thenne syre launcelot mete badde hym come chamber shold haue mete drynke ynough soo dyd syre gawayne reffused hem al wold doo none syr kay commaunded hym profer touchynge syre gawayn hadde reson profer hym lodgyng mete drynke profer came blood nere kynne hym wyst syre launcelot dyd grete gentylnes curtosye psoo thus putte kechyn laye nyghtly boyes kechen dyd soo endured alle twelue moneth neuer displeasyd man chylde alweyes meke mylde euer whanne sawe ony iustynge knyghtes wold see myght euer syre launcelot wold gyue hym gold spende clothes soo dyd syre gawayne ony maystryes done atte wold myghte none cast barre stone hym two yerdys thenne wold syre kay saye lyketh yow boye kechyn soo past tyl feest whytsontyde tyme kynge helde hit att carlyon moost royallest wyse myghte lyke dyd yerly kynge wold mete ete vpon whyysonday vntyl herd aduentures thenne cam ther squyer kyng said syre ye maye goo mete cometh damoysel somme straunge aduentures thenne kynge gladde sette hym doune pryghte soo ther came damoysel halle salewed kynge prayd hym socour whome sayd kynge aduenture psyre sayd haue lady grete worship renomme byseged tyraunte may oute castel cause callyd noblest knyghtes world come praye socour heteth lady dwelleth name hath byseged syre kyng saide ladyes name shall ye knowe tyme lete wete lady grete worship grete landes tyraunt bysyegeth destroyeth landes called rede knyght reed laundes knowe hym sayd kynge syre said syre gawayne knowe hym wel one perilloust knyghtes world men saye hath seuen mennys strengthe hym escaped one ful hard lyf fayre damoysel sayd kynge ben knyytes wolde doo power rescowe lady cause ye wylle telle name dwelleth therfor none knyghtes shal goo yow wylle thenne must speke sayd damoysel pcapitulum iij wyth wordes came kynge beaumayns whyle damoysel ther thus said syr kyng god thanke haue ben xij monethe kechyn haue hadde ful sustenauce aske two yeftes ben behynde aske vpon peryl said kynge syre shal two gyftes fyrst ye wil graunte haue aduenture damoysel hit belongeth vnto thou shalt haue hit sayd kyng graunte thenne syr yeft ye shal bydde launcelot du lake make knyyt hym wil made knyght el none whanne paste praye yow lete hym ryde make knyght whan requyre hym al shal done sayd kynge fy sayde damoysel shalle haue none one kechyn page thenne wrothe toke hors departed cam one beaumayns told hym hors armour come hym dwarf come thyng hym neded rychest maner ther al court moche merueill fro whens cam al ye gere soo whanne armed none fewe soo goodely man ryght soo came halle took leue kyng arthur sir gawayn syr launcelot prayed wolde hyhe hym soo departed rode damoysel pcapitulum iiij bvt wente many behold wel horsed trapped clothe gold neyther shelde spere thenne syr kay sayd al open halle wylle ryde boye kechyn wete whether wylle knowe better said syr launcelot sir gawayn yet abyde home syr kay made hym redy took hors spere rode hym ryghte beumayns ouertook damoysel ryghte soo cam syre kay sayd beumayns syre knowe ye thenne torned hors knewe hit sir kay done hym alle despyte ye haue herde afore ye sayd beumayns knowe yow vngentyl knyghte courte therfore beware syre kay putte spere reyste ranne streyghte vpon hym beaumayns cam fast vpon hym swerd hand soo putte awey spere swerd foyne thrested hym thorou syde syr kay felle doune ben dede alyght doune took sir kayes shelde spere starte vpon owne hors rode waye al sawe syr launcelot soo dyd damoysel thenne badde dwarf starte vpon sir kayes hors soo dyd syre launcelot come thenne profered sir laucelot iuste eyther made hem redy came gyder soo fyersly eyther bare doune erthe sore brysed thenne sir launcelot arose halpe hym fro hors thenne beaumayns threwe sheld hym profered fyghte sir launcelot foote soo rasshed gyders lyke borys tracynge rasynge foynynge mountenaunce houre syre launcelot felte hym soo bygge merueylled strengthe fought lyker gyaunt knyght fyghtynge urable passynge perillous syr launcelot moche adoo hym dred hym self shamed sayd beumayns fyghte sore youre quarel myn soo grete may leue truly trouthe sayd beumayns doth good fele myght yet lord shewed vtteraunce pcapitulum quintum goddes name sayd syr launcelot promyse feythe body moche doo myght saue self fro vnshamed therfore haue ye doubte none erthely knyghte hope ye maye ony whyle stand proued knyght sayd beaumayns ye sayd launcelot doo ye haue done shal waraunt thenne praye sayd beaumayns yeue ordre knyghthode thenne must ye telle name seyd launcelot kynne ye borne syr soo ye wylle discouer shal sayd beaumayns nay sayd syre lau celot promyse yow feithe body vn tyl hit openly knowen thenne syr sayd name gareth broder vnto syr gawayn fader moder syr said launcelot gladder euer thouyte ye shold grete blood ye cam courte neyther mete ne drynke thenne sire launcelot gaf hym thordre knyythode thenne sire gareth prayd hym departe lete hym goo soo syre launcelot departed hym came syre kay maade hym born home vpon shelde helyd hard lyf al men scorned syr kay especyal sir gawayne syre launcelot sayd parte rebuke yonge man ful lytel knewe byrth comen cause came courte soo leue syr kay torne vnto beaumayns whanne ouertaken damoysel anone sayd dost thow thou stynkest al kechyn thy clothes ben bawdy greece talowe thou gaynest kyng arthur kechyn wonest thou sayd alowe yonder knyyt thou kyllest nay truly thou slowest hym vnhappely cowardly therfor torne ageyn bawdy kechyn page knowe wel syre kay named beaumayns arte thou luske torner broches ladyl wessher damoysel sayd beaumayns saye ye wylle wylle goo someuer ye say haue vndertake kynge arthur acheue aduenture shal fynysshe ende eyther shal dye therfore fy kechyn knaue wolt thou fynysshe myn aduenture thou shalt anone met al thou woldest alle brothe euer thou soupest one loke hym face shal assaye sayd beaumayns soo thus rode woode ther came man fleynge al euer myghte whether wolt thou sayd beaumayns lord said helpe slade syxe theues haue taken lord bounde hym soo aferd lest wyl slee hym brynge thyder said beaumayns soo rode gyders vntyl came knyghte bounden thenne rode vnto hem strake one vnto dethe thenne another thyrd stroke slewe thyrdde theef thenne thre fledde rode hem ouertook hem thenne tho thre theues tourned ageyne assayled beaumayns hard last slewe retorned vnbounde knyghte knyght thanked hym prayd hym ryde hym castel lytel besyde shold worshipfully rewarde hym good dedes syr sayd beaumayns wille reward haue day made knyghte noble syr launcelot therfor wylle reward haue god rewarde also must folowe damoysel whan came nyghe bad hym ryde fro thou smellyst al kechyn wenest thou haue ioye al dede thou hast done ny myshappen thou shalt see syghte shal make torne ageyne lyghtly thenne knyght whiche rescowed theues rode damoysel prayed lodge hym alle nyghte cause nere nyght damoysel rode hym castel grete chere souper knyght sat syr beumayns afore damoisel fy fy said syr knyghte ye vncurtoys sette kechyn page afore hym bysemeth better stycke swyne sytte afore damoysel hyhe parage thenne knyght ashamed atte wordes took hym vp sette hym asyde bord sette hym self afore hym soo al nyght good chere mery reste pcapitulum sextum morn damoisel took leue thanked knyght soo departed rode way vntyl came grete forest grete ryuer one passage ther redy two knyghtes ferther syde lette passage saist thou sayd damoysel wylt thou matche yonder knyghtes torne ageyne nay sayd syr beaumayns wyl torne ageyn syxe mo ther al rasshyd water myddes water eyther brake speres vpon handes thenne drewe swerdes smote egerly last syr beaumayns smote vpon helme hede stonyed alle felle doune water drowned thene sporyd hors vpon londe knyghte felle vpon hym brake spere soo drewe theyr swerdes foughte longe gyders laste syre beaumayns clafe helme heede doune sholders soo rode vnto damoysel bad ryde forth way allas sayd euer kechen page shold haue fortune destroye suche two douyty knyghtes thou wenest thou hast done doughtely soo fyrste knyghte hors stumbled drouned water neuer thy force thy myght last knyghte myshap thou camyst behynde hym myshappely thou slewe hym damoysel sayd beaumayns ye maye saye ye wyl someuer haue doo al truste god serue hym departe therfor recke ye say soo may wynne youre lady fy fy foule kechen knaue thou shalt foe knyghtes shal abate thy boost fayre damoysel gyue goodly langage thenne care past knyghtes someuer care ne doubte hem also sayd saye thyne auayle yet mayst thou torne ageyne thy worship thou folowe thou arte slayne see alle euer thou dost mysauenture prowesse thy handes wel damoysel ye may say ye wylle someuer ye goo wylle folowe soo beaumayns rode lady tyl euensong tyme euer chyde hym wold reste cam black launde black hauthorne theron henge blak baner syde henge black shelde hit stode black spere grete longe grete black hors couerd sylke black stone fast pcapitulum septimum ther sat knyghte al armed black harneis name ye knyyt blak laude thene ye damoysel whanne sawe knyghte badde hym flee doun valey hors sadeled gramercy sayd beaumayns alweyes ye wold haue coward black knyghte whanne came nyghe hym spak sayd damoysel haue ye broughte knyghte kynge arthur champyon nay fayr knyghte sayd kechyn knane fedde kynge arthur kechyn almesse cometh sayd knyghte suche aray hit shame bereth company syr delyuerd hym sayd rydeth maugre myn hede god wold ye shold put hym outher slee hym ye may vnhappy knaue vnhappely hath done day thorou myshappe sawe hym slee two knyghtes passage water dedes dyde besorne ryght merueyllous thorou vnhappynes merueylled sayd black knyghte ony man worshyp wylle haue adoo hym knowe hym sayd damoysel cause rydeth wene man worship borne may sayd blak knyghte ye say man worshyp ful lykely persone ful lyke stronge man thus moche shal graunte sayd black knyghte shal putte hym doune vpon one foote hors hys harueys shal leue shame doo hym ony harme whanne syre beaumayns herd hym saye thus sayd syre knyghte thou art ful large hors harneys lete wete coste noughte whether hit lyketh launde wylle passe maulgre thyn hede hors ne harneys getest thou none yf thou wynne hem thy handes therfor lete see thou canst doo sayst thou sayd black knyghte yelde thy lady fro besemeth neuer kechyn page ryde suche lady thou lyest sayd beaumayns gentyl man borne hyghe lygnage thou wyl preue thy body thenne grete wrathe departed theyr horse came gyders hit ben thonder black knyghtes spere brake beaumayns threste hym thorou bothe sydes spere brak truncheon lefte stylle syde neuertheles black knyght drewe suerd smote many eger stroke grete myghte hurte beaumayns ful sore laste black knyghte within houre half felle doune hors swonne dyed thenne beaumayns sawe hym soo wel horsed armed thenne alyghte doune armed hym armour soo took hors rode damoysel whanne sawe hym come nyghe sayd awey kechyn knaue oute wynde smelle thy baudy clothes greueth allas sayd euer suche knaue shold myshap slee soo good knyghte thou hast done alle thys thyn vnhappynes one shal paye alle thy payement therfore yet counceylle flee may happen sayd beaumayns beten slayne warne fayre damoysel wyll flee awey leue company al ye say euer ye say wil kylle bete someuer hit happeneth escape lye groud therfore good hold styll thus al day rebukynge aweye wille tyl see vttermest iourneye el wylle slayne outher truly beten therfore ryde waye folowe wille someuer happen pcapitulum octauum thus rode gyders sawe knyght come dryuend al grene bothe hors harneis whanne came nyghe damoysel asked broder black knyyte ye haue brought yow nay nay sayd vnhappy kechen knaue hath slayne broder thorou vnhappynesse allas sayd grene knyghte grete pyte soo noble knyghte shold soo vnhappely slayne namely knaues hand ye say traytour sayd grene knyghte thou shalt dye sleynge broder ful noble knyghte name syr pereard defye said beaumayns lete wete slewe hym knyghtely shamefully al grene knyghte rode vnto horne grene hit enge vpon thorne blewe thre dedely motys came two damoysels armed hym lyghtely thenne took grete hors grene shelde grene spere thenne ranne gyders al myghtes brake speres vnto handes thenne drewe swerdes gaf many sadde stroke either wounded ful yll last ouerthwart beaumayns hors strake grene knyghtes hors vpon syde felle erthe thenne grene knyghte auoyded hors lightly dressid hym vpon foote sawe beaumayns al alighte rasshed gyders lyke two myghty kempys longe whyle sore bledde bothe cam damoysel said lord grene knyghte shame stande ye soo longe fyghtyng kechyn knaue allas shame euer ye made knyghte see suche ladde matche suche knyghte wede ouer grewe corne grene knyght ashamed al gaf grete stroke myghte clafe shelde thorou whan beaumayns sawe shelde clo ien sonder lytel ashamed stroke langage thenne gaf hym suche buffet vpon helme felle knee soo sodenly beaumayns pulled hym vpon ground grouelynge thenne grene knyghte cryed hym mercy yelded hym vnto syre beaumayns prayd hym slee hym al vayn said beaumayns thou shalt dye yf damoysel came praye saue thy lyf ther al vnlaced helme lyke wold slee hym fy vpon false kechen page wyll neuer pray saue lyf neuer soo moche thy daunger thenne shalle deye sayde beaumayns soo hardy thou bawdy knaue sayd damoysel thou slee hym allas sayd grene knyghte suffre dye fayre word may saue fayr knyyt said grene knyghte saue lyf wyl foryeue dethe broder euer become thy man xxx knyghtes hold euer shal doo seruyse deuyls name sayd damoysel suche bawdy kechen knaue shold haue thyrtty knyghtes seruyse syr knyght said beaumayns alle auaylleth yf damoysel speke thy lyf therwith al made semblaunt slee hym lete sayd damoysel thou baudy knaue slee hym thou thou shalt repente damoysel said beaumayns charge pleasyr commaundement lyf shal saued el thenne said sir knyghte grene armes releace quyte damoysels request wylle make wrothe wille fulfylle al chargeth thenne grene knyghte kneled doune dyd hym homage swerd thenne said damoisel repenteth grene knyghte dommage youre broders dethe black knyghte helpe grete myster drede sore passe forest nay drede sayd grene knyghte ye shal lodge nyghte morne shalle helpe thorou forest soo tooke theyre horse rode manoyr whiche fast besyde pcapitulum ix euer rebuked beaumayns wold suffre hym sytte table grene knyghte took hym sat hym syde table merueylle thynketh said grene knyght damoysel ye rebuke noble knyghte ye warne damoysel full noble knyght knowe knyght abel matche hym therfor ye doo grete wrong rebuke hym shall yow ryght good seruyse someuer maketh hym self ye shalle preue ende come noble blood kynges lygnage fy fy said damoisel shame saye hym suche worship truly said grene knyyt shame sey hym ony disworship hath preued hym self better knyght yet haue mett many knyghtes dayes neuer tyme haue fond knyght matche nyghte yede vnto rest al nyght grene knyght commaunded thyrtty knyghtes pryuely watche beaumayns kepe hym al treason soo morne al arose herd masse brake theyr fast thenne tooke horse rode theire waye grene knyghte conueyed hem thorou forest grene knyghte said lord beaumayns thyrtty knyghtes shall alweye somons erly late callyng whether euer ye wille sende v wel said sayd beaumayns whanne calle vpon ye must yelde vnto kynge arthur knyghtes yf ye commaunde v shal ben redy tymes said grene knyght fy fy vpon deuyls name saide damoysel ony good knyghtes shold obedyent vnto kechyn knaue soo thenne departed grene knyghte damoysel thenne said vnto beaumayns folowest thou thou kechyn boye caste away thy shelde thy spere flee aweye yet counceille tymes thou shalt say ryght soone allas thou wyyte euer wade laucelot trystram good knyghte syr lamaryk thou shalt passe paas called paas perillous damoysel said beaumayns aferd lete hym flee shame torne ageyne sythen haue ryden soo longe yow wel said damoysel ye shal sone whether ye wyll pcapitulum x soo within whyle sawe toure whyte ony snowe wel matchecold al aboute doubel dyked ouer toure gate henge fyfty sheldes dyuerse colour vnder toure fayr medow therin many knyghtes squyers behold scaffoldes pauelions vpon morn shold grete turnement lord toure castel loked wyndowe sawe damoysel dwarf knyyt armed al poyntes god helpe said lord ye knyyt wyll iuste see kniyt arraut soo armed hym horsed hym hastely whanne horsbak shelde spere al rede bothe hors harneis alle hym longeth whanne came nyghe hym wende hadde ben broder black knyghte thenne cryed loude broder doo ye march nay nay sayd damoysel kechyn knaue brought vp almesse kynge arthur courte neuertheles sayd reed knyghte wylle speke hym departe sayd damoysel knaue hath kylled thy broder syre kay named hym beaumayns hors harneis thy broders black knyghte also sawe thy broder grene
