knyghte ouercome handes maye ye reuenged vpon hym may neuer quyte hym pwith eyther knyghtes departed sondre cam gyder alle myght eyther horse fell erthe auoyded horse put sheldes afore drewe swerdes either gaf sadde stroke rasyng tracyng foynynge hurlynge lyke two bore space two houres thenne cryed hyhe rede knyghte allas thou noble reed knyghte thynke worship hath folowed lete neuer kechyn knaue endure soo longe doth thenne reed knyght waxed wrothe doubled stroke hurte beaumayns wonderly sore blood ranne doune ground wonder see stronge bataille yet last syre beaumayns strake hym erthe wold haue slayne reed knyghte cryed mercy sayeng noble knyghte slee shall yelde fyfty knyghtes commaundement forgyue al despyte thou hast done dethe broder black knyghte auailleth said beaumayns yf damoysel praye saue thy lyf therwith maade semblaunt stryke hede lete thou beaumayns slee hym noble knyghte soo hardy vpon thyne hede thou saue hym thenne beaumayns badde reed knyghte stand vp thanke damoysel thy lyf p thenne reed knyght praid hym see castel al nyghte soo damoysel thenne graunted hym mery chere alweyes damoysel spak many foule wordes vnto beaumayns wherof reed knyght grete merueylle alle nyghte reed knyghte maade thre score knyghtes watche beaumayns shold haue shame vylony vpon morne herd masse dyned reed knyghte came beaumayns thre score knyghtes profered hym homage feaute al tymes knyghtes doo hym seruyse thanke said beaumayns ye shalle graunte whanne calle vpon come afore lord kynge arthur yelde vnto hym knyghtes syr said reed knyghte wille redy felauship somons syr beaumayns departed damoysel ouer rode chydynge hym fowlest manere pcapitulum xj damoysel said beaumayns ye vncurteis rebuke ye doo semeth haue done good seruyse euer ye threate shal betyn knyghtes mete euer al boost lye dust myre therfor pray rebuke whan ye see beten yolden recreaut thenne may ye bydde goo shamefully fyrste lete wete wylle departe werse foole wold departe whyle wynne worship wel said ryght soone ther shall mete knyght shal paye alle thy wage man worship world excepte kyng arthur wel said beaumayns worship shalle worship haue adoo hym thenne anone ware afore cyte ryche fayre betwixe cyte myle half fayre medowe semed newe mowen therin many pauelions fayre beholde lo said damoysel yonder lord oweth yonder cyte custome whan weder fayr lye medowe iuste torneye euer ben aboute hym fyue honderd knyghtes gentilmen armes ben alle maner game ony gentylman deuyse goodly lord saide beaumayns wold fayne see thou shalt see hym tyme ynough saide damoysel soo rode nere aspyed pauelione loo sayd seest thou yonder pauelione al coloure inde al maner thynge aboute men wymmen horse trapped sheldes speres colour inde name sir persant inde moost lordlyest knyghte euer thou lokest hit may wel said beaumayns neuer stoute knyghte felde shalle abyde tyl see hym vnder shelde foole said thou better flee tymes sayd beaumayns suche knyghte ye make hym wylle sette vpon alle men v c knyghtes ther come one one shall hym fayle whylest lyf lasteth fy fy said damoysel euer suche stynkynge knaue shold blowe suche boost damoysel said ye ar blame soo rebuke leuer fyue batails rebuked lete hym come thenne lete hym doo werst syre said merueylle thou arte kyn thou arte come boldly thou spekest boldly thou hast done haue sene therfore praye saue thy self thou mayst thy hors thou haue grete traueylle drede dwelle ouer longe sege hit hen seuen myle alle perillous passage ar past saue al passage drede sore lest ye shalle ketche hurte therfore wold ye hen ye brysed hurte stronge knyghte lete wete syr persant ynde thyng myyte strength vnto knyghte leid syege aboute lady said syre beaumayns may sythen come soo nyghe knyght wille preue myghte departe hym el shalle shamed withdrawe hym therfore damoysel haue ye doubte grace god shall dele knyghte within two houres none shalle delyuer hym thenne shal come syege day lyghte ihesu merueille haue said damoysel maner man ye hit may neuer ben otherwyse ye comen noble blood soo foule ne shamefully dyd neuer woman rule knyghte haue done euer curtoisly ye haue suffred cam neuer gentyl blood pdamoysel sayd beaumayns knyght may lytel may suffre damoisel someuer ye said vnto took none hede wordes ye sayd ye angryd wrathe wrekyd vpon doo al therfor alle myssayenge ye myssayed fordered bataill caused thynke shewe preue self ende perauentur thouy mete kyng arthur kechyn yet myyt haue mete ynouy place alle dyd preue assaye frendes shalle knowen another day whether gentylman borne none lete wete fayre damoysel haue done gentilmans seruyfe parauentur better seruyse yet wille departe allas said fayr beaumayns forgyue alle haue myssaid done ageynst wyth alle herte said forgyue yow ye dyde thyng ye shold doo al euyl wordes pleasyd damoysel saide beaumayns syn hit lyketh saye thus fayre vnto wete ye wel gladeth herte gretely semeth ther knyght lyuynge able ynough hym pcapitulum duodecimum wyth sir persant ynde aspyed houed felde knyytly sente whether came werre pee say thy lord said beaumayns take force whether hym lyst hym self soo messager went ageyne vnto fyr persaunt told hym alle ansuer wel thenne haue adoo hym vtteraunce soo purueyed hym rode ageynst hym beaumayns sawe hym made hym redy ther mette euer theyr horse myght renne braste speres eyther thre pyeces horse rassed gyders bothe horse felle dede erthe lyytly auoyded horse put sheldes afore drewe swerdes gaf many grete stroke somtyme hurtled gyder felle grouelyng ground thus fought two houres sheldes theyr hauberkes al ewen many stedys wounded last syr beaumayns smote hym thorou cost body thenne retrayed hym knyghtly mayntened batail long tyme last though hym lothe beaumayns smote sir persant aboue vpon helme felle grouelyng erthe thenne lepte vpon hym ouerthwart vnlaced helme haue slayne hym thenne syr persant yelded hym asked hym mercy cam ye damoisel praid saue lyf wil wel pyte noble knyyt shold dye gramercy sayd persaunt gentyl knyyt damoysel certeynly wote wel ye slewe broder black knyghte black thorne ful noble knyyte name syr perard also sure ye wanne myn brother grene knyght name syre pertolepe also ye wanne broder reed knyght syr perrymones syn ye haue wonne shal please ye shal haue homage feaute c knyghtes alweyes commaundement go ryde ye wil commaunde v wente vnto sir persauntes pauelione dranke wyne ete spyeces afterward sire persaunte made hym reste vpon bedde vntyl souper tyme souper bedde ageyne whan beaumayns abedde syr persaunt lady faire douyter xviij yere age called vnto hym charged commaunded vpon blessynge go vnto knyghtes bedde lye doun syde make hym straunge chere good chere take hym thyne armes kysse hym loke done charge ye wil haue loue good wil syr persants doughter dyd fader bad soo wente vnto syr beaumayns bed pryuely dispoylled leid doune hym thenne awoke sawe asked syre said sir persants douyter commaundement fader come hyder ye mayde wyf said sir said clene maiden god defende sayd shold defoyle doo syre persaunt suche shame therfore fayre damoysel aryse oute bedde el wille syre said cam myn owne wille commaunded allas said syr beaumayns shameful knyghte wolde fader ony disworship kyst soo departed came vnto syr persant fader told hym alle spedde truly saide syre persaunt someuer comen noble blood soo leue hem tyl morne pcapitulum xiij soo morne damoy el sir beaumayns herd masse brake fast soo took leue fair damoysel said persant whether ward ar ye way ledyng knyghte syr said knyghte goyng sege besyegeth syster castel dangerus sayd persaunt knyghte reed launde whiche moost peryllous knyghte knowe lyuyng man withouten mercy men sayen hath seuen men strength god saue said beaumayns ye knyghte doth grete wrong lady grete pyte one fairest ladyes world semeth damoysel suster name lynet said ye sir said lady systers name dame lyonesse shal telle said syr persaunt thys rd knyghte reed laund hath layne long syege wel nyghe two yeres many tymes myghte haue wold prolongeth tyme thys entent haue sir laucelot du lake doo bataill hym sir trystram syr lamerak de galys syre gawayne taryenge soo longe syege lord syre persaunt ynde saide damoysel lynet requyre ye wille make gentilman knyghte euer fyghte reed knyghte herte said syr persaunt please hym take ordre knyghthode symple man sire said beaumayns thanke good wil better sped certaynly noble knyght sir launcelot made knyght said sir persant renomed knyghte myghte ye made knyghte alle knyghtes maye called chyef knyghthode world saith betwix thre knyghtes departed clerly knygthode laucelot du lake syr trystram de lyones sir lamerak de galis bere renommee ben many knyghtes sir palamydes sarasyn sir sasere broder also sir bleoberys sire blamore de ganys broder also syr bors de ganys syr ector de mary sir percyuale de galis many mo ben noble kniytes ther none yt passe ye iij aboue said therfor god spede wel said syr persant ye may matche rede knyghte ye shalle called fourth world sir said beaumayns wold fayne good fame knyghthode lete wete cam good men dare say fader noble man soo ye wil kepe hit close damoysel wyl telle kyn wille discouer said tyl ye commaunde v feythe owe vnto god ptruly thenne saide name gareth orkeney kynge lot fader moder kynge arthur syster name dame morgawse sir gawayne broder sir agrauayne sir gaheryes yongest hem alle yet wote kyng arthur sir gawayn pcapitulum xiiij soo book saith lady biseged word systers comynge dwerf knyghte passed al perillous passage manere man said lady noble knyght truly madame said dwerf yong man lykely man euer ye sawe ony sayd damoysel kynne comen whome made knyghte madame said dwerf kynges sone orkeney name wille telle tyme wete ye wel syre launcelot maade knyght none wolde maade knyghte sire kay named hym beaumayns escaped said lady bretheren persaunt pmadame said noble knyghte shold fyrste slewe two bretheren att passage water saide good knyghtes murtherers one hyght gherard de breusse knyght hyght sir arnolde le brewse thenne madame recountred black knyght slewe hym playne batail toke hors armour fouyt grene knyght wanne hym playn bataill lyke wyse serued reed knyyt aftir wyse serued blewe knyyt wan hym playn batail thene said lady hath ouercome sir persaut inde one noblest knyytes world ye dwerf said hath wone al iiij brethere slayn blak knyght yet dyd tofore ouerthrewe sir kay lefte hym nyghe dede vpon ground also dyd grete batayll syre launcelot departed euen handes thenne syre launcelot made hym knyghte dwerf sayd lady gladde tydynges therfor go thou hermytage myn shalt thow bere wyn two flagans siluer ar two galons also two cast brede fatte veneson bake deynte foules cop gold delyuer ryche precyous bere myn hermytage put hermytes handes sythen go thow vnto syster grete wel commaude vnto gentyl knyghte praye hym ete drynke make hym stronge say ye hym thanke hym curtosye goodenes wold take vpon hym suche labour neuer dyd hym bounte curtosye palso pray hym good herte courage shalle mete ful noble knyghte neyther bounte curtosye gentylnes attendyth vnto nothynge murther cause prayse hym loue hym dwerf departed came syre persant fond damoysel lynet syr beaumayns tolde hem alle ye haue herd thenne took theyr leue syr persant took ambelyng hacney conueyed hem theyr wayes thenne belefte hem god soo within lytil whyle came heremytage dranke wyne ete veneson foules baken whan repasted hem wel dwerf retorned ageyn vessel vn castel ageyne mette hym reed knyght reed laundes asked hym whens came ben syr sayd dwerf haue ben ladyes syster castel hath ben kynge arthur courte broughte knyghte thenne accompte trauaille loste though broughte syre launcelot sir trystram syr lamerak syr gawayne wold thynke selfe good ynough may well said dwerf knyghte hath passed alle peryllous passage slayn klack knyghte two mo wonne grene knyght reed knyghte bl knyghte thenne one four haue afore reherced none tho said dwerf kynges sone name sayd reed knyght reed laund wille telle feyd dwerf sire kay vpon scorne named hym beaumayns care said knyght knyghte soo euer shal soone delyuer hym yf euer matche hym shalle haue shameful dethe many haue pyte sayd dwerf merueill ye make suche shameful warre vpon noble knyghtes pcapitulum xv leue knyghte dwerf speke beaumayns al nyyt lay hermytage vpon morne damoysel lynet herd theire masse brake fast thenne toke theyr horse rode thorou oute fair forest thenne came playne sawe many pauelions tentys fayr castel moche smoke grete noyse whanne came nere sege syr beaumayns aspyed vpon grete tree rode henge ful goodly armed knyghtes neck theire sheldes aboute theire neckys swerdes gylt spore vpon heles soo henge nyghe fourty knyghtes shamefully ful ryche armes thenne sir beaumayns abated countenaunce sayd meneth fayre syre said damoysel abate chere syghte ye must courage self el ye ben al shente knyghtes came hyder sege rescowe syster dame lyones whanne reede knyghte reed laund hadde ouercome hem putte shameful dethe withoute mercy pyte wyse wyll serue yf ye quyte better ihesu deffende said beaumayns suche vylaynous dethe shenship armes rather sholde faren wolde rather slayn manly playn bataille soo ye better said damoysel trust hym curtosye alle goth deth shameful murther pyte ful lykely man wel made body ful noble knyghte prowesse lorde grete laundes possession truly said beaumayns may wel good knyghte vseth shameful custom merueylle endureth longe none noble knyghtes lord arthur haue delt hym thenne rode dyke sawe double dyked ful warly wallis lodged many grete lordes nyghe wally grete noyse mynstralsy see betyd vpon one syde walles many shippes maryners noyse hale also fast sykamore tree ther henge horne grettest euer sawe olyfantes bone knyght reed laund hanged vp ther yf ther came ony arraunt knyghte muste blowe horne thenne wylle make hym redy come hym doo bataille syr pray said damoysel lynet blowe ye horne tyl hyghe none aboute pryme encreaced myghte men say hath seuen men strengthe fy shame fair damoisel say ye neuer soo good knyghte euer shalle neuer fayle hym moost myghte outher wille wynne worship worshipfully dye knyghtely felde ther spored hors streyghte sykamore tree blewe soo horne egerly alle sege castel range therof thenne lepte oute knyghtes oute tentys pauelions within castel loked ouer wallis oute att wyndowes thenne reed knyghte reed laudes armed hym hastely two baron sette spore vpon heles alle blood reed armour spere shelde erle bucled helme vpon hede thenne broughte hym rede pere rede stede soo rode lytyl vale vnder castel al castel sege myghte behold bataill pcapitulum xvj syre sayd damoysel lynet vnto syr beaumayns loke ye gladde lyght yonder dedely enemy yonder wyndowe lady syster dame lyones sayd beaumayns yonder said damoysel poynted fynger trouthe sayd beaumayns besemeth ferre fayrest lady euer loked vpon truly said aske better quarel bataylle truly shalle lady wylle fyghte euer loked vp wyndowe gladde countenaunce lady lyones made curtosy hym doune erthe holdynge vp bothe handes wyth reed knyghte reed laundes callid syr beaumayns leue syr knyghte thy lokynge behold cou ceille warne wel lady haue done many stronge batails yf thou haue done said beaumayns semeth waste labour loueth none thy felauship thou loue loueth grete foly vnderstode glad comynge wold auysed dyd bataille vnderstande syegyng castel may forbere thy felauship therfor wete thou wel thou rede knyghte reed laundes loue wille rescowe el dye saist thou said reed knyghte semeth thou oughte reson beware yonder knyghtes thow sawest hange vpon yonder tree fy shame said beaumayns euer thou sholdest saye euyl thou shamest thy self knyghthode thou mayst sure ther wylle lady loue knoweth thy wycked custommes thou wenest syghte hanged knyghtes shold fere nay truly shameful syght causeth haue courage hardynes ageynste wold haue ageynst thou wel ruled knyght make redy said reed knyghte reed lau de talke lenger thenne syre beaumayns badde damoysel goo hym thenne putte speres reystes came gyders alle myyt bothe eyther smote myddes sheldes paytrellys sursenglys crowpers b aste felle erthe bothe reynys brydels handes soo laye grete whyle sore stonyed al castel sege wende neckes ben broken thenne many straunger sayd straunge knyyt bygge man noble iuster sawe neuer noo knyghte matche reed knyghte reed laundes thus sayd bothe within castel withoute thenne lyghtly auoyded theyr horse put sheldes afore drewe swerdes ranne gyders lyke two fyers lyon eyther gafe suche buffet vpon helmes relyd bacward bothe two strydys thenne recouerd bothe hewe grete pyeces theire harneis theire sheldes grete parte felle feldes pcapitulum xvij thenne thus foughte tyl past none neuer wold stynte tyl att laste lacked wynde bothe thene stode wagyng scateryng pontyng blowynge bledynge al behelde moost party wepte pyte soo whan restyd whyle yede bataille ageyne tracyng racyng foynyng two bore tyme toke renne hit ben two rammys hurtled gyders somtyme felle grouelyng erthe somtyme amased eyther took others swerd stede owne thus endured tyl euensong tyme none beheld myghte knowe whether lyke wynne bataill armour fer hewen men myyt see naked sydes place naked euer naked place dyd defende rede knyghte wyly knyght werre wyly fyghtyng taughte syr beaumayns wyse aboughte hit fulle sore dyd aspye fyghtynge thus assente bothe graunted eyther rest sette hem doune vpon two molle hylles besydes fyghtynge place eyther hem vnlaced helme toke cold wynde either page fast come wh called vnlace harneis sette hem ageyn commaundement thenne whan syr beaumayns helme loked vp wyndowe sawe faire lady dame lyones made hym suche countenaunce herte waxed lyghte ioly ther bad reed knyghte reed laundes make hym redy lete v doo bataille vtteraunce wel said knyghte thenne laced vp helmes page auoyded stepte gyders foughte fresshely reed knyghte reed laundes awayted hym ouerthwart smote hym within hand swerd felle oute hand yet gaf hym another buffet vpon helme felle grouelynge erthe reed knyghte felle ouer hym holde hym doune thenne cryed maiden lynet hyghe syr beaumayns thy courage become allas lady syster beholdeth sobbeth wepeth maketh myn te heuy syr beaumayns herd saye soo abrayed vp grete myght gate hym vpon foot lyghtely lepte swerd gryped hit hand doubled hys paas vnto reed knyghte foughte newe bataille gyder sir beaumayns thenne doubled stroke smote soo thyck smote swerd oute hand thenne smote hym vpon helme felle erthe sir beaumayns felle vpon hym vnlaced helme haue slayne hym thenne yelded hym asked mercy said lowde vois noble knyghte yelde thy mercy thenne syr beaumayns bethoughte hym vpon knyghtes made hanged shame fully thenne said may worship saue thy lyf shameful dethes thou hast caused many ful good knyghtes dye syre saide reed knyghte reed laundes hold hand ye shalle knowe cause put hem shameful dethe saye said sir beaumayns syre loued one lady faire damoisel broder slayne said hit syr launcelot du lake el syr gawayn praide loued hertely wold make promyse feith knyghthode laboure dayly armes vnto mette wyth one alle myghte ouercome shold putte vnto vylaynous dethe cause haue putte alle knyghtes dethe soo ensured alle vylony vnto kynge arthur knyghtes shold toke vengeauce vpon alle knyghtes syr wille telle euery daye strengthe encreaceth tylle none al tyme haue seuen men strengthe pcapitulum xviij thenne came ther many erles baron noble knyghtes praid knyghte saue lyf take hym prysoner felle vpon knee prayd hym mercy wolde saue lyf syr sayd fairer hym take homage feaute lete hym holde landes slee hym deth ye shal haue none auauntage mysdedes ben done maye ben vndone therfor shal make amendys al partyes al wil become men doo homage feaute fayre lordes said beaumayns wete wel ful lothe slee knyyt neuertheles hath done passyng ylle shamefully soo moche al dyd ladyes request blame hym lesse sake wil releace hym shal haue lyf vpon couenaunt goo within castel yelde hym lady yf wil forgyue quyte hym wil wel make amendys al trespas hath done ageynst landes pand also whanne done ye goo vnto courte kyng arthur ye aske syr launcelot mercy syr gawayn euyl wil ye haue ageynst sire said reed knyght reed laundes al wil ye commaunde syker assuraunce borowes ye shal haue soo thenne whan assuraunce made made homage feaute alle tho erles baron wyth hym thenne mayden lynet came syre beaumayns vnarmed hym serched woundes stynted blood lyke wyse dyd rede knyghte reed laundes soiourned ten dayes tentes reed knyghte made lordes seruauntes doo alle pleasyre myghte vnto syre beaumayns soo within whyle reed knyghte reed laundes yede vnto castel putte hym grace soo receyued hym vpon suffysaunt seurte alle hurtes wel restored al coude complayne thenne departed vnto courte kynge arthur openly reed knyghte reed laundes putte hym mercy syre launcelot syr gawayne told openly ouercome whome also told alle batails begynnynge vnto endynge ihesu mercy sayd kynge arthur sire gawayne merueylle moche blood come noble knyghte haue ye merueille saide sire launcelot ye shal ryght wel wete comen ful noble blood myghte hardynes ther ben fewe lyuynge myghty noble prowesse semeth yow said kynge arthur ye knowe name fro whens come blood suppose doo said launcelot el wold haue yeuen hym thordre knyythode gaf suche charge tyme shold neuer discouer hym vntyl requyred el knowen openly pcapitulum xix torne vnto syr beaumayns desyred lynet myght see syster lady syre said wold fayne ye sawe thenne syr beaumayns alarmed hym toke hors spere rode streyyt vnto castel whanne cam gate fond many men armed pulled vp drawe brydge drewe porte cloose pthenne merueilled wold suffre hym entre thenne loked vp wyndow sawe fair lyones said hyghe go thy way syr beaumayns yet thou shalt haue holy loue vnto tyme thou callyd one nombre worthy knyghtes therfor goo laboure worship twelue monethe thenne thou shalt newe tydynges allas faire lady said beaumayns haue deserued ye shold shewe straungenes wend shold haue ryght good chere vnto power haue deserued thanke wel sure haue boughte loue parte best blood within body fayre curteis knyghte said dame lyones displeasyd ouer hasty wete wel grete trauaill good loue shal lost consydre grete trauail labour bounte goodenes oughte doo therfore goo wey loke ye good comforte shal worship best perde twelue moneth wille soone done trust fair knyghte shal true neuer te bitraye dethe shalle loue none ther alle torned wyndowe syr beaumayns rode awey ward castel makyng grete dole soo rode wyste ne rode tyl hit derke nyghte thenne happend hym come poure man hous herborowed nyghte syr braumayns hadde rest walowed wrythed loue lady castel soo vpon morowe took hors rode vn tyl vnderne thene came brode water grete lodge alyghte slepe leid hede vpon shelde bitoke hors dwarf commaunded hym watche al nyghte torne lady castel thoughte moche vpon beaumayns thenne called vnto syr gryngamore broder praid hym al maner loued hertely wold ryde syr beaumayns euer haue ye wayte vpon hym tyl ye may fynde hym slepynge sure heuynes wil alyyt doun place leye hym doune slepe therfor haue ye wayte vpon hym preuyest manere ye take dwerf go ye waye hym faste euer ye maye syr beaumayns awake syster lynet telleth telle kynreed come ryghte name meane whyle syster wille ryde vnto youre castel awayte whanne ye brynge dwerf thenne whan ye haue broughte hym vnto youre castel wylle haue hym examynacion self vnto tyme knowe ryghte name kynred come shalle neuer mery herte psyster said syre gryngamore alle thys shalle done entente soo rode alle daye nyghte tylle fond syre beaumayns lyenge water hede vpon shelde slepe p thenne whanne sawe syre beaumayns fast slepe cam stylly stalkyng behynde dwerf plucked hym fast vnder arme soo rode aweye hym faste euer myght vnto owne castel syre gryngamors armes alle black hym longeth euer rode dwerf toward castel cryed vnto lord prayd hym helpe awoke syre beaumayns vp lepte lyghtly sawe gryngamor rode waye dwerf soo syr gryngamor rode oute syghte pcapitulum xx thenne syre beaumayns putte helme anone buckeled shelde tooke hors rode hym alle euer myghte ryde thorou mary feldes grete dale many tymes hors plonged ouer hede depe myres knewe wey took gaynest waye woodenes many tymes lyke perysshe laste hym happend come fayre grene waye mette poure man countreye salewed asked hym whether mette knyghte vpon black hors black harneis lytel dwerf syttynge behynde hym heuy chere syre saide poure man came syre gryngamor knyght suche dwerf mornyng ye saye therfore rede folowe hym one perylloust knyghtes world castel nyhe hand two myle therfor aduyse ryde syr gryngamor yf ye owe hym good wille soo leue syre beaumayns rydynge toward castel speke sir gryngamor dwerf anone dwerf come castel dame lyones dame lynet syster asked dwerf maister borne lygnage come yf thou telle said dame lyones thou shalt neuer escape castel euer prysoner said dwerf fere gretely telle name kynne come wete ye wel kynges sone moder syster kyng arthur broder good knyghte syre gawayne name syre gareth orkeney haue told ryght name praye fayre lady lete goo lord ageyne wille neuer oute countrey vn yl haue ageyne yf angry wil doo moche harme stynte worche wrake countray thretyng sayd syr gryngamore may wille goo dyner soo wasshed wente mete made hem mery wel ease cause lady lyones castel made grete ioye ptruly madame sayd lynet vnto syster wel maye kynges sone hath many good tatches hym curteis mylde moost sufferynge man euer mette al dar saye ther neuer gentylwoman reulyd man soo foule manere haue rebuked hym tymes gafe goodely meke ansuers ageyne pand sate thus talkynge ther came sire gareth gate angry countenaunce swerd drawen hand cryed aloude alle castel myyt hit sayeng thou traitour syre gryngamor delyuer dwerf ageyn feith owe ordre knygthode shal doo al harme thenne syr gryngamor loked oute wyndow said syr gareth orkeney leue thy bostyng wordes thou getest thy dwerf ageyne thou coward knyghte sayd syr gareth brynge hym come doo bataylle wynne hym take hym wille said syr gryngamor lyst al thy grete wordes thou getest hym fayr broder said dame lyones wold dwerf ageyne wold wroth hath told al desyre kepe nomore dwerf also broder hath done moche delyuerd reed knyghte reed laundes therfor broder owe hym seruyse afore al knyghtes lyuynge wete ye wel loue hym al ful fayne wold speke hym wyse wold wist another straunge lady wel said syr gryngamor sythen knowe wille wylle obeye vnto hym ryght ther al wente doun vnto syr gareth said syr crye mercy al haue mysdone wille amend hit wille therfore pray ye wold alyghte take suche chere make castel shal haue dwerfe saide syre gareth ye syr alle pleasaunce make soone dwerf told ye blood ye ar come noble dedes ye haue done march thenne repentyd dedes thenne syre gareth alyghte ther came dwerf took hors felawe said syr gareth haue many aduentures thy sake soo syre gryngamor tooke hym hand ledde hym halle wyf pcapitulum xxij thenne came forth dame lyones arayed lyke pryncesse made hym passyng good chere ageyne goodely langage louely countenaunce gyder syre gareth thought many tymes ihesu wold lady castel perillous fayre al maner game playes dauncyng syngynge euer syre gareth bihelde lady loued brenned loue past hym self reason forth toward nyghte yede vnto souper syre gareth myghte ete loue soo hote wist alle lokes aspyed syr gryngamor thenne souper callid syster dame lyones vnto chamber sayd fair syster haue wel aspyed coutenauce betwixe knyght wil syster ye wete ful noble knyyt yf ye make hym abyde wil hym pleasyr yt ye better ye ar ye wel bywaryd vpon hym fayr breder said dame lyones vnderstande wel knyghte good come noble hous notwithstandyng wille assaye hym better moost beholdyng hym ony erthely hath grete labour loue passid many daungerous passage ryght soo syr gryngamor wente vnto syr gareth said syre make ye good chere ye shal haue none cause lady syster al tymes worship saued wete ye wel loueth wel ye doo better yf better may wist said syr gareth ther lyued gladder man wold vpon worship said syr gryngamor trust vnto promyse long lyketh ye shal soiourne lady shal v dayly nyghtly make yow alle chere wille wel said syre gareth haue promysed nyghe countrey twelue moneth wel sure kynge arthur noble knyghtes wille fynde within twelfe moneth shal soughte founden yf lyue p thenne noble knyghte syre gareth wente vnto dame lyones whiche thene moche loued kyst many tymes eyther made grete ioye promysed hym loue certaynly loue hym none dayes hyr lyf thenne lady dame lyones assente broder told syr gareth alle trouth lady dyd batail lady castel peryllous told hym caused broder take awey dwerf pcapitulum xxij cause knowe certaynte name kynne ye come thenne lete fetche tofore hym lynet damoysel ryden hym many wylsome wayes thenne syre gareth gladder fore thene trouth plyte eche loue neuer faylle whyles lyfe lasteth soo brente bothe loue accorded abate lustes secretely dame lyones counceylled syr gareth slepe none place halle promysed hym come bedde lytel afore mydnyght councell soo pryuely kepte vnderstande yonge bothe tendyr age vsed none suche craftes forne wherfor damoysel lynet lytel displeasyd thoughte syster dame lyones lytel ouer hasty myghte abyde tyme maryage sauyng worship thoughte abate hote lustes p lete ordeyne subtyl craftes entente neyther delytes vntyl maryed soo past souper made clene auoydaunce euery lord lady shold goo vnto rest syr gareth said playnly wold goo noo ferther halle suche place said conuenyent arraunt knyyt take rest ordeyned grete couch theron fether beddes leyde hym doune slepe within whyle cam dame lyones wrapped mantel furred ermyne leid doun besydes syr gareth alle beganne kysse thenne loked afore hym apperceyued sawe come armed knyght many lyghtes aboute hym sawe come armed knyyt many lyghtes hym knyghte longe gysarme hand maade grym countenaunce smyte hym whanne syre gareth sawe hym come wyse lepte oute bedde gate hand swerd lepte strayte toward knyght whanne knyght sawe syr gareth come fyersly vpon hym smote hym foyne theron thycke thyy wound shaftmon brode cutte two many vaynes senewes al syr gareth smote hym vpon helme suche buffet felle grouelyng thenne lepte ouer hym vnlaced helme smote hede fro body thenne bledde fast myghte stande soo leid hym doun vpon bedde swouned laye ben dede thenne dame lyones cryed alowde broder syr gryngamor herd came doune whan sawe syr gareth soo shamefully wounded sore displeasyd sayd shamed noble knyghte thus honoured syr sayd syr gryngamore hou may ye thys noble knyghte wounded broder said telle yow done myn assente lord must myn husband therfore broder wille ye wete shame hym doo hym alle pleasyr syster said syre gryngamore ye wete syr gareth neuer done assente vnhappy dede done staunched bledynge wel myght grete sorou made sir gryngamor dame lyones forthe al came dame lynet toke vp hede syghte hem alle enoynted oynement smyten wyse dyd parte hede stak thenne sette gyders stak fast euer knyghte arose lyghtely vp damoysel lynet put hym chambre alle sawe sir gryngamor dame lyones soo dyd sir gareth wel espyed damoysel lynet rode hym thorou peryllous passage wel damoysel said syre gareth wende wold haue done ye haue done lord gareth said lynet alle haue done auowe alle haue done shal youre honoure worship v alle soo within whyle syr gareth nyghe hole waxid lyghte iocound sange daunced gamed dame lyones soo hote brennynge loue made couenaunte tenth nyghte shold come bedde cause wouded afore laid armour swerd nyghe beddes syde pcapitulum xxiij ryght promysed came soo soone bedde aspyed armed knyghte comyng toward bedde alle warned syr gareth lyghtly thorou good helpe dame lyones armed hurtled gyders grete ire malyce al aboute halle grete lyght ben nombre xx torch bothe behynd soo syr gareth strayned hym soo old wounde braste ageyne bledyng hote couragyous toke kepe grete force stroke doune knyghte voyded helme strake hede thenne hewe hede honderd pyeces whan done took vp alle tho pyeces threwe hem oute wyndow dyches castel done faynt vnnethes myght stande bledyng thenne al vnarmed felle dedely swoune lore thenne dame lyones cryed soo syr gryngamor herd whan cam fond syr gareth plyte made grete sorou awaked sir gareth gaf hym drynke releued hym wonderly wel sorou dame lyones made maye tonge telle soo faryd self wold haue dyed pryghte soo cam damoysel lynet hem al fette alle gobbet hede syr gareth throwen wyndowe enoynted hem done fore set gyder ageyn wel damoisel lynet said syre gareth haue deserued alle despyte ye doo vnto sir knyghte said haue thynge auowe al haue done shalle worship v al thenne syre gareth stauched bledyng le said ther man bare lyf sholde bele hym thorou oute wounde yf ed hym caused stroke enchauntement leue syr gareth syr gryngamore systers torne vnto kynge arthur nexte feest pentecost helde feest cam grene knyyt fyfty knyghtes yelded hem vnto kynge arthur came reed knyghte broder yelded hym kyng arthur thre ore knyghtes hym also came blewe knyghte broder honderd knyghtes yelded hem vnto kynge arthur grene knyghtes name partolype reed knyghtes name perymones blewe knyghtes name syr persant inde thre bretheren told kynge arthur ouercome knyghte damoysel called hym beaumayns ihesu sayd kyng merueylle knyghte lygnage come twelue monethe pourely shamefully ostred syre kay scorne named hym beaumayns soo ryghte kyng stode soo talkyng thre bretheren come syr launcelot du lake told kynge come goodly lord vj c knghtes hym thenne kynge wente oute carlyon feest came hym lord alewed kynge goodly manere wylle ye sayd kyng arthur youre erand syr said name reed knyghte reed laundes name syr ironsyde syre wete ye wel sente yow knyght called beaumayns wanne playne bataille hande hand soo dyd neuer knyght euer better xxx wynter whiche commaunded yelde yow youre wylle ye welcom said kyng ye haue ben long grete foo courte truste god shalle soo entreate ye shal frend syre bothe fyue honderd knyghtes shal alweyes somons doo seruyse maye lye oure power ihesu mercy said kyng arthur moche beholdynge vnto knyght hath put soo body deuoyre worshippe courte ironsyde art called reed knyghte reed laundes thou arte called peryllous knyyt yf thou wylt holde shal worshippe make knyghte table round thenne thou must murtherer syre haue promysed vnto syre beaumayns neuer vse suche custommes shameful customes vsed dyd request lady loued therfor must goo vnto syr launcelot vnto syre gawayne aske foryeuenes euyll wylle vnto alle put deth al loue syr launcelot syr gawayne ben said kynge afore maye ye saye ye wylle thenne kneled doune vnto syre launcelot syre gawayne prayd foryeuenes enemytee euer ageynste pcapitulum xxiiij thenne goodely said al one god foryeue praye ye telle v may fynde syr beaumayns fayre lordes said syr ironsyde telle ful ard fynde hym suche yong knyghtes one whanne aduentures ben neuer abydynge place pbut saye worship reed knyghte reed laundes syr persaunt broder said beaumayns merueil wel fayre lordes said kynge arthur wete yow wel shalle honour loue syr beaumayns soone euer mete hym shalle make al vpon one day knyghtes table round syre persaunt inde thou hast ben euer called ful noble knyghte soo haue euer ben thy thre bretheren called merueil said kyng black knyyt broder ful noble knyghte syr sayd pertolype grene knyyt syr beaumayns slewe hym recoutre spere name syr perard grete pyte sayd kynge soo said many knyghtes four bretheren ful wel knowen courte kynge arthur noble knyghtes long tyme holden werre ageynst knyghtes round table thenne sayd pertolepe grene knyghte kynge atte passage water mortay e encountred syr beaumayns two bretheren euer moost party kepte passage two dedely knyghtes slewe eldest broder water smote hym vpon heede suche buffet felle doune water drouned name sir garard le brewse slewe broder vpon lond name syr arnold le brewse pcapitulum xxvj soo thenne kyng wente mete serued best manere satte mete ther came quene orkeney ladyes knyytes grete nombre thenne syr gawayn syr agrauayn gaherys arose wente salewed vpon knee asked blyssyng xv yere sene thenne spak hyghe broder kynge arthur haue ye done yong sone syr gareth amongst twelue moneth ye made kechyn knaue hym whiche shame allas haue ye done dere sone ioye blysse dere moder said syr gawayn knewe hym said kynge repenteth thanked god preued worshipful knyghte ony lyuyng yeres shal neuer glad tyl may fynde hym broder sayd quene vnto kyng arthur vnto syr gawayne alle sone ye dyd self grete shame whan ye amongst kepte sone kechyn fedde hym lyke poure hog fayr sister said kyng arthur ye shall ryghte wel wete knewe hym nomore dyd syre gawayn bretheren sythen hit said kyng thus gone v alle must shape remedy fynde hym also syster semeth ye myght haue done wete comynge thenne done wel hym ye myyt haue blamed whan cam courte came enyng vpon two men sholders though myght haue gone thenne asked thre yeftes one asked day wold gyue hym mete ynough twelue moneth two yeftes asked day twelue moneth myghte haue thaduenture damoysel lynet thyrd syre launcelot shold make hym knyght whan desyred hym soo graunted hym alle desyre many courte merueilled desyred sustenaunce twelf monethe demed many v come noble hous syre said quene orkeney vnto kynge arthur broder wete ye wel sente hym vnto ryghte wel armed horsed worshipfully bysene body gold syluer plente spende may said kynge therof awe none sauf daye departed v knyghtes told ther came dwerf hyder sodenly broughte hym armour good hors ful wel rychely ene al merueille fro whens rychesse came demed al come men worship broder said quene alle ye saye byleue euer sythen growen merueillously wytted euer feythful true promesse merueille said syre kay dyd mocke hym scorne hym gaf hym name beaumayns yet syr kay said quene named hym ryghteuously wende dare saye lyue fair handed man wel disposed ony lyuynge syre said arthurle te langage stylle grace god shal founde within seuen royames lete alle passe e mery proued man worship ioye pcapitulum xxvij thenne said syr gawayne bretheren vnto arthur syre ye wyl gyue v leue wille go seke oure brother nay said syr launcelot shalle ye nede said syr bawdewyn bretayne oure aduys kynge shal sende vnto dame lyones messager praye wille come courte alle hast may doubte ye wille come th ne may gyue best couceille ye shal fynde hym wel said said kyng soo thenne goodely letter made messager sente forth nyghte day wente tyl vnto castel perillous thenne lady dame lyones sente fore wyth syr gryngamor broder syre gareth whan vnderstode message badde hym ryde way vnto kynge arthur wold come al goodely hast pthenne whan came syr gryngamor sir gareth told hem al kyng arthur sente cause said syr gareth auyse said dame lyones shalle saye manere shal rule lady loue said sir gareth pray wyse ye aknowen wel wote moder alle bretheren wille take vpon hem seke wote wel doo madame wold ye sayd aduysed kynge whan questyoned thenne maye ye say aduys hit lyke good grace ye wille doo make crye ayenst feest thassumpcion lady knyghte preueth hym best shal welde land yf soo wedded man wyf shall degre coronal gold besette stone vertue valewe thousand pound whyte iarfaucon soo dame lyones departed came kynge arthur nobly receyued sore questyoned kyng quene orkeney ansuerde syr gareth coude telle thus moche said vnto arthur syre wille lete crye turnement shalle done castel assumpcion oure lady crye shal lorde arthur shalt knyghtes puruey knyghtes shalle ageynst thennne sure ye shall syr gareth wel aduysed said kynge arthur soo departed kynge maade grete prouysyon turnement whan dame lyones come yle auylyon yle ther broder syr gryngamor dwelte thenne told hem al done promyse made kynge arthur allas said syr gareth haue ben soo wounded vnhappynes sythen cam castel shal abyl doo turnement lyke knyghte neuer thorouly hole syn hurte ye good chere said damoysel lynet vndertak within xv dayes make hole lusty euer ye thenne leid oynement salue hym pleasyd neuer fressh soo lusty thenne said damoysel lynet send vnto syr persaunt ynde assomone hym knyghtes haue promysed also ye send vnto syr ironsyde reed knyghte reed laundes charge hym redy hole somme knyghtes thenne shalle ye abyl matche kynge arthur knyghtes soo done alle knyghtes sente vnto castel peryllous thenne reed knyght ansuerd said vnto dame lyones syre gareth madame lord syr gareth ye shal vnderstande haue ben court kynge arthur sire persaunt inde bretheren haue done oure homage ye commaunded v also syr ironsyde sayd haue taken vpon syre persaunt inde bretheren hold party ageynst lord sir launcelot knyghtes courte haue done loue lady dame lyones lord sir gareth ye haue wel done said syr gareth wete wel ye shal ful sore matched moost noble knyghtes world ther must purueye v goode knyghtes may gete wel said said sir persaunt worshipfully soo crye made england walis scotland ireland cornewaille alle oute iles bretayn many countreyes feest lady assumpcion next comyng men shold come castel peryllous besyde yle auylyon al knyghtes ther came shold haue choyse whether lyst one party knyghtes castel party kynge arthur two monethes daye turnement shold ther cam many good knyytes large helde hem moost party ageynst kynge arthur knyghtes round table cam syde castel syr epynogrus fyrst kynges sone northumberland syr palamydes sarasyn another syr safere broder syre segwarydes broder crystned syre malegryne another syr bryan de le ilelys noble knyghte syr grummore gummursum good knyghte scotland syr carados dolorous toure noble knyghte syr turquyn broder syr arnold syre gauter two bretheren good knyghtes cornewaile cam syr trystram de lyones hym syr dynadas seneschal sir saduk syr tristram tyme knyght table round one best knyghtes world soo noble knyghtes accompanyed hem lady castel reed knyghte reed laundes sir gareth wold take vpon hym meane knyghtes pcapitulum xxviij thenne ther cam kynge arthur sir gawayn agrauayne gaherys bretheren thenne neuewes syr vwayn le blaunche maynys syr aglouale syr tor sir percyuale de galys syre lamorrak de galis thenne came sir launcelot du lake bretheren neuews cosyns sir lyonel sir ector de mary syr bors de ganys sir galyhodyn syre galihud many moo syre launcelots blood syre dynadan sir la coote male tayle broder good knyghte sir sagramore good knyyt al party round table also ther cam kynge arthur knyghtes kynge ireland kynge agwysaunce kyng scotland kyng carados kynge vryens londe gore kyng bagdemagus sone syr melyaganus syr galahault noble prynce alle kynges prynces erles baron noble knyghtes syre braundyles syre vwayne le auowtres syre kay syr bedeuere syr melyot de logrys syr petypase wynkelsee syr godelake alle came kynge arthur moo ben reherced pnow leue kynges knyghtes lete v speke grete araye made within castel aboute castel bothe partyes lady dame lyones ordeyned grete aray vpon party noble knyghtes al maner lodgyng vytaille cam land water ther lacked thynge party plente gold syluer kynge arthur knyghtes thenne ther cam herbegeours kynge arthur herberowe hym kynges duke erles baron knyghtes thenne syr gareth prayd dame lyones reed knyghte reed laundes syr persant broder syre gryngamor wyse ther shold none telle name make hym leest knyghte said wille knowen neyther ne lesse neyther begynnynge neyther endynge pthenne dame lyones said vnto syr gareth syre wylle leue rynge wold pray ye loue hertely lete haue ageyne whanne turnement done pfor rynge encreaceth beaute moche hym self vertu rynge grene torne reed reed wil torne lykenes grene blewe wil torne lykenes whyte whyte wil torne lykenes blewe wil doo al manere colour also bereth rynge shalle lese blood grete loue wil gyue thys rynge gramercy said syr gareth myn lady rynge passynge mete hit wille torne al manere lykenes shalle cause shall knowen thenne syr gryngamor gaf syr gareth bay courser passyng good hors also gafe hym good armoure sure noble swerd somtyme syre gryngamors fader wanne vpon hethen tyraunt soo thus euery knyghte made hym redy turnement kyng arthur comen two dayes fore thassumpcion lady al maner royalte al mynstralsye myghte founde also cam quene gweneuer quene orkeney syr gareths moder vpon assumpcion day whanne masse matyns done herowdes trompettes commaunded blowe feld soo came oute syr epynogrus kynges sone northumberland castel encountred hym syre sagramor le desyrus eyther hem brake speres handes thenne came syre palamydes oute castel encountred hym gawayne eyther hem smote hard bothe good knyghtes horse felle erthe thenne knyghtes eyther party rescowed knyghtes thenne cam syr safere syre segwarydes bretheren syre palamydes encountred syr agrauayne syr safere syr gaherys encountred syre segwarydes syr safere smote doune agrauayne syr gawayns broder sir segwarydes syr saferys broder syr malgryne knyyt castel encountred syr vwayne le blaunche maynys syre vwayne gaf syr malgryn falle almost broke neck pcapitulum xxix thenne syr bryan de le yles grummore grummorssum knyghtes castel syre ag ouale syre tor smote doun syr gromere gromorson erth thenne cam syr carados dolorous toure syr turquyne knyghtes castel encoutred hem syr percyuale de galys syr launcelot de galys two bretheren encountred syr percyuale syre caradus eyther brake speres vnto handes thenne syr turquyn syre lamerak eyther hem smote doune others hors alle erthe eyther partyes rescowed horsed ageyn syr arnold syr gautere knyghtes castel encountred syre braundyles syr kay four knyghtes encountred myghtely brake speres handes thenne came syr trystram syre saduk syre dynas knyghtes castel encountred syr trystram wyth syr bedyuere syr bedyuere smyten erthe bothe hors man syr saduk encountred sir petypase syr saduk ouerthrowen vwayne le auoutres smote doune syr dynas seneschal thenne came syr persaunt inde knyght castel encountred hym syr launcelot du lake smote syr persaunts hors man erthe thenne came syr pertylope castel encountred hym syr lyonel syr pertylope grene knyght smote doune syr lyonel broder syr laucelot marked noble heroudes bare hym best theire name thenne came fold syre perymones grene knyght syr persaunts broder knyght castel encountred syr ector de mary eyther smote hard bothe horse felle erthe thenne came reed knyght reed laundes syr gareth castel encountred hem syr bors de ganys syr bleoberys reed knyghte syr bors smote hard speres brast horse felle grouelynge erthe thenne syr blamor brake spere vpon syr gareth stroke syr blamor felle erthe whan syr galyhondyn sawe sir gareth kepe hym sire gareth smote hym erthe thenne sire galyhud gate spere auenge broder wyse sir gareth serued hym sir dynadan broder la cote male tayle sir sagramor desirus sir dodynas le saueage bare doun one spere whan kyng aguysauce irland sawe syr gareth fare merueiled myyt one tyme semed grene another tyme ageyne comyng semed blewe thus euery cours ro e fro chaunged colour ther myghte neyther kynge knyghte haue redy conguyssaunce hym thenne syr anguyssaunce kyng irland encountred syr gareth syr gareth smote hym hors sadyl thenne came kyng caradus scotland syr gareth smote hym doun hors man wyse serued kyng vryens land gore thenne came syr bawdemagus syr gareth smote hym doune hors man erthe bawdemagus sone melyganus brake spere vpon sir gareth myghtely knyghtely thenne syr galahaut noble prynce cryed hyghe knyghte many colour wel hast thou iusted make redy maye iuste syre gareth herd hym gat grete spere soo encountred gyder prynce brake spere syr gareth smote hym vpon lyfte syde helme relyd falle doune men recouerd hym soo god help sayd kynge arthur fame knyght many colour good knyghte wherfor kynge called vnto hym syr launcelot praid hym encountre knyghte syr said launcelot may wel fynde herte forbere hym tyme hath hadde trauail ynough day whan good knyghte doth soo wel vpon somme day good knyghtes parte lette hym worship namely whan seeth knyght hath done soo grete labour peraduenture said syr launcelot quarel day perauentur best byloued lady al ben see wel payneth hym enforceth hym grete dedes therfor said syr launcelot day shall haue honour though lay power put hym fro wold pcapitulum xxx thenne whanne done drawynge swerdes thenne began sore turnement dyd syr lamerak merueyllous dedes armes betwixe syr lamerak syre ironsyde reed knyghte reed laudes strong batail betwix syre palamides bleoberys strong batail sir gawayne syr trystram mette syr gawayne werse pulled syre gawayne hors long vpon foote defouled thenne cam syr launcelot smote syr turquyne hym thenne came syr caradus broder bothe one assaylled hym moost noblest knyght world worshipfully foughte hem bothe al men wondred noblesse syr launcelot thenne came syr gareth knewe sir launcelot fought tho two peryllous knyghtes thenne syr gareth came good hors hurtled hem sonder stroke wold smyte syr launcelot aspyed sir launcelot demed shold good knyghte syre gareth thenne syr gareth rode smote ryght hand lyfte hand alle folke myghte wel aspye rode fortune mette broder syr gawayn put syr gawayne werse put helme serued fyue syxe knyghtes rounde table alle men said put hym payne best dyd deuoyr whan syr trystram beheld hym fyrst iusted foughte wel swerd thenne rode vnto syr ironsyde syre persaunt ynde asked hem feythe maner knyghte yonder knyght semeth soo many dyuerse colour truly semeth sayd trystram putteth hym self grete payne neuer ceaseth wote ye sayd syr ironsyde said syr trystram thenne shal ye knowe loueth lady castel hym ageyne wannne whan byseged lady castel wanne syr persaunt ynde thre bretheren name sayd syr trystram blood come called courte kyng arthur beaumayns ryyt name sir gareth orkeney broder sir gawayn hede said sir tristram good kniyt knyght bygge man armes yf yong shalle preite ful noble knyghte child saide syr launcelot made knyyt therfor mykel better said trystram thenne syr trystram syr iron yde syr persaunt broder rode gyders helpe sir gareth thenne gyuen many strong stroke thenne syr gareth rode oute one syde amende helme thenne said dwerf take ryng ye lese whyle ye drynke whan dronken gat helme egerly took hors rode felde lefte rynge dwerf dwerf gladde ryng hym thenne wist wel shold knowen thenne whan syr gareth felde folkes sawe hym wel playnly yelowe colour rassyd helmes pulled doun knyytes kynge arthur merueylle knyyt kyng sawe knyght pcapitulum xxxj bvt fore many colour one colour yelowe goo said kyng arthur vnto dyuerse heroudes ryde aboute hym aspye maner knyght haue speryd many knyghtes day ben vpon party saye knowe hym heroude rode nyhe gareth coude sawe wryten aboute helme golde helme syr gareth orkeney thenne heroude cryed wood many heroudes hym syre gareth orkeney yelowe armes kynges knyghtes arthur beheld hym awayted thenne pressyd al beholde hym euer heroudes cryed syre gareth orkeney kyng lot sone whan syr gareth aspyed discoueryd thenne doubled stroke smote doune syr sagramore broder sir gawayn broder saide sir gawayn wende ye wolde haue stryken whan herd hym say thrang grete payne gat prees mette dwerf boye said syr gareth thou hast begyled foule day thou kepte rynge gyue anone ageyn may hyde body al soo tooke hym thenne wist become syr gawayn maner aspyed syr gareth rode thenne rode alle myghte aspyed syr gareth rode lyghtely forest syr gawayn wist become whan syr gareth wyst syr gawayn past asked dwerf best counceil syr said dwerf semeth best ye escaped fro spyeng ye send lady dame lyones rynge wel aduysed said syr gareth haue saye recommaunde vnto good grace saye come whan maye pray true feythful wil syr said dwerf shal done ye commaunde soo rode waye dyd eraund vnto lady thenne said knyghte syr gareth madame said dwerf bad saye wold long p soo lyghtely dwerf cam ageyne vnto syr gareth wold ful fayne haue lodgyng nede reposed thenne felle thonder rayne heuen erthe shold goo gyder syr gareth lytyl wery al day lytel rest neyther hors syr gareth rode soo longe forest vntyl nyghte came euer lyghtned thondred ben woode last fortune came castel herd waytes vpon wally pcapitulum xxxij thenne syr gareth rode vnto barbycan castel praid porter fayr lete hym castel porter ansuerd vngoodely ageyne saide thow getest lodgyng fayr syr say soo knyyte kynge arthur pray lord lady castel gyue herberow loue kynge arthur thenne porter wente vnto duchesse told ther knyghte kyng arthur wold haue herberowe lete hym said duchesse wille see knyghte kyng arthur sake shalle herberoules pthenne yode vp toure ouer gate greete torche lyght whan sir gareth sawe torche lyghte cryed thou lord lady gyaunt champyon toke force may haue herberowe nyghte yf hit must nedes fyghte spare morne haue restyd bothe myn hors ben wery syr knyghte said lady thou spekest knyghtly boldly wete thou wel lord castel loueth kyng arthur none court lord hath euer ben ageynst hym therfor thou better come within castel thou come nyghte thou must come vnder suche fourme someuer thou mete lord styy strete thou must yelde hym prysoner madame said syre gareth lord name syr lordes name duke de la rouse wel madame said syr gareth shal promyse yow place mete lord shalle yelde vnto hym good grace vnderstande wille harme yf vnderstand e wille wil releace self spere swerd ye say wel said duchesse thenne lete drawe brydge doune soo rode halle e alyghte hors ledde stable halle vnarmed hym saide madame oute holle nyghte whan daye lyght lete see wil haue adoo shal fynde redy thenne sette vnto souper many good dysshes thenne syr gareth lyst wel ete knyghtely ete mete egerly many fair lady hym said neuer sawe goodlyer man wel etynge thenne made hym passyng good chere shortly whan souped ledde made rested hym al nyghte morne e herd masse brake fast toke leue duchesse al thanked goodely lodgyng good chere thenne asked gym name madame saide truly name gareth orkeney men calle umayns thene knewe wel knyyt fouyt dame lyones sir gareth departed rode vp montayne ther mette hym knyghte name syr bendelayne sayd syr gareth thou shalt passe way outher thou shalt iuste el prysoner thenme wille iuste said syr gareth soo lete horse renne syr gareth smote hym thorou oute body syr bendalyne rode forth castel besyde dyed syr gareth wold haue rested hym cam rydynge bendalaynis castel thenne knyghtes seruauntes aspyed slayne lord thenne armed xx good men cam oute assailled syr gareth soo spere swerd put shelde afore hym brake speres vpon hym assailled hem passyngly sore euer syr gareth deffended hym knyght pcapitulum xxxiij soo whan sawe myghte ouercome hym rode hym took counceylle slee hors soo cam vpon syr gareth speres slewe hors thenne assailled hym hard whan foote none caughte gaf suche buffet dyd neuer recouer slewe hem one one tyl foure fledde sire gareth took good hors one rode waye thenne rode grete paas til came castel herd moche mornynge ladyes gentylwymmen ther cam hym page noyse said syr gareth within castel syre knyghte said page ben within castel thyrtty ladyes alle wydowes knyght wayteth dayly vpon castel name broun knyght withoute pyte parylloust knyght lyueth therfor sir said page rede flee nay said sir gareth wille flee though thou aferd hym thenne page sawe came broune knyghte loo said page yonder cometh lete dele hym said syre gareth whan eyther syghte lete theyr horse renne broune knyghte brake spere sir gareth smote hym thorou oute body ouerthrewe hym ground stark dede sir gareth rode castel praid ladyes yt myyt repose hym allas said ladyes ye may lodged make hym good chere said page knyghte hath slayne enemy thenne al made hym good chere laye power wete ye wel maade hym good chere myghte none otherwyse doo poure morne wente masse sawe thyrtty ladyes knele lay grouelyng vpon dyuerse tombes makynge grete dole sorowe thenne syr gareth wyst wel tombes lay theire lordes fayre ladyes said syr gareth ye must next feeste pentecost court kynge arthur saye syr gareth sente thyder shal doo said ladyes soo departed fortune came mountayne found goodely knyght badde hym abyde syr knyghte iuste ye said syr gareth name said duke de la rowse syr ye ar knyghte lodged one castel made promyse vnto lady shold yelde vnto yow said duke arte thou proud knyghte proferest fyghte knyghtes therfore make redy wil haue adoo soo lete horse renne ther syr gareth smote duke doune hors duke lyghtly auoyded hors dressid shelde drewe swerd bad syr gareth alyghte fyghte hym soo dyd alyghte dyd grete batail gyders houre eyther hurte ful sore att last sir gareth gat duke erthe wold haue slayn hym thenne yelded hym hym thenne must ye goo said sir gareth vnto syr arthur lord next feest saye sir gareth orkeney sente vnto hym hit shal done said duke wil doo yow homage f aute c knyytes alle dayes lyf doo seruyse wh ye wille commaunde pcapitulum xxiiij soo duke departed sir gareth stode alone sawe armed knyght comyng toward hym thenne syre gareth toke duke shelde mounted vpon horsbak soo withoute bydyng gyder ben thonder knyyt hu syr gareth vnder syde spere thenne alyghte drewe swerdes gafe grete stroke blood trayled ground soo foughte two houres last ther came damoysel lynet somme men calle damoysel saueage came rydynge vpon ambelynge meule cryed al hyghe syr gawayne syr gawayne leue thy fyghtynge thy broder syre gareth whan herd saye soo threwe aweye hys shelde swerd ranne syre gareth tooke hym armes sythen kneled doune asked hym mercy ye said syr gareth ryght soo stronge soo myghty sodenly yelde gareth broder syr gawayn youre sake haue grete sorou labour thenne syr gareth vnlaced helme knelyd doune hym asked hym mercy thenne rose enbraced eyther armes wepte grete whyle myghte speke eyther hem gaf pryce bataille many kynde wordes bitwene hem allas faire broder said sir gawayn perde owe ryghte worshippe ye broder ye haue worshipped kyng arthur courte ye haue sente mo worshipful knyghtes twelue moneth syxe best round table haue done excepte sir launcelot thenne cam damoysel saueage lady lynet rode sir gareth soo longe dyd staunche sir garethe woundes sir gawayns wille ye doo said damoysel saueage semeth wel yt arthur wetyng horse soo brysed may bere faire damoysel said syr gawayne praye ryde vnto lord myn vnkel kynge arthur telle hym aduenture betyd suppose wille tary long thenne tooke meule lyghtly came kynge arthur two myle then whan told hym ty ynges kynge bad gete hym palfroy pand whan vpon bak badde lordes ladyes come wold sadelyng brydelyng quenes horse prynces horse wel hym soonest myght redy soo whan kynge came sawe syr gawayn syr gareth sytte vpon lytel hylle syde thenne kynge auoyded hors whanne cam nyghe syre gareth wold haue spoken myghte therwith sanke doune swoune gladnesse soo starte vnto theyr vnkyl requyred hym good grace good comforte wete ye wel kyng made grete ioye many pyteous complaynte made syr gareth euer wepte ben chyld cam moder quene orkeney dame morgause whan sawe syr gareth redely vysage myghte wepe sodenly felle doun swoune lay grete whyle lyke ben dede thenne syr gareth recomforted moder suche wyse recouerd made good chere thenne kynge commaunded al maner knyghtes vnder obeissaunce shold make lodgyng ryght loue neuewes soo done al manere purueaunce purueyd ther lacked nothyng myghte goten tame wylde gold syluer thenne meanes damoysel saueage syr gawayne syr gareth heled woundes soiourned eyght dayes thenne said kyng arthur vnto damoysel saueage merueylle syster dame lyones cometh especyal cometh vysyte knyghte neuewe syre gareth hath soo moche trauaille loue lord said damoysel lynet ye must good grace hold excused knoweth lord syr gareth go ne said kynge arthur may apoynted best done accordyng plesyr neuewe syr said damoysel shal done soo rode vnto syster lyghtely myght made redy cam morne broder syr gryngamor xl knyytes whan come alle chere myghte done bothe kynge many kynges quenes pcapitulum xxxv monge alle th se ladyes named fayrest thenne whanne syr gawayn sawe many goodely loke goodely wordes alle man worship ioye beholde thenne cam kynge arthur many kynges dame gweneuer quene orbeney kyng asked neuew syr gareth whether wold haue lady peramour haue wyf lord wete yow wel loue aboue al ladyes lyuynge fayre lady said kyng arthur say ye moost noble kynge said dame lyones wete yow wel lord syr gareth leuer haue welde husband ony kyng prynce yf maye haue hym promyse yow wylle neuer haue none lord arthur sayd dame lyones e ye wel fyrst loue shal laste yf ye wil suffre hym haue wyl free choyse da saye e wylle haue trouthe said syr gareth haue weld wyf shal neuer lady ne gentylwoman reioyce neuewe said kynge wynde dore wete ye wel wold stynte croune causar withdrawe hertes wete ye wel ye con loue wel shal rather encreace hit dystresse hit also ye shal haue loue lordship vttermest wyse may lye power wyse said sir gareths moder thenne made prouysyon day maryge kynges aduyse prouyded shold mychelmas folowyng kynkenadon see syde ther plentyful countrey soo cryed al place thurgh wyamme thenne syr gareth sent somones alle knyghtes ladyes wonnen batail fore shold day maryage kynkenadon sandys thenne dame lyones damoysel lynet syr gryngamor rode theire castel goodely ryche rynge gaf syr gareth gaf another kyng arthur gaf ryche bee gold soo departed kyng arthur felauship rode toward kynkenadon syr gareth broughte lady way cam kyng ageyne rode hym lord grete chere syr launcelot made sir gareth hym neuer knyght syr gareth oued wel dyd syr launcelot euer party wold syr launcelots company syr gareth aspyed sir gawayns condycions withdrewe hym self fro broder syr gawayns felauship vengeable hated wold auengyd murther hated syr gareth pcapitulum xxxvj soo hit drewe faste mychelmas thyder came dame lyones lady castel peryllous syster dame lynet syre gryngamor broder hem conduyte ladyes lodged deuyse kyng arthur vpon mychelmas day bisshop caunterbury made weddyng betwixe syr gareth lady lyones grete solempnyte kyng arthur made gaherys wedde damoysel saueage dame lynet kyng arthur made syr agrauayne wedde dame lyones nees fayr lady name dame laurel whan solemnacion done thenne came grene knyghte syr pertylope thyrtty knyghtes dyd homage feaute syr gareth knyghtes hold hym euermore also sir pertilope said pray feest maye chamberlayne good wil said syr gareth syth lyketh take soo symple offyce thenne come reed knyghte thre score knyghtes hym dyde syr gareth homage feaute alle th knyghtes hold hym euermore thenne syr perymonyes praide sir gareth graunte hym chyef botteler hyghe feest wil wel saide sir gareth ye haue offyce better thenne came syr persant inde c knyghtes hym dyd homage feaute al knyghtes shold doo hym seruyse hold londes hym euer prayd syr gareth make hym sewar chyef feest wel said syr gareth ye haue better thenne cam dukde larowse c knyghtes hym dyd homage feaute syr gareth soo hold theire londes hym euer requyred syr gareth myght serue hym wyn day feest wil wel sayd syr gareth better thenne came reed knyyte reed laundes syr ironsyde broughte hym thre honderd knyghtes dyd homage feaute al knyghtes hold landes hym euer thenne asked syr gareth keruer wel said syr gareth please thenne came courte thyrtty ladyes alle semed wydowes tho thyrtty ladyes broughte hem many fayre gentylwymmen alle kneled doune one vnto kyng arthur vnto syr gareth al th ladyes told kyng syr gareth delyuerd hem dolorous oure slewe broune knyght withoute pyte therfore oure heyres euermore wille doo homage vnto syr gareth orkeney thenne kynges quenes prynces erlys baron many bold knyghtes wente vnto mete well maye ye wete al maner mete plentyuously alle manere rule game al manere mynstralsy vsed tho dayes palso ther gr te iustes thre dayes kynge wold suffre syre gareth iuste cause newe bryde frensshe book sayth dame lyones desyred kynge none wedded shold iuste feest soo fyrst day iusted sir lamerak de galys ouerthrewe thyrtty knyghtes passyng merueillously dedes armes thenne kyng arthur made syr persaunt two bretheren knyghtes round table lyues ende gaf hem grete londes also second daye iusted trystram best ouerthrew fourty knyghtes dyd merueillous dedes armes kynge arthur made ironsyde reed knyghte reed laundes knyghte table round lyues ende gaf hym grete landes thyrd day iusted syr launcelot du lake ouerthrewe fyfty knyghtes dyd many merueyllous dedes armes men wondred hym kynge arthur made duke de la rouse knyghte round table lyues ende gaf hym grete landes spende whan iustes done syr lamerak syr trystram departed sodenly wold knowm whiche kyng arthur court sore displeasyd soo helde courte fourty dayes grete solempnyte syr gareth noble knyghte wel rulyd fayr langaged pthus endeth tale syr gareth orkeney wedded dame lyones castel peryllous also syr gaherys wedded syster dame lynet called damoysel saueage syr agrauayne wedded dame laurel fayr lady grete myghty landes grete rychesse gaf kyng arthur ryally myght lyue tyl lyues ende foloweth viij book first book sir tristram de lyones fader moder hou borne fosteryd made knyghte pcapitulum primum hit kyng hyghte melyodas lord kynge countre lyonas melyodas lykely knyght ony tyme lyuynge fortune wedded kynge markys syster cornewaille called elyzabeth callyd bothe good fair tyme kynge arthur regned hol kynge englond walys scotland many royammes many kynges lordes many countreyes alle held landes kyng arthur walys two kynges north many kynges cornewail west two kynges palso irland two thre kynges al vnder obeissaunce kyng arthur kynge fraunce kyng bretayn lordshippes vnto rome whan kyng melyodas hadde ben wyf within whyle waxid grete child ful meke lady wel loued lord ageyne soo grete ioye betwixe thenne ther lady countrey loued kynge melyodas longe meane neuer coude gete loue therfore lete ordeyne vpon day kynge melyodas rode huntynge grete chacer enchauntement made hym chace herte hym self alone til came old castel anone taken prysoner lady hym loued whanne elyzabeth kyng melyodas myst lord nyghe oute wytte also grete child took gentylwoman ranne forest seke lord whanne ferre forest myghte ferther byganne trauaille fast child many grymly throwes gentylwoman halp alle myghte soo myracle oure lady heuen delyuerd grete paynes taken suche cold defaute helpe depe draughtes deth toke nedes must dye departe oute world ther none boote whanne quene elyzabeth sawe ther none bote thenne made grete dole said vnto gentylwoman whan ye see lord kyng melyodas recommaunde vnto hym telle hym paynes endure gi loue must dye sake defaute good helpe lete hym wete ful sory departe world fro hym therfor pray hym frende soule lete see lytel child whome haue alle sorowe whanne sawe hym said thus lytel sone thou hast murthered thy moder therfore suppose thou arte murtherer soo yong thou arte ful lykely manly man thyn age cause shal dye byrthe charge gentylwoman thou pray lord kynge melyodas tha whan crystned lete calle hym trystram moch saye sorouful byrthe ther quene gafe vp ghoost dyed thenne gentylwoman leyd vnder vmbre grete tree thenne lapped chyld wel myght cold ryghte soo ther came baron folowynge quene pand whan sawe dede vnderstood none kynge destroyed pcapitulum secundum thenne certayne wold haue slayne child cause wold haue ben lordes countrey lyonas thenne thorou faire speche gentylwoman meanes made moost party baron wold assente ther thenne lete cary home dede quene moche dole made thenne meane whyle merlyn delyuerd kynge melyodas pryson morne quene dede kynge come home moost party baron made grete ioye sorou kyng made quene myghte tong telle soo thenne kynge lete entere rychely lete crystene child wyf commaunded afore deth thenne lete calle hym trystram sorouful borne child pthenne kynge melyodas endured seuen yeres withoute wyf alle tyme trystram nourysshed wel pthenne hit befell kynge melyodas wedded kynge howles doughter bretayne anone hadde child kynge melyodas thenne heuy wrothe child shold reioyce countrey lyones wherfor quene ordeyned poysone yong tristram lete poyson put pyece syluer chamber trystram child gyders vnto entente whanne trystram thursty shold drynke drynke hit felle vpon daye quenes sone chamber aspyed pyece poyson wende hit hadde ben good drynke cause child thursty tooke pyece poyson dranke frely al sodenly child brast dede whanne quene melyodas wyst dethe sone wete ye wel heuy yet kyng vnderstode thynge treason pnot withstandynge quene wold leue efte lete ordeyne poyson putte hit pyece fortune kyng melyodas husband fond pyece wyn poyson moche thursty took pyece drynke ther oute wold haue dronken therof quene aspyed hym thenne ranne vnto hym pulled pyece hym sodenly pthe kyng merueilled dyd soo remembryd hym sone sodenly slayne poyson thenne took hand sayd thou fals traitresse thou shalte telle manere drynke el shalle slee ther pulled oute swerd sware grete othe shold slee yf told hym trouthe mercy lord sayd shalle telle alle thenne told hym wold haue slayne trystram cause chyldren shold reioyce land wel said kyng melyodas therfor shal ye haue lawe soo dampned assente baron brent thenne ther made grete fyre ryght fyre take execucion yong trystram knelyd afore kynge melyodas besought hym gyue hym bone wylle wel said kynge ageyne pthenne saide yonge trystram gyue lyf thy quene stepmoder vnryghtfully asked said kyng melyodas thou oughte ryght hate wold haue slayne poyson myghte haue hadde wille thy sake moost cause sholde dye syr saide trystram byseche mercy ye wille forgyue hither parte god forgyue doo soo moche lyked hyhenes graunte bone goddes loue requyre hold promyse sythen hit soo said kynge wille ye haue lyf thenne said kynge gyue go ye fyre take doo ye wylle soo syre trystram wente fyre commaundement kyng delyuerd dethe kynge melyodas wold neuer haue adoo bedde borde good meanes yong trystram made kynge accorded thenne kynge wold suffre yonge trystram abyde lenger courte pcapitulum iij thenne lete ordeyne gentylman wel lerned taughte name gouernayle thenne sente yonge trystram gouernayle fraunce lerne langage nurture dedes armes trystram seuen yeres p thenne whanne wel couthe speke langage hadde lerned alle myght lerne countreyes thenne came home fader kynge melyodas ageyne trystram lerned harper passynge alle none suche called countrey soo harpynge instrumentys musyke applyed hym yongthe lerne growed myght strengthe laboured euer huntynge haukynge soo neuer gentylman euer herd rede pand book sayth beganne good mesures blowyng beestes venery beestes chace alle manere vermayns alle termes haue yet haukyng huntyng therfore book venery haukynge huntynge called book syr trystram wherfor semeth alle gentylmen beren old armes oughte ryght honoure syre trystram goodly termes gentilmen haue vse shalle daye dome maner alle men worship maye disseuer gentylman fro yoman yoman vylayne gentyl wylle drawe hym vnto gentil tatches folowe custommes noble gentylmen pthus syr trystram endured cornewaile vntyl bygge stronge age xviij yeres thenne kynge melyodas grete ioye syr trystram soo quene wyfe euer lyf cause syre trystram saued fyre dyd neuer hate hym loued hym euer gaf trystram many grete yeftes euery estate loued hym wente pcapitulum quartum thenne befelle kynge anguysshe irland sente vnto kynge marke cornewaile truage cornewaile payed many wynters alle tyme kynge marke behynde truage uen yeres kyng marke baron gaf vnto messager irland wordes ansuere wold none paye bad messagyer goo vnto kynge anguysshe telle hym wille paye hym truage telle youre lord wille alweyes haue truage v cornewaile bydde hym sende trusty knyghte land wille fyghte ryght shalle fynde another defende oure ryght ansuer messagers departed irland pand whanne kynge anguysh vnderstood ansuere messagers wonderly wroth thenne callyd vnto hym syr marhaus good knyght nobly preued knyghte table round marhaus broder vnto quene irland pthenne kynge sayd thus fayre broder sir marhaus praye yow goo cornewaile sake bataille truage ryght oughte haue someuer ye spende ye shalle haue suffyciently ye shal nede syre saide marhaus wete ye wel shalle bothe doo bataille ryght land best knyght table rounde knowe moost party ben theire dedes auaunce dedes encreace worship wylle ryght gladly goo vnto iourneye oure ryghte psoo alle haste made purueaunce syr marhaus hadde al thynge hym neded soo departed irland arryued vp cornewaile euen fast castel tyntagil whan kynge marke vnderstood arryued fyghte irland pthenne made kynge marke grete sorou whan vnderstood good noble knyghte sire marhaus come knewe knyght durste haue adoo hym tyme syre marhaus called one famosest renoumed knyghtes world pand thus syre marhaus abode see euery daye sente vnto kynge marke paye truage behynde seuen yere outher el fynde knyght fyghte hym truage maner message syre marhaus sente dayly vnto kynge marke pthenne cornewayle lete make cryes euery place knyght wold fyghte saue truage cornewaile sholde rewarded soo sholde fare better terme hys yf pthenne baron sayde kynge marke counceiled hym sende courte kynge arthur se e yre launcelot du lake tyme named merueilloust knyght alle worlde pthenne somme baron counceylled kynge doo soo said laboure vayn cause syr marhaus knyght round table ther ony hem loth haue adoo yf hit ony knyght owne request wold fyghte dysguysed vnknowen soo kynge alle baron assented bote seke ony knyght round table p meane whyle came langage noyse vnto kynge meliodas hou sire marhaus abode bataille faste tyntagil kyng marke couthe fynde maner knyghte fyghte hym whan yong trystram herd thys wrothe sore ashamed ther durst knyghte cornewaile haue adoo syr marhaus irland pcapitulum quintum al trystram wente vnto fader kynge meliodas asked hym counceil best doo recouer cornewaile truage semeth said sir tristram shame syr marhaus quenes broder irland shold goo aweye onles foughten alle pa said kyng meliodas wete wel sone tristram syre marhaus called one best knyghtes world knyghte table round therfore knowe knyghte countre able matche hym p allas saide syre tristram made knyght yf sir marhaus shold thus departe irland god lete neuer haue worship made knyght shold matche hym syr said trystram pray gyue leue ryde kynge mark soo ye displeasyd kynge mark wille made knyght wille wel saide kyng meliodas ye ruled courage wille rule pthenne sir trystram thanked fader moche thenne made hym redy ryde cornewaile pin meane whyle came messager letter loue fro kynge faramon fraunces doughter vnto syre trystram ful pyteous letter wryten many complayntes loue syre tristram ioye letter gard vnto also sente hym lytel brachet assynge fayre whan kynges doughter vnderstood sy trystram wold loue book sayth dyed sorou p thenne squyer broughte letter brachet came ageyne vnto syr trystram ye shalle tale psoo yonge syre trystram rode vnto eme kynge marke cornewayle pand whanne came herd say ther wold ne knyghte fyghte syre marhaus thenne yede sir tristram vnto eme sayd syre yf ye wylle gyue thordre knyghthode wille doo bataille syr marhaus ye said kynge whens ye comen sir said trystram come fro kynge melyodas wedded syster gentylman wete ye wel pkynge marke behelde sir trystram sawe yonge man age passyngly wel maade bygge pfaire syre said kynge youre name ye borne syre sayd ageyne name trystram countreye lyones borne ye saye wel said kynge yf ye wille doo batayll shalle make yow knyghte therfore come sayd syre trystram none cause pbut thenne kynge marke made hym knyghte al anone made hym knyght sente message vnto syre marhaus letter said hadde fonde yonge knyghte redy take bataile vtter mest hit may wel said syre marhaus pbut telle kynge marke wille fyghte knyghte blood royal saye outher kynges sone outher quenes sone borne prynce pryncesse pwhanne kynge marke vnderstood sente syre trystram de lyones tolde hym ansuer syr marhaus pthenne sayd syre trystram sythen seyth lete hym wete comen fader syde moder syde noble blood pfor syre shalle ye knowe kynge melyodas sone borne youre syster dame elyzabeth dyed forest byrthe ihesu said kynge mark ye welcome faire neuewe pthenne alle haste kynge lete horse syr tristram arme hym best maner myghte goten gold syluer pand thenne kynge marke sente vnto sir marhaus dyd hym wete letter born hym self shold fyghte hym name sir trystram de lyonas goten kynge melyodas borne kynge markes syster thenne sir marhaus glad blythe shold fyghte suche gentylman soo assente kynge mark syr marhaus lete ordeyne shold fyghte within iland nyghe syr marhaus shyppes soo syr trystram putte vessel bothe hors hym longed bothe body hors syre trystram lacked nothynge whan kynge marke baron cornewaile beheld yonge syr trystram departed suche caryage fyghte ryghte cornewaile neyther man ne woman worship wepte see vnderstande soo yonge knyght ieoparde hym self ryghte pcapitulum sextum soo shorten tale whan syr trystram arryued within iland loked ferther syde sawe anker syxe shippes nyghe land vnder shadowe shippes vpon land houed noble knyghte syr marhaus irland thenne syr trystram commaunded seruaunt gouernail brynge hors land dresse harneis al manere ryghtes thenne whan soo done mounted vpon hors whan sadel wel apparailled shelde dressid vpon sholder trystram asked gouernayle knyghte shal haue adoo alle syre sayd gouernaile see ye hym wende ye sene hym yonder houeth vnder vmbre shippes horsbak spere hand sheld vpon sholder trouthe sayd noble knyght syre trystram see hym wel ynouy thenne commaunded seruaunt gouernayle goo vessaile ageyne commaunde vnto myne eme kynge marke praye hym yf slayn bataille entere body hym semed best lete hym wete neuer yelde cowardyse yf slayne flee thenne haue lost truage yf soo flee yelde recreaut bydde myn eme neuer berye crysten beryels vpon thy lyf said syr trystram gouernayle come thou nyghe iland tyl thou see ouercomen slayne el wynne yonder knyght soo eyther departed sore pynge pcapitulum septimum thenne syr marhaus auysed syr trystram said thus yonge knyght syr trystram dost thou sore repenteth thy courage wete thou wel haue ben assayed best knyghtes land haue ben assayed hand also haue matched best knyghtes world therfor counceille retorne ageyne vnto thy vessaile faire knyght wel preued knyght said syre trystram thou shalt wel wete maye forsake quarel thy sake made knyght thou shalt wel wete kynges sone born goten vpon quene suche promyse haue made att neuews request myn owne sekyng shalle fyghte vnto vttermest delyuer cornewaile old truage also wete thou wel syr marhaus grettest cause thou couragest haue adoo thou art called one moost renoumed knyght world cause noyse fame thou hast thou gyuest courage haue adoo neuer yet preued good knyghte sythen toke ordre knyghthode day wel pleasyd maye haue adoo good knyght thou arte wete thou wel syr marhaus caste gete worship thy body yf preued trust god shal worshipfully preued vpon thy body delyuer countrey cornewaile euer fro al maner truage irland euer whanne syr marhau herde hym saye wold saide thenne thus ageyn fair knyght sy hen soo thou castest wynne worship lete wete worship may thou none lese yf thou mayst stande thre stroke lete wete noble dedes preued sene kyng arthur made knyghte table round thenne beganne feutre theyre speres mette soo fyersly gyders smote eyther doune bothe hors sir marhaus smote syr trystram grete wounde syde spere thenne auoyded horse pulled oute swerdes threwe sheldes afore thenne lasshed gyders men wyld couragyous whan hadde stryken soo gyder longe thenne lefte stroke foyned brethes vysours sawe myght preuaile thene hurt led gyders lyke rammes bere eyther doun thus fought stylle half day eyder wounded passyng sore blood ranne doune fresshly fro vpon ground thenne syr trystram waxed fressher syr marhaus better wynded bygger myghty stroke smote syr marhaus vpon helme suche buffet hit went thorou helme thorou coyfe stele thorou brayn pan swerd stak soo fast helme brayn pan sir trystram pulled thryes swerd euer myght pulle hede marhaus felle doun knee edge tristram swerd left brayne pan sodenly syr marhaus rose grouelynge threwe swerd shelde hym soo ranne shippes fledde waye sir tristram hadde euer shelde swerd whan sir tristram sawe sir marhaus withdrawe hym said sir knyght roud table withdrawest thou thou dost thy selfe thy kyn grete shame yong knyghte neuer preued rather shold withdrawe rather hewen c pyeces syr marhaus ansuerd worde yede way sore gronynge well sir knyght said sir tristram promy e thy suerd thy sheld shal myn thy sheld shalle al place ryde myn aduentures syghte kyng arthur alle round table pcapitulum viij anon sir marhaus felauship departed irland soone came kynge broder lete
