serche woundes p whan hede serched pyece syre trystrams swerd founden therin myghte neuer oute hede surgeon soo dyed syr trystrams swerd pyece swerd quene syster kepte hit euer wyth thoughte reuengyd myghte pnow torne ageyne vnto syr trystram sore wounded ful sore bled myyt within lytel whyle take cold vnnethe stere hym lymmes ne sette hym doune softely vpon lytel hylle bledde fast thenne anone came gouernaile man vessel kynge baron came procession ageynst hym whan come vnto land kynge marke toke hym armes kynge sir dynas senescal ladde syr tristram castel tyntygail thenne serched best maner leid bedde whan kynge marke sawe woundes wepte hertely soo dyd alle lordes god help said kyng mark wolde alle landes neuewe dyed soo syr trystram laye moneth euer lyke deye stroke sir marhaus smote hym fyrst spere frensshe book saith speres hede enuenymed syr trystram myghte hole thenne kynge mark alle baron passynge heuy demed none syr trystram shold recouer thenne kynge lete sende alle manere lech surgens bothe vnto men wymmen none wold behote hym lyf thenne came lady ryght wyse lady said playnly vnto kyng mark sir trystram alle baron shold neuer hole yf sire trystram wente countrey venym came fro countrey shold ho pe el neuer thus said lady vnto kynge whan kynge marke vnderstood lete purueye syr trystram faire vessel wel vytailled therin put syr trystram gouernail hym sir tristram toke harp hym soo putte see sayle irland soo good fortune arryued vp irland euen fast castel kynge quene arryuayl sat harped bedde mery lay suche one herd neuer none irland afore tyme pand whan told kyng quene suche knyght suche harper anone kyng sente hym lete serche woundes thenne asked hym name thenne ansuerd countrey lyonas name tramtryst thus wounded bataille fought ladyes ryght god help said kyng anguysshe ye shal haue al helpe land ye may haue lete wete cornewaile grete losse euer hadde kynge lost best knyghte world name marhaus ful noble knyghte knyght table round told syr trystra wherefore syr marhaus slayne syr trystram made sem blaunt ben sory better knewe hit kynge pcapitulum ix thenne kynge grete fauoure maade tramtryst put doughters ward kepyng cause noble surgeon whan serched hym fond bottome wound therin poyson soo heled hym within whyle therfore tramtrist cast grete loue la beals isoud tyme fairest mayde lady worlde tramtryst lerned harpe beganne haue grete fantasye vnto hym tyme sir palamydes sarasyn countrey wel cherysshed kynge quene euery day syr palamydes drewe vnto la beale isoud profered many yeftes loued passyngly wel al aspyed tramtryst ful wel knewe syr palamydes noble knyght myghty man wete ye wel syr tramtryst grete despyte syr palomydes la beale isoud told tramtryst palamydes wylle crystened sake thus ther grete enuy betwixe tramtryst syr palamydes thenne hit befelle kynge anguysshe lete crye grete iustes grete turnement lady called lady laundes nyghe cosyn vnto kynge man wanne thre dayes shold wedde haue alle landes crye made england walys scotland also fraunce bretayne befelle vpon day la beale isoud came vnto syr tramtryst told hym turnement ansuerd sayd fayr lady feble knyghte late ben dede good ladyship ben fayre lady wold ye shold doo matere wel ye wote lady maye iuste tramtryst said la beale isoud wille ye haue ado turnement wel wote syr palamydes shall doo maye therfore tramtryst pray el syr palamydes lyke wynne degree madame said tramtrist may soo proued knyght yong knyght late made fyrst batail dyd myshapped sore wounded ye see wyst ye wold better lady turnement ye wille kepe counceille lete creature haue knouleche shalle iuste self suche ye wil kepe counceil poure persone shall ieoparde sake perauentur sir palamydes shal knowe whan come therto said la beale isoud best said la beale isoud shal purueye hors armour deuyse ye soo hit said syr tra trist wille comaundement day iustes ther cam sir palamydes black sheld ouerthrew many knyghtes alle peple merueylle hym putte werse syr gawayne gaherys agrauayn bagdemagus kay dodyus le saueage sagramo le desyrus gumret le petyte gryflet le fyse de dieu alle fyrste daye syr palamydes strake doune erthe thenne alle maner knyghtes adred sir palamydes many called hym knyght black sheld soo day syre palamydes grete worshyp pthenne cam kynge anguysshe vnto tramtryst asked hym wold iuste syr said late hurte yet dare auenture pthenne came squyer sente kynges doughter fraunce vnto syr trystram whanne aspyed syre iristra felle flat feete alle aspyed la bele isoud curtosye squyer made vnto syr trystram therwith al sodenly syr trystram ranne vnto squyer who name hebe le renoumes praid hym hertely noo wyse telle name syr said hebe wille discouer name yf ye commaunde pcapitulum x thenne syr trystram asked hym dyd countreyes syr sayd came hyder syr gawayn made knyght yf please handes may made knyghte awaite vpon morn secretely feld shal make knyght thenne la beale isoud grete suspecyon vnto tramtryst somme man worship proued ther comforted self cast loue vnto hym done tofore pand soo morne syr palamydes maade hym redy come feld dyd fyrst day smote doune kynge c knyghtes kynge scottes pthenne la beale isoud ordeyned wel arayed syr trystram whyte hors harneis ryght soo lete putte hym oute preuy posterne soo came feld ben bryght angel anone syr palamydes aspyed hym ther feutrid spere vnto syr tramtrist ageyne vnto hym syr trystram smote doune syr palamydes vnto erth thenne grete noyse peple sayd syre palamydes hadde falle said knyght blak shelde falle wete wel la beale isoud passynge gladde thenne sire gawayne felawes ix merueille knyghte myght smyten doune syr palamydes thenne wold none iuste tramtryst alle forsoke hym moost lest thenne syr trystram made hebe knyght caused hym put hym self forthe dyd ryght wel day syr hebe held hym syr trystram whan syre palamydes receyued falle wete ye wel sore ashamed pryuely myght withdrewe hym oute feld alle aspyed syre trystram lyghtly rode syre palamydes ouertoke hym badde hym torne better wold assaye hym euer departed thenne syr palamydes torned hym eyther lasshed swerdes fyrste stroke syre trystram smote doune palamydes gaf hym suche stroke vpon hede felle erthe soo thenne tristram badde yelde hym doo commaundement el wold slee hym whan syre palamydes beheld countenaunce dredde buffet soo graunted al kynges wel said said sir tristram shalle charge fyrst vpon payne lyf ye forsake lady la beale isoud maner wyse ye drawe also twelue moneth day ye bere none armour none harneis werre pnow promyse shalt thou dye allas saide palamydes euer ashamed pthenne sware syr trystram hadde commaunded hym thenne despyte anger syre palamydes cutte harneis threwe aweye soo syr trystram torned ageyne castel la beale isoud weye mette damoysel asked syre launcelot wanne dolorous gard worshipfully damoysel asked sire tristram tolde smote doune syr palamydes x knyghtes kynge arthur smyten doune thenne damoysel prayd syr trystram telle h whether syr launcelot du lake demyd knyght world myghte suche dedes armes yf launcelot fayre damoysel sayd syr trystram wete ye wel syr launcelot neuer suche prowesse god al maye make good knyght good knyght sir lau celot gentyl knyght said put vp thy vysure whan beheld vysage thouyt sawe neuer better ma vysage better farynge knyght thenne whan damoysel knewe certaynly syre launcelot thenne took leue departed hym thenne syre trystram rode pryuely vnto posterne kepte hym la beale isoud made hym good chere thanked god good spede soo anone within whyle kynge quene vnderstood hit tramtryst smote doune syre palamydes thenne moche made pcapitulum xj thus sir tramtryst longe wel cherysshed kynge quene namely labeale isoud vpon daye quene la beale isoud made bayne syre tramtryst whan bayne quene isoud doughter romed vp doune chamber whyles gouernail hebe attendyd vpon tramtryst quene beheld swerd laye vpon bedde thene vnhap quene drewe oute swerd beheld longe whyle bothe thoughte passynge fayre swerd within foote half poynte grete pyece oute broken edge whan quene aspyed gap swerd remembryd pyece swerd foude brayne pan syre marhaus good knyght broder allas thenne said vnto doughter la beale isoud traytour knyghte slewe broder thyn eme whanne isoud herd saye soo passynge sore abasshed passyng wel loued tramtryst ful wel knewe cruelnes moder quene anon alle quene went vnto owne chamber soughte cofre toke oute pyece swerd pulled syr marhaus hede dede thenne ranne pyece yron swerd laye vpon bedde whanne putte pyece stele yron vnto swerd hit mete myghte whan newe broken ne quene gryped swerd hand fyersly alle myghte ranne streyghte vpon tramtryst sat bayne hadde ryued hym thorou hadde syr hebe goten armes pulled suerd el hadde threst hym thorou thenne whanne lettyd euyl wylle ranne kynge anguyssh husband sayde knee lord haue ye hous traitour knyght slewe broder seruaunt noble knyght syr marhaus said kynge anguysshe syr said hit syr tramtryst knyght doughter helyd allas said kynge therfore ryght heuy ful noble knyght euer sawe felde pbut charge said kyng quene ye haue ado knyght lete dele hym thenne kynge went chambre vnto syr tramtryst thenne gone vnto chambre kynge fond hym al redy armed mounte vpon hors whanne kynge sawe hym al redy armed goo vnto horsbak kynge said nay tramtryst hit wille auaile compare ageynst thus moche shalle doo worship thy loue soo moch thou arte within courte hit worship slee therfore vpon condycyon wille gyue leue departe courte saufte thou wilt telle thy fader thy name yf thou slewe syr marhaus broder pcapitulum xij syr said trystram shalle telle alle trouthe faders name sir melyodas kynge lyonas moder hyyt elyzabeth sister vnto kynge marke cornewaile moder dyed foreste cause therof commaunded dyed whan crystened shold crystene trystram cause wold knowen countrey turned name lete calle tramtryst truage cornewayle fought myn emes sake ryght cornewaile ye posseded many yeres wete ye well said trystram vnto kynge dyd bataille loue myn vnkel kynge marke loue countreye cornewaile encreace myn honoure day fought sir marhaus made knyyt neuer dyd bataile knyght frome went alyue lefte sheld suerd behynde god helpe said kyng may say ye dyd knyght shold part doo quarel encreace worship knyght shold may mayntene countrey worship onles shold displease baron wyf kyn syr said trystram thanke good lordship haue grete goodenes lady doughter hath shewed therfor said sir tristram may happen ye shalle wynne lyf dethe partyes englond may happen may doo scruyse season ye shal glad euer ye shewed good lordship pwith promyse true knyyt place shal lady douyters seruaunt knyyt ryght wrong shal neuer fayle doo moche knyght maye doo palso byseche good grace may take leue lady doughter alle baron knyghtes wille wel said kynge pthenne sire tristram wente vnto la beale isoud tooke leue thenne tolde chaunged name cause wold knowen hou lady told hym yt shold neuer hole tyl cam coutrey poyson made thorou nere dethe ladyship ben gentyl knyght said la beale isoud ful wo thy departynge sawe neuer man oughte soo good wille wepte hertely madame said sire trystram ye shalle vnderstande name sir trystram de lyones goten kyng melyodas borne quene promyse feythfully shal alle dayes lyf knyghte gramercy said la beale isoud promyse ageynste shalle maryed seuen yeres assent whome ye wille shalle maryed hym wylle haue wille haue yf ye wil consente thenne syre trystram gaf rynge gaf hym another ther departed fro leuynge makynge grete dole lamentacion streyghte wente vnto courte amonge alle baron took leue moost leest openly said amonge faire lordes soo muste departe yf ony man haue offended vnto ony man greued lete complayne hym afore euer depart shal amende vnto power yf ony wil profer wronge say wrong shame behynde bak saye hit neuer body make good body ageynst body alle stood stylle ther one wold saye one word yet knyghtes quenes blood sire marbaus blood wold medle hym pcapitulum xiij soo sir tristram departed toke see good wynde arryued vp tyntagyl cornewaile whan kyng mark hole prosperite ther cam tydynges sir tristram arryued hole woundes therof kynge marke passyng glad soo alle baron whan sawe tyme rode vnto fader kyng melyodas al chere kyng quene coude make hym thenne largely kyng melyodas quene departed landes goodes sire trystram pthenne lycence kyng melyodas fader retorned ageyne vnto court kynge mark lyued grete ioye long tyme vntyl laste befelle ialousye vnkyndenes betwyxe kynge marke sir tristram loued bothe one lady erles wyf hyght syre segwarydes lady loued syre trystram passyngly wel loued ageyne passynge fayr lady aspyed sir tristram wel p thenne kynge mark vnderstood ialous kyng marke loued passyngly wel soo felle vpon day lady sent dwerf vnto sir tristram badde hym loued wold nyyt nexte folowynge also charged ye come yf ye wel armed lord called good knyghte psyre trystram answerd dwerf recommaunde vnto lady telle wille fayle wille terme hath sette ansuer dwerf departed kynge marke aspyed dwerfe syre trystram vpon message segwarydes wyf thenne kyng marke sent dwerfe whanne comen maade dwerf force telle hym alle wherfore came message sire tristram pnow said kynge marke goo thou wolt vpon payne dethe thou saye word thou spakest soo dwerf departed kynge pand nyghte steuen sette betwixt segwarydes wyfe syr trystram kynge marke armed hym made hym redy took two knyghtes counceylle hym soo rode afore abyde waye awayte vpon sir trystram pand sire trystram came rydynge vpon hys waye spere hand kynge marke came hurtlynge vpon hym two knyghtes sodenly alle thre smote hym theyre speres kynge marke hurte syre trystram brest ryght sore thenne syre tristram feutryd spere smote vnkel kynge marke soo sore rasshyd hym erthe brysed hym laye stylle swoune longe hit euer myghte welde hym self thenne ranne one knyght ef e smote hem cold erthe laye stylle ther alle sir tristram rode forthe sore wounded lady fonde abydynge hym posterne pcapitulum xiiij welcomed hym fayre eyther halsed armes soo lete putte vp hors best wyse thenne vnarmed hym soo soup lyghtely wente bedde grete ioye plesaunce soo ragyng took kepe grene wound kynge marke gyuen hym soo syr tristram bebled ouer shete nether pelowes hede shete within whyle ther came one afore warned lord nere hand within bowe draughte soo made sir trystram aryse soo armed hym tooke hors departed thenne come segwarydes lord whan fond bedde troubled broken wente nere beheld candel lyghte thenne sawe layne wounded knyght fals traitresse thenne said hast thou bitrayed alle swange oute swerd said yf thou telle hath ben thou shalt dye lord mercy sayd lady helde vp handes sayeng slee shall telle alle hath ben telle anone said segwarydes alle trouthe anone drede saide sir trystram way came ward sore wounded fals traitresse said segwarides become sir said armed departed ho e bak yet hen half myle ye saye wel said segwarydes thenne armed hym lyghtly gate hors rode syre tristram rode streyght waye vnto tyntagyl within whyle ouertoke sire tristram thenne adde hym torne fals traitour knyghte syr tristram anon torned hym ageynst hym al segwarides smote syr trystram spere alle braste pand thenne swange oute swerd smote fast syr tristram syre knyght said syre trystram counceyle ye smyte wronges haue done wille forbere longe maye pnay sayd segwarides shalle outher thou shalt dye thenne syre tristram drewe oute swerd hurtled hors vnto hym fyersly thorou waste body smote syre segwarides felle erthe swoune soo sire tristram departed lefte hym soo rode vnto tyntagil tooke lodgynge secretely wold knowen hurte palso sir segwarides men rode theyr maister whome fond lyenge feld sore wounded brouyt hym home shelde lay longe hole laste recouerd p also kynge marke wold aknowen sir tristram hadde mette nyght syre trystram knewe kynge marke mette hym soo kynges astau ce came sir tristram comforte hym laye seke bedde longe kynge marke lyued loued neuer sire trystram though fayre speche loue none thus past many wekes dayes alle forgyuen forgoten sire segwarydes durste haue ado sir tristram cause noble prowesse also cause neuewe vnto kynge marke therfore lete ouer slyp hath pryuy hurte loth haue shame outward pcapitulum xv thenne hit befelle vpon daye good knyghte bleoberys de ganys broder blamore de ganys nyghe cosyn vnto good knyght sir launcelot du lake bleoberys came vnto courte kynge marke asked kynge marke bone gyue hym yeft wold aske courte pwhanne kyng herd hym aske soo merueilled hys askynge cause knyghte round table grete renomme kynge marke graunted hym hole askynge thenne saide sire bleoberys wille haue fayrest lady courte lyst chese maye say nay sayd kynge marke chese youre aduenture soo sir bleoberys dyd chese syr segwarydes wyf toke hand soo wente waye soo tooke hors gart sette behynde squyer rode vpon way sir segwarydes herd telle lady gone knyght kynge arthur courte pthenne armed hym rode knyght rescowe lady soo whan bleoberys gone lady kyng mark courte wroth awey thenne certayne ladyes knewe grete loue bitwene sir tristram also lady loued sir tristram aboue alle knyghtes thenne one lady rebuked sir tristram horryblest wyse called hym coward knyghte wold shame knyghthode see lady soo shamefully taken aweye fro vnkels courte ment eyther hem hadde loued entiere hert sire tristram ansuerd thus faire lady parte haue adoo suche mater whyle lord husband present yf hit hadde ben lord hadde ben courte thenne worship courte perauentur wold haue ben champyon yf sir segwarides spede wel may happen wille speke good knyght euer passe countrey thenne within whyle came one sir segwarydes squyers told court sir segwarides beten sore wounded poynte dethe wold haue rescowed lady sir bleoberis ouerthrewe hym sore hath wounded hym thenne kynge marke heuy therof alle courte sire tristram herd ashamed sore greued thenne soone armed horsbak gouernaile seruaunt bare shelde spere soo sire tristram rode fast mette sir andret cosyn commaundement kynge marke sente brynge forth euer laye power ij knyghtes arthur courte rode countrey seke aduentures whan syr trystram sawe sir andret asked hym tydynges soo god helpe said syre andret ther neuer worse commaundement kynge mark sente fetche two knyghtes kynge arthur courte one bete wounded sette nought message faire cosyn said sir tristram ryde way yf may mete may happen shal reuenge syr andret rode cornewaile syr tristram rode two knyghtes whiche one hyght sagramor le desyrus hyght dodynas le saueage pcapitulum xvj thenne within whyle syr trystram sawe hem afore hym two lykely knyghtes sir said gouernaile vnto maister sir wold counceile nought haue ado hem ben two preued knyghtes arthur courte said syr trystram haue ye doute wille haue adoo hem encreace worship many daye sythen dyd ony dedes armes doo ye lyste said gouernaile alle anone syr trystram asked whens came wheder wold dyd tho march syre sagramore loked vpon syre tristram hadde scorne wordes asked hym ageyne fair knyghte ye knyght cornewaile aske ye hit said sir tristram seldom sene said sir sagramore ye cornysshe knyghtes ben valyaunte men armes within two houres mette v one cornysshe knyghtes grete wordes spak anon lytel myght leyd erthe trowe sayd sir sagramore ye shal haue handsel hadde faire lordes said sire tristram may soo happen maye better withstande dyd whether ye nyl wil haue ado cause cosyn ye bete therfore best wete ye wel yf ye quyte better vpon ground one knyyt cornewaile shal bete whan sire dodynas le saueage herd hym saye soo gatte spere hand said sire knyghte thy self thenne departed came gyders ben thonder syr dodynas spere brast sonder syr trystram smote hym myght smote hym clene ouer hors croupe nyghe hadde broken neck whanne syre sagramour sawe felawe haue suche falle merueylled knyyt myght dresseth spere alle myght syr trystram ageynst hym came gyders thonder ther sir tristram smote syr sagramore stronge buffet bare hors hym erthe fallyng brake thygh whan done syr trystram asked hem fayre knyghtes ye ony bygger knyytes courte kynge arthur shame say v knyytes cornewayle dishonoure may happen cornysshe knyght may matche trouthe said syr sagramore haue wel preued requyre sayd syre sagramore telle v youre ryght name feythe trouthe ye owe hyghe ordre knyghthode ye charge grete thynge said syr trystram sythen ye lyst wete hit ye shal knowe vnderstande name syr trystram de lyonas kynge melyodas sone neuewe vnto kynge marke thenne two knyghtes fayne mette trystram soo praid hym abyde felauship nay said sire tristram must haue ado one felawes name syr bleoberys de ganys god spede wel said syr sagramore dodynas syre trystram departed rode ward waye thenne ware hym valeye rode syr bleoberys sir segwarydes lady rode behynde squyer vpon palfroy pcapitulum xvii thene syr trystram rode paas vntyl ouertake hym thenne spak syr trystram abyde said knyght arthur courte brynge ageyne lady delyuer wille doo neyther said bleoberys drede cornysshe knyght soo sore lyste delyuer said syr tristram may cornysshe knyght doo wel another knyght daye two knyghtes courte within thre myle mette euer departed fonde cornyssh knyght good ynough bothe name said bleoberis told said syr trystram one hyghte syr sagramore le desyrus hyghte dodynas le saueage said syr bleoberys haue ye met soo god helpe two good knyghtes men grete worship yf ye haue bete bothe ye must nedes good knyght yf soo ye haue bete bothe yet shalle ye fere ye shalle bete euer ye haue thys lady thenne defende said syr tristram soo departed came gyder lyke thonder eyder bare doune hors alle erthe thenne auoyded horse lasshed gyder egerly swerdes myghtely tracyng trauersynge ryght hand lyfte hand two houres somtyme rasshed gyder suche myght laye bothe grouelynge ground thenne sir bleoberis de ganys starte abak said thus gentyl good knyght whyle hold handes lete v speke gyders saye ye wille said trystram wille ansuere sire saide bleoberys wold wete whens ye ye come name soo god help said syr trystram fere telle name wete ye wel kynge melyodas sone moder kyng markes sister name sir tristram de lyonas kynge marke myn vnkel truly said bleoberys ryght gladde ye slewe marhaus knyght hand hand iland truage cornewaile also ye ouercame sir palamydes good knyght turnement iland ye bete sir gawayne nyne felawes soo god helpe said sir trystram wete ye wel knyyt haue told name telle good wete ye wel name sir bleoberys g n broder hyghte sire blamore de ganys called good knyght syster child vnto lord sir laucelot du lake calle one best knyghtes world trouthe said sir tristram sir launcelot called pierles curtosy knyghthode sake said sir trystram good wille fyghte grete loue haue sir launcelot du lake good feith said bleoberys wille lothe fyghte sythen ye folowe haue lady shal profer kyndenys curtosy gentilnes right vpon ground lady shalle betwixe v bothe whome wille go lete hym haue pee wille wel said tristra deme wille leue come ye shalle preue hit anone said bleoberys pcapitulum xviij soo whan sette betwixe bothe sayd wordes vnto sir tristram wete ye wel syr tristram de lyones late thou man world moost loued trusted wende thou haddest loued ageyne aboue alle ladyes whan thou sawest knyght lede awey thou madest chere rescowe suffred lord segwarydes ryde vn tyl tyme wend thou haddest loued therfore wille leue neuer loue alle went vnto sir bleoberys whan syr tristram sawe doo soo wonderly wrothe lady ashamed come courte sir tristram said sir bleoberys ye defaute ladyes wordes day trusted aboue alle erthely knyghtes saith ye haue deceyued therfore wete ye wel ther may noo man hold wille aweye rather ye shold hertely displeasyd wold ye wold abyde nay said lady god help wil neuer goo hym loued wende loued therfore sire trystram said ryde thou cam though thou haddest ouercome knyyt ye lykely neuer wold haue gone shall pray knyghte soo faire knyghthode euer passe countrey wille lede abbeye lord syr segwarydes lyeth soo god helpe said bleoberis lete yow wete good knyght sire trystram cause kynge marke gaf choyse yefte courte lady lyked best withstandynge wedded hath lord haue fulfylled quest shall sent vnto husband ageyne especyal moost youre sake sir trystram yf wold goo wold ye thanke said syr trystram loue shal beware manere lady shalle loue truste lord syr segwarydes ben away courte shold haue ben fyrst shold haue folowed yow sythen ye haue refused true knyght shalle knowe passyngly wel shal loue trust soo took theyr leue one fro thother departed soo sir tristram rode vnto tyntagyl syr bleoberys rode vnto abbay syr segwarydes lay sore wounded delyuerd lady departed noble knyght whan sir segwarydes sawe lady gretely comforted thenne told hym sir trystram done grete bataill syre bleoberys caused hym brynge ageyne wordes pleasyd sir segwarydes ryght wel sir tristram wold doo soo moche soo lady told alle bataill vnto kynge marke betwixe syr trystram sir bleoberys pcapitulum xix thenne whanne done kynge mark cast alweyes hert myght destroye syr tristram thenne ymagyned hym self sende sir tristram irland la beale isoud sir trystram soo preysed beaute goodnes kynge mark said wold wedde vpon praid syr trystram take wey irland hym message done entente slee syr tristram withstandynge syr trystram wold reffuse message dauger peryl myght falle pleasyr vnkel goo made hym redy goodlyest wyse myght deuysed sir tristram tooke hym mooste goodlyest knyghtes myght fynde courte arayed gyse thenne vsed goodlyest maner sir tristram departed toke see alle felauship anone brode see tempest toke hym felauship drofe bak coste england arryued fast camelot ful fayne take land pand whan landed sir tristram sette vp pauelione vpon land camelot lete hange shelde vpon pauelione day came two knyghtes kynge arthur one sir ector de mary sir morganor touched shelde badde hym come oute pauelione iust wold iust ye shalle ansuerd said sir tristram ye wille tarye lytel whyle soo made hym redy fyrste smote doune sir ector de mary smote doune sir morganor alle one spere sore brysed whan laye vpon erthe asked sir tristram countrey knyghte faire lordes said sir tristram wete ye wel cornewaile allas said sire ector ashamed euer ony cornysshe knyghte shold ouercome thenne despyte syre ector put armour fro hym wente foot wold ryde pcapitulum xx thenne felle sire bleoberys sire blamore de ganys bretheren hadde assomoned kyng anguysshe irland come arthur court vpon payne forfeture kyng arthur good grace yf kynge irland came day assigned sette kynge shold lese landes hit happend day assigned kyng arthur neither sire launcelot myght gyue iugement kynge arthur sir launcelot castel ioyous gard kynge arthur assigned kyng carados kyng scottes day iuges whan kynges camelot kynge anguysshe irland come knowe accusars thenne blamore de ganys appeled kynge irland treason hadde slayne cosyn courte irland treason kyng sore abasshed accusacion come att somons kynge arthur c camelot wist wherfore sente whanne kyng herd sir blamor saye wille vnderstood wel none remedy ansuere hym knyghtly custome suche tho dayes ony man appealed ony treason murther shold fyghte body body el fynde another knyght hym alle maner murtherers tho dayes callid treason whan kyng anguysshe vnderstood accusynge passynge heuy knewe sir blamor de ganys noble knyght noble knyghtes comen thenne kynge irland symply purueyed ansuere therfore iuges gaf hym respyte thyrdde daye gyue ansuere soo kynge departed vnto lodgynge mean whyle ther came lady sir trystrams pauelione makyng grete dole eyleth said sir tristram ye make suche dole fayre knyght said lady ashamed onles som good knyght helpe grete lady worship sente fayre child ryche vnto sir launcelot du lake mette knyghte threwe doune fro palfray took aweye child wel lady said syr tristram lord syr launcelots sake shalle gete child ageyne el shalle beten hit soo sire tristram tooke hors asked lady whiche wey knyght rode thenne tolde hym rode hym within whyle ouertoke knyght thenne syr tristram badde hym corne gyue ageyne child pcapitulum xxj knyghte torned hors made hym redy fyghte thenne sir trystram smote hym swerd suche buffet tombled erthe thenne yelded hym vnto sir tristram thenne come thy waye sayd sire trystram brynge child lady ageyne soo took hors wekely rode sir trystram thenne waye syr trystram asked hym name thenne said name breunis saunte pyte soo whanne hadde delyuerd child lady said sir child wel remedyed thenne sir trystram lete hym goo ageyne sore reyentyd hym grete oo vnto many good knyghtes kynge arthur courte pthenne whan sir tristram pauelione gouernaile man cam told hym kynge anguysshe irland come thyder putte grete distresse gouernaile told sir trystram kynge anguysshe somoned appealed murther soo god help said sir tristram ben best tydynges euer cam vij yere shalle kynge irland haue nede helpe dare saye knyght countrey arthur courte dare doo bataille syre blamore de ganys wynne loue kyng irland wil take batail vpon therfor gouernaile brynge charge kyng thenne gouernaile wente vnto kynge anguysshe irland sal wed hym fayre kynge welcomed hym asked hym wolde syr saide gouernaile knyghte nere hande desyreth speke badde saye wolde doo seruyse knyght saide kynge syr said hit sir tristram du yonas good grace ye shewed hym landes wyll rewarde countreyes come felawe said kynge anone shewe vnto sir trystram soo kyng took lytel hackney fewe felauship vntyl came vnto sir trystrams pauelione whanne syre trystram sawe kynge ranne vnto hym wold haue holden styrope kynge lepte hors lyghtly eyther hal ed armes gracious lord sayde sire trystram gramercy grete goodness shewed vnto march landes tyme promysed doo seruyse euer laye power gentyl knyght said kynge vnto sir tristram haue grete nede neuer soo grete nede knyghtes helpe soo good lord said sire trystram shalle telle said kynge assomoned appeled fro countrey deth knyght kyn vnto good knyght sir launcelot wherfor sir blamor de ganys broder sir bleoberys hath appeled fyghte hym outher fynde knyght stede wel wote said kyng come kynge ban blood sir launcelot passynge good knyghtes hard men wynne bataille ony knowe lyuynge syre said sir trystram good lordship ye shewed irland lady youre doughters sake la beale isoud wille take bataille vpon condycyon ye shalle graute two thynges one ye shal swere ye ryght ye neuer consentynge knyytes dethe syr thenne said sir tristram haue done bataille yf god yeue grace spede ye shalle gyue reward thynge resonable wille aske soo god help said kyng ye shal haue someuer ye aske wel said said sir trystram pcapitulum xxij make ansuer youre champyon redy shalle dye quarel rather r r aunt haue doubte said kynge ye shold haue adoo sir launcelot du lake syr said sir tristram sire launcelot called noblest knyghte worlde wete ye wel knyghtes blood noble men drede shame bleoberys broder syr blamor haue done bataille hym therfore vpon hede shame calle hym good knyght noysed said kynge blamor hardyer knyghte ire lete hym shal neuer refused best knyght bereth shelde spere soo kyng anguysshe departed vnto kynge carados kynges tyme iuges told hem hadde fonde champyon redy thenne commaundementes kynges sir blamor de ganys sire tristram sente charge whan come beforne iuges many kynges knyghtes biheld sire tristram moche speche hym cause slewe sir haus good knyght cause foriusted sir palomydes good knyght pso taken theire charge withdrewe hem make hem redy doo bataile thenne said sir bleoberys broder sir blamore fayr dere broder remembre kyn come man sir launcelot du lake neyther ferther nere brother child ther neuer none oure kyn euer shamed bataille rather suffre deth broder shamed broder said blamore haue ye doute shal neuer shame none blood hou sure yonder knyghte called passynge good knyght tyme one world yet shal neuer yelde say lothe word wel may happen smyte doun grete myyt chyualry rather shalle slee shal yelde recreaunt god spede wel said bleoberys ye shal fynde hym myghtyest knyght euer ye hadde ado knowe hym haue ado hym god spede said blamor de ganys therwith tooke hors one ende lystes sire trystram atte ende lystes soo f utryd theyre speres came gyders ben thonder sir tristram thorou grete myght smote doune sir blamore hors erthe thenne anone sir blamor auoyded hors pulled oute swerd threwe shelde afore hym ladde sir trystram alyghte though hors hath failed truste god erthe wil faile thenne syre trystram alyght dressid hym vnto batail lasshed gyder strongly racyng tracyng foynynge dasshyng many sad stroke kynges knyghtes g te wonder myghte stande euer fought lyke wood men neuer knyghtes sene fyghte fyersly dyd sire blamore hasty wold haue rest alle men wondred brethe stande foot alle place blody fought laste syre tristram smote sir blamor suche buffet vpon helme felle donne vpon syde sir trystram stode beheld hym pcapitulum xxiij thenne whan sir blamor myghte speke said thus syre tristram de lyones requyre thou art noble knyghte best knyghte euer fond thou wilt slee oute wold lyue made lord alle erth haue leuer dye worship lyue shame nedes sir tristram thou must slee el thou shalt neuer wynne feld wille neuer saye lothe word therfore yf thou dare slee slee requyre whanne sir tristram herd hym saye soo knyghtely wyste doo hym remembryng hym bothe partyes blood comen sir launcelots sake wold lothe slee hym party wyse myghte chese must make hym saye lothe word el slee hym thenne syre tristram starte alak went kynges iuges ther kneled doun fore hem besoughte hem worshippes kynge arthur sir laucelots sake wold take mater theyr handes fayre lordes said sir tristram hit shame pyte noble knyght yonder lyeth shold slayne ye wel shamed wille pray god neuer slayne shamed kyng whome fyghte fore shalle requyre hym true champyon true knyght felde wille haue mercy vpon knyghte god helpe said kynge anguysshe wil sake syre tristram ruled ye wylle haue knowe true knyghte pand therfore wylle hertely pray kynges ben iuges take hit theire handes kynges iuges called syr bleoberys asked hym aduyse pmy lordes said bleoberys though broder beten hath wers thorou myghte armes dare saye though syre trystram hath beten body hath beten herte thanke god shamed daye rather shold shamed requyre sayd bleoberys lete sir tristram slee hym oute shalle soo said kynges parte aduersary bothe kynge champyon haue pyte syre blamors knyghthode lordes said bleoberys wille ryght wel ye wille pthenne kynges called kynge irland fond hym goodely tretabyl thenne alle aduyses syre tristram syre bleoberys toke vp sire blamore two bretheren accorded kynge anguysshe kyssed made frendys euer thenne sire blamor sire trystram kyssed gyders made othes wold neuer none two betheren fyghte syre trystram syre trystram made oth gentyl bataille alle blood syre launcelot loued sire trystram euer pthenne kynge anguysshe syre tristram toke theire leue ande sailed irland grete noblesse ioye psoo whanne irland kynge lete make knowen thoroute alle land manere syre trystram done hym p thenne quene alle made moost hym myghte ioye la beale isoud made syr tristram myghte tonge telle alle men erthely loued hym moost pcapitulum xxiiij thenne vpon daye kynge anguysshe asked syr tristram asked bone someuer promysed hym shold haue hit withoute fayle syre sayd sire trystram hit tyme alle wylle desyre ye wylle gyue la beale isoud youre doughter self myn vnkel kynge marke shalle haue wyf soo haue promysed hym allas said kynge leuer alle land haue ye wold wedde youre self syre dyd shamed euer world fals promyse therfore said sire trystram praye hold promyse ye promysed desyre ye wylle gyue la beale isoud goo cornewaile wedded kynge marke myn vnkel p sayd kynge anguysshe ye shalle haue doo please saye yf ye lyst wedde self leuest yf ye wille gyue vnto kynge marke youre vnkel youre choyse psoo make short conclusion la beale isoud made redy goo syre trystram dame bragwayne wente chyef gentylwoman many thenne quene isouds moder gaf dame bragwayne doughters gentilwoman vnto gouernaile drynke charged day kynge marke shold wedde daye shold gyue hym drynke soo kynge marke shold drynke la beale isoud thenne said quene vndertake eyther shalle loue dayes lyf soo drynke yeuen vnto dame bragwayne vnto gouernaile thenne anone syre trystram tooke see la beale isoud whan theire caban hit happed soo thursty sawe lytel flacked gold stande hit semed coloure taste noble wyn thenne sire trystram toke flacket hand sayd madame isoud best drynke euer ye drank dame bragwayne youre mayden gouernayle seruaunt haue kepte self thenne lough made good chere eyther dranke frely thoughte neuer drynke euer dranke soo swete soo good theyr drynke bodyes loued eyther wel neuer theyr loue departed wele neyther wo thus happed loue fyrste betwixe sire tristram la beale isoud whiche loue neuer departed dayes lyf soo thenne sayled tyl fortune came nyghe castel hyght pluere arryued repose wenyng haue hadde good herborouy anon sir trystram castel taken prysoners customme castel suche rode castel brought ony lady must nedes fyghte lord hyghte breunor yf soo breunor wanne feld thenne shold knyght straunger lady putte dethe euer yf hit straunge knyghte wanne feld sir breunor thenne shold dye lady bothe custome vsed many wynters hit called castel pluere saye wepynge castel pcapitulum xxv thus sire trystram la beale isoud pryson hit happed knyght lady came vnto chere haue merueille said tristram vnto knyyt lady cause lord castel holdeth v pryson hit neuer custome place worship euer came whan knyghte lady asked herborugh receyue hem destroye ben gestes syr said knygyt old custome castel whan knyght cometh must nedes fyghte lord weyker muste lese hede whan done yf lady bryngeth fouler lordes wyf must lese heede yf fayrer preued oure lady thenne shal lady castel lese heede soo god help said sire tristram fowle custome shameful one auau tage haue said sir trystram haue lady fayre ynouy fayrer sawe neuer alle lyfe dayes doubte lack beaute shalle lese heed rather shold lese heede wille fyghte hit fayre felde p wherfore syre knyght pray telle lord wille redy morne lady selfe doo batail yf hit maye haue hors myne armour syre said knyght vndertake youre desyre shalle spedde ryght wel thenne sayd take youre rest loke ye vp tymes make redy lady ye shall wante thynge behoueth ther departed morne tymes knyghte came sire trystram fetched hym oute lady brouyte hym hors armour owne badde hym make hym redy feld alle estate comyns lordship redy behold bataille iugement p thenne came syre breunor lord castel wyth lady hand muffeld asked syre trystram lady thy lady fayrer myn wyth thy swerd smyte ladyes hede yf lady fayrer myn swerd muste stryke heed yf maye wynne yet shalle thy lady myne thou shalt lese thy hede psyre said trystram fowle custome horryble rather lady shold lese heed yet leuer lese hede pnay nay said sire breunor ladyes shalle fyrst shewed gyder one shalle haue iugement nay wille soo said sire tristram none wille gyue ryghteuous iugement doubte said sir tristram lady fayrer thyne wille preue make good hand someuer wille saye contrary wille preue hit hede sire tristram shewed la beale isoud torned thryes aboute naked swerd hand whanne syre breunor sawe dyd wyse torne lady whanne syre breunor beheld la beale isoud hym thought sawe neuer fayrer lady thenne dradde ladyes hede shold soo al peple present gaf iugement la beale isoud fayrer lady better made said sir tristra semeth pyte lady shold lose heed cause thou long tyme haue vsed wycked custome bothe haue many good knyghtes ladyes ben destroyed cause losse destroye bothe soo god help said sir breunor saye thy lady fayrer myn sore repenteth soo peple pryuely saye alle wymmen sawe none soo fayre therfor thou wilt slee lady doute shal slee haue thy lady pthou shalt wynne said sir trystram dere euer knyyt wan lady cause thyn owne iugement thou woldest haue done lady yf ben fouler cause euyl custome gyue thy lady said trystram alle sir tristram strode vnto hym toke lady hym auke stroke smote hede clene wel knyght said sir breunor hast thou done despyte pcapitulum xxvj take thyn hors sythen lady le wil wyn thy lady may thenne took horse came gyders hit ben thonder sire trystram smote sir breunor clene hors lyytely rose vp sir trystram came ageyne hym threst hors thorou oute sholders hors hurled felle dede ground euer sir breunor ranne haue slayne sire tristram sire tristram lyght nymel voyded hors lightely euer sir trystram myght dresse sheld swerd gaf hym thre foure sadde stroke p thenne rasshed gyders like two bore tracyng trauercyng myytely wysely two noble knyghtes sire breunor proued knyghte hadde ben dethe many good knyghtes pyte long endured thus fouyt hurlyng nyy two houres eyder wounded sore thenne last sir breunor rasshed vpon sir trystram tooke hym armes trusted moche strengthe thenne sir trystram called strengest hyest knyght world called byggar sir laucelot sir launcelot better brethed soo anone sire trystram thrust syr breunor doune grouelynge thenne vnlaced helme strake hede thenne al longed castel cam hym dyd hym homage feaute prayenge hym wold abyde stylle litel whyle fordo foule custom syr trystram graunted ther meane whyle one knyghtes castel rode vnto sire galahad haut prynce whiche sir breunors sone whiche noble knyyt told hym mysauenture fader hadde moder pcapitulum xxvij thenne came sir galahad kyng honderd knyghtes hym syr galahad profered fyghte sir trystram hand hand soo made redy go vnto bataile horsbak grete courage thenne sir galahad sir trystram mette gyders soo hard eyder bare doune hors alle erthe thene auoyded horse noble knyghtes dressid theire sheldes drewe swerdes wi h ire rancour lasshed gyder many sadde stroke one whyle strykynge another whyle foynynge tracynge trauersynge noble knyghtes thus fought long nere half day eyder sore wounded last sire trystram waxed lyghte bygge doubled stroke drofe syr galahad abak one syde lyke haue ben slayne came kynge honderd knyghtes felauship went fyersly vp sir tristram whan sir trystram sawe comyng vpon hym thenne wist wel myghte endure pthene wyse knyght werre said sir galahaud haut prynce syre ye shewe knyghthode suffre alle youre men haue adoo al one pand semeth ye noble knyghte handes hit grete shame god helpe said sire galahad none waye thou must yelde outher el dye said sir galahad sir trystram wille rather yelde dye myght men handes ther alle sir trystram tooke owne suerd poynte put pomel hand sir galahad alle came kynge honderd knyghtes hard beganne assaylle sir trystram lete said sir galahad ye soo hardy touche hym haue gyuen knyght lyf youre shame said kynge c knyghtes hath slayne fader moder said syre galahad may wyte hym gretely fader hym pryson enforced hym doo bataill hym fader suche customme shameful custome knyght came aske herborouh lady must nedes deye yf fayrer moder yf fader ouercame knyght must nedes deye shameful customme vsage knyghte herberowe askynge haue suche herborage pand customme wold neuer drawe aboute hym god helpe said kynge shameful customme truly said syre galahad soo semed semed ben grete pyte knyght shold haue ben slayne dare saye noblest man bereth lyf yf sir lau celot du lake fayre knyght said sir galahad requyre telle thy name whens thou arte whyder thou wolt syr said name sir trystram du lyones kynge marke cornewaile sente message vnto kynge anguysshe irland fetche doughter wyf redy go cornewaile name la beale isoud sir trystram said sir galahad haut prynce wel ye fonde march soo ye wille promyse goo vnto syr launcelot du lake accompanye hym ye shalle goo ye wylle fayre lady shalle promyse neuer al dayes shal suche custommes vsed castel haue ben vsed syr said syre trystram lete wete soo god helpe wende ye ben syr launcelot du lake whan sawe fyrste therfore dredde sire promyse said sir tristram soone may wille see sir launcelot enfelaushippe hym alle knyghtes world moost desyre felouship pcapitulum xxviij thene sir tristram took leue whan sawe tyme tooke see meane whyle word came vnto sir launcelot sir trystram sire carados myghty kynge made lyke gyaunt fought sir gawayn gaf hym suche stroke swouned sadel took hym coller pulled hym oute sadel fast bounde hym sadel bowe rode wey hym toward castell rode fortune sir launcelot mette sire carados anone knewe sire gawayne lay bounde hym said sir launcelot vnto sire gawayne stande neuer hard said sir gawayn onles ye helpe god help without ye rescowe knowe knyght may outher syr trystram sir launcelot heuy sir gawayns wordes thenne sir launcelot bad sir carados leye doune knyghte fyghte thou arte foole saide sire carados wylle serue wyse said sir launcelot spare warne wille spare thenne bond sir gawayne hand foot threwe hym ground thenne gate spere squyer departed syr launcelot fetche cours soo eyther met brake speres handes thenne pulled swerdes hurtled gyders horsbak houre laste sire launcelot smote sir carados suche buffet vpon helme perched brayne pan thenne sir launcelot toke sir carados coller pulled hym vnder hors foot thenne alyyte pulled helme strake hede thenne sir launcelot vnbounde sir gawayne soo tale told sir galahad sir trystram maye ye noblenes foloweth sir launcelot allas said syr trystram message hand fayre lady truly wold neuer stynte fonde syre launcelot thenne sire trystram la beale isoud wente see come cornewaile alle baron mette hem pcapitulum xix anone rychely wedded grete nobley euer frensshe book sayth sir trystram la beale isoud loued euer gyders pthenne grete iustes grete torneyenge many lordes ladyes feest sir trystram preysed alle thus dured feest longe feest done within lytel whyle assent two ladyes quene isoud ordeyned hate enuy destroye dame bragwayne mayden lady vnto la beale isoud sente forest fetche herbes mette bounde feete hand tree soo bounden thre dayes fortune sir palamydes fond dame bragwayne delyuerd dethe brought nonnery besyde recouerd whanne isoud quene myst mayden wete ye wel ryght heuy euer ony quene alle erthely wymmen loued best cause came oute countreye soo vpon day quene isoud walked forest putte aweye thoughtes ther wente self vnto welle made grete mone sodenly came palamydes herd alle complaynte sayd madame isoud ye wille graunte bone shalle brynge dame bragwayne sauf sound quene glad profer sodenly vnauysed grau ted alle askynge wel madame said palamydes trust promyse yf ye wille abyde half houre shal brynge shall abyde said la beale isoud sir palamydes rode forth way nonnery lyghtly came ageyne dame bragwayne good wille wold haue comen ageyne cause loue quene stood aueture lyf notwithstandyng half ageynst wille wente sir palamydes vnto quene whan quene sawe passyng glad madame said palamydes remembre vpon promyse haue fulfilled promyse sir palamydes said quene wote desyre wille ye wete promysed largely thought none euyl warne none ylle wille doo madame said sir palamydes tyme ye shalle knowe desyre bifore lord husband shalle ye knowe wil haue desyre ye haue promysed therwith quene departed rode home kynge sir palamydes rode whan syr palamydes came kynge said sir kyng requyre ye ryghteuous kynge ye wille iuge ryght telle cause said kynge ye shalle haue ryght pcapitulum xxx syre said palamydes promysed quene isoud brynge ageyne dame bragwayne lost vpon couenaunt shold graunte bone wold aske without grutchynge outher auysemet graunted saye ye lady said kynge hit saith soo god help said quene saye sothe promysed hym askynge loue ioye see wel madame said kynge yf ye hasty graunte hym bone wold aske wylle wel ye performe promyse thenne said palamydes ye wete wille haue quene lede gouerne lyst kynge stood styll thought hym sir trystram demed wold rescowe thenne hastely kynge ansuerd take aduetures shal falle hit suppose thou wylt enioye noo whyle said palamydes dare ryght wel abyde aduenture soo make short tale sir palamydes toke hand said madame grutche goo desyre thynge promyse said quene fere gretely go hou thou hast auauntage vpon promyse doute shalle worshipfully rescowed fro said sir palamydes maye quene isoud sette behynde palamydes rode way anon kynge sente syr trystram wyse coude foude forest huntyng alweyes custome yf vsed armes chase hunte forestes allas said kynge shamed euer myn owne assente lady quene shalle deuoured thenne came forth knyght name lambegus knyght syr trystram lord sayd knyght sythe ye haue truste lord sire tristram wete ye wel sake wille ryde quene rescowe el shal b ten gramercy saide kynge lyue sir lambegus shal deserue hit thenne sir lambegus armed hym rode fast myghte thenne within whyle ouertoke sir palamydes thenne sir palamydes lefte quene arte thou saide palamydes arte thou trystram nay saide seruaunte name sir lambegus repenteth saide palamydes hadde leuer thou haddest ben sire trystram bileue wel said lambegus thou metest sir trystram thou shalt haue thy handes ful thenne hurtled gyders alle braste speres thenne pulled oute swerdes hewed helmes hauberkes laste sire palamydes gaf sir lambegus suche wonnd felle doun lyke dede knyghte erthe thenne loked la beale isoud thene gone nyst wete ye wel sir palamydes neuer soo heuy quene ranne forest fond wel theryn hadde thoughte haue drouned self good fortune wold ther came knyght hadde castel ther name sire adtherp fonde quene meschyef rescowed broughte castel whanne wyst armed hym took hors said wold auengyd vpon palamydes soo rode tyll mette hym sir palamydes wounded hym sore force made hym telle hym cause dyd bataille hym ladde quene vnto castel brynge said palamydes thou shalt dye handes sir said sir adtherp soo wounded may folowe ryde way hit shalle brynge castel within quene thenne sire palamydes rode styll tyl came castel wyndowe la beale isoud sawe sir palamydes thenne made yates shette strongly whan sawe myght come within castel putte brydel sadel putte hors pasture sette hym self doune atte gate lyke man oute wytte retchyd hym self pcapitulum xxxj torne vnto sir tristram whanne come home wyste la beale isoud gone syr palamydes wete ye wel wrothe oute mesure allas said sir trystram day shamed thenne cryed gouernaile man haste armed horsbak wel wote lambegus hath myghte strengthe withstande sir palamydes allas haue ben stede soo anone armed horsed sir tristram gouernaile rode forest within whyle fond knyght lambegus al moost wou ded dethe syre trystram bare hym foster charged hym kepe hym wel thenne rode forth fond syr adtherp sore wounded told hym hou quene wold haue drouned self ben sake loue taken vpon hym doo bataille sir palamydes lady said sire trystram syr said knyght sure ynough within castel hold within hit gramercy said syre trystram thy grete goodenes soo rode tyl came nyghe castel thenne syr trystram sawe syr palamydes sat gate slepynge hors pastured fast afore hym goo thou gouernaile said sire tristram byd hym awake make hym redy gouernayle rode vnto hym said sir palamydes aryse take thyn harneis suche study herd gouernayle said gouernaile came ageyne told syre trystram slepte el madde goo thou ageyne said sire tristram bydde hym aryse telle hym mortal foo gouernaile rode ageyne putte vpon hym spere said sir palamydes make redy wete ye wel syr tristram houeth yonder sendeth word thy mortal foo sire palamydes arose stylly withoute wordes gate hors sadeled hym brydeled hym lyghtely lepte vpon gat spere hand eyder feutryd speres hurtled faste gyders tristram smote doune sire palamydes ouer hors tayle thenne lightely sire palamydes putte sheld afore hym drewe swerd beganne stronge bataill bothe partyes fought loue one lady euer laye walles behelde hou foughte oute mesure eyther wouded possyng sore palamydes moche sorer wou ded thus fought tracynge trauercyng two houres wel nygh dole sorowe la beale isoud swouned pallas said one loued yet doo loue yet grete pyte shold see sir palamydes slayne wel knowe tyme ende done sir palamydes dede knyyt cause crystened wold bothe shold dye sarasyn alle came doune bisought sire trystram fyghte madame saide meane wille ye haue shamed wel ye knowe wille ruled wylle dishonour saide la beale isoud wold ye wold sake spare vnhappy sarasyn palamydes madame said syre trystram wille leue fyghtynge tyme sake pthenne said sire palamydes shalle charge thou shalt goo oute countrey whyle therin wille obeye commaundement said sire palamydes whiche sore ageynst wylle pthenne take thy waye said la beale isoud vnto courte kynge arthur recommaude vnto quene gueneuer telle send word ther withyn land four louers sire launcelot du lake quene gueneuer sire trystram de lyonas quene isoud pcapitulum xxxij soo syre palamydes departed grete heuynes sir tristram took quene brouyte ageyne kynge marke thenne made grete ioye home comynge cherysshed sir trystram thenne sir trystram lete fetche syr lambegus knyyte fro foster hous hit longe hole last wel recouerd thus lyued ioye play long whyle euer sir andred nygh cosyn syr trystram lay watche wayte betwix sir trystram la beale isoud take hem sklanndre hem soo vpon day syr tristram talked la beale isoud wyndowe aspyed sir andred told kynge thenne kynge marke took swerd hand came sir tristram called hym fals traitour wold haue stryken hym sir trystram nyghe hym ranne vnder swerd tooke hit oute hande thenne kynge cryed knyghtes men charge slee traitour tyme one wold meue wordes whanne syre trystram sawe one wold ageynst hym shoke swerd kynge made countenaunce though wold haue stryken hym thenne kynge marke fledde sire tristram folowed hym smote vpon hym fyue sixe stroke flatlynge neck made hym falle vpon nose thenne sir tristram yede waye armed hym tooke hors men soo rode forest vpon daye syr trystram mette two bretheren knyghtes kynge marke strake hede one wounded dethe maade hym bere broders hede helme vnto kynge thyrtty moo wounded whan knyght came kynge saye message dyed afore kynge quene thenne kynge marke called counceill vnto hym asked aduyse baron best doo sire trystram syr said baron especyal syre dynas seneschal syr wille yeue counceyll sende sir tristram wille ye wete many men wille holde syre trystram hard bestad syr said sire dynas ye shalle vnderstande sir tristram called pyerles makeles ony crysten knyghte myghte hardynes knewe none soo good knyght yf hit sire launcelot du lake yf departe courte goo kynge arthur courte wete ye wel wille gete hym suche frendes wylle sette malyce therfore syre counceyle yow take hym youre grace wylle wel said kynge sente maye frendes thenne baron sente syr tristram vnder sauf conduyte soo whan syre tristram came kynge welcome rehersail made game playe thenne kynge quene wente huntynge sir tristram pcapitulum xxxiij kynge quene made pauelions theire tentes forest besyde ryuer ther dayly huntynge iustynge euer xxx knyghtes redy iuste vnto alle came tyme fortune came sire lamerak de galys sir dryaunt syre dryaunt iusted ryght wel laste falle thenne sire lamerak profered iuste whan began ferd thyrtty knyytes one hem gaf hym falle somme sore hurte merueyle said kyng mark knyght doth suche dedes armes sir said sire tristram knowe hym wel noble knyght fewe ben lyuynge name sir lamorak de galys grete shame saide kynge shold goo thus aweye onles somme mette hym better syre said syre tristram semeth worship noble man haue adoo hym cause tyme hath done ouer moche ony meane knyghte lyuynge therfore semeth hit grete shame vylony tempte hym ony tyme soo moche hors wery bothe dedes armes hath done daye wel consydered ynough sir launcelot du lake pa said kynge marke requyre ye loue lady quene la beale isoud take youre armes iuste sire lamorak de galys p syre said sir tristram ye byd doo thynge ageynst knygthode wel deme shal gyue hym falle hit maystry hors ben fresshe bothe hors wete ye wel wil take hit grete vnkyndenes euer one good bothe take another disauauntage cause wil displease yow ye requyre soo wille obeye commaundemet soo sire tristram armed hym took hors putt hym forth sire lamerak mette hym myghtely myght owne spere sire tristram spere syr lamoraks hors felle erthe syttynge sadel thenne anone lyghtly myghte auoyded sadel hors put shelde afore hym drewe swerd thenne badde sir tristram lyghte thou knyght thou darst nay said sire tristram wil haue adoo haue done ouer moche vnto dishonour thy worship pa said sir lamorak thanke syn thou hast foriusted horsbak requyre biseche thou sir tristram fyghte foote p wylle soo said ore tristram wete ye wel name sire tristra de lyones wel knowe ye sire lamorak de galys haue done ageynst wylle requyred therto saye wille doo atte youre request thys tyme haue ado hameth haue done pa shame said sire lamorak thy party myne beare thou hit thou wilt though mary sone hath fayled quenes sone shalle fayle therfore thou suche knyghte men calle requyre alyghte fyghte syre lamorak said sire tristram vnderstande youre herte grete cause ye haue saye fothe hit wold greue ony knyght shold kepe hym fresshe thenne stryke doune wery knyghte knyghte hors neuer fourmed alwey myght sta de endure therfore said sire tristram wille haue adoo forthynketh haue done said sire lamorak shal quyte euer see tyme pcapitulum xxxiiij noo departed hym sire dryaun weye mette knyyt sente morgan le fay vnto kynge arthur knyght hadde fayre horne harnest gold horne suche vertue ther myght lady ne gentilwoman drynke horne yf true husband yf fals shold spylle alle drynke yf true lord myght drynke peasyble cause quene gueneuer despyte sire launcelot horne sente vnto kynge arthur force sire lamorak made knyghte telle alle cause bare horne p shalte thou bere horn sayd lamorak vnto kyng marke el chese thou dye telle playnly despyte repreef sire tristram thou shalte bere horne vnto kynge marke vnkel say thou hym sent hit hym assay lady pand yf true hym shal preue soo knyghte wente waye vnto kynge marke broughte hym ryche horne sayd sir lamorak sente hit hym told hym vertue horne pthenne kynge maade quene isoud drynke therof honderd ladyes four ladyes alle tho dranke clene pallas saide kynge marke grete despyte sware grete othe shold brente ladyes pthenne baron gadred gyder said playnly wold haue tho ladyes brente horne maade sorcery came fals sorceresse wytche tho lyuynge horne dyd neuer good caused stryf debate alweyes dayes ben enemy alle true louers soo many knyghtes made auowe euer met morgan le fay wold shewe short curtosye palso sir tristram passynge wrothe sire lamorak sente horne vnto kynge marke wel knewe hit done despyte hym therfor thoughte quyte sire lamorak pthenne syre tristram vsed dayly nyghtely go quene isoud whanne myght euer syre andred cosyn watched hym nyght daye take hym la beale isoud soo vpon nyght syre andred aspyed houre tyme whan sir trystram wente lady pthenne syre andred gate vnto hym twelue knyghtes mydnyghte sette vpon sire tristram secretely sodenly sire tristram take naked bedde la beale isoud thenne boud hande foot soo kepte vntyl daye pand thenne assent kynge marke syr andred somme baron syre tristram ledde vnto chappel stode vpon see rockes take iugement soo ledde bounden fourty knyghtes whan sire tristram sawe none boote nedes must dye thenne said fayr lordes remembre haue done countreye cornewaile ieopardy haue ben wele alle whan fouyt truage cornewaile sir marhaus good knyght promysed better rewarded whanne ye alle reffused take bataille therfore ye good gentyl knyghtes see thus shamefully dye shame alle knyghthode thus see dye dare saye said sire tristram neuer met knyght good better fy vpon said sir andred fals traitour thou arte thyn auau cynge alle thy boost thou shalt dye daye andred andred said sir tristram thou sholdest kynnesman thou art ful vnfrendely mo thou thou woldest putte deth said sir andred ther drewe swerd wold haue slayne hym whanne sir tristram sawe hym make suche countenaunce loked vpon bothe handes fast bounden vnto two knyghtes sodenly pulled bothe hym vnwrast handes thenne lepte vnto cosyn syr andred wrothe swerd oute handes thenne smote sir andred fylle erthe soo sir tristram foughte tyl hadde kylled x knyghtes thenne sir tristram gate chappel kepte hit myghtely thenne crye grete peple drewe faste vnto sire andred moo honderd whanne sir tristram sawe peple drawe vnto hym remembryd naked sperd fast chappel dore brake barrys wyndowe soo lepte oute fylle vpon crackys see tyme sir andred none felawes myghte gete hym tyme pcapitulum xxxv soo whanne departed gouernaile sire lambegus sire sentraille de lushon sir tristram men soughte maister whanne herd escaped thenne passynge gladde rockes fond hym tuels pulled hym vp thenne sire tristram asked hem la beale isoud wende ben aweye andreds peple syr said gouernaile put lazar cote pallas said syre trystram ful vngoodely place suche fayre lady yf maye shalle belonge soo took men wente la beale isoud fette aweye broughte forest fayre manoyre sire tristram abode soo good knyghte badde men goo hym att tyme maye helpe soo departed alle sauf gouernaile soo vpon daye sir tristram yede forest disporte hym thenne hit happend felle slepe came man sire tristram afore hand slayne broder whan man hadde foud hym shotte hym thorou sholder arow sir tristram lepte vp kylled man meane tyme told kynge marke sir tristram la beale isoud manoir soone euer myght thyder came many knyytes slee sir tristram whanne came fond hym gone took la beale isoud home hym kepte strayte meane neuer myght wete sende vnto trystram vnto thenne whanne syre tristram came toward old manoir fond trak many horse ther wiste lady gone thenne sir tristram took grete sorou endured grete payne long tyme arowe hurte al enuenymed thenne meane la beale isoud told lady cosyn vnto dame bragwayne came sir tristram told hym myght hole meanes thy lady la beale isoud maye helpe therfor byddeth haste bretayne kynge howel ye shal fynde douyter isoud le blaunche maynys shal helpe thenne sir tristram gouernaile gat shyppyng soo sailed bretayne whan kynge howel wist sir tristram ful gladde hym syre said comen countrey haue help doughter hit tolde none may hele soo within whyle heled hym pcapitulum xxxvj erle hyghte gryp erle maade grete werre vpon kynge putte kynge werse byseged hym tyme syre kehydyus sone kynge howel yssued oute sore wounded nyghe dethe pthenne gouernaile wente kynge said syre counceyle desyre lord syre tristram nede helpe wille doo counceylle said kynge soo yede vnto syr trystram praid hym warris helpe hym sone kehydyus may goo felde psire said sir tristram wille goo feld doo maye thenne sir tristram yssued towne suche felauship myght make dyd suche dedes alle bretayne spake hym thene last grete myghte force slewe erle gryp owne handes moo honderd knyghtes slewe daye thenne sire tristram receyued worshipfully procession pthenne kynge howel enbraced hym armes said sire tristram alle kyngdome wille resygne god defende said sir tristram beholden vnto youre doughters sake doo p thenne grete meanes kynge howel kehydyus sone grete profers grewe grete loue betwixe isoud sire trystram lady bothe good fayre woman noble blood fame pand cause sir tristram suche chere rychesse alle plesaunce hadde moost hadde forsaken la beale isoud soo vpon tyme sir trystram agreed wedde isoud la blaunche maynys laste wedded solempnly held theyr maryage soo whanne abedde bothe sire tristram remembryd hym old lady la beale isoud thenne toke suche thought sodenly alle desmayed chere maade none clyppynge kyssynge flesshly lustes sire trystram neuer thoughte hadde adoo suche mencyon maketh frensshe booke also maketh mencyon lady wende ben pleasyr kyssynge clyppynge pand meane tyme knyght bretayne name suppynabyles came ouer see englond thenne came court kynge arthur met sir launcelot du lake told hym maryage syre tristram thenne said sire launcelot fy vpon hym vntrue knyghte lady soo noble knyghte sir trystram shold foude fyrst lady fals la beale isoud quene cornewaile saye ye hym said sire launcelot alle knyghtes world loued hym moost moost ioye hym alle noble dedes lete hym wete loue bitwene hym done euer gyue hym warnyng daye forth mortal enemy pcapitulum xxxvij thenne departed syr suppynabyles vnto bretayne ageyne fond sir tristram told hym ben kynge arthur courte thenne said sir tristram herd ye ony thynge soo god help saide syre suppynabyles herd sire launcelot speke grete shame ye fals knyght lady bad doo wete wille mortal enemy euery place may mete repenteth said tristram alle knyghtes loued felauship soo syre tristram made grete mone ashamed noble knyghtes shold deffame hym sake lady meane whyle la beale isoud maade letter vnto quene gueneuer complaynyng vntrouthe sir tristram hadde wedded kynges doughter bretayne quene gueneuer sente another letter badde good chere shold haue ioye sorou sire tristram noble knyyt called craftes sorcery ladyes wolde make suche noble men wedde ende quene gueneuer said hit shal thus shalle hate loue better euer dyd fore p leue sire trystram bretayne speke sire lamerak de galys sayled shyp felle rok perysshed saue sire lamerak squyer swam myghtely fysshees yle ruage toke hym vp squyer drouned ship men grete laboure saue sire lamoraks lyf alle comfort coude doo lord yle hyght syre nabon le noyre grete myghty gyaunt sir nabon hated alle knyghtes kynge arthur wyse wold doo hem fauoure fysshers told sir lamorak alle gyse syre nabon came neuer knyghte kynge arthur destroyed hym atte last bataille dyd slayne syr nanowne le petyte put shameful dethe despyte kynge arthur drawen lymme meale forthynketh said sir lamerak knyghtes dethe cosyn yf myn ease wel euer wold reuenge dethe pee sayd fysshers make wordes euer ye departe hen syre nabon must knowe ye haue ben el shold dye sake hole said lamorak disease haue taken see wille ye telle hym knyyt kynge arthur neuer aferd reneye lord pcapitulum xxxviij tourne vnto sire trystram vpon daye took lytel barget wyf isoud la blauche maynys sire kay hedyus broder playe hem cosstes whan land wynde drofe hem coste walys vpon yle seruage syre lamorak barget rofe dame isoud hurte wel myyte gate forest welle sawe segwarydes damoysel thenne eyther salewed syre sayde segwarydes knowe sire tristram de lyones man world haue moost cause hate cause ye departed loue bitwene wyf sayd segwarydes wil neuer hate noble knyyt lyyt lady therfore pray frende wille vnto power wete ye wel ye hard bestad valey shalle haue ynough doo eyther v socoure thenne sir segwarydes brought sir trystram lady borne cornewaile told hym alle peryls valey ther cam neuer knyght taken prysoner slayne wete wel fair lady said sir trystram slewe sire marhaus delyuerd cornewaile truage irland delyuerd kynge irlande sire blamor de ganys bete sire palamydes wete ye wel sire trystram de lyones grace god shalle delyuer woful yle seruage sir tristram wel eased thenne one told hym knyghte kyng arthur yt wrackyd rockes name said sir tristram wote said fysshers kepeth counceil knyghte kynge arthur myghty lord yle setteth nought praye said sir tdestram ye maye brynge hym hyder maye see hym yf ony knyghtes arthur shalle knowe hym thenne lady prayed fysshers brynge hym place soo morowe brouyt hym thyder fysshers rayment soone sire tristram sawe hym smyled vpon hym knewe hym wel knewe sir tristram fair sir saide sire tristram semeth chere ye haue ben diseased late also thynketh shold knowe fore wille wel said sir lamorak ye haue sene mette fair sir saide sir tristram telle name vpon couenaunt wil telle said sir lamorak ye wil telle whether ye lord iland noo called nabon le noyre sothe said sir tristram hold hym foo wel ye soo shal foude departe oute yle wel said sir lamorak syn ye haue saide soo largely vnto name sire lamorak de galis sone vnto kynge pellinore forsothe trowe wel said sir tristram ye said knowe contrary ye said syre lamorak knoweth sir trystram de lyones syre remembre ye falle ye dyd yeue one ye refused fyghte foot fere said sire tristram shamed att tyme haue doo semed ye hadde ynough sire lamorack kyndenes many ladyes ye putte repreef whan ye sente horne morgan le fay kynge marke ye dyd despyte well said doo ageyne soo wold doo leuer stryf debate felle kyng mark courte rather arthur courte honour bothe courtes lyke said sir tristram knowe wel pbut done despyte alle youre malyce thanke god hurte gretely therfor said sir tristram ye shal leue alle malyce soo wille lete v assay hou may wynne worship bitwene vpon gyaunt sir nabon le noyre lord iland destroye hym sir said sir lamorak vnderstande knyghthode maye fals alle men saye bounte noble worship alle knyghtes ye pyerles curtosy gentilnes shewed vngentilnesse repenteth pcapitulum xxxix meane tyme cam word sir nabon made crye alle peple yle shold castel fyfthe day pand daye sone nabon shold made knyghte alle knyghtes valey shold iuste tho royamme logrys shold iuste northwalys thyder came fyue honderd knyghtes countrey brought thyder syre lamorak sir tristram syre kehydyus sire segwarides durst none wyse doo thenne sir nabon lent sire lamorak hors armour sire lamoraks desyre sire lamorak iusted dyd suche dedes armes nabon peple said neuer knyyt euer sawe suche dedes armes frensshe book saith foriusted moost party fyue honderd knyghtes none abode hym sadel thenne sir nabon profered playe hym playe sawe neuer knyghte doo soo moche vpon daye wille wel said sire lamorak playe may wery sore brysed eyther gate spere nabon wold encountre sire lamorak smote hors forhede soo slewe hym thenne sire lamorak yede foote torned shelde drewe swerd beganne stronge bataill foote sir lamorak sore brysed shorte brethed tracyd trauercyd somwhat abak fair felawe said syre nabon hold thy hand shalle shewe curtosye euer shewed knyght cause haue sene daye thy noble knyghthode therfore stand thou wil wete whether ony thy felawes wille haue adoo thenne whan sir tristram herd stepte forth said nabon lende hors sure armour wille haue adoo wel felawe said sir nabon goo thou yonder pauelione arme best thou fyndest shalle playe merueillous playe thenne said sire tristram loke ye playe wel el peraduentur shalle lerne newe play wel said felawe said sir nabon whan sir tristram armed hym lyked best wel shelded swerded dressid hym foote wel knewe syr nabon wold abyde stroke spere therfore wold slee alle knyghtes horse fair felawe said sir nabon lete v playe soo thenne foughte longe foote tracynge trauercynge smytynge foynynge longe withoute ony rest atte last sir nabon praid hym telle hym name syre nabon telle name sir tristram de lyones knyyt cornewail vnder kynge marke thou art welcome said sir nabon alle knyghtes haue moost desyred fyghte sir launcelot soo thenne went egerly gyders sire tristram slewe sire nabon soo forth lepte sone strake hede thenne al countrey sayde wold holde sire tristram nay saide sire tristram wille soo worshipfull knyght sir lamorak de galys shalle lord countreye hath done grete dedes armes nay said sir lamorak wil lord countrey haue deserued wel ye therfore gyue ye hit ye wille none haue wel saide sire tristram syn ye wille haue hit lete v yeue hit hym hath wel deserued hit doo ye lyst said segwarydes yefte wil none haue deserued hit soo yeuen segwarydes wherof thanked hem soo lord worshipfully dyd gouerne hit thenne sir segwarydes delyuerd alle prysoners sette good gouernaunce valey soo torned cornewaile told kynge mark la beale isoud sir tristram auaunced hym yle seruage proclamed al cornewaile alle aduentures two knyghtes hit openly knowen ful wo la beale isoud herd telle sire tristram wedded isoud la blaunche maynys pcapitulum xl soo torne vnto sir lamorak rode toward arthur courte sire tristram wyf kehydyus took vessel sailed bretayne vnto kynge howel welcome whan herd aduetures merueilled noble dedes torne vnto sir lamorak whan departed sire tristram rode oute forest tyll came hermytage whan heremyte sawe hym asked hym whens came sir said sir lamorak come fro valey sir said hermyte therof merueille xx wynter sawe neuer knyght passe countrey slayne vylaynously wounded passe poure prysoner tho ylle custom said sir lamorak fordone sir tristram slewe lord syr nabon sone thenne heremyte gladde bretheren said ther neuer suche tyraunt among cry en men therfor said hermyte valey frauceis wille holde sire tristram soo morowe sir lamorak departed rode sawe four knyghtes fyghte ageynst one one knyght defended hym wel atte last four knyghtes hym doune thenne sir lamorak wente betwixe asked wold slee one knyght said hit shame four ageynst one thou shalt wel wete said four knyghtes fals youre tale said sir lamorak whanne hym also speke wille say ye saye p thenne said lamorak knyght ye excuse ye fals knyghte syr said yet excuse word handes wille make good vpon one best body body pthenne spake al attones wil ieopardy bodyes wete thou wel saide kynge arthur hym self shold lye power saue lyf moche said said sire lamorak many speke hynde man wylle saye face cause wordes ye shalle vnderstande one symplest kynge arthur courte worship lord doo best despyte shalle rescowe hym thenne lasshed alle one sir lamorak anone two stroke syre lamorak slayne two thenne two fledde psoo thenne sire lamorak torned ageyne knyghte asked hym name syre sayde name sire frolle oute iles thenne rode sire lamorak bare hym company rode waye sawe semely knyght rydynge ageynst whyte said frol yonder knyght iusted late smote doune therfore wil iuste hym ye shal doo soo said sire lamorak counceil ye wille telle quarel whether ye iusted request nay said sir frol iusted hym request syr said lamorak thene wil couceile dele hym semeth countenaunce shold noble knyght iaper thynketh shold table round therfor wil said sir frol thenne cryed said sir knyyt mak redy iust nedeth said whyte knyghte haue luste iuste yet feutryd theyr speres whyte knyghte ouerthrewe sire frol ne rode waye softe paas thenne sir lamorak rode hym praid hym telle hym name semeth ye shold felauship round table vpon couenaunt said e wille telle name soo ye wylle discouer name also ye wille telle thenne said name sir lamorak de galys name sir launcelot du lake thenne putte vp suerdes kyssed hertely gyders eyder made grete ioye syr said sir lamorak hit please wyll seruyse god defende said launcelot ony soo noble blood ye shold doo seruyse thenne saide quest must doo self alone god spede said sir lamorak departed thenne sir lamorak came sir frol horsed hym ageyne knyght said sir frol sir said knowe poynte charge ye vncurteis saide sire frol therfore wille departe fro yow ye may doo ye lyst said sir lamorak yet company ye haue saued fayrest floure garland soo departed pcapitulum xlj thenne within two thre dayes syr lamorak fond knyghte welle slepynge lady sate hym waked ryght came sir gawayne toke knyghtes lady sette vp behynde squyer soo syre lamorak rode syre gawayne said sire gawayne torne ageyne thenne said sir gawayne wylle ye neuewe vnto kyng arthur syre said cause wil spare el lady shold abyde wyth el ye shold iuste thenne sire gawayne torned hym ranne hym ought lady spere knyght pure myght smote doune syre gawayne took lady hym alle sir lamorak saw said hym self reuenge felawe say dishonour kynge arthur courte thenne sire lamorak retorned profered knyght iuste syr said redy came gyders alle myght sir lamorak smote knyght thorou sydes fylle erthe dede thenne lady rode knyghtes broder hyght belliauce le orgulus duelled fast ther thenne told hym broder slayne allas said wille reuengyd soo horsed hym armed hym within whyle ouertook syre lamorak badde hym torne leue lady thou must playe newe playe thou hast slayne broder syre froll better knyghte euer thou myghte wel said sir lamorak day felde foud better soo rode gyder vnhorsed torned sheldes drewe swerdes foughte myghtely noble knyghtes preued space two houres ne sir bellyaunce prayed hym telle hym name syr said name sire lamorak de galys said syr bellyaunce thou arte man world moost hate slewe sone thy sake saued thy lyf thou hast slayne broder syr frol allas shold acoorded therfore defende thou shalt dye ther none remedy pallas said sir lamorak ful wel ought knowe ye man moost haue done alle sire lamorak knelyd doune bisought hym grace aryse said sir bellyaunce el thou knelest shalle slee shal nede saide sire lamorak wyl yelde vnto fere yow strengthe goodenes maketh ful haue adoo wherfore requyre goddes sake honour knygthode forgyue al haue offended vnto allas said belleaunce leue thy knelynge el shal slee withoute mercy thenne yede ageyne vnto batail either wounded al ground blody foughte laste belleaunce withdrewe hym abak sette hym doune softely vpon lytil hylle faynte bledyng myght stande thenne sir lamorak threwe shelde vpon bak asked hym chere wel said syr belliaunce syr yet shalle shewe faueour male ease knyght syr belliaunce said syr lamorak thou arte foole suche auauntage thou hast done shold slee thy gentylnes good large must nedes forgyue myn euylle wille thenne sire lamorak knelyd adoune vnlaced fyrst vmberere thenne owne thenne eyther kyssed wepynge teres thenne sire lamerak ledde sir belliauce abbay fast sire lamorak wold departe bellyaunce tyl hole thenne sware gyders none hem shold neuer fyghte ageynst syre lamorak departed wente courte kynge arthur phere leue sire lamorak sir tristram pand begynneth historye la cote male tayle pcapitulum primum courte kynge arthur cam yonge man bygly made rychely bysene desyred made knyghte kyng ouer garmet sat ouerthwartly hit hit ryche clothe gold pwhat name said kynge arthur syre saide name breunor le noyre within shorte space ye shalle knowe good kyn maye wel said sir kay seneschal mockage ye shalle called la cote male tayle moche saye euyl shapen cote hit grete thynge thou askest said kyng cause werest thou ryche cote telle wel thynke somme cause hit syre ansuerd fader noble knyght rode huntynge vpon daye hit happed hym leye hym doune slepe came knyght ben longe enemy whan sawe fast slepe alle hewe hym cote fader tyme maketh cote sytte soo euyll vpon stroke ben hit fond hit neu r shalle amendyd thus haue faders dethe remembraunce cote tyl reuengyd cause ye callyd moost noblest kynge world come ye shold make knyght sir said sir lamorak sir gaherys hit wel done make hym knyght hym besemeth wel persone countenaunce shall preue good man good knyght myghty sire ye remembryd euen suche one sire launcelot du lake whanne came fyrste courte full fewe v knewe whens came preued man moost worship world courte alle round table sire launcelot worshipped amended ony knyghte lyuynge trouthe saide kynge morou att request shalle make hym knyght p morou herte founden thyder rode kynge arthur company knyghtes slee herte yonge man sire kay named la cote male tayle lefte behynd quene gueneuer sodeyne aduenture ther horryble lyon kepte stronge toure stone happend tyme brake loo came hurlynge afore quene knyghtes pand whanne quene sawe lyon cryed fledde praide knyghtes rescowe none hem alle twelue abode alle fledde p thenne saide la cote male tayle see wel alle coward knyghtes ben dede alle drewe swerd dressid hym afore lyon lyon gaped wyde came vpon hym raumppynge haue slayne hym thenne smote hym myddes hede suche myghty stroke clafe hede sonder dasshed erthe p thenne hit tolde quene yonge man sire kay named scorne la cote male tayle hadde slayne lyon kyng came home pand whanne quene tolde hym aduenture wel pleased said vpon payne myn hede shalle preue noble man feythful knyghte true promyse thenne kynge forth al made hym knyght sire said yonge knyght requyre alle knyghtes youre courte ye calle none name la cote male tayle soo moche syr kay hath soo named soo wille called assente wel therto said kynge pcapitulum secundum thenne daye came damoysel courte brought grete black shelde whyte hand myddes holdynge swerd pyctour none shelde whan kyng arthur sawe asked whens came wold syr said haue ryden longe many day sheld many wayes cause come courte good knyght ought sheld knyght vndertake grete dede armes enchieue hit soo mysfortuned hym another stronge knyght met hym sodeyne aduenture fought longe eyther wounded passynge sore soo wery lefte bataille euen hand soo knyghte ought shelde sawe none way must dye ne commaunded bere shelde courte kynge arthur requyrynge prayenge somme good knyyt take shelde wold fulfylle quest saye ye quest said kynge arthur ony wille take vpon hym welde shelde pthenne one wold speke one word thenne sir kay took shelde handes sire knyyt said damoysel name wete ye wel said name sir kay seneschal wyde knowen syre said damoysel laye doune shelde wete ye wel falleth must better knyyt ye shalle welde shelde
