damoysel sayd syr kay wete ye wel toke sheld handes youre leue behold entent goo someuer thou wilt go thenne damoysel stode stylle grete whyle byheld many tho knyghtes thenne spak knyght la cote male tayle fayre damoysel wille take shelde aduenture vpon soo wyst shold knowe wheder ward iourney myght cause thys daye made knyght wold take aduenture vpon name fayre yonge man said damoysel name said la cote male tayle wel mayst thou called said damoysel knyyt euylle shapen cote thou soo hardy take vpon bere shelde folowe wete thou wel thy skyn shalle wel hewen thy cote said la cote male tayle whan soo hewen wille aske salue hele alle forth ther came court two squyers brouyt hym grete horse armour speres anone armed tooke leue pi wold said kynge ye took vpon hard aduenture sir said aduenture myn fyrst euer took vpon wille folowe someuer come pthenne damoysel departed la cote male tayle fast folowed within whyle ouertook damoysell anone myssaid hym fowlest maner pcapitulum tercium thenne sire kay ordeyned sir dagonet kynge arthur foole folowe la cote male taile sir kay ordeyned sir dagonet horsed armed bad hym folowe la cote male taile profer hym iuste soo dyd whan sawe la cote male tayle cryed badde hym make hym redy iuste soo sir la cote male tayle smote sir dagonet ouer hors croupe thenne damoysel mocked la cote male tayle said fy shame art thou shamed arthur courte whan sende foole haue adoo specially thy fyrst iustes thus rode longe chyde p within whyle ne sir bleoberys good knyght iusted la cote male tayle syre bleoberys smote hym sore hors alle felle erth thenne la cote male tayle arose vp lyghtely dressid sheld drewe suerd wold haue done bataill vtterauce wode oshe soo said bleoberys de ganys tyme wille fyghte vpon foo thenne damoysel maledysaut hym foulest maner badde hym orne ayene coward damoysel said pray mercy myssa gryef ynough though ye gyue calle self neuer wers knyght whan mary sone fayleth also dompte neuer wers knyght falle sir bleoberys soo thus rode two dayes fortune came sir palomydes encountred hym wyse serued hym dyd bleoberys fore hand pwhat dost thou fel uship saide damoysel maledysaunt thou canst sytte knyghte withstande hym one buffet yf hit sir dagonet fair damoysel wers take falle sire palamydes yet grete disworship haue none neyder bleoberys yet palamydes wold fyghte foote said damoysel wete thou wel haue desda ne scor e lyghte horse fyghte suche knyght thou te soo meane whyle ther cam sir mordred sir gawayns broder soo felle felauship damoysel maledy aunt thenne came ore castel orgulous suche customme myght knyght come castel outher must iuste prysoner lest le hors harne came oute two knyghtes ageynst sir mordred iusted formest knyght castel smote sire mordred doune hors thenne la cote male tayle iusted eyther hem smote doune hors alle erthe whanne auoyded horse thenne eyther hem took others horse pand thenne la cote male tayle rode vnto knyght smote doune sire mordred iusted hym syre la cote male tayle hurte wounded hym passynge sore putte hym hors ben dede torned vnto hym mette hym afore took flyght toward castel sire la cote male tayle rode hym castel orgulous la cote male tayle shewe hym pcapitulum iiij anone came honderd knyytes hym assaylled hym whan sawe hors shold slayne alyghte voyded hors putte brydel vnder feete put hym gate whan soo done hurled amonge hem dressid bak vnto ladyes chamber walle thynkynge hym self leuer dye worship abyde rebuke damoisel maledysaunt meane tyme stood fouyt lady who chamber wente oute slyly posierne without gate fond la cote male tayles hors lyghtly gate hym brydel teyed hym posterne thenne wente vnto chambre slyly ageyn behold hou one knyghte fought ageynst honderd knyghtes whan behold hym longe wente wyndowe behynde bak said thou knyght thou fyghtest wonderly wel alle last thou must nedes dye thou canst thorou thy myyty prowesse wynne vnto yonder posterne haue fastned thy hors abyde wete thou wel thou must thynke thy worship thynke dye thou maiste wynne vnto posterne without thou doo nobly myghtly whan la cote male tayle herd saye gryped swerd handes putt sheld fayre afore hym thorou thyckest prees thrulled thorou whan came posterne fond redy four knyghtes two fyrst stroke slewe two knyghtes fledde soo wanne hors rode alle reherced kynge arthur courte hou slewe twelue knyghtes within castel orgulous rode waye meane whyle damoysel said sir mordred wene foolysshe knyyt outher slayn take prysoner thene ware came rydyng whan come told alle hadde spedde escaped despyte alle somme best hem wille telle tale thou lyest falsly saide damoysel dare make good foole dastard alle knyghthode haue lete passe may ye preue said la cote male tayle sente currour rode alweye knowe trouthe dede soo rode thydder lyghtly asked maner la cote male tayle escaped oute castel pthenne alle knyghtes cursyd hym said fende noo man hath slayne twelue oure best knyghtes wende vnto daye hit ben moche sir lau celot du lake sire tristram de lyones despyte v alle departed v maulgre oure hedes pwith ansuer currour departed came maledysaunt lady told alle syr la cote male tayle spedde castel orgulous thenne smote doun h ed sayd lytel hede said sir mordred damoysel ye gretely blame rebuke hym warne playnly good knyghte doubte shalle preue noble knyghte yet may yet sytt sure horsbak shalle good horsman hit must come vsage excercyse whan cometh stroke swerd thenne noble myghty sawe sire bleoberys sir palamydes wete ye wel wyly men armes anon knowe whan see yonge knyghte rydyng ar sure yeue hym falle hors grete buffet moost party wille lyghte foote yonge knyghtes wyght strongly armed lyke wyse sir launcelot du lake whan fyrste made knyghte often putte werse vpon horsbak euer vpon foote recouerd renomme slewe defoyled many knyghtes round table therfor rebuke sir launcelot dyd vnto many knyghtes causeth men prowesse beware often haue sene old preued knyghtes rebuked slayne yonge begynners thus rode sure talkynge way gyders p leue whyle tale speke sire launcelot du lake pcapitulum quintum whan come courte kynge arthur thenne herd telle yonge knyghte la cote male tayle slewe lyon tooke vpon hym aduenture black shelde whiche named atte tyme hardyest aduenture world soo god saue said sir laucelot vnto many felawes shame alle noble knyghtes suffre suche yonge knyghte take suche aduenture vpon hym destructyon wille ye wete said sire launcelot damoysel maledysaunt hath born shelde many day seche proued knyghtes breunys saunce pyte took sheld tristram de lyones rescowed shelde hym gaf damoysell ageyne lytil afore tyme sir tristram fought neuewe sire blamore de ganys quarel betwixe kynge irland hym thenne many knyghtes sory sir la cote male tayle gone forth aduenture truly said sir launcelot cast ryde hym within seuen dayes sir launcelot ouertook la cote male tayle thenne salewed hym damoysel maledysaunt whan sir mordred sawe sir laucelot thenne lefte felauship soo sir launcelot rode hem al day euer damoysel rebuked la cote male taile thenne sire launcelot ansuerd hym thenne lefte rebuked sir launcelot soo meane tyme syre tristram sente damoysel letter vnto sire launcelot excusynge hym weddynge isoud le blaunche maynys said letter true knyyt hadde neuer adoo flesshly isoud la blaunche maynys passynge curtoisly gentyly sir tristram wrote vnto sire launcelot euer bysechyng hym good frende vnto la beale isoud cornewaile sire launcelot wold excuse hym yf euer sawe p within shorte tyme grace god said sir tristram wold speke la brale isoud hym ryghte hastely thenne sire launcelot departed damoysel syr la cote male taile ouersee letter wryte another letter vnto syre tristram de lyones meane whyle la cote male tayle roode damoysel vntyl came castel hyght pendragon syxe knyghtes stode afore hym one hem profered iuste la cote male tayle la cote male tayle smote hym ouer hors croupe pand thenne fyue knyghtes sette vpon hym one speres smote la cote male tayle doun hors man thenne lyght sodenly sette handes vpon hym attones toke hym prysoner soo ledde hym vnto castel kepte hym prysoner morne sir launcelot arose delyuerd damoysel letter vnto sir tristram thenne took way la cote male tayle way vpon brydge knyghte profered sire launcelot iuste sire launcelot smote hym doune thenne foughte vpon foote noble batail gyders myghty laste sire launcelot smote hym doune grouelynge vpon handes knee thenne knyghte yelded hym sire launcelot receyued hym fayre syr said knyght requyre telle name moche herte yeueth vnto nay said sire launcelot tyme wil telle name onles thenne ye telle name certaynly said knyght name sir nerouens made knyght lord sir launcelot du lake newuens de lyle said sire launcelot ryght gladde ye ar proued good knyghte wete ye wel name sir launcelot du lake allas said sire nerouens de lyle haue done al flatlyng e felle foot wold haue kyst sir launcelot wold lete hym thenne eyther made grete ioye thenne sire nerouens told sir launcelot shold goo castel pendragon lord myghty knyght many knyghtes hym nyght herd say toke knyght prysoner yesterday rode damoysel saye knyghte round table pcapitulum vj said sir launcelot knyght felawe hym shalle rescowe el shalle ese lyf therfore alle rode fast tyl came castel pendragon anone alle cam vj knyghtes alle made hem redy sette vpon sire launcelot one thenne sire laucelot feutryd spere smote formest brake bak sonder thre hytte thre fayled thenne sire launcelot past thorou lyghtly torned ageyne smote another knyghte thorugh brest thorou oute bak ell ther alle spere brak soo thenne alle remenaunt four knyghtes drewe swerdes lasshed syre launcelot euery stroke sire launcelot bestowed stroke four stroke sondry auoyded theyr sadel passynge sore wounded forthe alle rode hurlynge castel anon lord castel tyme cleped sir bryan de le yles noble grete enemy vnto kyng arthur within whyle armed vpon horsbak thenne feutryd speres hurled gyders soo strongly bothe theire horse rasshed erthe thenne auoyded sadels dressid sheldes drewe theire swerdes flange gyders wood men many stroke yeuen whyle last sir launcelot gaf sir bryan suche buffet kneled vpon knee thenne sir launcelot rasshed vpon hym grete force pulled helme whanne sire bryan sawe shold slayne yelded hym put hym mercy grace thenne sire launcelot made hym delyuer alle prysoners within castel therin sir laucelot fonde arthur knyghtes thyrtty xl ladyes soo delyuerd hem thenne rode waye anon la cote male tayle delyuerd gat hors harneis damoysel maledysaunt meane whyle syre neroueus sir launcelot foughten alle afore brydge sente damoysel sir launcelot wete hou spedde castell pendragon thenne within castel merueylled knyght whan sir bryan knyghtes delyuerd alle tho prysoners haue ye merueille said damoysel best knyghte world dyd iourney wete ye wel said sire launcelott thenne sir bryan ful gladde soo lady alle knyghtes suche man shold wynne whan damoysel la cote male tayle vnderstood syr launcelot du lake ryden felauship pand remembryd hou rebuked hym callyd hym coward thenne passynge heuy pcapitulum septimum soo thenne took horse rode forth pa sire launcelot within two myle ouer took hym salewed hym thanked hym damoysel cryed sir launcelot mercy euyll dede sayenge knowe floure alle knyghthode departed euen bitwene sire tristram god knoweth said damoysel haue soughte lord sir launcelot sir tristram longe thanke god haue mette one camelot mette sir tristram ther rescowed blak shelde whyte hand holdynge naked swerd sir bruyns saunce pyte taken fayre damoysel said sir launcelot told name syre said came damoysell knyghte ye fought brydge told name sir launcelot du lake blame haue thenne said sire launcelot lord sire neroueus hath told damoysel said sire launcelot vpon couenaunt wille ryde ye wille rebuke knyght sir la cote male tayle nomore good knyght doubte shalle preue noble knyght sake pyte sholde destroyed folowed hym socoure hym grete nede ihesu thanke said damoysel wil say vnto hym rebuked hym neuer hate hated hym grete loue hym euer supoosed ben yonge tendyr take vpon hym aduentures therfore wille wold haue dryuen hym aweye ialousy lyf maye yong knyghtes dede shal enchyeue aduenture ende perdieu said sire launucelot hit wel said ye called damoysel maledysaunt wille calle damoysel bien pensaunt soo rode forthe grete whyle vnto came bordoure countrey surluse fond fayr vyllage stronge brydge lyke fortresse whanne sir launcelot bridge starte forth afore gentilmen yomen many saide faire lordes ye maye passe brydge fortresse cause black shelde see one bere therfore shalle passe one one therfore chese whiche shalle entre withynne brydge fyrste thenne sir launcelot profered hym self fyrst entre within brydge syr said la cote male tayle biseche lete entre within fortresse yf may spede wel wille sende yf happend ayn goth yf soo prysoner taken thenne maye ye rescowe lothe said sir launcelot lete passe passage syre said la cote male tayle praye lete putte body aduenture goo youre waye said sire laucelot ihesu spede entrid anone mette hym two bretheren one hyyte syr playne de force hyght sir playne de u anone mette sir la cote male tayle forste la cote male tayle smote doune playne de force smote doune playne de amour thenne dressid sheldes swerdes badde la cote male tayle alyghte soo dyd dasshyng foynyng swerdes soo began assaile ful hard la cote male tayle many grete woundes gaf hym vpon heed vpon brest vpon sholders myght euer amonge gaf sadde stroke ageyne thenne two bretheren traced trauercyd bothe handes sire la cote male tayle fyne force knyghtly prowesse gate hem afore hym thenne whan felte hym self soo wounded thenne doubled stroke gaf soo many woundes feld erthe wold haue slayne yelded ryyt soo sire la cote male tayle tooke best hor thre soo rode forth waye fortresse brydge mette thyrd broder whoos name sire plenorius ful noble knyghte iusted gyder eyther smote doune hors man erthe thenne auoyded horse dressid sheldes drewe swerdes gaf many sad stroke one whyle one knyght afore brydge whyle thus foughte two houres neuer rested euer sire launcelot damoysel eheld pallas said damoysel knyghte fyghteth passynge sore ouer longe pnow may ye see said sir launcelot noble knyghte consydre fyrste bataile greuous woundes euen forth wounded merueile may endure longe batail good knyghte pcapitulum octauum meane whyle syre la cote male tayle sanke ryghte doun vpon erthe forwounded forbled myghte stande thenne knyghte hadde pyte hym sayd fayr yonge knyghte desmaye ye ben fresshe whan ye mette wote wel shold haue endured longe ye haue done therfore youre noble dedes armes shall shewe kyndenes gentylnesse alle maye forth al noble knyght sir plenorius took hym vp armes ledde hym toure thenne commaunded hym wyn made rche hym stoppe bledynge woundes psyre said la cote male toyle withdrawe hyhe yonder brydge ag yne wille mete another maner knyght euer said plenorius another maner knyght behynde felauship ye said la cote male tayl ther moche better knyght name sayd plenorius ye shalle knowe said la cote male tayle wel said knyght shalle encountred alle someuer thenne sir plenorius herd knyght calle sayd syr plenorius art thou outher thou must delyuer prysoner thou hast led vnto thy toure el come doo bataile thenne plenorius gat hors came spere hand walloppynge toward syr launcelot thenne beganne feutre speres came gyders thonder smote eyther myghtely horse felle doune vnder thenne auoyded horse pulled swerdes lyke two bulles lasshed gyders grete stroke foynes euer syr launcelot recouerd ground vpon hym sire plenorius traced haue gone aboute hym sire launcelot wold suffer bare hym backer backer tyll came nyyhe toure gate thenne said sire launcelot knowe wel good knyght wete thou wel thy lyf dethe hand therfore yelde thy prysoner ansuerd word strake myytely vpon sir lau celots helme fyre spr nge eyen thenne syre launcelot doubled stroke soo thyck smote hym myghtely made hym knele vpon knee sir launcelot lepte vpon hym pulled hym grouelyng doune thenne sir plenorius yelded hym toure alle prysoners wille thenne sir launcelot receyued hym took trouthe thene rode brydge sir launcelot iusted thre bretheren one hyght pillounes hyght pellogris thyrdde sir pellandris fyrst vpon hor bak sir launcelot smote hem doune afterward bete foote made yelde vnto hym thenne retorned vnto sir plenorius fond pryson kyng carados scotland many knyghtes alle delyuerd thenne sire la cote male tay e came sire launcelot theune sir launcelot wold haue yeuen hym alle fortress brydges nay said la cote male tayle wille haue sire plenorius lyuelode wylle graunte lord sire launcelot come vnto kynge arthur courte knyght alle bretheren pray lord lete hym haue lyuelode wille wel said sire launcelot wille come courte kynge arthur bicome man bretheren fyue sir plenorius wille vndertake said sir launcelot next feest soo place wyded ye shalle knyght round table syr said plenorius atte next feest pentecost wille arthur courte tyme wille guyded ruled kynge arthur ye wille haue thenne sir launcelot sire la cote male tayle reposed hem vnto tyme sire la cote male tayle hole woundes hadde mery chere good rest many good gamys many fayre ladyes pcapitulum nonum meane whyle came sir kay seneschal sire brandyles anone felaushypped wyth thenne within ten dayes thene departed tho knyghtes arthur courte fortress sir lau celot came castel pendragon putte sir bryan de le yles landes cause wold neuer hold kynge arthur alle castel pendragon alle landes therof gaf sire la cote male tayle thene sir launcelot sente neroneus made one knyghte made hym haue alle rule castel countrey vnder la cote male tayle soo rode arthur courte al holy gyders pentecost next folowynge sire plenorius sir la cote male tayle called otherwyse ryght syr breunes le noyre bothe maade knyghtes table round grete londes kynge arthur gaf breune le noyre wedded damoysell maledysaunt called beau viuante euer party called la cote male tayle preued passynge noble knyghte myghty many worshipful dedes dyd lyf sire plenorius proued noble knyght ful prowesse alle dayes lyf moost party awayted vpon sir lau celot sire plenorius bretheren euer knyghtes kynge arthur also frensshe book maketh mencyon syr la cote male tayle auengyd faders dethe pcapitulum x leue sire la cote male tayle torne vnto sir tristram de lyones bretayne whanne la beale isoud vnderstode wedded sent hym mayden bragwayne py eous letter coude thoughte made conclusion hit pleasyd syr tristram wold come courte brynge hym isoud la blaunche maynys shold kepte wel self thenne sir tristram called vnto hym sir kehydius asked hym whether wold go hym cornewaile secretely ansuerd hym redy al tymes thenne lete ordeyne pryuely lytel vessel therin wente syr tristram kehydius dame bragwayne gouernaile sir tristram squyer see contraryous wynde blewe hem costes northwalys nygh castel peryllous thenne sayd sir tristram shalle ye abyde ten dayes gouernaile squyer yf come ageyne daye take next way cornewaile thys forest many straunge aduentures haue herd saye somme hem caste preue departe whanne maye shalle hyhe thenne sir tristram ehydius took horse departed felauship soo rode within forest myle last sir tristram sawe afore hym lykely knyyt armed syttynge welle stronge myghty hors passyng nyghe hym teyed oke man houynge rydynge hym ledynge hors lade speres knyghte satte atte welle semed countenaunce passyng heuy thenne sire tristram rode nere hym said fayr knyyt sytte ye soo droupyng ye seme knyght erraunt armes harneis therfor dresse iuste one v bothe knyght made noo wordes took shelde bokeled hit aboute neck lyghtely took hors lepte vpon hym ne took grete spere nyer departed waye furlonge sire kehydius asked leue sir tristram iuste fyrst doo best said sire tristram soo mette gyders sir kehydius falle sore wounded hyghe aboue pappys pthenne sir tristram said knyyt wel iusted make redy vnto redy said knyght thenne knyght took gretter spere hand encountred sir tristram grete force knyght smote doune sir tristram hors grete falle thenne sir tristram sore ashamed lyghtly auoyded hors put sheld afore sholder drewe swerd thenne sire trystram requyred knyghte knyghthode alyghte vpon foote fyghte hym wille wel said knyght soo alyghte vpon foote auoyded hors cast shelde vpon sholder drewe swerd fought longe bataile gyder ful nyghe two houres pthenne sir tristram said fayr knyght hold thyn hand telle whens thou arte thy name pa said knyght wille auysed thou wolt telle thy name peraduenture wille telle myn pcapitulum xj fayr knyght said name sire tristram de lyones syre saide knyght name sir lamorak de galys sir lamorak said sir tristram well mette bethynke despyte thou dydest sendyng horne vnto kynge markes courte entente haue slayne dishonoured lady quene la beale isoud therfore wete thou wel said sir tristram one v shalle dye departe sire said sir lamorak remembre gyders yle seruage tyme ye promysed grete frendship thenne sire tristram wold make lenger delayes lasshed sir lamorak thus foughte longe tyl eyder wery thenne sir tristram seid sir lamorak alle lyf mette neuer suche knyght soo bygge well brethed ye therfore said syre tristram hit pyte ony v shold meschyeued syr said sire lamorak youre renomme name wille ye haue worship bataille therfor yelde vnto ther took poynte swerd yelde hym nay said sir tristram ye shalle doo soo wel knowe profers gentylnesse fere drede ye haue alle sir tristram profered hym swerde said sire lamorak ouercomen knyghte yelde vnto noble prowesse uer mette alle nay said sir lamorak wille doo gentylnesse requyre yow lete v sworne gyders neuer none v shalle day haue adoo alle syre tristram sire lamorak sware neuer none hem shold fyghte ageynst wele woo pcapitulum xij meane whyle came sire palomydes good knyght folowynge questynge beest hadde shap hede lyke serpent hede body lyke lybard buttock lyke lyon foted lyke herte body suche noyse hit ben noyse thyrtty coupel houdes questyng suche noyse beest made someuer wente beest euermore syr palomydes folowed hit called quest ryyt folowed beest came syr tristram soone cam palamydes breue matere smote doune sir tristram sir lamorak bothe one spere soo departed beste glatysaunt called questynge beest wherfore two knyghtes passynge wrothe sir palomydes wold fyghte foote hem phere men may vnderstande ben worship neuer fourmed alle tymes myght stande somtyme putte werse male fortune somme tyme wers knyghte putte better knyghte rebuke thenne sire tristram sire lamorak gate sire kehydius vpon sheld betwixe bothe ledde hym foster lodge gaf hym charge kepe hym well hym abode thre dayes thenne two knyghtes toke horse crosse departed thenne said sir tristram sire lamorak requyre yf ye happe mete wyth sir palamydes say hym shal fynde atte welle mette hym sire tristram shalle preue whether better knyght soo eyther departed sondry way sire tristram rode nyghe sire kehydius sire lamorak rode vntyl came chappel putte hors vnto pasture anone came sir melyagaunce kynge bagdemagus sone putte hors pasture ware sir lamorak thenne knyght sire melliagaunce maade mone loue hadde quene gueneuer made woful complaynte herd sire lamorak morne sir lamorak took hors rode vnto forest mette two knyghtes houynge vnder wood shawe faire knyghtes said sire lamorak doo ye houynge watchynge yf ye knyghtes arraunt wille iuste loo redy nay sir knyght said soo abyde iuste lye wayte knyghte slewe broder pwhat knyght said sir lamorak ye wold fayne mete syre said hit sire launcelot slew oure broder yf euer maye mete hym shal escape shalle slee hym p ye take vpon grete charge saide sire lamorak sire launcelot noble proued knyyt doute ny none v good ynough hym bileue said sir lamorak herd neuer yet knyght dayes lyf sir launcelot bygge hym pcapitulum xiij ryyght soo stode talkynge thus syre lamorak ware hou syr launcelot came rydynge streyghte toward thenne sire lamorak sale wed hym hym ageyne thenne sire lamorak asked sir launcelot yf ony thynge myght doo hym march nay said sire launcelot tyme thanke thenne eyther departed sir lamorak rode ageyn ther lefte two knyghtes thenne fond hydde leued woode fy said sir lamorak fals cowardes pyte shame ony shold take hyhe ordre knyghthode soo sir lamorak departed fro within whyle mette sire melyagaunce thenne syre lamorak asked hym loued quene gueneuer dyd fer whanne ye made complaynte chappel dyd ye soo said sir melyagau ce thenne wille abyde hit loue quene gueneuer wille ye hit wille preue make good fayrest lady moost beaute world p said sire lamorak say nay therto quene morgause orkeney moder sire gawayne moder fayrest quene lady bereth lyf sayd syre melyagaunce wille preue handes vpon thy body wille ye soo said sire lamorak better quarel kepe fyghte thenne departed eyther grete wrathe thenne came rydyng gyder hit ben thonder eyther smote sore horse felle bakward erthe thenne auoyded horse dressid sheldes drewe swerdes thenne hurtled gyders wylde bore thus fought grete whyle melyagaunce good man grete myght sire lamorak hard bygge hym putte hym alweyes bak eyther wounded sore pand stode thus fyghtynge fortune came sire launcelot sire bleoberys rydynge thenne sire launcelot rode betwixe asked cause fought soo gyders ye bothe knyghtes kynge arthur pcapitulum xiiij syr said melyagaunce shalle telle cause doo bataille praysed lady quene gueneuer said fayrest lady world sire lamorak said nay therto said quene morgause orkeney fayrer beaute syre lamorak saist thou soo hit thy parte disprayse thy pryncesse thou arte vnder theire obeyssauncedn alle alyghte foote sayd quarel make redy wille preue vpon quene gueneuer fayrest lady moost bounte world psyre said sire lamorak loth haue adoo quarell euery man thynketh owne lady fayrest though prayse lady loue moost ye shold wrothe though lady quene gueneuer fayrest eye wete ye wel quene morgause orkeney fayrest myn eye soo euery knyght thynketh owne lady fayrest wete ye wel syr ye man world excepte sire tristram moost lothest haue adoo alle ye wille nedes fyghte shal endure longe may pthenne spake sire bleoberys said lord sire lau celot wyste neuer soo mysauysed ye syre lamorak saith reason knyghtely pfor warne haue lady thynketh fayrest lady world grete reason ye shold wrothe suche langage wel ye wote syr lamorak noble knyght knowe hath oughte v euer good wille therfore praye good frendes pthenne sire launcelot sayd vnto sir lamerak pray foryeue myn euylle wylle yf mysauysed wille amende hit syre sayde sir lamorak amendys soone made betwixe soo sir launcelot sire bleoberys departed syr melyagaunce sir lamorak took horse eyther departed within whyle came kynge arthur mette sir lamorak iusted hym smote doune sire lamorack wounded hym sore spere soo rode hym wherfore sir lamorak wrothe wold fyghte hym foote hou sire lamorak knewe kynge arthur pcapitulum xv leue tale speke sire tristram rode mette sir kay seneschal sire kay asked sir tristram coutrey ansuerd countrey cornewail hit maye wel said sir kay yet herd neuer euer good knyghte came oute cornewaile euyl spoken said sir tristram please telle name requyre syre wete ye wel said sire kay name sire kay seneschal name said sir tristram wete ye well ye named shamefullest knyghte youre tonge lyuynge ye called good knyght ye called vnfortunate passyng ouer thwarte tonge thus rode gyders tyl came brydge knyghte wold lete hem passe tyl one hem iusted hym knyyt iusted sir kay knyght gaf sir kay falle name sire tor syre lamoraks half broder thenne two rode theyre lodgynge fonde sire brandyles sir tor came thyder anone pand satte atte souper foure knyghtes thre spa alle shame cornysshe knyghtes psyr tristram herd alle saide sayd lytell thoughte tyme discouerd name vpon morne sir tristram took hors abode vpon way syre brandyles proferd iuste sir tristram sir tristram smote hym doune hors alle erthe thenne sire tor le fyse de vayshoure encountred syre tristram sire tristram smote hym doune thenne rode waye sir kay folowed hym wold felauship thenne sire brandyles came sir kay said wold wete fayne knyghtes name come said sir kay shall praye hym telle v name soo rode gyders tylle came nyghe hym thenne ware sat welle putte helme drynke welle whanne sawe come laced helme lyghtly took hors proferd hem iuste nay said syre brandyles iusted late ynough come entent come requyre knyghthode telle v name fayre knyghtes sythen desyre please ye shal wete name sir tristram de lyones neuewe vnto kynge mark cornewayle good tyme saide sire brandyles wel ye fonden wete ye wel ryght gladde haue fonde felauship wold ryyt glad company ye knyghte world noble felauship round table mooste desyreth haue company god thanke said sir tristram theyre grete goodenes yet feale wel vnabyl felauship neuer yet suche dedes worthynes company suche felauship sayde sire kay ye syre tristram de lyones ye man called moost prowesse excepte sir launcelot du lake bereth lyf crysten ne hethen fynde suche another knyght speke prowesse handes trouthe alle yet coude neuer creature saye hym dishonour make hit good pthus talked grete whyle thenne departed eyther suche weyes hem semed best pcapitulum xvj shall ye cause kynge arthur cam forest perillous northwalys meanes lady name annowre lady came kynge arthur cardyf fayre promyse fayre bihestes maade kynge arthur ryde forest perillous grete sorceresse many dayes hadde loued kynge arthur cause wold haue hym lye came countrey soo whanne kynge gone many knyghtes folowed kynge arthur whan myst hym sir launcelot braundyles many brought hym toure desyred hym lye thenne kynge remembryd hym lady wold lye crafte coude doo thenne euery daye wolde make hym ryde forest owne knyghtes entent haue kynge arthur slayne whan lady annoure sawe myyt haue hym wille thenne laboured fals meanes haue destroyed kynge arthur slayne thenne lady lake alwey frendely kynge arthur vnderstoode subtyl craftes kynge arthur lyke destroyed therfore lady lake hyght nyneue cam forest seke sire launcelot du lake sire tristram helpe kynge arthur day lady lake knewe wel kynge arthur shold slayne onles hadde helpe one two knyytes thus rode vp donne tyl mette sire tristram anone sawe hym knewe hym lord sir tristram said well ye mette blessid tyme haue mette day within two houres shalle done foulest dede euer done land fair damoysel said sir tristram maye amende hit come said alle haste ye maye ye shal see worshipfullest knyyt world hard bestad pthenne said sire tristram redy helpe suche noble man neither better ne wer said lady lake noble kynge arthur hym self god defence said sir trystram euer shold suche distresse thenne rode gyders grete pa vntyl came lytel turret castel vndernethe c stel sawe knyghte standynge vpon foote fyghtynge two knyghtes soo sir tristram biheld laste two knyghtes smote doune one knyghte one hem vnlaced helme haue slayne hym lady annoure gat kyng arthur suer hand haue stryken hede alle came sire tristram alle myghte cryenge traytresse traitresse leue anone sire tristram smote one knyghtes thorou body felle dede ne rasshed smote bak sonder meane whyle lady lake cryed kyng arthur lete fals lady escape thenne kynge arthur ouertoke swerd smote heed lady lake took vp heed henge hit vp heyre sadel bowe thenne sir tristram horsed kyng arthur rode forth hym charged lady lake discouer name tyme whan kynge horsed thanked hertely sire tristram desyred wete name wold telle hym poure knyght auenturous soo bare kynge arthur felauship tyl met somme knyghtes within whyle mette sir ector de mary knewe kynge arthur sir tristram desyred iuste one hem thenne sire tristram rode vnto sir ector smote hym hors whanne hadde done soo cam ageyne kynge said lord yonder one knyghtes may bere felauship another day dede haue done truste god ye shalle vnderstande wold seruyse allas said kyng arthur lete wete ye tyme said sir tristram soo departed lefte kynge arthur sir ector gyders pcapitulum xvij thenne day sette sire tristram sire lam rak mette welle thenne took kehydius foster hous soo rode hym ship lefte dame brangwayne gouernayle soo sayled cornewaile holy gyders assent enformacyon dame brangwayn whan thye landed rode vnto sire dynas seneschal trusty frende sir tristram dame brangwayne syre dynas rode courte kynge marke told quene la beale isoud sir tristram nyghe countrey thenne pure ioye la beale isoud swouned whan myghte speke said gentyl knyyt seneschall help myght speke hym outher herte wille brast p thenne sir dynas dame brangwayne broughte syr tristram kehydius pryuely vnto courte vnto chamber la beale isoud hadde assygned hit telle ioyes betwixe la b ale isoud sire tristram tonge telle herte thynke hit pen wryte hit frensshe book maketh mencyon fyrst tyme euer sir kehydius sawe la beale isoud soo enamoured vpon pure loue myghte neuer withdrawe hit last ye shall book ended sire kehydius dyed loue la beale isoud thenne pryuely wrote vnto lettres ballade moost goodlyest vsed tho dayes p whanne la beale isoud vnderstood letter hadde pyte co playnt vnauysed wrote another letter comforte hym alle sire tristram alle whyle turret commaundement la beale isoud whan myght came vnto sire tristram day kynge mark played chesse vnder chamber wyndowe tyme sire tristram sire kehydius within chamber ouer kyng marke myshapped sir tristram fonde letter kehydius nt vnto la beale isoud also foud letter wrote vnto kehydius tyme la beale isoud chamber thenne sir tristram came vnto la beale isoud said madame letter sente vnto letter ye sent vnto hym sente letter allas madame good loue haue loued many landes rychesse haue forsaken loue ye traytresse whiche dothe grete payne sir kehydius broughte oute bretayne coutrey thy fader kynge howel wanne landes wedded thy syster isoud le blaunche maynys goodenes dyd vnto yet ue knyghte clene mayden wete thou wel syr kehydius falshede treason thou hast done wille reuenge hit vpon alle sir tristram drewe oute swerd said sire kehydius kepe thenne la beale isoud swouned erthe whanne sir kehydius sawe sir tristram come vpon hym sawe none bote lepte oute bay wyndowe euen ouer hede sat kynge marke playenge chess whanne kynge sawe one come hurlynge ouer hede sayd felawe arte thou cause thou lepest oute wyndowe p lord kynge said kehydius hit fortuned slepe wyndowe aboue hede slepte slommeryd soo felle doune thus sir kehydius excused hym pcapitulum xiij thenne sir tristram dredde sore lest discouerd vnto kynge wherfore drewe hym strengthe toure armed hym suche armour fyghte hem wold stande hym soo whanne sire tristram sawe resystence ageynst hym sente gouernaile hors spere knyghtely rode forth oute castel openly called castel tyntagil euen atte gate mette gyngalyn syr gawayns sone anone sir gyngalyn putte spere reyste ranne vpon ire trystram brake spere sire tristram tyme swerd gaf hym suche buffet vpon helme fylle doune sadel swerd ode adoune carf sonder hors neck sire tristram rode waye forest alle doynge sawe kyng mark thenne sente uyer vnto hurte kynghte commaunded hym come hym soo dyd whanne kynge marke wyst sir gyngalyn wel comed hym gaf hym hors asked hym knyght hit encoutred hym syr said sir gyngalyn wote knyyt wel wote sygheth maketh grete dole thenne sir tristram within whyle mette knyght owne hyghte sir fergus whan mette hym made grete sorowe moche felle doune hors swoune suche sorowe thre dayes thre nyghtes thenne laste sir tristram sent vnto courte sir fergus spere tydynges rode way met damoysel came sir palamydes knowe ke sir tristram dyd thenne sir fergus told al mynde pallas said damoysel shalle fynde hym suche place said sire fergus pthenne sir fergus fond quene isoud seke bedde makynge grettest dole euer ony erthely woman made whan damoysel fonde sire tristram made grete dole cause myyt amende hym made hym payne last sir tristram toke hors rode aweye thenne thre dayes coude fynde hym thenne broughte hym mete drynke wold none thenne another tyme sir tristram escaped awey damoysel happed hym ryde castel sire palamydes sir tristram dyd bataille whan la beale isoud departed fortune damoysel mette sire tristram ageyne makynge grettest dole euer erthely creature made yede lady castel tolde mysauenture sire tristram allas said lady castel lord sir tristram ryght castel said damoysel good tyme saide lady e soo nyghe shalle haue mete drynke best harp haue vpon taught goodely harpynge bereth pryde world lady damoisel brought hym mete drynke ete lytel therof thenne vpon nyght putte hors hym thenne vnlaced armour thenne sir tristram wold go wildernesse brast doune tree bowes otherwhyle whan fond harp lady sente hym thenne wold harpe playe therupon wepe gyders somtyme whan sire tristram woode lady wyst thenne wold sytte doune playe vpon harp thenne wold sire tristram come harp herken ther somtyme wold harpe hym self thus endured quarter yere thene last ranne way wiste become thenne naked waxed lene poure flesshe soo felle felauship herd men sheepherdes dayly wold gyue hym somme mete drynke whan dyd ony shrewd dede wold bete hym roddes soo clypped hym sheres made hym lyke foole pcapitulum xix vpon day dagonet kynge arthur foole came cornewaile two squyers hym rode thorugh forest came fayre welle sir tristram wonte whether hote alyghte drynke welle meane whyle horse brake lous p ryght soo sire tristram came vnto fyrst sousyd sire dagonet welle squyers lough sheepherdes forth al ranne horse broughte hem ageyne one one ryghte soo wete made hem lepe vp ryde wayes p thus sire tristram endured halfe yere naked wold neuer come town ne vyllage meane whyle damoysel syre palomydes sente seke sir tristram yede vnto sir palomydes told hym alle meschyef sir tristram endured allas sayd sir palomydes hit grete pyte euer soo noble knyght shold soo mescheued loue af lady neuertheles wille goo seke hym comforte hym may pthenne lytel tyme la beale isoud co maunded sir kehydius oute conutrey cornewaile soo sir kehydius departed dolorous herte aduenture mette sir palamydes enfelaushypped gyder eyther complayned theire ho lou loued la beale isoud lete v said sir palomydes seke sire tristram loued wel lete v preue whether maye recouer hym soo rode forest thre dayes thre nyghtes wold neuer take lodgynge euer soughte sir tristram vpon tyme aduenture mette kynge mark ryden hys men al alone whanne sawe hym syre palomydes knewe hym sir kehydins knewe hym fals kynge said sir palomydes pyte thou hast thy lyf thou arte destroyer alle worshipful knyghtes thy meschyef thy vengeaunce thou hast destroyed mooste noble knyght sire tristram de lyones therfor defende said sir palomydes thou shalt dye day shame said kyng mark ye two armed vnarmed said sir palomydes shalle fynde remedy therfore knyyt thou shalt haue harneis nay said kyng mark wille haue adoo yow cause haue ye none alle mysease sir tristram hath letter fond dyd hym displeasyre god knoweth ful sory disease malady soo kyng thus xcused hym frendes kyng mark wold haue vnto tyntagil syr palomydes wolde torned vnto realme logrys sir kehydius saide wolde goo bretayn p torne vnto sir dagonet ayene whanne squyers vpon horsbak demyd sheepherdes sente foole araye hem cause laughed hem soo rode vnto kepers beestes alle bete syr tristram sawe bete wonte gyue hym mete drynke thenne ran thyder gat sir dagonet hede gaf hym suche falle erthe brysed hym sore lay stylle thenne wrast swerd oute hand ther ranne one squyers smote hede fled soo sir tristram took waye swerd hand rennynge hadde ben wylde woode pthenne sir dagonet rode kyng mark told hym hou spedde forest therfore said sir dagonet beware kynge mark thou come aboute welle forest foole naked foole foole mette gyders hadde almost slayn pa said kynge mark sir matto le breune felle oute wytte cause lost lady whan sir gaherys smote doune sir matto wanne lady hym neuer syns mynde pyte good knyght pcapitulum xx thenne sir andred cosyn vato sir tristram made lady peramour say noyse hit sire tristram euer dyed tale broughte vnto kynge markes courte buryed hym welle dyed besoughte kynge marke make cosyn sir andred kynge countre lyonas whiche sir trystram lord alle dyd sir andred cause wold haue sire tristram la de pand whanne kynge mark herd telle sir tristram dede wepte made grete dole whanne quene isoud herd tydynges maade suche sorowe nyghe oute mynde soo vpon daye thought slee self neuer lyue sir tristram deth soo vpon day la beale isoud gat swerd pryuely bare hit gardyn pyghte swerd thorugh plumme tree vp hyltes soo hit stak fast hit stode brest hyhe wold haue ronne vpon swerd haue slayne self palle aspyed kyng marke kneled doune saide swete lord ihesu haue mercy vpon maye lyue dethe syr tristram de lyones fyrst loue shalle last wordes came kyng mark took armes thenne took vp swerd bare away hym toure made kept watched surely lay longe seke nyy poynte dethe meane whyle ranne sir tristram naked forest swerd hand soo cam hermytage leid hym doun slepte meane whyle heremyte stale aweye swerd leid mete doune hym thus kepte ten dayes last departed came herd men ageyne gyaunt countre hyght tawleas fere sir tristram seuen yere durst neuer moche goo large moost party kepte hym sure castel owne soo tauleas herd telle sir tristram dede noyse courte kynge marke thenne tauleas wente dayly large soo happed vpon daye came herd men wandryng langerynge sette hym doun reste among meane whyle ther cam knyght cornewaile ledde lady hym name sir dynaunt whanne gyaunt sawe hym wente herd men hydde hym vnder tree soo knyght came welle alyghte repose hym soone hors gyaunt tauleas came betwixe knyght hors toke hors lepte vpon hym forth rode vnto sir dynaunt took hym coller pulled hym afore hym vpon hors wolde haue stryken hede thenne herd men said vnto sire tristram helpe yonder knyght helpe ye hym seid sir tristram dare said herd men thenne sir tristram ware swerd knyght hit lay soo thyder ranne took vp swerd stroke sir tauleas hede yede way herd men pcapitulum xxj thenne knyght took vp gyaunts hede bare hit hym vnto kynge marke told hym aduenture betyd hym forest naked man rescowed hym grymly gyaunt tauleas hadde ye aduenture said kynge marke forsothe said syr dynaunt fayre fontayne foreste many aduenturous knyytes mete madde man wel said kyng mark wille see wild man within day two kynge marke commaunded knyghtes hunter shold redy morne hunte soo vpon morne wente vnto forest whanne kynge came welle fonde lyenge welle fayr naked man swerd hym thenne kyng mark blewe straked knyghtes came hym thenne kynge commaunded knyghtes take naked man fayrenes brynge hym castel soo saufly fayre cast mantel vpon sir tristram soo ledde hym vnto tyntagyll bathed hym wasshed hym gaf hym hote suppynges til brought hym wel remembraunce alle whyle creature knewe sir tristram man soo hit felle vpon daye quene la beale isoud herd suche man ranne naked foreste kynge brought hym home courte thenne la beale isoud called vnto dame brangwayne said come wille goo see man lord brought forest last daye passed forthe spered seke man thenne squyer told quene gardyn takynge rest repose hym ageynst sonne soo whan quene loked vpon sir tristram remembryd hym euer heid vnto dame brangwayne semeth shold haue sene hym fore many place soone sir tristram sawe knewe wel ynough thenne torned awey vysage wepte thenne quene hadde alweyes lytel brachet sir tristram gaf fyrst tyme euer came cornewaile neuer wold brachet departe yf syre tristram nyghe la beale isoud brachet sente kynges doughter fraunce vnto syre tristram grete loue anone lytel brachet felte saueour syr tristram lepte vpon hym lycked leary erys thene whyned quested smelled foot handes partyes body myghte come lady sayd dame brangwayn vnto la beale isoud allas allas said see myn lord syr tristram therupon isoud felle doune swoune soo laye grete whyle whan myght speke said lord sir tristram blessid god ye haue lyf sure ye shalle discouerd lytel brachet wille neuer leue also sure soone lord kynge mark doo knowe wil bannyssh oute countrey cornewaile el destroye goddes sake myn owne lord graunte kynge marke wille thenne drawe vnto courte kyng arthur ye byloued euer whan maye shalle sende vnto whan ye lyst ye may come alle tymes erly late wille commaundement lyue poure lyf euer dyd quene lady madame said sir tristram goo mykel anger daunger haue escaped loue pcapitulum xxij thenne quene departed brachet wold hym alle came kynge marke brachet sat vpon hym bayed al syr andred spak said syr sir tristram see brachet nay said kyng suppose thenne kyng asked hym vpon feith name pso god help said name sir tristram de lyones ye lyst saide kyng mark repenteth recouer thenne lete calle baron iuge sir tristram dethe thene many baron wold assente therto especyal syr dynas seneschal sir fergus thaduyse al sir tristram banysshed coutrey x yere therupon took oth vpon book kyng baron soo made departe oute countrey cornewaile many baron brought hym vnto hys shyp whiche somme frendes somme foe meane whyle came knyghte kynge arthur name dynadan comyng seke sir tristram thenne shewed hym armed alle poyntes goynge shyp fayre knyyte said sir dynadan ye passe courte ye iuste requyre good wille said sir tristram lordes wille gyue leue thenne baron graunted therto soo ranne gyders sire tristram gaf sire dynadan falle thenne praid sir tristram gyue hym leue goo felauship ye shalle ryght welcome said thenne sire tristram soo took theyr horse rode shyppes gyders whanne sire tristram see said grete wel kyng marke myn enemyes saye hem wille come ageyne whan maye wel rewarded fyghtynge sire marhaus delyuerd countrey seruage wel rewarded fetchyng costes quene isoud oute irland daunger fyrst last way comynge home daunger brynge ageyne quene isoud castel pluere well rewarded whanne foughte sir bleoberys syre segwarydes wyf well rewarded whan fouyt syre blamore de ganys kynge anguysshe fader vnto la beale isoud well rewarded whan smote doune good knyghte syre lamorak de galys kyng markes request wel rewarded whan fought kynge honderd knyghtes kynge northgalys bothe wold haue put land seruage put rebuke wel rewarded sleynge tauleas myghty gyaunte many dedes haue done hym haue waryson telle kynge mark many noble knyghtes table roud haue spared baron countrey sake also wel rewarded whan fought good knyght sir palomydes rescowed quene isoud hym tyme kynge marke said afore baron shold haue ben better rewarded nad forth alle took see pcapitulum xiij next landynge faste see mette sir tristram sir dynadan sir ector de mary sir bors de ganys sir ector iusted syr dynadan smote hym hors doun thenne sir tristram wold haue iusted syre bors sir bors said wolde iuste cornysshe knyghtes called men worship done vpon brydge came sire bleoberys syr dryaunt sir bleoberys profered iuste syr tristram sir tristram smote doune syr bleoberys thenne said sire bors de ganys wist neuer cornyssh knyghte soo grete valoure soo valyaunt knyyt bereth trappours enbroudred crounes thenne sir tristram syr dynadan departed fro forest mette damoysel came loue sire launcelot seke somme noble knyghtes kyng arthur courte rescowe sir launcelot soo sir launcelott ordeyned treason quene morgan le fay haue slayne sir launcelot cause ordeyned thyrtty knyghtes lye wayte sir launcelot damoysel knewe treason cause damoysel came seke noble knyghtes helpe syr launcelot nyght day syr launcelot shold come xxx knyghtes soo damoysel mette syre bors sire ector sir dryaunt told hem alle four treason morgan le fay thenne promysed wold nyghe sire launcelot shold mete xxx knyytes yf soo set vpon hym wil rescowes damoysel departed aduenture damoisel met sir tristram sir dynadan damoysel told hem al treason ordeyned sir launcelot fair damoysel said sir tristram bryng place shold mete sir launcelot thenne said sir dynadan ye hit v fyghte thyrtty knyghtes wete wel wylle therof matche one knyght two thre ynough men matche xv knyghtes wille neuer vndertake fy shame said sire tristram doo youre parte nay said sir dynadan therof yf ye wil lene sheld ye bere sheld cornewaile cowardyse named knyytes cornewaile sheldes ye euer forborne nay said syr tristram departe sheld sake gaf one thyng said sir tristram promyse syr dynadan yf thou wilt promyse abyde shalle slee desyre ansuer one knyghte yf thy herte wille serue stande loke vpon syre said syre dynadan promyse loke vpon doo may saue self wold mette soo thenne anone thyrtty knyghtes cam fast four knyghtes ware eyther soo thyrtty knyghtes lete thys cause wold wrathe yf caas adoo syr launcelot four knyghtes lete passe entent wold see beholde wold doo syr launcelot soo thyrtty knyghtes paste came sir tristram sir dynadan thenne sir tristram cryed hyghe loo knyght ageynste loue sire launcelot slewe two one sperd ten swerd thenne came syte dynadan dyd passynge wel soo thyrtty knyghtes wente ten awey fledde al bataille sawe sir bors de ganys thre felawes thenne sawe wel hit knyghte iusted hem brydge thenne took horse rode vnto syr tristram praysed hym thanked hym good dedes alle desyred syre tristram goo wyth hem lodgynge said nay wold go lodgynge thenne alle four knyghtes praid hym telle hem name faire lordes said syr tristram tyme wille telle name pcapitulum xxiiij thene sir tristram sir dynadan rode forth theire weye tyl came sheepherdes herde men asked hem yf knewe ony lodgynge herberough nyghe hand p forsothe syrs sayde herde men good lodgynge castel suche customme shalle knyghte herberowed yf iuste two knyghtes yf one knyghte must iuste two ye therin soone shalle ye matched shrewde herberowe said syre dynadan lodge ye wille lodge fy shame sayd sir tristram ye knyghte table round wherfore ye may worship refuse lodgynge soo said herd men ye beten haue wers ye shalle lodged yf ye bete ye shalle wel herberowed said syr dynadan two sure knyghtes thenne sire dynadan wold lodge manere sire tristram requyred hym knygthode rode thyder make shorte tale syr tristram sir dynadan smote hem doune bothe soo entred castel good chere coude thynke deuyse whanne vnarmed thought mery good rest came yates syre palomydes syre gaherys requyrynge haue customme castel aray said sire dynadan wold haue rest may said sir tristram must nedes defende customme castel soo moche haue better lordes castel therfore saide sire tristram nedes muste ye make redy deuyls name said sir dynadan came company made redy sir gaherys encountred sire tristram syr gaherys falle sir palamydes encountred sir dynadan sir dynadan falle thenne hit fall falle soo thenne muste fyghte foote wold syr dynadan sore brysed falle syre palomydes gaf hym thenne sir tristram vnlaced syre dynadans helme praid hym helpe hym wille sayde syr dynadan sore wounded thyrtty knyghtes hadde late agoo doo alle pbut ye fare said sire dynadan vnto syr tristram madde man man yt oute mynde yt wold cast hym self awey may curse tyme euer sawe al world two suche knyghtes ben wode sire launcelot ye syr tristram one felle felauship syr launcelot haue done set werke quarter yere kepte bedde ihesu defende said syr dynadan suche two knyghtes specially felauship thenne said syre tristram fyghte hem thenne syr tristram badde hem come forth wille fyghte thenne syr palomydes syr gaherys dressid smote hem bothe thenne dynadan smote syr gaherys stroke two torned hym nay said sir palomydes moche shame v two knyghtes fyghte one thenne dyd byd syr gaherys stande syde knyght hath lyste fyghte thenne rode gyders fought longe attelast syr tristram doubled stroke drofe syre palomydes bak thre strydes thenne one assente syre gaherys syr dynadan wente betwixe departed sonder thenne assent syr tristram wold haue lodged gyders syre dynadan wold lodge castel thenne cursed tyme euer came feauship soo took hors harneis departed thenne sir tristram prayd lordes castel lene hym man brynge hym lodgynge soo dyd ouertoke sir dynadan rode lodgynge two myle then good man pryory wel ease nyght sir bors sire bleoberys sir ector syre dryaunt abode stylle place sire tristram fouyt thyrtty knyghtes mette syr launcelot nyght made promyse lodge syr colgreuaunce nyght pcapitulum xxv bvt anone noble knyghte syre launcelot herd shelde cornewayle thenne wyst wel hy sire tristram fought enemyes thenne syre launcelot praysed syre tristram called hym man moost worship world psoo knyght pryory hyght pellinore desyred wete name sire tristram wyse coude syr tristram departed lefte sir dynadan pryory soo wery soo sore brysed myghte ryde thenne knyght syre pellinore said sire dynadan sythen ye wille telle knyghtes name ryde hym make hym telle name shall dye therfore beware sir knyght said sir dynadan ye folowe hym ye shalle repente hit soo knyghte sire pellinore rode sire tristram requyred hym iustes ne si tristram smote hym doune wounded hym thoruy sholder soo past way next day folowyng syr tristram mette pursyuauts told hym made grete crye turnement bitwene kynge carados scotland kynge northwalys eyther shold iuste ageyne castel maydens pursyuautes sought alle coutrey good knyytes especyal kynge carados lete make sekynge sir launcelot du lake kyng northgalys lete seke sir tristram de lyonas pand tyme syr tristram thought iustes soo aduenture mette sire kay seneschal syr sagramor le desyrus syr kay requyred sir tristram iuste sire tristram maner refused hym cause wold hurte brysed ageynste grete iustes shold bifore castel maydens therfore thought repose hym reste hym alway sir kay cryed sir knyyt cornewaile iust el yelde recreaunte whan sir tristram herd hym saye soo torned hym thenne sire kay refused hym torned bak thenne syr tristram said fynde shalle take thenne sire kay torned euylle wylle syre tristram smote syr kay doune soo rode forthe p thenne syre sagramor le desyrus rode syre tristram maade hym iuste hym syre tristram smote doune syre sagramor le desyrus hors rode way day mette damoysel told hym shold wynne grete worship knyyt aduenturous dyd moche harme alle countrey pwhanne sir tristram herd say soo gladde goo wynne worship sire tristram rode damoysel vj myle thenne mette hym syre gawayne alle syre gawayne knewe damoysel damoysel quene morgan le fay thenne sir gawayne vnderstode ladde knyght somme meschyef faire knyght said sire gawayne whyder ryde wyth damoysel syr said sire tristram wote whyder shalle ryde damoysel wylle lede syr saide syre gawayne ye shalle ryde lady neuer good ylle thenne sir gawayne pulled oute swerd said damoysel yf thou telle anon cause thou ledest knyyt thou shalt dye hit ryght anone knowe alle ladyes treason mercy syre gawayne said yf ye wille saue lyf wille telle saye said sir gawayne thow shalte haue thy lyf syre said quene morgan le fay lady hath ordeyned xxx ladyes seke aspye sir laucelot sir tristram ye trainys ladyes may fyrst mete ony two knyghtes shold torne hem vnto morgan le fay castel sayenge shold doo dedes worship yf ony tho two knyytes cam xxx knyghtes lyenge watchyng toure wayte vpon sir launcelot vpon syre tristram fy shame said sire gawayne euer suche fals treason shold wrought vsed quene kynges syster kynge quenes doughter pcapitulum xxvj syr said sire gawayne wille ye stande wille see malyce thyrtty knyghtes syr said sir tristram goo ye hem hit please ye shal see wille fayle hit long go syn felawe mette thyrtty knyytes quenes felauship god spede v soo may wynne worship ne sir gawayne sire tristram rode toward castel morgan le fay euer sir gawayne demed wel sire tristram de lyones cause herd two knyghtes slayne beten thyrtty knyghtes whanne came afore castel sir gawayn spak hyghe said quene morgan le fay sende oute youre knyghtes ye haue leyd watche sir laucelot sir tristram said sir gawayne knowe fals treason thorou place ryde men shall knowe fals treason lete see sir gawayn whether ye dare come castel ye thyrtty knyghtes thenne quene spak al thyrtty knyghtes attones said sir gawayne ful wel wetest thou thou dost saist god knowe passynge wel alle thou spekest dost thow saist hit vpon pryde good knyghte somme v knowen full wel handes knyght ouer alle wel wete thou wel sir gawayne hit sake thyn wylle come oute castel wete ye wel sir gawayne knyght bereth armes cornewaile knowe hym thenne sir gawayne sir tristram departed rode wayes day two gyders aduenture met syr kay syr sagramor le desyrus thenne glad syr gawayne wiste shelde corne waile demynge thus rode gyders daye two thenne ware syr breuse sau ce pyte chacynge lady haue slayne slayn peramour afore hold stylle said syr gawayne shewe none forthe ye shalle see reward yonder fals knyght aspye wel horsed wille escape awey thenne syre gawayne rode betwix syr breuse lady said fals knyghte leue haue adoo whan syr breuse sawe moo syre gayne feutryd spere syr gawayne ageynst hym syr breuse ouerthrewe syr gawayne thenne rode ouer hym ouerthwart hym twenty tymes haue destroyed hym whan sire tristram sawe hym doo soo vylaynous dede hurled oute ageynste hym whan syr breuse sawe hym shelde cornewaile knewe hym well syre tristram thenne fledde sir tristram folowed hym syr breuse saunce pyte horsed wente waye quyte sir tristram folowed hym longe wold fayne haue ben auengyd vpon hym soo whanne hadde longe chaced hym sawe fayre welle thyder rode repose hym teyed hors til tree pcapitulum xvij thenne pulled helme wasshed vysage handes soo felle slepe pin meane whyle came damoysel sought sir tristram many wayes dayes within land whanne came welle loked vpon hym forgeten hym remembraunce sire tristram hys hors knewe hym hyghte passe brewel ben sire tristram hors many yeres whanne mad forest syr fergus kepte hym soo lady dame brangwayne abode stylle tyl awake soo whanne sawe hym wake salewed hym ageyn eyther knewe old acqueyntaunce thenne told hym sought hym longe brode told hym hou hadde letter quene la beale isoud thenne anon sire tristram redde wete ye well gladde theryn many pyteous complaynte thenne sir tristram said lady brangwayne ye shalle ryde tyl turnement done castel maydens thenne shalle ye bere letter tydynges thenne sire tristram took hors sought lodgynge mette wyth good auncyent knyght prayd hym lodge hym ryyt came gouernaile vnto sir tristram glad lady soo old knyghtes name sir pellownus told grete turnement shold att castel maydens sir launcelot xxxij knyytes blood ordeyned sheldes cornewaile ryyte soo came one vnto syr pellounes told hym sir persydes de bloyse come home thenne knyght helde vp handes thanked god comynge home sir pellounes told syr tristram two yeres sene sone syr persydes syr said sir tristram knowe sone wel ynough good knyght soo tyme syr tristram syr persydes came lodgynge one soo vnarmed hem putte vpon hem clothynge thenne two knyghtes eche welcomed whanne syr persydes vnderstode sir tristram cornewaile said one cornewaile iusted afore kynge marke soo happed tyme ouerthrowe ten knyghtes thenne came syre tristram de lyones ouerthrewe took lady awey shalle neuer forgete shalle remembre euer see tyme said sir trystram vnderstande ye hate syr tristram dome ye wene ye sir tristram able withstande malyce yes said sir persydes knowe wel sir tristram noble knyght moche better knyght yet shalle owe hym good wille p ryght stode thus talkynge bay wyndowe castel sawe many knyghtes tydynge fro toward turnement thenne sire tristram ware lykely knyght rydyng vpon grete black hors black couerd shelde knyyte said sire tristram black hors blak sheld semeth good knyyt knowe hym wel said sir persydes one best knyghtes world thenne syre launcelot said sir tristram nay said syre persydes hit syr palomydes yet vncrystened pcapitulum xxviij thenne sawe moche people countrey salewe sire palomydes within whyle ther cam squyer castel told syre pellounes lord castel knyght blak sheld smyten doune thyrten knyytes fayr broder said sir tristram vnto syr persydes lete v caste vpon v clokes lete v goo see play soo said sir persydes wille goo lyke knaues thyder wille ryde lyke men good knyghtes withstande oure enemyes soo armed took horse grete speres thyder went many knyytes assayed hem self turnement anone sir palomydes sawe sir persydes thenne sente squyer vnto hym said goo thou yonder knyght grene sheld therin lyon gooldis say hym requyre hym iuste telle hym name sire palomydes whanne sir persydes vnderstood request syre palomydes made hym redy anone mette gyders syre persydes falle thenne syre tristram dressid hym reuengyd vpon sir palomydes sawe syre palomydes redy soo sire tristram took hym auauntage smote hym ouer hors tayle whanne spere reyste thenne starte vp syre tristram took hors lyytely wrothe oute mesure sore ashamed falle thenne sire tristram sente vnto syr palomydes gouernaile prayd hym iuste hym request nay said sire palomydes att tyme wille iuste knyght knowe hym better weneth yf wrothe may ryghte morne att castel maydens maye see many knyghtes came syr dynadan whanne sawe sire tristra wrothe lyst ia e lo sayd sir dynadan may preue man neuer soo good yet maye haue falle neuer soo wyse myght ouersene rydeth wel neuer fylle soo syre tristram passynge wrothe sayd syre persydes syre dynadan wille reuenge ryghte soo stood talkyng came sir tristram lykely knyght rydyng passynge soberly heuyly blak shelde knyght said sir tristram vnto syr persydes knowe hym well said sir persydes name sire bryaunt northwalys soo paste amonge knyghtes northwalys came syre launcelot du lake sheld armes cornewaile sente squyer vnto syr bryaunt requyred hym iuste hym wel said syr bryaunt sythen requyred iuste wille doo may syre launcelot smote donne syr bryaunt hors grete falle thenne syr tristram merueiled knyght bare sheld cornewaile euer said syr dynadan warante kynge bannys blood whiche ben knyghtes moost noble prowesse world accompte soo many soo many thenne came two knyytes northgales one hyghte hewe de la montayne syr madok de la montayne chalengyd sire launcelot foote hote syr launcelot refusyng hem made hym redy one spere smote hem doune bothe ouer hors croupe soo sir launcelot rode way good lord said sire tristram good knyght bereth shelde cornewaile semeth rydeth best maner euer sawe knyghte ryde thenne kynge northgalys rode vnto syre palomydes praid hym hertely sake iuste knyght hath done v northgalys despyte syr said sir palomydes ful lothe haue adoo knyght cause morne grete turnement shalle therfor wille kepe self fresshe wille nay said kyng northgalys pray requyre hym iustes syre sayd syr palomydes wille iuste request requyre knyght iuste often haue sene man haue falle owne request pcapitulum xix thenne sir palomydes sente vnto sir launcelot squyer requyred hym iustes fair felawe seid sir launcelot telle thy lordes name syre said squyer lordes name syr palomydes good knyght good houre said sir launcelot knyght sawe thys seuen yeres leuer adoo hym eyther knyghtes made hem redy two grete speres nay said syr dynadan ye shalle see sir palomydes quyte hym ryght wel hit may soo said sir tristram vndertake knyght sheld cornewayle shal gyue hym falle bileue hit said sir dynadan ryght spored horse feutryd speres eyther hytte syr palomydes brake spere vpon sire launcelot sat meued sir launcelot smote hym lyghtly made hors auoyde sadel stroke brake shelde hauberke fallen slayne said sir tristram wiste wel maner rydyng bothe sire palomydes shold haue falle ryght sir launcelot rode way rode well drynke repose hym northgalys aspyed hym whyther rode thenne folowed hym twelue knyghtes haue meschyeued hym cause vpon morne turnement castel maydens shold wynne vyctory soo came vpon sir launcelot sodenly vnnethe myght putte vpon hym helme take hors handes hym thenne sir launcelot gat spere rode thorou slewe knyght brake spere body thenne drewe swerd smote vpon ryght hand vpon lyfte hand soo within fewe stroke slayne thre knyghtes remenaunt abode wounded hem sore alle dyd abyde thus syr launcelot escaped enemyes northwalys thenne sir launcelot rode way tyl frende lodged hym tyl morne wold fyrste daye haue adoo turnement cause grete labour fyrst day kyng arthur set hyhe vpon schaffold discerne best worthy dedes sir launcelot kyng arthur iusted fyrst daye pcapitulum xxx torne vnto sir tristram de lyones commaunded gouernaile seruaunt ordeyne hym blak sheld none remembraunce therin soo syre persydes syr tristram departed hooste syr pellounes rode erly toward turnement thenne drewe hem kynge carados syde scotland anone knyytes beganne felde kynge northgalys party kynge carados party began grete party thenne hurlyng rasshynge ryght soo came syr persydes sire tristram soo dyd fare put kyng northgalys abak thenne came syre bleoberys de ganys syre gaherys northaglys thenne sir persydes smyten doune alle moost slayne moo xl horsmen wente ouer hym syr bleoberys dyd grete dedes armes syre gaherys fayled hym whanne sire tristram byheld sawe hem doo suche dedes armes merueyled also sir tristram thought shame sir persydes soo done thenne gat grete spere hand thenne rode sire gaherys smote hym doune hors thenne sire bleoberys wroth gate spere rode ageynst sir tristram grete yre syre tristram mette hym smote sir bleoberys hors soo thenne kynge honderd knyghtes wrothe horsed sire bleoberys sir gaherys ageyne beganne grete medle euer sir tristram held passynge shorte euer sir bleoberys passynge besy vpon syre tristram came sir dynadan ageynst syre tristram sire tristram gaf hym suche buffet swouned sadel thenne anone sir dynadan cam sire tristram said syr knowe better thowwenest promyse trouthe wille neuer come ayenst promyse swerd thyn shal neuer come myn helme came sir bleoberys syr tristram gaf hym suche buffet doune leyd hede thenne raught hym sore helme pulled hym vnder hors foot thenne kyng arthur blewe lodgynge thenne syre tristram departed pauelione sire dynadan rode hym sire persydes kyng arthur thenne kynges vpon bothe partyes merueylled knyght blak shelde many said aduyse knewe hym syre tristram helde pee wold nought say soo fyrste day kyng arthur alle kynges lordes iuges gaf sir tristram pryce hou hit knewe hym named hym knyght black sheld pcapitulum xxxj thenne vpon morne sire palomydes retorned kynge northgalys rode kyng arthur syde kynge carados kynge irland syr launcelots kynne sir gawayns kynne sire palomydes sente damoysel vnto sire tristram sente seke hym whanne oute mynde forest thys damoysel asked sire tristram name said sir tristram telle sir palomydes ye shalle wete tyme vnto tyme haue broken two speres vpon hym lete hym wete thus moche said sir tristram knyghte smote doune ouer euenyng turnement telle hym playnly party syre palomydes wille contrary parte syre said damoysel ye shalle vnderstande sir palomydes wille kyng arthur syde moost noble knyghtes world ben name god said sir tristram thenne wille kynge northgalys cause syr palomydes wille kynge arthur syde el wold sake psoo whanne kynge arthur come blewe vnto felde thenne began grete party soo kynge carados iusted kynge honderd knyghtes kynge carados hadde falle thenne hurlynge rasshynge ryght cam knyghtes kynge arthur bare bak kynge northgalys knyghtes thenne sir tristram came beganne roughly soo bygly none myght withstande hym thus sire tristram dured longe p last syr trystram felle amonge felauship kynge ban felle vpon hym syr bors de ganys syr ector de mary sire blamor de ganys many knyghtes thenne sir tristram smote ryght hand lyfte hand alle lordes ladyes spak noble dedes last syre tristram shold haue werse kynge honderd knyghtes ben thenne came felauship rescowed sir tristram brought hym awey tho knyghtes bare sheldes cornewaile thenne sir tristram sawe another felauship self xl knyghtes gyder sir kay sene chal gouernour thenne sire tristram rode amongest smote doune syr kay hors fared among tho knyghtes lyke grey hound among conyes thenne launcelot fond knyght sore wounded vpon hede sir said sir launcelot wounded sore sire said knyght bereth black shelde maye curse tyme euer mette hym deuyl man soo sire launcelot departed fro hym thought mete sir tristram soo rode swerd drawen hand seke sir tristram thenne aspyed hym hurled euery stroke syr tristram wel nygh smote doune knyght mercy ihesu said kynge syth tyme bare armes sawe neuer knyght merueillous dedes armes yf shold sette vpon knyght said sir launcelot hym self dyd shame self al sir launcelot put vp swerd thene kyng c knyytes honderd northwalys set vpon twenty sir launcelots kyn xx knyytes held euer gyder wylde swyne none wold faile whan sir tristram beheld noblesse xx knyghtes merueiled good dedes sawe fare theil reule leuer deye auoyde felde pnow ihesu saide syre tristram wel maye valyaunte ful prowesse hath suche sorte noble knyghtes vnto kynne ful lyke noble man leder gouernour mente hit sir launcelot du lake p soo whanne syre tristram holden long thouyt shame see ij c knyytes batteryng vpon twenty knyghtes p thenne sire tristram rode vnto kynge honderd knyghtes said syre leue youre fyghtynge tho twenty knyghtes ye wynne worship ye soo many soo fewe wete ye well wille oute felde see chere countenaunce worship gete ye none ye slee therfore leue fyghtynge encreace worship wyll ryde twenty knyghtes helpe myghte power pnay said kynge honderd knyghtes ye shall see youre courage curtosy wille withdrawe knyytes pleasyr euermore good knyght wylle fauoure another lyke wille drawe lyke pcapitulum xxxij thenne kyng honderd knyghtes withdrewe knyghtes al whyle long tofore syr launcelot watched vpon syr tristram purpos haue felaushipped hym thenne sodenly syr tristram syr dynadan gouernaile man rode waye forest man perceyued wente soo thenne kynge arthur blewe vnto lodgynge gaf kynge northgalys pryce cause syr tristram vpon syde thenne syr launcelot rod wood lyon fauted fylle cause loste syre tristram soo retorned vnto kynge arthur thenne alle felde noyse wynde hit myght herd two myle then lordes ladyes cryed knyght blak shelde hath wonne felde pallas said kynge arthur knyght become hit shame alle tho felde lete hym escape awey gentylnes curtosy ye myght haue brought hym vnto castel maydens p thenne noble kynge arthur wente v knyghtes comforted best wyse coude sayd fayre felawes dysmayed hit ye haue loste felde daye many hurte sore wounded many hole p felawes said kynge arthur loke ye good chere morne wille feld reuenge youre enemyes psoo nyght kynge arthur knyghtes reposed self pthe damoysel came la beale isoud vnto syr tristram alle whyle turnement adoynge quene gueneuer euer quene asked cause came countr pmadame ansuerd come none cause lady la beale isoud wete welfare f r wyse wold telle quene came syr tristram sake soo lady dame brau wayne took leue quene gueneuer rode syr tristram rode thurgh forest herd grete crye thenne commaunded squyer goo forest wete noyse soo came welle fond knyght bounden tyl tree cryeng ben wod hors harneis standynge hym whan aspyed squyer ther abraide brake hym self loo took swerd hand ranne haue flayne squyer thenne took hors fledde euer myght vnto dame brangwayne told aduenture thenne rode vnto syr tristram pauelione told sire tristram aduenture fonde forest allas said syr tristram vpon heede somme good knyghte meschyef thenne sire tristram tooke hors swerd rode thyder herd knyght complayned vnto hym self sayd woful knyght syre palomydes mysauenture befalleth thus defoiled falshede treason thorou syre bors syre ector allas sayde lyue soo longe thenne gat swerd handes maade many straunge sygnes token soo thorou ragynge threwe swerd fontayne pthenne sir palomydes wayled wrange handes laste pure sorow ranne fontayne ouer bely soughte swerd thenne sir tristram sawe ranne vpon syr palomydes helde hym armes fast arte thou said palomydes holdeth soo man forest wold none harme allas said sire palomydes maye neuer wynne worship syr tristram euer thenne gete worship yf awey moost party haue gree onles sir launcelot syr lamorak thenne sire palomydes said one irland syr tristram putte werse another tyme cornewaile place land wold ye said syre tristram ye sir tristram wold fyghte hym said sir palomydes ease hert vpon hym yet saye sothe syre tristram gentelyst knyght world lyuynge wil ye doo sayd sir tristram wille ye goo youre lodgynge nay sayde wille goo kynge honderd knyghtes rescowed sire bors de ganys sir ector el ben slayne traitourly syre tristram said hym suche kynde wordes syre palomydes wente hym lodgynge thenne gouernaile wente fore charged dame brangwayn goo oute way lodgynge bydye syre persydes make hym quarels rode gyders tyl came sire tristram pauelione syre palomydes alle chere myght nyghte wyse sire palomydes myyt knowe syr tristram soo souper yede reste syr tristram grete trauaile slepte tylle daye syr palomydes myghte slepe anguysshe daunynge daye tooke hors pryuely rode waye vnto syr gaherys vnto syr sagramour le desyrus pauelions thre felawes begynnynge turnement thenne vpon morne kynge blewe vnto turnement vpon thyrdde daye pcapitulum xxxiij soo kynge northgalys kynge honderd knyghtes two encountred kyng carados kynge irland kynge honderd knyghtes smote doune kynge carados kynge northgalys smote doune kynge irland came syr palomydes whan cam made grete werke endented shelde well knowen soo came kynge arthur dyd grete dedes armes gyders putte kynge northgalys kynge honderd knyghtes werse came syr tristram black shelde anone iusted syre palomydes fyne force syr tristram ote syre palomydes ouer hors croupe thenne kynge arthur cryed knyght black shelde make redy wyse sir tristram smote kynge arthur thenne force kyng arthur knyghtes kynge sir palomydes horsed ageyne thenne kyng arthur grete egre herte gate spere hand therupon one syde smote syr tristram ouer hors thenne foote hote syr palomydes cam vpon sir tristram vpon foot haue ouer ryden hym thenne sir tristram ware hym stouped syde grete yre gate hym arme pulled hym doune hors thenne syre palomydes lyghtely arose thenne dasshed gyder myghtely swerdes many kynges quenes lordes stode beheld laste syre tristram smote syre palomydes vpon helme thre myyty stroke euery stroke gaf hym said haue syre tristram sake syre palomydes felle erthe grouelynge thenne came kynge honderd knyghtes broughte syre tristram hors soo horsed ageyn thenne syr palomydes horsed grete yre iusted vpon syr tristram spere hit reyste gaf hym grete dasshe swerd pthenne sir tristram auoyded spere gate hym neck bothe handes pulled hym clene oute sadel soo bare hym afore hym lengthe ten speres thenne presence hem al lete hym falle aduenture thenne sire tristram ware kynge arthur naked suerd hand spere sir tristram ranne vpon kynge arthur thenne kynge arthur boldely abode hym swerd smote atwo spere alle syre tristram stonyed soo kynge arthur gaf hym thre four grete stroke myyt gete swerd last sir tristram drewe swerd assailed passynge hard grete prees departed thenne sir tristram rode dyd grete payne xj good knyghtes blood kynge ban sire launcelots kyn daye syre tristram smote doune alle estate merueilled grete dedes alle cryed vpon knyght black sheld pcapitulum xxxiiij thenne crye soo large sir launcelot herd thenne gate grete spere hand came towardes crye thenne sir launcelot cryed knyght blak shelde make redy iuste whanne sire tristram herd hym say gate spere hand eyther abeyshed doun hedes came gyder thonder sire tristram spere brake pyeces syr launcelot male fortune stroke sir tristram syde depe wound nyghe dethe yet syr tristram auoyded sadel soo spere brak sir tristram wounded gate oute swerd rasshed sir launcelot gaf hym thre grete stroke vpon helme fyre sprange oute sir launcelot abeyshed hede owely toward sadel bowe alle sir tristram departed felde felte hym soo wouded wende shold haue dyed sir dynadan aspyed hym folowed hym forest thenne sir launcelot abode dyd many merueyllous dedes soo whan sire tristram departed forest syde alyght vnlaced harneis fress ed woud thene wende sir dynodan shold haue dyed nay nay saide sire tristram dynadan neuer drede herte hole wounde shal soone hole mercy god pby sir dynadan ware came palomydes rydynge streyghte vpon thenne syre tristram ware syre palomydes came haue destroyed hym syre dynadan gaf hym warnyng saide sire tristram lord ye soo sore wounded ye may haue adoo hym therfore wille ryde ageynst hym doo hym maye yf slayne ye maye praye soule meane whyle ye maye withdrawe goo castel foreste shalle mete p syre tristram smyled said thanke syre dynadan good wylle ye shalle wete able handle hym thenne anone hastely armed hym took hors grete spere hand said syre dynadan adieu rode toward syre palamydes softe paas pthenne whanne sire palomydes sawe made countenaunce amende hors dyd hit cause abode sire gaherys came hym pand whanne come rode toward syre tristram pthenne syre tristram sente vnto syr palomydes requyred hym iuste hym yf smote doune sir palomydes wold doo hym yf happend sire palomydes smote doune syr tristram badde hym vtteraunce accorded thenne mette gyders syre tristram smote doune sir palomydes greuous falle soo laye stylle hadde ben dede thenne sire trystram ranne vpon syr gaherys wold haue iusted whether wolde syre tristram smote hym ouer hors croupe laye stylle though ben dede thenne syr tristram rode waye lefte syre persydes squyer within pauelions syre tristram syre dynadan rode old knyghtes place lodge olde knyght fyue sone turnement whome prayed god hertely comyng home pand frensshe book saith cam home al v wel beten whan syr tristram departed forest syr laucelot held alwey stoure lyke hard man araged took heede hym self ye wel many noble knyghte ageynst hym whanne kyng arthur sawe sir launcelot doo soo merueyllous dedes armes thenne armed hym took hors armour rode felde helpe syr launcelot many knyghtes came kyng arthur make short tale conclusion kyng northgalys kynge honderd knyghtes putte wers cause syre launcelot abode last feld pryce yeuen hym sir laucelot wold neyther kyng quene ne knyghte haue pryce crye cryed thorugh felde syr launcelot sir launcelot hath wonne felde day syre launcelot lete make crye contrary syr tristram hath wonne feld beganne fyrst last hath endured soo hath done fyrst day second thyrd day pcapitulum xxxv thenne alle estate degree hyhe lowe sayd syr launcelot grete worship honour dyd vnto syr tristram honour doyng sir tristram tyme preysed renoumed ouerthrowen v c knyghtes peple holy gentylnes fyrst estate bothe hyhe lowe comynalte cryed one syre launcelot hath wonne felde soo euer saye nay thenne syre launcelot wroth ashamed soo alle rode kynge arthur allas said kynge alle dysmayed syr tristram thus departed v god said kynge arthur one noblest knyytes euer sawe hold spere swerd hand moost curteyst knyght fyghtyng ful hard sawe hym sayd kyng arthur whanne smote syr palomydes vpon helme thryes abasshed helme stroke also said stroke syr tristram thus thryes sayd thenne kynge arthur syr launcelot sire dodynas le saueage took horse seke sir tristram menes syr persydes told kyng arthur syr tristram pauelione whanne came syr tristram sir dynadan gone thenne kynge arthur syr launcelot heny retorned ageyne castel maydens makyng grete le hurte syre trystram sodeyne departynge soo god helpe said kyng arthur heuy mete hym thenne al hurtes alle knyghtes haue turnement ryght soo came sir gaherys told kynge arthur syr tristram smyten doune syr palomydes atte syr palomydes owne request allas said kyng arthur grete dishonoure syre palomydes moche syre tristram sore wounded may alle kynges knyytes men worship saye syre tristram may called noble knyght one best knyghtes euer sawe dayes lyf wille ye al kynges knyghtes knowe said kynge arthur neuer sawe knyghte doo merueyllously hath done thre dayes first began lengest held sauf last day though hurte manly aduenture two noble knyghtes whan two noble men encountre nedes must one haue werse lyke god wil suffre tyme pa said sir launcelot alle landes euer fader lefte wold haue hurte sir tristram knowen hym tyme hurt hym sawe sheld sene black sheld wold haue medled hym many cause late dyd moche euer dyd knyght wel knowen adoo thyrtty knyytes helpe saue syr dynadan one thynge shalle promyse said syr launcelot syr palomydes shalle repente vnkyndely delynge folowe noble knyght myshap hurted thus syr launcelot sayd alle worship myght said sir tristram thenne kyng arthur made grete feest alle wold come thus lete passe kynge arthur lytyl wille torne vnto sir palomydes falle sire tristram nyghe hand araged oute wyt despyte sir tristram soo folowed hym aduenture came ryuer woodenes wold haue made hors haue lepte ouer hors fayled footynge felle ryuer wherfore syre palomydes adrad lest shold haue ben drouned thenne auoyded hors swamme land lete hors goo doune aduenture pcapitulum
