xxxvj whanne came land took harneis satte rorynge cryenge man oute mynde ryght came damoysel euen syr palomydes sente fro syr gawayne broder vnto sir mordred lay seke place old knyyt syr tristram frensshe book saith syr persydes hurte soo syr mordred ten dayes afore ben loue sir gawayne broder syr persydes slayne sir mordred soo damoysel came sir palomydes langage gyder whiche pleasyd neyther soo damoysel rode wayes tyl came old knyghtes place told old knyght mette woodest knyght aduenture euer mette bare sheld said sir tristram hit endented whyte black saide damoysel said sir tristram sir palomydes good knyght wel knowe hym said sir tristram one best knyghtes lyuynge realme thenne old knyght took lytel hackney rode syre palomydes brought hym vnto owne manoyr ful wel knewe sire tristram syr palomydes said lytel tyme syr tristram walkyng vpon foot wel amended hurtes alweyes whan sire palomydes sawe syr tristram wold behold hym ful merueillously euer hym med hadde sene hym thenne wold saye vnto syre dynadan euer may mete syre tristram shal escape myn handes merueile said sir dynadan yt ye booste behynde syr tristram late youre handes ye handes wold ye holde hym whanne ye hadde hym sawe self twyes thryes ye gat lytel worship sir tristram thenne syr palomydes ashamed soo leue lytyl whyle old castel old knyght sir darras p shall speke kynge arthur said sir launcelot ye ben lost syre tristram dayly vnto tyme ye mette hym euylle tyme sayd arthur ye encountred hym lord arthur said launcelot ye putte vpon shold ben cause departycyon god knoweth hit ageynste wille whan men ben hote dedes armes ofte hurte frendes wel foe lord said sir launcelot ye shal vnderstande sir tristram man loth offende hath done euer dyd hym yet thenne sir launcelot made brynge forth book ne sir launcelot said ten knyghtes wil swere vpon book neuer reste one nyght rest another twelue moneth vn tyl fynde syr tristram said syre launcelot promyse vpon book may mete hym outher fayrenes foulnesse shalle brynge hym courte el shalle dye therfore name ten knyghtes hadde vndertake quest folowynge fyrst sir launcelot syr ector de mary syr bors de ganys bleoberis syre blamor de ganys lucan botteler syr vwayne syr galyhud lyonel galyodyn soo x noble knyghtes departed courte kynge arthur soo rode vpon quest gyders vntyl came crosse departed four wayes departed felauship four seke syr tristram syr launcelot rode aduenture mette dame brangwayn sent countrey seke sir tristram fled faste palfrey myght goo soo sire launcelot mette asked fledde pa fayre knyghte said dame brangwayne flee drede lyf foloweth syr breuse saunce pyte slee hold nyghe sayd sir launcelot thenne whanne sire launcelot sawe sir breuse saunce pyte syr launcelot cryed vnto hym said fals knyght destroyer ladyes damoysels thy last dayes come whanne sire breuse saunce pyte sawe sire launcelots sheld knewe hit wel tyme bare armes cornewaile bare owne shelde thenne syre breuse fled syr tristram folowed hym sir breuse soo wel horsed whan hym lyst flee myght wel flee also abyde whan hym lyst thenne sire launcelot retorned vnto dame brangwayne thanked hym grete labour pcapitulum xxxvij wille speke sir lucan buttelere fortune came rydyng place syr tristram came none entente aske herberowe thenne porter asked name telle lord name syr lucan botteler knyghte round table soo porter wente vnto syre darras lord place told hym aske herborouy nay nay seid syr daname neuewe syr darras saye hym shalle lodged lete hym wete syr daname wyll mete hym anon bydde hym make hym redy sire daname came forth horsbak mette gyders speres sir lucan smote doune syr daname ouer hors croupe ne fledde place sir lucan rode hym asked hym many tymes thenne syr dynadan said sire tristram hit shame see lordes cosyn place defoiled abyde said sir tristram shalle redresse meane whyle syr dynadan horsbak iustid lucan ye botteler ther sir lucan smote dynada thury thyck thyghe soo rode way sire trisram wrothe sir dynadan hurte folowed thought auenge hym within whyle ouertook sir lucan hadde hym torne soo mette gyders soo sire tristram hurt sir lucan passynge sore gaf hym falle came sire vwayne gentyl knyyt whanne sawe sire lucan soo hurte called syre tristram iuste hym faire knyght said sire tristram telle name requyre syre knyghte wete ye wel name syre vwayne le fyse de roy vreyne saide sire tristram wille wold haue adoo tyme ye shalle soo said sir vwayne ye shalle haue adoo thenne sire tristram sawe none boote rode ageynst hym ouerthrewe syr vwayn hurte hym syde soo departed vnto lodgynge ageyne whanne sire dynadan vnderstood syr tristram hurte sir lucan wold haue ryden syr lucan haue slayne hym sir tristram wold suffre hym pthenne syr vwayne lete ordeyne hors lytter brought sir lucan abbey ganys castel hyght castel ganys whiche syr bleoberys lord castel sire launcelot promysed alle felawes mete quest syr tristram soo whan sir tristram come lodgyng ther came damoisel yt told sir darras thre sone slayne turnement two greuously wouded neuer lyke helpe self alle done noble knyghte bare black shelde bare pryce pthenne came one told syr darras knyght within hym bare black sheld thenne sir darras yede vnto sir tristram chamber fond sheld shewed damoysel syr said damoysel slewe thre sone thenne withoute ony taryenge sir darras putte syre tristram syre palomydes syr dynadan within strong pryson sir tristram lyke haue dyed grete sekenesse euery day syr palomydes wold repreue sir tristram old hate betwixe euer sir tristram spak fayre said lytel whan sir palomydes sawe fallynge sekenesse sir tristram thenne heuy hym comforted hym alle best wyse coude frensshe booke saith came fourty knyghtes sire darras owne kyn wold haue slayne sire tristram two felawes sire darras wold suffre kepte pryson mete drynke sire tristram endured grete payne sekenesse vndertake hym grettest payne prysoner maye haue alle whyle prysoner may haue helthe body maye endure vnder mercy god hope good delyueraunce whanne sekenes toucheth prysoners bo thenne may prysoner say al welthe hym afte thenne hath cause wayle wepe ryyt dyd syre tristram whanne sekenes vndertake hym thenne tooke suche sorou almost slayne hym self pcapitulum xxxviij wille speke leue sir tristram syre palomydes syr dynadan pryson speke knyghtes soughte syre tristram many dyuerse partyes land yede cornewaile aduenture syr gaheryse neuewe vnto kyng arthur came vnto kynge mark wel receyued satte atte kynge mark owne table ete owne messe pthenne kynge mark asked sir gaheryse tydynges royalme logrys syre said syr gaheryse kyng regneth noble knyght late grete iustes turnement euer sawe ony realme logrys moost noble knyghtes iustes one knyght dyd merueyllously thre dayes bare black shelde alle knyghtes euer sawe preued best knyyt thrnne said kyng mark syre launcelot syre palomydes paynym soo said syr gaherys bothe syre launcelot sire palomydes contrary party ageynst knyght blak shelde thenne sir tristram said kyng ye said sir gaheryse kyng smote doun hede herte feryd sore syre tristram shold gete hym suche worship royame logrys thorou hym self shold able withstande hym thus syre gaheryse grete chere kynge marke quene la beale isoud whiche gladde syr gaheryse wordes wel wist dedes maners syr tristram thenne kynge made feest royal feest came sir vwayne le fyse de roy vreyne somme callid hym vwayne le blaunche maynys syr vwayn chalengyd alle knyghtes cornewaile thenne kyng woode wroth knyghtes ansuer hym thenne sire andred neuewe vnto kynge mark lepte vp said wille encountre syr vwayne thenne yede armed hym horsed hym best maner syre vwayne mette syre andred smote hym doune swouned erthe thenne kynge marke sory wrothe oute mesure knyghte reuenge neuewe sir andred soo kynge called vnto hym syr dynas seneschal praid hym sake take vpon hym iuste sir vwayne syr said syr dynas ful bothe haue adoo ony knyght round table yet said kyng loue take vpon guste soo syr dynas made hym redy anone encountred gyders grete speres sire dynas ouerthrowen hors man grete falle wrothe kynge marke allas said haue knyght wille encountre yonder knyghte syr said sir gaheryse sake wille iuste sir gaherys made hym redy whanne armed rode felde whanne sir vwayne sawe syr gaheryses sheld rode hym said sir ye doo youre parte sire fyrst tyme ye made knyght round table ye sware ye shold haue felauship wetyngly par dy sir gaheryse ye knewe shelde knowe sheld thouy ye wold breke othe wold breke myn one ye shall thynke aford yow durst ryght wel haue adoo yet sister sone thenne sir gaheryse ashamed soo alle euery knyght wente way sir vwayne rode countrey thenne kyng mark armed hym tooke hors spere squyer hym thenne rode afore sir vwayne sodenly gap ranne vpon hym ware hym smote hym al thurgh body lefte hym within whyle cam sir kay fonde sir vwayne asked hym hurte wote said sir vwayne wherfore treason sure gat hurte came knyghte sodenly vpon ware sodenly hurte pthenne come syre andred seke kynge marke pthou traytour knyght said sir kay wiste thou thus traitourly hast hurte noble knyghte thow sholdest neuer passe handes syre saide sir andred dyd neuer hurte hym wylle reporte hym self fy fals knyghtes said syr kay ye cornewaile ar nought worthe soo syr kay made cary syr vwayne abbay black crosse helyd thenne syr gaherys took leue kynge mark departed sayd syre kynge ye dyd foule shame vnto courte whan ye bannysshed sir tristram cou trey ye neded haue doubted knyght ben soo departed pcapitulum xxxix thenne came syre kay seneschal vnto kynge marke hadde good chere shewyng outeward fayre lordes said wille ye preue ony aduenture forest morris whiche knowe wel hard aduenture knowe ony syr said sir kay wille preue hit sir gaheryse said wold auysed kynge mark euer ful treason al syr gaheryse departed rode waye waye syre kay shold ryde leyd hym doune reste chargynge squyer wayte vpon sir kay warne whanne cometh soo within whyle sir kay came rydynge way thenne sir gaheryse tooke hors met hym sayd sire kay ye wyse ryde request kynge mark deleth alle treason thenne said sire kay requyre lete v preue aduenture shal fayle said sir gaherys soo rode tyme tyl lake tyme called peryllous lake abode vnder shawe wood pthe meane whyle kyng marke within castel tyntagyl auoyded alle baros alle sauf suche pryuy hym auoyded oute chamber thenne lete calle neuewe sir andred badde arme hym horse hym lyghtely tyme mydnyght soo kynge marke armed blak hors alle soo att pryuy posterne two yssued oute varlet rode tylle came lake thenne sir kay aspyed fyrst gat spere profered iuste kynge mark rode ageynst hym smote eche ful hard mone shone bryght day iustes sir kayes hors fylle doune hors bygge kynges hors sir kayes hors brysed hym ful sore thenne sire gaherys wrothe sir kay falle thenne cryed knyght sytte thou fast thy sadel wille reuenge felawe thenne kynge marke aferd syr gaherys euyl wylle kynge marke rode ageynst hym sir gaherys gaf hym suche stroke felle doun thenne forth syr gaheryse ranne vnto syr andred smote hym hors quyte helme smote erthe nyhe broken neck al syr gaherys alyghte gate vp sir kay thenne yode bothe foote badde yelde telle theire name shold dye thenne grete payne sire andred spak fyrst said hit kynge marke cornewaile therfore ye ware ye sir andred cosyn fy bothe said sir gaheryse fals traitour fals treason hast thou wrouyt vnder fayned chere ye made v pyte said sir gaherys thou sholdest lyue ony lenger saue lyf said kynge marke wil make amendys consyder kynge anoynted shame said sir gaherys saue thy lyf thou arte kynge enoynted creme therfore thou sholdest holde alle men worship therfor thou arte worthy dye lasshed kyng mark without sayeng ony couerd hym sheld defended hym myghte thenne sir kay lasshed sir andred kynge marke yelded hym vnto syr gaherys thenne kneled adoune made othe vpon crosse suerd neuer whyle lyued wold ageynst arraunt knyghtes also sware good frende vnto sir tristram yf euer came cornewaile thenne sir andred erthe sir kay wold haue slayne hym lete said sir gaherys slee hym pray pyte said syre kay shold lyue ony lenger nygh cosyn vnto syr tristram euer hath ben traytour vnto hym hym exyled oute cornewaile therfor slee hym sayd sir kay ye shalle said sir gaherys sythen haue gyuen kynge lyf pray yeue hym lyf alle sir kay lete hym goo soo sir kay syre gaherys rode way vnto dynas seneschal cause herd say loued wel sir tristram soo reposed soone rode vnto royamme logrys soo within lytel whyle mette sire launcelot alweyes dame bragwayn hym entente wende haue mette sooner sir tristram syr launcelot asked tydynges cornewaile whether herd sir tristram syr kay sir gaherys ansuerd said herd hym thenne told sir launcelot word word theire aduenture thenne syr launcelot smyled said hard hit take oute flesshe bred bone soo maade hem mery gyders pcapitulum xl leue tale speke syr dynas hat within castel peramour loued another knyghte better hym whanne syr dynas wente oute huntynge slypped doune tuell took two bracket soo yede knyght loued ageyne pand whanne sir dynas come home myst peramour brachets thenne wrother brachets lady soo thenne rode knyght peramour badde hym torne iuste syr dynas smote hym doune falle brake legge arme thenne lady peramour cryed sire dynas mercy said wold loue hym better euer dyd nay said sir dynas shalle neuer truste one bytrayed therfor ye haue begonne ende wyll neuer medle sir dynas departed tooke brachets hym soo rode castel wil torne vnto sir launcelot ryght heuy coude neuer tydynges sir tristram al whyle pryson sir darras palomydes dynadan thenne dame brangwayne took leue goo cornewaile syr launcelot syr kay syr gaherys rode seke sir tristram countrey surleuse speketh tale sir tristram two felawes euery daye syre palomydes brauled sayd langage ageynst syr tristram merueyle said sir dynadan syr palomydes thou haddest syre tristram thou woldest hym harme wolf shepe gyders pryson wolf wold suffre sheep pee wete thou wel said sire dynadan sire tristram word maist thou doo thy best hym lete see yf ye skyfte handes thenne sire palomydes abasshed said lytyl syr palomydes thenne said syr tristram haue herd moche maugre ageynst wille medle tyme wille cause drede lord place hath v gouernaunce dredde hym doo soone hit shold skyfte soo peaced self ryght soo came damoysel said knyghtes good chere ye sure lyues herd say lord syre darras thenne gladde alle thre dayly wende shold haue dyed pthenne soone syr tristram fylle seke wende haue dyed thenne syr dynadan wepte soo dyd sire palomydes vnder bothe makyng grete sorou p soo damoysel came fonde mornynge thenne wente vnto sire darras told hym myghty knyghte bare black shelde lykely dye shake sayd sir darras god defende whanne knyghtes come socour shold suffre hem dye within pryson therfor said sir darras damoysel fetche knyyt felawes afore thenne anone sir darras sawe sir tristram brought afore hym said sire knyghte repenteth thy sekenesse thou arte called ful noble knyght soo hit semeth wete ye wel shall neuer said syr darras shalle destroye suche noble knyght thou arte pryson hit thou hast slayn iij sone gretely agreued shalt thou goo thy felawes youre harneis horse haue ben fayre clene kepte ye shall goo hit lyketh vpon couenaunt thou knyght wilt promyse good frende sone two ben lyue also thou telle thy name syr said name sir tristram de lyones cornewaile born neuewe vnto kynge marke deth sone myght doo alle ben next kyn yt haue myyt haue done none wyse yf slayne hem treason trechery hadde ben worthy haue dyed alle consyder said syr darras alle ye dyd force knyghthode cause wold putte deth sythe ye syr tristram good knyght pray hertely good frend sone syr said sire tristram promyse yow feithe body euer whyle lyue wille yow seruyse ye haue done v naturel knyghte ought doo thenne sir tristram reposed hym tyl amended sekenesse whanne bygge stronge took leue euery knyght took horse soo departed rode gyders tyl came crosse way felawes said syr tristram wylle departe sondry wayes cause sire dynadan hadde fyrst aduenture hym wille begynne pcapitulum xlj soo sir dynadan rode welle fond lady makyng grete dole eyleth said sir dynadan syre knyght said lady wofullest lady world within fyue dayes came knyght called sir breuse saunce pyte slewe myn owne broder euer syns hath kepte owne al men world hate hym moost therfor requyre knygthode auenge wille tary anone lete hym come said sire dynadan cause honour alle wymmen wylle doo parte cam syr breuse whan sawe knyght lady wood wrothe thenne said sir knyght kepe soo hurled gyder thonder eyther smote passynge sore syre dynadan putte hym thurgh sholder greuous wounde euer sir dynadan myght torne hym syr breuse gone fledde thenne lady prayd hym brynge castel besyde four myle then soo sir dynadan brought welcome lord castel vnkel soo syre dynadan rode way vpon aduenture torne tale vnto syre tristram aduenture cam castel aske lodgynge wherin quene morgan le fay soo whan sire tristram lete castel good chere alle nyght vpon morne whan wold haue departed quene said wete ye wel ye shall departe lyghtely ye prysoner ihesu defende said syr tristram late prysoner fayr knyght sayd quene ye shalle abyde tyl wete ye ar whens ye come euer quene wold set syr tristram owne syde peramour syde euer quene morgan wold beholde syr tristram ther knyght ialous wille sodenly haue ronne vpon syr tristram swerd lefte shame thene quene said sir tristram telle thy name shalle suffre departe whan ye vpon couenaunt telle name syr tristram de lyones sayd morgan le fay wyst thou sholdest haue departed soo soone thou shalt sythen haue maade promyse wille holde hyt thou wilt promyse bere vpon shelde shall delyuer vnto castel hard roche kynge arthur hath cryed grete turnement pray ye wille doo moche dedes armes ye maye doo att castel maydens syr tristram ye dyd merueillous dedes armes euer herd knyght doo madame said syr tristram lete see shelde shalle bere thenne shelde brought forth feld guldyssh kynge quene therin paynted knyght standynge aboue vpon kynges hede vpon quenes madame said sir tristram fayre shelde myyty sygnefyeth kynge quene knyght standynge vp bothe hedes shalle telle said morgan le fay hit sygnefyeth kynge arthur quene gueneuer knyght holdeth bondage seruage knyght said syre tristram shalle ye wete tyme said quene frensshe book saith quene morgan loued sir launcelot lest euer desyred hym wold neuer loue doo thyng request therfore held many knyghtes gyder haue taken hym strengthe cause demed syr launcelot loued quene gueneuer peramour hym ageyne therfore quene morgan le fay ordeyned sheld put sir launcelot rebuke entent kyng arthur myght vnderstande loue bitwene thenne sir tristram took sheld promysed bere hit atte turnement castel hard roche sir tristram knewe sheld ordeyned ageynst syr launcelot afterward knewe hit pcapitulum xlij soo thenne sire tristram took leue quene took sheld hym thenne came knyyte helde quene morgan le fay name syre hymeson made hym redy folowe syre tristram fayr frende said morgan ryde knyght ye shalle wynne worship hym fy hym coward saide sire hemyson wyst neuer good knyghte come oute cornewaile yf hit syr tristram de lyones said nay nay said la beale isoud daffyssh knyght allas fair frende ye shalle fynde hym best knyght euer ye mette alle knowe hym better ye doo sake said sir hemyson shalle slee hym fayr frende said quene repenteth ye wylle folowe knyght fere sore youre ageyne comynge knyghte rode waye woode wrothe rode syr tristram fast hadde ben chaced knyghtes whanne sir tristram herd knyghte come hym soo fast retorned aboute sawe knyyt comynge ageynst hym whanne came nyghe sir tristram cryed hyghe syr knyght kepe thenne rasshed gyders hit ben thonder sir hemyson brysed spere vpon syr tristram harneis soo good myght hurte hym syre trystram smote hym harder bare hym thorou body fylle ouer hors croupe thenne sire tristram torned haue done swerd sawe soo moche blood go hym hym med lykely deye departed hym came fayre manoyre old knyyt syre tristram lodged p leue speke sir tristram speke knyght wounded dethe thenne varlet alyght took helme thene asked lord whether ony lyf hym lyf saide knyghte hit lytyl therfore lepe thou vp behynde whan thou hast holpen vp holde fast falle brynge quene morgan le fay depe drauytes dethe drawen herte may lyue wold fayne speke dyed el soule wyll grete perylle dye grete payne varlet brought hym castel syr hemyson fylle doun dede whanne morgan le fay sawe hym dede made grete sorou oute reason thenne lete despoylle hym vnto shyrde soo lete hym putte tombe aboute tombe lete wryte lyeth syr hemyson slayne handes sire tristram de lyones p torne vnto syre tristram asked knyght hoost yf sawe late ony knyghtes aduenturous sir said last nyght lodged ector de mary damoysel hym damoysel told one best knyghtes world soo said sir tristram knowe four better knyghtes owne blood fyrst syr launcelot du lake calle hym best knyght sir bors de ganys syr bleoberys syr blamor de ganys syr gaheris nay said hoost sir gawayne better knyght soo said syr tristram haue mette hem bothe felte syr gaherys better knyght sir lamorak calle hym good ony excepte sir launcelot name ye sir tristram said hoost accompte hym good ony knowe sire tristram said tristram thus talked bourded longe lyste thenne wente reste morne sir tristram departed took leue hoost rode toward roche deure none aduenture sire tristram soo rested tyl came castel sawe fyue ctentys pcapitulum xliiij thenne kynge scottes kyng irland helde ageynst kynge arthur knyghtes beganne grete medle came syr tristram dyd merueillous dedes armes smote doune many knyytes euer afore kynge arthur shelde whanne kynge arthur sawe shelde meruyylled gretely entente hit made quene gueneuer demed wherfor heuy thene ther damoysel quene morgan chamber kynge arthur whan herd kynge arthur speke shelde thene spak openly vnto kynge arthur syre kynge wete ye well sheld ordeyned warne shame dishonour longeth quene thenne anone damoysel pyked awey pryuely man wyst become thenne kynge arthur sadde wrothe asked whens came damoysel one knewe wyste become thenne quene gueneuer called sir ector de mary made complaynte hym said wote wel sheld made morgan le fay despyte sir launcelot wherfore drede sore lest shold destroyed euer kynge bihelde syre tristram dyd soo merueillous dedes armes wo dred sore knyght myght wel wyst hit syr launcelot hit told hym syr tristram petyte bretayne isoud la blaunche maynys demyd ben realme logrys syr launcelot somme felawes quest syr tristram shold haue fond hym tyme kyng arthur merueylle knyght myghte euer syr arthur eye shelde alle aspyed quene made sore aferd thenne euer syr tristram smote doune knyghtes wonderly beholde vpon ryght hand vpon lyfte hand vnnethe knyyt myght withstande hym kyng scottes kyng irland beganne withdrawe hem whanne arthur aspyed thought knyght straunge sheld shold escape hym thenne called vnto hym syre vwayn la blaunche maynys bad hym arme hym make hym redy soo anone kynge arthur sir vwayne dressid bifore sir tristram requyred hym telle hem shelde syr said quene morgan le fay sister vnto kynge arthur psoo endeth history book firste book sire tristram de lyones second book sir tristram foloweth phere begynneth second book sire tristram syre tristram smote doune kyng arthur sir vwayne cause wold telle hem wherfor shelde made say fothe sire tristram coude telle cause knewe pthe tenth book pcapitulum primum yf ye descryue ye bere ye ar worthy bere armes said syr tristram wille ansuere sheld yeuen desyred quene morgan le fay descryue armes poynt charge yet truste god bere hem worship truly sayd kynge arthur ye oughte bere none armes yf ye wist ye bare pray telle youre name entente said syre tristram wold wete said arthur syre ye shalle wete tyme thenne shalle ye doo bataille gyders sayd kyng arthur said syre tristram wylle ye doo bataille yf telle name lytyl nedeth ye man worshyp ye haue sene thys day haue grete traueylle therfore ye vylaynous knyght aske bataille consyderynge grete traueylle hit wyl fayle haue ye doubte feare though ye thynke ye haue atte grete auauntage yet shalle ryght wel endure kynge arthur dressid shelde spere syre tristram ageynst hym came soo egerly gyders kynge arthur brake spere pyeces vpon syr tristram shelde sir tristram hitte arthur ageyne hors man felle erthe kynge arthur wounded lyfte syde grete wounde peryllous thenne whannne sir vwayne sawe lord arthur lye ground sore wounded passynge heuy thenne dressid shelde spere cryed lowde vnto syr tristram said knyght defende came gyder thonder syr vwayne brysed spere alle pyeces vpon syre tristram shelde syre tristram smote hym harder sorer suche myyt bare hym clene oute sadel erthe syr tristram torned aboute said fair knyghtes nede iuste haue ynough doo daye thenne arose arthur wente syr vwayn said sire tristram haue haue deserued thurgh orgulyte demaunded bataille yet knewe youre name neuertheles seynt crosse said syre vwayne stronge knyght myn aduyse ony lynyng thenne sir tristram departed euery place asked demaunded sir launcelot place coude hym whether dede lyue wherfor sir tristram made grete dole sorowe soo syr tristram rode forest thene ware fayre toure mareyse one syde syde fayr medowe sawe ten knyghtes fyghtynge gyder euer nere came sawe ther one knyght dyd bataille ageynst nyne knyghtes one dyd soo merueyllously syre tristram grete wonder euer one knyyt myght doo soo grete dedes armes thennne within lytell whyle slayne half horse vnhorsed horse ranne feldes foreste thenne syre tristram soo grete pyte one knyght endured soo grete payne euer thought hit shold syr palomydes shelde soo rode vnto knyghtes cryed vnto bad seace bataille self grete shame soo many knyghtes fyghte one thenne ansuerd maister tho knyghtes name called breuse saunce pyte te tyme mooste meschyeuoust knyght lyuynge said thus syr knyyt haue ye ado v medle therfor ye wyse departe way ye cam knyghte shalle escape v pyte said syr tristram soo good knyght shold slayne soo cowardly therfore warne socoure hym puyssaunce pcapitulum secudum syre tristram alyghte hors cause foote shold slee hors ne dressid sheld swerd hand smote ryght hand lyfte hand passyng sore wel nygh euery stroke strake doun knyght aspyed stroke fled breuse sauce pyte vnto toure sir tristram folowed fast suerd hand escaped toure shytte sire tristram withoute gate pand whanne sire tristram sawe retorned abak vnto syr palomydes fond hym syttyng vnder tree sore wounded faire knyght saide syre tristram wel ye fonde gramercy said sir palomydes grete goodenes ye haue rescowed lyf saued dethe name said sir tristram said name syr palomydes ihesu said syr tristra thou hast fayre grace daye shold rescowe thou arte man world mooste hate make redy doo bataille name sayd palomydes name sir tristram mortal enemy hit may soo said sir palomydes ye haue done ouer moche day shold fyghte moche ye haue saued lyf hit wille worship haue adoo ye fressh wounded sore therfor ye wille nedes haue ado assigne day thenne shal mete withoute fayle ye saye wel said sir tristram assigne mete medowe ryuer camelot merlyon sette peron soo agreed thenne sir tristram asked syr palomydes ten knyghtes dyd bataill hym cause said sir palomydes rode vp myn aduentures forest besyde aspyed laye dede knyght lady wepynge besyde hym whanne sawe makynge suche dole asked slewe lorde psyre said falsest knyght world lyuyng moost vylayne ouer man herd speke name sir breuse saunce pyte thenne pyte made damoysel lepe palfroy promysed waraunt helpe entyere lord soo sodenly came rydynge toure came oute syr breuse saunce pyte sodenly strake hors thenne myghte recouer hors sir breuse slewe damoysel soo took hors ageyne sore ashamed beganne medle betwixe v cause wherfore dyd bataille well said sir tristram vnderstande maner bataiylle ony wyse haue remembraunce promyse ye haue made doo bataille day fourtenyght shal fayle said sir palomydes wel said sir tristram tyme wille fayle tyl ye oute dau ger enemyes mounted vpon theyr horse rode gyders vnto foreste fond fayre welle clere water burbelynge fayr sir said sir tristram drynke water haue courage thenne alyght horse thenne ware stood grete hors teyed tree euer neyhed thenne ware fayr knyght armed vnder tree lackyng pyece harneis saue helme lay vnder heede good lord said sir tristram yonder lyeth wel farynge knyght best doo awake hym said sir palomydes sir tristram awaked hym spere soo knyght arose vp hastely putte helme vpon hede gat grete spere hand without ony moo wordes hurled vnto sir tristram smote hym clene sadel erthe hurte hym lyfte syde sir tristram lay grete perylle thenne wallopped ferther fette cours came hurlynge vpon sir palomydes strake hym parte thorou body fylle hors erthe p thenne straunge knyght lefte took way thurgh foreste sir palomydes sire tristram foote gat horse ageyn eyther asked counceylle best done hede said sir tristram wyll folowe strong knyght thus hath shamed v p well said sir palomydes wylle repose frend myn beware said sire tristram vnto palomydes ye fayle day ye haue set bataill deme ye wille hold day moche bygger ye said sir palomydes hit hit maye feare seke prysoner wil fayle haue cause haue doubte ye wille mete ye ryde yonder strong knyght yf ye mete hym hit hard aduenture euer ye escape handes ryght soo sir tristram sir palomydes departed eyther took wayes dyuerse pcapitulum iij syre tristram rode longe stronge knyght laste sawe lay lady ouer thwarte dede knyght faire lady said sir tristram hath slayne lord syr said came knyght rydyng lord rested v asked hym whens lord said arthur courte therfore said stronge knyght wille iuste hate alle ben arthur courte lord lyeth dede amounted vpon hors stronge knyght lord encountred gyder smote lord thorugh oute spere thus hath broughte grete woo dammage repenteth said sire tristram grete anger hit please telle husbandes name syr said name galardoun wold haue preued good knyghte soo departed sir tristram dolorous lady hadde moche euylle lodgyng thenne thyrdde day syr tristram mette syr gawayne sir bleoberys forest lodge eyther sore wounded thenne syre tristram asked syr gawayne syr bleoberys yf met suche knyghte suche cognoyssaunce keuerd shelde faire syr said knyghtes suche knyght met v oure grete dommage fyrst smote doune felawe syre bleoberys sore wouded hym cause badde shold haue ad hym ouer stronge strong knyght toke wordes scorne said said mockery thenne rode gyders soo hurte felawe whan done myght shame must iuste hym fyrst course smote doune hors erthe al moost slayne v took hors departed euyll tyme mette hym faire knyghtes said sir tristram soo mette another knyght hyght palomydes smote v bothe doune one spere hurt v ryght sore feythe said sir gawayne counceil ye shalle lete hym passe seke hym ferther nexte feest round table vpon payne hede ye shalle fynde hym feythe said sir tristram shall neuer reste tyl fynde hym thenne sir gawayne asked hym name thenne said name sir tristram eyther told name thenne departed syr tristram rode way fortune medowe sire tristram mette sir kay seneschal sir dynadan tydynges said sir tristram knyghtes good said knyghtes soo said sir tristram praye telle ryde seke knyght cognoyssaunce bereth said sir kay bereth said sir tristram couerd sheld close clothe hede said sir kay knyght mette v nyght lodged within wydowes hous knyght lodged whanne wyst arthur court spak grete vylonye kynge specially quene gueneuer p thenne morne waged bataille hym cause fyrst recoutre said sir kay smote doune hors hurte passynge sore whanne felawe syr dynadan sawe smyten doune hurte wold reuenge fledde thus departed thenne sir tristram asked theyr name soo eyther told name soo syre tristram departed syr kay sir dynodan past thurgh grete forest playne tyl ware pryory reposed hym good man syxe dayes pcapitulum quartum thenne sente man hyght gouernaile commaunded hym goo cyte fetche hym newe harneis hit long tyme afore syre tristram ben refresshed harneis brysed broken whanne gouernaile seruaunt come apparail toke leue wydowe mounted vpon hors rode way erly morne sodeyn aduenture syr tristram mette sir sagramore le desyrus sir dodynas le saueage two knyghtes mette syre tristram questyoned hym asked hym yf wold iuste hem faire knyghtes said sir tristram good wylle wold iuste haue promysed day sette nere hand bataille strong knyght therfore lothe haue adoo hit mysfortuned hurte shold able doo bataille whiche promysed said sagramor maulgre hede ye shalle iuste v ye passe v well said syr tristram yf ye enforce therto must doo may thenne dressid sheldes came rennynge gyder grete yre thurgh syr tristram grete force strake syr sagramor hors thenne hurled hors ferther said sir dodynas knyyte make redy soo thorou fyne force syre tristram strake dodynas hors whanne sawe hem lye erthe took brydel rode forth way man gouernaile hym anone sir tristram paste syr sagramore sir dodynas gate ageyne horse mounted vp lyghtely folowed sir tristram whan syre tristram sawe come soo fast hym retorned hors asked wold hit longe ago sythen smote erthe owne request desyre wold haue ryden ye wold suffre semeth ye wold doo bataille trouthe said sire sagramore syre dodynas wille reuengyd despyte ye haue done v faire knyghtes said sir tristram shall lytyl nede dyd ye caused hit wherfore requyre knygthode leue tyme sure doo bataille shalle escape oute grete hurtes suppose ye shalle escape alle lotles cause soo loth haue ado must fyghte within thre dayes good knyght valyaunt ony lyuynge yf hurte shalle able doo bataille hym knyght said sir sagramor ye shalle fyghte alle syrs said good knyght called sir palomydes hede said sir sagramor sire dodynas ye haue cause drede hym ye shall fynde hym passyng good knyght valyaunt cause ye shalle haue ado hym wille forbere tyme el ye shold escape v lyghtely fayr knyght said sir sagramour telle v name syr said name sir tristram de lyones said sagramor sir dodynas well ye fonde moche worship haue herd thenne eyther took leue departed way p capitulum v thenne departed sire tristram rode streyghte vnto camelot peron merlyn made fore sire lancyor kynges sone irland slayne handes balyn place fayr lady columbe slayn loue vnto sir lanceor dede took suerd threst hit thorou body crafte merlyn made entiere knyght lanceor lady columbe vnder one stone tyme merlyon profecyed place shold fyghte two best knyghtes euer arthur dayes best louers psoo whanne syre tristram came tombe lancyor lady buryed loked aboute hym sir palomydes thenne ware semely knyght came rydyng ageynst hym whyte couerd shelde whanne came nyghe sir tristram said hyghe ye welcome syr knyght wel truly haue ye hold promyse thenne dressid sheldes speres came gyder alle theire myghtes horse met fyersly bothe horse knyghtes fylle erthe fast myyte auoyded theyre horse putte sheldes afore strake gyders bryght swerdes men myght eyther wouded wonderly sore blood ranne vpon grasse thus fought space four houres neuer one wold speke one word harneis hewen many pecys lord ihesu said gouernaile merueyle gretely stroke maister hath yeuen mayster hede said sir laucelots seruaunt maister hath yeuen many maister hath receyued many ihesu saide gouernaile moche sir palomydes suffre sir launcelot yet pyte eyther good knyghtes shold destroye others blood soo stode wepte bothe made grete dole whan sawe bryghte swerdes ouer couerd blood bodyes thenne last spake syr launcelot said knyght thou fyghtest wonderly wel euer sawe knyght therfor hit please telle name syr saide syre tristram lothe telle ony man name truly said sir launcelot requyred neuer loth telle name hit wel said said sir tristram thenne requyre telle name fayr knyghte said name sir launcelot du lake allas said sire tristram haue done ye man world loue best faire knyght said sir launcelot telle name truly said name sir tristram de lyones ihesu said sir launcelot aduenture befalle syr launcelot kneled doune yelded hym vp suerd alle sir tristram kneled adoune yelded hym vp suerd soo eyther gaf degree thenne bothe forth went stone set doune vpon hit toke helmes kele eyther kyst honderd tymes thenne anone took helmes rode camelot mette sir gawayne sir gaherys made promyse arthur neuer come ageyne court tyl brought syr tristram pcapitulum sextum retorne ageyne said sir launcelot quest done haue mette sir tristram loo owne persone thenne syr gawayne gladde said sire tristram ye welcome haue ye easyd gretely labour cause said sir gawayne came ye courte fair sir said sir tristram came thys countrey cause syr palomydes assygned day haue done bataille gyders peroun merueyle hym thus aduentur lord syre laucelot mette gyders came kynge arthur whan wyst sir tristram thenne ranne vnto hym toke hym hand saide sire tristram ye welcome ony knyghte euer came courte whanne kynge herd sire launcelot foughten eyther wounded wonderly sore thenne kynge maade grete dole thenne sir tristram told kynge came thydder haue adoo sire palomydes thenne told kynge rescowed hym nyne knyghtes breuse saunce pyte fond knyght lyeng well knyght smote doune sir palomydes sheld couerd clothe soo sir palomydes lefte folowed knyghte many place fonde slayne knyghtes foriusted many hede said sir gawayne knyghte smote doun sire bleoberys hurte v sore couerd shelde sayd sir kay knyght smote adoune hurte passynge sore fayne wolde haue knowen hym myyt ihesu mercy said arthur knyghte couerd shelde knowe saide sir tristram said said kyng arthur thenne wote sir laucelot thene al loked vpon sir lau celot said ye haue begyled v couerd shelde hit fyrst tyme said arthur hath done soo lord sayd sir launcelot truly wete ye wel knyght bare couerd shelde cause wold knowen courte said worship hows trouthe said sir gawayne sir kay sir bleoberys thenne kynge arthur took sir tristram hand wente table round thenne came quene gueneuer many ladyes alle tho ladyes sayden one voyce welcome sir tristram welcome said damoysels welcome sayd knyghtes welcome said arthur one best knyghtes gentylst world man mooste worship alle maner huntynge thou berest pryce alle mesures blowynge thou arte begynnynge alle termes huntyng haukyng ye begynner instrumentes musyke ye ar best therfor gentyl knyght said arthur ye welcome courte also pray said arthur graunte bone shall commaundement said tristram wel said arthur desyre ye wille abyde courte syr saide syre tristram therto othe haue adoo many countreyes soo said arthur ye haue promysed hit ye maye say nay syr said sir tristram wille ye wille thenne wente arthur vnto seges round table loked euery syege whiche voyde lacked knyghtes thenne kynge sawe siege marhaus letter saiden syege noble knyght sir tristram thenne arthur made sir tristram knyght table round grete nobley grete f est myghte thought sir marhaus slayne afore handes sire tristram yland wel knowen tyme courte arthur marhaus worthy knyght euylle dedes dyd vnto countrey cornewaile sire tristram foughte foughte soo longe tracynge trauer ynge tylle fylle bledynge erthe sore wounded myght stande bledynge sir tristram fortune recouerd syre marhaus dyed thurgh stroke hede soo leue sir tristram speke kyng marke pcapitulum vij thenne kynge marke grete despyte renoume sir tristram thanne chaced hym oute cornewaile yet neuewe vnto kynge marke grete suspecyon vnto sire tristram cause quene la beale isoud hym semed moche loue bitwene bothe soo whan sir tristram departed oute cornewaile englond kynge marke herd grete prowesse sir tristram dyd whiche greued hym sore soo sente party men aspye dedes dyd quene sente pryuely party spyes knowe dedes done grete loue bitwene tweyn soo whan messagers come home told trouth herd passed alle knyghtes yf sir launcelot thenne kynge marke ryght heuy tydynges glad la beale isoud thenne grete despyte took hym two good knyytes two squyers desguysed hym self took way englond entente slee sir tristram one ij knyghtes hyght bersules knyyt called amant soo rode kynge marke asked knyght met shold fynde kynge arthur said camelot also asked knyghte sire tristram whether herd hym courte kynge arthur wete wel said knyyt ye shall fynde sir tristram ther man grete worship lyuyng thury prowesse wa turnement castel maydens standeth hard roche sythen hath wonne owne handes thyrtty knyghtes men grete honour pand laste batail euer dy e foughte syre launcelot merueilous bataille force syr launcelot brought sir tristram courte hym kynge arthur made passynge grete ioye soo maade hym knyght table round seate good knyghtes sir marhaus seate thenne kyng marke passynge sory whanne herd honour sir tristram soo departed thenne said kyng marke vnto two knyghtes wille telle counceylle ye men trust moost lyue wille ye wete comynge hyder entente destroye sir tristram wyles treason hit shalle hard yf euer escape handes allas said sir bersules mene ye sette suche waye ye disposed shamefully sir tristram knyyt moost worship knowe lyuynge therfor warne playnly wyll neuer consente doo hym de therfor wyll yelde seruyse forsake whan kynge mark herd hym say sodenly drewe swerd said traitour smote syr bersules hede suerd wente teeth whanne amant knyghte sawe hym doo vylaynous dede squyers said hit foul done meschyeuously wherfore wille doo seruyse wete ye wel wil appeche treason afore arthur thenne kynge marke wonderly wrothe wold haue slayne amant two squyers held gyders sette nought malyce whanne kynge marke sawe myght reuenged said thus vnto knyght amant wete thou wel thou apoeche treason shalle therof defende afore kynge arthur requyre thou telle name kyng mark someuer come said sir amant wil discouer name soo departed amant felawes took body bersules buryed hit pcapitulum octauum thenne kynge mark rode tyl came fontayne rested hym stode doubte whether wold ryde arthur courte none retorne ageyne countrey thus rested hym fontayne ther came hym knyght wel armed horsbak alyghte teyed hors vntyl tree sette hym doune brynke fontayne made grete la gour dole made dolefullest complaynte loue euer man herd al whyle ware kynge marke grete parte complaynte cryed wepte sayenge fayre quene orkeney kynge lot wyf moder sir gawayne sire gaheris moder many thy loue grete paynes thenne kynge marke arose wente nere hym sayd fayr knyght ye haue made pyteous complaynte truly said knyght hit honderd parte reufullyr herte vtter requyre said kyng marke telle name sir said name wil hyde knyght bereth shelde name sire lamorak de galys whan sire lamorak herd kynge mark speke thenne wist wel speche cornysshe knyght syr said sir lamorak vnderstande tonge ye cornewaile wherin duelleth shamefullest kynge lyuynge grete enemy alle good knyghtes preueth wel hath chaced oute countrey syr tristram worshipfullest knyght lyuynge alle knyghtes speken hym worship ialousnes quene hath chaced hym oute countrey hit pyte said sir lamorak euer ony suche fals knyght coward kynge marke shold matched suche fayre lady good la beale isoud alle world hym speketh shame worshyp ony quene maye haue p haue adoo matere said kynge marke neyther noughte wille speke therof wel said said syre lamorak syre ye telle ony tydynges telle said syr lamorak shalle grete turnement hast besyde camelot castel iagent kynge c knyytes kyng irland suppose make turnement p thenne came knyght callid sire dynadan salewed bothe whan wyst kynge marke knyght cornewaile repreued hym loue kynge marke thousand fold dyd sir lamorak thenne profered iuste kynge mark ful lothe therto sir dynadan edgyd hym soo iusted sir lamorak sir lamorak smote kyng marke sore bare hym spere ende ouer hors tayle thenne kynge marke arose ageyne folowed sir lamorak sir dynadan wold iuste sire lamorak told kynge marke sire lamorak syre kay neschall soo said kynge mark moche byggar sir kay soo folowed ouertoke hym badde hym abyde wille ye doo said sir lamorak syr said fyghte swerd ye haue shamed spere dasshed gyders swerdes sir lamorak suffred hym forbare hym kynge marke passyng hasty smote thycke stroke syr lamorak sawe wold stynte waxyd somwhat wrothe doubled stroke one noblest knyghtes world bete hym soo helme hede henge nyy vn sadel bowe whan sir lamorak sawe hym fare soo said syr knyght chere semeth ye haue nyghe fylle fyghtynge hit pyte doo yow ony harme ye meane knyght therfore gyue leue goo ye lyst gramercy said kyng mark ye match thenne sir dynadan mocked kyng marke said ye able matche good knyght said kyng mark first tyme iusted knyyt ye refused hym thynke ye shame said syr dynadan nay syr euer worship knyyt refuse thyng may atteyne therfor worship ben moche haue refused hym dyd warne playnly able bete suche fyue ye ye knyghtes cornewaile men worship knyghtes cause ye men worship ye hate alle men worship neuer bredde countrey suche knyght sir tristram pcapitulum ix thenne rode forth alle gyders kynge mark sir lamorak sir dynadan tyl came brydge ende therof stode fayre toure thenne sawe knyght horsbak wel armed braundysshyng spere cryenge proferynge hym self iuste said sir dynadan vnto kyng mark yonder ar two bretheren one hyght aleyn hyghte tryan iuste ony passeth passage profer self said dynadan kynge mark euer ye leide erthe thenne kynge marke ashamed feutryd hys spere hurtl sir tryan eyther brake speres pyeces passid thurgh anone thenne syr trian sent kynge mark another spere iuste wyse wold iuste thenne came castel al thre knyghtes praid lord castel herburgh ye ryght welcome said knyghtes castel loue lord castel whiche hyght sir tor le fyse aries thenne came fayr courte wel repayred passynge good chere tyl lieutenaunt castel hyght berluse aspyed kyng marke cornewaile thenne said berluse syr knyght knowe better ye wene ye kynge marke slewe fader afore myne owne eyen hadde ye slayne hadde escaped wood wete ye wel loue lord castel neyther hurte ne harme none felauship wete ye wel whan ye past lodgynge shalle hurte may ye slewe fader traitourly fyrst loue lord sir tor loue sir lamorak honourable knyght lodged ye shal haue none ylle lodgynge hit pyte euer ye shold company good knyghtes ye ar vylaynous knyght kynge knowen lyue ye destroyer good knyghtes alle ye doo treason pcapitulum x thenne kynge marke sore ashamed sayd lytyl ageyne whanne sir lamorak sir dynadan wyst kynge marke sory felauship soo souper wente lodgynge soo morne arose erly kynge marke sir dynadan rode gyders thre myle fro lodgynge met hem thre knyghtes sir berluse one two cosyns syr berluse sawe kynge marke thenne cryed hyghe traytour kepe wete thou wel berluse syr knyght said sir dynadan counceylle leue tyme rydynge kynge arthur cause haue promysed conduyte hym lord kynge arthur nedes must take part hym hit loue condycyon fayne wold hym wel dynadan said sir berluse repenteth ye wille take party hym doo best ne hurtled kynge marke smote hym sore vpon shelde bare hym clene sadel erthe sawe sir dynadan feutryd spere ranne one berluses felawes smote hym doune sadel thenne dynadan torned hors smote thyrdde knyght wyse erthe sire dynadan good knyght horsbak byganne grete batail berluse felawes helde gyders strongly ote soo thurgh grete force sir dynadan kyng marke berluse erthe two felawes fledde ben syre dynadan kynge mark wold haue slayne hym soo syre dynadan resoowed hym lyf kynge marke murtherer thenne took horse departed lefte sir berluse sore wouded thenne kynge mark sir dynadan rode forth four leges englysshe tyl came brydge houed knyght horsbak armed redy iuste p loo sayd syr dynadan vnto kynge marke yonder houeth knyghte wille iuste shalle none passe brydge must iuste knyght hit wel said kynge marke iustes falleth syr dynadan knewe knyght wel noble knyght fayne wold haue iusted leuer kyng mark iusted hym meane kynge marke wold iuste thenne syr dynadan myght refuse hym maner thenne eyther dressid speres sheldes smote gyders soo thorou fyne force syr dynadan smyten erthe lyghtely arose vp gat hors requyred knyght doo bataille suerdes ansuerd said fair knyght tyme may haue adoo nomore customme passage suche thenne sir dynadan passynge wrothe myyt reuenged knyghte soo departed wyse wold knyght telle name euer sir dynadan thought shold knowe hym shelde shold sir tor pcapitulum xj soo rode way kynge mark thenne beganne mocke sir dynadan said wend yow knyghtes table round myyt wyse fynde match ye say well said sir dynadan lyfe calle none best knyghtes sythe ye haue despyte requyre iuste preue strengthe soo said kynge mark wille haue ado maner requyre one thyng whanne ye come arthur courte discouer name soo hated shame said sir dynadan ye gouerne soo shamefully see ye ar ful cowardyse ye murtherer grettest shame knyght may haue neuer knyght beynge murtherer hath worship neuer shalle haue sawe late thury force ye wold haue slayn sir berluse better knyghte ye euer ye shal prowesse pthus rode forth talkynge tyl came fayre place stood knyght prayd take lodgynge hym soo request knyght reposed made wel ease grete chere al arraunt knyghtes welcome hym specially alle tho arthur courte thenne sire dynadan demaunded hoost knygytes name kepte brydge cause aske said hoost hit long ago said syr dynadan sythen gaf falle fayr knyght said hoost therof haue ye meruaylle passynge good knyght name sir tor sone aries le vayshere said sir dynadan sir tor truly soo euer thought ryght stode thus talkyng gyders sawe come rydynge ouer playne vj knyghtes courte kynge arthur wel armed al poyntes theire sheldes sire dynadan knewe wel fyrst good knyght sir vwayne sone kynge vryens second noble knyght sir brandyles thyrd ozana le cure hardy fourthe vwayne le auenturous fyfthe syr agrauayne vj sir mordred broder sir gawayne whanne sir dynadan sene vj knyghtes thought hym self wold brynge kynge marke wyle iuste one anone toke horse ranne knyghtes wel thre myle englysshe thenne kynge marke ware sat al syxe aboute welle ete drank suche mete horse walkyng somme teyed sheldes henge dyuerse place aboute loo said sir dynadan yonder ar knyghtes arraunt wyl iuste v god forbede said kynge mark syx two said sire dynadan lete v spare wille assaye formest maade hym redy whanne kynge marke sawe hym doo soo fast sir dynadan rode toward kynge marke rode froward alle mayneal meyny soo whan sire dynadan sawe kynge marke gone sette spere oute reest threwe sheld vpon bak came rydynge felauship table round anone sire vwayne knewe sir dynadan welcomed hym soo dyd al felauship pcapitulum xij thenne asked hym aduentures whether sene syr tristram sir launcelot god helpe said sir dynadan sawe none sythen departed camelot knyght said sir brandyles soo sodenly departed rode ouer yonder felde syr said hit knyghte cornewaile moost horryble coward euer bestrode hors name said alle knyghtes wote said sir dynadan soo whan reposed spoken gyders took horse rode castel duellid old knyght made alle knyghtes erraunt good chere thenne meane whyle talkynge came castel syr gryflet le fyse de dieu welcome alle asked hym whether sene sire launcelot syre tristram syrs ansuerd sawe hym sythen departed camelot soo sir dynadan walked beheld castel chamber aspyed kynge marke thenne rebuked hym asked hym departed soo syr said durst abyde cause many escaped ye said kyng mark syr said sir dynadan better frendes wend ben capytayn felauship said kynge thenne fere hym sir dynadan sayd sir launcelot ihesu said kyng myghte knowe sir launcelot shelde ye said dynadan bereth shelde syluer black bendys alle said fere kyng sire launcelot felauship pray said kyng mark ye wille ryde felauship lothe doo said syre dynadan cause ye forsoke felauship ryght soo sir dynadan went kyng mark wente felauship soo mounted vpon horse rode wayes talked cornyssh knyghte dynadan told castel lodged hit wel said said sir gryflet haue brought sir dagonet kynge arthur foole best felawe meryest world p wille ye doo wel said sir dynadan haue told cornysshe knyght sir launcelot cornysshe knyght asked shelde bare truly told hym bare shelde sir mordred bereth wyl ye doo wel said sir mordred hurte maye wel bere shelde harneis therfore put shelde harneis vpon sir dagonet lete hym sette vpon cornysshe knyght shalle done said sir dagonet feythe thenne anone dagonet armed hym mordreds harneis shelde sette grete hors spere hand said dagonet shewe knyght trowe shalle bere hym doune soo alle knyghtes rode woode syde abode tyl kynge marke came way thenne putte forth sir dagonet came al whyle hors myght renne streyght vpon kynge mark whanne came nyghe kynge marke cryed wood said kepe knyghte cornewaile wille slee anone kynge mark beheld shelde said hym self yonder sir launcelot allas destroyed made hors renne fast myghte thorugh thycke thynne euer sire dagonet folowed kynge mark cryenge rat ynge hym wood man thurgh grete forest whanne sir vwayne sire brandyles sawe dagonet soo chace kynge marke laughed wood thenne toke theire horse rode see sir dagonet spedde wold good sire dagonet shente kyng arthur loued hym passynge wel made hym knyght owne handes att euery turnement beganne make kynge arthur laughe thenne knyghtes rode cryenge chacyng kynge marke alle forest range noyse pcapitulum xiij soo kyng mark rode fortune welle way stood knyght erraunte horsbak armed att al poyntes grete spere hand whanne sawe kynge marke comynge fleynge said knyght retorne ageyne shame stand shalle thy waraunt fayr knyght said kyng marke lete passe yonder cometh best knyght world blak bended sheld fy shame said knyght none worthy knyghtes yf syre launcelot sir tristram shold doubte mete better bothe whanne kynge marke herd hym saye word torned hors abode hym thenne stronge knyght bare spere dagonet smote hym sore bare hym ouer hors tayle nyghe broken neck anone hym came sir brandyles whanne sawe dagonet haue falle passynge wrothe cryed kepe knyght soo hurtled gyders wonder sore knyght smote sir brandyles sore wente erthe hors man syre vwayne came sawe alle ihesu said yonder stronge knyght thenne feutryd speres knyght came soo egerly smote doune sir vwayne thenne came ozana hardy hert smyten doune said sire gryflet counceyl lete v sende yonder arraunt knyght wete whether arthur courte deme sir lamorak de galys soo sente vnto hym prayd straunge knyghte telle name whether arthur courte name shalle wete telle hem knyyt arraunt ar lete wete knyghte kynge arthur courte soo squyer rode ageyne vnto told ansuer hym hede said sir agrauayne one strongest knyghtes euer sawe hath ouerthrowen thre noble knyghtes nedes must encountre hym shame syr agrauayne feutryd spere redy smote hym doune ouer hors erthe wyse smote sir vwayne le auoultres also sir gryflet thenne serued hem alle sir dynadan behynde sir mordred vnarmed dagonet harneis psoo whan done stronge knyght rode way softe paas kynge marke rode hym pray synge hym mykel wold ansuer wordes syghed wonderly sore hangynge doune hede takyng hede wordes thus rode wel thre myle englysshe thenne knyght called hym varlette badde hym ryde vntyl yonder fayr manoyre recommaunde lady castel place praye sende refresshynge good mete drynkes yf aske telle knyght foloweth glatysaunt beest englysshe saye questynge beeste beest someuer yede quested bely suche noyse hadde ben thyrtty couple houndes pthenne varlet wente way came manoyr salewed lady told whens came whan vnderstode came knyghte folowed questynge beeste swete lord ihesu sayd whan shalle see noble knyghte dere sone palomydes allas wille abyde swouned wepte made passynge grete dole thenne also soone myghte gaf varlet alle axyd varlet retorned vnto sir palomydes varlet kynge marke soone came told knyghtes name sir palomydes wel pleasyd said kynge marke holde styll seye thynge p thenne alyghte sette doune reposed whyle anone alle kynge marke felle slepe whanne syre palomydes sawe hym sound slepe took hors rode way said wille companye slepynge knyghte soo rode forthe grete paas pcapitulum xiiij torne vnto sire dynadan fonde seuen knyghtes passynge heuy whanne wyste sped heuy lord vwayne said dynadan dare ley hede sir lamorak de galys promyse alle shalle fynde hym may founde countrey soo syre dynadan rode knyghte dyd kyng marke sought hym thurgh forest soo kyng mark rode sir palomydes herd noyse man made grete dole thenne kyng mark rode nyghe noyse myght durst thenne ware knyght descended hors hadde putte helme made pyteous complaynte dolorous loue pnow leue talke sire dynadan rode seke syr palomydes came within foreste mette knyght chacer dere syr said sire dynadan mette ye knyghte shelde syluer lyon hedes ye fayr knyghte sayd suche knyght mette whyle agone strayte yonder waye yede gramercy said sir dynadan myght fynde trak hors shold fayle fynde knyghte ryghte sir dynadan rode euen late herd doleful noyse man pthenne sir dynadan rode toward noyse whanne came nyghe noyse alyghte hors wente nere hym foote thenne ware knyght stood vnder tree hors teyed hym helme hede euer knyght made doleful complaynte euer made knyghte alweyes made complaynte la beale isoud quene cornewaile said fayr lady loue thou art fayrest alle yet shewest thou neuer loue bounte allas yet must loue may blame fayre lady myn eyen ben cause sorowe yet loue foole best knyghte world loueth ye hym ageyne sir tristram de lyones falsest kynge knyghte youre husband moost coward ful treason lord kyng marke pallas euer fayre lady pyerles alle shold matched moost vylaynous knyght world alle langage herd kynge marke sir palomydes said hym wherfore adradde whanne sawe sire dynadan lest aspyed hym wold telle syre palomydes kynge marke withdrewe hym took hors rode men commaunded hem abyde soo rode fast myght vnto camelot day fonde amant knyght redy afore arthur appeled hym treason soo lyghtely kynge commaunded bataile mysauenture kynge marke smote amant thorugh body yet amant ryghtuous quarel ryghte soo took hors departed court drede sir dynadan wold telle syr tristram sir palomydes pthenne ther maydens la beale isoud hadde sente sire tristram knewe sir amant wel pcapitulum xv thenne lycence kynge arthur went hym spak hym whyle troncheon spere stake body spak fayr damoysels said amant recommaude vnto la beale isoud telle slayn loue sir tristram told damoysels cowardly kyng mark slayne hym sire bersyles felawe pand dede appeled hym treason slayne ryghtuous quarel alle cause sir bersyles wold consente treason flee noble knyght sir tristram thenne two maydens cryed alowde alle courte myght said swete lord ihesu knowest alle hydde thynges suffrest thow soo fals traytour vaynquysshe slee trewe knyght fought ryghtuous quarel thenne anone hit spronge kyng quene alle lordes kynge mark slayne syr amant sire bersules afore hand wherfor dyd theire bataille thenne kyng arthur wroth oute mesure alle knyghtes whanne sire tristram knewe alle matere maade grete dole sorowe oute mesure wepte sorou losse noble knyghtes syr bersyles sir aman pwhanne sir launcelot aspyed sir tristram wepe wente hastely kynge arthur said syre pray gyue leue retorne ageyne yonder fals kynge knyghte pray yow said kynge arthur fetche hym ageyne wold ye slewe hym worship thenne sir launcelot armed hym alle haste mounted vpon grete hors toke spere hand rode kynge marke then thre myle englysshe sir launcelot ouertook hym badde hym torne recreaunt kyng knyght whyder thou wilt thow shalt go kyng arthur courte kynge marke retorned loked vpon sir launcelot said faire syr name wete thou wel said name sire launcelot therfor defende whanne kynge marke wiste sire launcelot came soo fast vpon hym spere cryed thenne lowde yelde sir launcelot honourable knyghte sire launcelot wold hym came fast vpon hym kyng marke sawe maade defence tombled adoune sadel erthe sak lay stylle cryed sire launcelot mercy aryse recreaunt knyghte kynge wylle fyghte said kynge marke whether ye wille wil goo yow allas allas said sire launcelot maye gyue one buffet loue sire trestram la beale isoud two knyghtes thou hast slayne traitourly soo mounted vpon hors brouyt hym kyng arthur kynge marke alyghte place threwe helme hym vpon erthe suerd fylle flat erthe kynge arthur foot putte hym grace mercy psoo god help said arthur ye welcome maner maner ye ar welcome maner ye welcome ye come hyder maulgre thy hede suppose pthat trouthe said kynge marke el ben lord sir launcelot brought hyder thurgh fyne force hym yolden recreaunt pwel said arthur ye vnderstande ye oughte doo seruyse homage feaute neuer wold ye doo none euer ye haue ben ageynst destroyer knyghtes wille ye acquyte sir said kynge marke ryght lordship requyre vnto power wille make large amendys fayre speker fals vnder thenne grete pleasyr syr tristram make tweyne accorded kyng withheld kynge marke tyme made broken loue day bitwene pcapitulum xvj torne ageyne vnto sir palomydes sir dynadan comforted hym alle myghte grete sorow knyghte ye said sir palomydes syre knyght erraunt ye hath soughte longe sheld sheld said sir palomydes wete ye wel ye wille oughte wille defende hit nay said sir dynadan wille haue adoo yow good maner yf ye wil ye shal fynde sone redy syr said sir dynadan whyder ward ryde way hede sayd sir palomydes wote fortune ledeth herde ye sawe ye ought sir tristram god help sir tristram bothe herd sawe thenne loued inwardly wel gyders yet meschyef sir tristram rescowed dethe yet departed bothe assentes assigned day shold haue met stony grane merlyon sette besyde camelot haue done bataille gyders hit letted sayd sir palomydes myght holde daye whiche greueth sore haue large excuse prysoner lord many moo shalle syre tristram ryght wel vnderstande yt brake hit fere cowardyse thenne sir palomydes told sir dynodan day shold haue mette soo god helpe sayd syre dynadan day mette sire launcelot sir tristram graue stone p moost myghtyest bataille euer sene land betwyxe two knyghtes fought two houres bothe bledde soo moche blood alle men merueyled euer myght endure hit pand laste bothe assentes made frendes sworne bretheren euer man iuge better knyght sir tristram made knyghte round table sytteth sege noble knyght sire marhaus pby hede said sir palomydes syre tristram ferre bygger sir launcelot hardyer knyghte p haue ye assayed bothe saide syre dynadan pi haue sene syre tristram fyghte said syre palomydes neuer sire launcelot wetynge fontayne sire launcelot lay slepe one spere smote doune sire tristram said palomydes tyme knewe eyther faire knyghte said sir dynadan sir launcelot sir tristram lete werst wille lyghly matched knyghtes knowe lyuynge said sire palomydes god defende quarel better bothe wold good wylle fyghte hym yow psyre requyre telle name good feith shalle hold company tyl come camelot shall ye haue grete worship grete turnement shalle quene gueneuer la beale isoud cornewaile wete yow wel syre knyght loue la beale isoud wille el wille haue adoo kynge arthur courte sir said dynadan shal ryde yow doo seruyse ye wille telle youre name syre ye shalle vnderstande name syre palomydes brother safere good noble knyghte syre segwarydes sarasyns borne fader moder psyre said sire dynadan thanke moche tellyng name gladde knowe name promyse feyth body ye shalle hurte rather auaunced therto wille helpe yow power promyse doubte ye certaynly lyf ye shalle wynne grete worship courte kynge arthur ryght welcome soo thenne dressid helmes putte sheldes mounted vpon horse toke brode way toward camelot thenne ware castel fayre ryche also passyng strong ony reame pcapitulum xvij syr palomydes said dynadan castell knowe wel therin duelleth quene morgan le fay kynge arthur syster kynge arthur gafe castel whiche hath repented hym sythen thousand tymes sythen kynge arthur haue ben debate stryfe castel coude neuer gete wynne maner engyne euer myght made werre kynge arthur alle daungerous knyghtes withholdeth destroye alle knyghtes kynge arthur loueth shalle noo knyghte passe way muste iuste one knyght two thre yf hit happe kyng arthur knyght beten shal lefe hors harneis alle hath hard yf escape shalle prysoner psoo god helpe said palomydes shameful customme vylaynous vsaunce quene vse namely make suche werre vpon owne lord called floure chyualry crysten hethen alle hert wold destroye shameful customme wille alle world wete shalle haue seruyse yf sende oute ony knyghtes suppose wil iuste shalle haue bothe handes ful shalle fayle said sir dynadan vnto puyssaunce vpon lyf soo stode horsbak afore castel came knyght reed sheld ij squyers hym came streyght vnto syre palomydes good knyghte sayd hym fayre gentyl knyyt erraunt requyre loue thou owest vnto knyghthode ye wille haue adone men thys castell sire lamorack thus said came hydder seke dede hit request therfor biseche knyght lete dele yf beten reuenge name god said palomydes lete see ye wil spede shalle behold p thenne anone came forth knyght castel profered iuste knyyte reed sheld anone encountred gyders reed shelde smote hym soo hard bare hym ouer erthe anone came another knyght castel smyten sore auoyded sadel forth alle came thyrd knyghte knyght reed shelde smote hym erthe thenne came sir palomydes besought hym myght helpe hym iuste faire knyght said vnto hym suffre tyme haue wylle twenty knyghtes shalle doubte euer vpon wally castel many lordes ladyes cryed said wel haue ye iusted knyght reed shelde pbut soone knyght smyten hem doune squyer toke horse auoyded sadels brydels horse tourned forest made knyghtes kepte ende iustes ryght soo came oute castel fourth knyght fresshly proferd iuste knyghte reed shelde redy smote hym soo hard hors man felle erthe knyghtes bak brak falle neck also ihesu said syr palomydes yonder passyng good knyyt best iustar euer sawe hede said sir dynadan good euer sir launcelot sir tristram knyghte someuer p capitulum xviij thenne forthe alle came knyght oute castel shelde bended blak whyte pand anone knyghte reede shelde encountred soo hard smote knyght castel thorou bented shelde thurgh body brake hors bak faire knyghte said syr palomydes ye haue ouer moche hand therfor praye lete iuste ye nede reposed sir said knyght seme ye weyke feble sir thynketh ye profer wrong shame whan doo wel ynough telle yow told erst twenty knyytes shal bete yf beten slayne thenne may ye reuenge yf ye thynke wery ye haue appetyte iuste shalle fynde iustynge ynough syr said palomydes said cause wold iuste semeth ye haue ouer moche hand therfor ye gentyl said knyght reed sheld ye shold profer shame therfor requyre iuste ye shalle fynde wery syth ye requyre said sir palomydes take kepe self pthenne two knyytes came gyders fast horse myght renne knyght smote sir palomydes sore shelde spere wente syde grete wounde perillous alle sir palomydes auoyded sadel knyght torned vnto sir dynadan sawe hym comynge cryed loude said syr wyll haue ado lete cam streyghte vpon hym soo sire dynadan shame put forthe hys spere alle sheuerd hit vpon knyght smote syr dynadan ageyne soo hard smote hym clene sadel horse wold suffre squyers medle cause knyghtes erraunt thenne dressid hym ageyne castel iusted seuen knyytes moo none hem myght withstande hym bare hym erthe twelue knyghtes slewe playne iustes four eyght knyghtes made swere crosse suerd shold neuer vse euylle custommes castel whan made swere othe lete passe euer stode lordes ladyes castel walles cryeng sayenge knyghte reed shelde ye haue merueyllously wel done euer sawe knyght doo therwith came knyght oute castel vnarmed said knyghte reed sheld ouer moche dammage hast thou done v day therfor retorne whyther thou wilt ar moo wille haue adoo repente sore euer thow camest fordone old customme castel word tourned ageyne castel shytte yates thenne knyght reede sheld torned called squyers past forth waye rode grete paas whanne past sire palomydes wente sir dynadan said neuer suche shame one knyght euer met therfore caste ryde hym reuenged swerd horsbak deme shalle gete worship hym syre palomydes said dynadan ye shalle medle hym counceil ye shal gete worship hym cause ye haue sene hym day haue ouer moche done ouer moche trauailed almyyty ihesu said palomydes shall neuer ease tyl haue adoo hym syr said dynadan shalle gyue beholdynge wel said palomydes thenne shall ye see shalle redresse myghtes soo took horse varlet rode knyght reed shelde doune valey besyde fontayne ware alyghte repose hym done helme drynke welle pcapitulum xix thenne palomydes rode faste tyl came nyghe hym thene said knyght remembre ye shame ye dyd ryght castel therfore dresse wille haue adoo fair knyyt said palomydes ye wynne worship ye haue sene daye haue ben trauailed sore said palomydes wille lete wete ye wel wil reuenged wel said knyght may happen endure mou ted vpon hors took grete spere hand redy iuste nay said palomydes wille iuste sure iustynge gete pryce fair knyght said knyghte wold biseme knyght iuste fyghte horsbak ye shalle see wille doo said palomydes therwith alyghte doune vpon foote dressid shelde afore hym pulled oute swerd thenne knyghte reed sheld descended doune hors dressid sheld afore hym soo drewe oute suerd thenne came gyders softe paas wonderly lasshed gyders passyng thyck moutenaunce houre euer brethed thenne tracyd trauercyd waxed wonderly wrothe eyther behyght dethe hewe fast suerdes cutte doune half theire swerdes mayles bare flesshe place stode aboue theyr harneis pand whan sir palomydes beheld felawes swerd ouer hylled blood hit greued hym sore whyle fayned whyle strake wyld men last sir palomydes waxed faynte cause first wounde atte castel spere wound greued hym wonderly sore faire knyght said palomydes semeth haue assayed eyther passyng sore yf hit may please requyre thy knyghthode telle thy name sir said knyyt palomydes loth doo thou hast done wronge knyghthode prefer bataille consyderynge grete trauaylle p thou wolt telle thy name wille telle myn syr said wete thou wel name palomydes syr ye shall vnderstande name sir lamorak de galys sone heyre vnto good knyghte kynge kynge pellenore syr tor good knyght half broder whanne sire palomydes herd hym saye soo kneled doune asked mercy oultragyously haue done daye consyderyng grete dedes armes haue sene done shamefully vnknyghtely haue requyred doo bataille syre palomydes said sir lamorak ouer moche haue ye done sayd ther enbraced hym handes said palomydes worthy knyght alle land noo better ye prowesse repentyd sore shold fyghte gyders doth said palomydes yet sorer wounded ye ben pbut shalle soone therof hole certaynly wold fayrest castel land yf thou met shalle loue dayes lyfe afore al knyghtes excepte broder sir safere saye said syre lamorak excepte broder sir tor thenne came sire dynadan made grete ioye sir lamorak pthenne theire squyers dressid bothe sheldes harneis stopped woundes pryory rested alle nyghte pcapitulum xx torne ageyne whan sire gaynys sir brandyles felawes came courte kyng arthur told kynge syr launcelot sir tristram sire dagonet foole chaced kynge marke thurgh forest stronge knyght smote doune al seuen one spere grete laughynge iapynge atte kynge marke sire dagonet knyghtes coude telle knyyt rescowed kyng mark thenne asked kynge marke yf knewe hym ansuerd said named hym self knyght folowed questynge beest name sente one varlet place moder herd whens cam made passyng grete dole discouerd varlet name said dere sone sire palomydes wolt thou see therfor syr said kyng mark vnderstande name sir palomydes noble knyght thenne alle seuen knyghtes gladde knewe name pnow torne ageyne morne toke horse bothe sir lamorak palomydes dynada squyers varlet tyl sawe fayre castel stood montayne wel closed thyder rode fond knyght hyght galahalt lord castel grete chere wel eased syr dynadan said sire lamorak wil ye doo sir said dynadan wylle morowe courte kynge arthur pby hede said sir palomydes wille ryde thre dayes sore hurte moche haue bled therfor wille repose truly said sir lamorak wille abyde whan ye ryde thenne wille ryde onles ye tary ouer longe thenne wyll take myn hors therfor pray syr dynadan abyde ryde v feythfully said dynadan wylle abyde haue suche talent see sir tristram may abyde longe hym dynadan said syre palomydes vnderstande ye loue mortal enemy therfore shold trust wel said dynadan loue lord syre tristram aboue hym wille serue honoure shalle said syre lamorak al may lye power soo morne sir dynadan rode vnto court kynge arthur way rode sawe stode erraunt knyght made hym redy iuste soo said dynadan haue wylle iuste shalle ye iuste said knyght ye passe waye whether aske ye iustes loue hate knyght ansuerd wete ye wel aske hit loue hate hit maye wel soo said syre dynadan ye profer hard loue whan ye wylle iuste sharp spere fayre knyghte sayd syre dynadan fythe ye wylle iuste mete wyth courte kynge arthur shalle iuste wel said knyght sythe ye wille iuste pray yow telle name psyr knyght said name syre dynadan said knyghte ful wel knowe good knyghte gentyl wete yow wel loue hertely pthenne shalle iustes sayd dynadan betwix v soo departed day came camelot lay kynge arthur salewed kynge quene syre launcelot syre tristram alle courte gladde sir dynadan gentyl wyse curtrys good knyghte especyal valyaunt knyght sir tristram loued syre dynadan passyng wel aboue alle knyghtes sauf sir launcelot pthenne kynge asked syr dynadan aduentures sene sire said dynadan haue sene many aduentures somme kyng mark knoweth alle thenne kynge herkened syr dynanadan told sir palomydes afore castel morgan le fay syr lamorak toke iustes afore foriusted twelue knyghtes four slewe smote doune sir palomydes bothe may byleue sayd kynge sir palomydes passyng good knyghte trouthe said sir dynadan yet sawe hym better preued hand hand thenne told kyng alle batail sir palomydes weyker hurte lost blood withoute doubte sayd sir dynadan bataille lenger lasted palomydes slayn ihesu said kynge arthur grete merueylle syr said tristram merueylle ye thynge therof myn aduys valyaunter knyghte world lyuynge knowe myght wille saye yow neuer soo wery knyghte yf sir launcelot knyghte world excepte syr launcelot wold dyd soo wel sir lamorak soo god help said kyng wold knyght syre lamorak came thys courte syr said dynadan wille shorte space syr palomydes bothe fere palomydes may yet trauayle pcapitulum xxj thenne within thre dayes kynge lete make iustyng pryory made hem redy many knyghtes round table syr gawayne brethere made redy iuste tristram laucelot dynadan wold iuste suffred sir gawayne loue kyng arthur bretheren wynne gree yf myght thenne morne apparayled iuste syr gawayne four bretheren dyd grete dedes armes sir ector de mary dyd merueyllously wel sire gawayne passed alle felauship wherfore kynge arthur alle knyghtes gafe sire gawayne honour begynnynge p ryght soo kynge arthur ware knyght two squyers whiche came oute forest syde sheld couerd leder thenne came slyly hurtlyd anone one spere smyten doune two knyghtes round table thenne hurtlyng lost keuerynge sheld thenne kynge alle ware bare reed shelde ihesu saide kynge arthur see rydeth stoute knyghte reed shelde noyse cryenge beware knyght reed shelde soo within lytel whyle ouerthrowen thre bretheren sire gawayns soo god help said kynge arthur semeth yonder best iuster euer sawe sawe hym encountre sire gawayne smote hym doune soo grete force made hors auoyde sadel phow said kyng sire gawayne hath falle wel knewe knyght reed shelde knowe hym wel said dynadan tyme ye shalle knowe name hede said syr tristram iusted better sir palomydes yf ye lyst knowe name wete ye wel name sir lamorak de galys stode thus talkynge sire gawayne encountred gyders ageyne smote sir gawayne hors brysed hym sore syghte kynge arthur smote doune twenty knyghtes besyde sire gawayne bretheren soo clerely pryce yeuen hym knyght pyerles thenne slyly merueyllously syr lamorak drewe hym alle felauship forest syde al aspyed kynge arthur eye wente neuer hym pthenne kynge syr launcelot syr tristram syr dynadan took theire hackneis rode streyght good knyght syr lamorak de galys fond hym thus said kyng fayr knyght wel ye fonde whanne sawe kynge put helme salewed hym whanne sawe sir tristram alyghte doun hors ranne hym take hym thyes sir tristram wold suffre hym alyghte came eyder took armes made grete ioye kynge gladde also alle felauship round table excepte sire gawayne bretheren whanne wyst syre lamorak grete despyte hym wonderly wrothe hym putte hym dishonour day thenne gawayn called pryuely cou ceille alle bretheren said thus faire bretheren may ye see whome hate kynge arthur loueth whome loue hateth pand wete ye wel fayr bretheren sir lamorak wille neuer loue v cause slewe fader kynge pellenore demed slewe fader kynge orkeney despyte pellenore syr lamorak dyd v shame oure moder therfore wille reuenged syr said sir gawayns bretheren lete see ye wylle maye reuenged ye shalle fynde v redy wel said gawayne hold stylle shalle aspye oure tyme pcapitulum xxij passe oure matere leue sire gawayn speke kynge arthur day sayd vnto kynge marke syr pray yow gyue yefte shall axe yow syr said kyng mark gyue someuer ye desyre hit power syre gramercy said arthur wille aske yow ye wille good lord vnto sir tristram man grete honour ye wille take hym yow cornewaile lete hym see frendes cherysshe hym sake syre said kynge marke promyse yow feythe body feythe owe god yow shalle worshippe hym sake alle may syr said arthur wylle forgyue yow alle euylle wylle euer oughte yow ye swere vpon book afore good wille said kynge marke soo sware vpon boook afore hym alle knyghtes ther kynge mark sire tristram toke eyther handes hard knyt gyders alle kynge marke thought falsly preued put sir tristram pryson cowardly wold haue slayne hym thenne soone kynge marke took leue ryde cornewayl sir tristram made hym redy ryde hym wherof moost party round table wrothe heuy especial sir launcelot sire lamorak sir dynadan wrothe oute mesure wel wyst kyng marke wold slee destroye sir tristram allas said dynadan lord syr tristram shalle departe sir tristram toke suche sorowe amasyd lyke foole p allas said sir launcelot vnto kynge arthur haue ye done ye shall lese moost man worship euer cam court owne desyre said arthur therfore myghte doo alle haue done alle made accord accord said sir launcelot fy vpon accord ye shalle shalle slee sir tristram put hym pryson moost coward vylaynst kyng knyght lyuyng sire launcelot departed cam kynge mark said hym thus syr kyng wete thou wel good knyght sir tristram shalle goo beware rede treason thou meschyeue knyght ony maner falshede treson feythe owe god ordre knyghthode shall slee myn owne handes syr launcelot said kyng ouer moche haue ye said haue sworne said ouer largely afore kynge arthur herynge alle knyghtes shal sle bitraye hym ouer moche shame breke promyse ye saye wel said sir launcelot ye called fals ful treason man man byleue yow pfor soth knowen wel wherfor ye came countrey none cause slee sir tristram soo grete dole kynge marke sir tristram rode gyders hit sir tristram wil meanes goo kyng marke entente see la beale isoud without syghte syr tristra myght endure pcapitulum xxiij torne ageyne vnto sire lamorak speke bretheren syr tor whiche kynge pellenors fyrst sone bygoten aryes wyf couherd bastard sire aglouale fyrste sone begoten wedlok syre lamorak dornar percyuale sone wedlok psoo whanne kynge marke sire tristram departed courte made grete dole sorowe departynge sir tristram thenne kynge knyghtes made manere ioyes eyghte dayes atte eyghte dayes ende ther cam courte knyghte yonge squyer hym whanne knyghte vnarmed went kynge requyred hym make yonge squyer knyghte lygnage come said kynge arthur syre sayd knyght sone kyng pellenore dyd somtyme good seruyse broder vnto syr lamorak de galys good knyghte wel sayd kynge cause desyre ye shold make hym knyghte wete wel lord kynge yonge squyer broder wel sir lamorak name aglauale syre aglouale sayd arthur loue sire lamorak faders loue shalle made knyghte morowe pnow telle said arthur name syre sayd knyght name percyuale de galys soo morne kynge made hym knyght camelott kynge alle knyghtes thoughte hit wold longe preued good knyghte pthenne dyner whanne kynge set table euery knyyt prowesse kyng commaunded hym sette amonge meane knyghtes soo sire percyuale tte kynge commaunded thenne mayden quenes court come hyhe blood domme neuer spak word ryght cam streyght halle went vnto sir percyuale toke hym ye said lowde kyng knyghtes myght hit aryse syr percyuale noble knyght goddes knyght go soo dyd broughte hym ryght syde sege perillous said fair knyghte take thy sege sege apperteyneth none ryght soo departed asked preste confessid houseld thenne dyed thenne kynge alle courte made grete ioye syr percyuale pcapitulum xxiiij torne vnto sir lamorak moche preysed
