thenne meane sir gawayn bretheren sente moder besydes fast castel besyde camelot alle entente slee sir lamorak quene orkeney whyle sir lamorak wyst beynge ful fayne make ende matere sente vnto ther betwixe nyght assygned sir lamorak shold come therof ware syre gaherys rode afore nyght waited vpon sire lamorak ne sawe came armed sire lamorak alyghte yed hors preuy posterne wet palour vnarmed hym thenne wente vnto quenes bedde made hym passynge grete ioye ageyne eyther loued passynge sore psoo whan knyght syr gaherys sawe tyme cam beddes syde alle armed swerd naked sodenly gat moder strake hed whanne sir lamorak sawe blood dasshe vpon hym hote whiche loued passynge wel wete yow wel sore abasshed desmayed dolorous knyght al sir lamorak lepte bedde sherte knyght desmayed sayenge thus syre gaherys knyght table round foule euylle haue ye done yow grete shame allas haue ye slayn moder bare ryght ye shold haue slayne pthe offence hast thou e sayd gaherys withstandynge man borne offre seruyse yet sholdest thow beware whome thow medlest thow hast putte bretheren shame thy fader slewe fader thow lye moder moche shame v suffre thy fader kyng pellenore broder sir gawayne slewe hym ye dyd hym wronge said sire lamorak fader slewe fader balyn le saueage yet faders dethe reuenged leue tho wordes said sir gaherys thou speke felonsly wil slee cause thow arte naked ashamed slee wete thou wel place may gete shalle slee moder quyte withdrawe take thyn armour thow gone syre lamorak sawe none bote fast armed hym took hors rode way makynge grete sorowe shame doloure wold ryde kynge arthur courte rode another waye whan hit knowen gaherys slayne moder kynge passynge wrothe commaunded hym goo oute courte wete ye wel sire gawayn wrothe gaherys slayne moder lete sire lamorak escape matere kynge passynge wro e soo sir lamorak many knyghtes syr said sir launcelot grete meschyef befallen felony fore cast treason syster thus shamefully slayne dare saye wrouyte treson dare saye ye shalle lese good knyghte sir lamorak whiche grete pyte wote wel sure sir tristram wyste hit wold neuer come within courte whiche shold greue yow moche alle youre knyghtes god defende said noble kynge arthur shold lese sire lamorak sir tristram thenne tweyne chyef knyghtes table round gone syre saide syre laucelot sure ye shalle lese sir lamorak sir gawayne bretheren wille sle hym one meane amonge haue concluded sworne slee hym euer may see tyme shalle lette sayd arthur page duplicate page duplicate pcapitulum xxv leue sire lamorak speke sire gawayns bretheren specially syr agrauayne syre mordred rode theire aduentures mette knyghte fleynge sore wounded asked hym tydynges faire knyghtes said cometh knyght wylle slee came sire dynadan rydynge aduenture wold promyse help sir agrauayne sire mordred promysed hym rescowe hym alle came knyght streyght vnto anone proferd iuste sawe syre mordred rode hym strake mordred ouer hors tayle pthat sawe sire agrauayn streyghte rode toward knyght ryghte soo serued mordred soo serued agrauayne said syrs wete ye wel bothe breuse saunce pyte hath done yow yet rode ouer agrauayne fyue syxe tymes pwhan dynadan sawe muste nedes iuste hym shame dynadan encountred gyders pure strengthe sir dynadan smote hym ouer hors tayle thenne took hors fledde foot one valyauntest knyghtes arthur dayes grete destroyer alle good knyghtes thenne rode sir dynadan vnto sir mordred vnto sir agrauayne syre knyght said alle wel haue ye done wel haue ye reuenged v wherfor praye yow telle v youre name faire sir ye ouyte knowe name whiche called sire dynadan whanne vnderstood dynadan wroth hated hym oute mesure cause sir lamorak dynadan suche custome loued alle good knyghtes valyaunt hated al tho destroyer good knyghtes none hated dynadan tho euer called murtherers thenne spack hurt knyght breuse saunce pyte hadde chaced name dalan said yf thou dynadan thow slewest fader hit may wel said dynadan thenne defence request hede said dalan thow shalt dye therfore dressid spere shelde make shorter tale syre dynadan smote hym doune hors neck nyy broken wyse smote syre mordred sir agrauayne quest sa egreal cowardly felloynsly flewe dynadan whiche grete dammage grete bourder passyng good knyght pand soo sire dynadan rode castel hyght beale valet fonde sire palomydes yet hole wound syr lamorak gaf hym dynadan told palomydes tydynges herd sawe syre tristram gone kynge marke hym hath alle wyll desyre syre palomydes waxed wrothe loued la beale isoud thenne wyste wel syre tristram enioyed pcapitulum xxvj leue sire palomydes sire dynadan castel beale valet torne ageyne vnto kynge arthur came knyght oute cornewail name fergus felawe round table ther told kynge sir launcelot good tydynges sir tristram brought goodly letter lefte hym castel tyntagil pthenne came damoysel broughte goodly letter vnto kynge arthur vnto sire launcelot hadde passynge good chere kynge quene gueneuer sire launcelot pthenne wrote goodly letter ageyne fyre laucelot badde euer sire tristram beware kynge marke euer called hym letter kynge foxe saith fareth alle wyles treason wherof sire tristram herte thanked syre lau celot pthenne damoysel went vnto la beale isoud bare letter kynge syre launcelot whereof passynge grete ioye pfaire damoysel said la beale isoud fareth lord arthur quene gweneuer noble knyyt syr launcelot ansuerd make short tale moche better ye sire tristram ben ioye god rewarde said la beale isoud sir tristram suffereth grete payne hym damoysel departed broughte letter kynge marke whanne redde vnderstood wrothe sir tristram demed sente damoysel vnto kyng arthur arthur launcelot maner threted kyng mark kynge mark redde letter demed treson syr tristram damoysel said kynge marke wille ye ryde ageyne bere letter vnto kynge arthur sir said wille commaundement ryde whan ye wille ye saye wel said kyng come ageyne said kyng morne fetche letter thenne departed told shold ryde ageyne letter vnto arthur thenne praye said la beale isoud sir tristram whanne ye haue receyued letter ye wold come v may see pryuete letter al may doo madame ye wote wel must doo sir tristram haue ben longe owne mayden soo morne damoysel went kynge marke haue letter departe auysed said kynge marke tyme sende letter thenne pryuely secretely sent letter vnto kynge arthur vnto quene queneuer vnto sir launcelot varlet departed fond kynge quene walys carlyon kyng quene masse varlet came letter whanne masse done kynge quene opened letter pryu self begynnynge kynges letter wonderly short vnto kynge arthur badde hym entermete hym self wyf knyghtes able ynough rule kepe wyf pcapitulum xvij whanne kynge arthur vnderstood letter musyd many thynges thouyt systers wordes quene morgan le fay sayd betwixe quene gueneuer sir launcelot thoughte studyed grete whyle thenne bethought hym ageyne syster owne enemy hated quene sir launcelot soo putte oute thoughte pthenne kyng arthur redde letter ageyne latter clause said kynge marke tooke sire tristram mortal enemy wherfor put arthur oute doubte wold reuengyd sir tristram thenne kyng arthur wroth kynge marke whanne quene gueneuer redde letter vnderstood hit wrothe oute mesure letter spak shame sir launcelot soo pryuely sente letter vnto sir launcelot whanne wyste entent letter soo wrothe leyd hym doune bedde slepe wherof sir dynadan ware hit maner preuy alle good knyghtes sire launcelot slepte stale letter oute hand red word word thenne made grete sorow anger soo sir launcelot awaked went wyndowe redde letter ageyne whiche maade hym angry syre said dynadan wherfore ye angry discouer hert sothe ye wote wel owe yow good wylle hit poure knyght seruytour vnto yow alle good knyghtes though worship self loue alle tho ben worship trouth said sir launcelot ye trusty knyght grete trust wille shewe yow counceylle whan dynadan vnderstood alle said counceyl sette ryght nought thretys kynge marke soo vylaynous fayre speche shalle neuer man gete hym p ye shalle see shalle doo wille make lay hym whan hit made shalle make harper synge hit afore hym soo anone wente made hit taughte hit harper hyght elyot whanne coude hit taught hit many harper p soo wylle sire launcelot arthur harper went streyghte walys cornewaile synge laye sire dynadan made kynge marke whiche werste lay euer harper sange harp ony instrumentys pcapitulum xviij torne ageyne vnto sire tristram kyng marke syr tristram iustes att turnement hit fortuned sore hurte bothe spere swerd yet wanne alweyes degre repose hym wente good knyght duelled cornewaile castel who name syr dynas le seneschall thenne mysfortune came oute sessoyne grete nombre men armes hydous hoost entred nyghe castel tyntagyl capytayns name elyas good man armes whan kyng mark vnderstode enemyes entred land maade grete dole sorow wyse wille kyng mark wold sende sir tristram hated hym dedely soo whan counceill come deuysed cast many peryls strengthe enemyes thenne concluded one said thus vnto kynge marke syr wete ye wel ye must sende sire tristram good knyghte el wylle neuer ouercome sire tristram must foughten alle el rowe ageynst streme pwel said kynge marke wille doo counceylle yet ful bothe ther nede constrayned hym sonde hym thenne sente alle hast myyte shold come kynge marke whanne vnderstood kynge marke sente hym mounted vpon softe ambuler rode kynge marke come kynge said thus faire neuewe syr tristra alle come oure enemyes sessoyne nyghe hand withoute taryenge must mette shortly el wylle destroye countrey syr said sir tristram wete ye wel alle power commaundement wete ye wel syre eyght dayes may bere none armes woundes ben yet hole day shalle doo may ye saye wel said kynge marke thenne goo ye ageyne repose yow make yow fresshe shalle go mete sessoyns alle power soo kyng departed vnto tyntagyl sir tristram went repose hym kyng made grete hoost departed thre fyrste parte ledde syr dynas seneschall sir andred ledde second parte sir arguys ledde thyrd parte blood kyng mark sessoyns thre grete batails many good men armes soo kynge marke aduyse knyghtes yssued oute castel tyntagyl vpon enemyes dynas good knyghte rode oute afore slewe ij knyghtes owne handes thenne beganne batayls merueyllous brekyng speres smytyng suerdes slewe doune many good knyghtes euer syr dynas seneschal best kyng markes party thus bataille endured longe grete mortalyte last kynge mark sire dynas neuer soo lothe withdrewen hem castel tyntagyll grete slaughter peple sessoyns folowed fast ten put within gate four slayne porte coloyse thenne kyng marke sente sire tristram varlet told hym alle mortalyte pthenne sente varlet ageyne bad hym telle kyng mark wille come soone hole erste maye doo hym noo good thenne kynge mark hadde ansuer came elyas badde kynge yelde vp castel ye maye hold whyle sir elyas said kyng wyll yelde vp castel yf soone rescowed anone kyng marke sente ageyne rescowe sir tristram thenne sir tristram hoole hadde goten hym ten good knyghtes arthur hem rode vnto tyntagyl whanne sawe grete hoost sessoyns merueylled wonder gretely thenne sir trystram rode woodes dyches secretly myght tyl came nyghe gatys dressid knyghte hym whan sawe sir tristram wold entre sir tristram smote hym doune dede soo serued thre mo eueryche ten knyghtes slewe man armes soo sir tristram entryd castel tyntagyl whan kynge marke wyst sir tristram come glad comyng soo alle felaushyp hym made grete ioye pcapitulum xxix soo morne elyas capytayne came bad kynge marke come oute doo bataille good knyghte sir tristram entryd wylle shame sayd elyas kepe thy walles whan kynge mark vnderstode wrothe sayd word went vnto sir tristram axed hym counceyl sire said sir tristram wylle ye gyue hym ansuer wille wel sayd kynge marke thenne sir tristram said thus messagere bere thy lord word kynge wyl batail hym morne playne felde name said messager wete thou wel name sir trystram de lyones alle messager departed told lord elyas alle herd syr saide sire tristram vnto kynge marke praye yow gyue leue haue rule bataill pray yow take rule said kyng mark thenne sire tristram lete deuyse bataille manere shold lete departe hoost syxe partyes ordeyned sir dynas seneschal haue fore ward knyghtes rule remenaunt nyghte syre tristram brente alle sessoyns shyppes vnto cold water anone elyas wyst said hit sir tristram doynge casteth shalle neuer escape moder sone v therfore fayre felawes fyghte frely morowe myscomforte yow noughte ony knyyt though best knyght world maye haue doo v alle pthenne ordeyned theyr batails four partyes wonderly wel apparailled garnysshed men armes thus within yssued withoute sette frely vpon sir dynas dyd grete dedes armes thenne sir dynas felauship put werse came sire tristram slewe two knyghtes one spere thenne slewe ryght hand lyfte hande men merueylled euer myght suche dedes armes thenne myght see somtyme bataille dryuen bowe draughte castel somtyme gate castel thenne came elyas capytayne rashynge hytte kynge mark sore vpon helme made hym auoyde sadel thenne sir dynas gate kynge mark ageyne horsbak alle came sir tristram lyke lyon mette elyas smote hym sore vpon helme auoyded sadel thus fought tyl nyghte grete slauyter wounded peple eueryche party drewe reste whan kynge marke come within castel tyntagyl lacked knyghtes honderd withoute lacked two honderd serched wounded men bothe partyes thenne wente counceil wete yow wel eyther party lothe fyghte soo eyther myght escape worship pwhan elyas capytayn vnderstode dethe men made grete dole whan wyst lothe goo bataille ageyne wrothe oute mesure thenne elyas sente word vnto kyng mark grete despyte whether wold fynde knyght wold fyghte hym body body pand yf myght slee kynge markes knyghte haue truage corne waile yerely yf knyght slee myn fully releece clayme euer thenne messager departed vnto kynge marke told hym lord elyas sente hym word fynde knyght doo bataille hym body body whanne kyng marke vnderstood messagyer badde hym abyde shold haue ansuer thenne called alle baronage gyder wete best counceyll sayd one fyghte felde haue lust ben syr tristram prowesse hit ben lykely neuer shold haue escaped therfor sir deme hit wel done fynde knyyt wold batail hym knyytly profereth pcapitulum xxx thenne whan alle said coude fynde knyght wold doo bataille hym syre kynge said alle knyght dare fyghte wyth elyas allas said kynge marke thenne vtterly ashamed vtterly destroyed onles neuewe sire tristram wylle take bataille vpon hym wete yow wel sayd alle yesterday ouer moche hand wery trauaille sore wounded said kyng mark syr said bedde repose hym allas said kynge marke haue socoure neuewe sir tristram vtterly destroyed euer one wente syr tristram lay told hym kynge marke sayd sire tristram aroos lyghtely putt hym longe gowne came afore kynge al lordes whan sawe hem alle soo desmayed asked kynge lordes tydynges hem neuer werse said kynge told hym alle word elyas fynde knyyt fyghte truage cornewail none fynde yow said kynge alle lordes maye aske yow shame thurgh hardynes yesterday ye saued alle lyues syre said syr tristram vnderstande ye wold haue socour reason wold shold doo al lyeth power doo sauynge worship lyf hit sore brysed hurte sythen sir elyas profereth soo largely shalle fyghte hym el slayne felde el wille delyuer cornewaile old truage therfore lyghtely calle messager shalle ansuerd yet woundes ben grene wille sorer seuen nyght ben ther shalle haue ansuere doo bataill morn hym thenne messager departed brought kynge marke herke felawe said sir tristram goo fast vnto thy lord bydde hym make true assuraunce party truage kyng shalle make party thene telle thy lord sir elyas sir tristram kynge arthur knyght knyghte table round wylle morne mete thy lord horsbak doo batail longe hors maye endure doo bataille hym foote vtteraunce messager behelde syre tristram top alle departed came lord told hym ansuerd sir tristram alle made hostage bothe partyes made hit sure hit myghte whether party vyctory soo ende thenne bothe hostes assembled bothe partyes felde withoute castel tyntagyl ther none sir tristram sir elyas armed soo whan poyntement made departed sonder came gyders alle myght horse myghte renne eyther knyghte smote soo hard bothe horse knyghtes wente erthe thenne bothe lyghtely aroos dressid sheldes sholders naked swerdes handes dasshed gyders hit semed flammynge fyre thus tracyd trauercyd hewe helmes hawberkes cutte awaye many cantels sheldes eyther wounded passynge sore hote blood felle fresshly vpon erthe p thenne foughten mountenaunce houre sir tristram waxte faynte forbledde gaf sore bak sawe sire elyas folowed fyersly vpon hym wounded hym many place euer sire tristram tracyd trauercyd wente froward hym couerd hym shelde myghte alle weykely alle men said ouercome sir elyas hadde gyuen hym twenty stroke ageynst one p thenne laughyng sessoyns party grete dole kynge markys party allas said kynge ashamed destroyed euer book saith syr tristram neuer matched yf sir launcelot thus stode beheld bothe partyes one party laughynge party wepynge syre tristram remembryd hym lady la beale isoud loked vpon hym lykely neuer come presence thenne pulled vp shelde erst henge ful lowe thenne dressid vp shelde vnto elyas gaf hym many sadde stroke twenty ageynst one alle brake shelde hauberk hote blod ranne doune erthe thenne beganne kynge mark laughe alle cornysshe men party wepe euer sir tristram said sir elyas yelde pthenne whanne sir tristram sawe hym soo stakkerynge groud said syr elyas ryght sory thou arte passynge good knyghte euer mette alle excepte sire launcelot ther alle sir elyas fylle erthe dyed shalle doo said sir tristram vnto kynge marke bataille ende thenne elyas party departed kynge marke took hem many prysoners redresse harmes scathe remenaunt sente countrey borowe oute felawes thenne sire tristram serched wel helyd yet alle kynge marke wold fayne haue slayne sir tristram pbut alle euer sire tristram sawe herd kynge marke yet wold neuer beware treason euer wold la beale isoud pcapitulum xxxj wille passe mater speke harper sir launcelot sir dynadan hadde sente cornewaile grete feest kyng marke made ioye sessoyns putte oute countrey thenne came elyas harper lay dynadan made secretely broughte hit vnto sir tristram told hym lay dynadan made kynge marke whan sir tristram herd hit said lord ihesu dynadan make wonderly wel ylle shalle psyr said elyas dare synge songe afore kynge marke ye perylle said sire tristram shalle thy waraunt thenne mete cam elyas harper cause curyous harper men herd hym synge lay dynadan made whiche spak moost vylony kyng marke treason euer man herd whan harper songe songe ende kynge marke wonderly wrothe p sayd thow harper durst thow soo bold thy heede synge thys songe afore syr said elyas wete yow wel mynstrel must doo commauded lordes bere armes syre wete ye wel sir dynadan knyghte table round made songe made synge hit afore yow thow sayest wel sayd kynge marke cause thow arte mynstral thow shalt go quyte charge hyhe fast oute syghte soo harper departed wente sir tristram told hym sped thenne syre tristram lete make letter goodely coude launcelot sire dynadan soo lete conduyte harper oute coutrey say yt kyng mark wonderly wrothe demed lay songe afore hym made sir tristram counceylle wherfore thoughte slee hym alle wel wyllars countrey pcapitulum xxxij torne another mater felle bitwene kyng marke broder called good prynce bodwyne alle peple countrey loued passynge wel hit befelle tyme mescreaunts sarasyns londed countreye corne waile soone sessoyns gone thene good prynce boudwyne landynge areysed countrey pryuely hastly hit day lete put wylde fyre thre owne shyppes sodenly pulled vp ayle wynde made tho shyppes dryuen amonge nauye sarasyns make shorte tale tho thre shippes set fyre alle shippes none saued atte poynt day good prynce boudwyn felauship sette mescreauntes shoutes cryes slewe nombre xl lefte none lyue whan kynge marke wyst wonderly wrothe broder shold wynne suche worship cause prynce better byloued countrey al boudwyn loued wel sir tristram therfore thoughte slee hym thus hastly man oute wytte sente prynce boudwyn anglides wyf bad brynge theyre yonge sone myght see hym alle dyd entente slee child wel fader falsest traitour euer borne allas goodenes good dedes gentyl prynce boudwyn slayne soo whan came wyf anglydes kynge made fayre semblaunt tyl dyned whanne dyned kynge marke sente broder said thus broder spedde yow whan mescreaunts aryued yow semeth hit youre parte haue sente word myght haue ben iourneye ben reason honour syre said prynce boudwyn soo taryed tyl sente yow tho myscreauntes hadde destroyed countrey thou lyest fals traytour said kynge marke thou arte euer aboute wynne worship put dishonour thow cheryst hate stroke hym hert daggar neuer spake word thenne lady anglydes made grete dole swouned sawe lord slayne afore face thenne doo prynce boudwyn despoylled brought buryels anglydes pryuely gat husbandes dobblet sherte kepte secretely thenne moche sorowe cryenge grete dole made sir tristram sir dynas sir fergus dyd alle knyghtes prynce passyngly wel byloued soo la beale isoud sente vnto anglydes prynce boudwyns wyf badde auoyde lyytely el yonge sone alysander le orphelyn shold slaye whanne herd took hors child rode suche poure men durst ryde pcapitulum xxxiij withstandynge whan kyng marke done dede yet thought doo vengeaunce swerd hand sought chamber chamber seke anglydes yonge sone myste called good knyghte hyghte sadok charged hym payne dethe fetche anglydes ageyne yonge sone syre sadok departed rode anglydes within ten myle ouertoke badde torne ageyne ryde hym kynge marke allas fair knyyt said shalle ye wynne sone deth myn haue hadde ouer moche harme grete losse madame said sadok losse dole pyte madame said sadok wold ye departe oute countrey sone kepe hym tyl age may reuenge faders dethe thenne wold suffer yow departe ye promyse reuenge dethe prynce boudwyn gentyl knyght ihesu thanke yf euer sone alysander le orphelyn lyue knyght shal haue faders dobblet shert blody markes shalle gyue hym suche charge shalle remembre hit whyles lyueth al sadok departed eyther toke god pand sadok came kyng ke told hym feythfully drouned yong alysander sone therof kynge marke ful gladde pnow torne vnto anglydes rode bothe nyghte day aduenture oute corne waile lytyl fewe place rested euer drewe southward see syde tyl fortune came castel called magouns hit called arundel southsex conestable castel welcomed said welcome owne castel anglydes worshipfully receyued conestables wyf nyghe cosyn conestables name belangere conestable told anglydes castel ryght enherytaunce thus anglydes endured yeres wynters tyl alysander bygge stronge none soo wyght countrey neyther none myghte doo manere maystry afore hym pcapitulum xxxiiij thenne vpon day bellangere conestable came anglydes sayd madame tyme lord alysander made knyyt passyng strong yonge man syre said wold made knyghte thenne must yeue hym moost charge euer synful moder gaf childe doo ye lyste sayd bellangere shalle gyue hym warnynge shalle maade knyght hit wyl wel done may made knyght oure lady day lente hit soo said anglydes pray yow make redy therfore soo came conestable alysander told hym shold oure lady lente made knyghte thanke god said alysander best tydynges euer came thenne conestable ordeyned twenty grettest gentylmens sone best born men countrey shold maade knyghtes day alysander made knyght soo daye alysander twenty felawes made knyghtes offrynge masse came anglydes vnto sone sayd thus p fayre swete sone charge vpon blessynge hyghe ordre chyualry thou takest day thow vnderstande shalle saye charge alle alle pulled blody dobblet blody sherte bebledde old blood whanne alysander sawe starte abak waxed paale sayd fayre moder maye meane shall telle fayre sone thus thyne owne faders dobblett sherte ware vpon hym daye slayne told hym wherfore hou goodenes kynge marke slewe hym daggar afore myn owne eyen therfor shalle charge shalle gyue pcapitulum xxxv requyre charge vpon blessyng vpon hyghe ordre knyythode thow reuengyd vpon kynge marke dethe thy fader swouned thenne alysander lepte moder took vp armes sayd fair moder ye haue gyuen grete charge promyse yow shalle auengyd vpon kynge marke whanne may promyse god yow p soo feest endyd conestabyl aduyse anglydes lete purueye alysander wel horsed harneysid thenne iusted twenty felawes made knyghtes hym make shorte tale ouerthrewe alle tho twenty none myght withstande hym buffet p thenne one tho knyghtes departed vnto kynge marke told hym alle alysander maade knyghte alle charge moder gaf hym ye haue herd afore tyme pallas fals treason said kynge marke wende yonge traitour ben dede allas whome may truste alle kynge marke took swerd hand soughte sire sadok chamber chamber slee hym pwhanne sir sadok sawe kynge marke come suerd hand sayd thus beware kynge marke come nyghe wete thow wel saued alysander lyf whiche neuer repente thow falsly cowardly slewe fader boudwyn traytourly good dedes wherfore pray almyghty ihesu sende alysander myghte strengthe reuengyd vpon beware kynge marke yonge alysander made knyghte palas said kynge marke euer shold traytour saye soo afore p foure knyghtes kynge markes drewe theire swerdes slee syre sadok anone sir sadok slewe hem alle kynge markes presence thenne sire sadok past forthe chamber toke hors harneis rode waye good paas neyther syre tristram neyther syre dynas syre fergus wold sir sadok ony euylle wylle pthenne kynge marke wrothe thoughte destroye syre alysander syre sadok saued hym kynge marke dredde hated alisander moost ony man lyuynge whanne sir tristram vnderstood alysander made knyghte anone forth alle sente hym letter prayenge hym chargynge hym wold drawe hym courte kynge arthur putte hym rule handes sire launcelot psoo letter sente alysander cosyn syr tristram tyme thought doo commaundement thenne kynge mark called knyght broughte hym tydynges alysander badde hym abyde stylle countrey syre sayd knyght soo muste doo myn owne countrey dare come force said kynge marke shalle gyue double moche landes euer thow haddest thyne owne within short space sir sadok mette fals knyght slewe hym thenne kynge marke wode wrothe oute mesure pthenne sente vnto quene morgan le fay quene northgalys prayenge letter two sorceress wold sette alle countrey fyre ladyes enchauntresses suche daungerous knyghtes malgryn breuse saunce pyte meane alysander le orphelyn shold escape outher shold taken slayne ordenaunce made kyng marke destroye alysander pcapitulum xxxvj torne ageyne vnto sire alysander departynge moder toke hym faders blody sherte soo bare hym alweyes tylle hys dethe daye tokenynge thynke faders dethe psoo alysander purposed ryde london cou ceille sire tristram syre launcelot fortune wente see syde rode wronge wanne turnement gree kynge carados made smote doune kynge carados twenty knyghtes also sire safere good knyght sire palomydes broder good knyght palle sawe damoysel sawe best knyghte iuste euer sawe euer smote doune knyghtes made swere none harneis twelue monethe day wel sayd saide morgan le fay knyght wold fayne see soo took palfroy rode grete whyle thenne rested pauelione came four knyghtes two armed two vnarmed told morgan le fay name fyrst elyas de gomeret second carde gomoret tho armed tweyne camylyard cosyns vnto quene gueneuer one hyyt guy hyght garaut tho vnarmed four knyghtes told morgan le fay yonge knyghte smyten doune castel mayden castel said late made knyghte yonge suppose yf hit sire tristram sire launcelot sire lamorak good knyy none myyt sytte hym buffet spere well said morgan le fay shalle mete knyght longe tyme dwelle countrey psoo torne damoysell castel whanne alysander le orphelyn hadde fori sted four knyghtes called hym said thus syre knyghte wolt thou sake iuste fyghte knyghte sake countrey hath ben long tyme euyll neyghbour name malgryne wylle suffer maryed maner wyse doo ony knyght sake pdamoysel said alysander come whyles wylle fyghte hym poure body sake wille ieoparde alle sente hym commaundement whan eyther hadde syghte made hem redy iuste cam gyder egerly malgryn brysed spere vpon alysander alisander smote hym ageyne hard bare hym quyte sadell erthe malgryne aroos lyghtly dressid sheld drewe suerd badde hym alyyte sayeg thouy thou haue better horsbak thow shalt fynde shalle endure lyke knyght foot wel said said alysander soo lyghtly auoyded hors bitoke hym varlet thenne rasshed gyders lyke two bore leyd helmes sheldes longe tyme space thre houres neuer man coude saye whiche better knyghte pand mene whyle came morgan le fay damoysel castel beheld bataylle malgryne olde roted knyghte called one daungerous knyghtes world doo bataille foot horsbak many better euer malgryne awayted slee alysander soo wounded hym wonderly sore merueylle euer myghte stande bledde soo moche blood alysander fought wyldly wyttely felonous knyyte awayted hym smote hym sore somtyme rasshed gyders sheldes lyke two bore rammes fylle grouelynge bothe erthe pnow knyghte sayd malgryn hold thy hand whyle telle thow arte wylle said alysander yf lyst telle thy name thow kepest thys countrey el thow shalt dye handes wete thow well sayd malgryne maydens loue castel haue slayne ten good knyghtes myshap outerage orgulyte self haue slayne ten knyghtes soo god helpe sayd alysander fowlest confessyon euer herd knyghte make neuer herd speke men suche shameful confession wherfore hit grete pyte grete shame vnto shold lete lyue ony lenger therfore kepe wel euer thow mayst true knyghte eyther thow shalte slee el shal slee promyse feythfully pthenne lasshed gyders fyersly last alysander smote malegryne erthe thenne racyd helme smote hede lyghtely pand whanne hadde done ended bataille anone called hym varlet whiche brought hym hors thene wenyng strong ynouy wold haue mouted soo leyd sire alysander hors lyttar ledde hym castel foote ne myyt stande vpon erthe syxtene grete woundes especyal one lyke dethe pcapitulum xxxvij thenne quene morgan le fay serched woundes gaf suche oynement vnto hym shold haue dyed morne whanne came hym camplayned hym sore thenne put oynements vpon hym thenne payne thenne cam damoysel castel said vnto morgan le fay pray yow helpe knyghte myghte wedde hath wonne handes ye shalle see said morgan le fay shalle saye thenne morgan le fay wente vnto alysander bad ony wyse shold refuse lady desyre wedde yow yow soo damoysel came desyred hym maryage damoysel sayd orphelyn thanke yow yet caste marye countrey syre said sythen ye mary pray yow soo moche ye haue wonne ye wyl gyue knyghte countrey hath ben frende loued many yeres alle herte said alysander wylle assente therto thenne knyyte sente name geryne le grose anone made hand fast wedded thenne came quene morgan le fay alysander badde hym aryse putte hym hors lyttar gaf hym suche drynke thre dayes thre nyghtes waked neuer slepte soo brought hym owne castel tyme called la beale regard thenne morgan le fay came alysander asked hym yf wold fayne hole wold seke said alysander myghte hole wel said morgan le fay thenne shalle ye promyse youre knyghthode daye twelue monethe daye ye shalle passe compas thys castel withoute doubte ye shalle lyghtely hole assente said sire alysaunder made promyse thenne soone hole whanne alysander hole thenne repentyd hym othe myghte reuengyd vpon kynge marke ryght soo came damoysel cosyn erle pase cosyn morgan le fay ryght castel la beale regard shold haue ben true enherytaunce soo damoysel entred castel lay alysander fond hym vpon bed passynge heuy alle sad pcapitulum xxxviij syre knyghte said damoysel ye wold mery coude telle yow good tydynges wel said alysander myghte good tydynges stande prysoner promyse syr sayd wete ye wel ye prysoner werse ye wene lady cosyn quene morgan le fay kepeth yow none entente doo pleasyr yow whan hit lyked ihesu defende said alysander suche pleasyr leuer cutte awey hanger wold suche pleasyr ihesu helpe said damoysel ye wold loue ruled shalle make youre delyueraunce worshyp telle said alysander meane ye shalle haue loue fayre knyghte sayd castel ryght ought myn haue vnkel whiche myghty erle erle pase al folkes hateth moost morgan le fay shalle sende vnto hym praye hym sake destroye castel euylle custommes ben vsed therin thenne wylle come sette wylde fyre euery parte castel shalle gete yow oute pryuy posterne shall ye haue hors harneis ye say wel damoysel sayd alysander thenne sayd ye may kepe rome thys castel twelue moneth day thenne breke ye othe truly fayr damoysel said alysander ye saye sothe thenne kyste dyd plesaunce pleased bothe tymes leysers soo anone sent vnto vnkel badde hym come destroye castel book saith wold haue destroyed castel afore tyme damoysel ben whanne erle vnderstood letter sente word ageyne suche day wold come destroye castel soo whan day came shewed alysander posterne thorou shold flee gardyn shold fynde armour hors whanne day came sette thydder came erle pase four honderd knyghtes sette fyre partyes castel seaced lefte stone standynge alle whyle fyre castell abode gardyn whan fyre done lete make crye wold kepe pyece erthe castel la beale regard twelue monethe daye alle manere knyghtes wold come soo hit happed duke hyyte ansirus kyn sir launcelot knyght grete pylgrym euery thyrdde yere wold iherusalem cause vsed alle lyf goo pylgremage men called hym duke anserus pylgrym duke douyter hyyt alys passyng fayre woman cause fader called alys le beale pylgrym anone herd crye wente vnto arthur courte sayd openly heryng many knyghtes knyghte maye ouercome knyght kepeth pyece erthe shal haue alle landes whan knyghtes round table herd saye thus many gladde passynge fayre grete rente ryght lete crye castels townes faste syde alysander dyd syde thenne dressid pauelione streyghte pyece erthe alysander kepte soone came knyght arthur courte hyghte sagramore le desyrus proferd iuste alysander encountred sagramore le desyrus brysed spere vpon sire alysander sire alysander smote hym soo harde auoyded sadel whanne la beale alys sawe hym iuste soo wel thought hym passynge goodly knyyt horsbak thenne lepte oute pauelione toke sir alysander brydel thus sayd fayre knyght requyre thy knyghthode shewe thy vysage dar wel said alysander shewe vysage thenne put helme sawe vysage said swete ihesu must loue neuer thenne shewe vysage said pcapitulum xxxix thenne vnwympeled vysage whanne sawe said haue fond loue lady truly fayre lady said promyse yow knyghte none bereth lyf gentil knyghte said telle name name said alysander le orphelyn damoysel telle name sayd name said alys la beale pilggrym whan oure hertes ease ye shalle telle blood come soo grete loue betwyxe thus talked came knyghte hyghte harsouse le berbuse axed parte sir alysanders speres thenne sire alysander encountred hym fyrst sir alysander smote hym ouer hors croupe thenne came another knyghte hyyt sire hewgon sire alysander smote hym doune dyd thenne sire heugon profered bataille foote syre alysander ouercame hym thre stroke wold haue slayne hym yelded hym soo thenne alisander made bothe tho knyghtes swere none armour twelue moneth day thenne sire alisander alyyte doun wente reste hym repose hym thenne damoysell halp sire alysander oute castel play told alys gyder prysoner castel la beale regard told gat hym oute pryson syr said alys la beale pylgrym semeth ye ar moche beholdynge mayden trouth said sir alysander alys told hym blood come syre wete ye wel said blood kynge ban fader vnto sir launcelot ye wy fayr lady sayd alysander moder told fader broder vnto kynge nyghe cosyn vnto sire tristram ne whyle came thre knyghtes one hyyt vayns hyght haruys de le march thyrdde hyght peryn de la montayne one spere sire alysander smote doune alle thre gaf suche fallys hadde lyste fyghte vpon foote soo made swere none armes twelue moneth soo whanne deperted sire alysander beheld lady alys hors bak stood pauelione thenne soo enamoured vpon wyst whether horsbak foote ryght came fals knyght syr mordred sawe sir alysander assoted vpon lady ther alle took hors brydel ledde hym cast haue ledde hym oute place haue shamed hym whanne damoysel halpe hym castel sawe shamefully ledde anone lete arme sette sheld vpon sholder ther mounted vpon hors gatte naked swerd hand threst vnto alysander alle myght gaf hym suche buffet thought fyre flewe oute eyen whanne alysander felte stroke loked hym drewe swerd whan sawe fledde soo dyd mordred forest damoysel fledde pauelione whanne alysander vnderstood hym self fals knyght wold haue shamed hym hadde damoysel ben thenne wrothe hym self syre mordred soo escaped handes thenne sire alysander alys hadde good game damoysel hou sadly hytte hym vpon helme pthenne sir alysander iusted thus day day foot dyd many batails many knyghtes kynge arthur court many knyghtes straungers therfore telle alle batails ouer moche reherse euery day within twelue moneth adoo one knyght day adoo thre foure neuer knyght putte hym werse twelue monethes ende departed lady alys la beale pylgrym damoysel wold neuer goo hym soo went theyr countrey benoye lyued grete ioye pcapitulum xl bvt book sayth kyng marke wold neuer stynte tyll slayne hym treason alys gat child hyght bellengerus le beuse good fortune came courte kynge arthur preued passynge good knyghte reuenged faders dethe fals kynge marke slewe bothe syre tris ram alysander falsly felo sly hit happed alysander hadde neuer grace ne fortune come kynge arthur court comen sire launcelot alle knyghtes sayd knewe hym one strengest knyghtes arthur dayes grete dole made hym soo lete hym passe torne another tale hit bef lle ire galahalt haute prynce lord countrey surluse wherof came many good knyghtes noble prynce passynge good man armes euer helde noble felaushyp gyders thenne came arthur court told hym entent wyll hou wold lete crye iustes coutrey surluse whiche countrey within landes kynge arthur axed leue lete crye iustes wyl gyue yow leue said kynge arthur wete thow wel sayd kynge arthur maye syre said quene gueneuer please hit gyue leue iustes ryght good wille said arthur sire galahalt haute prynce shall haue yow gouernaunce syr said galahalt wille ye wylle sir thenne quene wille take suche knyghtes pleasen best ye lyst said kynge arthur anone commaunded sire launcelot make hym redy suche knyghtes thought best soo euery good towne castel land made crye countrey surluse syre galahalt sholde make iustes shold laste eyghte dayes haute prynce help quene gueneuers knyghtes shold iuste ageyne alle manere men wold come whanne crye knowen kynges prynces duke erles baron noble knyghtes made redy iustes daye iustyng came sire dynadan disguysed dyd many grete dedes armes pcapitulum xlj thenne request quene gueneuer kynge bagdemagus sir laucelot came rayeng desguysed cause fewe folke knewe hym mette hym sir ector de mary owne broder eyther brake speres vpon theyr handes thenne eyther gate another spere thenne sire launcelot smote doune syr ector de mary owne broder sawe sire bleoberys smote sir launcelot suche buffet vpon helme wyst wel thenne sir launcelot wrothe smote sir bleoberys sore vpon helme hede bowed doune backward smote efte another buffet auoyded sadel soo rode threst forth thyckest whan kynge northgalys sawe sire ector bleoberys lye ground thenne wroth came party ageynst surluse kynge northgalys ran sire launcelot brake spere vpon hym pyeces sire launcelot ouertook kynge northgalys smote hym suche buffet helme suerd made hym auoyde hors anone kyng horsed ageyne bothe kynge bagdemagus kyng northgalys party hurled thenne beganne stronge medle northgalys ferre bygger whanne sire launcelot sawe party goo werst thrange thyckest prees suerd hand smote doune ryght hand lyft hand pulled doune knyghtes racyd helmes alle men hadde wonder euer one knyght myghte doo dedes armes whanne sire mellegaunt sone vnto kyng bagdemagus saw sir launcelot ferd merueiled gretely whan vnderstood wyst wel desguysed sake thenne sire malegeaunt prayd knyghte slee sir launcelots hors outher suerd spere tyme kynge bagdemagus mette wyth knyghte hyght sauseyse good knyghte sayd fayr sauseyse encounter sone malegeaunt gyue hym large payment wold well beten thy handes myghte departe oute feld thenne sir sauseyse encountred syr malegeaunt eyther smote doune thene fought fote sauseyse wonne syre malegeaunt hadde come rescowes thenne haute prynce blewe lodgynge euery knyghte vnarmed hym wente grete feest pthenne meane whyle came damoysel haute prynce complayned knyghte hyght goneryes withhelde alle landes thenne knyghte presente caste gloue hym ony wold fyghte name soo damoysel took vp gloue alle heuyly defaute champyon thenne came varlet sayd damoysel wille ye doo ful fayne said damoysel thenne goo ye vnto suche knyght lyeth besyde ermytage foloweth questyng best pray hym take bataille vpon hym anone wote wel wille graunte yow pso anone took palfroy within whyle fond knyght sire palomydes whan requyred hym armed hym rode made go haute prynce aske leue knyght doo batail wille wel said haute prynce thenne knyghtes redy feld iuste horsbak eyther gatte spere handes mette soo fyersly gyders speres alle sheuerd thenne flange swerdes syr palomydes smote sire gonereys doune erthe thenne racyd helme smote hede thenne wente souper damoysel loued palomydes peramour book saith kyn soo thenne palomydes desguysed hym self manere shelde bare questynge beest alle trappours p whanne thus redy sente haute prynce gyue hym leue iuste knyghtes adoubted sire launcelot haute prynce sente hym word ageyne shold welcome syre launcelot shold iuste hym thenne sire galahalt haute prynce lete crye knyght someuer smote doune sir palomydes shold haue damoysel hym self p capitulum xlij begynneth second daye anone sire palomydes came felde syr galahalt haute prynce raunge ende mette sire palomydes hym grete speres thenne cam soo hard gyders speres alle sheuered syr galahalt smote hym soo hard bare hym backward ouer hors yet lost styropes pthenne drewe swerdes lasshed gyder many sadde stroke many worshipful knyghtes lefte besynes behold last sire galahalt haut prynce smote stroke myghte vnto palomydes sore vpon helme helme soo hard swerd myght byte slypped smote hede hors sir palomydes whan haut prynce wyst sawe good knyght falle vnto erthe ashamed stroke alyghte doune owne hors prayd good knyghte palomydes take hors yefte forgyue hym dede syre said palomydes thanke yow grete goodnes euer man worship knyghte shalle neuer aue disworship soo mounted vpon hors haute prynce another anone said haute prynce relece yow maiden ye haue wonne said palomydes damoysel commaundement departed sire galahalt dyd grete dedes armes ryght soo came dynadan encountred syr galahalt eyther came fast theire speres speres brak handes dynadan wende haute prynce ben wery thenne smote many sadde stroke haute prynce whan dynadan sawe myght gete hym erthe said lord pray yow leue take another haute prynce knewe dynadan lefte goodely fayr wordes soo departed soone came another told haute prynce hit dynadan soth sayd prynce therfor heuy soo escaped mockes iapes shalle neuer haue done hym thenne galahalt rode fast hym bad hym abyde dynadan kynge arthur sake nay said dynadan soo god helpe mete gyder daye thenne wrathe haute prynce mette melyagaunt smote hym throte fallen neck broken spere smote doune another knyght thenne came northgalys many straugers lyke haue putte surluse werse syr galahalt haut prynce ouer moche hand soo came good knyghte semound valyaunt wyth fourty knyghtes bete al abak thenne quene gueneuer sire launcelot lete blowe lodgynge euery knyghte vnarmed hym dressid hem feeste pcapitulum xliij whanne palomydes vnarmed axed lodgynge hym self damoysel anone haute prynce commaunded lodgynge soone lodgynge came knyghte hyght archade broder vnto gomoryes palomydes slewe afore damoysels quarel knyght archade called yre palomydes traytour appelyd hym dethe broder leue haute prynce sayd palomydes shalle ansuer whan sire galahalt vnderstood theyre quarel badde goo dyner soone ye haue dyned loke eyther knyghte redy felde hadde dyned armed bothe tooke horse quene prynce syr launcelot set behold soo lete renne horse sir palomydes bare archade spere ouer hors tayle thenne palomydes alyght drewe swerd syr archade myght aryse syr palomydes racyd helme smote hede pthenne haute prynce quene gueneuer wente vnto souper pthenne kynge bagdemagus sente aweye sone melyagaunt cause syr launcelot shold mete hym hated sire launcelot knewe pcapitulum xliiij begynneth thyrdde daye iustynge att daye kynge bagdemagus made hym redy came ageynst hym kynge marsyl yefte iland syre galahalt haute prynce yland name pomytayn thenne hit befelle kyng bagdemagus kynge marsyl pomytayn mette gyders speres kynge marsyl suche buffet felle ouer hors croupe p thenne came therin knyght kynge marsyl reuenge lord kynge bagdemagus smote hym doune hors man erthe psoo came erle hyght arrouse sir breuse honderd knyghtes hem pometayne kynge northgalys hem alle ageynst surluse thenne beganne grete bataylle many knyghtes caste vnder hors foot euer kynge bagdemagus dyd best fyrste beganne euer helde gaherys gawayns broder smote euer face kynge bagdemagus laste kynge bagdemagus hurtled doune gaherys hors man pthenne aduenture syre palomydes good knyghte mette syre bleoberys de ganys syre bleoberys broder eyther smote grete speres theyre horse knyghtes felle erthe syre blamore suche falle al moost broken neck blood braste oute nose mouthe eres laste recouerd well good surgyens thenne therecam duke chaleyns claraunce gouernaunce came knyghte hyghte elys la noyre encountred hym kynge bagdemagus smote elys made hym auoyde sadel p soo duke chaleyns claraunce dyd grete dedes armes soo late came thyrdde daye man dyd soo wel excepte kynge bagdemagus sire palomydes pryce gyuen day kynge bagdemagus pand thenne blewe vnto lodgynge vnarmed hem wente feest p ryght soo came dynadan mocked iaped kynge bagdemagus alle knyghtes lough hym fyne iaper wel louynge alle good knyghtes psoo anone dyned came varlet berynge foure speres bak came palomydes sayd thus knyyte hath sente yow choyse foure speres requyreth yow lady sake take one half speres iuste hym felde p telle hym said palomydes wyll fayle hym whanne sire galahalt wyste badde palomydes make hym redy p quene gueneuer haute prynce sire launcelot set vpon schafholdes gyue iugement two knyghtes pthenne syre palomydes straunge knyght ranne egerly gyders speres brake handes anon alle eyther tooke grete spere hand alle sheuered pyeces thenne eyther tooke gretter spere thenne knyghte smote doune syre palomydes hors man erthe wold haue passed ouer hym straunge knyghtes hors stumbled felle doune vpon palomydes p thenne drewe swerdes lasshed gyders wonderly sore grete whyle pthenne haute prynce sire launcelot sayd sawe neuer two knyghtes fyghte better dyd euer straunge knyght doubled stroke putte palomydes abak alle haute prynce cryed hoo thenne wente lodgynge whanne vnarmed knewe hit noble knyyt syr lamorak pwhanne syr launcelot knewe hit sir lamorak made moche hym aboue alle erthely men loued hym best excepte sire tristram p thenne quene gueneuer commended hym soo dyd alle good knyghtes made moche hym excepte sire gawayns bretheren thenne quene gueneuer said vnto sire launcelot syr requyre yow ye iuste ony ye iuste none blood lord arthur soo promysed wold tyme pcapitulum xlv begynneth fourthe daye thenne came felde kynge honderd knyghtes alle northgalys duke chaleyns claraunce kynge marsyl pomatyn came safyr palomydes broder told hym tydynges moder name called erle appeled hym afore kynge arthur made warre vpon oure fader moder slewe hym playne bataille soo wente feld damoysel wyth came encountre ageyne sire bleoberys de ganys sir ector de mary sire palomydes encou tred sir bleoberys eyther smote doune wyse dyd sire safere sir ector tho two couple dyd bataille foote thenne came sire lamorak encountred kynge honderd knyghtes smote hym quyte ouer hors tayle wyse serued kynge northgalys also smote doune kynge marsyl euer stynte smote doune spere suerd thyrtty knyghtes whan duke chaleyns sawe lamorak doo soo grete prowesse wolde medle hym shame thenne charged knyghtes payne dethe none yow touche hym hit shame alle good knyghtes knyght shamed pthenne two kynges gadred gyders alle sette vpon sire lamorak faylled rasshed smytyng ryght hand lyfte racyd many helmes haute prynce quene gueneuer said sawe neuer knyghte suche dedes armes horsbak allas sayd launcelot kynge bagdemagus wylle arme helpe syre lamorak wylle ryde yow said kyng bagdemagus whanne two horsed came sir lamorak stood amonge thyrity knyghtes wel hym myght retche hym buffet euer smote ageyn myghtely thenne came prees sir launcelot threwe doune sir mador de la porte truncheon spere threwe doune many knyghtes kynge bagdemagus smote lyfte hand ryyt hand merueylously wel thenne thre kynges fledde abak thenne sire galahalt lete blowe lodgynge alle heroudes gaf sire lamorak pryce p alle whyle foughte palomydes ire bbeoberys sire safere sir ector foot neuer foure knyghtes euener matched thenne departed vnto lodgyng vnarmed hem soo wente grete feeste whanne sire lamorack come courte quene gueneuer took hym armes sayd syr wel haue ye done daye thenne came haute prynce maade hym grete ioye soo dyd dynadan wepte ioye ioye sire launcelot made sir lamorak myghte man telle thenne wente vnto rest morne haute prynce lete blowe vnto felde pcapitulum xlvj begynneth fyfthe daye soo hit befelle syre palomydes came morne tyde profered iuste kynge arthur castel besydes surluse encountred hym worshipful duke sire palomydes smote hym ouer hors croupe duke vnkel vnto kynge arthur thenne sire elyses sone rode vnto palomydes palomydes serued elyse wy whanne sire vwayne sawe thys wrothe thenne took hors encountred syr palomydes palomydes smote hym soo hard wente erthe hors man make short tale smote doune thre bretheren syre gawayns say mordred gaherys agrauayne ihesu said arthur grete despyte sarasyn shalle smyte doune blood alle kyng arthur woode wrothe thoughte haue made hym redy iuste aspyed sire lamorak arthur blood discomfyte anone redy axed palomydes yf wold ony iuste shold said palomydes thenne hurtled gyders brake speres alle sheuerd alle castel range theyr dyntys thenne eyther gate gretter spere hand came soo fyersly gyders sir palomydes spere brast syre lamorak dyd holde alle sire palomydes lost steroppes lay vp ryght horsbak ne sire palomydes retorned ageyne took damoysel sir safere retorned way soo whan departed kynge arthur came syr lamorak thanked hym goodnes prayd hym telle hym name syr sayd lamorak wete thow wel owe yow seruyse att tyme wylle abyde see myn enemyes many aboute p allas sayd arthur wote wel syre lamorak de galys lamorak abyde croune shalle neuer fayle soo hardy gawayns hede none bretheren doo ony wronge syre said syre lamorak wronge haue done yow bothe trouth sayd kyng slewe theyre owne moder syster whiche sore greueth hadde ben moche fayrer better ye wedded ye kynges sone wel po ihesu sayd noble knyght sire lamorack vnto arthur dethe shalle neuer forgete promyse yow make myn auowe vnto god shalle reuenge dethe soone see tyme conenable yf hit reuerence hyhenes shold haue ben reuenged vpon syre gawayn bretheren truly said arthur wil make acord syr said lamorak tyme may abyde yow muste iustes syre launcelot haute prynce syre galahalt thenne damoysel doughter kynge bandes sarasyn knyghte hyghte corsabryn loued damoysel wyse wold suffre maryed euer corsabryn noysed named oute mynde thus lette myght maryed pcapitulum xliiij soo fortune damoysel herd telle palomydes dyd moche damoysels sake soo sent hym pensel prayd hym fyghte sire corsabryn loue shold haue landes faders shold falle thenne damoysel sente vnto corsabryn badde hym goo vnto sire palomydes paynym wel gaf hym warnyng sente hym pensel yf myghte ouercome palomydes wold wedde hym whanne corsabryn wyste dedes thenne wood wroth angry rode vnto surluse haute prynce fond sire palomydes redy whiche pensel soo waged batail either afore galahalt wel said haute prynce daye muste noble knyghtes iuste dyner shall see ye spede thenne blewe iustes cam dynadan mette sir geryn good knyght threwe hym doune ouer hors croupe sire dynadan ouerthrewe four knyytes moo dyd grete dedes armes good knyyt scoffer iaper meryest knyght among felauship tyme lyuynge hadde suche customme loued euery good knyghte euery good knyght loued hym ageyne p soo thenne whanne haute prynce sawe dynadan doo soo wel sente vnto syre launcelot bad hym stryke doune syre dynadan whan ye haue done brynge hym afore noble quene gueneuer thenne sir launcelot dyd requyred thenne sire lamorak smote doune many knyghtes racyd helmes drofe alle knyghtes afore soo sire launcelot smote doune sire dynadan made men vnarme hym soo brought hym quene haute prynce lough dynadan sore myghte stande wel said sire dynadan yet haue shame old shrewe sire launcelot smote doune wente dyuer alle courte good sporte dynadan pthenne whanne dyner done blewe felde beholde sire palomydes corsabryn syre palomydes pyght pensell myddes felde thene hurtled gyders speres thonder eyther smote erthe thenne pulled oute swerdes dressid sheldes lasshed gyders myghtely myghty knyytes wel nyghe pyece harneis wold hold corsabryn passynge folonous knyghte corsabryn said palomydes wylte thow releace yonder damoysel pensell thenne corsabryn wrothe oute mesure gaf palomydes suche buffet kneled knee p thenne palomydes arose lyghtely smote hym vpon helme felle doune ryyt erthe ther racyd helme sayd corsabryn yelde ellys thou shalt dye handes fy said corsabryn doo thy werst thenne smote hede cam stynke body whan soule departed myyt body abyde sauoure soo corp hadde aweye buryed wood cause paynym pthenne blewe vnto lodgynge palomydes vnarmed pthenne wente vnto quene gueneuer haute prynce syre launcelot psyre sayd haute prynce haue ye sene day grete myrakel corsabryn sauour whanne soule departed body syre wylle requyre yow take baptym vpon yow promyse yow alle knyghtes wyll sette yow say worship yow psyre said palomydes wille ye alle knowe land came crystened herte crystened crystend wille p haue made suche auowe maye crystend tyl haue done seuen true batails ihesus sake thenne wil crystend truste god wylle take myn entent meane truly thenne sire palomydes prayed quene gueneuer haute prynce soupe hym soo dyd bothe sire launcelot sire lamorak many good knyghtes soo morne herd masse blewe felde thenne knyghtes made redy pcapitulum xlviij begynneth syxthe day thenne came therin syr gaherys encountred hym syre ossaise surluse sir gaherys smote hym ouer hors croupe thenne eyther party encountred many speres broken many knyghtes ca vnder feete psoo came sir dornard sir aglouale bretheren vnto sire lamorak mette two knyghtes eyther smote soo hard four knyghtes horse felle erthe whan sire lamorak sawe two bretheren doune wrothe oute mesure thenne gat grete spere hand alle smote doune four good knyytes thenne spere brake thenne pulled oute suerd smote aboute hym ryght hand lyfte hand racyd helmes pulled doune knyghtes alle men merueylled suche dedes armes dyd ferd many knyghtes fledde thenne horsed bretheren ageyne sayd bretheren ye oughte ashamed falle horse knyght whan horsbak sett knyght whanne foote batails fote ar pelowres batails shold knyghte fyghte foote yf hit treason el dryuen therto force therfore bretheren sytte faste horse el fyghte neuer afore cam duke chaleyns claraunce encountred hym erle vlbawes surluse eyther hem smote doune thenne knyghtes bothe partyes horsed lordes ageyne syr ector bleoberys foote waytynge duke chaleyns kynge honderd knyghtes erle vlbawes came gaherys lasshed kynge honderd knyghtes hym ageyne thenne came duke chaleyns departed thenne blewe lodgynge knyytes vnarmed drewe dyner atte myddes dyner came dynadan beganne rayle thenne beheld haute prynce semed wrothe somme faute sawe hadde customme loued fysshe cause serued fysshe whiche hated therfore mery whan sir dynadan aspyed haute prynce aspyed fyss grete hede gatte betwixe two dysshes serued haute prynce fysshe thenne said thus sir galahalt wel may lyken yow wolf wille neuer ete fysshe flesshe thenne haute prynce lough wordes wel wel said dynadan launcelot deuylle doo ye countrey may meane knyytes wynne worship sir dynadan said laucelot ensure shalle mete thy grete spere maye sytte sadel spere hyttyth yf happy shalle beware boystous body thow berest wel said launcelot make good watche euer god forbede euer mete yf hit dysshe mete thenne lough quene haute prynce myghte sytte table thus made grete ioye tyl morn thenne herd masse blewe felde quene gueneuer estate set iuges armed clene sheldes kepe ryghte pcapitulum xlix begynneth seuenth bataill cam duke cambynes encountred hym syr arystaunce counted good knyghte mette soo hard eyther bare doune hors man pthenne came erle lambayle helped duke ageyne hors thenne came syr ossayse surluse smote erle lambayle doune hors thenne beganne doo grete dedes armes many speres broken many knyghtes caste erthe pthenne kynge northgalys erle vlbawes smote gyders alle iuges thought lyke mortal dethe meane whyle quene gueneuer haute prynce syr laucelot made syre dynadan make hym redy iuste wold said dynadan ryde felde thenne one one yow tweyne wille mete per dieu sayd haute prynce ye maye see hou sytte iuges oure sheldes alweyes mayst thow beholde whether sytte soo syr dynadan departed tooke hors mette many knyghtes dyd passynge wel departed syre launcelot desguysed hym self putte vpon armour maydens garment fresshely attyered thenne sire launcelot made sire galyhodyn lede hym thorugh raunge alle men wonder damoysel soo sire dynadan came raunge sire launcelot damoysels araye gatte galyhodyns spere ranne vnto sir dynadan alwayes sire dynadan loked vp syre launcelot thenne sawe one sytte stede sire launcelot armed whanne dynadan sawe maner damoysel drad peryls syre launcelot desguysed syre launcelot came hym fast smote hym ouer hors croupe thenne grete scornes gate sire dynadan forest besyde dispoylled hym vnto sherte putte vpon hym woman garment brought hym felde soo blewe vnto lodgynge euery knyght wente vnarmed thenne sir dynadan brought among alle whanne quene gueneuer sawe sir dynadan brought soo amonge alle thenne lough fylle doune soo dyd alle wel sayd dynadan launcelot thow arte soo fals neuer beware thenne alle assente gaf syre launcelot pryce next sire lamorak de galys thyrd sir palomydes fourthe kynge bagdemagus soo four knyghtes pryce grete ioye grete nobley alle courte morne quene gueneuer sir launcelot departed vnto kynge arthur noo wyse syr lamorak wold go shalle vndertake said sire launcelot ye wyll goo v kynge arthur shalle charge syre gawayne bretheren neuer doo yow hurte sayd syre lamorak wylle truste sire gawayne none bretheren wete ye wel sir launcelot hit lord kynge arthur sake shold matche sire gawayn bretheren wel ynouy say shold truste shal neuer therfor pray recommaunde vnto lord arthur vnto alle lordes round table place euer come shal seruyse power syr late reuengyd whan lord arthur kynne put werse sire palomydes thenne sir lamorak departed sir lau celot eyther wepte departynge p capitulum l torne fro mater speke sir tristram whome booke pryncipal leue kynge quene syr launcelot syre lamorak begynneth treason kynge mark ordeyned ageynst syr tristram cryed costes cornewaile grete turnement iustes al done sir galahalt haut prynce kynge bagdemagus entent slee launcelot el vtterly destroye hym shame hym cause sir launcelot alweyes hyher degree therfore prynce kynge made iustes ageynst sire launcelot thus couceyll discouerd vnto kynge marke wherof ful gladde thenne kyng marke bethoughte hym wold haue syre tristram vnto turnement desguysed man shold knowe hym entente haute prynce shold wene sir tristram syre launcelot soo thise iustes came syr tristram tyme sire launcelot whan sawe knyyt desguysed doo suche dedes armes wende hit ben sir launcelot especyal kynge mark sayd hit syre launcelot playnly thenne sette vpon hym bothe kynge bagdemagus haute prynce theyre knyghtes hit wonder euer sire tristram myght endure payne withstandynge alle payne syr tristram wanne degree turnement hurte many knyytes brysed hurte hym brysed hym wonderly sore p whanne iustes alle done knewe wel hit sire tristram de lyones kyng markes party glad sir tristram hurte remenaunt sory hurte syre tristram soo behated syre launcelot within reame englond thenne came kyng marke vnto syre tristram sayd fayre neuewe sory hurtes gramercy lord said syre tristram pthenne kynge marke made sir tristram putte hors bere grete sygne loue said fayre cosyn shalle leche self soo rode forthe sire tristram brought hym castel day lyghte thenne kynge mark made syre tristram ete thenne gaf hym drynke whiche soone ad dronke fell slepe whanne nyghte made hym caryed another castel putte hym stronge pryson ordeyned man woman gyue hym mete drynke soo grete whyle thenne syr tristram myssed creature wyst become la beale isoud herd hou myssed pryuely went vnto sir sadok praid hym aspye sir tristram thenne sadok wyst hou sir tristram myssed anon aspyed put pryson kyny mark traitours magos thene sadok two cosyns leid enbusshement fast castel tyntagyl armes fortune came rydynge kynge marke foure neuewes certayn traytours magouns whanne sir sadok aspyed brake oute busshement sette vpon whan kynge mark aspyed sire sadok fledde fast myghte sir sadok slewe alle four neuewes vnto kynge marke traitours magons slewe one sadoks cosyns grete wound neck sadok smote dethe thenne sir sadok rode vpon way vnto castel called lyonas aspyed treason felony kynge marke soo castel rode syre sadok tyl came castel hyghte arbray toune fond syre dynas seneschal good knyght whan sire sadok told syre dynas alle treason kynge marke defyed suche kynge sayd wold gyue vp landes held hym whanne said wordes alle manere knyghtes sayd syre dynas said thenne aduys sire sadoks lete stuffe alle townes castels within countrey lyones assembled peple myght make pcapitulum lj torne vnto kynge marke whan escaped sir sadok rode vnto ca el tyntagyl made grete crye noyse cryed vnto harneis alle myghte bere armes thenne sought fond dede four cosyns kyng markes traytour magouns thenne kynge lete entyere chappel thenne kynge lete crye alle countrey helde hym goo vnto armes vnderstood werre must nedes whanne kynge marke herde vnderstood syre sadok sir dynas arysen countrey lyones remembryd wyles treason lo thus dyd lete make counterfete letter pope dyd make straung clerke bere vnto kyng mark whiche letter specyfyed kynge marke shold make hym redy vpon payne cursyng hoost come pope helpe goo iherusalem make warre vpon sarasyns whan clerk come meane kynge anone alle kyng marke sente letter vnto sire tristram badde hym saye thus wold goo werre vpon mescreauntes shold oute pryson haue alle power whanne sire tristram vnderstood letter thenne sayd thus clerke kynge marke euer hast thou ben traytour euer wylle clerke said sire tristram say thou thus vnto kynge marke syn appostle pope hath sente hym bydde hym goo thyder hym self telle hym traitour kynge wylle goo commaudement gete oute pryson may see wel rewarded true seruyse thenne clerke retorned vnto kynge marke told hym ansuer sire tristram wel sayd kynge marke yet shal begyled soo wente chamber counterfete letter letter specyfyed pope desyred sire tristram come hym self made werre vpon mescreauntes whan clerke come ageyne sir tristram tooke hym letter thenne sire tristram behelde letter anone aspyed kynge markes counterfetynge said syre tristram fals hast thow ben euer kynge marke soo wolt thou ende thenne clerke departed sire tristram came kynge marke ageyne thenne come four wounded knyghtes within castel tyntagil one neck nyghe broken tweyn another arme stryken awey thyrdde borne thurgh spere fourth eth stryken tweyn whanne came afore kynge marke cryed sayd kynge fleest thow alle countrey arysen clerely ageynst thenne kynge marke wrothe oute mesure meane whyle came countrey sire percyuale de galys seke sire tristram whan herd syre tristram pryson syr percyual made clerely delyueraunce sir tristram knyghtly meanes whan soo delyuerd made grete ioye syre percyuale soo echone syr tristram sayd vnto sire percyuale ye wille abyde march wylle ryde yow nay said percyuale countrey maye tary muste nedes walys psoo syre percyuale departed sire tristram rode streyghte vnto kynge marke told hym delyuerd syre tristram also told kyng done hym self grete shame putte sir tristram pryson knyght moost renomme world lyuynge wete thow wel noblest knyghtes worlde loue syr tristram yf wille make werre vpon yow ye maye abyde hit trouthe said kynge marke may loue sire tristram cause loueth quene wyf la beale isoud fy shame said syr percyuole say ye neuer ye vnkel vnto sir tristram neuewe ye shold neuer thynke soo noble knyghte sire tristram wold doo hym self soo grete vylony holde vnkels wyf said syr percyuale may loue quene synles cause called one fayrest ladyes world thenne syr percyuale departed kynge marke soo whan departed kyng mark bethought hym treson withstadyng kyng mark graunted syre percyuale neuer manere meanes hurte sire tristram soo anone kynge marke sente vnto syre dynas seneschal shold putte doune alle peple reysed sente hym othe wold goo hym self vnto pope rome warre vpon mescreauntes fayrer werre thus areyse peple ageynst youre kynge whanne sir dynas vnderstood kynge marke wold goo vpon mescreauntes thenne sire dynas alle hast putte doune alle peple whan peple departed euery man home thene kyng mark aspyed sire tristram la beale isoud treason kynge marke lete take hym put hym pryson contrary promyse made vnto syre percyuale whan quene isoud vnderstood syr tristram pryson made grete sorowe euer made lady gentylwoman thenne sire tristram sent letter vnto la beale isoud praid good lady yf hit pleased make vessel redy hym wold goo vnto reame logrys land pwhanne la beale isoud vnderstood syre tristram letter entent sente hym another badde hym good comforte wold doo make vessel redy alle thynge purpos pthenne la beale isoud sente vnto syre dynas sadok prayd hem ony wyse take kynge marke put hym pryson vnto tyme syre tristram departed vnto royamme logrys whan sir dynas seneschall vnderstood treason kynge marke promysed ageyne sente word kynge marke shold put pryson deuysed hit soo done thenne syre tristram delyuerd oute pryson anone alle haste quene isoud syr tristram went took counceyll wold haue whan departed pcapitulum lij thenne la beale isoud sire tristram took vessel came water land land four dayes came crye iustes turnement kynge arthur lete make whanne sire tristram herd telle turnement desguysed hym self la beale isoud rode vnto turnement whan came sawe many knyghtes iuste turneye syr tristram dressid hym raunge make short conclusion ouerthrewe fourten knyghtes round table whanne sir launcelot sawe knyghtes thus ouerthrowen sire launcelot dressid hym sir tristram sawe la beale isoud sire launcelot come felde pthenne la beale isoud sente vnto sire launcelot rynge badde hym wete sir tristram de lyones whanne sir launcelot vnderstood syre tristram ful gladde wold iuste thene sire launcelot aspyed whyder syre tristram yede hym rode thenne eyther made grete ioye soo sire launcelot broughte sire tristram la beale isoud vnto ioyous gard owne castel wonne owne handes sire launcelot put welde owne wete ye wel castel garnysshed furnysshed kynge quene royal haue soiourned syre launcelot charged alle people honoure loue wold doo hym self psoo sire launcelot departed vnto kynge arthur thenne told quene gueneuer iusted soo wel atte last turnement sire tristram told hadde hym la beale isoud maulgre kynge marke soo quene gueneuer told alle vnto kynge arthur pwhanne kynge arthur wyste sire tristram escaped comen kynge marke bad broughte la beale isoud hym thenne passynge gladde use sire tristram kynge arthur lete make crye may day shold iustes castel lonazep castel fast ioyous gard thus arthur deuysed alle knyghtes land cornewaile northwalys shold iuste ageynste alle countreyes irland scotland remenaunt walys countrey gore surluse lystynoyse northumberland alle helde landes arthur half see whanne crye made many knyghtes gladde many vngladde p syre said lau celot vnto arthur crye ye haue made ye wyll put v ben aboute yow grete ieopardy many knyghtes haue grete enuye v therfore shal mete daye iustes wille hard skyfte amonge v said arthur care shal preue shal best handes soo whan sir launcelot vnderstode wherfore kynge arthur made iustyng thene made suche purueaunce la beale isoud shold behold iustes secrete place honest estate pnow torne vnto sire tristram la beale isoud maade grete ioye dayly gyders alle manere myrthes coud deuyse euery day sir tristram wold goo ryde huntyng sire tristram tyme called best chacer world noblest blower horne alle manere mesures bookes reporte syre tristram came alle good termes venery hu tynge alle syses mesures blowynge horne hym fyrste alle termes haukyng whiche beestes chace beestes venery whiche vermyns alle blastes longen maner gamen fyrste vncoupelynge sekynge rechate flyghte dethe strake many blastes termes maner gentylmen haue cause worldes ende preyse sir tristram praye soule pcapitulum liij soo daye la beale isoud sayd vnto sir tristram merueyle moche said ye remembre self ye straunge countrey many peryllous knyghtes wel ye wote kyng marke ful treason ye wylle ryde thus chace hunte vnarmed ye myghte destroyed p fayr lady loue crye mercy wille doo soo soo thenne sire tristram rode dayly huntynge armed hi men berynge shelde spere soo day lytyl afore monethe may syre tristram chaced hert passynge egerly soo herte passed fayr welle thenne sir tristram alyghte putte helme drynke burbley water ryght soo herd sawe questynge beest come welle whan syre tristram sawe beste putte helme demed shold sir palomydes beste quest pryght sir tristram sawe came knyghte armed vpon noble courser salewed hym spake many thynges thys knyghtes name breuse saunce pyte ryght alle came vnto noble knyghte sire palomydes eyther sal wed spake fair fair knyghtes said sir palomydes canne telle yow tydynges said tho knyghtes syrs wete ye wel kynge marke put pryson owne knyghtes alle loue sire tristram kynge marke hadde put syre tristram twyes pryson one sire percyuale delyuerd noble knyghte sire tristram oute pryson pand laste tyme quene la beale isoud delyuerd hym wente cleryly aweye hym reame alle whyle kynge marke fals traytour pryson trouthe said palomydes thenne shall hastely sire tristram say loue la beale isoud peramours dare make good doo hath seruyse aboue alle ladyes shalle haue terme lyf ryght soo stood talkynge sawe afore came knyghte alle armed grete hors one men bare sheld speres anone knyght aspyed gatte shelde spere dressid hym iuste pfair felawes said sire tristram yonder knyghte wil iuste v lete see whiche v shalle encountre hym see wel courte kynge arthur pit shalle longe mette alle said sire palomydes fonde neuer noo knyght queste glastynge beest wold iuste neuer refused hym pa wel may said breuse saunce pyte folowe beest ye thenne shalle ye doo bataille said palomydes soo syre palomydes dressid hym vnto knyghte syre bleoberys ful noble knyghte nyghe kynne vnto sire launcelot soo mette soo hard syre palomydes felle erthe hors alle thenne sir bleoberis cryed lowde said thus make redy thou fals traytour knyghte breuse saun e pyte wete thow certaynly wille haue adoo vtteraunce noble knyghtes ladyes thou hast falsly bitraid pwhanne false knyght traitour breuse saunce pyte herde hym saye soo took hors brydel fledde waye faste euer hors myghte renne sore hym aferd p whan syr bleoberys sawe hym flee folowed faste thorugh thycke thorugh thynne fortune sir breuse fledde sawe euen afore hym thre knyghtes table round whiche tho one hyghte sire ector de mary hyghte syre percyuale de galys thyrdde hyghte sir harre de fyse lake good knyght hardy syr percyuale called tyme tyme one best knyghtes world best assured breuse sawe knyghtes rode streyghte vnto cryed vnto prayd re owes nede haue ye said sire ector fayr knyghtes saide syre breuse foloweth moost traytour knyght moost coward moost vylony name breuse saunce pyte yf may gete wylle slee withoute mercy pyte abyde v said sir percyuale shalle waraunt yow thenne ware syre bleoberys came rydynge alle myghte thenne sir ector put hym self forth iuste afore alle sire bleoberis sawe four knyghtes hym self stode doubte whether wold torne hold waye thenne said hym self knyght table round rather shold shame myn othe blood wille hold way soo euer falle therof thenne sire ector dressid spere smote either passynge sore sire ector felle erthe sawe sir percyuale dressid hors toward hym myghte dryue sir percyuale suche stroke hors man felle erth pwhanne sir harre sawe bothe erthe thenne said hym self neuer breuse suche prowesse soo sire harre dressid hors mette gyders soo strongly bothe horse knyghtes felle erthe sire bleoberis hors beganne recouer ageyne sawe sire breuse came hurtlyng smote hym ouer ouer wolde haue slayne hym lay ground thenne syr harre le fys lake arose lyghtely toke brydel sir breuse hors said pfy shame stryke neuer knyght erthe knyght may called shameful knyghte dedes yet men may see lyeth groud hath done worshipfully putte werse passynge good knyghtes therfore wylle lete saide sire breuse thow shalte chese said syr harre tyme thenne whanne sir bruse sawe myghte chese haue wylle spak fayre thenne syre harre lete hym goo thenne anone made hors renne ouer syre bleoberys rasshed hym erthe lyke yf wold haue slayne hym whanne syre harre sawe hym doo vyloynsly cryed traytour knyyt leue shame sir harre wold haue taken hors fyghte sir breuse thenne sir breuse ranne vpon hym half vpon hors smote hym doune hors man erthe nere slayne syr harre good knyght sawe sire percyuale thenne cryed traitour knyghte dost thou whan sire percyuale vpon hors syr breuse tooke hors fledde euer myght syre percyuale syre harre folowed hym fast euer lenger chaced ferther behynde thenne torned ageyne came syr ector de mary syre bleoberys fayr knyghtes said bleoberys haue ye socoured fals knyght traitour said sire harre knyght wel wote hit fals knyght said sir harre coward felonous knyght syr sayd bleoberys moost coward knyghte deuourer ladyes destroyer good knyghtes specyally arthur name saide sir ector name syr bleoberys de ganys allas fair cosyn sayde ector forgyue sir ector de mary thenne syre percyuale sire harre made grete ioye met bleoberys alle w heuy syr breuse escaped wherof made grete dole p capitulum liiij ryght soo stood thus came sir palomydes whanne sawe shelde bleoberys lye erthe pthenne said palomydes oweth sheld lete hym dresse hym smote doune fast fontayne therfore wylle fyghte hym foote redy said bleoberys ansuer wete thow wel syr knyyt name bleoberys de ganys wel arte thou met saide palomydes wete thow wel name palomydes sarasyn eyther hated dethe psyre palomydes sayd ector thow wel neyther thow none knyght bereth lyf sleeth ony oure blood shalle dye hit therfor thow lyste fyghte goo seche sire laucelot sir tristram shalle ye fynde matche hem haue mette said palomydes neuer worship neuer maner knyghte said sire ector euer matched yow yes sayd palomydes thyrdde good knyght ony age best euer fond myghte haue lyued tyl ben hardyer man lyueth knyghte suche name syre lamorak de galys iusted turnement ouerthrewe xxx knyghtes moo wanne degree departynge mette hym syre gawayne bretheren grete payne slewe hym felonsly vnto alle good knyghtes grete domage anone sir percyuale herd broder dede syr lamorak felle ouer hors mane swounynge made grettest dole euer maade knyghte pand whan syr percyuale aroos said allas good noble broder syre lamorak shalle neuer mete trowe alle wyde world man maye fynde suche knyght age hit moche suffre dethe fader kynge pellenore dethe good broder sir lamorak thenne meane wyhle came varlet court kyng arthur told grete turnement shold lonazep landes cornewail northgalys shold ageynst alle wold come pcapitulum lv torne vnto sir tristram rode huntynge mette sire dynadan comen countrey seke syre tristram thenne sire dynadan told sire tristram name sire tristram wold telle hym name wherfore syr dynadan wrothe suche foolysshe knyghte ye said sire dynadan sawe late day lyenge welle fared slepte lay lyke foole grymmynge wold speke shelde lay hym hors stode hym wel wote louer fayr syr said syre tristram ye louer mary fy crafte said sir dynadan euylle said said sire tristram knyyt maye neuer prowesse yf louer wel said said sir dynadan telle name syth ye louer el shalle doo bataille yow said sir tristram hit reason fyghte telle yow name name shalle ye wete tyme fy shame said dynadan arte thow knyghte darste telle thy name therfore wil fyghte said sir tristram wylle aduysed wil doo batail yf lyst yf doo batail said sire tristram ye able withstande fy coward sayd syre dynadan thus houed styl sawe knyght came rydyng ageynst lo said sir tristram see cometh knyght rydynge wyll iuste anon sir dynadan beheld hym said doted knyyt sawe lye welle neither slepyng ne wakyng wel sayde sire tristram knowe knyght wel couerd shelde asure kynges sone northumberland name epynegrys grete louer knowe loueth kynges doughter walys ful fayre lady suppose said sire tristram ye requyre hym wille iuste yow thenne shalle ye preue whether louer better knyghte ye wylle loue lady wel said dynadan shalt thou see shall alle sire dynadan spake hyghe said sir knyghte make redy iuste custome erraut knyytes one iuste sir said epynegrys yt rule yow arraunt knyghtes make knyght iuste nyll sayd dynadan make redy al spored theyr horse mett gyders soo hard epynegrys smote doune sir dynadan thenne sir tristram rode sire dynadan sayd semeth louer hath wel spedde fy coward sayd syre dynadan yf thow good knyghte reuenge nay said syr tristram wylle iuste tyme take hors lete v goo hen god defende sayd syre dynadan thy felaushyp neuer sped wel syn mette soo departed wel sayd sir tristram peraduenture coude telle yow tydynges sir tristram god defende said dynadan thy felaushyp sir tristram mykel werse thy company thenne departed syre said sir tristram yet may happen shal mete place rode syr tristram vnto ioyous gard herd toune grete noyse crye noyse said sire tristram syre sayd knyght castel hath ben longe among v ryght slayne two knyghtes none cause oure knyghte sayd sir lau celot better knyght syre gawayne symple cause said sir tristram slee good knyght saye wel mayster lytel remedy v sayde men toune sire launcelot ben soone shold haue ben reuenged vpon fals knyghtes whan syre tristram herd saye soo sente shelde spere lyghtly within whyle ouertake badde torne amende mysdone amendes woldest thow haue sayd one knyghte therwith tooke theyr cours eyther mette hard syr tristram smote doune knyghte ouer hors tayle thenne knyght dressid hym syr tristram wyse serued knyghte pand thenne gate horse wel myghte dressyd sheldes swerdes bataile vtteraunce knyghtes said sire tristram ye shalle telle whens ye ar youre name suche men ye myyte ye shold hard escape handes ye myghte suche men suche countre alle euylle dedes ye shold passe quyte wete thow wel syre knyghte sayde feare telle oure name name syr agrauayne name gaherys bretheren vnto good knyghte sire gawayne neuewes vnto kyng arthur wel sayd sir tristram kynge arthur sake shalle lete yow passe att tyme hit shame said sire tristram sire gawayne ye comen soo grete blood ye foure bretheren soo named ye ye called grettest destroyer murtherers good knyghtes ben reame herde saye syr gawayne ye slewe amonge yow better knyght euer ye noble knyghte syre lamorak de galys hit hadde pleased god sayd syre tristram wold ben syre lamorak deth thenne sholdest thou haue gone way said sir gaherys fayre knyghte said syre tristram ther must haue ben many moo knyghtes ye alle sire tristram departed fro toward ioyous gard whanne departed took theyre horse one said wylle ouertake hym reuenged vpon hym despyte sire lamorak p capitulum lvj soo hadde ouertake sire tristram sir agrauayne badde hym torne traytour knyght euyll sayd said sir tristram ther pulled suerd smote syr agrauayne suche buffet vpon helme tombled doune hors swoune hadde greuous wounde thenne torned
