gaherys sire tristram smote swerd helme gyders suche myght gaherys felle oute sadel soo sir tristram rode vnto ioyous gard alyght vnarmed hym soo sire tristram told la beale isoud alle aduenture ye haue herd forne whan herd hym telle sire dynadan syr said made song kynge marke said sire tristram best bourder iaper noble knyghte handes best felawe knowe alle good knyghtes loue felauship allas syre said broughte ye hym yow haue ye care sayd syr tristram rydeth seke countre therfore wylle awey tyl haue met sire tristram told la beale isoud sir dynadan helde ageynste alle louers ryght came varlet told sir tristram come erraunt knyght toune suche colour vpon sheld syre dynadan said syre tristram wete ye ye shalle doo said sire tristram send ye hym lady isoud wylle sene ye shal meryest knyghte euer ye spak alle maddest talker praye yow hertely ye make hym good chere thenne anone la beale isoud sente toune prayd syr dynadan wold come castel repose hym lady good wylle sayd syre dynadan soo mounted vpon hors rode castel alyghte vnarmed brought castel anone la beale isoud came vnto hym eyther salewed thenne asked hym whens madame sayd dynadan courte kynge arthur knyyte table round name syre dynadan doo ye countrey sayd la beale isoud madame sayd seke syre tristram good knyght hit told countrey hit may wel said la beale isoud ware hym madame said dynadan merueylle sire tristram moo louers eyleth soo mad soo foted vpon wymmen said la beale isoud ye knyght louer shame ye may called good knyyte yf ye make quarel lady god defende sayd dynadan ioye loue short sorow therof cometh therof dureth ouer longe said la beale isoud say ye soo fast good knyght sire bleoberys foughte thre knyghtes one damoysels sake wanne afore kynge northumberland hit said sire dynadan knowe hym wel good knyyte noble comen noble blood alle ben noble knyghtes whome comen sire launcelot du lake pray yow said la beale isoud telle wylle ye fyghte loue thre knyghtes done grete wronge soo moche ye knyyt kyng arthur requyre yow doo batail thenne syr dynadan sayd shalle say yow ye fayr lady euer sawe ony moche fayrer lady quene gueneuer wete ye wel one word wylle fyghte yow wyth thre knyghtes ihesu defende thenne isoud lough good game hym soo alle chere myghte make hym lay alle nyght morn erly syr tristram armed hym la beale isoud gaf hym good helme thenne promysed wold mete syr dynadan two wold ryde gyders vnto lonazep turnement shold shal make redy yow ye shalle see turnement thenne departed sir tristram two squyers bare sheld speres grete longe pcapitulum lvij thenne syr dynadan departed rode way grete paas vntyl ouertake sir tristram syr dynadan ouertake hym knewe hym anone hated felauship hym aboue knyghtes said syre dynadan art thow coward knyght mette yesterday kepe thou shalte iuste maulgre thy hede wel said sire tristram bothe iuste soo lete theyr horse renne syr tristram myssid hym purpos sir dynadan brak spere vpon sire tristram syre dynadan dressid hym drawe swerd soo said sir tristram ye soo wrothe wille fyghte fy coward sayd dynadan thow shamest alle knyghtes said syre tristram care wille wayte vpon vnder protectyon cause ye good knyght ye may saue deuylle delyuer said syr dynadan thou arte goodely man armes thy persone euer sawe moost coward euer sawe wolt thow doo tho grete speres thou caryest shalle gyue said sir tristram somme good knyght whan come turnement yf soe yow doo best shalle gyue yow soo thus rode talkyng sawe came erraunt knyght afore dressyd hym iuste loo said syr tristram yonder one wylle iuste dresse hym shame betyde said sire dynadan nay soo said tristram knyght besemeth shrewe thenne shalle said syr dynadan soo dressid sheldes speres mette gyders soo hard knyght smote doun sir dynadan hys hors loo said sir tristram hit ben better ye lefte fy coward said sire dynadan thenne sir dynadan starte vp gat swerd hande profered batail foote whether loue wrathe saide knyghte lete v doo bataille loue said sir dynadan name said knyght pray yow telle wete ye wel name sir dynadan dynadan said knyght name gareth yongest broder vnto syre gawayne thenne eyther made grete chere gareth best knyghte alle tho bretheren preued good knyghte thenne took horse spak sir tristram suche coward euery word sir tristram herd lough scorne thenne ware came knyght afore wel horsed wel armed made hym redy iuste fair knyghtes said syr tristram loke betwixe yow shalle iuste yonder knyghte warne yow wille haue adoo hym thenne shall said syr gareth soo encountred gyders knyght smote doune sire gareth ouer hors croupe saide sire tristram vnto syre dynadan dresse reuenge good knyght gareth shall said sir dynadan hath stryken doune moche bygger knyghte said sire tristram sire dynadan see fele wel herte fayleth yow therfore shalle ye see shalle doo thenne sire tristram hurtled vnto knyghte smote hym quyte hors whanne sire dynadan sawe merueyled gretely thenne demed hit sire tristram thenne knyght foot pulled oute swerd doo bataille name said sire tristram wete ye wel sayde knyghte name syre palomydes knyghte hate ye moost said syr tristram syr knyeght said hate sir tristram dethe may mete hym one v shalle dye ye saye wel said sir tristram wete ye wel sire tristram de lyones doo werste whanne sire palomydes herd hym saye soo astonyed thenne said thus praye yow sir tristram forgyue alle myn euylle wylle yf lyue shal doo seruyse aboue alle knyghtes ben lyuynge haue owed yow euylle wylle sore repenteth wote eyleth semeth ye good knyghte none knyghte named hym self good knyghte shold hate yow therfor requyre yow syr tristram take displeasyr myn vnkynde wordes syr palomydes said sire tristram ye say wel wel wote ye good knyghte haue sene preued many grete enterpryses haue ye taken vpon yow wel encheued therfor said sire tristram ye haue ony euyll wille maye ye ryghte hit redy hand soo lord sire tristram wille doo yow knyghtly seruyse alle thynge ye wyl commaunde ryght soo take yow said syre tristram soo rode forthe theyr wayes talkyng many thynges lord sire tristram said dynadan foule haue ye mocked god knoweth cam coutrey sake aduyse lord sire launcelot yet wold sire launcelot telle certeynte shold fynde yow truly said sir tristram syre launcelot wiste wel abode within owne castel pcapitulum lviij thus rode vntyl ware castel lonazep thenne ware foure honderd tentys pauelions merueylous grete ordenaunce soo god helpe saide sire tristram yonder see grettest ordenaunce euer sawe syre said palomydes semeth grete ordenaunce att castel maydens vpon roche ye wanne pryce sawe self ye foriusted thyrtty knyghtes psyr sayd dynadan surluse turnement galahalt longe iles maade whiche dured seuen dayes grete gadrynge many nacyons best said sire tristram sire sir launcelot du lake noble knyghte sire lamorak de galys sir launcelot wanne degree doubte said sir tristram wanne degree ben ouermatched many knyghtes dethe sire lamorak sayd syre tristram hit ouer grete pyte dare say clenest myyted man best wynded age lyue knewe hym byggest knyght euer mette yf hit sire launcelot allas said sire tristram ful woo deth yf cosyns lord arthur slewe hym shold dye hit tho consentyng dethe suche thynges said sire tristram feare drawe vnto courte lord arthur wylle ye wete hit said sire tristram vnto gare h syre blame yow said gareth wel vnderstande vengeaunce bretheren sire gawayne agrauayne gaherys mordred said sire gareth medle mater therfore none loueth vnderstande murtherers good knyghtes lefte theyre company god wold ben sayd gareth whanne noble knyghte syre lamorak slayne ihesu help said sir tristram wel said leuer al gold betwixe rome ben ye wy said palomydes soo wold ben yet neuer degree iustes turnement put werse foot horsbak day slayne dyd dedes armes euer sawe knyghte doo alle lyfe dayes p whan hym gyuen degree lord arthur syre gawayne thre bretheren agrauayne gaherys sire mordred sette vpon syre lamorack pryuy place slewe hors fought hym foote thre houres bothe biforne hym behynd hym sire mordred gaf hym dethes wound behynde hym bak alle hewe hym one squyers told sawe hit fy vpon treason said sir trystram hit kylleth herte tale doth myn said gareth bretheren myn shall neuer loue drawe felauship dede speke dedes said palomydes lete hym lyf ye maye gete ageyne pyte said dynadan sire gawayne bretheren excepte yow sire gareth haten alle good knyghtes round table party wel wote myght pryuely hate lord sire launcelot al kynne grete pryuy despyte haue hym lorde syre launcelot wel ware causeth hym haue good knyghtes kyn aboute hym pcapitulum lix syre said palomydez lete v leue matere lete v see shalle doo turnement myn aduyse said palomydes lete v foure holde gyders ageynste alle wyl come counceil said sire tristram see pauelions ther wil four honderd knyghtes doubte ye said sir tristram wil many good knyghtes man neuer soo valyaunt soo bygge yet may ouermatched soo haue sene knyghtes done many tymes whanne wend best haue wonne worship loste hit manhode worthe yf medled wysedome said sir trystram hit maye happen shalle kepe myn owne hede wel another soo thus rode vntyl came humber bank herd crye doleful noyse pthenne ware wynde came ryche vessel hylled ouer reed sylke vessel londed fast sire tristram alyghte knyghtes syre tristram wente afore entred vessel pand whanne came within sawe fayre bedde rychely couerd vpon laye dede semely knyghte armed sauf hede al bebledde dedely woundes vpon hym whiche semed passynge good knyghte phow may thys said sire tristram knyghte thus slayne thenne syre tristram ware letter dede knyytes hande maister maronners said sire tristram meaneth letter syre sayd letter ye shalle knowe hou slayne cause name sire said maronners wete ye wel man shall take letter rede hit yf good knyghte wille feythfully promyse reuenge dethe el shal knyghte see letter open wete ye wel said sir tristram somme v may reuenge dethe wel yf hit soo ye maronners saye dethe shalle reuenged sire tristram took letter oute knyghtes hande hit sayd thus harmaunce kynge lord reed cyte send vnto alle knyghtes erraunt recommaundynge vnto yow noble knyghtes arthur courte byseche alle amonge fynde one knyghte wylle fyghte sake two bretheren brought vp nought felonsly traytourly haue slayne wherfore byseche one good knyghte reuenge deth reuenged dethe wille haue rede cyte alle castels syre said maronners wete ye wel kynge knyghte lyeth ful worshipful man ful grete prowesse ful wel loued alle maner knyghtes errauntes soo god help said sire tristram pyteous caas ful fayne wold take enterpryse vpon haue made suche promyse nedes muste grete turnement el shamed wel wote sake especyal lord arthur lete make iustes turnement countrey well wote many worshipful people wylle att turnement see therfor fere take enterpryse vpon shal come ageyne tyme iustys syr said palomydes pray yow gyue enterpryse ye shall see encheue worshipfully outher el shal dye quarel wel said sire tristram enterpryce gyue yow ye turnement shalle day seuen nyght syre said palomydes promyse yow shalle yow day yf vnslayne vnmaymed pcapitulum lx thenne departed sire tristram gareth sir dynadan lefte sire palomydes vessel sir tristram behelde maronners sayled ouer longe humber whan sir palomydes oute theyre syghte toke theyr horse beheld aboute thenne ware knyght came rydyng ageynst vnarmed nothynge aboute hym swerd whan knyghte came nyghe salewed hym ageyne faire knyghtes sayd knyght praye yow soo moche ye knyghtes erraunt ye wille come see castel take suche ye fynde praye yow hertely soo rode hym vntyl castel brought halle wel apparailled soo vnarmed sette bord whan knyghte sawe sire tristram anone knewe hym thenne knyght waxed pale wroth sir tristram whan sire tristram sawe hoost make suche chere merueylled said syre myn hoost chere make yow wete thou wel said fare werse knowe sir tristram de lyones thou slewest broder therfore gyue somons wille flee euer maye gete large syr knyght said sir tristram neuer aduysed euer slewe ony broder yf ye say dyd wille make amendys vnto power wyll none amendys said knyyt kepe whan dyned sir tristram asked armes departed rode wayes within whyle sir dynadan sawe cam knyyt wel armed wel horsed without shelde syre tristram said sir dynadan take kepe self dar vndertake yonder cometh hoost haue ado lete hym come said sir tristram shall abyde hym wel may anone knyghte whanne came nyghe sir tristram cryed bad hym abyde kepe hym hurtled gyders sir tristram smote knyght sore bare hym ouer hors croupe knyght arose lyghtely took hors ageyne soo rode fyersly sir tristram smote hym twyes hard vpon helme sir knyyte said sir tristram pray yow leue smyte wold lothe dele yow myyt chese haue mete drynke within body al wold leue thene sir tristram gaf hym suche buffet vpon helme felle vp soo doune fro hors blood brast oute ventayls helme soo lay styll lykely dede thenne sire tristram said repenteth buffet smote sore suppose dede soo lefte hym rode wayes pso ryden whyle sawe rydyng ayenst two ful lykely knyghtes wel armed wel horsed goodly seruauntes aboute one berrannt le apres called kynge honderd knyytes sir segwarydes whiche renomed two noble knyghtes cam eyther kynge loked vpon sir dynadan tyme syre tristram helme vpon sholder whiche helme kynge sene fore quene northgalys quene kynge loued peramour helme quene north galys gyuen la beale isoud quene la beale isoud gaf sir tristram syr knyghte sayd berraunt ye helme wold ye said sire dynadan wylle haue adoo said kynge loue owed helme therfore kepe yow soo departed came gyders alle myghtes theyr horse kyng honderd knyghtes smote sire dynadan hors alle erthe thene commaunded seruaunt goo take thou helme kepe hit soo varlet wente vnbockel helme helme wolt thou doo said sir tristram leue helme entente sayd kynge wille ye sire knyght medle helme wete yow wel said sir tristram helme shalle departe derer boughte thenne make redy said sir beraunce vnto syre tristram soo hurtled gyders syr tristram smote hym doun ouer hors tayle thenne kynge arose lyghtely gatte hors lyghtely ageyne thenne strake fyersly att syre tristram many grete stroke thenne syre tristram gaf sir beraunce suche buffet vpon helme fell doune ouer hors sore stonyed loo said dynadan helme vnhappy v tweyne falle hit sir kynge haue ye another fake pthenne segwarydes asked shal iuste praye said syre gareth vnto dynadan lete haue iustes syr said dynadan pray yow take reason said tristra iustes shold p att word said dynadan wille therof p thenne gareth dressid hym syre segwarides syre segwarides smote gareth hors erthe pnow sayd syr tristram dynadan iuste yonder knyghte wil therof said dynadan thenne wille said syr tristram thenne syr tristram ranne hym gaf hym falle soo lefte foote syre tristram rode vnto ioyous gard sir gareth wold curtosy haue gone castel syre tristram wold suffre hym departe soo alyghte vnarmed hadde grete chere whan dynadan came afore la beale isoud cursed tyme euer bare syr tristram helme tolde syre tristram mocked hym thenne laughyng iapynge syr dynadan wiste doo hym p capitulum lxj wille leue mery within ioyous gard speke syr palomydes thene sir palomydes sailled euen longes huber costes see fair castel tyme hit erly mornynge afore daye thenne maronners wente vnto sire palomydes slepte fast syre knyghte saide maronners ye muste aryse castel ye muste goo assente sayd sire palomydes alle aryued thenne blewe horne maronners yeuen hym whanne within castel herd horne put forthe many knyghtes stode vpon walles said one voys welcome ye castel thenne waxed clere day sire palomydes entred castel within whyle serued many dyuerse mete thenne sire palomyders herd aboute hym moche wepynge grete dole may meane said sir palomydes loue suche sorou fayne wold knowe meaneth thenne came afore hym one who name sir ebel said thus wete ye wel sir knyghte dole sorowe made euery daye pand cause kynge hyght hermaunce kynge ed cyte kyng lord noble knyght large lyberal expense world loued thynge soo moche dyd erraunt knyytes kynge arthur courte alle iustynge huntynge al maner knyytly game kynde kynge knyghte neuer rule poure peple cause goodenes gentylnesse bemone hym euer shalle alle kynges estate may beware oure lord destroyed owne defaute cherisshed blood hadde yet lyued grete rychesse reste alle estate may beware kynge allas sayd ebel shalle gyue alle warnynge dethe ptelle said palomydes manere youre lord slayne whome syr said sir ebel oure kyng brought vp child two men peryllous knyghtes two knyghtes oure kynge soo cherete loued man trusted man blood none aboute hym two knyghtes oure kyng gouerned soo ruled hym peasybly landes neuer wolde suffre none blood haue rule oure kynge also soo free soo gentyl fals deceyuable ruled hym peasybly aspyed lordes kynges blood departed hym vnto owne lyuelode thenne whan two traytours vnderstoode dryuen alle lordes blood hym pleased rule thenne thoughte haue euer hit old sawe gyue chorle rule wylle suffysed someuer ruled vylayne born lord soyle gentilman born vylayne shalle destroye alle gentylmen aboute hym therfor al estate lordes beware whome ye take aboute yow yf ye knyght kyng arthur courte remembre tale ende conclusion lord kyng rode vnto forest aduyse traytours chaced reed dere armed alle pye e ful lyke good knyght soo labour waxed drye thenne alyghte dranke welle whan lyghte assente two traytours one hyght helyus sodenly smote kynge thurgh body spere soo lefte hym whan departed thenne fortune came welle fond lord kyng wounded dethe whan herd complaynte lete brynge hym water syde shyp put hym lyue whan lord kynge hermaunce vessel requyred true feyth owed vnto hym wryte letter maner pcapitulum lxij recommaundynge vnto kyng arthur al knyytes erraut bisechyng al moche kyng hermauce kyng reed cyte thus slayn felony treason thury two knyghtes myn myn bryngyng vp myn owne makyng som worshipful knyyt wil reuenge deth moche haue ben euer power wel willyng vnto arthur court wil aduenture lyf two traitours sake one batail kyng hermauce kyng rede cyte frely gyue hym landes rente euer welded lyf letter said ebel wrote lordes commaundement thenne receyued creatoure whan dede commanded euer cold put letter fast hand thenne commaunded putte forthe vessel doune humber shold gyue maronners commaundement neuer stynte vntyl came vnto logris noble knyghtes shall assemble tyme shalle somme good knyghte haue pyte reuenge dethe neuer kynge lord falslyer ne traitourlyer slayne dethe p thus complaynte kyng hermauce said sir ebel ye knowe alle lord bitrayed requyre goddes sake haue pyte vpon dethe worshipfully reuenge dethe thenne may ye weld alle thise landes alle wete wel ye may slee two traytours reed cyte alle tho ben therin take lord truly said sire palomydes hit greueth herte telle doleful tale saye trouthe sawe letter ye speke one best knyghtes erthe redde letter commaundement cam hydder reuenge kynges deth therfor haue done lete wete shall fynde tho traitours shal neuer ease herte tyl handes p syr said sire ebel thenne take ship ageyne shyp must brynge vnto delectable yle fast reed cyte castel shalle pray yow abyde ageyne comynge castel ye spede wel must nedes oure kyng harmaunce lete make castel loue two traytours kepte stronge hande therfore ful sore threted p wote ye ye shal said sir palomydes somme euer come loke ye kepe wel castel mysfortune soo slayn quest sure wil come one best knyghtes world reuenge deth sir tristram de lyones el sir launcelot du lake pthenne sir palomydes departed castel cam nyghe cyte cam shyp goodly knyyt armed ageynst hym shelde sholder hand vpon swerd anone came nyghe sir palomydes said sir knyghte seke ye leue queste myn myn euer therfor wille haue hit syr knyght said palomydes may wel quest myn letter take oute dede kynges hand tyme lykelyhode knyght vndertake reuenge deth kynge soo tyme promysed reuenge dethe soo shalle el ashamed ye say wel sayd knyghte wete ye wel thenne wille fyyte yow better knyghte v bothe lete hym take bataille vpon hand assente said sire palomydes thenne dressid sheldes pulled swerdes lasshed gyder many sadde stroke men myghte fyytyng houre last sir palomydes waxed bygge better wynded soo thenne smote knyght suche stroke made hym knele vpon knee thenne knyghte spak hyghe sayd gentyll knyght hold thy hand syr palomydes goodely drewe hand thenne knyght sayd wete ye wel knyyt thou arte better worthy haue bataille requyre knygthode telle thy name syr name palomydes knyghte kynge arthur table round hyder came reuenge dethe dede kynge p capitulum lxiij wel ye fond said knygyte palomydes alle knyghtes ben lyue excepte thre leuest haue yow fyrste sire launcelot du lake sir tristram de lyones thyrd nyy cosyn syr lamorck de galys broder vnto kynge harmaunce dede name sir hermynde ye saye wel said sir palomydes ye shal see shal spede yf slayn goo ye lord sir laucelot el lord sir tristram pray reuenge deth sir lamorak hym shal ye neuer see world allas said sir hermynde may slayne said sire palomydes sire gawayne bretheren soo god helpe said hermynd one one slewe hym trouthe said sire palomydes four daungerous knyghtes slewe hym syr gawayne syr grauayne sire gaherys sire mordred sire gareth fyfthe broder awey best knyght alle soo syre palomydes told hermynde alle manere slewe sir lamorak treason sir palomydes took ship aryued vp delectable yle meane whyle syr hermynde kynges broder arryued vp att reed cyte told comen knyghte kynge arthur auenge kynge hermaunce dethe name sire palomydes good knyght moost party foloweth best glatysaunt thenne alle cyte made grete ioye mykel herd sire palomydes noble prowesse soo lete ordeyne messager sente vnto ij bretheren make redy knyght comen wold fyghte bothe soo messager wente vnto castel besyde told knyght comen kynge arthur courte fyghte bothe one welcome said telle v pray yow yf hit sire launcelot ony blood none blood said messager thenne care lesse said two bretheren none blood sire launcelot kepe haue doo alle wete ye wel said messager name sire palomydes yet vncrystened noble knyght well said vncrystened shalle neuer crystend soo apoynted cyte within two dayes whanne sire palomydes come cyte made passynge grete ioye hym thenne beheld hym sawe wel made clenely byggely vnmaymed lymmes neyther yonge old soo alle peple preysed hym though crystened yet byleued best maner fulfeythful true promyse wel condycyoned cause made auowe wold neuer crystened vnto encheued beste glatysaunt whiche ful wonderful beest grete sygnyfycacyon merlyn profecyed moche beest also sire palomydes auowed neuer take ful crystendome vnto tyme done seuen batails within lystys within thyrd day came cyte two bretheren one hyght helyus hyyt helake whiche men grete prowesse hit fals ful treason poure men borne yet noble bnyytes handes hem brought fourty knyghtes entent shold bygge ynough reed cyte thus came two bretheren grete bo aunce pryde put reed cyte fere dammage thenne broughte lystes sire palomydes came place sayd thus ye two bretheren helyus helake slewe kynge lord syr hermaunce felony treason whome comen hyder reuenge dethe wete thow wel said sir helyus sir helake ar knyghtes slewe kyng harmaunce wete thow wel sire palomydes sarasyn shalle handle thou departe thou shalt wysshe thou werest crystened hit maye wel said sir palomydes yet wold dye crystened yet soo aferd yow truste god shal dye better crysten man ony yow doubte ye said sir palomydes eyther ye shalle lefte dede place p capitulum lxiiij thene departed two bretheren came ayenst sir palomydes ageynst fast horse myght renne fortune sir palomydes smote helake thorou shelde thurgh brest fadom alle whyle sir helyus helde vp spere pryde orgulyte wold smyte sire palomydes wyth spere whan sawe broder lye erth fawe myyt el e hym self thene said vnto sir palomydes helpe thy self came hurtlynge vnto sir palomydes spere smote hym quyte sadel thenne sire helyus rode ouer sir palomydes twyes thryes sir palomydes ashamed gat hors sir helyus brydel therwith al hors areryd sir palomydes halp felle erthe anone sir helyus starte vp lyghtely smote sir palomydes grete stroke vpon helme kneled vpon owne knee thenne lasshed gyder many sad stroke tracyd trauercyd bakward sydelyng hurtlyng gyders lyke two lore tyme felle grouelyng erthe thus fought styll withoute ony reposynge two houres neuer brethed thene sir palomydes waxed faynt wery sir helyus waxed passyng strong doubled stroke drofe sir palomydes ouerthwart endlonge alle feld cyte whan sawe sir palomydes caas wept cryed made grete dole party made grete joye allas said men cyte noble knyght shold thus slayne kynges sake thus wepyng cryeng sir palomydes suffred honderd stroke wonder stode foot last sire palomydes beheld myght comen peple wepte hym thenne said hym self fy shame syr palomydes hangest thou thy hede soo lowe bare vp sheld loked sir helyus vysage smote hym grete stroke vpon helme another another thenne smote sir helyus suche myghte felle erthe grouelynge thenne rassyd helme hede smote hym suche buffet departed hede body thenne peple cyte ioyefullest peple myght soo brought hym lodgynge grete solempnyte alle peple became men thenne sire palomydes prayd take kepe vnto alle lordship kynge hermaunce fair sir wete ye wel maye tyme abyde yow muste alle haste lord kyng arthur castel lonazep whiche haue promysed thenne peple ful heuy departynge alle cyte profered sir palomydes thyrd parte goodes soo wold abyde hem wyse tyme wold abyde soo sire palomydes departed soo came vnto castel sire ebel lieutenaunt whanne castel wyste hou sire palomydes sped ioyeful meyny soo sir palomydes departed came castell lonazep whanne wy sire tristram took way ouer humber came vnto ioyous gard sir tristram la beale isoud syr tristram commaunded knyght erraunt came within ioyous gard toune shold warne sire tristram soo came man toune told sire tristram knyghte toune passynge goodely man manere man said sire tristram sygne bereth soo man told sire tristram alle token hym palomydes said dynadan maye wel said sir tristram go ye hym said sire tristram vnto dynadan soo dynadan wente vnto sire palomydes eyther made grete ioye soo laye gyder nyghte morne erly came sire tristram sire gareth took theyr beddes soo arose brake fast pcapitulum lxv thenne sire tristram desyred sire palomydes ryde feldes woodes accorded repose foreste whanne hadde played grete whyle rode vnto fayre welle anone ware armed knyght came rydyng ageynste eyther salewed thenne armed knyghte spak sire tristram asked knyghtes lodged ioyous gard wote ar said sir tristram knyytes ye said knyyte semeth ye knyghtes erra nt cause ye ryde vnarmed whether knyghtes lyste telle oure name wilt thou telle thy name said knyght thenne kepe thou shalt dye handes therewith gate spere handes wold haue ronne sir tristram thurgh sawe sir palomydes smote hors trauerse myddes syde man hors felle erthe ther sire palomydes alyghte pulled swerd haue slayne hym lete said sir tristram slee hym knyght foole shame slee hym take awey spere said sire tristram lete hym take hors goo wille soo whan knyghte arose groned sore falle soo took hors whan vp torned thenne hors requyred sir tristram sir palomydes telle hym knyghtes wete ye wel said sir tristram name sir tristram de lyones knyghtes name sir palomydes wyste took hors spore cause shold aske hym name rode fast awey thurgh thyck thynne thenne came knyghte bented sheld asure who name epynogrys cam toward grete wallop whether ye rydynge said sir tristram fayre lordes said epynogrys folowe falsest knyght bereth lyf wherfor requyre yow telle whether ye sawe hym bereth shelde caas reed ouer god help said tristram suche knyyt departed v quarter houre agon pray yow telle v name allas said epynogrys lete ye hym escape yow soo grete fo vnto al erraunt knyghtes name breuse saunce pyte fy shame said sire palomydes allas euer escaped myne handes man world hate moost thenne euery knyghte made grete sorowe epynogrys departed folowed chace hym thenne sir tristram thre felawes rode vnto ioyous gard sir tristram talked vnto sire palomydes batail hou sped atte reed cyte ye haue herd afore hit ended truly said sir tristram gladde ye haue wel sped ye haue done worshipfully wel said sir tristram must forward meen thenne deuysed shold syr tristram deuysed sende two pauelions sette fast welle lonazep therin shalle quene la beale isoud hit wel said said sir dynadan sire palomydes herd herte rauysshed oute mesure withstandynge sayd lytel soo c ioyous gard sire palomydes wold haue gone castel sire tristram took hym fynger ladde hym castel whanne sire palomydes sawe la beale isoud rauysshed myghte vnneth speke soo wente vnto mete palomydes myghte ete alle chere myght hadde morn apparaylled ryde toward lonazep psoo sir tristram thre squyers la beale isoud thre gentylwymmen bothe quene rychely apparailled peple none varlet bere sheldes speres p thus rode forthe rode sawe afore route knyghtes hit knyght galyhodyn xx knyghtes hym fair felawes said galyhodyn yonder comen foure knyghtes ryche wel fayre lady wylle take lady fro best counceil said one galyhodyns men sende ye wete wille saye soo hit done came squyer vnto sire tristram asked whether wold iuste el lese lady soo said sire tristram telle lord byd hym come many ben wynne take syre said palomydes hit please lete haue dede shalle vndertake foure wyll ye haue said sire tristram pleasyr goo telle lord galyhodyn knyghte wylle encountre hym felawes p capitulum lxvj thenne squyer departed told galyhodyn thenne dressid shelde put forthe spere sir palomydes another sire palomydes smote galyhodyn soo hard smote bothe hors man erthe horryble falle thenne came ther knyght wyse serued hym soo scrued thyrd fourthe smote ouer horse croupe alweyes sire palomydes spere hole thenne came sixe knyghtes moo galyhodyns men wold haue ben auenged vpon sire palomydes lete sayd sir galyhodyn soo hardy none yow alle medle knyght man grete bounte honoure yf wold ye able medle hym ryghte soo helde styll euer sire palomydes redy iuste whan sawe wold rode vnto sire tristram ryght wel haue ye done said sir tristram worshypfully haue ye done good knyghte shold galyhodyn nyghe cosyn vnto galahalt haute prynce galyhodyn kynge within countrey surluse soo sir tristram syr palomydes la beale isoud rode gyders sawe afore four knyghtes euery man spere hand fyrst sire gawayne second sir vwayne thyrd sir sagramor ledesyrus fourthe dodynas le saueage whan sir palomydes beheld four knyytes redy iuste praid sir tristram gyue hym leue haue adoo also lo ge myghte holde hym horsbak yf le smyten doune pray yow reuenge wel said sire tristram wille ye wille ye soo fayne haue worship wold fayne encreace worship sir gawayne put forth spere sir palomydes another cam egerly gyders sir palomydes smote sire gawayne erthe hors alle wyfe serued vwayne sir dodynas sagramore alle four knyytes sir palomydes smote doun dyuers speres thenne sire tristram departed toward lonezep whanne departed thenne came thydder galyhodyn x knyytes vnto sir gawayne ther told hym alle sped merueyle said sire gawayne knyghtes ben ar arayed grene knyyt vpon whyte hors smote doun said galihodyn iij felaws dyd said gawayn wel wote said sire gawayne outher vpon whyte hors sire tristram el sire palomydes gay bysene lady quene isoud thus talked one thynge meane whyle sir tristram passed tyl came welle two pauelions sette alyghted fawe many pauelions grete araye thenne sire tristram lefte sire palomydes sire gareth la beale isoud sir tristram syre dynadan rode lonezep herken tydynges sire tristram rode vpon sire palomydes whyte hors whanne came castel sir dynadan herd grete horne blowe horne drewe many knyghtes thenne sire tristram asked knyght meaneth blast horne sir said knyght alle tho shalle holde ageynst kyng arthur turnement fyrste kynge irland kynge surluse kynge lystynoyse kyng northumberland kynge best parte walys many countreyes drawe counceylle vnderstande gouernaunce shalle kynge irland who name marhalt fader good knyghte sir marhaus sire tristram slewe alle speche sir tristram myghte said lordes felawes lete v loke self wete ye wel kynge arthur sure many good knyghtes el wold soo fewe knyghtes haue adoo v therfore counceyl late euery kynge haue standard cognoissaunce hym self euery knyghte drawe naturel lord thenne maye euery kyng capytayne helpe knyytes yf haue nede whan sir tristram herd counceyl rode vnto kynge arthur counceyl p capitulum lxvij bvt sir tristram soo soone come place sire gawayne sir galyhodyn wente kynge arthur told hym grene knyyte grene harneis whyte hors smote v two doune vj oure felawes day wel said arthur thenne called sir tristram asked hym name syre said sire tristram ye shalle holde excused att tyme ye shalle wete name sir tristram retorned rode way haue merueylle said arthur yonder knyght wille telle name goo thow gryflet le fyse de dieu praye hym speke betwixe v thenne sire gryflet rode hym ouertoke hym said hym kyng arthur praid hym fo speke hym secretely parte vpon couenaunt said sir tristram wille speke hym wille torne ageyne soo ye wille ensure desyre name shalle vndertake said sir gryflet wille gretely desyre hit soo rode gyders vntyl cam kyng arthur fair sir said kynge arthur cause ye wylle telle name syr said sir tristram withoute cause wille hyde name vpon party ye hold said kynge arthur truly lord said sir tristram wote yet party wille vntil come felde herte gyueth wille hold morowe ye shalle see preue party shall come al retorned wente pauelions vpon morne armed alle grene came felde yonge knyghtes beganne iuste dyd many worshipful dedes thenne spacke gareth vnto sire tristram praid hym gyue hym leue breke spere hym thoughte shame bere spere hole ageyne whan sir tristram herd hym say soo lough sayd pray yow doo best thenne sir gareth gate spere profered iuste sawe knyght neuewe vnto kynge honderd knyghtes name selyses good man armes soo knyght selyses thenne dressid hym vnto sir gareth two mette gyders soo hard eyther smote doune hors alle erthe brysed hurte lay tyl kyng honderd knyghtes halp selyses vp syr tristram sir palomydes halpe vp gareth ageyne rode sir gareth vnto pauelions thenne pulled helme whanne la beale isoud sawe sire gareth brysed face asked hym eyled hym madame said sire gareth grete buffet suppose gaf another none felawes god thanke wold rescowe forsothe said palomydes hit longed none v daye iuste haue day iusted preued knyghtes nede ye wold iuste whan party sawe ye prof red self iuste sonte one yow passynge good knyght age knowe hym wel name selyses worshipfully ye met hym neyther yow dishonoured therfor refresshe self ye may redy hole iuste morowe said gareth shalle fayle yow may bestryde myn hors pcapitulum lxviij vpon party said tristram hit best alle morne syr said palomydes ye shalle haue myn aduyse ageynst kynge arthur morne party wille syre launcelot many good knyghtes blood hym moo men worship worship shalle wynne full knyghtely spoken said sir tristram ryght soo ye counceile soo wille doo name god said soo myghte lodged best mo ne whan day arayed alle grene trap pours sheldes speres la beale isoud coloure thre damoysels ryghte soo four knyghtes came feld endlonge thurgh ledde la beale isoud thyder shold stande beholde iustes bay wyndowe al wayes wympeld man myyt see vysage thenne thre knyytes rode streyght vnto party kynge scottes whan kyng arthur sene hym doo asked sir lau celot knyytes quene sir said launcelot say certayn yf sir tristram countrey sir palomydes wete ye wel certeyn la beale isoud thenne arthur called hym syre kay said goo lyghtely wete many knyghtes ben lackynge table round seges thou maiste knowe soo wente syr kay sawe wrytynge eges lacked ten knyghtes ben name ben syr tristram syr palomydes syr percyuale syr gaherys syr epynogry syr mordred syre dynadan syr la cote male tayle syr pelleas noble knyyt wel said arthur somme dar vndertake ar thys day ageynst v thenne came therin two bretheren cosyns vnto syre gawayne one hyght syr edward hyyte syr sadok whiche two good knyghtes asked kynge arthur myght haue fyrst iustes orkeney pleased said kynge arthur thenne syr edward encountred kynge scottes who party syre tristram syr palomydes syre edward smote kynge scottes quyte hors syr sadok smote doune kynge northwalys gaf hym wonder grete falle grete crye kynge arthur party made syr palomydes passyng wrothe soo syr palomydes dressid shelde spere alle myght mette syr edward orkeney smote hym soo hard hors myghte stande foot soo hurtled erthe thenne spere syr palomydes smote doune syre sadok ouer hors croupe ihesu said arthur knyghte arayed grene iusteth myghtely wete wel said syr gawayne good knyghte yet shall ye see hym iuste better departe yet shalle ye see saide syre gawayne another bygger knyghte coloure knyghte said syre gawayn smote doune ryghte four cosyns smote doune within two dayes seuen felawes moo meane whyle stood thus talkynge came place syr tristram vpon black hors euer stynte smote doune one spere four good knyghtes orkeney kynne sir gawayn sir gareth sir dynadan eueryche smote doun good knyyt ihesu seid arthur yoder knyghte vpon black hors doth myghtely merueyllously wel abyde said sir gawayne knyght black hors beganne yet thenne syr tristram made horse ageyne two kynges edward sadok vnhorsed begynnynge thenne sire tristram drewe swerd rode thyckest prees ayenst orkeney smote doune knyghtes rasshed helmes pulled awey theire sheldes hurtled doun many knyghtes ferd soo sire arthur alle knyghtes grete merueille whan sawe one knyghte doo soo grete dedes armes sire palomydes fayled vpon syde dyd merueyllously wel al men wonder kynge arthur lykened syre tristram black hors lyke wood lyon lykened syr palomydes vpon whyte hors vnto wood lybard sir gareth sir dynadan vnto eger wolues custom suche amonge none kynges wold helpe alle felauship euery standard helpe myght euer sire tristram dyd soo moche dedes armes orkeney waxed wery hym drewe vnto lonezep pcapitulum lxix thenne crye heraudes alle manere comyn peple grene knyghte hath done merueyllously beten orkeney heraudes nombred syr tristram satte vpon black hors smyten doune speres swerdes xxx knyghtes sir palomydes smyten doune twenty knyghtes moost party l knyytes hous kyng arthur proued knyytes god help said arthur vnto sir laucelot grete shame v see four knyghtes bete soo many knyghtes myn therfor make yow redy wyll haue adoo syr said launcelot wete ye wel ar two passynge good knyghtes grete worship hit v haue adoo haue day sore trauaylled said arthur wille auengyd therfor take yow sire bleoberys sir ector wille fourthe sayd arthur syre said launcelot ye shal fynde redy broder sir ector cosyn sir bleberys soo whanne redy horsbak chese said sir arthur vnto sir laucelot whome ye wil encountre alle sir said launcelot wille mete grene knyghte vpon black hors syre tristram cosyn sir bleoberys shalle matche grene knyghte vpon whyte hors sir palomydes broder syre ector shall matche grene knyyt vpon whyte hors sir gareth thenne must said sir arthur haue doo grene knyghte vpon gryseld hors sire dynadan euery man take heede felawe said sir launcelot soo trotted gyders ther encountred sire launcelot ageynste syre tristram p soo syr launcelot smote sir tristram soo sore vpon shelde bare hors man erthe sir launcelot wend ben sire palomydes soo passed forthe thenne sire bleoberys encountred sire palomydes smote hym soo hard vpon shelde sire palomydes whyte hors rustled erthe pthenne sir ector de mary smote sire gareth soo hard doune felle hors noble kynge arthur encountred sir dynadan smote hym quyte sadel thenne noyse torned whyle grene knyghtes slayn doune whanne kynge northgalys sawe syre tristram falle thenne remembryd hym grete dedes armes sir tristram done thenne made redy many knyghtes customme crye suche knyght smyten doun myghte horsed ageyne felawes outher owne strength daye shold prysoner vnto party smyten hym doune soo came kynge northgalys rode streyghte vnto sire tristram whanne came nyghe hym alyghte doune sodenly bytoke sir tristram hors sayd thus noble knyghte knowe countrey thow arte noble dedes thow haste done day take hors lete doo wel maye ihesu helpe thow arte better worthy haue myne hors self gramercy said sir tristram yf may shalle quyte yow loke ye goo ferre v suppose shalle wynne yow hors ther sire tristram mounted vpon hors mette kynge arthur gaf hym suche buffet vpon helme swerd kynge arthur power kepe sadel thenne sir tristram gaf kynge northgalis kynge arthur hors thenne grete prees kyng arthur horse hym ageyne sire palomydes wold suffre kynge arthur horsed ageyne euer sir palomydes smote ryght hand lyfte hand myghtely noble knyght meane whyle sir tristra rode thorou thyckest prees smote doune knyghtes ryyt lyfte hand racyd helmes soo passed forth vnto pauelions lefte syr palomydes foot syr tristram chaunged hors desguysed hym self alle reed hors harneis pcapitulum lxxij whan quene la beale isoud sawe syre tristram vnhorsed wist thenne wept gretely sir tristram whan redy came dasshynge lyghtely feld thenne la beale isoud aspyed hym dyd grete dedes armes one spere grete syr tristram smote doune fyue knyytes euer stynte thenne syr launcelot aspyed hym redyly syr tristram thenne repentyd hym smyten hym doune soo syr launcelot went oute prees repose hym lyghtely came ageyne whanne syr tristram came prees thorou grete force put syre palomydes vpon hors syr gareth syre dynadan thenne beganne merueyllously sir palomydes none two felawes knewe holpen horsbak ageyne euer syre tristram nyghe socoured hym cause chaunged reed armour al whyle sir launcelot awry soo whanne la brale isoud knewe sir tristram ageyne vpon horsbak passynge gladde thenne lough make good chere hit happend sir palomydes loked vp toward lay wyndowe aspyed laughed took suche reioycynge smote doune spere suerd alle euer mett thurgh syghte soo enamoured loue semed tyme bothe sir tristram sir launcelot ben bothe ageynst hym shold haue wonne worship hym herte book saith syre palomydes wysshed worship myghte haue doo sir tristram bifore alle men cause la beale isoud pthenne syre palomydes beganne double strengthe dyd soo merueyllously alle men wonder hym euer caste vp eye vnto la beale isoud whanne sawe make suche chere ferd lyke lyon myghte man withstande hym thenne syre tristram beheld hym sire palomydes bestured hym thenne said vnto sir dynadan soo god help sir palomydes passynge good knyghte wel endurynge suche dedes sawe hym neuer doo neuer herd telle euer dyd soo moche one day day said dynadan wold saye vnto syr tristram hym self sayd yf ye knewe who loue doth alle dedes armes soone wolde syre tristram abate courage allas said syre tristram syre palomydes crystened soo said kynge arthur soo said tho behelde hym thenne alle peple gaf hym pryce best knyght day passed syr launcelot outher syre tristram wel said dynadan hym self alle worship syre palomydes hath daye maye thanke quene isoud ben aweye daye syre palomydes geten pryce daye p ryght soo came felde syr launcelot du lake sawe herd noyse crye grete worship syre palomydes dressid hym ageynst syr palomydes grete myghty spere alonge thought smyte hym doune whanne syre palomydes sawe sir launcelot come vpon hym soo fast ran vpon sire launcelot fast swerd myght sire launcelot shold haue stryken hym smote spere syde smote atwo swerd sir palomydes rasshed vnto sire launcelot thoughte haue putt hym shame swerd smote hors neck sire launcelot rode vpon thenne sir launcelot felle erthe thenne crye huge grete see sir palomydes sarasyn hath smyten doune syre launcelots hors pryght thenne many knyghtes wrothe syre palomydes cause done de therfor many knyghtes held ageynst vnknyghtely done turnement kylle hors wilfully hit ben done playne batail lyf lyf pcapitulum lxxj whanne sir ector de mary sawe sir launcelot broder haue suche despyte set foot thenne gat spere egerly ran ageynst sir palomydes smote hym hard bare hym quyte hors sawe sir tristra reed harneis smote donne syr ector de mary quyte hors thenne sir launcelot dressid sheld vpon sholder suerd naked hand cam streyyt vpon sir palomydes fyersly said wete thou wel thow hast done day grettest despyte euer ony worshipful knyyt dyd turnement iustes therfore auengid vpon therfor take kepe self p mercy noble knyyt said palomydes forgyue myn vnkyndely dedes haue power myyt withstande haue done soo moche daye wel wote dyd neuer moche neuer shal lyf dayes therfore moost noble knyyt requyre spare day promyse shal euer knyyt whyle lyue ye putte worship ye putte grettest worship euer euer shalle haue lyf dayes wel sayd sire launcelot see say sothe ye haue done merueyllously wel day vnderstande parte who loue ye doo hit wel wote loue grete maystresse yf lady ny wete yow wel said sire palomydes ye shold bere awey worship beware loue discouerd syr tristram may knowe hit ye wille repente hit sythen quarel ye shall haue day worshyp consyderyng grete trauaylle payne ye haue day worship putte yow hit wyth sir launcelot suffred sit palomydes departe pthenne sir launcelot grete force myghte gate owne hors maulgre xx knyghtes soo whanne sire launcelot horsed dyd many merueylles soo dyd sir tristram syre palomydes lyke wyso thenne sir laucelot smote doune spere sir dynadan kynge scotland kynge walys kynge northumberland kynge lystynes soo thenne sire laucelot felawes smote doune wel fourty knyghtes thenne came kyng irland kynge streyte march rescowe syre tristram sire palomydes beganne grete medle many knyghtes smyten doune bothe partyes alweyes sir launcelot spared sir tristram spared hym sir palomydes wold medle sir launcelot soo hurtelynge thenne kynge arthur sente oute many knyghtes table round sir palomydes euer formest fronte syre trystram dyd soo strongly wel kynge alle merueylle thenne kynge lete blowe lodgynge cause sir palomydes beganne fyrste neuer went rode oute feld repose euer doynge merueyllously wel outher foote horsbak lengest durynge kynge arthur alle kynges gaf sir palomydes honour gree daye thenne syr tristram commaunded sir dynadan fetche quene la beale isoud brynge two pauelions stode welle soo dynadan dyd commaunded sir palomydes vnderstode wyst sire tristram reed armour reed hors wete ye wel gladde soo sir gareth sire dynadan alle wende syre trystram taken prysoner thenne euery knyghte drewe inne thenne kynge arthur euery knyghte spake tho knyghtes aboue alle men gaf sire palomydes pryce alle knyghtes knewe sire palomydes wonder dedes syre said sir launcelot vnto arthur sir palomydes grene knyghte dare say daye best worthy haue degree reposyd hym neuer ne neuer chaunged wedys beganne fyrste longest held yet wel wote said sir launcelot ther better knyght shalle preued departe vpon payne lyf pthus talked eyther party soo sire dynadan rayled sir tristram said deuyl vpon day sir palamydes strength febled neuer day euer doubled strengthe pcapitulum lxxij thou sire tristram faryst alle daye though thou haddest ben slepe therfor calle coward wel dynadan said sir tristram neuer called coward erthely knyghte lyf wete thou wel syr calle selfe neuer coward though syre launcelot gaf falle oute cepte hym al knyghtes doubte ye syr dynadan syr launcelot haue quarel good ouer good ony knyght lyuynge yet sufferaunce largesse bounte curtosy calle hym knyght pyerles soo sire tristram maner wrothe syr dynadan alle langage syr dynadan said cause wold angre syre tristram cause hym awake spyrytes wrothe wel knewe syr dynadan syr tristram thorouly wrothe syre palomydes shold gete pryce vpon morn enten e syr dynadan said alle raylynge langage ageynst sir tristram truly said syre palomydes syr launcelot noble knyythode curtosye prowesse gentilnes knowe pyere day sayd syre palomydes dyd ful vncurtoisly vnto sire launcelot ful vnknyghtely ful knyghtely curtoisly dyd ageyne ben vngentyl hym daye wonne worship therfor sayd palomydes shal sire launcelots knyght whyles lyfe lasteth thys talkynge howses kynges alle kynges lordes knyghtes sayd clere knyghthode pure strengthe bounte curtosye syr launcelot sir tristram bare pryce aboue alle knyghtes euer arthur dayes neu r knyghtes arthur dayes dyd half soo many dedes dyd book sayth ten knyghtes dyd half dedes dyd neuer knyghte dayes requyred sir launcelot sire tristram ony quest soo hit theyre shame performed desyre pcapitulum lxxiij soo morne syre launcelot departed sir tristram redy la beale isoud sir palomydes sir gareth soo rode alle grene ful fresshely bysene vnto forest sir tristram left sir dynadan slepynge bed rode happ kynge launcelot stode wyndowe sawe syre tristram ryde isoud syre sayd launcelot yonder rydeth fayrest lady world excepte youre quene dame gueneuer said sir arthur sir sayd quene isoud oute taken lady quene makeles take hors said arthur araye yow alle ryytes wylle doo promyse yow said kynge wille see pthenne anone armed horsed eyther took spere rode vnto forest syre said launcelot good ye goo nyghe wete ye wel two good knyghtes lyuynge therfore sir pray yow hasty peraduenture wille somme knyghtes ben displeased come sodenly vpon sayd arthur wyll see take force whome greue syr said launcelot ye putte self grete ieopardy said kynge wille take aduenture ryght soo anone kyng rode euen salewed said god yow saue syr said ye welcome thenne kynge beheld lyked wonderly wel came sire palomydes vnto arthur said vncurtois knyght sekest thow thou art vncurtois come vp n lady thus sodenly therfor withdrawe syr arthur took none hede sire palomydes wordes euer loked stylle vpon quene isoud thenne sir palomydes wrothe took spere cam hurtelynge vpon kynge arthur smote hym doune spere whan sire launcelot sawe despyte sir palomydes sayd hym self loth haue adoo yonder knyght owne sake sir tristram one thynge sure yf smyte doune sir palomydes must haue adoo sire tristram ouer moch matche bothe two noble knyghtes withstandynge whether lyue dye nedes muste reuenge lord wille someuer befalle sir launcelot cryed sir palomydes kepe thenne sir launcelot sire palmydes rasshed gyder two speres strongly sire launcelot smote sir palomydes soo hard wente quyte oute sadel grete falle whanne sire tristram sawe syre palomydes haue falle sayd sire launcelot syr knyght kepe must iuste iuste said sir launcelot wille fayle yow dr de haue yow lothe haue adoo yow myghte chese ye wete must reuenge special lord vnhorsed vnwarly vnknyghtely therfor though reuengyd falle take ye displeasyr therin suche frende may see hym shamed anone sir tristram vnderstode parson knyghtely wordes sir launcelot du lake veryly sir tristram demed kynge arthur sir palomydes smyten doune thenne sir tristram put spere hym putte sire palomydes ageyne horsbak sir launcelot put kyng arthur horshak soo departed god helpe sayd sire tristram vnto palomydes ye dyd worshipfully ye smote doune knyght soo sodenly ye dyd wete ye wel ye dyd self grete shame knyghtes cam hyder gentilnesse see fayre lady euery good knyghtes parte behold fayr lady ye hadde adoo playe suche maystryes afore lady wete thow wel hit wille tourne angre ye smote doune kynge arthur good knyght sire launcelot shalle forgete wordes ire launcelot whan callyd hym man grete worship wyst kynge arthur sire launcelot ben fyue honderd knyghtes medowe wold haue refused yet said wold refuse ageyne wyst sir launcelot euer forbereth euery place sheweth grete kyndnesse alle knyghtes oute take none saye men wille say bereth floure al chyualry saye hit hym someuer wille wel angred hym lyst vtteraunce withoute ony fauour knowe hym lyue sir launcelot ouer hard hym hit horsback foote may neuer byleue sayd palomydes kyng arthur wille ryde soo pryuely poure erraunt knyghte said sir tristram ye knowe lord arthur knyytes maye lerne knyghte hym therfore ye may sory said ire tristram vnkyndely dedes noble kynge thynge done may vndone sayd palomydes thenne sire tristram sente quene isoud vnto lodgynge pryory behold alle turnement pcapitulum lxxiiii thenne crye vnto knyghtes herd horne blowe shold make iustes dyd fyrst day lyke bretheren sire edward sir sadok beganne iustes fyrst daye sir vwayne kynges sone vreyn sir lucanere de buttelere beganne iustes second day fyrst encountre syr vwayne smote doune kynges sone ottes syr lucanere ranne ageynste kynge walys brake speres alle pyeces soo fyers bothe hurtled gyders bothe felle erthe p thenne dorkeney horsed ageyne syr lucanere thenne came syr tristram de lyones thenne syr tristram smote doune syr vwayne syre lucanere syre palomydes smote doune two knyghtes syre gareth smote doune two knyghtes thenne said syre arthu vnto syr launcelot see yonder thre knyghtes doo passyngly wel namely fyrst iusted sir said launcelot knyghte beganne yet ye shalle see hym day doo merueyllously thenne came place duke sone orkeney thenne beganne many dedes armes pwhan syre tristram sawe soo begynne said palomydes fele ye self maye ye doo daye ye dyd yesterday nay said palomydes fele self soo wery soo sore brysed dedes yesterday maye endure dyd yesterday repenteth said syre tristram shall lacke yow day sire palomydes saide truste maye doo dyd alle wordes said palomydes begyle syr tristram syr said syr tristram vnto syr gareth thenne muste truste vpon yow wherfor praye yow ferre rescowe nede said gareth shalle fayle yow alle maye doo pthenne syr palomydes rode hym self thenne despyte syr tristram putte hym self thyckest prees amonge dorkeney dyd soo merueyllous dedes armes alle men wonder hym myghte none ande hym st oke whanne syre tristram sawe syre palomydes doo suche dedes merueylled sayd hym self wery company soo syr tristram beheld hym grete whyle dyd lytel el noyse crye soo huge grete syre tristram merueylled w en came strengthe sire palomydes felde syr said sire gareth vnto syr tristram remembre ye wordes syr dynadan sayd yow yesterday called yow coward sothe sir said none yf ye man world moost loueth alle sayd worship therfore said sir gareth sir tristram lete knowe daye ye wondre ye soo vpon sire palomydes enforceth hym self wynne alle worship honour yow maye well byleue said sir tristram sythen vnderstande euyl wylle enuy ye shalle see yf enforce selfe noyse shalle lefte vpon hym thenne sire tristram rode thyckest prees thenne dyd soo merueyllously wel dyd soo grete dedes armes alle men sayd sire tristram dyd double moche dedes armes syre palomydes done afore hand thenne noyse wente playne sire palomydes alle peple cryed vpon sir tristram ihesu said peple see sire tristram smyteth doune spere soo many knyghtes see saide many knyghtes smyteth doune suerd many knyghtes rasshed helmes sheldes soo bete al orkeney afore hym said sir launcelot vnto kynge arthur told yow daye wold knyyt playe pagent yonder rydeth knyyt ye may see doth knyghtely hath strengthe wynde god help said arthur launcelot ye saye sothe sawe neuer better knyghte passeth fer sire palomydes syre wete ye well sayd launcelot hit muste soo ryghte hit hym selfe noble knyght syr tristram maye ryght wel byleue said arthur whan sire palomydes herd noyse crye torned hym rode oute parte beheld sir tristram whanne sire palomydes sawe sir tristram merueyllously wel wepte passyngly sore despyte wiste wel shold worship wynne daye wel knewe sire palomydes whanne sire tristram wold put forth strengthe manhode shold gete lytyl worship daye pcapitulum lxxv thenne came kynge arthur kynge northgaly sir launcelot du lake sire bleoberis sire bors de ganys sir ector de mari thre knyghtes came feld sire launcelot thenne sire launcelot thre knyghtes kynne dyd soo grete dedes armes alle noyse beganne vpon sir launcelot soo bete kynge walys kyng scottes ferre abak made auoyde felde sir tristram sir gareth abode stylle felde endured euer came alle men wonder ony knyght myght endure soo many stroke euer sir launcelot thre kynnesmen cammaudement syr launcelot forbare sir tristram thenne said sir arthur sir palomydes endureth soo wel nay sayd sir launcelot wete ye wel good knyght sir tristram yonder ye maye see syr palomydes beholdeth houeth doth lytel noughte sire ye shalle vnderstande sire tristram weneth thys day bete v alle oute felde said sire launcelot shal bete hym bete hym soo wil sir said launcelot vnto arthur ye may see sir palomydes houeth yonder though dreme wete ye wel ful heuy tristram doth suche dedes armes thenne foole said arthur neuer sire palomydes neuer shalle suche prowesse sir tristram yf haue ony enuy sir tristram cometh hym vpon syde fals knyghte pa kynge sir launcelot thus spake sir tristram rode pryuely oute prees none aspyed hym la beale isoud sir palomydes two wold lete eyen vpon sir tristram pand whanne sir tristram cam pauelions fond sire dynadan bedde slepe awake said tristram ye ouyt ashamed soo slepe whan knyghtes haue ado feld thenne syr dynadan arose lyghtely said syr wylle ye shalle doo make yow redy said syr tristram ryde felde soo whan syr dynadan armed loked vpon syre tristram helme shelde whan sawe soo many stroke vpon helme vpon shelde said good tyme thus slepe hadde ben yow must nedes shame haue folowed yow shame ony prowesse see wel tho stroke shold haue ben truly beten yesterdaye leue youre iapes said sire tristram come felde ageyne sayd sire dynadan herte vp yester daye ye ferd though ye dremed soo thenne sir tristram arayed black harneis ihesu said dynadan eyleth yow day semeth ye wylder ye yesterday thenne smyled syr tristram sayd dynadan awayte wel vpon yf ye see ouermatched loke ye euer behynde shalle make yow redy way goddes grace soo sir tristram syre dynadan took horse alle aspyed sir palomydes bothe goynge comynge soo dyd la beale isoud knewe sir tristram aboue alle pcapitulum lxxvj thenne whanne sire palomydes sawe sir tristram desguysed thenne thoughte doo hym shame soo syre palomydes rode knyghte sore wounded satte vnder fayre welle felde syr knyghte said sire palomydes pray lene armour shelde myn ouer wel knowen felde hath done grete dommage ye shall haue myn armour shelde sure wille wel said knyghte ye haue myn armour shelde yf may doo yow ony auayle sire palomydes armed hym hastely knyghtes armoure sheld shone ony crystall syluer soo came rydynge felde thenne ther neyther sire tristram none kynge arthur party knewe sir palomydes pand ryght soo sir palomydes come feld syr tristram smote doune thre knyghtes euen syght sir palomydes thenne sir palomydes rode ageynst syre tristram eyther mette grete speres braste handes thenne dasshed gyder swerdes egerly thenne sire tristram merueylle knyghte dyd bataill knyghtely hym thenne sir tristram wrothe felte hym passynge stronge demed myghte haue adoo remenaunt knyytes cause strengthe syre palomydes psoo lasshed gyder gaf many sadde stroke gyders many knyghtes merueylled knyghte myghte soo encountred black knyghte sir tristram ful wel knewe la beale isoud syre palomydes fought sir tristram aspyed al wyndowe stode syr palomydes chaunged harneis wounded knyghte thenne beganne wepe hertely despyte syr palomydes ther swouned thenne came syr laucelot knyghtes orkeney whanne party aspyed sir launcelot cryed retorne retorne cometh syre launcelot du lake soo came knyghtes sayd syr launcelot ye must nedes fyghte yonder knyght black harneis syr tristram hath al moost ouercome good knyghte fyghteth hym syluer shelde syr palomydes thenne sir launcelot rode betwix sir tristram syr palomydes syr launcelot said palomydes syr knyghte lete haue batail ye haue nede reposed syr palomydes knewe syr launcelot wel dyd syre tristram cause syr launcelot ferre hardyer knyght hym self therfor gladde suffred syr launcelot fyghte syr tristram wel wyste syre launcelot knewe sir tristram hope syr launcelot shold bete shame syre tristram wherof syre palomydes ful fayne soo syr launcelot gaf syr tristram many sadde stroke syre launcelot knewe sir tristram sir tristram knewe wel syre launcelot thus fought longe gyders la beale isoud wel nygh oute mynde sorou thenne syr dynadan told sir gareth knyyt black harne sir tristra laucelot fyyteth hym yt must nedes haue better hym sir tristram hath moche trauaylle day thenne lete v smyte hym doune said syre gareth better doo said sire dynadan thenne sir tristram shamed yonder houeth stronge knyghte syluer shelde falle vpon syre tristram yf nede thenne forthe alle gareth rasshed vpon syre launcelot gaf hym grete stroke vpon helme soo hard astonyed thenne came syr dynadan spere smote syr launcelot suche buffet hors alle felle erthe ihesu said syr tristram syre gareth syre dynadan fy shame dyd ye smyte doune soo good knyght namely whan adoo hym ye doo self grete shame hym disworship helde hym resonable hote though ye holpen thenne cam syre palomydes desguysed smote doune syr dynadan hors thenne syr launcelot cause syr dynadan smyten hym afore hand thenne syr launcelot assailed syre dynadan passynge sore syre dynadan defended hym myghtely wel vnderstood syr tristram syre dynadan myghte endure syr launcelot wherfor syr tristram sory thenne came syre palomydes fresshe vpon syre tristram whanne syr tristram sawe hym come thoughte delyuer hym one cause wold helpe syre dynadan cause stode grete perylle syr launcelot pthenne syre tristram hurteled vnto syre palomydes gafe hym grete buffet thenne sir tristram gate sir palomydes pulled hym doune vnder nethe hym felle sir tristram hym syr tristram lepte vp lyghtely lefte sir palomydes wente betwixe sir launcelot dynadan thenne beganne bataille gyders pryght soo sire dynadan gat sir tristram hors said hyghe sir launcelot myght lord sir tristra take hors whanne sire launcelot herd hym neneme sir tristram ihesu said launcelot haue done dishonoured lord syre tristram said launcelot ye desguysed ye haue put self grete perille daye praye noble knyghte pardone knowen yow done bataille sir said sir tristram fyrst kyndenes ye shewed soo bothe horsed ageyne thenne people one syde gaf sir laucelot honour degree syde people gaf noble knyyt sir tristram honour degree launcelot sayd nay ther worthy haue honour wil reporte vnto alle knyghtes sir tristram hath ben lenger felde hath smyten doun many moo knyghtes thys day haue done therfore wille gyue sire tristram voyce name praye alle lordes felawes soo doo thenne hole voyce duke erles baron knyghtes syr tristram thys day preued best knyghte pcapitulum lxxvij thenne blewe vnto lodgynge quene isoud ledde vnto pauelions wete yow wel wrothe oute mesure syr palomydes sawe alle treason begynnynge endynge whyle neyther syr tristram neyther sir gareth dynadan knewe treason sir palomydes afterward ye shalle bef lle grettest debate betwixe syre tristram sire palomydes myghte whanne turnement done sir tristram gareth dynadan rode la beale isoud pauelions euer sire palomydes rode theyr company desguysed whanne sir tristram aspyed hym knyghte sheld syluer helde hym soo hote day sir knyghte said sire tristram wete yow wel none hath nede youre elauship therfore praye yow departe v psire palomydes ansuerd ageyne though knowen sir tristram wete yow wel sir knyghte felauship wille neuer departe one best knyghtes world commaunded company tyl discharge seruyse wille discharged sir tristram knewe sir palomydes sir palomydes sayd noble knyghte sire tristram ar ye suche knyghte ye haue ben named wronge ye haue longe ben called gentil knyyt daye ye haue shewed grete vngentilnes ye hadde al mooste broughte vnto dethe yow suppose shold haue done wel ynough sir launcelot yow ouer moche knowe knyght lyuynge sire launcelot ouer good hym wylle doo vttermest allas said sir palomydes ar ye lord sir tristram ye sir ye knowe wel ynough knyghthode said palomydes vntyl knewe yow wende ye ben kynge irland wel wote ye bare armes armes said syre tristram wille stand wanne one f lde ful noble knyghte name sir marhaus grete payne wanne knyghte none recouer sir marhaus dyed thorugh fals lech yet neuer yolden sir said palomydes wend ye ben torned vpon sir launcelots party caused torne ye say wel said sir tristram take forgyue yow soo thenne rode pauelions whan alyyt vnarmed wesshe theyre face handes soo yode vnto mete sette atte table whanne isoud sawe sir palomydes chau ged thenne colour wrath myght speke anon sir tristram spyed countenaunce said madame cause make ye v suche chere haue ben sore trauailed day myn owne lord said la beale isoud goddes sake ye dyspleasyd maye none wyse doo sawe thys day ye bitrayed nyghe broughte dethe truly syre sawe euery dele wyse therfor syr shold suffre presence suche felon traytour sir palomydes sawe hym myn eyen beheld yow whan ye wente oute felde euer houed stylle vpon hors til sawe yow come ageynward thene forth al sawe hym ryde hurte knyghte chaunged harn hym thenne streyghte sawe hym rode felde pand anone foude yow encountred yow thus wilfully sir palomydes dyd bataille yow hym sir gretely aferd dred sore laucelot knewe yow madame said palomydes ye maye saye ye wyll may contrary yow knyghthode knewe sir tristram psir palomydes said sir tristram wille take excuse wel wote ye spared lytel alle pardonned party thenne la beale isoud held doune heed said tyme pcapitulum lxxviij alle two knyghtes armed cam vnto pauelione alyghte bothe came armed alle pyeces faire knyghtes sayd syre tristram ye ar blame come thus armed alle pyeces vpon whyle ar oure mete yf ye wold ony thynge whan felde myghte ye haue easyd hertes said one tho knyghtes come entent wete ye wel sir tristram come hydder frendes come said one see yow thys knyghte come see la beale isoud thenne said sire tristram requyre yow doo helmes maye see yow wille doo desyre sayd knyghtes whanne helmes sir tristram thought shold knowe thenne said sir dynadan pryuely vnto syr tristram syr sire launcelot du lake spak vnto yow fyrst lord kynge arthur thenne said sir tristram vnto la beale isoud madame aryse lord kynge arthur thenne kynge quene kyssed sire launcelot syr tristram braced eyther armes thenne ioye withoute mesure request la beale isoud kynge arthur launcelot vnarmed thenne mery talkynge pmadame said sire arthur hit many day sythen haue desyred see yow ye haue ben praysed soo ferre dar say ye fayrest euer sawe sir tristram fayre good knyghte ony knowe therfor besemeth ye wel besett gyders syr god thanke yow said noble knyyt sire tristram isoud grete goodenesse largesse ye ar pyerles thus talked many thynges alle hole iustes cause sayd kynge arthur ye sir tristram ageynst v ye knyght table round ryghte ye shold haue ben v syre said sir tristram dynadan sire gareth owne neuewe caused ayenst yow lord arthur sayd gareth may wel bere blame sir tristram owne dedes may repente sayd dynadan vnhappy sire tristram broughte v turnement many grete buffet caused v haue thenne kynge launcelot lough myghte sytte knyght sayd arthur held yow soo short sheld syluer syr said sir tristram syt eth bord said arthur hit sire palomydes wete ye wel hit said la beale isoud p god help said arthur vnknyghtely done soo good knyghte haue herd many peple calle curtois knyghte sir said palomydes knewe sir tristram soo desguysed soo god helpe sayd launcelot maye wel knewe sir tristram merueyle ye torned oure party done cause said launcelot said sir tristram haue pardonned hym wold ryght bothe leue felauship loue ryght wel company soo lefte talked thynges euenynge kyng arthur sir launcelot departed vnto lodgynge wete ye wel sir palomydes enuy hertely alle nyght neuer rest bedde wayled wepte oute mesure soo morn sire tristram gareth dynadan arose erly thenne wente vnto sire palomydes chamber fond hym fast slepe al nyyt watched seene vpon chekes wept ful sore say thynge said syr tristram sure hath taken anger sorowe rebuke gaf hym la beale isoud pcapitulum lxxix thenne sir tristram lete calle sir palomydes bad hym make hym redy tyme go felde whan redy armed clothed al reed bothe isoud alle soo sad passynge fresshely thurgh feld pryory lodgynge thenne herd thre blastes blowe euery kynge knyghte dressid hym vnto felde fyrste redy iuste sir palomydes sir kaynus straunge knyghte table round soo two encountred gyders sire palomydes smote sir kaynus soo hard smote hym quyte ouer hors croupe forth alle sir palomydes smote doune another knyght brake thenne spere pulled oute swerd wonderly wel thenne noyse beganne gretely vpon sir palomydes loo said kynge arthur yonder palomydes begynneth play pagent god help said arthur passynge good knyght ryght stood talkyng thus came sir tristram thonder encountred syre kay seneschall smote hym doune quyte hors spere sir tristram smote doune thre knyghtes moo thenne pulled oute swerd dyd merueyllously thenne noyse crye chaunged syr palomydes torned sir tristram alle peple cryed tristram tristram thenne sir palomydes clene forgeten said launcelot vnto arthur yonder rydeth knyght playeth pagents god help said arthur launcelot ye shalle see daye yonder two knyghtes shalle doo day wonder syr said launcelot one knyght wayteth vpon enforceth hym self thurgh enuy passe noble knyght sire tristram knoweth pryuy enuy whiche syre palomydes hath hym noble syre tristram dothe thorou clene knygthode thenne sire gareth dynadan dyd wonderly grete dedes armes two noble knyghtes soo kyng arthur spak grete honour worship kynges knyghtes sir tristram syde passyngly wel helde truly gyders thenne sir arthur sir launceloot took horse dressid gete thyckest prees syr tristram vnknowyng smote doune kyng arthur thenne syre launcelot wold haue rescowed hym soo many vpon sir launcelot pulled hym doune hors thenne kynge irland kynge scottes knyghtes dyd payne take kynge arthur sir launcelot prysoner whanne syr launcelot herd hem say soo ferd hit ben hongry lyon ferd knyghte durste nyghe hym thenne came sir ector de mari bare spere ageynst sire palomydes brast vpon hym alle sheuers thenne syr ector came ageyne gaf sire palomydes suche dasshe swerd stouped doune vpon sadel bowe forth alle syre ector pulled doune sir palomydes vnder feete thenne syr ector de mary gate sir launcelot du lake hors brought hit hym badde hym mounte vpon hym sir palomydes lepte afore gatte hors brydel lepte sadel soo god helpe said launcelot ye better worthy haue hors thenne sir ector broughte syr launcelot hors gramercy sayd launcelot vnto broder pand horsed ageyne one spere smote doune four knyghtes thenne sir launcelot broughte kynge arthur one best iiij horse thenne syr launcelot kynge arthur fewe knyghtes sire launcelots kynne dyd merueyllous dedes tyme booke recordeth syr launcelot smote doune pulled doun thyrtty knyghtes withstandyng parte held soo fast gyders kyng arthur knyghtes ouermatched whanne sir trisram sawe labour kyng arthur knyghtes especyal noble dedes syre launcelot dyd owne handes merueylled gretely pcapitulum lxxx thenne sir tristram called vnto hym syr palomydes syr gareth syr dynadan sayd thus fayre felawes wete ye wel torne vnto kynge arthur party sawe neuer soo fewe men doo soo wel hit wille shame vnto v knyghtes ben round table see lord kynge arthur noble knyght sire launcelot dishonoured wille wel said sire gareth syr dynadan best said palomydes wille chaunge party came al sake said sir tristram god spede yow iourneye soo departed syr palomydes fro thenne sir tristram gareth dynadan torned sir launcelot thenne syr launcelot smote doune kynge irland quyte hors syr launcelot smote doune kynge scottes kynge walys thenne sir arthur ranne vnto syre palomydes smote hym quyte hors thenne syr tristram bare doune alle mett syr gareth sir dynadan dyd noble knyghtes thenne al partyes beganne flee allas said palomydes euer shold see day haue lost al worship wanne thene sir palomydes wente way waylynge soo withdrewe hym tyl came welle putte hors hym dyd armour wayled wepte lyke ben wood man thenne many knyghtes gaf pryce syre tristram many gaf pryce vnto syre launcelot pfair lordes said sir tristram thanke yow honour ye wold yeue pray yow hertely ye wold gyue voys syr launcelot feythe said syre trystram wille gyue sir launcelot voys syre launcelot wold haue hit pryce gyuen betwix bothe thenne euery man rode lodgynge syr bleoberis syr ector rode sir tristram la beale isoud vnto pauelions thenne syr palomydes atte well waylynge wepynge came hym fleyng kyng walys scotland sawe syre palomydes arage allas said soo noble man ye shold araye thenne tho kynges gat sir palomydes hors ageyne made hym arme hym mounte vpon hors soo rode hem makyng grete dole psoo whan sire palomydes came nyghe pauelions syre tristram la beale isoud thenne sire palomydes prayd two kynges abyde hym whyle spake sir tristram whanne came porte pauelions syre palomydes said hyghe arte thow syr tristram de lyones syr said dynadan palomydes sir palomydes wille ye come amonge v fy traytour sayd palomydes wete yow wel hit day lyght nyght shold slee myn owne handes yf euer maye gete said palomydes thou shalt dye dayes dede sir palomydes said sir tristram ye wyte wronge ye done dyd ye hadde wonne worship sythen ye gyue soo large warnynge shalle wel ware yow fy traitour saide palomydes departed thenne morne sir tristram bleoberis sir ector de mary sir gareth syr dynadan water lond brought la beale isoud vnto ioyous gard reposed vij nyghte made alle myrthes disportes coude deuyse kyng arthur knyghtes drewe vnto camelot syre palomydes rode two kynges euer made grettest dole ony man coude thynke alle soo dolorous departyng la beale isoud parte sorouful departe felauship sir tristram sire tristram soo kynd soo gentyl whanne sire palomydes remembrid hym therof myghte neuer mery pcapitulum lxxxj seuen nyghtes ende sir bleoberys syr ector departed sir tristram quene two good knyghtes grete yeftes sir gareth sir dynadan abode sir tristram whan sire blebeorys sir ector comen quene gueneuer lodged castel sce syde thorou grace god quene recouerd maladye p thenne asked two knyghtes whens came sayd came sir tristram la beale isoud doth sir tristram said quene la beale isoud truly sayd tho two knyghtes dothe noble knyght shold doo quene isoud pyerles alle ladyes speke beaute bounte myrthe goodenesse sawe neuer matche ferre haue ryden gone mercy ihesu said quene gueneuer soo sayth alle people haue sene spoken god wold parte condycyons mysfortuned sekenesse whyle turnement endured suppose shalle neuer see alle lyf suche assemble knyghtes ladyes ye haue done thenne knyghtes told hou palomydes wanne degree fyrst daye grete noblesse second day sir trystram wanne degree thyrdde day syre launcelot wanne degree wel said quene gueneuer dyd best alle thre dayes soo god help said knyghtes sir launcelot sire tristram hadd leest dishonour wete ye wel sir palomydes dyd passynge wel myghtely torned ageynst party cam alle caused hym lese grete parte hys worship semed sir palomydes passyng enuyous thenne shalle neuer wynne worship said quene gueneuer happeth enuyous man one wynne worshyp shalle dishonoured twyes therfore cause alle men worship hate enuyous man wille shewe hym fauour curtois kynde gentil hath fauour euery place pcapitulum lxxxij leue mater speke sir palomydes rode lodged hym two kynges wherof kynges heuy thenne kynge irland sent man syr palomydes gaf hym grete courser kynge scotland gaf hym grete yeftes fayne wold haue sire palomydes haue abyden wyse wold abyde soo departed rode auentures wold guyde hym tyl nyy none thenne forest welle syr palomydes sawe lay fayre wounded knyght hors bounden hym knyght made grettest e euer herd man make euer wepte ther syghed though wold dye thenne syre palomydes rode nere hym salewed hym myldly sayd fayr knyghte wayle ye soo lete lye doune wayle yow doubte moche heuyer ye dare say sayd palomydes sorowe honderd fold therfor lete v complayne eyther fyrst saide wounded knyghte requyre yow telle name thow none noble knyghtes round tabble thou shalt neuer knowe name someuer come faire knyghte said palomydes suche better hit w rse wete thou wel name sire palomydes sone heyre vnto kynge astlabor sir safyr sir segwarydes two bretheren wete thou wel self neuer crystened two bretheren ar truly crystend noble knyghte said knyghte wel haue mette yow wete ye wel name epynogrys kynges sone northumberland sytte doune sayd epynogrys lete v eyther complayne thenne syre palomydes beganne complaynte shalle telle yow said palomydes wo endure loue fairest quene lady euer bare lyf wete ye wel name la beale isoud kynge markes wyf cornewaile grete foly said epynogrys loue quene isoud one best knyghtes world loueth sir tristram de lyones trouthe said palomydes man knoweth mater better doo haue ben sir tristram felauship moneth la beale isoud gyders allas said palomydes vnhappy man haue loste felauship syre tristram euer loue la beale isoud euer neuer lyke see sir tristram ben eyther mortal enemyes wel said epynogrys sythe ye loued la beale isoud loued yow euer ageyne ony thyng ye coude thynk wyte el dyd ye reioyse euer ony pleasyr nay knyghthode said palomydes neuer aspyed euer loued alle world neuer plesyr laste daye gaf grettest rebuke euer whiche shalle neuer goo herte yet wel deserued rebuke dyd knyghtely therfor haue lost loue sir tristram euer haue many tymes enforced self doo many dedes la beale isoud sake causer worship wynny ge allas said sir palomydes haue lost alle worshyp euer wanne neuer shalle befalle suche prowesse felauship sir tristram pcapitulum lxviij nay nay sayde epynogrys youre sorowe iapes sorowe reioyced lady wanne handes loste ageyn allas daye thus fyrst wanne said epynogrys lady erles doughter erle two knyytes cam turnement lonezep sake sette vpon erle two knyghtes lady beynge present soo fortune slewe erle one knyghtes knyghte fledde soo nyghte lady morne reposed v atte thys welle syde came erraunt knyghte name syr helyor le preuse hardy knyght sir helyor chalengyd fyghte lady thenne wente bataille fyrst vpon hors foote last sir helyor wounded soo lefte dede soo toke lady hym thus sorowe haue reioy ed ye reioy ed neuer trouthe said palomydes sythe neuer recouer self shalle promyse yow yf mete sir helynor shalle gete yow lady ageyne el shalle bete thenne sire palomydes made sir epynogrys take hors rode hermytage sir epynogrys rested hym meane whyle syre palomydes walkd pryuely oute reste hym vnder leues besyde sawe knyghte come rydynge sheld sene sir ector de mary bere afore hand came hym ten knyghtes soo x knyghtes houed vnder leues hete anone came knyyt grene shelde whyte lyon ledynge lady vpon palfroy thene knyyt grene sheld semed maister ten knyghtes rode fyersly sire helyor hurte sir epynogrys whanne cam nyghe sir helyor badde hym defende lady defende said helyor vnto power soo ranne gyders soo myghtely eyther knyghtes smote doune hors erthe thenne wanne vp lyghtely drewe swerdes sheldes lasshed gyders myghtely houre alle sire palomydes sawe behelde euer last knyghte sir ectors shelde byggar att laste knyghte smote sir helyor doune thenne knyghte vnlaced helme haue stryken hede thenne cryed mercy praid hym saue lyf badde hym take lady pthenne sire palomydes dressid hym vp cause wyste wel lady epynogrys lady promysed hym helpe hym thenne sir palomydes wente streyghte lady toke hand asked whether knewe knyghte hyghte epynogrys allas said euer knewe hym haue sake loste worship also lyf greueth moost al lady said palomydes come epynogris hermytage wel said lady lyue whether wylt thow lady said knyght syr ectors shelde doo lyst said palomydes wete yow wel sayd knyghte thou spekest ouer large though thou semest haue auauntage cause thow sawest doo bataille late thou wenest sir knyghte haue lady away lyghtly nay thynke hit neuer thow good knyghte syr launcelot sir tristram sir palomydes thow shalt wynne derer euer dyd soo went vnto bataille vpon foote gaf many sadde stroke eyther wounded passyng sore thus fouyt stille houre thenne sire palomydes merueil knyghte myghte soo stronge soo wel br thed durynge thus said palomydes knyyt requyre telle thy name wete thow wel said knyghte dar telle name soo thow wilt telle thy name wille said palomydes truly said knyghte name safyr sone kynge labor sire palomydes syre segwarydes bretheren wete thou wel name sir palomydes thenne sir safyr kneled doune vpon knee prayd hym mercy thenne vnlaced helmes eyther kyssed wepynge meane whyle sire epynogrys aroose oute bedde herd stroke soo armed hym helpe sire palomydes yf nede pcapitulum lxxxiiij thenne sir palomydes tooke lady hand broughte sire epynogrys grete ioye betwixe eyther swouned ioye whan
