mette fair knyght lady said sir safer pyte departe yow ihesu send yow ioye eyther gramercy gentyl knyghte said epynogrys moche thanke lord sir palomydes thus hath thurgh prowesse made gete lady pthenne sir epynogrys requyred sire palomydes sire safere brother ryde vnto castel sauf gard person sire said palomydes redy conduyte cause ye sore wounded soo epynogrys lady horsed lady behynde hym vpon softe ambuler thenne rode vnto castel grete chere ioye grete euer sir palomydes sir safere lyfe dayes soo morne sir safere sir palomydes departed rode fortune ledde soo rode alle daye vntyl none last herd grete wepynge grete noyse doune manoir syre said thenne sir safere lete v wete noyse wil wel said sir palomydes soo rode forth tyl came fayr gate manoir satte old man sayenge prayer bede thenne sire palomydes sir safere alyghte lefte horse wente within gate sawe ful many goodely men wepynge pfair syrs said palomydes wherfore wepe ye make sorowe anone one knyghtes castel beheld sir palomydes knewe hym thene wente selawes said fair felawes wete ye wel al haue castel knyght slewe oure lord lonezep knowe hym wel syre palomydes thenne wente vnto harneis alle myghte bere harneis horsbak foote nombre thre score whan redy came fresshly vpon syr palomydes vpon syr safere grete noyse sayd thus kepe syre palomydes thow arte knowen ryght thow must dede thow hast slayne oure lord therfore wete ye wel wille slee therfore defende thenne sir palomydes syr safer one sette bak gaf many grete stroke took many grete stroke thus fouyte twenty knyghtes fourty gentilmen yomen nyghe two houres last though bothe sir palomydes syr safere taken yolden putte stronge pryson within thre dayes twelue knyghtes passed vpon fond sir palomydes gylty syr safyr gylty lordes dethe whan sir safyr shold delyuerd grete dole betwixe syr palomydes hym many pyteous complayntys sir safyr made departynge maker reherce tenthe parte fair broder said palomydes lete thy dolour thy sorou yf ordeyned dye shameful dethe welcome wist deth demed vnto shold neuer haue ben yolden soo syr safere departed broder grettest dolour sorou euer made knyghte pand morne castel ordeyned twelue knyghtes ryde syre palomydes vnto fader knyght syr palomydes slewe soo bound legges vnder old edes bely thenne rode syr palomydes vnto castel see syde hyghte pelownes syr palomydes shold haue iustyce thus ordenaunce rode syr palomydes fast castel ioyous gard pand passed castel came rydynge oute castel one knewe syr palomydes whan knyghte sawe sire palomydes bounden vpon croked courser knyght asked syre palomydes cause led fair felawe knyghte sayd palomydes ryde toward dethe sleynge knyght turnement lonezep yf departed lord syr tristra ouyte haue done myyt haue ben sure haue lyf saued pray yow syr knyght recommaunde vnto lord sir tristram vnto lady quene isoud say yf euer trespaced aske foryeuenes also biseche yow recommaunde vnto lord kynge arthur alle selauship round table vnto power thenne knyghte wepte pyte syr palomydes alle rode vnto ioyous gard faste hors myghte renne ande lyghtly knyght descended doune hors wente vnto sir tristram told hym ye haue herd euer knyghte wepte ben madde pcapitulum lxxxv sir tristram herd sir palomydes went deth heuy said wroth sir palomydes yet wil suffre hym dye shameful deth ful noble knyyt thenne anon sir tristram armed toke hors two squyers wyth hym rode grete paas towarde castel pelownes sir palomydes iuged deth twelue knyytes led sir palomydes passed welle sir laucelot whiche alyghte teyed hors tree taken helme drynke welle whan saw knyghtes syr launcelot putte helme suffred passe hym thenne ware sire palomydes bounden ledde shamefully dethe ihesu said launcelot mysauenture befalle hym thus ledde toward dethe forsoth said launcelot shame suffre noble knyght soo dye myyte helpe hym therfor wille helpe hym someuer come hit el shal dye syr palomydes sake pand thenne sir launcelot mounted vpon hors gate spere hand rode twelue knyghtes ledde sir palomydes fair knyghtes said sir launcelot whyder lede ye knyyt bysemeth hym ful ylle ryde bounden thenye twelue knyghtes sodenly torned horse said sir launcelot syr knyghte counceille medle knyght hath deserued deth vnto dethe juged repenteth said launcelot may borowe hym fayrenesse ouer good knyghte dye suche shameful dethe therfor fayre knyghtes said syr launcelot kepe yow wel ye rescowe knyght dye thenne beganne dresse speres sir launcelot smote formest doune hors man serued thre moo one spere thenne spere brast al sir launcelot drewe swerd thenne smote ryght hand lyfte hand thenne within whyle lefte none tho twelue knyghtes leyd erthe moost party hem sore wounded thenne syr launcelot took best hors fonde loused sire palomydes sette hym vpon hors retorned ageyne vnto ioyous gard thenne sir palomydes ware sir tristram came rydynge whan sir launcelot sawe hym knewe hym wel sir tristram knewe hym cause syre launcelot sholder golden shelde soo syr launcelot made hym redy juste syr tristram sire tristram sholde wene syre launcelot thenne sir palomydes cryed lowde syr tristram lorde requyre yow juste knyght goode knyght hath saued dethe whan syre tristram herde hym saye came softe trottyng paas toward thenne syre palomydes sayd lord syr tristram moche beholdynge vnto yow youre grete goodenes wold profer youre noble body rescowe vndeserued haue gretely offended yow withstandynge said sire palomydes mette noble knyghte worshipfully manly rescowed xij knyghtes smote doune alle wounded sore pcapitulum lxxxvj fayre knyght said syr tristram vnto syre launcelot whens ye knyght erraunt sayd sir lau celot rydeth seke many aduentures name said sir tristram syre tyme wille telle yow thenne syre launcelot sayd vnto sir tristram palomydes eyther yow ar mette gyders wille departe yow soo said syr tristram pray yow knyythode ryde vnto castel wete yow wel said syr launcelot may ryde yow haue many dedes doo place tyme maye abyde yow mercy ihesu said syr tristram requyre yow ye true knyghte ordre knyghthode playe nyghte thenne sire tristram graunte syre launcelot though desyred hym wold haue ryden hem outher soone haue come syr launcelot cam none cause countrey see syr tristram whanne come joyous gard alyght horse ledde stable thenne vnarmed whanne syre launcelot vnhelmed sir tristram syr palomydes knewe hym thenne sire tristram took syr launcelot armes soo dyd la b ale isoud palomydes kneled doune vpon knee thanked syr launcelot whan syr launcelot sawe sir palomydes knele lyghtely toke hym vp sayd thus wete thou wel sir palomydes ony knyght land worship oughte veray ryght socoure rescowe soo noble knyghte ye proued renoumed thurgh oute alle reame endlonge ouerthwart thenne joye amonge oftyner syre palomydes sawe la beale isoud heuyer waxed day day thenne sir launcelot within thre four dayes departed hym rode sir ector de mary dynadan sir palomydes lefte sire tristram two monethes euer sire palomydes faded morned alle men merueylle wherfore faded soo aweye vppn day daunynge sire palomydes wente foreste hym self alone fond welle thenne loked welle water sawe owne vysage hou distourbled defaded nothyng lyke may meane said sire palomydes thus said hym self palomydes palamydes arte thow dyffaded thou wonte called one fayrest knyytes world wille lede lyf loue maye neuer gete recouer leyd hym doune welle thenne beganne make ryme la beale isoud hym pand meane whyle syr tristram day ryden forest chace herte greese sire tristram wold ryde huntynge neuer vnarmed cause syr breuse saunce pyte soo sir tristram rode forest vp doune herd one synge merueyllously lowde syre palomydes lay welle thenne syr tristram rode softely thyder demed knyght excaunt welle p whanne sire tristram came nyghe hym descended doune hors teyed hors fast tyl tree thenne came nere hym foote anone ware lay sire palomydes welle sange lowde meryly euer complayntes noble quene la beale isoud whiche merueyllously wonderfully wel sayd ful dolefully pytously made alle hole songe noble knyghte sire tristram herd begynnynge endynge whiche greued troubled hym sore p thenne last whanne sir tristram herd sir palomydes complayntes wrothe oute mesure thouyt slee hym lay thenne syr tristram remembryd hym self sir palomydes vnarmed noble name sir palomydes noble name hym self thenne made restraynte anger wente vnto sire palomydes softe paas said sir palomydes haue herd youre complaynte thy treason thow hast owed longe wete thou wel therfor thow shalt dye yf shame knyythode thow sholdest escape handes knowe wel thow hast awayted treason telle said syre tristram thow wolt acquyte sir said palomydes thus wille acquyte quene la beale isoud ye shal wete wel loue aboue ladyes world wel wote shalle befalle loue befelle noble knyghte syre kehydius dyed loue la beale isoud sir tristram wil ye wete haue loned la beale isoud many day hath ben causer worshyp el ben moost symplest knyght world cause haue wonne worshyp haue remembryd la beale isoud wanne worship someuer came party yet neuer reward bounte dayes lyf yet haue ben knyght gwerdonles therfor syr tristram ony deth drede hadde lyef dye lyue yf armed thow arte shold lyghtely doo batail wel haue ye vttered treason said tristram haue done yow treason said palomydes loue free alle men though haue loued lady lady wel haue wronge yf ony wronge ye reioyce haue desyre soo neuer neuer lyke haue yet shall loue vttermest dayes lyf wel ye pcapitulum lxxxvij thenne said syr tristram wil fyghte yow vttermest graunte saide palomydes better quarel kepe neuer fyghte dye handes better knyghtes handes may slayne sythen vnderstande shalle neuer reioyce la beale isoud haue good wylle dye lyue thenne sette ye day said sir tristram shalle doo bataille day xv dayes said payd palomydes wille mete yow medowe vnder ioyous gard fy shame said sire tristram wille ye sette soo longe day lete v fyghte morn soo sayd palomydes megre haue ben longe seke loue la beale isoud therfore wille repose tyl haue strengthe ageyne soo thenne sire tristram syr palomydes promysed feythfully mete welle day xv dayes remembryd said sir tristram palomydes ye brake one promyse whan rescowed yow breuse saunce pyte ix knyghtes thene ye promysed mete peron graue besydes camelot tyme ye fayled promyse wete wel said palomydes vnto sir tristram day pryson myghte holde promyse god helpe said sir tristram ye holden promyse werk ben tyme ryghte soo departed syre tristram sire palomydes soo sire palomydes tooke hors harneis rode vnto kynge arthur courte syr palomydes gat hym four knyghtes four sergeaunts armes soo retornod ageynward vnto ioyous gard meane whyle syr tristram chaced hunted alle maner venery aboute thre dayes afore bataille shold syr tristram chaced herte ther archer shot herte mysfortune smote syr tristram thyck thygh arowe slewe sir tristram hors hurte hym whan sir tristram hurte passynge heuy wete ye wel bled sore thenne took another hors rode vnto ioyous gard grete heuynesse promyse hadde made sir palomydes doo bataille hym within thre dayes ony hurte thyy wherfor ther neyther man ne woman coude chere hym ony thynge code make hym neyther quene la beale isoud euer demed syr launcelot smyten hym soo shold able doo bataille hym day sette pcapitulum lxxxviij bvt wyse knyghte aboute syr tristram wold byleue euer syr palomydes wold hurte sir tristram neyther owne handes none consentynge thenne whan fyftenth day come sir palomydes came welle four knyytes hym arthur courte thre sergeauntes armes ententente syr palomydes broughte knyytes hym sergeaunt armes shold bere record bataille betwixe syre tristram syr palomydes one sergeaunt brought helme spere thyrd swerd soo thus palomydes came folde abode nyghe two houres thenne sente squyer vnto syr tristram desyred hym come felde holde promyse whan squyer come ioyous gard anone sir tristram herd comynge lete commaunde squyer shold come presence lay bedde lord sir tristram said palomydes squyer wete yow wel lord palomydes abydeth yow felde wold wete whether ye wold doo bataille fair broder said sir tristram wete thou wel ryght heuy tydynges therfor telle sire palomydes wel atte ease wold lye shold haue noo nede sende myghte outher ryde goo thow shalt saye lyer syre tristram shewed hym thye wounde sixe inch depe thou hast sene hurte telle thy lord fayned mater telle hym leuer gold kyng arthur hole telle palomydes soone hole shal seke endlong ouerthwart yt promyse true knyyt euer may mete hym shal haue batail fylle squyer departed palomydes wist yt tristra hurt glad said sure shalle haue shame wote wel shold haue hard handelynge hym lykely muste nedes haue werse hardest knyghte bataylle lyuynge excepte sir launcelot thenne departed syr palomydes fortune ladde hym within moneth sir tristram hole hurte thenne took hors rode countray countrey straunge aduentures acheued someuer rode alweyes enquyred sire palomydes alle quarter sommer syr tristram coude neuer mete sir palomydes thus sir tristram soughte enquyred sire palomydes sir tristram encheued many grete batails thorugh alle noyse felle syr tristram seaced sir launcelot therfor syre launcelots bretheren kynnesmen wold haue slayne sire tristram cause fame whanne syre launcelot wyste kynnesmen sette said openly wete yow wel enuy yow alle soo hardy wayte vpon lord sire tristram ony hurte shame vylony true knyghte shalle slee best yow myne owne handes allas fy shame shold ye noble dedes awayte vpon hym slee hym ihesu defende said launcelot euer ony noble knyghte syre tristram shold destroyed treason noyse fame sprange cornewaile amonge lyonas wherof passynge gladde made grete ioye thenne lyonas sente letter vnto sire tristram recommendacyon many grete yeftes mayntene sir tristram estate euer bitwene sir tristram resorted vnto ioyous gard la beale isoud loued hym lyf phere endeth tenthe book whiche syr tristram pand foloweth enleuenth book whiche sir launcelot pcapitulum primum leue syr tristram de lyones speke sire launcelot du lake sire galahalt syr launcelots sone hou goten maner book frensshe reherceth afore tyme syre galahalt goten borne came hermyte vnto kynge arthur vpon whytsonday knyghtes satte table round whan heremyte sawe syege perillous asked kyng alle knyghtes sege voyd sir arthur alle knyghtes ansuerd ther shalle neuer none sytte syege one yf destroyed pthenne sayd hermyte wote ye nay said arthur alle knyghtes wote shalle sytte therin thenne wote said heremyte shal sytte vnborne vngoten yere shalle goten shalle sytte ther syege perillous shall wynne sancgreal whan hermyte made mensyon departed courte kynge arthur thenne feeste syr launcelot rode aduenture tyl tyme aduenture past ouer pounte corbyn sawe fayrest toure euer sawe ther vnder fayre towne ful peple alle peple men wymmen cryed one welcome sir launcelot du lake floure alle knyghthode alle shalle holpen oute daunger mene ye said sire launcelot ye crye soo vpon fayr knyght said alle within thys toure dolorous lady hath ben therin paynes many wynters dayes euer boyleth scaldynge water late said alle peple sire gawayne myght helpe soo lefte payne soo may saide syr launcelot leue payne wel sire gawayne dyd nay said peple knowe wel sir laucelot shalle delyuer wel said launcelot thenne shewe shalle doo thenne brought sire launcelot toure came chamber lady dores yron vnlocked vnbolted syr launcelot wente chambre hote ony stewe syr launcelot toke fayrest lady hand euer sawe naked nedel enchauntemet quene morgan le fay quene northgalys hadde put paynes cause called fairest lady countrey ben fyue yeres neuer myghte delyuerd oute grete paynes vnto tyme best knyghte world taken hand thenne peple broughte clothes whanne arayed syre launcelot thoughte fayrest lady word yf quene gueneuer thenne lady said sire launcelot syre yf hit please yow wille ye goo chappel may yeue louyng thankynge vnto god pmadame said sir launcelot cometh wille goo yow whanne came gaf thankynges god alle people lerned lowde gaf thankynges vnto god hym sayd sir knyght syn ye haue delyuerd lady ye shall delyuer v serpent tombe thenne syr launcelot tooke shelde said brynge thyder may doo vnto pleasyr god yow wille doo psoo whanne sir laucelot came thydder sawe wryten vpon tombe letter gold said thus shalle come lybard kynges blood shalle e serpent lybard shalle engendre lyon foreyn countrey whiche lyon shall passe alle knyghtes soo thenne sir launcelot lyfte vp tombe came horryble fyendly dragon spyttynge fyre oute mouthe thenne sir launcelot drewe swerd fought dragon longe atte laste grete payne sir launcelot slewe dragon alle came kynge pelles good noble knyght salewed syr launcelot hym ageyne fair knyghte sayd kynge name requyre knyythode telle pcapitulum ij syr said launcelot wete yow wel name syre launcelot du lake name sayd kyng pelles kynge foreyn countrey cosyn nyghe vnto ioseph armathye thenne eyther made moche soo wente castel take theyr repaste anone came doune wyndowe mouth semed lytel censer gold alle suche sauour alle spyecery world ben forth vpon table al maner mete drynkes coude thynke vpon soo cam damoysel passynge fayre yonge bare vessel gold betwixe handes therto kynge kneled deuoutely said prayer soo dyd alle ihesu said sir launcelot maye meane thys said kynge rychest thyng ony man hath lyuyng whanne thynge goth aboute round table shall broken wete thow wel said kynge holy sancgreal ye haue sene soo kynge sir lau celot ladde lyf moost parte daye fayne wold kynge pelles haue fond meane haue hadde syre launcelot haue layne doughter fayre elayne entent kyng knewe wel syr launcelot shold gete chyld vpon doughter whiche shold named sir galahalt good knyghte whome alle forayn countrey shold broughte oute daunger hym holy graale shold encheued p thenne came forth lady hyghte dame brysen said vnto kynge syr wete ye wel syre launcelot loueth lady world quene gueneuer therfore wyrche ye counceylle shalle make hym lye doughter shall wete lyeth quene gueneuer fayre lady dame brysen said kyng hope ye brynge syr said vpon payne lyf lete dele brysen one grettest enchauntresses tyme world lyuynge pthenne anone dame brysens wytte maade one come syr launcelot knewe wel man brouyt hym rynge quene gueneuer lyke hit hadde come suche one wonte moost parte sir laucelot sawe toke wete ye wel neuer soo fayne lady said syr launcelot castel case said messager fyue myle then thenne sir launcelot thoughte nyghte thenne brysen commaundement kynge pelles lote sende elayne castel xxv knyghtes vnto castel case thenne syr launcelot ageynst nyght rode vnto castel anone receyued worshipfully suche peple semyng aboute quene queneuer secrete soo whanne sir launcelot alyghte asked quene soo dame brysen said bedde thenne peple auoyded sir launcelot ledde vnto chamber thenne dame brysen broughte sir launcelot cup ful wyne anone dronken wyn soo assoted madde myghte make delay withouten ony lette wente bedde wende mayden elayne ben quene gueneuer wete yow wel sir launcelot glad soo lady elayne geten sir launcelot armes well knewe nyght shold goten vpon galahalt shold preue best knyghte world soo lay gyders vntyl vndorne morn alle wyndowes hole chamber stopped man ere day myghte sene thenne sire launcelot remembryd hym arose vp wente wyndowe pcapitulum tercium anone vnshet wyndowe enchau tement gone thene knewe hym self done amys allas sayd haue lyued long shamed soo thenne gat swerd hand said thow traitresse arte thow haue layn alle nyghte thow shalt dye ryghte handes thenne fayr lady elaye skypped oute bedde al naked kneled doune afore sir launcelot sayd fair curteis knyghte comen kynges blood requyre yow haue mercy vpon pand thow arte renoumed moost noble knyghte world slee haue wombe hym shal moost noblest knyyte world fals traitresse said syr launcelot hast thow bytrayed anone telle thow arte syr said elayn doughter kynge pelles wel said sire launcelot wyl forgyue yow dede took vp armes kyssed fayr lady lusty yonge wyse ony tyme lyuyng god helpe said sir launcelot may wyte thys yow made enchauntement vpon bytwene yow may fynde lady brysens shehalle lese hede wytchecraftes neuer knyghte deceyued soo nyghte soo syre launcelot arayed hym armed hym toke leue myldely lady yonge elayne soo departed thenne said lord sir launcelot biseche yow see soone ye may haue obeyed vnto prophecy fader teld commaudement fulfille prophecy haue gyuen grettest rychesse fayrest floure euer maydenhode shalle neuer haue ageyne therfore gentyl knyyt owe youre good wille soo syr launcelot arayed hym armed toke leue myldely yonge lady elayne soo departed rode tyl came castel corbyn fader fast tyme came delyuerd fayr chylde crystened hym galahalt wete ye wel child wel kepte wel nourisshed named galahalt cause syr launcelot named fontayne stone lady lake confermed hym sir launcelot du lake thenne lady delyuerd chirched came knyghte vnto name sire bromel la pleche whiche grete lord hadde loued lady longe euermore desyred wedde soo meane coude putte hym tyl day said syr bromel wete thow wel sir knyyt wille loue yow loue set vpon best knyyt world said syr bromel syr said syre launcelot du lake loue none therfore wowe lenger ye saye wel said sir bromel sythen ye haue told soo moche ye shalle haue lytel ioye sir launcelot shal slee hym someuer mete hym sire said lady elayne doo hym noo treason wete ye wel lady said bromel promyse yow twelue moneth shalle kepe pounte corbyn syr launcelots sake shalle neyther come ne goo vnto yow shall mete hym pcapitulum quartum thenne hit felle fortune aduenture sire bors de ganys neuewe vnto sir launcelot cam ouer brydge ther syre bromel sire bors iusted sir bors smote syre bromel suche buffet bare hym ouer hors croupe thenne syre bromel hardy knyghte pulled suerd dressid sheld doo bataille syr bors thenne syr bors alyyte auoyded hors dasshed gyders many sadde stroke long thus foughte tyl att laste syr bromel leyd erthe syre bors began vnlace helme slee hym thenne syr bromel cryed syre bors mercy yelded hym vpon couenaunt thou shalt haue thy lyf said syr bors soo thou goo vnto syr launcelot vp whytsondaye next cometh yelde vnto hym knyghte recreaunt wille doo hit said syr bromel sware vpon crosse swerd soo lete hym departe syr bors rode vnto kynge pelles within corbyn whanne kynge elayne doughter wist syr bors neuewe vnto syr launcelot made hym grete chere thenne said dame elayne merueyle sir launcelot came neuer one meruelle said sir bors half yere hath ben pryson quene morgan le fay kyng arthur syster allas said dame elayne repenteth euer syr bors beheld child armes euer hym semed passynge lyke sire launcelot truly said elayne wete ye wel child gat vp thene sir bors wepte ioye praid god myyt preue good knyghte fader soo cam whyte douue bare lytel censer gold mouthe alle maner mete drynkes mayden bare sancgreal said openly wete yow wel syr bors child galahalt shalle sytte sege peryllous encheue sancgreal shalle moche better euer sir launcelot du lake owne fader thenne kneled doune made theyre deuocyons suche sauour alle spyecery world ben whanne douue took flyghte mayden vanysshed sancgreal cam syr said sir bors vnto kynge pelles castel may named castel aduenturous many straunge aduentures sothe said kynge wel maye place called aduentures place come fewe knyghtes gone aweye ony worship neuer strong may preued late sire gawayne good knyght gate lytyl worship lete yow wete said kynge pelles shalle knyght wynne worship worship hym self good lyuynge loueth god dredeth god el geteth worshyp neuer soo hardy wonderful thyng said syr bors ye meane countrey wote ye haue many straunge aduentures therfor wyl lye castel nyghte ye shalle doo said kynge pelles counceyll hit hard ye escape withoute shame shalle take aduenture wille befalle said syr bors thenne counceyle yow said kynge confessid clene said sire bors wille shryuen good wylle soo syr bors confessyd al wymmen sir bors vyrgyne sauf one doughter kynge brangorys gat child hyghte elayne sauf syre bors clene mayden soo sir bors ledde vnto bed fayr large chamber many dores shette aboute chamber whan sir bors aspyed alle tho dores auoyded alle peple myght haue body hym wyse syr bors wold vnarme hym soo leid hym doune vpon bedde ryght soo sawe come lyghte myght wel see spere grete longe came streyghte vpon hym poyntelynge syre bors semed hede spere brente lyke tapre anon syr bors wyst spere hede smote hym sholder hand brede depnesse wound greued syre bors passynge sore thenne leyd hym doune ageyne payne anone alle came knyght armed shelde sholder suerd hande bad sir bors aryse syr knyyte fyghte sore hurte said yet shal fayle thenne syr bors starte vp dressid shelde thenne lasshed gydders myghtely grete whyle laste syr bors bare hym bakward vntyl came vnto cha ber dore knyghte yede chamber rested hym grete whyle whan hadde reposed hym came fresshely ageyne beganne newe bataille sir bors myghtely strongly pcapitulum quintum thenne sir bors thought shold goo chamber reste hym soo syr bors dressyd hym betwixe knyghte chamber dore sir bors smote hym doune thenne knyght yelded hym name said syr bors syr said name pedyuere streyte march soo syre bors made hym swere whytsonday next comyng atte court kyng arthur yelde hym prysoner ouercome knyghte handes syr bors soo thus departed syr pedyuere strayte march thenne syre bors layd hym doune reste thenne herd felt moche noyse chamber thenne sir bors aspyed ther came wist whether dores wyndowes shot arowes quarels soo thyck merueylled many felle vpon hym hurte hym bare place thenne syre bors ware came hydous lyon soo sire bors dressid hym vnto lyon anone lyon berafte hym sheld suerd syr bors smote lyon heed ryght soo syre bors forth sawe dragon courte passynge horryble semed letter gold wryten forhede sir bors thoughte letter made sygnyfycacyon kynge arthur ryghte soo came horryble lybard old foughte longe dyd grete batail gydere laste dragon spytte oute mouthe hit ben honderd dragon lyghtely alle smal dragon slewe old dragon tare hym pyeces anone alle came old man halle sa te hym doune fayre chayre semed se two edders aboute neck thenne old man harp sange old songe ioseph armathye came land thenne whanne songen old man bad sir bors go then shall ye haue mo aduentures ful worshypfully haue ye done better shalle ye doo thenne sir bors semed came whytest doune lytel golden senser mouthe anone alle te pest ceased passed afore merueyllous soo alle courte ful good sauours thenne syre bors sawe four child berynge four fayre tapres old man myddes child senser hys owne hand spere hand spere called spere vengeaunce pcapitulum sextum said old man sire bors goo ye cosyn syr launcelot telle hym aduenture whiche ben conuenyent hym al erthely knyytes synne soo foule hym may encheue suche holy dedes ben synne bad past al knyytes euer dayes telle thou sir launcelot alle worldly aduentures passeth manhode prowesse al spyrytuel mater shalle haue many better thenne sir bors sawe four gentylwymen come hym pou ely bisene sawe entrid chamber grete lyyte somer lyghte wymen kneled doune afore aulter syluer foure pyllowes hit ben bisshop kneled doune afore table syluer sire bors loked ouer hede sawe swerd lyke syluer naked houynge ouer hede clerenes smote soo eyen att tyme syre bors blynde herd wy said go hen thou syre bors yet thow arte worthy place thenne yede backward bedde tyl morne morne kynge pelles made grete ioye sir bors thenne departed rode camelot fonde sire launcelot du lake told hym aduentures sene kynge pelles corbyn soo noyse sprange arthur courte launcelot geten childe vpon elayne doughter kynge pelles wherfor quene gueneuer wrothe gafe many rebuke sir launcelot called hym fals knyghte thenne sire laucelot told quene made lye enchau tement lykenes quene soo quene helde sir lau celot excused book saith kyng arthur ben fraunce made warre vpon myghty kyng claudas wonne moche landes whanne kyng come ageyne lete crye grete feest al lordes ladyes al englond shold yf suche rebellion ageynst hym pcapitulum vij dame elayne doughter kyng pelles herd feeste wente fader requyred hym wold gyue leue ryde feest kyng ansuerd wel ye go thyder ony wyse ye loue wile haue blessyng ye wel bisene rychest wyse loke ye spare cost aske ye shalle haue alle yow nedeth thenne aduyse dame brysen mayden alle thynge apparaylled vnto purpose neuer lady rychelyer bysene rode xx knyytes x ladyes getilwymen nombre honderd horse whanne came camelot kynge arthur quene gueneuer sayd knyghtes dame elayne fayrest best bysene lady euer sene courte pand anone kynge arthur wyste come mette salewed soo dyd moost party al knyghtes round table bothe syr tristram sir bleoberys syr gawayne many moo wille reherce whanne syre launcelot sawe soo ashamed cause drewe swerd morne whan layne wold salewe speke yet syre launcelot thought fayrest woman euer sawe lyf dayes whanne dame elayn sawe syre launcelot wold speke vnto heuy wend herte wold haue brast wete wel oute mesure loued hym thenne elayne sayd vnto woman dame brysen vnkyndenesse syr launcelot sleeth nere pa pee madame said dame brysen wille vndertake nyghte shalle lye yow ye wold hold yow stylle leuer sayd dame elayne alle gold aboue erthe lete dele said dame brysen psoo whanne elayne broughte vnto quene gueneuer eyther made good chere countenaunce nothynge hertes alle men wymmen spake beaute dame elayne grete rychesses thenne nyghte quene commaunded dame elayne shold slepe chamber nyghe chamber alle vnder one roofe soo done quene commaunded pthenne quene sent syre launcelot badde hym come chamber nyghte el sure said quene ye go ladyes bed dame elayn whome ye gat galahalt madame said syr launcelot neuer saye ye dyd ageynste wille thenne said quene loke ye come whan send yow madame said launcelot shall fayle yow shall redy commmandemet bargayn soone done made bitwene dame bryson knewe craftes told hit lady dame elayne p allas said shall doo lete dele said dame brysen shalle brynge hym hand euen bedde shalle wene quene gueneuers messager pnow wel said dame elayne alle world loue soo moche doo syr launcelot pcapitulum viij soo whanne tyme came alle folkes bedde dame brysen came syr launcelots beddes syde said syre launcelot du lake slepe yow lady quene gweneuer lyeth awayteth vpon yow fayre lady sayd syr launcelot redy goo yow ye haue soo syr launcelot threwe vpon hym long gowne suerd hand thenne dame brysen took hym fynger ledde hym ladyes bedde dame elayne thenne departed lefte bedde gyders wete yow wel lady gladde soo syr launcelot wende another armes pnow leue kyssynge clyppynge kyndely thyng speke quene gueneuer sente one wymen vnto syr launcelots bed pand whan came fond bedde col e away soo came quene told alle allas said quene fals knyghte become thenne quene nyghe oute wytte thenne wrythed weltred mad woman myght slepe four fyue houres pthenne syre launcelot condycion vsed customme wolde clater slepe speke ofte lady quene gueneuer soo syr launcelot waked longe hit pleasyd hym thenne course kynde slepte dame elayne bothe slepe talked clatered iay loue ben betwixe quene gweneuer hym p soo talked soo lowde quene herde hym laye chamber herde hym soo clater nyghe woode mynde anger payne wist pand thenne coughed soo lowde syre launcelot awaked knewe hemynge p thenne knewe well lay quene lepte bed ben wood man sherte quene mett hym floore thus said fals traytour knyyt thow arte loke thow neuer abyde courte auoyde chamber soo hardy thow fals traytour knyyt thow arte euer thow come syghte allas sayd syr launcelot tooke suche hertely sorowe atte wordes f lle doune floore swoune alle quene gueneuer departed whanne syr launcelot awoke swoune lepte oute bay wyndowe gardyne thornes alle cratched vysage body soo ranne wyst whyder wylde wood euer man soo ranne two yere neuer man myghte haue grace knowe hym pcapitulum nonum torne vnto quene gueneuer fayr lady elayne whanne dame elayn herd quene soo rebuke syr launcelot also sawe swouned hou lepte oute bay wyndowe thenne said vnto quene gueneuer madame ye gretely blame syr launcelot haue ye lost hym sawe herd countenaunce mad euer allas madame ye doo grete synne self grete dishonour ye haue lord owne therfor youre parte loue hym quene world hath suche kynge ye haue yf ye myghte haue loue lord syr launcelot cause haue loue hym maydenhode hym haue borne fayre sone name galahalt shalle tyme best knyghte world pdame elayne said quene whanne hit daye lyght charge yow commaunde yow auoyde courte loue ye owe vnto sire launcelot discouer counceylle ye doo wille dethe said dame elayne dar vndertake marred euer haue ye made ye lyke reioyce hym made moost pytous grones whanne lepte oute yonder bay wyndowe euer herd man make allas sayd fayre elayne allas said quene gueneuer wote wel haue loste hym euer morne dame elayne took leue departe wold lenger abyde thenne kynge arthur brought waye mo honderd knyghtes thurgh forest pand way told sir bors de ganys alle hit betyd nyghte sir launcelot lepte att wyndowe araged oute wytte allas said syr bors lord sir launcelot become syr said elayne wote nere allas said syre bors betwixe yow bothe ye haue destroyed good knyghte said dame elayne sayd neuer dyd neuer thynge shold ony wyse displease hym rebuke quene gueneuer gaf hym sawe hym swoune erthe whanne awoke took swerd hand naked sauf sherte lepte oute wyndowe grysylyest grone euer herd man make pnow fare wel dame elayne saide syre bors hold lord arthur tale long ye wylle torne ageyne quene gueneuer gyue hete requyre yow euer ye wylle haue seruyse make good watche aspye yf euer ye may see lord sire launcelot ptruly sayd fayr elayne shalle doo alle may fayne wold knowe wete become yow ony kynne quene gueneuer cause grete ynough haue therto wel ony wete ye wel said fayre elayne sire bors wold lese lyf hym rather shold hurte allas cast neuer see hym chyef causer dame gueneuer p madame said dame brysen whiche made enchauntement betwix sir launcelot pray hertely lete syre bors departe hye hym al myyt fast may seke syre launcelot warne yow clene mynde yet shall wel holpen myracle thenne wepte dame elayne soo dyd syre bors de ganys soo departed syre bors rode streyghte vnto quene gueneuer whanne sawe sir bors wepte wood fy wepyng said sir bors de ganys ye wepe neuer whan bote allas said sir bors euer syr launcelots kynne sawe yow haue ye lost best knyght oure blood alle oure leder oure socour dare saye make good kynges crysten hethen may fynde suche knyghte speke nobylnesse curtosye beaute gentylnesse allas said sire bors shalle doo ben blood allas sayd ector de mary allas said lyonel pcapitulum x whanne quene herd saye soo felle erthe dede swoune thenne syr bors took vp dawed whanne awaked kneled afore thre knyghtes helde vp bothe handes besoughte seke hym spare noo goodes e founden wote oute mynde sir bors syr ector syr lyonel departed quene myght abyde lenger sorowe thenne quene sent tresour ynough theyr expencys took horse armour departed ne rode countrey countrey forestes wyldernes waste euer laid watche bothe att forestes alle maner men rode herken spere hym naked man sherte swerd hand p thus rode nyghe quarter yere endlonge ouerthwarte many place forestes wildernes oftymes euylle lodged sake yett alle theire laboure sekynge coude neuer word hym p wete yow well thre knyghtes passynge sory thenne laste sire bors felawes mette knyghte hyght syr melyon de tartare fayre knyyt said sir bors whether ye awey knewe eyther afore tyme sir said melyon way toward courte kyng arthur thenne praye yow sayd sire bors ye wille telle lord arthur lady quene gueneuer alle felaushyp roud table wyse telle syr launcelot become pthenne sire melyon departed sayd wold telle kynge quene alle felaushyp round table desyred hym soo whanne sire melyon came courte kynge arthur told kynge quene al felauship round table sir bors said syre launcelot thenne sire gawayne sire vwayne syr sagramor le desyrus syr aglouale syre percyuale de galys tooke vpon grete desyre kynge arthur especial quene seke thorou englond walys scotland fynde sire launcelot hem rode eyghten knyghtes moo bere felauship wete ye wel lacked maner spendyng soo thre twenty knyghtes pnow torne syre launcelot speke care woo payne endured cold honger thurste plente pand thus noble knyghtes rode gyders one assente departed thenne rode two thre foure fyue euer assigned shold mete soo sir aglouale syr percyuale rode gyders vnto theyr moder quene tho dayes whanne sawe two sone ioye wepte tendyrly thenne sayd dere sone whanne fader slayne l fte iiij sone whiche tweyn slayne dethe noble sone syre lamorak shalle herte neuer gladde thenne kneled doune vpon knee fore aglouale sir percyuale besoughte abyde home swete moder said syr percyuale may come kynges blood bothe partyes therfor moder kynde haunte armes noble dedes allas swete sone thenne sayd sake shalle lese lykynge lust thenne wynde weder may endure dethe fader kynge pellenore shamefully slayne handes syr gawayne broder syre gaherys slewe hym manly treason dere sone pyteous complaynte faders dethe consyderynge also dethe sire lamorak knyythode fewe felawee dere sone haue mynde thenne wepynge sobbynge courte whanne shold departe felle swounynge myddes courte pcapitulum xj whanne awaked sente squyer spendynge ynough soo whanne squyer ouertake wold suffre hym ryde hem sente hym home ageyne comforte theyr moder prayenge mekely blessynge squyer benyghted mysfortune happend come castel dwellid baroune p whanne squyer come castel lord asked hym whens came whome serued lord sayd squyer serue good knyghte called sire aglouale squyer said good entente wenynge vnto hym haue ben forborne syr aglouals sake han said serued quene aglouals moder wel felawe said lord castel syre aglouals sake thow shalt haue euyl lodgynge sir aglouale slewe b odr therfor thow shalt dye party payement pand thenne lord commaunded men haue hym aweye slee hym soo dyd soo pulled hym oute castel slewe bym without mercy pryghte morne came sire aglouale sire percyuale rydynge chirche yerd men wymmen besy beheld dede squyer thoughte berye hym said sir aglouale ye behold soo fast good man starte forthe said fayre knyghte lyeth squyer slayne shamefully nyght slayne fayr felawe said sir aglouale fayr syr said man lord castel lodged squyer nyght cause said seruaunt vnto good knyghte kynge arthur name syr aglouale therfor lord commaunded slee hym cause slayne gramercy said syr aglouale ye shalle see dethe reuenged lyghtely knyght whome squyer slayne thenne sir aglouale called vnto hym syr percyuale badde hym alyghte lyghtely soo alyghte bothe betoke theire horse men soo yede foote castel also soone within castel gate syre aglouale badde porter goo thow vnto thy lord telle hym syr aglouale whome squyer slayne nyyt anone porter told lord who name gode wyn anone armed hym thenne came court said whiche yow sir aglouale said aglouale cause slewest thow nyghte moders squyer slewe hym said syr goodewyn cause thow slewest broder syr gawdelyn thy broder sayd syr aglouale auowe hit slewe hym fals knyghte bitrayer ladyes good knyghtes dethe squyer thow shalt dye defye said sir goodewyn thenne lasshed gyders egerly hit ben two lyon syr percyuale fought alle remenaunt wold fyghte within whyle syr percyuale slayne alle wold withstande hym syr percyuale delt soo stroke soo rude durste man abyde hym within whyle sir aglouale sir goodewyn erthe vnlaced helme strake hede thenne departed took theyre horse thenne lete cary dede squyer vnto pryocy entered hym pcapitulum xij whanne done rode many countreyes euer enquyryng syr launcelot neuer coude hym laste came castell hyghte cardycan syre percyuale sire aglouale lodged gyders pryuely aboute mydnyyt sir percyuale came aglouals squyer sayd aryse make redy ye wylle ryde awey secretely sir said squyer wold ful fayne ryde yow ye wold haue lord broder take wille slee care thow shalle thy waraunt soo syr percyual rode tyl none thenne came vpon brydge stone fond knyght bounden chayne faste aboute wast vnto pyller stone fayre knyghte said bounden knyghte requyre lose boundes knyghte ye sayd syr percyuale cause ye soo bounden syre shalle telle yow said knyght knyyte table round name syre persydes thus aduentur came waye lodged castel atte brydge foote therin duelleth vncurtois lady cause profered peramour refused sette men vpon sodenly euer myghte come wepen thus bonde wote wel shal dye yf somme man worship breke bandes ye good chere said syr percyuale cause ye knyghte round table wel trust god breke youre bandes syr percyuale pulled swerd strake chayne suche myght cutte two chayne thoru syr percydes hauberk hurte hym lytel ihesu said sir persides myghty stroke euer felt one chayne ye hadde slayn al sire persydes sawe knyghte comyng oute castel al euer myghte flynge beware syr saide syre percydes yonder cometh man wille haue adoo lete hym come said syre percyuale mette knyghte myddes brydge sire percyuale gaf hym suche buffet smote hym quyte hors ouer parte brydge ben lytil vessel vnder brydge knyghte ben drouned thene sire percyual tooke knyghtes hors made sire percydes mounte vp hym soo rode vnto castel bad lady delyuer syre persydes seruaunts el wold slee alle euer fonde soo fere delyuerd alle thenne syre percyuale ware lady stode toure madame sayd syre percyuale vse customme lady destroye good knyghtes yf wylle peramour sothe shameful customme lady yf grete mater hand shold fordoo euylle custommes soo syr percydes brouyte syr percyuale vnto owne castel made hym grete chere alle nyghte morne whanne syr percyuale herd masse broken fast badde syr persydes ryde vnto kynge arthur telle kynge ye mette telle broder syre aglouale rescowed yow bydde hym seke quest seke sir launcelot du lake though seke shalle fynde telle hym wille neuer see hym courte tyl haue fond syre launcelot also telle sir kay seneschal syr mordred truste ihesu grete worthynes eyther telle shal neuer forgete theire mockes scornes day made knyghte telle wil neuer see courte tyl men speke worship euer men dyd ony bothe soo syre percydes departed syr percyuale thenne rode vnto kyng arthur told sire percyuale whan sire aglouale herd hym speke broder syr percyuale sayd departed vnkyndely pcapitulum xiij syr sayd syre percydes lyf shalle pr ue noble knyghte ony lyuynge whanne sawe sire kay syr mordred syr percydes said thus fayre lordes bothe syr percyuale greteth yow wel bothe sente word trusteth god euer come courte ageyne grete noblesse euer ye bothe mo men speke noblesse euer yow hit maye wel sayd syr kay syre mordred tyme whanne made knyghte ful vnly e preue good knyght sayd kynge arthur must nedes preue good knyghte fader bretheren noble knyghtes wille tourne vnto syr percyuale rode longe forest mette knyghte broken shelde broken helme soone eyther sawe redyly made redy iuste soo hurteled gyders alle myghte theyr horse gyders soo hard syre percyuale smyten erthe thenne syr percyuale arose lyghtely caste shelde sholder drewe swerd badde knyghte alyghte doo bataille vnto vttermest wylle ye sayd knyghte alyghte putte hors fro hym thenne came gyders esy paas lasshed gyder noble suerdes somtyme stroke somtyme foyned eyther gaf many grete woundes thus fought nere half daye neuer rested ryghte lytel none lasse woundes xv bledde soo moche merueyl stode feete knyghte foughte syre percyuale proued knyghte wyse fyghtynge knyghte syre percyuale yonge stronge knowyng fyghtyng thenne sir percyuale spake fyrste sayd syre knyghte hold thy hand whyle stille haue fouyten symple mater quarel ouer longe therfor requyre telle thy name neuer tyme matched soo god help sayd knyghte neuer tyme neuer knyght wounded soo sore thow hast done yet haue foughten many batails shalt thow wete knyghte table round name syr ector de mary broder vnto good knyghte syr launcelot du lake allas said syr percyual name syre percyuale de galys hath maade quest seke syr launcelot seker shall neuer fynysshe quest ye haue slayne handes soo said sire ector slayne youre handes maye lyuote therfor requyre yow sayd sire ector vnto syr percyuale ryde ye pryory brynge preest may receyue saueour may lyue whanne ye come courte kynge arthur telle broder sire launcelot ye slewe thenne wold mortal enemy ye may say slayne quest soughte hym allas said sire percyuale ye saye thynge neuer wille soo faynte bledynge maye vnnethe stande shold thenne take hors pcapitulum xiiij thenne made bothe grete dole oute mesure wille auayle said sire percyuale thenne kneled doune made prayer deuoutely vnto al myghty ihesu one best knyghtes world tyme whome veray feythe stode moost pryght soo came holy vessel sancgreal alle maner swetnes sauour coude redyly see bare vessel syre percyuale hadde glemerynge vessel mayden bare hit parfyte clene mayden forth al bothe hole hyde lymme euer theire lyf dayes thenne gaf thankynges god grete myldenesse ihesu said syr percyuale maye meane thus heled ryghte poynt dyenge wote ful wel said sire ector holy vessel borne mayden therin parte hooly blood oure lord ihesu crist blessid mote may sene said syr ector yf hit parfyte man soo god help said syr percyuale sawe damoysel thoughte alle whyte vessel handes forth al hole soo thenne toke horse harneis amended theire harneis wel myghte broken soo mounted vpon theyr horse rode talkynge gyders sir ector de mary told sire percyuale hadde soughte broder syr launcelot longe neuer coude wetynge hym many straunge aduentures haue ben queste soo eyther told aduentures phere endeth enleuenth booke pand foloweth twelfth boook pcapitulum primum leue whyle syr ector syre percyuale speke sir launcelot suffred endured many sharp shoures euer ranne wylde wood place place lyued fruyt suche myght gete dranke water two yere clothyng lytel sherte breche pthus sir lau celot wandred came fayre medowe fond pauelione vpon tree henge whyte shelde two swerdes henge two speres lened tree pand whanne syr launcelot sawe swerdes anone lepte one swerd tooke hit hand drewe hit oute thenne lasshed sheld alle medowe range dyntes gaf suche noyse ten knyghtes foughten gyders thenne came forthe dwerf lepte vnto syr launcelot wold haue suerd oute hand thenne syre launcelot took hym bothe sholders threwe hym ground vpon neck al moost broken neck alle dwerf cryed helpe thenne came forth lykely knyghte wel apparaylled scarlet furred myneuer anone sawe syr launcelot demed shold oute wytte thenne said fayre speche good man leye doune swerd semeth thow haddest nede slepe warme clothes welde swerd said syr launcelot come nyy thow doo wete thou wel wille slee knyghte pauelione sawe starte bakward pauelione thenne dwerf armed hym lyghtely soo knyghte thought force myghte take swerd syr launcelot soo came steppynge oute whanne syr launcelot sawe hym come alle armed hys swerd hand thenne sire launcelot flewe hym suche myghte hytte hym vpon helme suche buffet stroke troubled braynes suerd brak thre knyght felle erthe hadde ben dede blood brastynge oute mouthe nose eres thenne syr launcelot ranne pauelione rasshed euen warme bedde lady bedde gat smock ranne oute pauelione whanne sawe lord lye ground lyke dede thenne cryed wepte ben madde thenne noyse knyghte awaked swoun loked vp wekely eyen thenne asked madde man gyuen hym suche buffet suche buffet neuer man hand sir sayd dwerf worship hurte hym man oute wytte doubte ye hath ben man grete worship somme hertely sorow hath taken fall n madde besemeth said dwerfe resembleth moche vnto sir launcelot hym sawe grete turnement besyde lonezep ihesu defende said knyghte euer noble knyght syre launcelot shold suche plyte someuer said knyghte harme wille none doo hym knyghtes name blyaunt thenne said vnto dwerf goo thow fast horsbak vnto broder syr selyuaunt castel blank telle hym myn aduenture bydde hym brynge hym hors lytter thenne wille bere knyghte vnto castel pcapitulum ij soo dwerf rode fast came ageyne broughte syr selyuaunt hym syxe men hors lytter soo took vp fether bedde syre launcelot soo caryed alle awey hem vnto castel blank neuer awaked tyl within castel thenne bounde handes f gafe hym good mete good drynkes broughte hym ageyne strengthe fayrenesse wytte coude brynge hym ageyn knowe hym self thus syr launcelot yere half honestly arayed fayre farne alle thenne vpon day lord castel syr blyaunt took armes horsbak spere seke aduentures rode forest ther met hym two knyghtes aduenturous one breuse saunce pyte broder syr bertelot two ranne attones vpon syr blyaunt brake speres vpon body thenne drewe oute swerdes made grete bataill fought long gyders last syr blyaunt sore wounded felte hym self faynte thenne fled horsbak toward castel cam hurlyng vnder castel sir launcelot lay wyndowe sawe two knyghtes layd vpon syr blyaunt swerdes whanne sir launcelot sawe yet woode sory lord syr b yaunt thenne sir launcelot brake chaynes fro legges armes brekyng hurte handes sore sir launcelot ran posterne mett two knyytes chaced sir blyaunt pulled doun sir bertelot bare handes hors wrothe hys suerd hand lepte vnto syr bruse gaf hym suche buffet vpon hede tumbled bakward ouer hors croupe whan sir bertolet sawe broder haue suche falle gat spere hand wold haue ronne syr launcelot thurgh sawe sir blyaunt strake hand syr bertelot thenne syr bruse sir bertelot gat theyr horse fled away whan syre selyuaunt came sawe syr launcelot done brother thenne thanked god dyd broder euer dyd hym ony good pbut whanne sire blyaunt sawe syr launcelot hurte brekyng yrons thene heuy euer bound hym bynde hym said syr selyuaunt happy gracyous thenne made grete ioye syr launcelot bound hym soo abode half yere morne erly syr launcelot ware came grete bore many houndes nyghe hym bore byg ther myghte houndes tere hym hunter came blowyng horne bothe vpon horsbak vpon foote thenne sir launcelot ware one alyght teyed hors tree lened spere ageynste tree pcapitulum iij soo came syr launcelot fonde hors bounden tyl tree spere lenyng ageynst tree swerd teyed sadel bowe thenne sir launcelot lepte sadel gat spere hand thenne rode bore thenne syre laucelot ware bore set ar tree fast hermytage thenne sir launcelot ranne atte bore spere ther bore torned hym nemly rafe longes hert hors launcelot felle erthe euer sire launcelot myyt gete hors bore rafe hym brawne thyy vp hough bone thenne sir launcelot wrothe vp gat vpon foot drewe swerd smote bore hede one stroke came heremyte sawe hym haue suche wound thenne heremyte came sir launcelot bemoned hym wold haue hym home vnto hermytage whan syr launcelot herd hym speke wroth wound ranne vpon heremyte haue slayne hym heremyte ranne awey whan sir laucelot myght ouer gete hym threwe swerd hym syr launcelot myght tho ferther bledyng thene heremyte torned ageyn asked sir launcelot hurte felawe said sir launcelot bore hath beten sore thenne come said heremyte shalle hele yow goo thy wey said sir launcelot dele thenne heremyte ranne way mette good knyghte many men sir said heremyte fast place goodlyest man euer sawe sore wounded bore yet hath slayne bore wel wote sayd heremyte holpen goodly man shall dye wounde grete pyte thenne knyghte atte desyre heremyte gat carte carte knyghte putte bore sir launcelot sir lau celot soo feble myghte ryght easyly deale wyth hym soo syr launcelot broughte vnto hermytage heremyte heled hym wound heremyte myghte fynde syr launcelots sustenaunce enpayred waxed feble bothe body wyt defaute sustenaunce waxed wooder afore hand thenne vpon day syr launcelot ran waye forest aduenture came cyte corbyn dame elayne bare galahalt syr launcelots sone soo whan entryd toun ranne thurgh towne castel thenne alle yonge men cyte ranne sir launcelot threwe turues hym gaf hym many sadde stroke euer syre launcelot myghte ouer retche ony threwe soo wold neuer come handes brake legges armes fledde castel thenne came oute knyghtes squyers rescowed syr launcelot whan beheld hym loked vpon person thought sawe neuer goodly man whan sawe many woundes vpon hym alle demed ben man worship thenne ordeyned hym clothes body strawe vndernethe hym lytel hous thene euery day wold throwe hym mete sette hym drynke fewe wold brynge hym mete handes pcapitulum iiij soo befelle kynge pelles neuewe name castor desyred kyng made knyghte atte request castor kynge made hym knyghte feest candelmasse whanne syr castor made knyghte day gaf many gownes thenne sir castor sente foole syr launcelot come afore syr castor gaf sir launcelot robe scarlet alle longed vnto hym whanne syr launcelot soo arayed lyke knyghte semelyest man alle courte none wel made whanne sawe tyme went gardyn syre launcelot leid hym doune welle slepte soo none dame elayne maydens came gardyn playe romed vp doun one dame elayns maydens aspyed laye goodely man welle slepynge anone shewed hym dame elayne pee said dame elayne saye word thenne broughte dame elayne laye whan beheld hym anone felle remembraunce hym knewe hym veryly syr launcelot alle felle wepyng soo hertely sanke euen erthe whanne thus wepte grete whyle thenne aroos called maydens said seke yede gardyn wente streyghte fader toke hym parte self thenne said fader haue nede help yf ye helpe farewel good dayes euer doughter said kyng pelles sir said thus gardyn went sporte welle fonde syr launcelot du lake slepyng may bileue said kyng pelles syre said truly semeth shold distracte oute witte thenne hold yow stille said kyng lete dele thenne kyng called hym suche trusted iiij person dame elayn douyter whan cam welle beheld syr launcelot anone dame brysen knewe hym sire saide dame brysen muste wyse dele hym knyghte oute mynde yf awake hym rudely wil doo al knowe ye shal abyde shalle throwe suche enchauntement vpon hym shal awake within space houre dyd pthenne within lytel whyle kyng commaunded peple shold auoyde none shold way kyng wold come soo whan done four men ladyes layd hand syr launcelot soo bare hym toure soo chamber holy vessel sancgreal force syr launcelot laid holy vessel came holy man vnhylled vessel soo myracle vertu holy vessel syr launcelot heled recouerd whanne awaked groned syghed complayned gretely passynge sore pcapitulum v whanne sir launcelot sawe kynge pelles elayne waxed ashamed said thus lord ihesu came goddes sake lord lete wete came sir said dame elayne thys countrey ye cam lyke madde man clene oute wytte haue ye ben kepte foole creature knewe ye vntyl fortune mayden myn broughte vnto yow ye lay slepynge welle anone veryly beheld yow knewe yow thenne told fader ye broughte afore holy vessel vertu thus ye helyd ihesu mercy said sire launcelot yf sothe many knowen woodenes soo god help sayd elayne mo fader dame brysen crystes loue said sir launcelot kepe hit counceylle lete noo man knowe hit world sore ashamed haue ben thus myscaryed bannysshed oute countrey logrys euer saye countrey englond soo syr launcelot lay fourtenyghte euer myghte stere sorenes thenne vpon day sayd vnto dame elayne wordes lady elayne sake haue moche trauaill care anguysshe nedeth reherse hit ye knowe withstandyng knowe wel haue done foule yow whan drewe swerd haue slayn vpon morn whan layn yow alle cause ye dame brysen made lye yow maulgre myn hede ye saye nyghte galahalt sone begoten trouthe sayd dame elayne pnow wille ye loue said sire launcelot goo vnto fader gete place hym wherin maye dwelle courte kynge arthur maye neuer come syr said dame elayne lyue dye yow sake yf lyf myghte auaile dethe myghte auaile yow wete wel wold dye sake wille go fader sure thynge desyre hym shalle haue hit ye lord syr launcelot doubte ye wille yow alle seruyse may soo forth alle wente fader said syre lord syr launcelot desyreth yow castel wel doughter said kynge sythe hit desyre abyde march shalle castel blyaunt shalle ye hym twenty fayrest ladyes ben countrey shalle alle grete blood ye shalle haue ten knyghtes yow doughter wille ye wete alle ben honoured blood sire launcelot pcapitulum vj thenne wente dame elayne vnto syr launcelot told hym alle fader deuysed hym thenne cam knyyt syr castor neuewe vnto kyng pelles vnto syr launcelot asked hym name sir said syr launcelot name le cheualer malfet say knyyt hath trespaced sir said sir castor may wel euer semeth name shold syr laucelot du lake haue sene yow sir said launcelot ye gentyl knyyt put caas name syr laucelot lyste discouer name shold greue kepe counceyl ye hurte ther wete thou wel euer lye power shal greue yow promyse truly thenne sir castor kneled doune besouyt sir laucelot mercy shal neuer vtter ye whyle ye partyes thenne sire launcelot pardonned hym pand thenne kynge pelles x knyghtes dame elayne twenty ladyes rode vnto castel blyaunt stood iland beclosed yron fayr water depe large pand whanne syr launcelot lete calle hit ioyous yle called none wyse le cheualer malfet knyghte hath trespaced thenne sire launcelot lete make hym shelde alle sabel quene crowned myddes alle syluer knyghte clene armed knelyng afore euery day one ony myrthes alle ladyes myyt make hym wold one euery day loke toward realme logrys kynge arthur quene gueneuer thenne wold falle vpon wepyng hert shold braste soo hit felle tyme syr launcelot herd iustynge fast castel within thre leghes thenne called vnto hym dwerf badde hym goo vnto instynge euer knyghtes departe loke thow make crye herynge alle knyghtes one knyghte ioyous yle castel blyaunt saye name le cheualer malfet wille iuste ageynste knyghtes wille come putteth knyghte werse shalle haue fayr mayde ierfaucon capitulum septimum soo whanne crye made vnto ioyous yle drewe knyghtes nomber fyue honderd wete ye wel neuer sene arthur dayes one knyght dyd soo moche dedes armes syre launcelot dyd thre dayes gyders booke maketh truly mencyon better fyue honderd knyghtes ther one slayne syr launcelot maade alle grete feest meane whyle came syr percyual de galys syr ector de mary vnder castel called ioyous yle beheld gay castel wold haue gone castel myghte brode water brydge coude fynde none thenne sawe syde lady sperhault sir percyual called vnto asked lady castel fair knyghtes said within thys castel fayrest lady land name elayne also haue castel fayrest knyghte myghtyest man dar saye lyuynge called hym self le cheualer mal fett came march sayd syr percyuale truly said damoysel came countrey lyke madde man dogges boyes chacyng hym thorou cyte corbyn holy vessel nke greal broughte wytte ageyne wil doo batail noo knyghte vndorne none yf ye lyste come castel sayd lady ye muste ryde vnto ferther syde castel shalle ye fynde vessel wille bere yow hors thenne departed came vnto vessel thenne syre percyual alyghte sayd sire ector de mary ye shalle abyde vntyl wete maner knyghte shame vnto v moche one knyghte shold doo batail hym doo ye ye lyste said sire ector shalle abyde yow vntyl yow thenne passed sire percyual water whanne cam castel gate bad porter goo thow good knyghte within castel telle hym come erraut knyghte iuste hym sir said porter ryde ye within castel comyn place iustynge lordes ladyes maye behold yow anone syr launcelot warnynge soone redy syr percyual sir launcelot encountred suche myghte theire speres soo rude horse knyghtes felle erthe thenne auoyded horse flange oute noble swerdes hewe awey cantels theire sheldes hurtled gyder sheldes lyke two bore eyther wounded passynge sore last syr percyual spake fyrst whanne foughten two houres fair knyghte said syre percyuale requyre telle thy name mette neuer suche knyghte sir said syr launcelot name le cheueler mal fet telle youre name saide syre launcelot requyre yow gentyl knyghte truly said sire percyual name syr percyual de galis broder vnto good knyghte syre lamozak de galys kynge pellenore oure fader syre agloual broder allas said sire launcelot haue done fyghte yow art knyghte table round somtyme felawe pcapitulum viij alle syre launcelot kneled doune vpon knee threwe awey sheld suerd hym whanne sire percyual sawe hym doo merueyled mened thenne thus said syre knyghte someuer thow requyre vpon hyghe ordre knyghthode telle thy true name thenne said god help name syre launcelot du lake kynge ban sone benoy allas said syr percyual haue done sente quene seke yow soo haue soughte yow nygh two yere yonder syre ector de mary broder abydeth syde yonder water goddes sake said sire percyual forgyue myn offencys haue done hit soone forgyuen said syre launcelot thenne syre percyual sente syr ector de mary whanne syr launcelot syghte hym ranne vnto hym took hym armes thene syr ector kneled doune eyther wepte vpon pyte beholde thenne came dame elayne maade grete chere myghte lye power told syr ector syr percyual manere sir launcelot came countrey heled hit knowen longe syr launcelot syre blyaunt syr selyuaunt fyrste mette departed cause bore heremyte heled syre launcelot grete woud came corbyn pcapitulum ix leue sire launcelot ioyous yle lady dame elayne syr percyual sir ector playenge hem torne syr bors de ganys sire lyonel soughte sire launcelot nygh space two yere neuer coude hym thus rode aduenture cam hous brandegore syr bors wel knowen geten child vpon kynges doughter fyften yere forne name helyn le blank whanne syre bors sawe child hit lyked hym passynge wel tho knyghtes good chere kynge brandegore pand morne syre bors came afore kynge brandegore said sone helyn le blanck sayd sone sythe hit soo wille ye wete wil haue hym vnto courte kynge arthur sir sayd kynge ye maye wel take hym ouer tender age sayd syre bors wille haue hym brynge hym hows worship world soo whanne syre bors shold departe made grete sorowe departynge helyn le blanck grete wepynge made sire bors syre lyonel departed within whyle came camelot kynge arthur whanne kynge arthur vnderstood helyn le blank kynge bors sone neuewe vnto kynge brandegore thenne kynge arthur lete hym make knyghte round table soo preued good knyght aduenturous pnow wille torne mater sire launcelot hit befelle vpon day syr ector syr percyual cam syr launcelot asked hym wold doo whether wold goo vnto kynge arthur nay sayd syr laucelot may meane venetreted courte cast neuer come sir said syr ector youre broder ye man world loue moost yf vnderstode disworship ye may vnderstande wold neuer counceyle yow ther kynge arthur al knyghtes especial quene gueneuer maade suche dole sorowe hit merueyle see ye muste remembre grete worship renoume ye ye haue ben spoken ony knyghte lyuynge none bereth name ye syr tristram therfore broder sayd syre ector make yow redy ryde courte v dar say neuer knyghte better welcome court ye wote wel make good said syr ector hath coste lady quene twenty thowsand pound sekynge yow wel broder said sire launcelot wil doo counceil ryde yow soo thenne took horse made redy took leue kyng pelles dame elayne whanne syre launcelot shold departe dame elayne made grete sorowe lord syr launcelot said dame elayne feest pentecost shall sone myn galahalt made knyghte fully xv wynter old doo ye lyst said sir launcelot god gyue hym grace preue good knyghte sayd dame elayne doubte shal preue best man kyn excepte one thenne shalle man good ynough said syre launcelot pcapitulum x thenne departed within fyue dayes iourney came camelot called englyssh wynchester whanne syre launcelot come among kynge knyghtes made grete ioye hym syre percyual de galys sire ector de mary beganne told hole aduentures syre launcelot ben mynde tyme absence called hym self le cheueler malefet knyyt trespaced thre dayes sir launcelot smote doun fyue honderd knyghtes euer sire ector sire percyual told tale syre launcelot quene gueneuer wepte shold haue dyed thenne quene made grete chere ihesu sayd kynge arthur merueyle cause ye syre launcelot wente mynde many deme loue fayre elayne doughter kynge pelles whome ye ar noysed ye haue goten child name galahalt men saye shalle doo merueylles lord sayd syr launcelot yf dyd ony foly haue souyt alle kynge spak sire launcelots kynne knewe whome wente oute mynde thenne grete feestes made grete ioye many grete lordes ladyes whanne herd sir launcelot come courte ageyne made grete ioye pcapitulum xj wille leue mater speke sire tristram syr palomydes sarasyn vncrystened whanne syr tristram come home vnto ioyous gard aduentures alle whyle syr launcelot thus myst two yere syre tristram bare renomme thurgh alle realme logrys many straunge aduentures befelle hym ful wel manly worshipfully broughte hem ende pso whanne come home la beale isoud told hym grete feest shold pentecost next folowyng told hym sir launcelot ben myst two yere al whyle ben oute mynde holpen holy vessel sancgreal allas said syr tristram caused debate betwixe hym quene gueneuer syr said dame isoud knowe hit quene gweneuer sente letter whiche wrote alle hit requyre yow seke hym blessid god said la beale isoud hole sound come ageyne courte therof glad said syr tristram shal ye make v redy ye wille atte feest sir said isoud hit please yow wille thorugh ye marked many good knyghtes caused yow haue moche labour sake nedeth yow thenne wille said syr tristram yf ye god defende said la beale isoud thenne shal spoken shame amonge alle quenes ladyes estate ye ar called one noblest knyghtes world ye knyghte round table maye ye myst feest shalle said amonge knyghtes see sire tristram hunteth hawketh coureth within castel lady forsaketh worshyp allas shalle say hit pyte euer made knyght euer shold haue loue lady also shal quenes ladyes saye hit pyte haue lyf wille holde soo noble knyghte ye ar worship soo god help said syre tristram vnto la beale isoud hit passynge wel sayd yow nobly counceyled well vnderstande ye loue lyke ye haue counceyled wille doo parte halle man childe ryde self soo wille ryde tewesday next comyng harneis werre spere suerd pcapitulum xij soo whanne daye came syre tristram toke leue la beale isoud sente hym iiij knyghtes within half myle sente ageyne within myle sir tristram sawe afore hym sir palomydes stryken doune knyghte al moost wounded hym dethe thenne syr tristram repentyd hym armed thenne houed stylle sir palomydes knewe syr tristram cryed hygh syr tristram mette departe wille redresse old sore said sir tristram yet neuer cristen man myghte make boost euer fledde hym wete ye wel syr palomydes thow arte saresyn shal neuer make thy boost syr tristram de lyones shall flee syr tristram made hors renne myghte came streyghte vpon syr palomydes bra e spere vpon hym honderd pyeces forth alle sir tristram drewe swerd thenne torned hors stroke palomydes vj grete stroke vpon helme thenne sir palomydes stode stylle beheld syre tristram merueyled woodenes foly thenne sir palomydes sayd hym self sir tristram armed hard ace hym bataille yf torne ageyne slee hym ashamed someuer goo thenne syr tristram spake said p thow coward knyghte castest thow doo wolt thow doo bataille haue thow noo doubte shalle endure alle thy malyce syr tristram said palomydes ful wel thou wotest maye fyghte shame thow arte naked armed yf slee dishonour shal myn wel thow wotest said syr palomydes sir tristram knowe thy strengthe thy hardynesse endure ageynst good knyghte trouthe said syr tristram vnderstande thy valyauntnesse wel ye saye wel said syr palomydes requyre yow telle question shalle saye yow telle hit said syr tristram shalle ansuer yow trouthe god helpe putte caas said sir palomydes ye armed al ryytes wel naked ye wold ye doo true knyghthode said syr tristram vnderstande wel syr palomydes must say myn iugement god blysse shalle say shal said fere haue wete sir palomydes tyme thou sholdest departe wold haue adoo wil said palomydes therfor ryde forth thy way maye chese said sir tristram outher ryde abyde sir palomydes said sir tristram merueille one thyng thow art soo good knyghte thow wolt crystened thy broder syr safere hath ben crystened many daye pcapitulum xiij said sire palomydes may yet cristened one auowe haue made many yeres gone herte bileue ihesu crist mylde moder mary haue one batail done wil baptysed good wille pby hede sayd tristram one bataille thou shat seke lenger god defende said sir tristram thury defaute thou sholdest lenger lyue thus sarasyn yonder knyghte ye syre palomydes haue hurte smyten doune helpe armed armour shalle soone fulfylle thyne auowes ye wille said palomydes soo shalle soo rode bothe vnto knyghte satte vpon bank thenne sir tristram salewed hym wekely salewed hym ageyne sir knyyt said sir tristram requyre yow telle ryghte name sir sayd name syr galleron galway knyghte table round soo god help said sir tristram ryghte heuy hurtes alle must praye yow lene alle hole armour ye see vnarmed must doo batail knyght syr said hurte knyghte ye shalle haue hit good ye muste beware warne yow knyghte wyghte syr sayd galeron praye yow telle name knyghtes name yt hath beten sir name sir tristram de lyones knyghtes name hath hurte syr palomydes broder good knyghte syre safere yet syr palomydes vncrystened allas said syr galleron pyte soo good knyghte soo noble man armes shold vncrystened soo god help said sir tristram outher shalle slee hym shalle crystened euer departe sonder lord syr tristram said sir galeron renoume worship wel knowen thorou many reames god saue yow day senshyp shame thenne syr tristram vnarmed galeron whiche noble knyghte done many dedes armes large knyghte flesshe boone whan vnarmed stood vpon foot brysed bak spere yet soo syr galleron myghte armed syr tristram thenne syr tristram mounted vpon owne hors hand gat syr gallerons spere al syr palomydes redy soo came hurtlynge gyders eyther smote myddes theyr sheldes al sir palomydes spere brak syre tristram smote doune hors sir palomydes soone myghte auoyde hors dressid sheld pulled oute swerd sawe sir tristram al alyght teyed hors tyl tree pcapitulum xiiij thenne came gyders two wyld bore lasshynge gyders tracyng trauercyng noble men ofte ben wel proued batail euer syr palomydes dredde myghte syre tristram therfor suffred hym brethe hym thus fought two houres often syr tristram smote suche stroke sir palomydes made hym knele syre palomydes brake cutte awey many pyeces sir tristram shelde thenne sir palomydes wounded sir tristram wel fyghtynge man thenne sire tristram woode wrothe oute mesure rasshed vpon syr palomydes suche myghte sire palomydes felle grouelynge erthe alle l pte vp lyghtely vpon foot thenne syre tristram wounded palomydes sore thurgh sholder euer syr tristram foughte stylle lyke hard syr palomydes fayled gaf hym many sadde stroke atte laste syr tristram doubled stroke fortune syre tristram smote syr palomydes swerd oute hand yf sir palomydes stouped swerd ben slayne thenne palomydes stode stylle beheld swerd sorouful herte said syr tristram vnto palomydes haue auauntage thow haddest daye shalle neuer said courte among good knyghtes syr tristram shalle slee ony knyghte wepenles therfor take thow thy swerd lete v make ende thys batail doo batail sayd palomydes dar ryyt wel ende hit haue grete luste fyghte cause said palomydes myn offence yow soo grete may frendes alle haue offended loue la beale isoud dar say pyerles aboue alle ladyes also proferd neuer dishonour haue geten moost parte worship sythen offended neuer owne persone offence haue done ageynste owne persone offence ye haue gyuen day many sad stroke haue yeuen yow ageyne dar say felte neuer man myghte soo wel brethed yf hit syr launcelot du lake wherfor requyre yow lord forgyue alle haue offended vnto yow day haue next chirche fyrst lete clene confessed see yow truly baptysed thenne wil alle ryde gyders vnto courte arthur hyhe feeste take hors said sir tristram ye say soo hit shal alle thyn euylle wil god forgyue yow doo within myle suffrecan carl l shalle gyue yow sacrament baptym thenne took horse sire galleron rode wyth p whanne cam suffrecan syre tristram told hym desyre thenne suffrecan lete fylle grete vessel water whanne halowed hit thenne confessid clene syr palomydes syr tristram sir galleron godfaders thenne soone departed rydynge toward camelot kynge arthur quene gueneuer moost party alle knyghtes round table kynge alle court glad syre palomydes crystened feeste came galahad sat sege perillous p soo alle departed disseuered alle knyghtes round table sire tristram retorned ayene vnto ioyous gard syr palomydes folowed questynge beest phere endeth second book syr tristram drawen oute frensshe englysshe rehersal thyrd book pand foloweth noble tale sancgreal called hooly vessel sygnefycacyon blessid blood lord ihesu cryste blessid mote whiche brought land ioseph armathye therfor al synful soul blessid lord haue thou mercy pexplicit liber xij et incipit decimustercius p capitulum primum vygyl pentecost whan alle felauship round table comen vnto camelot herd seruyse table set redy mete ryyte entryd halle ful fayre gentylwoman horsbak ryden ful fast hors al besuette thenne alyght came kynge salewed hym said damoysel god blysse sire said goddes sake saye syr launcelot yonder ye may see hym said kynge thenne wente vnto launcelot said syr launcelot salewe yow kynge pelles behalf requyre yow come forest thenne syr launcelot asked whome dwelled dwelle said kynge pelles wille ye said launcelot ye shal knowe said whanne ye come thyder wel sayd wille gladly goo yow soo syr launcelot badde squyer sadel hors brynge armes hast dyd commaundement thenne came quene vnto lau celot said wille ye leue v hyhe feest madame said gentylwoman wete ye wel shal yow morn dyner tyme pyf wyst said quene shold v morne shold goo good wylle pryght soo departed sir launcelot gentylwoman rode vntyl came foreste grete valey sawe abbay nonnes squyer redy opened gate soo entryd descended horse came fayr felauship aboute sir lau celot welcomed hym passyng gladde comynge thenne ladde hym vnto abbesse chamber vnarmed hym ryght soo ware vpon bed lyeng two cosyns syr bors sir lyonel thenne waked whanne sawe hym mad grete ioye syr said syre bors vnto syr launcelot aduenture hath brought yow hydder wende morne haue fond camelot p god help said syr launcelot gentylwoman brought hyther knowe cause meane whyle thus stode talkynge gyder therin came twelue nonnes broughte hem galahad whiche passynge fayre wel made vnneth world men myghte fynde matche alle tho ladyes wepte psire sayd alle brynge yow thys child whiche haue nourisshed praye yow make hym knyght worthyer man hande may receyue ordre knyghthode sir launcelot beheld yonge squyer sawe hym semely demure douue alle maner good fetuo wende age neuer haue sene soo fayre man forme pthenne said sir launcelot cometh desyre hym self alle sayd ye thenne shalle sayd sir launcelot receyue hyghe ordre knyghthode moene atte reuerence hyghe feeste nyght syr launcelot passyng good chere morne houre pryme att galahalts desyre made hym knyyt said god make hym good man beaute fayleth yow ony lyueth pcapitulum secundum fayre syr said syr launcelot wille ye come wyth vnto courte kynge arthur nay sayde wille goo yow tyme thenne departed fro took two cosyns hym cam vnto camelot houre vndoen whytsonday tyme kynge quene gone mynster seruyse thenne kynge quene passyng gladde sir bors syr lyonel soo alle felauship kyng knyytes come seruyse baron aspyed syeges round table al aboute wryten golden letter ouyt sytte oughte sytte thus wente soo longe tylle come sege perillous whete fond letter newely wreton gold whiche said iiij c wynters liiij accomplysshed passion oure lord ihesu criste ouyte sege fulfylled thenne alle said meruey ous thynge aduenturous name god said syr launcelot thenne accompted terme wrytynge byrthe oure lord vnto day semeth said syr launcelot sege oughte fulfylled day feest pentecost four honderd four fyfty yere yf wold please partyes wold none letter sene daye tyl come oughte enche e aduenture thenne maade ordeyne clothe sylke couer letter sege peryllous thenne kyng badde haste vnto dyner sire sayd sir kay steward yf ye goo vnto mete ye shalle breke old customme courte ye haue vsed day sytte mete ye haue sene som aduenture ye say sothe said kynge soo grete ioye sir launcelot cosyns whiche come courte hole sound bethoughte myne old customme soo stode spekyng cam squyer said vnto kyng sire brynge vnto yow merueillous tydynges said kyng sir bynethe ryuer grete stone whiche sawe flete aboue water therin sawe styckyng swerd kynge sayde wille see merueill soo knyghtes went hym whanne came vnto ryuer fonde stone fletyng hit reed morhel therein stack fair ryche swerd pomel therof precyous stone wrought subtyle letter gold thenne baron redde letter whiche said wyse neuer shalle man take hen who syde ought hange shalle best knyght world whanne kynge sene letter said vnto sir launcelot fair sire suerd ought sure ye best knyght world pthenne syr launcelot ansuerd ful soberly certes sir swerde palso sir wete ye wel haue hardynes sett hande hit longed hange syde p also assayeth take swerd fayleth hit shalle receyue wound swerd shalle hole longe pand wille ye wete day shall aduentures sancgreal called hooly vessel begynne pcapitulum iij fayre neuewe said kynge vnto syr gawayn assaye ye loue sir said sauf good grace shalle doo sir sayd kynge assaye take suerd commaundement syre sayd gawayne commaundement wille obeye ther took vp suerd handel myghte stere hit thanke yow said kynge syre gawayne pmy lord syr gawayne said syr laucelot wete ye wel swerd shalle touche yow soo sore ye shalle wylle ye neuer sette hand therto best castel realme syr sayd myghte withsay myn vnkels wyll commaundement whanne kynge herd repentyd hit moche said vnto syr percyual shold assaye loue said gladly bere syr gawayn felaushyp sette hand swerd drewe hit strongly myghte meue hit thenne moo durste soo hardy sette theire handes therto pnow maye ye goo dyner said syr kay vnto kynge merueillous aduenture haue ye sene soo kynge alle wente vnto courte euery knyghte knewe owne place sette hym therin yonge men knyghtes serued soo whan serued alle seges fulfylled sauf syege perillous anon befelle merueillous aduenture alle dores wyndowes palays shut self thenne halle gretely darked abasshed one pthenne kynge arthur spak fyrst sayd god fayre felawes lordes haue sene daye merueyls nyght suppose shal see gretter merueyl meane whyle came good old man auncyent clothed al whyte knyyt knewe whens came hym broughte yong knyyt bothe foote reed armes withoute swerd sheld sauf scauberd hangynge syde wordes said pee yow faire lordes pthenne old man sayd vnto arthur syre brynge yonge knyghte whiche kynges lygnage kynrede ioseph abarima thye merueylles thys courte straunge realmes shalle fully accomplysshed pcapitulum quartum kynge ryghte gladde wordes said vnto good man syr ye ryghte welcome yonge knyyte yow thenne old man made yong man vnarme hym cote reed ndel bare mantel vpon sholder furred rmyn put vpon hym old knyghte sayd vnto yonge knyght syr foloweth anone ledde hym vnto sege peryllous besyde sat syr laucelot good man lyfte vp clothe fonde letter said thus sege galahalt haute prynce sir said thold knyghte wete ye wel place thenne sett hym doune surely syege thenne sayd old man syr ye maye goo way wel haue ye done ye commaunded doo recommaunde vnto graunt sir kynge pelles vnto lord petchere say hem behalf shalle come see hem soone euer may soo good man departed met hym xx noble squyers took horse wente way thenne alle knyghtes table round merueylled gretely sir galahalt durst sytte syege perillous soo tendyr age wist whens came al god said whome sacgreal shal encheued sat neuer none mescheued thenne syr launcelot beheld sone grete ioye hym thenne bors told felawes vpon payne lyf yonge knyghte shalle come vnto grete worship noyse grete alle courte soo cam quene thenne merueylle knyght myght durste auenture hym sytte syege peryllous many said vnto quene resembled moche vnto sire launcelot may wel suppose said quene syr launcelot begatte hym kynge pelles doughter whiche made lye enchauntement name galahalt wold fayne see hym said quene must nedes noble man soo fader hym begat reporte vnto alle table round whanne mete done kynge alle rysen kynge yede vnto syege peryllous lyfte vp clothe fonde name galahad thenne shewed hit vnto syr gawayne sayd fayre neuewe haue amonge v syr galahad good knyght shalle worshippe v alle vpon payne lyf shal encheue sancgreal ryght sir launcelot done v vnderstande thenne came kyng arthur vnto galahad said syr ye welcome ye shall meue many good knyghtes quest sancgreal ye shal encheue neuer knyghtes myght brynge ende thenne kynge took hym hand wente doune paleis shewe galahad aduentures stone pcapitulum v quene herd therof came many ladyes shewed hem stone houed water sire
