said kyng vnto syre galahad grete merueylle euer sawe ryght good knyghtes haue assayed fayled psyre said galahad merueil aduenture myne seurte swerd brought none syde hangeth scau erd anone layd hand swerd lyghtly drewe oute stone putte shethe said vnto kynge hit goth better hit dyd aforehand sir said kynge sheld god shalle send haue swerd somtyme good knyghtes balyn le saueage passynge good man handes suerd slewe broder balan grete pyte good knyghte eyther slewe thorou dolorous stroke balyn gaf vnto graute fader kynge pelles whiche yet hole shal tyl hele hym kynge aspyed came rydynge doune ryuer lady whyte palfroy toward thenne salewed kynge quene asked yf syr launcelot thenne ansuerd hym self fayre lady thenne sayd al wepynge grete doynge chaunged syth day morne damoysel say ye soo sayd launcelot saye yow sothe said damoysel ye day best knyghte world shold saye soo shold lyar one better ye wel hit preued aduentures suerd ye durste sette hand chaunge leuynge name wherfore make vnto yow remembraunce ye shalle wene hensforth ye best knyght world touchynge vnto said launcelot knowe wel neuer best yes sayd damoysel ye yet ony synful man world sir kyng nacyen heremyte sendeth word shalle befalle grettest worship euer befelle kynge brytayne say yow wherfore daye sancgreal appiered thy hows fedde thy felaushyp round table soo departed wente way came pcapitulum vj sayd kyng sure quest sacgreal shalle alle ye table round departe neuer shalle see yow ageyne hole gyders therfor wille see yow alle hole gyders medowe camelot iuste torneye dethe men maye speke hit suche good knyghtes holy gyders suche day vnto counceyll kynges request accorded alle toke harneis longed vnto iustynge alle meuynge kyng entent see galahalt preued kynge demed shold lyghtly come ageyne vnto courte departynge assembled medowe bothe lasse thenne syr galahalt prayer kynge quene dyd vpon hym noble iesseraunce also dyd hys helme shelde wold take none prayer kyng thenne sir gawayne knyghtes praid hym take spere ryghte soo dyd quene toure alle ladyes behold turnement thenne sir galahalt dressid hym myddes medowe began breke speres merueyllously men wonder hym surmounted alle knyytes within whyle defouled many good knyghtes table round sauf tweyne syr launcelot sire percyuale pcapitulum vij thenne kyng quenes request made hym lyghte vnlace helme quene myyt see hym vysage whanne beheld hym sayd sothely dar wel say sir launcelot begat hym neuer two men resembled lykenes therfor ny merueyle though grete prowesse lady stode quene said madame goddes sake oughte ryghte good knyghte ye forsothe said quene alle partyes come best knyghtes world hyhest lygnage sir launcelot come viij degre oure lord ihesu cryst syre galahalt nynthe degree oure lord ihesu cryst therfor dar saye grettest gentilmen world thenne kynge al estate wente home vnto camelot soo wente euensonge grete mynster soo vpon souper euery knyyt sette owne place fore hand thenne anone herd crakynge cryenge thonder hem thought place shold alle dryue myddes blast entred sonne beaume clerer seuen tymes euer sawe daye al alyghted grace holy ghoost thenne beganne euery knyghte behold eyther sawe theire semynge fayrer euer sawe afore thenne knyght myghte speke one word grete whyle soo loked euery man ben dome thenne ther entred halle holy graile couerd whyte samyte ther none myghte see hit bare hit al halle fulfylled good odoures euery knyyt suc e mete drynkes best loued world whan holy grayle borne thurgh halle thenne holy vessel departed sodenly wyste hit becam thenne alle brethe speke thenne kynge yelded thankynges god good grace sente certes said kynge oughte thanke oure lord ihesu gretely hath shewed v daye atte reuerence hyhe feest pentecost said sir gawayn haue ben serued daye mete drynkes thoughte one thynge begyled v myght see holy grayle soo precyously couerd wherfor wil make auowe morne withoute lenger abydyng shall laboure quest sancgreal shalle hold oute twelue moneth day yf nede neuer shalle retorne ageyne vnto courte tyl haue sene hit openly hath ben sene yf may spede shall retorne ageyne maye ageynst wil lord ihesu cryste whan table round herde syr gawayne saye arose vp party maade suche auowes sire gawayne made panone kynge arthur herd gretely dyspleasyd wyste wel myghte ageyne saye theyre auowes pallas said kynge arthur vnto sir gawayn ye haue nyghe slayne auowe promesse ye haue made thurgh yow ye haue berafte fayrest felauship truest knyghthode euer sene gyders ony realme world whanne departe hen sure alle shalle neuer mete thys world shalle dye many quest soo forthynketh lytel haue loued wel lyf wherfor hit shall greue ryghte sore departycyon felauship haue old customme haue hem felauship capitulum octauuum ther teres fylle eyen thenne sayd gawayne gawayne ye haue sette grete sorowe haue grete doubte true felauship shalle neuer mete ageyne sayd syr launcelot comforte self hit shalle vnto v grete honour moche yf dyed ony place deth syker laucelot said ye kyng ye grete loue yt haue vnto al dayes lyf maketh say suche dolefull wordes neuer crysten kynge neuer soo many worthy men table haue daye round table grete sorowe pwhanne quene ladyes gentilwymmen wyst tydynges suche sorowe heuynesse ther myght tonge telle hit tho knyghtes hold honour chyerte amonge quene gueneuer made grete sorowe merueylle said lord wold suffre hem departe hym thus al courte troubled loue departycyon tho knyghtes many tho ladyes loued knyghtes wold haue gone louers soo done old knyghte come amonge relygyous clothyng thenne spake alle hyghe said fayre lordes haue sworn quest sancgreal thus sendeth nacyen heremyte word none queste lede lady gentylwoman hym hit doo hyghe seruyse labour warne yow playne clene synnes shalle see mysteryes lord ihesu cryste cause lefte ladyes gentylwymmen pafter quene came vnto galahad asked hym whens countrey told whens sone vnto launcelot saide said neyther ye nay god helpe said quene fader ye nede shame yow goodlyest knyghte best men world comen strene alle partyes kynges wherfore ye oughte ryghte dedes passynge good man certaynly said ye resemble hym moche thenne syr galahad lytel ashamed said madame sythe ye knowe certayne wherfore doo ye aske hit fader shalle knowen openly al tymes thenne wente reste honour hyhenes galahad ledde kynge arthur chamber rested owne bedde soone hit daye kynge arose rest alle nyght sorowe thenne wente vnto gawayne syr launcelot arysen masse thenne kyng ageyn said gawayne gawayne ye haue bitrayed neuer shal courte amended yow ye wille neuer sory yow teres began renne doune vysage kyng said knyghte syr launcelot requyre thow counceyle wold quest vndone myghte syr sayd syr launcelot ye sawe yester day soo many worthy knyghtes thenne sworne may leue maner wyse wote wel said kyng shal heuye departynge wote wel shal manere ioye remedye thenne kynge quene wente vnto mynster soo anone launcelot gawayne commaunded men brynge armes whanne alle armed sauf sheldes helmes thenne came theyre felauship whiche alle redy wyse goo mynster seruyse pthenne seruyse done kynge wolde wete many hadde vndertake queste holy grayle accompte praid alle thenne fond tale honderd fyfty alle knyghtes table round thenne putte helmes departed recommaunded holy vnto quene wepynge grete sorowe thenne quene departed chamber helde man shold perceyue grete sorowes whanne syre launcelot myst quene wente tyl chamber sawe hym cryed aloude launcelot launcelot ye haue bitrayed putte deth leue thus lord madame praye yow displeased shall come ageyne soone may worship allas sayd euer sawe yow suffred vpon crosse alle mankynde vnto yow good conduyte saufte alle hole felauship ryght soo departed launcelot fond felauship abode comyng mounted horse rode thorou strete camelot wepynge ryche poure kynge tourned awey myghte speke wepynge within whyle came cyte castel hyyt vagon entrid castel lord therof old man hyght vagon good man lyuynge sette open gate made hem alle chere myyt soo morne alle accorded shold departe eueryche morne departed wepynge chere euery knyyt took way hym lyked best pcapitulum ix rydeth galahalt yet withouten shelde rode four dayes without ony aduenture fourth day euensonge came whyte abbay receyued grete reuerence ledde vnto chambre vnarmed thenne ware knyghtes table round one sir bagdemagus syr vwayne whanne sawe hym wente vnto galahad made hym grete solace soo wente vnto souper sir said sire galahalt aduenture broughte yow hyder sir sayd told v place shelde man may bere aboute neck mescheued outher dede within thre dayes maymed euer syr said kyng bagdemagus shalle hit morne assay aduenture name god sayd galahad sire said bagdemagus may encheue aduenture shelde ye shalle take hit vpon yow sure ye shalle fayle sir said galahad ryghte wel agree therto haue shelde soo morne aroos herd masse thenne bagdemagus asked aduenturous sheld anone monke ledde hym behynde aulter shelde henge whyte ony snowe myddes reed crosse sir said monk sheld oughte hanged aboute knyghtes neck worthyest knyghte world therfore counceylle yow knyghtes wel aduysed wel said bagdemagus wote wel lest knyghte world shal assay bere hit soo bare hit oute mynstre ne said vnto galahad hit please abyde stil tyl ye wete spede shalle abyde yow sayd galahad thenne kynge bagdemagus took hym good squyer brynge tydynges vnto syr galahad spedde thenne whanne ryden two myle came fayr valey afore hermytage thenne sawe knyghte come party whyte armour hors came faste hors myghte renne spere reste syr bagdemagus dressid spere ageynst hym brake hit vpon whyte knyght stroke hym soo hard braste mayles sheef hym thorou ryght sholder shelde couerd hym tyme soo bare hym hors alyghte took whyte shelde hym sayenge knyght thow hast done thy self grete foly shelde oughte borne hym shalle haue piece lyueth thenne bagdemagus squyer saide bere shelde vnto good knyghte sir galahad thow lefte abbay grete hym wel sir said squyer name take thow none hede name said knyyte knowe none erthely man fayr syr said squyer reuerence ihesu cryste telle cause shelde may borne yf berer therof meschyeued sythe thow hast coniured soo sayd knyghte shelde behoueth vnto man vnto galahad ye squyer wet vnto bagdemagus asked whether sore wounded ye forsothe said shalle escape hard dethe thenne sette hors brought hym grete payne vnto abbay thenne taken doun softely vnarmed leid bedde loked woundes booke telleth laye longe escaped hard lyf pcapitulum x syr galahalt sayd squyer knyghte wounded bagdemagus sendeth yow gretynge bad ye shold bere shelde thurgh grete aduentures shold befalle blessid good fortune said galahad thenne asked armes mounted vpon hors henge whyte shelde aboute neck commaunded hem vnto god syr vwayne said wold bere hym felauship yf pleasyd hym psir sayd galahad maye ye must goo alone sauf squyer shall bere f lauship departed vwayne thenne within whyle came galahad whyte knyght abode hym heremytage eueryche salewed curt isly psir said galahad shelde ben many merueils fallen sir sayd knyght hit befelle passion lord ihesu crist xxxij yere ioseph armathye gentyl knyghte whiche took doune oure lord hooly crosse att tyme departed iherusalem grete party kynred hym laboured tyl came cyte hyght sarras att houre ioseph came sarras kynge hyghte euelake gret werre ageyne sarasyns especyal ageynste one sarasyn whiche kyng euelaks cosyn ryche kyng myghty whiche marched nyghe land name called tolleme la feyntes soo day two mette doo bataill thenne ioseph sone ioseph armathye wente kynge euelake told hym shold discomfyt slayne yf lefte bileue old lawe loue vpon newe lawe thenne shewed hym ryght bileue holy trynyte whiche agreed vnto alle herte shelde maade kynge euelake name hym dyed vpon crosse thenne thurgh good bileue better kyng tolleme whanne euelake batail clothe sette afore sheld whanne grettest perylle lete putte awaye clothe thenne enemyes sawe fygur man crosse thurgh alle discomfyte soo befelle man kynge euelaks smyten hand bare hand hand ioseph called man vnto hym badde hym goo good deuocyon touche crosse soone man touched crosse hand hole euer hit fore thenne soone felle grete merueyll crosse sheld one tyme vanysshed awey man wyst became thenne kynge euelake baptysed moost party alle peple cyte soone ioseph wold departe kynge euelake wold goo hym whether wold nold soo fortune came land tyme called grete bretayne fond grete felon paynym put ioheph pryson soo fortune tydynges cam vnto worthy man hyghte mondrames assembled alle peple grete renomme herde ioseph soo came land grete bretayne disherited felon paynym consumed hym ther delyuerd ioseph oute pryson alle peple torned crysten feithe pcapitulum vndecimum longe ioseph layd dedely bed whanne kynge euelake sawe made moche sorowe sayd thy loue haue lefte countrey sythe ye shalle departe oute world leue somme token may thynke ioseph said wille doo ful gladly brynge sheld toke yow whanne ye went bataille ageynst kyng tolleme thenne iosephibled sore nose myyt meane staunched therupon sheld made crosse owne blood may ye see remembraunce loue yow ye shalle neuer see shelde ye shal thynke shall alweyes fresshe neuer shalle man bere sheld aboute neck shalle repente hit vnto tyme galahad good knyyte ere hit laste lygnage shal haue hit aboute neck shall doo many merueyllous dedes sayd kynge euelake shalle put shelde worthy knyght may haue hit ye shal leue hit nacyen heremyte shal put dethe thydder shal good knyghte come fyftenth day shal receyue ordre knyghthode soo daye sette tyme haue shelde abbay lyeth nacyen heremyte thenne whyte knyghte vanysshed away anone squyer herde wordes alyghte hakney kneled doune galahad foot prayd hym myghte goo hym tyll made hym knyghte yf wold refuse yow thenne ye make knyyte sayd squyer ordre grace god shal wel tte soo syr galahad graunted hym tourned ageyne vnto abbay came fro men made grete ioye syr galahad anone alyghte monke broughte hym vnto tombe chirche yerd suche noyse herd hit shold veryly nyghe madde lese strengthe syre sayd deme hit fende pcapitulum xij lede thyder sayd galahad soo dyd alle armed sauf helme sayd good man goo tombe lyfte hit vp soo dyd hird grete noyse pytoirsly sayd alle men myyte hit syr galahad seruaunt ihesu cryste come thou nyghe thow shalt make goo ageyne ther haue ben soo longe galahad thynge affrayed lyfte vp stone came foul smoke sawe fowlest fygur lepe oute euer sawe lykenes man thenne blessid hym wyste wel hit fende pthenne herd voyse say galahad see enuyronne aboute many angel power may dere p ryght soo syr galahad sawe body al armed lye tombe besyde hym swerd fayr broder sayd galahad lete v remeue body hit worthy lye chircheyerd fals crysten man alle departed wente abbay anone vnarmed good man cam sette hym doune hym sayd syre shall telle yow betokeneth alle ye sawe tombe couerd body betokeneth duresse world grete synne oure lord fond world suche wretchydnesse fader loued sone sone loned fader one cause oure lord took flesshe blood clene mayden oure synnes grete tyme wel nyghe wickednes truly sayd galahad bileue yow ryghte wel syre galahad rested hym nyghte vpon morne made squyer knyghte asked hym name kynred come psyre sayd men calleth melyas de lyle sone kynge denmarke p fayre sire sayd galahad sythe ye come kynges quenes loketh knyghthode wel sette yow ye oughte myrrour vnto chyualry psire sayd syre melyas ye saye sothe syre sythen ye haue made knyyt ye must ryyt graute fyrst desyre yt resonable ye say soth said galahad melyas said thene ye wil suffre ryde yow quest sancgreal tyl somme aduenture departe v graunte yow sir thenne men brought syre melyas armoure spere hors soo syr galahad rode forth weke fond ony aduenture thenne vpon monday mornyng departed fro abbay cam crosse whiche departed two wayes crosse letter wryten sayd thus ye knyghtes arraunt whiche goth seke knyghtes aduenturous see ij wayes yt one wey defendeth thow ne go yt way shalle go oute way ageyne yf good man worthy knyghte yf thow goo lyfte hand thow shalt lyghtely wynne prowesse thow shalt way soone assayed sir said melyas galahad yf hit lyke yow suffer take way lyft hand telle shalle wel preue strengthe hit better said galahad ye rode way deme shold better escape way ye nay lord praye yow lete haue aduenture take goddes name said galahad pcapitulum xiij thene rode melyas old forest therin rode two dayes thenne came fayr medowe fayr lodge bowes thenne aspyed lodge chayer wherin crown gold subtyly wroughte also clothes couerd vp erthe many delycious mete sette theron sir melyadas behelde auenture thoughte hit merueillous honger croune gold took moch kepe stouped doune took hit vp rode way anone sawe knyght came rydynge hym sayd knyghte sette doune crowne whiche youre therfor defendeth yow thenne syre melyas blessid hym said fair lord heuen helpe sane thy newe made knyght thenne lete theire horse renne fast myyt knyyt smote sir melia thorou hauberk thorow lyfte syde felle erthe nyghe dede thenne took crowne went way syr melyas lay stylle power stere meane whyle fortune ther came syre galahad fond hym perille dethe thenne said melyas hath wounded yow therfor hit ben better haue ryden way whanne sir melyas herd hym speke syre sayd goddes loue lete dye forest bere vnto abbay besyde may confessyd haue ryghtes shal done said galahad hath wounded yow syr galahad herd leues crye hyghe knyght kepe syr said melyas beware hath slayne sir galahad ansuerd syr knyghte come perylle thenne eyther dressid came gyder fast horse myghte renne galahad smote hym soo hys spere wente thorou sholder smote hym doune hors fallyng galahad spere brak cam oute another knyghte oute leues brake spere vpon galahad euer myghte torne hym thenne galahad drewe oute swerd smote lyfte arme hym soo felle erthe thenne fledde sire galahad sewed fast hym thenne torned ageyne vnto syr melyas alyghte dressid hym softely hors fore hym truncheon spere body syr galahad sterte vp behynde hym helde hym armes soo broughte hym abbay vnarmed hym broughte hym chamber thenne asked saueour whanne receyued hym said vnto syr galahad syr lete deth come whan pleasyd hym drewe oute truncheon spere oute body thenne swouned thenne came olde monke whiche somtyme ben knyghte behelde syre melyas anone ransakyd hym thenne saide vnto syr galahad shal hele hym woude grace god within terme seuen wekes thenne sir galahad glad vnarmed hym said wold abyde thre dayes thenne asked syr melyas stood hym thenne sayd torned vnto helpyng god thanked pcapitulum xiiij wylle departe sayd galahad haue moche hand many good knyghtes ful besy aboute hit knyghte quest sancgreal sire said good man synne thus wounded merueylle said good man ye durst take vpon yow soo ryche thynge hyghe ordre knyghthode withoute clene confession cause ye bytterly wounded way ryyt hand betokeneth hyghe way lord ihesu cryste way good true good lyuer wey betokeneth way synners mysbyleuers whanne deuylle sawe pryde presumpcyon take yow quest sancgreal made ouerthrowen hit may eucheued vertuous lyuynge also wrytynge crosse sygnyfycacyon heuenly dedes knyghtly dedes goddes werkes knyytly dedes worldly werkes pryde hede alle dedely synnes caused knyghte departe galahad thow tokest croune gold thow synnest couetyse thefte alle knyghtely dedes galahad holy knyghte whiche foughte two knyghtes two knyghtes sygnefyen two dedely synnes whiche holy knyghte melyas myghte withstande yow ye withoute dedely synne departed galahad then betaught hem alle vnto god sir melyas sayd lord galahad soone may ryde shalle seke yow god sends yow helthe said galahad soo toke hors departed rode many iourneyes forward backward aduenture wold lede hym pand laste hit happend hym departe place castel whiche named abblasoure hadde herd masse whiche wonte euer euer departed oute ony castel place kepte customme pthenne syr galahad came vnto montayne fond old chappel fond body alle desolate kneled fore aulter besought god holsome counceil soo prayd herd voys sayd goo thow thou aduenturous knyghte castel maydens doo thow awey thy wycked custommes pcapitulum xv whanne syr galahad herd thanked god toke hors ryden half myle sawe valeye afore hym stronge castel depe dyches ranne besyde hit fayr ryuer hyghte syuarne mette man grete age eyther salewed galahad asked hym castels name fair syr said hit castel maydens cursyd castel said galahalt alle ben conuersaunt therin alle pyte oute therof alle hardynesse meschyef therin therfor counceyle yow sir knyght torne ageyne sir said galahad wete yow wel shalle tourne ageyne thenne loked syre galahad armes noo thynge fayled hym thenne put sheld afore hym anone mette hym seuen fayr maydens whiche sayd vnto hym syr knyghte ye ryde grete foly ye haue water passe ouer shold passe water said galahad rode awey mette squyer said knyghte tho knyghtes castel defyen yow defenden yow ye go ferther tyl wete ye wolde faire sir saide galahad come destroye wycked custome castel sir ye wille abyde ye shal haue ynough doo go yow said galahad hast nedes thenne squyer entryd castel anone came oute castel seuen knyghtes bretheren whan sawe galahad cryed knyghte kepe assure thynge dethe sayd galahad ye alle haue adoo one ye sayde therto maist thow trust thenne galahad putte forth spere smote form st erthe nere brake neck alle smote hym shelde grete stroke speres brake pthenne syr galahad drewe oute swerd set vpon hem soo hard merueylle see hit soo thurgh grete force made hem forsake felde galahad chased hem tyl entryd castel passed thury castel another gate mette syr galahad old man clothed relygyous clothynge sayd sire haue kayes castel thenne syr galahad opened gate sawe soo moche peple stretes myghte nombre alle sayd syr ye welcome longe haue abyden delyueraunce thenne came hym gentylwoman sayde knyghtes fledde wille come ageyne nyghte begynne ageyn euylle customme pwhat wille ye shalle doo sayd galahad sir said gentilwoman ye send alle knyghtes hyder hold landes castel make hem swere vse custommes vsed fore olde tyme wille wel said galahad broughte hym horne iuory bouden gold rychely saide sir blewe horne whych wille herde two myle aboute castel pwhanne syr galahad blowen horne set hym doune vpon bedde thenne came preest galahad said syr hit past seuen yere agone seuen bretheren cam castel herberowed lord castell hyght duke lyanowre lord thys countrey whanne aspyed duke doughter ful faire woman thenne fals couyn made debate betwixe self duke goodenes wold haue departed hem slewe hym eldest sone thenne took mayden tresour castel thenne grete force helde alle knyghtes castel ageynste theire wylle vnder theyre obeyssaunce grete seruage truage robbynge pyllynge poure comyn peple psoo hit happend daye duke doughter sayd ye haue done vnto greete wronge slee myn owne fader broder thus holde landes thenne sayd ye shalle holde castel many yeres one knyghte ye shal ouercomen thus prophecyed seuen yeres agone wel said seuen knyghtes sythen ye say ther shal neuer lady knyghte passe castel shall abyde maulgre hedes dye therfor tyl knyghte come whome shalle lese castel therfore called maydens castel haue deuoured many maydens said galahad whome castel lost nay sir said preest dede within thre nyghtes thus enforced sythen haue kepte yonger syster endureth grete paynes mo ladyes knyghtes countray comen thenne made hem doo homage feaute kynges douyter sette hem grete ease herte morne ther came one galahad told hym gawayn gareth vwayne slayne seuen bretheren suppose wel said syr galahad took armour hors commaunded hem vnto god pcapitulum xvj saith tale syr gawayne departed rode many iourneyes bothe toward froward att laste cam abbaye syre galahad whyte sheld syr gawayne lerned way sewe syr galahad soo rode abbay melyas lay seke syr melyas told syr gawayn merueyllous aduentures syr galahad dyd certes said sire gawayne happy took way wente maye mete hym wille departe hym lyghtely alle merueyllous aduentures sir galahad encheueth sir said one monkes wille felauship said syr gawayne sir said ye wycked synful ful blessid pryght thus stode talkynge came rydynge syr gareth thenne made ioye eyth r morne herd masse soo departed way met syr vwayne le auoultres syre vwayne told syr gawayne mette none aduenture sythe departed courte said sir gawayne eyther promysed tho thre knyghtes departe whyle quest yf fortune caused soo departed rode fortune tyl came castel maydens seuen bretheren aspyed thre knyghtes said sythen flemyd one knyghte castel shalle destroye alle knyghtes kyng arthur maye ouercome loue syr galahad seuen knyghtes sette vpon thre knyghtes fortune syr gawayne slewe one bretheren echone felawes slewe another soo slewe remenaunt thenne took wey vnder castel loste way sir galahad rode eueryche hem departed sir gawayne rode tylle came hermytage fond good man sayenge euensonge lady syr gawayne asked herberowe charyte good man graunted hit hym gladly thenne good man asked hym syre said kynyt kynge arthur queste sancgreal name syr gawayne sire sayd good man wold wete standeth betwixe god yow sir said sir gawayne wille good shewe yow lyf yf hit please yow tolde heremyte monke abbay called wycked knyght myght wel saye hit said heremyte whanne ye fyrste made knyghte ye sholde haue taken yow knyghtely dedes vertuous lyuynge ye haue done contrary ye haue lyued mescheuously many wynters sir galahad myd synned neuer cause shalle encheue goth ye none suche shalle atteyne none felauship ye haue vsed moost vntruest lyf euer herd knyghte lyue certes ye ben wycked ye ar neuer seuen bretheren slayne yow two felawes syre galahad hym self alone bete hem alle seuen day forne lyuyng suche shal slee man lyghtely also may say yow castel maiden betokenen good soules pryson afore incarnacyon ihesu cryste seuen knyghtes betokenen seuen dedely synnes regned tyme world may lyken good galahad vnto sone hyghe fader lyghte within mayde bought alle soules oute thralle soo dyd syre galahad delyuer maydens oute woful castel sire gawayne said good man thou must doo penaunce thy synne syre whal penaunce shalle suche wille gyue sayd good man nay said syre gawayne may doo penaunce knyghtes aduenturous ofte suffren grete woo payne wel sayd good man thenne held pee morne syre gawayne departed heremyte betaught hym vnto god aduentur mette syre aglouale syr gryflet two knyghtes table round two rode four dayes withoute fyndynge ony aduenture fyfthe day departed eueryche helde felle aduenture phere leueth tale syr gawayne felawes speke syr galahad pcapitulum xvij soo whanne syr galahad departed castel maydens rode tyl came waste forest mette syre launcelot syr percyuale knewe hym newe desguysed ryghte syr launcelot fader dressid spere brake vpon syr galahad galahad smote hym ageyne smote doune hors man thenne drewe suerd dressid hym vnto syr percyuale smote hym soo helme rofe coyfe stele swerd swarued syr percyuale ben slayne stroke felle oute sadel iustes done fore hermytage recluse dwelled sawe syr galahad ryde said god best knyghte world certes said alle alowde launcelot percyuale myyt yonder two knyghtes knowen wel doo wold haue encoutred thenne syr galahad herd say adrad knowen therwith smote hors spore rode grete paas toward thenne perceyued bothe galahad vp gat horse rode faste hym whyle syghte thene torned ageyne heuy chere lete v spere tydynges sayd percyuale yonder recluse ye lyst said syr launcelot whanne syr percyuale came recluse knewe hym wel ynough syr launcelot bothe syr launcelot rode ouerthwart endlonge wylde forest helde pathe wyld aduenture led hym last came stony crosse whiche departed two wayes waste land crosse stone marbel derke syr launcelot myghte wete thenne syre launcelot loked hym sawe old chappel ther wende haue fond peple sir launcelot teyed hors tyl tree dyd sheld henge hit vpon tree thenne wente chappel dore fonde hit waste broken within fond fayr aulter ful rychely arayed clothe clene sylke stode fayre clene candelstyk whiche bare syxe grete candels candelstyk syluer whanne syre launcelot sawe thys lyght grete wylle entre chappel coude fynde place myghte entre thenne passynge heuy desmayed thenne retorned cam hors dyd sadel brydel lete hym pasture vnlaced helme vngyrd swerd laide hym doune slepe vpon shelde fore crosse pcapitulum xviij soo felle slepe half wakynge slepyng sawe come hym two palfreyes alle fayr whyte whiche bare lytter therin lyenge seke knyghte whanne nyghe crosse abode stylle alle syr launcelot sawe beheld slepte veryly herd hym saye swe lord whanne shal sorowe leue whanne shalle holy vessel come thurgh shalle blessid haue endured thus longe lytyl toespace ful grete whyle complayned knyght thus alweyes syr launcelot herd syr launcelot sawe candelstyk syxe taper come crosse sawe body brought p also came table syluer holy vessel sancgreal whiche launcelot sene afore tyme kynge pescheours hows seke knyghte sette hym vp helde vp bothe handes said faire swete lord whiche within holy vessel take hede vnto may hole maladye ther handes knee wente soo nyghe touched holy vessel kyste hit anone hole thenne sayd lord god thanke helyd sekenesse whanne holy vessel ben grete whyle hit wente vnto chappel chaundeler lyght soo launcelot wyst become ouertaken synne power ryse ageyne holy vessel wherfor many men said hym shame took repentaunce thenne seke knyght dressid hym vp kyssed crosse anone squyer brought hym armes asked lord dyd certes sayd thanke god ryghte wel thurgh holy vessel helyd haue merueil slepynge knyghte power awake whanne holy vessel brought hyder dare ryyt wel saye sayd squyer dwelleth dedely synne wherof neuer confessid feythe said knyght someuer vnhappy dome felauship round table whiche entryd quest sancgreal sire said squyer haue brought yow alle armes sauf helme suerd therfor myn assente maye ye take knyytes helme suerd dyd whan clene armed took syr laucelots hors better soo departed crosse pcapitulum xix thenne anone syr launcelot waked sette hym vp bethought hym sene whether dremes ryght herd wy said syr launcelot harder stone bytter wood naked barer leef fygge tree therfore goo thow hen wythdrawe hooly place whanne syre launcelot herd passynge heuy wyst departed sore wepynge cursed tyme borne thenne demed neuer haue hadde worship tho wordes went herte tyl knewe wherfor called soo thenne syre launcelot wente crosse fonde helme swerd hors taken away thenne called hym self veray wretche moost vnhappy knyghtes sayd synne wyckednes haue brought vnto grete dishonour whanne soughte worldly aduentures worldly desyres euer encheued better euery place neuer discomfyt quarel ryght wronge take vpon aduentures holy thynges see vnderstande myn olde synne hyndereth shameth power stere speke whan holy blood appiered afore thus sorowed til hit day herd fowles synge thenne somwhat comforted whan syr launcelot myst hors harne thenne wyste wel god displeasyd hym thenne departed crosse foote foreste soo pryme came hyghe hylle fonde hermytage heremyte theryn whiche goynge vnto masse thenne launcelot kneled doune cryed oure lorde mercy wycked werkes soo whanne masse done launcelot called hym prayed hym charite lyfe good sayd good man sir sayd ye kynge arthur courte felauship round table ye forsothe name sir launcelot du lake hath ben ryght wel said good fortune chaunged moost wretche world heremyte behelde hym hadde merueille soo abasshed syre said heremyte ye oughte thanke god ony knyght lyuynge hath caused yow haue worldly worship ony knyghte lyueth presumpcyon take vpon dedely synne presence flesshe blood coused ye myghte see hit worldly eyen wille appiere suche synners ben yf hit vnto theire grete hurte vnto grete shame knyght lyuynge ought kenne god soo grete thanke ye hath yeuen yow beaute semelynes grete strengthe aboue knyghtes therfor ye morr beholdyng vnto god ony man loue hym drede hym strength manhode wille lytel auaylle yow god ageynste yow pcapitulum xx thenne sir launcelot wepte heuy chere sayd knowe wel ye saye sothe sire sayd good man hyde none old synne truly said syr launcelot ful lothe discouere xiiij yere neuer discouerd one thynge haue vsed maye wyte shame disauentur thenne told good man alle lyf hou loued quene vnmesurably oute mesure longe alle grete dedes armes haue done dyd moost party quenes sake sake wold doo batail hit ryght wronge neuer dyd bataille alle goddes sake wynne worshyp cause better biloued lytel noughte thanked god hit thenne syr launcelot sayd praye yow counceylle wille counceyle yow said heremyte yf ye wille ensure ye neuer come quenes felauship moche ye may forbere thenne syre launcelot promysed hym nold feithe body loke herte mouthe acoorde said good man shalle ensure yow ye shalle haue worship euer ye holy fader said syre launcelot merueylle wy sayd merueillous wordes ye haue herd forehand haue ye merueylle sayd good man therof hit semeth wel god loueth yow men maye vnderstande stone hard kynde namely one another vnderstande syr launcelot thou wylt leue thy synne goodnes god hath sente therfor thou arte ony stone neuer woldest thow maade neysshe water fyre hete holy ghoost maye entre take hede alle world men shal fynde one knyghte whome oure lord hath yeuen soo moche grace hath yeuen yow hath yeuen yow fayrenes semelynes hath yeuen wyt discrecyon knowe good euyll hath yeuen prowesse hardynesse gyuen werke soo largely thou hast al dayes better someuer thow came lord wille suffre lenger thow shalte knowe hym whether thow wilt nylt voyce called bytter wood ouer moche synne duelleth may lytel swetnesse wherfor thow arte lykened old roten tree haue shewed thou arte harder stone bytterer tree shall shewe thow arte naked barer fygge tree befelle lord palmsondaye preched iherusalem fonde people alle hardnes herberowed fond alle towne one wold herberowe hym thenne wente withoute towne fond myddes way fygge tree whiche ryghte fayr wel garnysshed leues fruyte none thenne lord cursyd tree bare fruyte betokeneth fygge tree vnto iherusalem leues fruyte soo thow syr launcelot whan hooly grayle broughte afore fonde noo fruyte good thoughte good wille defowled lechery certes said sir launcelot alle ye haue said true hen forward caste grace god neuer wycked haue ben folowe knyghthode fetys armes thenne good man ioyned syr launcelot suche penaunce myghte doo sewe knyghthode assoylled hym praid syre launcelot abyde hym alle daye wylle wel said syr launcelot haue neyther helme ne hors ne suerd sayd good man shalle helpe yow morne euen hors al longed vnto yow thenne syr laucelot repented hym gretely phere leueth history syr launcelot pand foloweth syr percyual de galys whiches xiiij book pcapitulum primum sayth tale whan syr launcelot ryden syre galahad whiche alle aduentures aboue sayd sir percyual torned ageyne vnto recluse demed haue tydynges knyyt launcelot folowed soo kneled wyndow recluse opened hit asked syre percyuale wold madame sayd knyghte kynge arthur courte name syr percyual de galys whanne reecluse herd name grete ioye hym mykel loued hym forne ony knyyt ouyt aunt thenne commannded gate opened alle chere myght make hym alle power commaundement soo morne syr percyual wente recluse asked yf knewe knyghte whyte shelde sir said wold ye wete truly madame said syr percyual shalle neuer wel ease tyl knowe knyghtes felauship may fyghte hym maye leue hym soo lyghtely haue shame yet percyual sayd wold ye fyghte hym see wel ye haue grete wylle slayne fader thorugh oultrageousnes madame sayd syr percyual hit semeth wordes ye knowe ye sayd wel ought knowe aunt al though pryory place somme called somtyme quene waste landes called quene moost rychesse world pleasyd neuer rychesse soo moche doth pouerte thenne syre percyual wepte veray pyte whan knewe aunt p fair neuewe said whanne herd ye tydynges moder truly sayd herd none dreme moche slepe therfore wote whether dede lyue certes fayr neuew sayd moder dede departynge took suche sorowe anone confessid dyed god haue mercy sowle sayd syr percyual hit sore forthynketh alle must chaunge lyf pnow fayre aunt telle knyghte deme hit bare reed armes whytsonday wete yow well said wyse oughte doo goo reed armes knyghte hath piere worcheth alle myracle shalle neuer ouercome none erthely man hand pcapitulum ij also merlyn made round table tokenyng roundenes world round table world sygnefyed ryghte al world crysten hethen repayren vnto round table whan chosen felauship roud table thynke hem blessid worship yf goten halfe world ye haue sene haue loste faders moders alle kynne wyues child felauship wel sene yow syns ye departed fro moder ye wold neuer see ye fond suche felauship roud table whan merlyn ordeyned round table said shold felawes round table trouth sancgreal shold wel knowen men asked hym men myghte knowe sholde best encheue sancgreal thenne said ther shold thre whyte bulles shold encheue hit two sholde maydens thyrd shold chast one thre shold passe fader moche lyon passeth lybard bothe strengthe hardynes herd merlyn saye soo sayd thus vnto merlyn sythen ther shalle suche knyghte thow sholdest ordeyne thy craftes sege man shold sytte hit al shalle passe alle knyghtes thenne merlyn ansuerd wold doo soo thenne made sege perillous whiche galahad satte mete whytsonday last past madame sayd syr percyual moche haue herd yow good wylle wille neuer haue doo syr galahad waye kyndenes goddes loue fayr aunte ye teche way maye fynde hym moche wold loue felauship hym fair neuewe sayd ye must ryde vnto castel whiche called goothe hath cosyn germayn ther may ye lodged nyghte techeth seweth faste ye yf telle yow noo tydynges hym ryde streyght vnto castel carbonek maymed kynge lyenge shalle ye true tydynges hym pcapitulum tercium thenne departed syr percyuale aunte eyther makynge grete sorowe soo rode tyl euensonge tyme thenne herd clok smyte thene ware hows closed wel walles depe dyches knocked gate lete alyght ledde vnto chamber soone vnarmed ryght good chere alle nyghte morne herd masse monastery fonde preest redy aulter ryght syde sawe pewe closyd yron behynde aulter sawe ryche bedde fayre clothe sylke golde thenne syr percyual aspyed therin man woman vysage couerd thenne left lokyng herd seruyse whan hit came sacrynge lay within percloos dressid hym vp vncouerd heede thenne hym besemed passynge old man crowne gold vpon hede sholders naked vnhylled vnto nauel thenne sir percyual aspyed body ful grete woundes bothe sholders armes vysage euer held vp handes ageynst oure lordes body cryed fair swete fader ihesu cryst forgete soo laye doune alwayes prayer orysons hym semed age thre honderd wynter whanne masse done preest took oure lordes body bare hit seke kynge whanne vsed hit dyd crowne commaunded crowne sette aulter thenne syr percyual asked one bretheren sire sayd good man ye haue herd moche ioseph armathye sente ihesu cryst land teche preche holy cristen feythe therfor suffred many persecucyons whiche enemyes cryst dyd vnto hym cyte sarras conuerted kynge who name euelake kynge came ioseph land euer besy sancgreal tyme nyghed soo nyghe oure lord displeasyd hym euer folowed hit tyl god stroke hym al blynde thenne kynge cryed mercy sayd faire lord lete neuer dye tyl good knyghte blood ix degree come may see hym openly shal encheue sancgreal may kysse hym pcapitulum quartum whanne kynge thus made prayer herd voys sayd herd ben thy prayer thow shalt dye tyl haue kyst whanne knyyte shalle come clerenes eyen shalle come ageyne thow shalt see openly thy woundes shalle heled erst shalle neuer close befelle kynge euelake kynge hath lyued thre honderd wynters thys holy lyf men saye knyghte courte shall hele hym sir sayd good man praye yow telle knyghte ye yf ye kyng arthur courte table roud ye forfoth said name sir percyual de galys whanne good man vnderstood name made grete ioye hym thenne syr percyual departed rode tyl houre none mette valey twenty men armes whiche bare bere knyghte dedely slayne whanne sawe syr percyuale asked hym whens ansuerd courte kyng arthur thenne cryed one slee hym thenne syr percyual smote fyrst erthe hors vpon hym thenne seuen knyghtes smote vpon sheld al attones remenaunt slewe hors soo felle erthe soo slayne hym taken hym good knyyte sir galahad ye reed armes come aduenture tho partyes whanne sawe alle tho knyghtes vp one knyghte cryed saue knyghtes lyf thenne dressid hym toward twenty men armes faste hors myght dryue spere reyste smote formest hors man erthe whanne spere broken sette hand suerd smote ryght hand lyfte hand merueylle see euery stroke smote one doune put hym rebuke soo wold fyghte fled thyck forest syr galahad folowed whanne sir percyuale sawe hym chase hem soo made grete sorowe hys hors awey thenne wyst wel syre galahad thene cryed alowde fayre knyghte abyde suffre doo thankynges vnto moche haue ye done euer syr galahad rode soo fast atte laste past oute syghte fast sir percyual myght wente hym foote cryenge thenne mette yoman rydynge vpon hakney whiche led hand grete stede blacker ony bere fayr frend sayd sir percyuale euer maye doo yow true knyghte fyrst place ye wille requyre ye wille lene black stede myghte ouertake knyghte whiche rydeth afore p syre knyghte sayd yoman praye yow hold excused maye doo wete ye wel hors suche man hors lente yow ony man wold slee allas sayd sir percyual neuer soo grete sorowe haue losynge yonder knyghte syr sayd yoman ryghte heuy yow good hors wold byseme yow wel dar delyuer hors yf ye wold take hym wille doo sayd syre percyual soo departed syre percyual sette hym doune vnder tree made sorowe oute sure ther cam came knyght rydyng hors yoman lad clene armed pcapitulum quintum anone yoman came pryckynge fast euer myghte asked syre percyuale yf sawe ony knyghte rydynge blak stede ye sir soth said syr aske ye syre stede hath benome strength wherfor lord wylle slee place fyndeth wel saide syre percyual woldest thow dyd thou seest wel foote good hors shold brynge hym soone ageyne sir said yoman take myn hakney doo best ye shall sewe yow foote wete ye shalle spede thenne sir percyual alyghte vpon hakney rode faste myghte laste sawe knyghte thenne cryed knyghte torne ageyne torned set spere ageynst syr percyuale smote hakney myddes brest felle doune dede erthe grete falle rode waye thenne syr percyual wood wrothe cryed abyde wycked knyghte coward fals herted knyghte torne ageyne fyghte foote ansuerd paste hys waye whanne syr percyual sawe wold torne caste aweye helme suerd sayd veray wretche cursyd moost vnhappy aboue knyghtes sorowe abode day tyl hit nyghte thenne faynte leyd hym doun slepte tyl mydnyghte thenne awaked sawe afore hym woman whiche sayd vnto hym ryght fyersly syre percyuale st thow ansuerd doo neyther good grete ylle yf thow wylt ensure said thow wylt fulfylle wylle whanne somone shall lene myn owne hors whiche shalle bere whyder thou wylt syr percyual glad profer ensured fulfylle alle desyre thenne abydeth shalle goo fetche yow hors soo cam soone ageyne broughte hors inly blak whan percyual beheld hors merueylled soo grete soo wel apparaylled thenne soo hardy lepte vpon hym took none hede hym self soo anone vpon hym threst hym spore soo rode forest mone shone clere within houre lasse bare hym four dayes iourney then vntyl came rough water whiche roryd hors wold haue borne hym hit pcapitulum vj whanne syr percyuale came nyghe brymme sawe water boystous doubted ouerpasse thenne made sygne crosse forheed whan fende felte hym soo charged shoke syr percyual wente water cryenge roryng makyng grete sorowe semed vnto hym water brente thenne sir percyual perceyued fend wold haue brought hym vnto perdycyon thenne commaunded hym self vnto god prayd oure lord kepe hym alle suche temptacyons praid alle nyghte tyl morn day thenne sawe wylde montayne whiche closed see nygh al aboute myyt see land hym whiche myyte releue hym wylde beestes thenne went valey sawe yonge serpent brynge yonge lyon neck soo came sir percyual came grete lyon cryenge rorynge serpent pand fast syr percyual sawe thys merueylled hyhed hym thyder anon lyon ouertake serpent beganne bataille hym p thenne syr percyual thoughte helpe lyon naturel beeste two drewe suerd sette hys shelde afore hym ther gaf serpent suche buffet dedely wound whanne lyon sawe made resemblaunt fyghte hym made hym chere beest myghte make man thenne percyuale perceyued caste doune sheld whiche broken thenne dyd helme gadre wynde gretely enchafed serpente lyon wente alwaye aboute hym fawnynge spanyel thenne stroked hym neck sholdere thenne thanked god felauship beeste aboute none lyon took lytel whelp trussed hym bare hym came fro thenne syr percyual alone tale telleth one men world tyme whiche moost byleued oure lord ihesu cryste tho dayes fewe folkes byleued god parfytely tho dayes sone spared fader straunger soo syre percyual comforted hym self lord ihesu besoughte god temptacyon shold brynge hym oute goddes seruyse endure true champyon thus whanne syr percyual prayd sawe lyon came toward hym thenne couched doune feete soo alle nyghte lyon slepte gyders whanne syr percyual slepte dremed merueyllous dreme two ladyes mette hym one sat vpon lyon sat vpon serpent one hem yonge old yongest hym thought said sir percyual lord saleweth sendeth word thow araye make redy morne thow must fyghte strongest champyon world yf thow ouercome thou shalt quyte losyng ony thy membrys thow shalt shamed euer worldes ende thenne asked lord said grettest lord alle world soo departed sodenly wyste pcapitulum vij thenne came forth lady rode vpon serpent sayd syr percyual complayne yow ye haue done vnto haue offended vnto yow certes madame sayd vnto yow lady neuer offended yes sayd shalle telle yow haue nourysshed place grete whyle serpent whiche serued grete whyle yesterday ye slewe hym gat pray saye cause ye slewe hym lyon madame said syre percyuale knowe wel lyon myn dyd hit lyon gentiller nature serpent therfor slewe hym semeth dyd amys ageynst yow madame sayd wold ye dyd wold sayd amendys beste ye bycome man thenne ansuerd wylle graunte yow sayd truly ye neuer seruaunt syn ye receyued homage lord ihesu crist therfor ensure yow place may fynde yow withoute kepynge shalle take yow somtyme man soo departed syr percyual lefte hym slepynge whiche sore trauaylled aduysyon morne aroos blessid hym passynge feble thenne sire percyual ware see sawe ship come sayllynge toward hym syr percyual went vnto shyp fond hit couerd within withoute wyth whyte samyte lord stood old man clothed surples lykenes preest syr said syr percyuale ye welcome god kepe yow sayd good man sir sayd old man whens ye syr said sir percyual kynge arthur courte knyghte table round whiche quest sancgreal grete duresse neuer lyke escape oute wyldernesse doubte sayd good man ye soo true knyghte ordre chyualry requyreth herte ye oughte ye shold doubte none enemy shold flay yow ar ye said syr percyuale syr sayd old man straunge countrey hyther come comforte yow syr sayd syr percyuale sygnefyeth dreme dremed nyghte told hym alle gyder whiche rode vpon lyon betokeneth newe lawe holy chirche vnderstande fayth good hope byleue baptym semed yonger hit grete reason borne resurection passion lord ihesu cryste grete loue came warne thy grete bataille shalle befalle whome sayd syre percyuale shalle fyghte moost champyon world said old man lady sayd yf thow quyte wel thow shalt quyte losynge one membre thow shalt shamed worldes ende rode serpent sygnefyeth olde lawe serpent betokeneth fende blamed thow slewest seruaunt betokeneth thyng serpent thow slewest betokeneth deuylle thou rodest vp roche whan thou madest sygne crosse thow slewest hym putte aw power whanne asked amendys become man thou saydest thou woldest make bileue leue thy baptym soo commaunded syr percyuale departe soo lepte ouer bord ship alle wente awey wyste whyder thenne wente vp vnto roche fonde lyon whyche alwey kepte hym felaushyp stryked hym vpon bak grete ioye hym pcapitulum viij syr percyuale abyden tyl myddaye sawe shyp came rowyng see wynd world dryuen hit soo droof vnder roche whanne syr percyual sawe hyhed hym thyder fonde ship couerd sylke blacker ony beare therin gentilwoman grete beaute clothed rychely none myghte better whanne sawe syr percyuale saide broughte yow wyldernes ye neuer lyke passe hen ye shal dye hongre meschyef damoysel saide syr percyuale serue best man world seruyse wille suffre dye knocketh shal entre asketh shalle haue seketh hym hydeth hym thenne said syr percyual wote ye ye sayd taughte yow name said sayd syre percyuale knowe better ye wene came oute waste forest fond reed knyghte whyte sheld sayd damoysel damoysel said knyghte wold mete passyng fayn sir knyghte said ye wille ensure feyth ye owe vnto knyghthode ye shalle doo wylle tyme somone yow shalle brynge yow vnto knyyt ye said shalle promyse yow fulfylle desyre well said shal telle yow sawe hym foreste chacynge two knyghtes vnto water whiche called mortay e drofe hym water drede dethe two knyghtes passed ouer r ed knyghte passed hors drenched thoro grete strengthe escaped vnto land thus told hym syr percyuale passynge glad therof thenne asked hym yf ete ony mete late nay madame truly ete mete nyghe thre dayes late spa good man fedde good wordes hooly refresshyd gretely syr knyghte said man enchauntee multyplyer wordes ye byleue hym ye shall playnly shamed dye roche pure honger eten wylde beestes ye yong man goodly knyghte shalle helpe yow ye wil ye said syr percyual profered thus grete kynd ne said gentylwoman disheryted whiche somtyme rychest woman world damoysel said syr percyual hath disheryted yow haue grete pyte yow sir said dwellid grettest man world made fayre clere ther none lyke grete beaute lytil pryde ought haue also sayd word pleasyd hym thenne wold suffre ony lenger company soo drofe myn herytage soo disheryted neuer pyte none counceylle courte sythen sir knyght hit hath befallen soo thurgh myn haue benome hym many men made hem become men aske neuer thyng gyue hit hem moche thus al seruauntes ayenst hym nyghte daye therfore knowe good knyyt noo good man gete hem syde maye knowe thow arte good knyyt byseche yow helpe ye felawe round table wherfore ye oughte fayle noo gentylwoman whiche disheryted besought yow helpe pcapitulum ix thenne syr percyual promysed alle helpe myghte thenne thanked hym tyme wheder hote thenne called vnto gentylwoman badde brynge forth pauelione soo dyd pyght hit vpon grauel sire sayd maye ye reste yow hete day thenne thanked put helme sheld slepte grete whyle thenne awoke asked yf ony mete sayd ye also ye shalle haue ynough soo sette ynough vpon table theron soo moche yt merueil maner mete yt coude thynke also dranke ther strengest wyn euer dranke hym thoughte lytel chafed oughte beheld gentilwoman hym thought fayrest creature euer sawe thenne syre percyual proferd loue prayd wold thenne refused hym maner whan requyred cause shold ardant euer seased pray loue whanne sawe hym wel enchauffed thenne sayd syr percyuale wete yow wel shall fulfylle youre wylle yf ye swere hensforth ye shalle true seruaunt doo thynge shalle commaunde yow wyl ye ensure ye true knyghte ye sayd fayr lady feythe body wel sayd shal ye doo soo hit please yow wete ye well ye knyghte world haue moost desyre thenne two squyers commaunded make bed myddes pauelione anone vnclothed leyd therin thenne syre percyual leyd hym doune naked aduenture grace sawe suerd lye ground naked who pomel reede crosse sygne crucyfyxe therin bethoughte hym knyghthode promyse made fore hand vnto good man thenne made sygne crosse forhede pauelione torned vp doune thenne chaunged vnto smoke blak clowde thenne adradde cryed alowde pcapitulum x fayr swete fader ihesu cryste ne lete shamed whiche nyghe lost thy good grace ben thenne loked shyp sawe entre therin whiche sayd sir percyual ye haue bitrayed soo wente wynde rorynge yellynge semed alle water brent thenne syr percyual made grete sorowe drewe suerd vnto hym sayeg sythen flessh maister shalle punysshe rofe hym self thurgh thygh blood starte aboute hym said good lord take recompensacion haue done ageynst lord soo thenne clothed hym armed hym called hym helf wretche sayenge nyghe lost haue loste sholde neuer haue geten ageyne vyrgynyte maye neuer recouerd hit one lost thenne stopped bledyng wounde pyece sherte thus made mone saw shyp come fro oryent good man day afore noble knyyt ashamed hym selfe felle swoune whan awoke went vnto hym wekely salewed good man thenne asked syr percyual hast thow done sythe departed sir said gentylwoman ledde dedely synne told hym gyders knewe ye mayde sayd good man syr said nay wel wote fende sente hyther shame good knyghte sayd thow arte foole gentilwoman maister fende helle whiche hath power aboue alle deuyls old lady thow sawest thyn aduysyon rydynge serpent thenne told syr percyuale lord ihesu cryst bete hym oute heuen synne whiche moost bryghtest angel heuen therfore loste herytage champyon thow foughtest alle whiche ouercome grace god ben beware syre percyuale take thys ensample thenne good man vanysshed awey thenne sire percyual took armes entryd shyp soo departed then phere endeth fourtenthe booke whiche syr percyual pand foloweth syre launcelot whiche fyftenth book pcapitulum primum whanne heremyte kepte syr launcelot thre dayes heremyte gate hym hors helme suerd pand thenne departed houre none thenne sawe lytel hows whanne came nere sawe chappel besyde sawe old man clothed al whyte ful rychely thenne sire launcelot saide god saue yow god kepe yow sayd good man make yow good knyghte thenne syr launcelot alyghte entred chappel sawe old man dede whyte shert passyng fyne clothe p sir said good man man dede oughte suche clothynge ye see hym brake othe hys ordre hath ben c wynter man relygyon thenne good man sire launcelot wente chappel good man tooke stole aboute hys neck look thenne coniured book sawe hydous fygure horryble man soo hard herted soo hard shold haue ben aferd thenne saide fende thow hast trauaylled gretely telle thou wilt wille saide good man thow telle felawe became dede whether saued dampned thenne said horryble voys lost saued may sayd good man semed lyued wel brake ordre sherte oughte none trespaceth ageynst ordre dothe wel soo sayd fende man lyeth dede come grete lygnage lord hyghte erle de vale helde grete werre ageynste man neuewe whiche hyghte aguarus soo aguarus sawe erle byggar thenne wente take counceylle vnkel lyeth dede ye maye see p thenne asked leue wente oute heremytage mayntene neuewe ageynse myghty erle hit happed man lyeth dede dyd moche wysedome hardynes erle take thre lordes force dede man pcapitulum ij thenne pee betwyxe erle aguarus grete seurte erle shold neuer werre ageynst hym thenne dede man lyeth came heremytage ageyne thenne erle made two neuewes auenged vpon man soo came day fonde dede man sacryng masse abode hym tyl sayd masse thenne set vp hym drewe oute swerdes haue slayne hym wold suerd byte hym vpon gad stele hyghe lord whiche serued hym preserued pthenne made grete fyre dyd alle clothes hayre bak thenne dede man heremyte sayd vnto wene ye brenne shalle lye power perysshe moche threde ony body noo sayd one hit shalle assayed thenne dispoylled hym putte vpon hym sherte cast hym fyre laye nyyt tyl hit daye fyre dede soo morn came fond hym dede fond neyther threde skynne tamyd soo tooke hym oute fyre grete fere leyd hym ye may see may ye suffer goo way haue sayd yow sothe thenne departed grete tempest thenne good man syr launcelot gladder fore thenne syr launcelot dwelled good man nyght sire said good man ye sir launcelot du lake ye sire said seke ye countrey syr sayd syr launcelot goo seke aduentures sancgreal wel sayd seke ye may wel though ye shalle haue noo power see hit blynd man shold see bryyte suerd longe synne el ye abeler ony man lyuynge thenne sir launcelot began wepe thenne sayd good man ye confessid syth ye loetryd quest sancgreal ye sir sayd syr launcent thenne vpon morne whanne good man songe masse thenne buryed dede man thenne syr launcelot sayd fader shalle doo sayd good man requyre yow take hayre holy man putte nexte thy skynne shalle preuaylle gretely fyr wille doo hi sayd sir launcelot also charge ye ete flesshe longe ye quest sancgreal ye shalle drynke noo wyne ye masse dayly ye may doo hit soo took hayre putte vpon hym soo departed euensonge tyme soo rode foreste mette gentylwoman rydynge vpon whyte palfrey thenne asked hym syre knyght whyder ryde ye certes damoysel sayd launcelot wote whyder ryde fortune ledeth syre launcelot said wote aduenture ye seke ye afore tyme neuer ye yet shalle ye see hit openly euer ye dyd shalle ye vnderstande shorte tyme thenne syr launcelot asked myghte herberowed nyghte ye shalle fynde day nyghte morne ye shal fynde herberowe good ease ye doubte thenne commaunded vnto god thenne rode tyl cam crosse took hoost nyghte pcapitulum tercium soo putte hors pasture dyd hys helme shelde made prayer vnto crosse neuer falle dedely synne ageyne soo leyd hym doune slepe anone slepe hit befelle hym aduysyon came man afore hym alle compas sterres man crowne gold hede man ledde felaushyp seuen kynges two knyghtes alle worshipped crosse knelyng vpon knee holdyng vp handes toward heuen alle sayd fair swete fader heuen come vysyte v yelde vnto v eueryche haue deserued thenne loked launcelot vp heuen hym semed cloudes dyd open old man came doun company angel alyghte amonge gafe vnto eueryche blessynge called seruauntes good true knyghtes whanne old man sayd thus came one tho knyghtes sayd haue lost alle haue sette thou hast rulyd ageynste warryour vsed wrong werres vayne glory pleasyr world please therfor thow shalt confounded withoute thow yelde tresour alle aduysyon sawe sir launcelot crosse morne took hors rode tyl mydday aduenture mette knyght took hors helme suerd whan slepte whan sancgreal appiered afore crosse whanne sire launcelot sawe hym salewed hym fayre cryed hyghe knyghte kepe thow hast done grete vnkyndenes thenne put afore speres sir launcelot came soo fyersly vpon hym smote hym hors doune erthe nyghe broken neck thenne sir launcelot tooke knyghtes hors owne afore hand descended hors sat vpon mounted vpon hors eyed knyghtes owne hors tree myght fynde hors whanne arysen pthenne sir launcelot rode tyl nyghte aduentur met heremyte eche hem salewed rested good man alle nyght gaf hors suche myghte gete thenne sayde good man vnto launcelot whens ye syr sayd arthur courte name sir launcelot du lake quest sancgreal therfor pray yow counceylle vysyon whiche hadde crosse soo tolde hym alle pcapitulum quartum loo sir launcelot said good man thou myytest vnderstande hyghe lygnage thou art comen thyne aduysyon betokeneth passion ihesu criste fourty yere ioseph armathye preched vyctory kynge euelake batails better enemyes seuen kynges two knyghtes fyrst hem called nappus holy man second hyghte nacyen remembraunce graunte syre hym dwelled oure lord ihesu cryst thyrd called hellyas le grose fourth hyght lysays fyfthe hyghte ionas departed countrey went walys toke doughter manuel nd gaule came dwelle countrey hym came kynge launcelot thy graute syre whiche wedded kynges doughter irland worthy man thow art hym cam kynge ban thy fader last seuen kynges sir launcelot hit sygnefyeth angel sayd thou none seuen felauships laste ix knyght sygnefyed lyon shold passe maner erthely knyghtes syre galahad whiche thow gate kynge pelles doughter thou ought thanke god ony man lyuynge synner erthely thow hast piere knygthode neuer shalle lytyl thanke hast thou gyuen god al grete vertues god hath lent psyr said launcelot ye saye good knyyt sone ouytest thow knowe man better said good man thow knewest doughter kyng pelles flesshely thow begattest galahad feest pentecost satte sege peryllous therfore make thow hit knowen openly one thy begetynge kynge pelles doughter wyl youre worship honour alle thy kynred couceyle yow place prece vpon hym haue adoo hym wel sayd launcelot semeth good knyghte shold praye vnto hyghe fader falle synne ageyne trust thow wel sayd good man thou faryst mykel better prayer sone shall bere wyckednes fader fader shalle bere wyckednes sone eueryche shalle bere owne burthen therfor beseke thow god wylle helpe alle thy nedes thenne syr launcelot wente souper soo leyd hym rest hayre prycked syr launcelots skynne whiche greued hym ful sore toke hit mekely suffred payne soo morne herd masse took armes soo toke leue pcapitulum quintum thenne mounted vpon hors rode forest helde hyhe waye loked afore hym sawe fayre playne besyde fayre castel afore castel many pauelions sylke dyuerse hewe hym semed sawe fyue honderd knyytes rydynge horsbak two partyes castel blak horse trappours blak withoute al whyte horse trappours eueryche hurteled merueylled syr launcelot laste hym thoughte castel putte werse thenne thoughte sir launcelot helpe weyker party encrecynge chyualry soo syr launcelot threst among party castel smote doune knyghte hors man erthe thenne rasshed dyd merueyllous dedes armes thenne drewe oute suerd strake many knyghtes erthe alle tho sawe hym merueylled euer one knyghte myghte doo soo grete dedes armes alweyes whyte knyghtes helde nyghe aboute syr launcelot tyere hym wynde hym att laste man may euer endure syre launcelot waxed faynt fyytyng trauaillyng wery grete dedes myghte lyfte vp armes gyue one stroke wende neuer haue borne armes thenne alle took ledde hym awey forest made hym alyghte reste hym thenne felaushyp castel ouercome defaute hym thenne sayd alle vnto syr launcelot blessid god ye oure felaushyp shalle holde yow oure pryson soo lefte hym fewe wordes thenne syr launcelot made grete sorowe neuer neuer turnement iustes best shamed thenne sayd sure synfuller euer thus rode sorowynge half day oute despayre tyl came depe valey whanne syr launcelot sawe myghte ryde vp montayne alyghte vnder appel tree lefte helme shelde put hors vnto pasture thenne leid hym doune slepe thenne hym thoughte came old man afore hym whiche sayd launcelot euylle feythe poure byleue wherfor thy wille tourned soo lyghtely toward thy dedely synne whanne sayd thus vanysshed away launcelot wyst become thenne tooke hors armed hym rode way sawe chappel recluse whiche hadde wyndowe myghte see vp aulter alle aloude called launcelot semed knyghte erraunt thenne came asked hym place aboute wente seke pcapitulum sextum thenne told alle gyder word word trouthe befelle hym turne ment told aduysyon nyghte slepe prayd telle hym hit myght mene wel contente hit p launcelot sayd longe ye knyghte erthely knyghthode ye moost merueillous man world moost aduenturous pnow said lady sythen ye sette amonge knyghtes heuenly aduentures yf aduenture felle contrary turnement haue thou merueille turnement yesterdaye tokenynge oure lord thenne none enchauntement turnement erthely knyghtes turnemet token see shold haue knyghtes outher clyazar sone kynge pelles argustus sone kynge harlon clyazar alle clothed whyte argustus couerd blak whiche comen alle betokeneth shalle telle yow pthe daye pentecost whan kynge arthur helde court befelle erthely kynges knyghtes toke turnement gydrs say quest sancgr al erthely knyghtes whiche clothed al black couerynge betokeneth synnes wherof confessid couerynge whyte betokeneth vyrgynyte chosen chastyte thus quest begonne thenne thow behelde synners good men thow sawest synners ouercome thow enclynest party bobaunce pryde world alle must lefte quest p quest thow shalte haue many felawes thy better thow arte soo feble euylle truste good byleue made hit whan thou took ledde forest anone appiered sancgreal vnto whyte knyghtes thow soo f ble good byleue feyth thou myghtest abyde hit alle techynge good man anone thou tornest synners caused thy mysauenture thow sholdest knowe good euylle vayne glory world whiche worth pere grete pryde thou madest grete sorow thou haddest ouercome alle whyte knyghtes keueryng whyte whome betokeneth vyrgynyte chastyte therfor god wroth yow god loueth suche dedes quest aduision signefyeth yt thou euil feythe poure byleue whiche wille make falle depe pytte helle yf thow kepe pnow haue warned thy vayne glory thy pryde thow hast many tymes erryd ageynst thy maker beware euerlastynge payne alle erthely knyghtes haue moost pyte knowe wel thow hast thy pyere ony erthely synful man soo commaunded syr launcelot dyner dyner toke hors commaunded god soo rode depe valeye sawe ryuer hyhe mntayn thorou water must nedes passe whiche hydous thenne name god took hit good herte came ouer sawe armed knyghte hors man black ony beare withoute ony word smote syr launcelots hors erthe soo passed wyst become thenne took helme shelde thanked god aduenture phere leueth story syr launcelot p speke sir gawayne whiche xvj book pcapitulum primum whanne sire gawayne departed felaushyp rode long withoute ony aduenture fond tenth parte aduenture wonte doo syre gawayn rode whytsontyde vntyl mychelmasse fonde none aduenture pleasyd hym soo daye befelle gawayne mette sir ector de mary eyther made grete ioye merueylle telle soo told eueryche complayned gretely coude fynde none aduenture p truly sayd syre gawayne vnto syre ector nyghe wery quest loth folowe strauge countreyes one thynge merueilled sayd syre ector haue mette twenty knyghtes felawes myn al complayne doo haue merueille said syr gawayne syr launcelot broder truly said sire ector hym syr galahad percyuale syr bors lete hem sayd syre gawayne foure haue pyeres yf one thyng syr launcelot felawe none erthely man yf took payne vpon hym four mette gyders wille bothe ony man mete hem fayle sancgreal hit waste alle remenaunt recouer hit thus ector gawayne rode eyghte dayes saterday fond old chappel whiche wasted semed man thyder repayred alyghte sette speres att dore entryd chappel made orysons grete whyle thenne sette hem doune seges chappel spak one thyng heuynes felle slepe befelle hem merueyllous aduentures sir gawayn hym semed cam medowe ful herbes floures sawe rake bulles honderd fyfty prowd blak sauf thre hem al whyte one blak spot two soo fayre soo whyte myght whyter thre bulles whiche soo fayre teyed two stronge cordes remenaunt bulles sayd among hem goo hen seke better pasture wente came ageyne lene myghte stande vp ryghte bulles soo whyte one came ageyne mo whan whyte bulle come ageyne amonge rose vp grete crye lack wynde yt fayled departed one another aduysyon befelle gawayne nyght pcapitulum secundum bvt ector de mary befelle another vysyon contrary hit semed hym broder syre launcelot alyghte oute chayer lepte vpon ij horse one sayde go seke shal fynde hym thoughte man bete syr launcelot despoylled hym clothed hym another aray whiche al ful knottes sette hym vpon asse rode tyll cam fayrest welle euer sawe syre laucelot alyghte wold haue dronke welle whan stouped drynke water water sanke hym pand whanne syre launcelot sawe torned wente thyder hede came fro meane whyle trowed hym self syr ector rode tyl cam ryche man hows weddynge sawe kynge whiche sayd syr knyghte place yow thenne torned ageyne vnto chayer came fro thus within whyle bothe gawayne ector awaked eyther told aduysyon whiche merueylled gretely truly sayd ector shalle neuer mery tyl tydynges broder launcelot p sat thus talkyng sawe hand shenyng vnto elbowe couerd reed samyte vpon henge brydel ryght ryche helde within fyst grete candel whiche brenned ryght clere soo passed afore entryd chappel thene vanysshed awey wyst anone came donne voyse whiche sayd knyghtes ful euylle feyth poure leue two thynges haue fayled yow therfor ye may come aduentures sancgreal thenne fyrst spak gawayne sayd ector haue ye herd wordes ye truly said sir ector herd alle goo sayd syre ector vnto heremyte wille telle v aduysyon hit semeth labour alle vayne soo departed rode valeye mette squyer whiche rode hakney salewed hym fayre sire sayd gawayne thou teche v ony heremyte one lytel montayne hit soo rough may hors go thyder therfore ye muste goo vpon foote shalle ye fynde poure hows nacyen heremyte whiche holyest man countrey departed eyther thenne valey mette knyghte al armed whiche profered hem iuste fer sawe name god sayd syr gawayne sythe departed camelot none profered iuste one sir said ector lete iuste hym nay sayd gawayne ye shalle yf bete hit shalle forthynke thenne yf ye goo thenne eyther enbraced iuste came gyders fast horse myghte renne brast sheldes mayles one gawayne wounded lyfte syde knyghte smy en thorou brest spere cam oute syde soo felle bothe oute sadels fallynge brak bothe speres anone gawayne aroos sette hand suerd caste sheld afore hym alle nought knyght power aryse ageyne hym thenne said gawayne ye must yelde ouercome el may slee sir knyghte sayd dede goddes sake gentilnes lede vnto abbay may receyue creatour syre sayd gawayne knowe hows relygyon syr sayd knyghte sette hors fore yow shalle teche yow gawayne sette hym vp sadel lepte vp behynde hym sustene hym soo came abbay wel receyued anone vnarmed receyued creatour thenne prayd gawayne drawe truncheon spere oute body thenne gawayne asked hym knewe hym sayd kynge arthur courte felawe round table bretheren sworne gyders syr gawayne thow hast slayne name vwayne le auoultres somtyme sone vnto kynge vryens quest sancgreal forgyue god hit shal euer sayd one sworn broder hath slayn thotherr pcapitulum tercium allas sayd gawayne euer mysauenture fallen force sayd vwayne sythe shalle dye deth moche worshypfuller man hand myghte dye whanne ye come court recommaunde vnto lord kynge arthur alle tho ben lefte lyue old brotherhode thynke thenne beganne gawayne wepe ector also thenne vwayne hym self syre gawayne drewe oute truncheon spere anone departed soule body ne sir gawayne sir ector beryed hym men oughte berye kynges sone made wryten vpon name whome slayne thenne departed gawayne ector heuy myghte mysauentur rode til came rouy montayne teyed horse wente foote heremytage whanne come vp sawe poure hows besyde chappel lytyl courtelage nacyen heremyte gadred wortes whiche tasted none mete grete whyle whanne sawe erraunt knyghtes came toward salewed hym ageyne faire lordes said aduentur brought yow hyther syr said gawayn speke yow confessid sir said heremyte redy thenne told hym soo moche wyst well thenne thoughte counceylle hem yf myght thenne began gawayne fyrst told hym aduysyon chappel ector told hym alle afore reherced sir said heremyte vnto sir gawayne fayr medowe rak therm ought vnderstande round table medowe oughte vnderstande humylyte pacyence tho ben thynges whiche ben alweyes grene quyck men maye tyme ouercome humylyte pacyence therfor round table fou den chyualry hath ben alle tymes soo fraternyte whiche myght ouercomen men sayd founded pacyence humylyte rake ete honderd fyfty bulles ete medowe hertes shold sette humylyte pacyence bulles prowde blak sauf thre bulles vnderstande felaushyp round table whiche synne wyckednes ben black blaknes saye withoute good vertuous werkes thre bulles whyte sauf one spotted two whyte bitokenen syr galahad sir percyual maydens clene withoute spotte thyrd spot sygnefyeth syr bors de ganys trespaced one vyrgynyte sythen kept hym self wel chastyte alle forgyuen hym mysdedes tho thre teyed neckes thre knyghtes vyrgynyte chastyte pryde smyten blak bulles whiche sayd goo hen tho whiche pentecost atte hyhe feest took vpon hem goo quest sancgreal withoute confession myghte entre medowe humylyte pacyence therfor retorned waste countreyes sygnefyeth dethe shalle dye many eueryche shalle slee synne shalle escape shalle soo lene hit shalle merueylle see thre bulles withoute spotte one shalle come ageyne two neuer pcapitulum quartum thenne spak nacyen vnto ector sothe hit launcelot ye came doune one chayer chayer betokeneth maistership lordshyp whiche ye came doune fro ye two knyghtes sayd heremyte ye goo seke ye shalle neuer fynde sancgreal hit secrete thynge oure lord ihesu cryste meane syre launcelot felle doune hors hath left pryde taken hym humylyte hath cryed mercy lowde synne sore repented hym lorde hath clothed hym clothyng whiche ful knottes hayre weryth dayly pand asse rode vpon beest humylyte god wold ryde vpon stede vpon palfrey ensample asse betokeneth mekenes thou sawest syr launcelot ryde thy slepe welle water sanke hym whanne shold haue taken therof whanne sawe myghte haue retorned thyder whens came welle betokeneth hyghe grace god men desyre hit take hit shalle desyre soo whanne came nyghe sancgreal meked hym held hym man worthy soo nyghe holy vessel ben soo defouled dedely synne space many yeres yet whanne kneled drynke welle sawe grete preuydence sancgreal serued soo longe deuylle shal haue vengeaunce four twenty dayes longe hath ben deuyls seruaunt four twenty yeres thenne soone shalle retorne vnto camelot oute coutrey shalle saye parte suche thynges hath fonde pnow wille telle yow betokeneth hande candel brydel vnderstande holy ghost charyte euer brydel sygnefyeth abstynence whanne brydeled crysten man herte holdeth hym soo shorte falleth dedely synne candell whiche sheweth clerenesse syghte sygnefyeth ryyt way ihesu cryst whanne wente sayd knyghtes poure feythe wycked byleue thre thynges fayled charyte abstynence trouth therfor ye maye atteyne hyhe aduenture sancgreal pcapitulum quintum certes sayd gawayne sothely haue ye sayd see openly pnow pray yow good man holy fader telle mette soo many aduentures wonte doo comynly haue better pi shalle telle yow gladly sayd good man aduenture sancgreal whiche ye many haue vndertake ye quest fynde cause appiereth synners wherfore merueylle though ye fayle therof many ye vntrue knyghte grete murtherer good men sygnefyeth thynges murther dar saye synful syre launcelot hath ben sythe wente quest sancgreal slewe neuer man nought shalle tyll come vnto camelot ageyne hath taken vpon hym forsake synne nere ny stable thoughte lykely torne ageyne shold nexte encheue sauf galahad sone god knoweth thoughte vnstabylnesse yet shalle dye ryght holy man doubte hath felawe erthely synful man sir sayd gawayne hit semeth wordes oure synnes wylle auaylle v trauaylle quest truly sayd good man ben honderd suche ye neuer shalle preuayle haue shame whanne herd voyces commaunded hym vnto god pthenne good man called gawayne sayd longe tyme passed syth ye made knyghte neuer sythen thow seruedest thy maker thow arte soo old tree neyther lyf ne fruyte wherfore bethynk thou yelde oure lord bare rynde sythe fende hath leues fruyte syr said gawayne leyser wold speke yow felawe syr ector gone abydeth yonder bynethe hylle wel sayd good man thow better counceylled thenne departed gawayne ande came ector soo took horse rode tyl came foster hows whiche herberowed ryyt wel morne departed theyr hooste rode longe coude fynde ony aduenture pcapitulum sextum whanne bors departed camelot mette relygyous man rydynge asse syre bors salewed hym anon good man knewe hym one knyytes erraunt quest sancgreal ye sayd good man sire sayd knyyte fayn wold counceylled quest sancgreal shall haue moche erthely worship may brynge ende certes sayd good man sothe shalle best knyghte world fairest alle felauship wete yow wel shall none atteyne clennes pure confession rode gyder tyl came heremytage prayd bors dwelle alle nyghte hym soo alyghte put awey armour prayd hym myghte confessid soo wente chappel clene confessid ete brede drank water gyder sayd good man praye thow ete none tyl thou sytte table sancgreal shalle sir sayd agree therto wete ye shall sytte yes sayd good man knowe shalle fewe felawes yow welcome sayd sir bors god sendeth also said good man stede sherte sygne chastysement ye shal garment therfor pray yow doo al clothes sherte soo dyd thenne tooke hym scarlet cote shold stede sherte tyll fulfylled quest sancgreal good man fond hym soo marueillous lyfe soo stable merueilled felte neuer corrupte flesshely lustes one tyme begat elyan le blank thenne armyd hym took leue departed soo lytel then loked vp tree sawe passynge grete byrde vpon olde tree hit passyng drye withoute leues byrd sat aboue byrdes whiche dede honger soo smote hym self bek whiche grete sharpe soo grete byrd bledde tyl dyed amonge byrdes yonge byrdes token lyf blood grete byrd whan bors sawe wyst wel grete tokenynge whanne sawe grete byrd arose thenne tooke hys hors yede way euensonge aduentur cam strong toure hyhe lodged gladly pcapitulum septimum whanne vnarmed ledd hym hyhe toure lady yonge lusty fayre receyued hym grete ioye made hym sytte doune soo sette soupe flesshe many deyntres whanne syre bors sawe bethought hym penaunce badde squyer brynge hym water soo broughte hym made soppes therin ete sayd lady trowe ye lyke mete yes truly sayd syr bors god thanke yow madame may ete none mete daye thenne spak nomore tyme lothe displease hym pthenne souper spak one thynge came squyer sayd madame ye must purueye yow morne champyon el syster wille haue castel also landes excepteye fynde knyyt wille fyghto morne quarel ageynst prydam le noyre thenne made sorowe sayd lord god wherfor graunted ye hold lond wherof shold disheryted withoute reason ryghte whanne sire bors herd say thus sayd shalle comforte yow syr sayd shal telle yow kynge hyghte anyause whiche held alle land kepynge soo hit myshapped loued gentilwoman grete dele elder soo tooke alle land kepyng men gouerne brought vp many euylle custommes putte dethe grete party kynnesmen whanne sawe lete charce oute land bytoke hit alle land demenys anone worthy kynge dede lady beganne werre vpon hath destroyed many men tourned hem ageynste haue wel nyghe man lefte haue nought el hyhe toure lefte yet hath promysed haue toure withoute fynde knyghte fyghte champyon telle sayd syr bors prydam le noyre syre sayd moost doubted man thys land p may ye send word ye haue fond knyghte shall fyghte prydam le noyre goddes quarel thenne lady lytel glad sente word purueyed nyghte bors good chere bedde wold come leyd hym floore neuer wold doo otherwyse tyl met quest sancgreal pcapitulum octanum anone slepe hym befelle vysyon came hym two byrdes one whyte swan merueyllous blak soo grete lykenes rauen ne whyte byrd came hym sayd thou woldest gyue mete serue shold gyue alle ryches world shalle make fayre whyte soo whyte byrd departed cam blak byrd hym sayd thou wolte serue morowe haue despyte though blak wete thow wel auayleth blaknes others whytnes thenne departed another vysyon hym thoughte came grete place whiche semed chappel fonde chayer sette lyste syde whiche worme eten feble ryghte hand two floures lyke lylye one wold haue benome others whytnes good man departed hem touched thenne oute eueryche floure came oute many floures fruyte grete plente thenne hym thoughte good man sayd shold doo grete foly wold lete two floures perysshe socoure rotten tree hit felle erthe syr sayd semeth woode myghte auayle kepe sayd good man thou neuer see suche aduenture befalle thenne awaked made sygne crosse myddes forhede soo rose clothed hym came lady place salewed hym ageyne wente chappel herd seruyse ther came companye knyghtes lady sent lede sir bors vnto bataille thenne asked armes whanne armed prayd hym take lytyl morsel dyne nay madame sayd shalle tyll haue done bataille grace god soo lept vpon hors departed alle knyghtes men hym soone two ladyes mette gyder whiche bors shold fyghte complayned sayd madame ye haue done wronge bireue landes kynge anyaus gaf ful bothe shold ony bataille ye shalle chese sayd lady el youre knyghte withdrawe hym thenne ther crye made whiche party better tho two knyghtes lady shold reioyse alle lande departed one knyghte thenne came gyders suche raundon perced sheldes hauberkes speres flewe pyeces wounded eyther sore thenne hurteled gyders folle erthe horse betwix legges anone arose sette handes swerdes smote chone vpon hedes made grete woundes depe blood wente oute bodyes ther fonde sir bors gretter defence knyght wende prydam passynge good knyghte wounded sir bors ful euyl hym ageyne euer prydam helde stoure lyke hard perceyued sire bors suffred hym tyl nyghe attaynte pand thenne ranne vpon hym wente bak drede deth soo withdrawynge felle vp ryght syre bors drewe helme soo strongly rente hit fro hede gafe hym grete stroke flatte swerd vpon vysage hym yelde hym shold slee hym thenne cryed hym mercy sayd faire knyght goddes loue slee shalle ensure neuer werre ageynst thy lady alwey toward thenne bors lete hym thenne old lady fledde alle knyghtes pcapitulum ix soo thenne came bors alle tho held landes lady sayd shold destroye
