hem yf dyd suche seruyse vnto longed landes soo dyd homage wold chaced oute landes thenne befelle yonge lady come estate ageyne myghty prowesse syr bors de ganys soo whan alle countrey wel set pee thenne syre bors toke leue departed thanked hym gretely wold haue gyuen hym grete rychesse refused hit thenne rode alle day tyl nyght came herberowe lady whiche knewe hym wel ynough maade hym grete ioye vpon morne soone day appiered bors departed then soo rode foreste vnto houre mydday bifelle hym merueyllous aduenture mette departyng two wayes two knyghtes ledde lyonel broder al naked bounden vpon stronge hakney handes bounden fore brest eueryche hem helde handes thornes wente betynge hym sore blood trayled doune honderd place body soo al blood fore behynde said neuer word whiche grete herte suffred alle euer dyd hym though felte none anguysshe anone syre bors dressid hym rescowe hym broder soo loked vpon syde hym sawe knyghte whiche brought fair gentylwoman wold haue set thyckest place forest haue ben surer oute way hem sought hym whiche thynge assured cryed hyghe voys saynte mary socoure mayde p anone aspyed syre bors came rydynge whanne came nygh hym demed hym knyghte round table wherof hoped haue comforte thenne coniured hym feythe ought vnto hym who seruyse thow arte entryd feythe ye owe vnto hyghe ordre knyghthode noble kyng arthur sake suppose made knyght thow help suffre shamed knyghte pwhanne bors herd saye thus soo moche sorowe nyst doo yf lete broder aduenture must slayne wold alle erthe yf help mayde shamed euer also shall lese vyrgynyte whiche shal neuer gete ageyne thenne lyfte vp eyen sayd wepynge fair swete lord ihesu cryste whoos lyege man kepe lyonel broder knyghtes slee hym pyte yow mary sake shalle socoure mayde pcapitulum x thenne dressid hym vnto knyghte whiche gentylwoman thenne cryed sir knyghte lete hand mayden ye dede thenne sette doune mayden armed alle pyeces sauf lacked spere thenne dressid sheld drewe oute swerd bors smote hym soo hard went thurgh shelde haberion lyfte sholder thorowe grete strengthe bete hym doune erthe pullynge oute bors spere swouned pthenne came bors mayde sayd semeth yow knyghte ye delyuerd tyme p sir said praye yow lede knyghte hadde soo shall gladly took hors wounded knyyght sette gentylwoman vpon hym soo broughte desyred sir knyghte sayd ye haue better sped ye wend lost maydenhede fyue honderd men shold haue dyed hit knyghte yow forest feithe sayd cosyn wote neuer engyn fende enchauffed hym yesterday took fader pryuely none faders men mystrusted hym yf hadde hadde maydenhede shold haue dyed synne body shamed dishonoured euer thus stood talkynge hym came twelue knyghtes sekyng anone told hem alle bors delyuerd thenne maad grete ioye besoughte hym come fader grete lord shold ryght welcome truly sayd bors may tyme haue grete aduentur doo countrey soo commaunded hem vnto god departed thenne syr bors rode lyonel broder trace horse thus rode sekyng grete whyle thenne ouer toke man clothed relygyous clothynge rode stronge black hors blacker bery sayd syre knyyte seke yow syre sayd seke broder sawe within whyle beten two knyghtes bors discomforte yow ne falle wanhope shall telle tydynges suche ben truly dede thenne shewed hym newe slayne body lyenge busshe semed hym wel body lyonel thenne made suche sorowe felle erthe swoune lay grete whyle whanne came hym selfe said faire brother syth company yow departed shall neuer haue ioye herte whiche haue take vnto maister help whanne sayd thus toke body lyghtely armes putte hit vpon arson sadel thenne sayd man canst thow telle vnto somme chappel may burye body come said one fast soo longe rood tyl sawe fayre toure afore semed old feble chappel thenne alyght bothe put hym tombe marbel pcapitulum xj leue hym sayd good man goo oure herberowe tyl morowe wille come ageyne doo hym seruyse sir sayde bors ye preest ye forscthe sayd thenne pray yow telle dreme befelle ye last nyyt say sayd thenne began soo moche telle hym grete byrd forest told hym byrdes one whyte another black rotten tree whyte floures syre shalle telle yow parte dele morowe whyte foule betokeneth gentylwoman fayre ryche whiche loued peramours hath loued longe p yf thou warne loue shalle goo dye anone yf thou haue pyte sygnefyeth grete byrd whiche shalle make warne pnow noo fere thou hast ne drede thow haste god thow shalte warne thou woldest hit holden chast conquere boo veyne glory world shalle befalle thou warne la ncelot good knyghte thy cosyn shalle dye therfore men shalle saye yt thow art man sleer thy broder syre lyonel thy cosyn syre launcelot du lake whiche thow myghtest haue saued rescowed easyly thow wenest rescowe mayde whiche perteyneth thynge pnow loke thow whether hit ben gretter harme thy broders deth el haue suffred haue lost maydenhode pthenne asked hym haste thow herd token thy dreme whiche haue told yow ye forsothe sayd syre bors alle youre exposycyon declarynge dreme haue wel vnderstande herd thenne said man black clothynge thenne hit thy defaute yf sire launcelot thy cosyn dye psyre said bors lothe wete ye wel thynge world leuer doo hit see lord sire launcelot du lake dye defaute ye one said good man thenne led syre bors hyghe toure fonde knyghtes ladyes tho ladyes sayde welcome soo vnarmed hym pand whanne dobblet men broughte hym mantel furred ermyn putte hit aboute hym thenne made hym suche chere hadde forgeten alle sorowe anguysshe sette herte delytes deyntees tooke noo thoughte broder syre lyonel neyther syre launcelot du lake cosyn anone came oute chamber hym fayrest lady euer sawe rycher bysene euer sawe quene gueneuer ony estat lo sayd syre bors lady vnto whome owe alle oure seruyse trowe rychest lady fayrest alle world whiche loueth yow best aboue alle knyghtes wille haue knyght yow whanne vnderstood langage abasshed thenne salewed hym thenne satte doune gyders spak many thynges soo moche besoughte hym loue loued hym aboue alle erthely men shold make hym rycher euer man age pwhanne bors vnderstood wordes ryght euyll ease whiche maner wold breke chastyte soo wyst ansuer pcapitulum xij allas sayd bors shalle ye doo wylle madame said bors lady world who wylle wylle fulfylle thynge broder lyeth dede whiche slayne ryght late bors sayd haue loued yow longe grete beaute haue sene yow grete hardynes haue herd yow nedes ye must ly nyghte therfor praye yow graunte ptruly sayd shalle doo hit maner wyse thenne made hym suche sorowe though wold haue dyed wel bors sayd vnto haue ye broughte nyghe myn ende took hym hand badde hym behold ye shal see shalle dye loue sayd thenne shalle neuer see thenne departed wente vp hyhe batilment led twelue gentylwymmen whan aboue one gentylwymmen cryed sayd pa syr bors gentil knyghte haue mercy v suffre lady haue wil yf ye doo muste suffre deth oure lady falle doune thys hyhe towre yf ye suffre v thus dye soo lytel thynge alle ladyes gentilwymmen wylle saye dishonour pthenne loked vpward semed alle ladyes grete estate rychely well bysene thenne hem grete pyte vncounceiled hym self leuer alle loste soules felle adoune alle one vnto erthe whan sawe al abasshed therof grete merueylle blessyd body vysage anone herd grete noyse grete crye though alle fendes helle ben aboute hym sawe neyther toure ne lady ne gentylwoman chappel broughte broder thenne helde vp bothe handes heuen sayd fayre fader god greuously escaped thenne tooke armes hors rode way thenne herde clok smyte ryght hand thydder came abbay ryght hand closyd hyhe walles lete thenne supposed one quest sancgreal ledde hym chamber vnarmed hym syrs sayd syr bors yf ony holy man hows pray yow lete speke hym thenne one hem ledde hym vnto abbot whiche chappel thenne syr bors salewed hym hym ageyne sir said bors knyght erraunt told hym aduenture whiche sene sir knyght sayd abbot wote ye wende neuer knyght age myghte haue ben soo strong grace lord ihesu cryst thenne ye shall go vnto rest wyll counceyle yow day hit late morowe shalle counceylle yow pcapitulum xiij nyghte syre bors serued rychely morne erly herd masse abbot came hym hym good morow bors hym ageyne thene told hym felawe quest sancgreal charge holy man ete brede water pthenne oure lord ihesus cryste shewed hym vnto yow lykenes sowle suffred grete anguysshe v syn putte vpon crosse bledde herte blood mankynde token lykenes sancgreal appiered afore yow blood grete foule bled reuyued chyckens deth lyf bare tree betokened world whych naked withoute fruyte yf hit come oure lord also lady whome ye fought kyng anyaus whiche lord fore betokeneth ihesu cryste whiche kynge world foughte champyon lady hit betokeneth whanne took bataille lady shall ye vnderstande newe lawe ihesu cryst holy chirche lady ye shalle vnderstande old lawe fende whiche al day werrith ageynst holy chirche therfor ye dyd bataille ryghte ye ihesu crystes knyghtes therfor ye oughte defender holy chirche black byrd myghte ye vnderstande holy chirche whiche sayth blak faire whyte byrd myghte men vnderstande fende shalle telle yow swan whyte withoute forth blak within hit ypocrysy whiche withoute yelowe pale semeth withoute forth seruauntes ihesu cryste ben within soo horryble fylthe synne begyle world euylle also whanne fende appiered lykenes man relygyon blamyd thow lefte thy broder lady soo ledde thow semyd thy broder slayne yet lyue alle putte errour brynge vnto wanhope lechery knewe thou tendyr herted thou sholdest fynde blessid aduenture sancgreal thyrdde foule betokeneth stronge bataille ageynst fair ladyes whiche alle deuyls also drye tree whyte lylye drye tree bitokeneth thy broder lyonel whiche drye withoute vertue therfore many men oughte calle hym rotten tree worme eten tree murtherer doth contrary ordre knyghthode two whyte floures sygnyfyen two maydens one knyght whiche wounded day gentylwoman whiche ye rescowed floure drewe nyghe knyghte wold haue defowled hym self bothe syr bors ye ben grete foole grete perylle haue sene tho two floures perysshe socoure roten tree synned gyder ben dampned ye rescowed hem bothe men myghte calle yow veray knyghte seruaunt ihesu cryste pcapitulum xiiij thenne wente sir bors then commaunded abbot vnto god thenne rode alle day herberowed old lady morne rode castel valey mette yoman goynge grete paas toward foreste saye sayd syre bors canst thow telle ony aduenture syre sayd shall vnder castel grete merueyllous turnement folkes shal hit sayd syr bors erle playns shal one party ladyes neuew heruyn party thenne bors thouyt yf myyt mete broder syr lyonel ony felaushyp whyche quest sancgreal thenne torned hermytage entre foreste come thyder fonde syr lyonel broder whiche sat al armed entre chappel dore abyde herberowe tyl morn turnement shalle whanne sir bors sawe hym grete ioye hym merueil telle hys ioye thenne alyghte hors sayd fair swete broder whanne came ye hydder anone lyonel sawe hym said pa bors ye maye make none auaunt myyt haue ben slayn whan ye sawe two knyytes ledyng awey betyng ye lefte socoure gentilwoman suffred perylle deth neuer erst ne dyd broder another grete vntrouthe mysdede ensure deth wel haue ye deserued therfore kepe hensforward shal ye fynde soone armed whan sir bors vnderstood broders wrath knelyd doune erthe cryed hym mercy holdyng vp handes prayd hym forgyue hym euyll wylle nay sayd lyonel shalle neuer maye haue hyher hand make myn auowe god thow shalt haue dethe pyte ye lyued lenger ryghte soo wente took harneis mounted vpon hors cam fore hym sayd bors kepe shall wold felon traytour ye vntruest knyght euer came oute soo worthy hows kynge bors de ganys whiche oure fader therfore starte vpon thy hors soo shalle ye moost auauntage yf ye wylle wille renne vpon yow ye stande vpon foote soo shame shalle myn harme shame ne reke noughte whan syr bors sawe must fyghte broder el dye nyst doo thenne herte counceyled hym therto moche lyonel borne wherfor ought bere hym reuerence yet kneled doune afore lyonels hors foot sayd fair swete broder haue mercy vpon sle haue remembraunce grete loue whiche oughte bitwene v tweyne syr bors sayd lyonel roughte fende broughte hym suche wyl shold slee hym thenne whanne lyonel sawe wold none wold haue rysen gyue hym bataille rasshed ouer hym smote bors hors feete vpward erthe hurte hym sore swouned distresse whiche felte hym self haue dyed withoute confession soo whanne lyonel sawe alyghte hors haue smyten hede soo toke hym helme wold haue rente hit heed p thenne came heremyte rennyng vnto hym whiche good man grete age wel herd alle wordes bitwene soo folle doune vpon syre bors pcapitulum xv thenne sayd lyonel gentyl knyghte haue mercy vpon thy b oder yf thow slee hym thow shalte dede synne sorouful one worthyest knyghtes world best condycyons soo god help sayd lyonel syr preest yf ye flee hym shall slee yow shalle neuer sooner quyte certes sayd good man haue leuer ye slee hym dethe shalle grete harme halfe soo moche wel sayd lyonel greed sette hand te swerd smote hym soo hard hede yede bakward restrayned hym euyll wylle took broder helme vnlaced hit haue stryken hede slayn hym withoute fayle soo happed colgreuaunce felawe round table cam tyme thyder oure lordes wylle whanne sawe good man slayne merueylled moche myght thenne beheld lyonel wold haue slayne broder knewe syre bors whiche loued ryyt wel thenne starte doune toke lyonel sholders drewe hym strongly abak bors sayd lyonel wylle ye slee broder worthyest knyghte world one shold noo good man suffer sayd lyonel wylle ye lette therfor yf ye entermete yow shall slee hym sayd colgreuaunce sothe ye wille slee hym slee hym wylle sayd saye contrary hath done moche ageynst hath wel deserued soo ranne vpon hym wold haue smyten hym thurgh hede sir colgreuaunce ranne betwyx sayd ye hardy soo two shal medle gyders lyonel vnderstood wordes took sheld afore hym asked hym told hym colgreuaunce one felawes thenne lyonel defyed hym gaf hym grete stroke thurgh helme thenne drewe suerd passyng good knyyte defended hym ryyt manfully soo longe dured batail bors rose vp anguysshly behelde colgreuaunce good knyght fought broder quarel thenne full sory heuy thoughte yf colgreuaunce slee hym broder sholde neuer haue ioye yf broder slew colgreuauce shame shold euer myn thenne wolde haue rysen haue departed soo moche myghte stande foote soo abode hym soo longe tyl colgreuaunce werse lyonel grete chyualrye ryghte hardy perced hauberk helme abode dethe lost moche blood merueylle myghte stande vp ryghte thenne beheld syr bors whiche sat dressynge hym vpward said bors come ye caste oute perylle dethe wherin haue put socoure yow whiche ryght nyghe dethe certes said lyonel shall auayle none shalle bere others waraunt ye shalle dye bothe hand bors herd dyd soo moche rose putte helme thenne per yued fyrste heremyte preest whiche slayne thenne made merueillous sorowe vpon hym pcapitulum xvj thenne ofte colgreuaunce cryed vpon syre bors wylle ye lete dye sake yf plese yow dye yow dethe wille please better saue worthy man word syre lyonel smote helme hed thenne colgreuaunce sawe myght escape thenne sayd fair swete ihesu haue mysdoo haue mercy vpon sowle suche sorowe herte suffreth goodenes almes dede wold haue done lygement penaunce vnto soules helthe wordes lyonel smote hym soo sore bare hym erthe soo whanne slayne colgreuaunce ranne vpon broder fendly man gaf hym suche stroke made hym stoupe ful humylyte prayd hym goddes loue leue bataille hit befelle fayre broder slewe yow ye shold dede synne p neuer god help yf haue yow mercy maye haue better hand thenne drewe bors suerd al wepynge sayd faire brother god knoweth myn entente fayre broder ye haue done ful euylle daye slee suche holy p est whiche neuer trespast also ye haue slayne gentyl knyghte one oure felawes wel wote ye ferd yow gretely drede wrathe god vnkyndely werre therefore god shewe myracle vpon v bothe god haue mercy vpon though defende lyf ageynst broder bors lyfte vp hand wold haue smyten broder pcapitulum xvij thene herd voyce sayd flee bo touche hym el thow shall slee hym ryght alyyt clowde betwixe lykenes fyre merueyllous flamme bothe two sheltes brente p thenne sore affrayed felle bothe erthe laye grete whyle swoune whanne came self bors sawe broder harme thenne held vp bothe handes dradde god taken vengeaunce vpon hym herd voyce saye bors go hen bere thy broder noo lenger felaushyp take thy way anone ryghte see sire percyual abydeth thenne sayd broder fayr swete broder forgyue goddes loue alle haue trespaced vnto yow thenne ansuerd god forgyue doo gladly sir bors departed hym rode nexte way see last fortune came abbay whiche nygh see nyght bors rested hym slepe came voice hym badde hym go see thenne starte vp made sygne crosse myddes forhede took harneis made redy hors mou ted vpon hym broken walle rode oute rode soo long tyl came see strond fond shyp couerd whyte samyte alyghte bitoke hym ihesu cryst soone entryd ship shyp departed see wente fast hym semed shyp wente fleynge hit soone derke soo myght knowe man soo slepte tyl hit daye thenne awaked sawe myddes shyp knyyt lye alle armed sauf helme thenne knewe hit syr percyual walys thenne made hym ryyt grete ioye sir percyual abasshed hym asked hym fayr syr sayd bors knowe ye certes sayd merueylle ye came hyther yf oure lord broughte yow hydder hym self thenne syre bors smyled dyd helme thenne percyual knewe hym eyther made grete ioye merueylle pthenne bors told hym came shyp whoos ammonysshement eyther told temptacyons ye haue herd fore hand psoo wente douneward see one whyle bakward another whyle forward eueryche comforted ofte prayer thenne sayd syre percyual lak thynge galahad good knyghte p thus endeth syxtenth book whiche syre gawayne ector de mary syre bors de ganys sir percyual pand foloweth seuententh book whiche noble knyghte syre galahad pcapitulum primum saith story whanne galahad rescowed percyual twenty knyghtes yede tho waste foreste wherin rode many iourneyes fonde many aduentures whiche brought ende wherof story maketh mencyon thenne toke waye see daye hit befelle passed castel wonder turnement withoute done soo moche within putte werse yet wythin good knyghtes ynouy whanne galahad sawe tho soo grete meschyef men slewe hem att entre castel thenne thoughte helpe hem putte spere forth smote fyrste flay erthe spere brak pyeces thenne drewe suerd smote thyckest dyd wonderful dedes armes alle merueylled thenne hit happed gawayne sir ector de mary knyghtes withoute whanne aspyed whyte shelde reed crosse one sayd yonder good knyght sir galahad haute prynce shold grete foole whiche shold mete hym fyghte soo aduenture came sire gawayne smote hym soo hard claf helme coyfe yron vnto hede gawayn felle erthe stroke soo grete slented doune erthe arfe hors sholder two whan ector sawe gawayne doune drewe hym asyde thoughte wysedome abyde hym also naturel loue vnkel thus thurgh grete hardynesse bete abak alle knyghtes withoute thenne within cam oute chaced hem alle aboute whanne galahad sawe ther wold none torne ageyne stale awey pryuely none wyst bicome hede sayd gawayn ector wonder true sayd launcelot du lake swerd whiche stak stone shold gyue suche buffet yt wold haue best castell world sothely hit preued trewe neuer ere suche stroke man hand sir sayd ector semeth quest done done sayd gawayn myn done shalle seke noo ferther thenne gawayne borne castel vnarmed hym leyd hym ryche bedde leche fonde myght lyue hole within moneth thus gawayne ector abode gyder syre ector wold awey til gawayne hole good knyyt galahad rode long tyll came nyghte castel carboneck hit befelle hym thus benyghted hermytage soo good man fayne whan sawe knyght erraunt tho whan rest ther cam gentilwoman knockyng dore called galahad soo good man cam dore wete wold thenne called heremyte syre vlfyn gentylwoman wold speke knyght whiche yow thenne good man awaked galahad badde hym aryse speke gentylwoman semeth hath grete nede yow thenne galahad wente asked wold galahad sayd ye arme moute vpon hors folowe shall shewe yow within thre dayes hyest aduenture euer ony knyght sawe anone galahad armed hym took hors commaunded hym god badde gentilwoman go wold folowe lyked pcapitulum ij soo rode fast palfrey myght bere tylle came see whiche called collybe nyghte came vnto castel valeye closed rennynge water stronge walles hyhe soo entred castel galahad grete chere lady castel damoysels lady soo whan vnarmed thenne said damoysel madame shalle abyde day nay sayd tylle hath dyned tyl hath slepte lytyl ete slepte whyle tyl mayde called hym armed hym torche lyght whan mayde horsed bothe lady took galahad fayr child ryche departed castel tyl came see syde fond shyp bors percyual whiche cryed shyps bord sir galahad ye welcome haue yden yow longe whan herd asked sir said leue hors shall leue myn toke sadels brydels made crosse soo entryd shyp two knyghtes receyued hem bothe grete ioye eueryche knewe soo wynde aroos drofe hem thurgh see merueyllous place within whyle dawyd thenne dyd galahad helme suerd asked felawes whens cam fayre shyp truly sayd ye wote wel goddes grace thenne told eueryche alle theire hard aduentures grete temptacyons truly sayd galahad ye moche bounden god ye haue escaped grete aduentures gentilwoman ben comen yow wend neuer haue fond yow straunge countreyes galahad saide bors yf launcelot fader thenne wel ease thenne semed fayled thynge may sayde galahad yf pleasyd oure lorde thenne shyp wente fro londe logrys aduenture arryued vp betwix two roches passyng grete merueyllous myght londe swalowe see sauf another ship vpon myght goo withoute daunger goo thyder sayd gentylwoman shalle see aduentures soo oure lordes wylle pand whanne came thyder fond ship ryche ynouy fond neyther man ne woman therin fonde ende ship two fayre letter wryten whiche sayd dredeful word merueyllous thow man whiche shalle entre shyp beware thou stedfast bileue feith therfor beware hou thou entrest thou faile shal helpe thenne saide getilwoman percyual wote ye certes said nay wetynge pwete wel sayd thy syster whiche doughter kynge pellenore therfore wete ye wel ye man world moost loue yf ye parfyte byleue ihesu cryst entre maner wyse thenne shold ye perysshe shyp soo parfyte wylle suffre synner hym whanne percyual vnderstode veray syster inwardly glad sayd faire syster shalle entre therin yf mys creature vntrue knyghte shalle perysshe pcapitulum tercium meane whyle galahad blessed hym entrid therin thenne next gentylwoman thenne sir bors sir percyual whan merueyllous fayre ryche merueylled myddes shyp fayr bedde galahad wente therto fond crowne sylke foot swerd ryche fayre hit drawen oute shethe half foot suerd dyuerse facyons pomel stone hym alle manere colour ony man myght fynde eueryche colour hadde dyuerse vertues skalys hafte two rybbes dyuerse b estes one beest serpent whiche conuersaunt calydone called serpent fend bone hym suche vertu hand handeleth hym shalle neuer wery hurte beest fysshe whiche ryght grete haunteth flood eufrate fysshe called ertanax bone suche maner kynde handeleth hem shalle haue soo moche wille shalle neuer wery shalle thynke ioye sorow hath thynge beholdeth hym suerd shalle neuer man begrype hym handel one shalle passe alle name god said percyual shall assaye handle hit soo sette hand suerd myghte begrype hit feyth said haue fayled bors set hand therto fayled thenne galahad beheld suerd sawe letter lyke blood sayd lete see shall assaye drawe oute shethe yf hardyer ony draweth wete ye wel shalle neuer fayle shame body wounded dethe feyth said galahad wold drawe suerd oute shethe offendynge soo grete shalle sette hand therto sir said gentilwoman wete ye wel drawynge suerd warned alle men sauf al yow also shyp aryued realme logrys tyme dedely werre bytwene kynge labor whiche fader vnto maymed kynge kynge hurlame whiche sarasyn thenne newely crystend soo men helde hym afterward one wyttyest men world soo vpon day hit befelle kynge labor kynge hurlame assembled folke vpon see shyp aryued kyng hurlame discomfyte men slayne aferd dede fled shyp fond suerd drewe hit cam oute fond kyng labor man world al crystendom whome thenne grettest feythe pand kynge hurlame sawe kynge labor dressid suerd smote hym vpon helme soo hard clafe hym hors erthe fyrst stroke suerd hit realme logrys soo bifelle grete pestylence grete harme realmes sythen encrecyd neyther corne ne grasse wel nyghe fruyte ne water fysshe werfor men callen hit landes two march waste land dolorous stroke kynge hurlame sawe suerd soo keruyng rned ageyne fetche scaubard soo came shyp entred putt vp suerd shethe soone done felle doune dede afore bedde thus swerd preued none ne drewe dede maymed laye ther tyl mayden cam shyp cast hym oute man hardy world entre shypthat defence pcapitulum quartum thenne beheld scaubard hit semed serpent skynne theron letter gold syluer gyrdel pourely come able susteyne suche ryche suerd letter sayd whiche shal welde oughte harder ony yf bere truly oughte born body hym whiche oughte hange shal shamed place whyle gyrd gyrdel neuer none soo hardy doo awey gyrdel oughte done away handes mayde kynges doughter quenes must mayde alle dayes lyf bothe wylle dede yf breke vyrgynyte shalle dye moost vylaynous dethe euer dyd ony woman sir said percyual torne suerd may see syde hit reed blood blak letter ony cole whiche sayd shal prayse moost moost shalle fynde blame grete nede whome shold moost debonair shall felon shalle one tyme faire broder sayd percyual befelle fourty yere passion ihesu cryst nacyen thy broder lawe kyng mordrayns boren towne xiiij dayes iourneye countrey commaundement lord yle partyes west men clepyd yle turnaunce soo befelle hit fond shyp entre roche fond bedde suerd haue herd thenne soo moche hardynesse drawe hit dwellid eyght dayes nynythe day felle grete wynde whiche departed hym yle brought hym another yle roche fond grettest gyaunt euer man myghte see therwith cam horryble gyaunt slee hym thenne loked aboute hym aad myghde flee thynge defende hym soo ranne suerd sawe hit naked praysed moche thenne shoke ther brak myddes said nacyen thyng moost praysed ought moost blame ther threwe pyeces suerd ouer bedde lepte ouer borde fyghte gyaunt slewe hym anone entryd shyp ageyne wynde arose drofe hym thurgh see aduenture came another shyp kynge mordrayns whiche hadde ben tempted ful euyll fende porte peryllous roche whanne one sawe made grete ioye eyther told aduenture swerd fayled hym moost nede whanne mordrayns sawe suerd praysed hit moche brekyng doo wyckednes thy self ward thow arte somme synne took suerd sette pecys gyders soudered fayr euer fore putte swerd shethe leyd doune bedde thenne herd voyce sayd go ship lytel whyle entre drede ye falle dedely synne ye fonde dedely synne ye maye escape perysshe soo wente shyp nacyen wente ouer borde smyten swerd ryghte foote felle doune noselynge shyps bord sayd god hurte thenne came voyce sayd take thow thy forsette thow dydest drawynge suerd therfor thow receyuest wounde thow neuer worthy handel wrytynge maketh mencyon name god said galahad ye ar ryyt wyse werkes pcapitulum v syr sayd kynge hyghte pelles maymed kynge whyle myghte ryde supported moche crystendome holy chirche soo vpon daye hunted woode whiche lasted vnto see last loste houndes knyghtes sauf one knyghte wente tyl cam toward irland fonde shyp whanne sawe letter vnderstood yet entryd ryghte parfyte lyf knyghte none hardynes entre ther fonde suerd drewe oute moche ye maye see soo entryd spere smyte hym thurgh bothe thyes neuer sythe myghte helyd ne nought shall fore come hym thus said kynge pelles graunte sir maymed hardynesse name god damoysel sayd galahad wente toward bedde behold al aboute hit aboue hede ther henge two swerdes also two spyndels whiche whyte ony snowe reed blood aboue grene ony emeraude thre colour spyndels naturel coloure within withoute ony payntynge spyndels sayd damoysel whan synful eue came gadre fruyte whiche adam putte oute paradyse tooke bough whiche appel henge thenne perceyued braunche fayre grene remembryd losse whiche came fro tree thenne thoughte kepe branuche longe myghte cofer kepe hit put erthe soo wylle lord braunche grewe grete tree within lytil whyle whyte ony snowe brauches bowes leues token mayden planted hit god came adam bad hym knowe wyf flesshly nature requyred soo lay adam wyf vnder tree anone tree whiche whyte ful grene ony grasse alle came oute hit tyme medled gyders abel begoten thus tree longe grene colour befelle many dayes vnder tree caym slewe abel wherof befelle grete merueil anone abel receyued dethe vnder grene tree lost grene colour becam reed tokenyng blood anone alle plantes dyed therof tree grewe waxed merueyllously fayre hit fayrest tree moost delectable ony man myght beholde see dyd plantes grewe tofore abel slayne vnder soo longe dured tree tyl salamon kynge dauyds sone regned helde londe fader salamon wyse knewe alle vertues stone tree soo knewe course sterres many dyuerse thynges salamon euylle wyfe thurgh wende ben good woman soo despysed hem bookes soo ansuerd voyce hym one salamon yf heuynes come man woman ne reke thow neuer yet shalle come woman wherof shalle come gretter ioye man honderd tymes heuynesse geueth sorowe woman shalle borne thy lygnage tho whan salamon herd wordes held hym self foole trouthe perceyued old bookes also holy ghoost shewed hym comynge gloryous vyrgyne marye thenne asked voyce yf hit shold yerde lygnage nay sayd voyce shalle come man whiche shalle mayde last blood shalle good knyght duke iosue thy broder lawe pcapitulum vj haue certefyed thow stodest doubte thenne salamon glad shold come ony suche lygnage euer merueylled studyed shold name myghte wyf perceyued studyed thoughte wolde knowe season wayted tyme asked hym cause studyenge told alle gyder voyce tolde hym wel sayd shalle lete make shyp best wood moost durable men maye fynde soo salamon sente alle carpenter lond best whan made shyp lady sayd salamon syr sayd syn hit soo knyght ouyte passe knyghtes cheualry whiche haue ben fore hym shall come hym ouer shall telle yow sayd ye shalle goo oure lordes temple kynge dauyds suerd fader whiche merueylloust sharpest euer taken ony knyghtes hand therfore take take pomel therto make ye pomel precyous stone soo subtylly made noo man perceyue al one make hylte soo merueyllously wonderly noo man maye knowe hit make merueyllous sheth whan ye haue made alle shalle lete make gyrdel ther suche shalle please alle kynge salamon dyd lete make deuysed bothe shyp alle remenaunt whan ship redy see sayle lady lete make grete bedde merueyllous ryche sette vpon beddes hede couerd sylke leyd suerd feete gyrdels hempe kynge angry syr wete ye wel sayd haue none soo hyghe thynge whiche worthy susteyne soo hyhe suerd mayde shall brynge knyghtes ther wote whanne hit shalle ne tyme lete make couerynge shyp clothe sylke shold neuer rote maner weder yet went lady maade carpenter come tree whiche abel slayne vnder sayd arue oute tree moche wood wylle make spyndyl madame sayd tree whiche fyrst moder planted hit sayd el shall destroye anone beganne werke ther cam droppes blood thenne wold haue lefte wold suffre hym soo tooke aweye moche wood myyte make spyndyl soo made hym take moche grene tree whyte tree whan thre spyndels shapen made hem fastned vpon selar bedde whanne salamone sawe sayd wyf ye haue done merueyllously though alle world ryght coude deuyse wherfor alle made oure lord hym self thow hast done hit wotest shal betoken late hit sayd ye shal tydynges sooner ye wene p shalle ye wonderful tale kyng salamon wyf pcapitulum vij nyght lay salamon bifore ship lytel felauship whan slepe hym thoughte come heuen grete company angel alyghte ship took water whiche broughte angel vessel syluer sprente alle shyp came suerd drewe letter hylte wente shyps borde wrote letter whiche sayd thou man wylt entre within beware thow ful within feythe ne feythe byleue whanne salamon aspyed letter abasshed soo durste entre soo drewe hym abak shyp anone shouen see wente soo faste lost syghte hym within lytyl whyle thenne lytyl voyce said salamon last knyghte thy lygnage shalle reste bedde thenne wente salamon awaked wyf told aduentures shyp pnow sayth thystory grete whyle thre felawes biheld bedde thre spyndels certayne naturel colour withoute payntynge thenne lefte vp clothe whiche aboue ground fond ryche purse semynge percyual took hit fonde therin wrytte redde hit deuysed maner spyndels shyp whens hit came whome made sayd galahad shall fynde gentylwoman shalle make newe gyrdels suerd fair syre sayd percyuals syster desmaye yow leue god shall lete make gyrdel suerd suche one shalle longe therto thenne opend boxe toke oute gyrdels semely wroughte golden thredys vpon sette ful precyous stone ryche buckel gold lo lordes said gyrdel oughte sette aboute suerd wete ye wel grettest parte gyrdle made whiche loued wel whyle woman world soone wyst aduenture ordeyned clypped made gyrdel name god ye wel fonde said sir bors certes ye haue put v grete payne wherin shold haue entryd ne tydynges ben thenne wente gentilwoman sette hit gyrdel suerd sayd felauship name suerd shalle calle hit truly sayd name suerd suerd straunge gyrdels shethe meuer blood noo man hath blood hym ne shalle neuer see one party shethe whiche made tree lyf thenne sayd galahad name ihesu cryste praye yow ye gyrd suerd whiche hath ben desyred moche realme logrys lete begynne sayd galahad grype thys swerd gyue yow courage wete ye wel hit longeth doth yow thenne gryped aboute hit fyngers grete dele thenne gyrte hym aboute myddel swerd rek though dye hold one blessid maydens world whiche hath made worthyest knyght world damoysel sayd galahad ye haue done soo moche shalle knyghte alle dayes lyf thenne wente shyp wente anone wynde droofe hem see grete paas vytaille hit befelle came morne castell men calle carteboyse march scotlad whan passed porte gentilwoman sayde lordes men aryuen wyste ye kynge arthur courte ye shold assayled anone damoysell sayd galahad cast v oute roche shalle delyuer v hem pcapitulum octauum soo hit befelle spoken thus cam squyer asked said kynge arthur hows sothe sayd hede sayd ye ylle arayed thenne torned ageyn vnto clyff fortresse within whyle herd horne blowe thenne gentylwoman came hem asked hem whens told faire lordes sayd goddes loue torne ageyne yf ye may ye come vnto youre dethe nay sayd wille torne ageyne shalle helpe v who seruyse ben entred pthenne stode talkynge came knyghtes wel armed bad hem yelde el dye yeldyng sayd shal noyous yow lete theyr horse renne sir percyual smote formest erthe took hors mounted therupon dyd galahad also bors serued another soo horse countrey lefte horse whan toke shyp countrayes pand soo whan horsed thenne beganne sette vpon castel fled stronge fortresse thre knyghtes castel soo alyghte foote swerdes slewe doune gate halle thenne whan beheld grete multytude peple slayne held self grete synners certes sayd bors wene god loued hem shold haue power haue slayne hem thus haue done soo moche ageyn lord wold suffre hem regne lenger say ye soo sayd galahad yf mysdyd ageynst god vengeaunce hym whiche hath power therof came oute chamber good man whiche preest bare goddes body coupe whanne sawe hem whiche lay dede halle alle abasshed galahad dyd helme kneled doune soo dyd two felawes syre sayd haue ye drede v ben kynge arthur courte pthenne asked good man slayn sodenly told hym truly sayd good man ye myghte lyue longe world myght endure ne myghte ye haue done soo grete almesse dede sire sayd galahad repente moch moche crystened nay repente yow sayd crystened shalle telle hou wote castel lord erle hernox one yere thre sone good knyghtes armes doughter fayrest gentylwoman men knewe soo tho thre knyghtes loued theyr syster sore brente loue lay maulgre hede cryed fader slewe took fader putte hym pryson wouded hym nygh deth cosyn rescowed hym thenne dyd grete vntrouthe slewe clerkes preestes made bete doune chappels oure lordes seruyse myght serued ne sayd daye fader sente confessid houseld suche shame neuer man day thre bretheren erle badde suffer sayde shold longe endure thre seruauntes oure lord shold destroye hit brought ende maye ye wete lord displeasyd dedes certes sayd galahad hit pleasyd lord neuer shold haue slayne soo many men soo lytyl whyle thenne broughte erle hernox oute pryson myddes halle knewe galahad anone yet sawe hym neuer afore reuelacyon lord pcapitulum ix thenne beganne wepe ryght tendyrly said long haue abyden comynge goddes loue holdeth armes sowle may departe oute body soo good man armes ye gladly sayd galahad thenne one sayd hyghe alle herde galahad wel hast thou auenged goddes enemyes behoueth goo maymed kyng soone thow maist shalle receyue helthe whiche hath abyden soo long ther sowle departed body galahad made hym buryed hym ought ryght soo departed thre knyghtes percyuals syster soo came waste foreste sawe afore whyte herte whiche four lyon ladde thenne took hem assent folowe knowe whydder repayred soo rode grete paas til cam valeye ther hermytage good man dwellid herte lyon entryd also soo whanne sawe torned chappel sawe good man relygyous wede armour lord wold synge masse holy ghoost soo entryd herde masse secretys masse thre sawe hert become man whiche merueyled hem sette hym vpon aulter ryche sege sawe four lyon chaunged one forme man forme lyon thyrd egle fourth chaunged vnto oxe thenne toke sege herte sat wente oute thurgh glas wyndowe thynge perysshed broken herd voyce say suche maner entred sone god wombe mayd mary who vyrgynyte ne perysshed ne hurte whanne herd wordes felle doune erthe astonyed ther grete clerenes whanne come self ageyn wente good man prayd hym wold say hem trouthe thynge haue ye sene sayd told hym sene lordes sayd ye welcome wote wel ye good knyghtes whiche shal brynge sancgreal ende ye ben vnto whome oure lord shalle shewe grete secretes wel oughte oure lord sygnefyed herte herte whanne old waxeth yonge ageyne hys whyte skynne ryght soo cometh ageyne oure lord dethe lyf lost erthely flesshe dedely flesshe whyche taken wombe blessid vyrgyn mary cause appiered oure lord whyte herte withoute spot foure hym vnderstande foure euuangelystes whiche sette wrytynge parte ihesu crystes dedes dyd somtyme whan amonge yow erthely man wete ye wel neuer erst ne myghte knyghte knowe trouthe oftymes oure lord shewed hym vnto good men vnto good knyghtes lykenes herte suppose hen forth ye shalle see thenne ioyed moche dwelled ther alle day pand vpon morowe whan herde masse departed commaunded good man god soo came castel passed came knyghte armed sayd lordes herke shal saye yow pcapitulum x gentylwoman ye lede yow mayde syr said mayde thenne took brydel sayd holy crosse ye shalle escape fore ye haue yolden customme castel lete go sayd percyual ye wyse mayde place cometh free soo meane whyle came oute ten twelue knyghtes armed oute castel hem came gentylwymmen whiche held dysshe syluer thenne sayd gentylwoman must yelde v customme castel sir sayd knyghte mayde passeth shalle yeue dysshe ful blood ryghte arme blame haue sayd galahad broughte vp suche custommes soo god saue ensure yow gentylwoman ye shal fayle whyle lyue soo god help sayd percyual leuer slayne also sayd sir bors trouthe sayd knyght thenne shalle ye dye ye maye endure ageynste v though ye best knyghtes world thenne lete renne eche thre felawes bete ten knyghtes thenne sette theire handes swerdes bete doune slewe thenne came oute castel thre score knyghtes armed faire lordes sayd thre felawes haue mercy youre selfe haue adoo v nay fayre lordes sayd knyghtes castel counceyl yow withdrawe yow ye ben best knyghtes world therfore doo ye haue done ynough wille lete yow go harme must nedes haue customme certes sayd galahad nought speke ye wel sayd wille ye dye yet come therto sayd galahad thene beganne medle gyders galahad straunge gyrdels drewe suerd smote ryght hand lyfte hand slewe euer abode hym dyd suche merueils none sawe hym wend ben none erthely man monstre two felawes halp hym passyng wel soo held iourney eueryche lyke hard tyl nyyt thenne must nedes departe cam good knyghte sayd thre felawes yf ye wyll come nyght take suche herberowe ye shal ryght welcome shall ensure yow feyth bodyes true knyghtes leue yow suche estat morowe fynde yow withoute ony falshede soone ye knowe custome dare say ye wyll accorde therfor goddes loue said gentylwoman goo thyder spare go sayd galahad soo entryd chappel alyghte made grete ioye hem soo within whyle thre knyghtes asked customme castel wherefor hit sayd wille saye yow othe pcapitulum xj ther castel gentylwoman whiche castel many soo befelle many yeres agone fylle vpon maladye whanne layne grete whyle felle vnto mesel leche coude haue remedy last old man sayd myght haue dysshe ful blood mayde clene vyrgyn wylle werke kynges doughter blood shold hele anoynte alle thynge customme made said percyuals sister fayr knyytes see wel yt gentylwoman dede certes sayd galahad ye blede soo moche ye maye dye truly sayd dye hele shal gete grete worship sowles helthe worshyp lygnage better one harme tweyn therfor ther shall batail morne shall yelde yow customme castel thenne grete ioye fore el ben mortal werre vpon morne withstandyng wold none whether wold nold nyght thre felawes easyd best morne herd masse sir percyuals sister bad brynge forth seke lady whiche euylle ease thenne sayd shall lete blood soo one came forth lete blood bled soo moche dysshe ful thenne lyfte vp hand blessid thenne said lady madame come dethe make yow hole goddes loue prayeth felle swoune thenne galahad two felawes starte vp lyfte vp staunched bled soo moche myght lyue thenne sayd whan awaked fayre broder percyual dye helynge lady soo requyre yow ye berye countrey soone dede put ote next hauen lete goo aduenture lede soone ye thre come cyte sarras ther encheue holy graile ye shalle fynde vnder towre arryued bery spyrytual place saye yow soo moche galahad shalle buryed ye also place thenne percyual vnderstood wordes graunted wepynge thenne sayd voyce lordes felawes morowe houre pryme ye thre shalle departe eueryche tyl aduenture brynge yow maymed kynge thenne asked saueour soone receyued hit soule departed body soo daye lady helyd whan enoynted alle thenne syr percyuale made letter holpen hem straunge aduentures put hit ryght hand soo leyd barge couerd blak sylke wynde aroos drofe barge lond alle knyghtes beheld hit tyl oute syghte thenne drewe alle castel soo forthe ther felle sodeyne tempest thonder layte rayne alle erthe wold haue broken soo half castel torned vp soo doune soo passed euensonge tempest seaced thenne sawe afore hem knyghte armed wounded hard body hede sayd god socoure nede knyght came another knyghte dwerf whiche cryed hem stand ye may escape thenne wounded knyghte held vp handes god shold dye suche trybulacyon truly sayd galahad shalle socoure hym sake calleth vpon sir said bors shalle doo hit yow one knyghte sir sayd graunte sir bors toke hors commaunded hym god rode rescowe wounded knyghte pnow torne tw felawes pcapitulum xij saith story al nyght galahad percyual chappel prayer saue sir bors psoo morowe dressid hem theire harneis toward castel wete whatwas fallen cam fond neyther man ne woman ne dede vengeaunce oure lord herd voyce sayd vengeaunce blood shedynge maydens also fonde atte ende chappel chirche yerd therin myght see thre score fair tombes place soo fayre soo delectable semed hem ben none tempest lay bodyes alle good maydens whiche martred seke ladyes sake also fond name eueryche blood come alle kynges blood twelue kynges doughters thenne departed wente foreste said percyual vnto galahad must departe soo pray oure lord maye mete gyders short tyme thenne dyd helmes kyssed gyder wepte departynge pcapitulum xiij sayth history whan launcelot come water mortoyse hit reherced grete perylle soo leyd hym doune slepte toke aduenture god wold sende hym psoo whan slepe came vysyon vnto hym said launcelot aryse vp take thyn armour entre first ship thow shalt fynde pand herd wordes starte vp sawe grete clerenes hym thenne lyfte vp hande blessid hym toke armes made hym redy soo aduenture came stronde fonde shyp withoute sayle ore soone within shyp felte moost swetnes euer felt fulfylled alle thynge thought desyred thenne sayd fair swete fader ihesu cryst wote ioye ioye passeth alle erthely ioyes euer soo ioye leyd hym doune shyps borde slepte tyl day awoke fonde fayre bed therin lyenge gentylwoman dede whiche syr percyuals syster launcelot deuysed aspyed hir ryght hand wrytte whiche redde whiche told hym aduentures ye haue herd fore lygnage come soo gentylwoman sir launcelot moneth yf ye wold aske lyued fedde peple israel manna deserte soo fedde euery day sayd prayer susteyned grace holy ghoost nyghte wente playe hym water syde somwhat wery shyp thenne lystned herd hors come one rydynge vpon hym whanne cam nygh semed knyghte soo lete hym passe wente shyp alyghte toke sadel brydel putte hors hym went ship thenne launcelot dressid vnto hym said ye welcome ansuerd salewed hym ageyne asked hym name moche hert gyueth vnto yow truly sayd name launcelot du lake sir saide thene ye welcome ye begynner world sayd ar ye galahad ye forsothe sayd kneled doune asked hym blessynge toke helme kyssed hym grete ioye bitwene tonge telle ioye made eyther many frendely word spoken bitwene kynde wold whiche nede reherced eueryche told theire aduentures merueils befallen many iourneyes sythe departed courte anone galahad sawe gentilwoman dede bed knewe wel ynough told grete worship best mayde lyuyng hit grete pyte whanne launcelot herd merueylous swerd goten made hit alle merueyls reherced afore thenne prayd galahad sone wold shewe hym suerd dyd anone kyssed pomel hyltes scaubard truly sayd launcelot neuer erst knewe hyhe aduentures done merueyllous straunge dwellid launcelot galahad within shyp half yere serued god dayly nyghtly alle power ten aryued yles ferre folke repayred none wylde beestes ther fond many straunge aduentures peryllous whiche broughte ende tho aduentures wylde beestes quest sancgreal therfor tale maketh mencyon therof wolde longe telle alle tho aduentures befelle pcapitulum xiiij soo mondaye hit befelle aryued edge foreste fore crosse thenne sawe knyghte armed al whyte rychely horsed ledde ryght hand whyte hors soo cam shyp salewed two knyghtes hyghe lordes behalf sayd galahad syr ye haue ben longe ynough fader come oute ship starte vpon hors goo aduentures shall lede quest sancgreal thenne wente fader kyst hym swetely sayd fair swete fader wote whan shal see tyl see body ihesu cryst praye yow sayd launcelot praye ye hyghe fader hold seruyse soo took hors ther herd voyce sayd thynke doo wel one shal neuer see dredeful day dome sone galahad said laucelot syn shal departe neuer see pray ye hyy fader conserue yow bothe sire said galahad noo prayer auaylleth soo moche galahad entryd foreste wynde aroos drofe launcelot moneth thurgh oute see slepte lytyl prayed god myght see tydynges sancgreal soo hit befelle nyghte mydnyghte aryued afore castel bak syde whiche ryche fayre posterne opened toward see open withoute ony kepynge sauf two lyon kept entre moone shone clere anone sir launcelot herd voyce sayd launcelot goo oute shyp entre castel thou shalt see grete parte thy desyre thenne ran armes soo armed hym soo wente gate sawe lyon thenne sette hand suerd drewe hit thenne ther came dwerf sodenly smote hym harme sore suerd felle oute hand thenne herd voyce say man euylle feyth poure byleue wherfor trowest thow thy harneis thy maker myghte auayle thyn armour who seruyse thou arte sette thenne said launcelot fay u fader ihesu cryste thanke thy grete mercy thou repreuest mysdede see wel ye hold youre seruaunt thenne toke ageyne suerd putte vp shethe made crosse forhede came lyon made semblaunt doo hym harme notwithstandynge passed hem without hurte entryd castel chyef fortresse al rest thenne launcelot entryd armed fond noo gate dore open last fond chamber wherof dore shytte sette hand therto haue opened hit myghte capitulum xv thenne enforced hym mykel vndoo dore thenne lystned herd voyce whiche sange swetely semed none erthely thynge hym thoughte voyce said ioye honour fader heuen thenne launcelot kneled doun fore chamber wel wyst sancgreal within chamber thenne sayd fair swete fader ihesu cryst yf euer dyd thyng pleasyd lord thy pyte ne haue despyte synnes done afore tyme thou shewe thynge seke sawe chamber dore open came oute grete clerenes hows bryghte torch world ben cam chamber dore wold haue entryd anone voyce said hym flee launcelot entre thou oughtest doo hit yf thou entre thou shalt forthynke hit thenne withdrewe hym abak ryght heuy thenne loked vp myddes chamber sawe table syluer holy vessel couerd reed samyte many angel aboute hit wherof one helde candel waxe brennyng held crosse ornementys aulter bifore holy vessel sawe good man clothed preest semed sacrynge masse semed launcelot aboue preestes handes thre men wherof two putte yongest lykenes bitwene preestes handes soo lyfte hit vp ryghte hyhe semed shewe peple thenne launcelot merueyled lytyl hym thouyt preest gretely charged fygure hym semed shold falle erthe whan sawe none aboute hym wolde helpe hym thenne came dore grete paas sayd faire fader ihesu cryst ne take hit synne though helpe good man whiche hath grete nede help ryghte soo entryd chamber cam toward table syluer whanne came nyghe felte brethe hym thoughte hit entremedled fyre whiche smote hym sore vysage hym thoughte brente vysage felle erthe power aryse soo araged loste power body herynge seynge pthenne felte many handes aboute hym whiche tooke hym vp bare hym oute chamber dore withoute ony amendynge swoune lefte hym semyng dede chamber dore lefte hym semynge dede al peple soo vpon morowe whan fayre day within arysen fonde launcelot lyenge afore chamber dore alle merueylled cam loked vpon hym felte pouse wyte whether ony lyf hym soo fond lyf hym myght stande stere membre soo tooke hym euery parte body bare hym chamber leyd hym ryche bedde ferre alle folke soo lay four dayes thenne one sayd lyue sayd nay name god sayd old man doo yow veryly wete dede soo fulle lyf myghtyest yow alle therfor counceylle yow wel kepte tyl god send hym lyf ageyne pcapitulum xvj suche maner kepte launcelot four twenty dayes also many nyghtes euer laye stylle dede man xxv daye byfelle hym myddaye opened eyen whan sawe folke made grete sorowe sayd haue ye awaked ease ihesu cryst myghte soo blessid myght see openly thy grete merueyls secretenes synnar may haue ye sene sayd aboute hym haue sene said grete merueyls tong may telle ony herte thynke sone ben afore sene moche thenne told hym layne four twenty dayes nyghtes thenne hym thoughte hit punysshement four twenty yeres ben synner wherfore lord put hym penaunce four twenty dayes nyghtes thenne loked syr launcelot afore hym sawe hayre whiche borne nyghe yere forthoughte hym ryyte moche broken promyse vnto heremyte whiche auowed doo pthenne asked hit stood hym sothe sayd hole body thanked lord therfore syrs goddes loue telle thenne sayd alle castel carbonek came gentylwoman brought hym sherte smal lynen clothe chaunged toke hayre hym ageyne sir sayd quest sancgreal encheued ryght yow neuer shalle ye see sancgreal nomore ye haue sene thanke god said launcelot grete mercy haue sene suffyseth suppose man world hath lyued better haue done enchere haue done ther took hayre clothed hym hit aboue put lynen sherte robe scarlet fresshe newe whanne soo arayed merueylled alle knewe hym launcelot good knyghte thenne sayd alle lord sir launcelot ye sayd truly thenne came word kyng pelles knyght layne soo longe dede sir launcelot thenne kynge ryght glad wente see hym whanne launcelot sawe hym come dressid hym ageynste hym made kyng grete ioye hym kynge told hym tydynges fayre doughter dede thenne launcelot ryght heuy hit sayd syre forthynketh dethe doughter ful fayre lady fresshe yonge wel wote bere best knyghte erthe euer sith god borne kynge held hym four dayes morowe took leue kynge pelles al felauship thanked grete labour ryghte soo sat dyner chyef sale thenne befalle sancgreal fulfylled table al maner mete ony herte myghte thynke psoo sate sawe alle dores wyndowes place shitte withoute mannys hand wherof al abasshed none wyste doo pand thenne happed sodenly knyghte cam chyefe dore knocked cryed vndo dore wold euer cryed vndoo wold atte laste noyed hem soo moche kynge hym self arose came wyndowe knyght called thenne said syr knyght ye shall entre tyme whyle sancgreal therfor goo another certes ye none knyytes quest one whiche hath serued fonde hast lefte seruyse oure lord passynge wrothe kynges wordes sir knyght sayd kynge syn ye wold fayn entre saye cou trey ye sir sayd realme logrys name ector de mary broder vnto lord sir lau celot name god sayd kynge forthynketh haue sayd youre broder within whan ector de mary vnderstood broder man world moost dredde loued thenne sayd god doubleth sorowe shame ful truly sayd good man hylle vnto gawayne oure dremes thenne wente oute courte sast hors myghte soo thurgh oute castel pcapitulum xvij thenne kynge pelles came sire launcelot told hym tydynges broder wherof sory wyste doo soo sir launcelot departed toke armes sayd wold goo see realme logrys whiche haue sene twelue moneth commaunded kynge god soo rode thurgh many realmes last came whyte abbay made hym nyghte grete chere morne aroos herd masse afore aulter fond ryche tombe whiche newely made thenne took bede sawe sydes wryten gold whiche sayd phere lyeth kynge bagdemagus gore whiche kynge arthur neuew slewe named hym syr gawayn thenne lytel launcelot loued hym moche ony ben ony gawayn shold haue escared dethe lyf sayd hym self lord god grete harte vnto kynge arthur courte losse suche man thenne departed came abbay galahad dyd aduenture tombes anne whyte sheld reed crosse e grete chere alle nyghte morne torned vnto camelot fonde kynge arthur quene many knyghtes round table slayne destroyed half soo thre come home ector gawayn lyonel many neden reherced alle courte passyng gladde syr launcelot kynge asked hym many tydynges sone galahad ther launcelot told kynge aduentures befallen hym syn departed also told hym aduentures galahad percyuale bors whiche knewe letter dede damoysel galahad told hym god wold sayd kynge thre shalle neuer said launcelot two hem shalle ye neuer see one hem shalle come ageyne pnow leue story speke galahad capitulum xviij saith story galahad rode many iourneyes invayne last cam abbay kyng mordrayns whan herd thouyte wold abyde see hym vpon morne whanne herd masse galahad came vnto kyng mordrayns anon kynge sawe hym whiche leyne blynd long tyme thenne dressid hym ageynst hym said galahad seruaunt ihesu cryste who comynge haue abyden longe enbrace lete reste thy brest may reste bitwene thyn armes thow arte clene vyrgyn aboue knyghtes floure lyly whome vyrgynyte sygnefyed thou arte rose whiche floure al good vertu coloure fyre fyre holy ghoost take flesshe al dede oldenes become yonge ageyne thenne galahad herd wordes thenne enbraced hym alle body thenne sayd faire lord ihesu cryst haue wil requyre poynt thow come vysyte anone oure lord herd prayer soule departed body thenne galahad putte hym erthe kynge oughte soo departede soo came perillous foreste fond welle whiche boy ed grete wawes tale telleth fore soone galahad sette hand therto sea brente hete departed brente hit sygne lechery whiche tyme moche vsed hete myght abyde pure vyrgynyte taken countrey myrakle soo euer called callahadys welle thenne aduenture cam countrey gore abbay launcelot ben fore hand fonde tombe kynge bagdemagus founder therof ioseph armathyes sone tombe symyan launcelot fayled thenne loked crofte vnder mynster sawe tombe whiche brent ful merueyllously thenne asked bretheren sir said merueyllous aduentur may broughte vnto none ende hym passeth bounte knyghthode al round table wold sayd galahad ye wold lede ther gladly sayd soo ledde hym tyl caue went doune vpon gresys cam nyghe tombe thenne flammynge fayled fyre staunched whiche many day ben grete thenne came voyce sayd moche ye beholde thanke oure lord whiche hath gyuen yow good houre ye may drawe oute sowles erthely payne putte ioyes paradys kynred whiche haue dwelled hete thys thre honderd wynter four fyfty purged synne dyd ageynst ioseph armathye thenne galahad toke body armes bare mynster nyghte lay galahad abbay morne gaf hym seruyse putte hym erthe afore hyghe aulter pcapitulum xix soo departed then commaunded bretheren god soo rode fyue dayes tyl came maymed kynge euer folowed percyual fyue dayes askynge ben soo one told hym aduentures logrys encheued daye bifelle cam oute grete foreste mette trauers sir bors whiche rode alone hit none nede telle yf glad hem salewed yelded hym honour good aduenture eueryche told thenne said bors hit yere half ne lay ten tymes men dwelled wylde forestes montayns god euer comforte thenne rode grete whyle tyl came castel carbonek whan entryd within castel kynge pelles knewe hem thenne grete ioye wyst wel theire comynge fulfylled quest sancgreal thenne elyazar kynge pelles sone broughte fore hem broken suerd ioseph stryken thurgh thygh thenne bors sette hand therto yf myght haue souded hit ageyne wold thenne took percyual power ther haue ye hit ageyne sayd percyuall galahad euer encheued ony bodely man ye must doo hit thenne took pyeces sette hem gyders semed neuer ben broken well hit ben fyrst forged whanne within aspyed aduenture suerd enchened thenne gaf suerd bors hit myght better set good knyghte worthy man lytel afore euen suerd arose grete merueyllous ful grete hete many men felle drede anone alyght voys amonge sayd ought sytte table ihesu cryst aryse shalle veray knyghtes ben fedde soo wente then sauf kynge pelles elyazar sone whiche holy men mayde nece soo thre felawes thre mo anone sawe knyghtes al armed came halle dore dyd helmes armes sayd vnto galahad sire haue hyed ryght moche yow table holy mete shalle departed thenne sayd ye welcome whens ye thre sayd gaule thre sayd irland thre sayd denmarke satte thus came oute bed tree chamber whiche four gentylwymmen broughte bed lay good man seke crowne gold vpon hede myddes place sette hym doune wente ageyne waye thenne lyfte vp hede sayd galahad knyght ye welcome moche haue desyred comynge suche payne suche anguysshe haue ben longe pbut truste god terme come payn shall alayed shall passe world promysed longe ago voyce sayd ther two amonge quest sancgreal therfor departe ye pcapitulum xx thenne kynge pelles sone departed alle besemed cam man four angel heuen clothed lykenes bisshop crosse hand foure angel bare hym vp chayer sette hym doune table syluer vpon sancgreal semed myddes forhede letter whiche sayd see ye ioseph fyrst bisshop crystendome whiche lord socoured cyte sarras spyrytuel place thenne knyghtes merueylled bisshop dede thre honderd yere fore knyghtes sayde merueyle somtyme erthely man herde chamber dore open sawe angel two bare candels waxe thyrd towel fourthe spere whiche bled merueillously thre droppes felle within boxe whiche helde hand sette candels vpon table thyrd towel vpon vessel fourth holy spere euen vp ryghte vpon vessel thenne bisshop made semblaunt thouy wold haue gone sacrynge masse thenne tooke vbblye whiche made lykenes breed lyftynge vp came fygur lykenes chyld vysage reed bryghte ony fyre smote hym self breed sawe hit breed formed flesshely man thenne putte hit holy vessel ageyne thenne dyd longed preest doo masse thenne wente galahad kyssed hym badde hym goo kysse felawes soo dyd anone sayd seruauntes ihesu cryste ye shall fedde afore table swete mete neuer knyghtes tasted whanne sayd vanysshed awey sette hem table grete drede made prayer thenne loked sawe man come oute holy vessel alle sygnes passion ihesu cryste bledynge alle openly sayd knyghtes seruauntes true child whiche ben come oute dedely lyf spyrytual lyf wyl lenger hyde yow ye shal see parte secretes hydde thynges holdeth receyueth hyghe mete whiche ye haue soo moche desyred thenne took hym self holy vessel came galahad kneled doune receyued saueour hym soo receyued alle felawes thoughte soo swete hit merueillous telle thenne sayd galahad sone wotest thow hold betwixe handes nay sayd yf ye telle sayd holy dysshe wherin ete lambe sherthursdaye hast thou sene thou desyred see yet haste thou sene hit soo openly thow shalt see cyte sarras spyrituel place therfore thow must go hen bere holy vessel nyght shalle departe realme logrys shalle neuer sene wotest thou wherfor serued worshypped ryghte land torned euylle lyuynge therfor shall disheryte honour whiche haue done hem therfore goo ye thre morowe vnto see ye shal fynde shyp redy take suerd straunge gyrdels mo yow sire percyual syre bors also ye take blood spere enoynte maymed kynge bothe legges alle body shalle haue e sire sayd galahad shalle felawes goo v cause ryght departed postels one another soo wille ye departe two yow shalle dye seruyse one yow shal come ageyne telle tydynges thenne gaf hem blessynge vanysshed awaye pcapitulum xxj galahad wente anone spere whiche lay vp table touched blood fyngers came maymed kynge anoynted legges clothed hym anone starte vpon foot oute bedde hole man thanked oure lorde helyd hym world ward anone yelded hym place relygyon whyte monkes ful holy man nyghte aboute mydnyght came voyce amonge hem whiche sayde sone chyef sone frendes werryours goo ye hen ye hope best doo bad yow thanked thou lord thou wilt vouchesaufe calle v thy synners maye wel preue haue lost paynes anone alle haste took harneis departed thre knyghtes gaule one hyghte claudyne kynge claudas sone two grete gentylmen thenne praid galahad eueryche yf come kynge arthur court sholde salewe lorde sir launcelot fader hem round table prayed hem yf cam party shold forgete ryght soo departed galahad percyual bors hym soo rode thre dayes thenne came ryuage fonde shyp wherof tale speketh fore whanne cam borde fonde myddes table syluer whiche lefte maymed kynge sancgreal whiche couerd rede samyte thenne gladde haue suche thynges theyr felaushyp soo entryd maade grete reuerence ther galahad felle prayer longe tyme oure lord tyme asked shold passe world soo moche prayd tyl voyce sayd hym galahad thou shalt haue thy request whan thow askest dethe thy body thou shalt haue thenne shalt thow fynde lyf soule percyual herd prayd hym felauship bitwene telle hym wherfor asked suche thynges shalle telle yow said galahad thother day whanne sawe parte aduentures sancgreal suche ioye herte trowe neuer man erthely therfore wote wel whan body dede sowle shalle grete ioye see blessid trynyte euery day mageste oure lord ihesu cryst soo longe shyp sayd galahad syr bedde ought ye lye soo saith scrypture soo leyd hym doune slepte grete whyle whan awaked loked afore hym sawe cyte sarras wold haue landed sawe shyp wherein percyual putte syster truly sayd percyual name god wel hath syster holden v couenaunt thenne toke ship table syluer tooke percyual bors goo fore galahad came behynde ryght soo went cyte gate cyte sawe old man croked thenne galahad called hym bad hym helpe bere heuy thynge truly said old man ten yere ago myyt goo crouchys care thou sayd galahad aryse vp shewe thy good wille soo assayed fonde hym self hole euer thenne ranne table took one parte ageynst galahad anone arose grete noyse cyte cryppyl maade hole knyghtes merueyls entryd cyte thenne anon thre knyghtes wente water broughte vp paleys percyuals syster buryed rychely kynges doughter oughte whan kynge cyte whiche cleped estorause sawe felaushyp asked hem whens thyng broughte vpon table syluer told hym trouthe sancgreal power whiche god sette thenne kynge tyraunt come lyne paynyms toke hem putte hem pryson depe hole capitulum xxij bvt soone oure lord sente hem sancgreal thorow whoos grace al waye fulfylled whyle pryson soo yeres ende hit befelle kynge estourause lay seke felte shold dye thenne sente thre knyghtes came afore hym cryed hem mercy done forgaf hit hym goodely dyed anone whanne kynge dede alle cyte desmayed wyst myghte kynge pryght soo counceille came voyce amonge badde hem chese yongest knyght thre kynge shalle wel mayntene yow soo made galahad kynge alle assente hole cyte el wold haue slayne hym whanne come holde land lete make aboue table syluer cheste gold precyous stone hylled holy vessel euery day erly thre felawes wold come afore hit make prayer yeres ende self daye galahad borne croune gold arose vp erly felawes came palais sawe fore hem holy vessel man knelynge knee lykenes bisshop aboute hym grete felaushyp angel ben ihesu cryst hym self thenne arose beganne masse oure lady whan cam sacrament masse done anone called galahad sayd hym come forthe seruaunt ihesu cryst thou shalt see thou hast moche desyred see thenne beganne tremble ryght hard whan dedely flesshe beganne beholde spyrytuel thynges thenne helde vp handes toward heuen sayd lord thanke see hath ben desyre many daye p blessyd lord wold lenger lyue yf myghte please lord good man tooke oure lordes body betwixe hys handes proferd galahad receyued hit ryghte gladly mekely pnow wotest thow sayd good man nay said galahad ioseph armathye whiche oure lord hath sente bere felaushyp wotest thou wherfor hath sente ony thou hast resemblyd thynges thou hast sene merueyls sancgreal thou hast ben clene mayden haue ben whanne said wordes galahad went percyual kyssed hym commaunded hym god soo wente sire bors kyssed hym commaunded hym god sayd fayre lord salewe lord syr launcelot fader soone ye see hym byd hym remembre vnstable world kneled doune tofore table made prayer thenne sodenly soule departed ihesu crist grete multitude angel bare soule vp heuen two felawes myghte wel behold hit also two felawes sawe come heuen hand sawe body thenne hit cam ryght vessel took spere soo bare hit vp heuen sythen neuer man soo hardy saye sene sancgreal capitulum xxiij whanne percyual bors sawe galahad dede made moche sorowe euer dyd two men yf ben good men myght lyghtly haue fallen despair peple countrey cyte ryyt heuy thenne buryed soone buryed sire percyual yelded hym hermytage oute cyte took relygyous clothynge bors alwaye hym neuer chaunged seculer clothyng purposed hym goo ageyne realme logrys thus yere two monethes lyued sir percyual hermytage ful holy lyf thenne passed oute world bors lete bery hym syster galahad spyrytueltees whanne bors sawe fer countreyes partyes babyloyne departed sarras armed hym cam see entryd shyp soo befelle hym good aduenture cam realme logrys rode fast tyl came camelot kynge thenne grete ioye made hym courte wend alle ben dede moche ben soo longe oute countrey whan eten kynge made grete clerkes come afore hym shold cronycle hyghe aduentures good knyghtes whanne bors told hym aduentures sancgreal suche befalle hym thre felawes launcelot percyual galahad hym self launcelot told aduentures sancgreal sene alle made grete bookes put vp almeryes salysbury anone sir bors sayd syre launcelot galahad youre owne sone salewed yow yow kynge arthur alle courte soo dyd sir percyual buryed hem myn owne handes cyte sarras palso sire launcelot galahad prayed yow remembre vnsyker world ye behyght hym whan ye gyders half yere true sayd launcelot truste god prayer shalle auayle thenne launcelot took syr bors armes sayd gentyl cosyn ye ryght welcome alle euer maye doo yow ye shalle fynde poure body redy atte tymes whyles spyryte hit promyse yow feythfully neuer fayle pand wete ye wel gentyl cosyn syre bors ye wylle neuer departe sonder whylest oure lyues may laste sir sayd wylle ye wylle p thus endeth thistory sancgreal breuely drawen oute frensshe englysshe whiche story cronycled one truest holyest thys world whiche xvij book pand foloweth eyghtenth book pcapitulum primum soo quest sancgreal fulfylled alle knyghtes lefte lyue comen ageyne vnto table round booke sancgreal maketh mencyon pthenne grete ioye courte especyal kynge arthur quene gueneuer made grete ioye remenaunt comen home passynge glad kynge quene sire launcelot sire bors ben passynge long away quest sancgreal thenne book saith syr launcelot beganne resorte vnto quene gueneuer ageyne forgat promyse perfectyon made quest book sayth sire launcelot ben hie preuy thouytes myndes sette inwardly quene semyng outeward god knyghte passed hym queste sancgreal euer thoughtes pryuely quene loued gyder hotter fore hand suche preuy draughtes gyder many courte spak hit especial sir agrauayne syr gawayns broder euer open mouthed bifel syre launcelot many resortes ladyes damoysels dayly resorted vnto hym besoughte hym champyon alle suche mater ryghte sir launcelot applyed hym dayly pleasyr oure lord ihesu crist euer moche myghte withdrewe hym companye felaushyp quene gueneuer eschewe sklaunder noyse wherfor quene waxed wroth sir launcelot vpon day called sir launcelot vnto chamber saide thus sir launcelot see fele dayly thy loue begynneth slake thou hast ioye presence euer thou arte oute thys cource quarels mater thow hast dayes ladyes gentilwymmen euer thou wonte haue afore hand madame said launcelot ye must holde excused dyuerse cause one late quest sancgreal thanke god grete mercy neuer deserte sawe quest moche euer sawe ony synful man told p yf pryuy thoughtes retorne loue ageyne doo sene grete mysteryes euer sawe sone galahad outher percyual sir bors therfor madame late quest wete ye wel madame hit maye yet lyghtely forgeten hyy seruyse whome dyd dylygent laboure also madame wete ye wel many men speken loue courte haue yow gretely wayte sire agrauayne syr mordred madame wete ye wel drede youre sake ony fere haue self maye happen escape ryde self grete nede ye must abyde alle wille said vnto yow thenne yf ye falle ony distresse thurgh wylfulle foly thenne none remedy help blood wete ye wel madame boldenes wille brynge v grete shame sklaunder lothe see dishonoured cause take vpon damoysels maydens euer dyd forne men shold vnterstande ioye delyte pleasyr haue adoo damoisels maydens pcapitulum ij alle whyle quene stood stylle lete sir launcelot saye wold hadde alle said brast oute wepynge soo sobbed wepte grete whyle whan myght speke sayd launcelot wel vnderstande thou arte fals recreaut knyghte comyn lecheoure louest holdest ladyes thou hast desdayne scorne p wete thou wel sayd vnderstande thy falshede therfor shalle neuer loue neuer thou hardy come syghte ryghte discharge courte thow neuer come within hit forfende felaushyp vpon payne thy hede thou see ryght soo sire launcelot departed grete heuynes vnnethe myyt susteyne hym self grete dole makyng thenne called sir bors sir ector de mary syr lyonel told hem quene forfendyd hym courte soo wille departe owne countrey fair sir said sire bors de ganys ye shalle departe oute land myn aduyse ye must remembre honour ye renoumed called noblest knyght world many grete mater ye haue hand wymmen hastynes wille doo oftymes sore repenteth hem therfor myn aduyse ye shalle take youre hors ryde good hermytage besyde wyndsoure somtyme good knyght name sir brasias shalle ye abyde tyl sende yow word better tydynges broder said sir launcelot wete ye wel ful lothe departe oute realme quene hath defended soo hyhely semeth wille neuer good lady hath ben saye ye neuer soo sayd sir bors many tymes tyme hath ben wroth yow first repented ye saye wel sayd launcelot wille doo youre counceylle take myn hors harneis ryde heremyte sir brasias repose vntyl somme maner tydynges fro yow fair broder praye yow gete loue lady quene gueneuer ye maye psire said sire bors ye nede meue suche mater wel ye wote wille doo may please yow thenne noble knyghte sire launcelot departed ryghte heuy chere sodenly none erthely creature wyste hym become sir bors soo whan sir launcelot departed quene outward made maner sorowe shewynge none blood none wete ye wel inwardly book sayth took grete thoughte bare proud countenaunce though felte nothynge daunger pcapitulum tercium thenne quene lete make preuy dyner london vnto knyytes round table al shewe outward grete ioye al knyghtes table round sir launcelot al dyner sir gawayne bretheren saye sir agrauayn sir gaherys sire gareth syre mordred also sir bors de ganys sire blamor de ganys syr bleoberys de ganys sire galyhud sir galyhodyn syre ector de mary sir lyonel sire palomydes sir safyr broder sir la cote male tayle sir persaunt sir ironsyde syre brandyles syr kay le seneschal sir mador de la porte syre patryse knyght irland alyduk sir astamore sir pynel le saueage whiche cosyn sire lamorak de galys good knyghte syr gawayne bretheren slewe treason four twenty knyghtes shold dyne quene preuy place self made grete feest al maner deyntees syre gawayne customme vsed dayly dyner souper loued wel al maner fruyte especial appels perys therfore someuer dyned feested syre gawayne wold comynly purueye good fruyte hym soo dyd quene please sir gawayne lete purueye hym al maner fruyte sir gawayn passyng hote knyght nature pyonel hated syre gawayne cause kynnesman syr lamorak de galys therfor pure enuy hate sir pyonel enpoysond certayn appels enpoysonne sir gawayn soo wel vnto ende mete soo befelle mysfortune good knyght named patryse cosyn vnto sire mador de la porte take poysend appel whanne eten hit swalle soo tyl brast sire patryce felle doun sodenly deede amonge hem thenne euery knyghte lepte bord ashamed araged wrathe nyghe oute wyttes wyste saye consyderynge quene gueneuer made feest dyner alle suspecyon vnto lady quene said gawayne wete ye wel madame dyner made alle folkes knowen condycyon vnderstande loue wel fruyte see wel nere slayne therfor madame drede lest ye shamed thenne quene stood stylle sore abasshed nyst saye shalle ended said syr mador de la porte haue loste ful noble knyght blood therfore vpon shame despyte wille reuenged vtteraunce openly sir mador appeled quene dethe cosyn sir patryse thenne stode stylle none wold speke word ageynst hym grete suspecyon vnto quene cause lete make dyner quene abasshed coude none wayes doo wepte soo hertely felle swoune noyse crye came kynge arthur whanne wyst trouble passynge heuy man capitulum iiij euer sir mador stood stylle afore kynge euer appeled quene treason customme suche tyme alle manere shameful dethe called treason fair lordes sayd kynge arthur repenteth trouble caas maye haue adoo mater must ryghtful iuge repenteth maye doo batail wyf deme dede came neuer therfore suppose shalle alle distayned somme good knyght shal putt body ieopardy quene rather shal brent wrong quarel therfor sir mador hasty hit maye happen shalle frendeles therfore desyre thow thy daye bataille shalle purueye somme good knyghte shalle ansuer yow el grete shame alle courte gracyous lord sayd sir mador ye muste holde excused though ye oure kynge degree ye knyght ye sworne vnto knyghthode wel therfor biseche yow ye displeased none four twenty knyghtes boden dyner alle haue grete suspecyon vnto quene say ye lordes said sir mador thenne ansuerd coude excuse quene made dyner outher hit must come seruauntes allas sayd quene made dyner good entente neuer none euyl soo almyghty god help ryght neuer purposed doo suche euylle dedes reporte vnto god lord kynge sayd sir mador requyre yow ye ryghtuous kyng gyue day may haue iustyce wel sayd kynge gyue daye thys day xv dayes thow redy armed horsbak medowe besyde westmynster yf soo falle ony knyght encounter yow mayst thow doo best god spede ryght yf hit falle knyght day thenne must quene brente ther shalle redy haue iugement ansuerd sayd sir mador euery knyghte wente lyked hem pso whan kynge quene gyders kynge asked quene caas bifelle quene ansuerd god help wote maner sir launcelot said kyng arthur wold grutche doo betaille yow sire sayd quene wote brother kynnesmen deme within realme repenteth sayd kyng arthur wold soone stynte stryf thenne wille counceyle yow sayd kynge vnto sire bors ye wil doo bataille sir launcelots sake vpon lyf wille refuse yow wel see said kynge none foure twenty knyghtes dyner sir patryse slayn wille doo batail yow none hem wille saye well yow shalle grete sklaunder yow thys courte allas said quene maye doo mys sir launcelot wold putte soone hertes ease pwhat eyleth yow said kynge ye kepe sir launcelot vpon syde wete ye wel sayd kynge hath sire launcelot vpon partye hath moost man worship world vpon syde goo way said kynge vnto quene requyre sir bors doo bataille yow sire launcelots sake pcapitulum quintum soo quene departed kynge sente sir bors chamber whan come besought hym socour madame said wold ye dyd maye worshyp haue adoo mater cause dyner drede ony tho knyghtes wold haue suspecyon also madame said sir bors mys ye sir launcelot wold haue fayled yow neyther ryght wronge ye haue wel preued whan ye haue ben daunger ye haue dryuen hym oute countrey whome ye alle dayly worshypped therfor madame merueylle ye dar shame requyre doo ony thynge yow soo moche ye haue chaced hym oute countrey whome borne vp honoured allas fayr knyghte sayd quene put holy grace alle done amys amende ye wille counceyle therwith kneled doune vpon bothe knee besought sir bors haue mercy vpon outher shall haue shameful dethe therto neuer offended ryght soo cam kyng arthur fonde quene knelyng afore sir bors thenne sir bors pulled vp said madame ye doo grete dishonoure gentil knyght said kyng haue mercy vpon quene curtois knyght certayne vntruly defamed ther curtois knyght sayd kynge promyse doo bataille requyre yow loue syr launcelot lord sayd syr bors ye requyre grettest thynge ony man may requyre wete ye wel yf graunte doo bataille quene shall wrathe many felauship table round sayd bors wille graunte lord lord sir launcelots sake sake wille daye quenes champyon onles come aduenture better knyghte doo batail ye promyse sayd kynge feythe ye sir said sir bors fayle yow bothe yf came better knyghte thenne shalle haue bataille thenne kynge quene passyng gladde soo departed thanked hym hertely soo thenne sir bors departed secretely vpon day rode vnto sire launcelot wyth heremyte sir brastias told hym theire aduenture ihesu said sir launcelot come happely wold haue hit therfor praye yow make redy doo bataille loke ye tary tyl ye see come longe ye may sure mador hote knyghte whan enchaufed ye suffre hym hastyer wille batail syr said bors lete dele hym doubte ye ye shalle haue alle wille thenne departed syre bors hym came courte ageyne thenne hit noysed alle courte sir bors shold doo bataill quene wherfore many knyghtes displeasyd hym wold take vpon hym doo batail quenes quarel fowe knyghtes courte demed quene wronge done treason soo sire bors ansuerd thus felawes table round wete ye wel fayre lordes shame v alle suffred see moost noble quene world shamed openly consyderynge lord lord man moost worship world moost crystend hath euer worshipped v alle al place many ansuerd hym ageyne oure mooste noble kynge arthur loue hym honoure hym wel ye quene gueneuer loue cause destroyer good knyghtes faire lordes sayd sir bors semeth ye saye ye shold say neuer yet dayes knewe neuer herd saye euer destroyer ony good knyghte att alle tymes ferre euer coude knowe mayntener good knyghtes euer hath ben large free goodes alle good knyghtes moost bountenous lady yeftes good grace euer sawe herd speke shame said sire bors v noble kynges wyf suffred shamefully slayne wete ye wel sayd sire bors wylle suffer dare say soo moche quene gylty sir patryse dethe owed hym neuer none ylle wylle none four twenty knyghtes dyner dar saye good loue bad v dyner male engyne doubte shalle preued someuer game goth treason amonge v thenne sayd sire bors may wel bileue wordes soo wel pleasyd somme pcapitulum vj daye came faste vntyl euen bataille shold thenne quene sente sir bors asked hym disposed truly madame sayd disposed lyke wyse promysed yow saye shal fayle yow onles aduenture come better knyghte doo batail yow thenne madame discharged promyse pwylle ye sayd quene telle lord arthur thus doth shal please yow madame thenne quene wente vnto kynge told hym ansuer sir bors haue ye doubte said kynge sir bors calle hym one beste knyghtes world profytelyest man thus past vntyl morne kynge quene maner knyghtes tyme drewe vnto medowe bysyde wynchester bataylle shold soo whan kynge come quene many knyghtes round table quene putte conestables ward grete fyre made aboute yron stake syr mador de la porte hadde better shold brente suche
