customme vsed tho dayes neyther fauour neyther loue affynyte shold none ryghtuous iugement wel vp kynge vpon knyghte wel vpon quene vpon another poure lady soo meane whyle came sir mador de la porte tooke othe afore kynge quene dyd treason vntyl cosyn sir patryse vnto othe wold preue body hand hand wold saye contrary ryght cam sire bors de ganys sayde quene gueneuer ryght wille make good handes culpable treason putte vpon thenne make redy said sir mador shalle preue whether thow ryght sir mador said sir bors wete thou wel knowe yow good knyghte thenne shal fere yow soo gretely truste god shalle able withstande malyce thus moche haue promysed lord arthur lady quene shalle bataille caas vttermest onles come better knyghte discharge alle said sire mador outher come thou doo batail el say nay take hors said sire bors suppose ye shalle tary longe ye shalle ansuerd thenne eyther departed tentys maade hem redy horsbak thoughte best anone sir mador cam felde shelde sholder spere hand soo rode aboute place cryenge vnto arthur byd champyon come forthe dare thenne sir bors ashamed took hors came lystes ende p thenne ware cam wood faste knyght armed vpon whyte hors straunge shelde straunge armes came rydynge alle myghte renne soo came sir bors sayd thus fair knyght pray yow displeased must better knyyt ye haue thys bataille therfor praye yow withdrawe yow wete ye wel haue day ryght grete iourneye bataille ought myn soo promysed yow whan spak yow last alle herte thanke yow good wille thenne sire bors rode vnto kynge arthur told hym knyyt come wold haue bataille fyghte quene pwhat knyght said kynge wote sayd syre bors suche couenaunt made day lord sayd syr bors discharged capitulum vij thenne kynge called knyghte asked hym yf wold fyghte quene thenne ansuerd kynge therfor cam hydder therfor sir kyng sayd tary noo lenger may tary anone haue fynysshed bataille must departe hen haue doo many mater el wete yow wel sayd knyght dishonour yow alle knyghtes round table see knowe soo noble lady curtoys quene quene gueneuer thus rebuked shamed amongest yow thenne alle merueylled knyyt myghte soo tooke bataille vpon hym one knewe hym yf syre bors thenne sayd sir mador de la porte vnto kynge lete wete whome shalle haue adoo alle thenne rode lystes ende couched speres ranne gyder alle myghtes sire madors spere brake alle pyeces others spere held bare syre madors hors alle bakward erthe grete falle myghtely sodenly auoyded hors putte sheld afore hym thenne drewe suerd badde knyghte alyghte doo batail hym foote thenne knyght descended hors lyghtly lyke valyaunt man putte sheld afore hym drewe suerd soo came egerly vnto bataille eyther gaf many grete stroke tracynge trauercynge racynge foynynge hurtlyng gyder suerdes wyld bore thus fyghtynge nyghe houre sir mador stronge knyghte myghtely proued many stronge batails laste thys knyghte smote sir madore grouelynge vpon erthe knyght stepped nere hym haue pulled sir mador flatlynge vpon ground sodenly sir mador aroos rysynge smote knyghte thurgh thyck thyyes blood ranne oute fyersly p whan felte hym self soo wounded sawe blood lete hym aryse vpon foot thenne gaf hym suche buffet vp helme felle erthe flatlynge therwith strode hym haue pulled helme hede thenne sir mador prayd knyghte saue lyf yelded hym ouercome relecyd quene quarel wille graunte thy lyf said knyghte thou frely relece quene euer mencyon made vpon sir patryces tombe euer quene gueneuer consented treason alle shalle done said sir mador clerely discharge quarel euer thenne knyytes parters lystes toke vp sire mador ledde hym tente knyghte wente streyghte steyer foote sat kyng arthur tyme quene come kynge eyther kyssed hertely whan kynge sawe knyghte stouped doune hym thanked hym lyke wyse dyd quene kynge prayd hym putte helmet repose hym take sop wyn thenne putte helme drynke thenne euery knyght knewe hym syre launcelot du lake anone quene wyst took quene hand yode vnto syr launcelot sayd sir graunt mercy grete trauaille ye haue hadde thys day quene lord sayd sir launcelot wete ye wel oughte ryghte euer quarel lady quenes quarel batail ye ar man gaf hyghe ordre knyghthode daye lady quene dyd grete worship el ben shamed day ye made knyghte thurgh hastynesse lost suerd lady quene fond hit lawed hit trayne gafe suerd whan hadde nede therto el ben shamed emonge alle knyghtes therfor lord arthur promysed day euer knyghte ryghte outher wronge graunt mercy sayd kyng iourneye wete ye wel said kyng shal acquyte youre goodenes euer quene behelde sir launcelot wepte tendyrly sanke groud sorowe done h r soo grete goodenes shewed hym grete vnkyndenes pthenne knyghtes blood drewe vnto hym eyther made grete ioye came alle knyghtes table round tyme welcomed hym thenne sir mador leche crafte sire launcelot helyd woud thenne made grete ioye myrthes courte pcapitulum octauum soo befelle damoysel lake name nymue whiche wedded good knyyt sir pelleas soo cam courte euer dyd grete goodenes vnto kynge arthur alle knytes thurgh sorcery enchauntementes soo whan herd quene angred dethe syre patryse thenne told openly neuer gylty disclosed whome done named hym syr pynel cause dyd openly disclosed soo quene excused knyyt pynel fled countre thenne openly knowen syr pynel enpoysond appels att feest entente haue destroyed sire gawayne cause syr gawayne bretheren destroyed syr lamorak de galys whiche syre pynel cosyn vnto thenne sire patryce buryed chirche westmestre tombe vpon wryten lyeth syre patryce irlond slayne syre pynel le saueage enpoysoned appels haue slayne syre gawayne mysfortune sire patryce ete one tho appels thenne sodenly brast also wryten vpon tombe quene gueneuer appelyd treason deth sire patryce sir mador de la porte made mencyon sire launcelot foughte hym quene gueneuer ouercame hym playne bataille alle wryten vpon tombe syr patryce excusyng quene thenne sir mador sewed dayly long haue quenes good grace soo meanes syre launcelot caused hym stande quenes good grace forgyuen thus passed tyl oure lady daye assupcyon within xv dayes feest kynge lete crye grete iustes turnement shold daye att camelot wynchester kynge lete crye kynge scottes wold iuste ageynst alle wold come ageynst hem whan crye made thydder cam many knyghtes soo came thyder kyng northgalys kyng anguysshe irland kyng honderd knyghtes galahaut haute prynce kynge northumberland many noble duke erles dyuerse countreyes soo kynge arthur made hym redy departe thise iustys wold haue quene hym tyme wold said seke myghte ryde tyme repenteth sayd kynge seuen yere ye sawe suche noble felaushyp gyders excepte wytsontyde whan galahad departed courte truly sayd quene kynge ye muste holde excused maye repenteth many demed quene wold cause sir launcelot du lake sire launcelot wold ryde kynge said hole wound whiche sire mador gyuen hym wherfor kynge heuy passynge wrothe soo departed toward wynchestre felaushyp soo way kynge lodged towne called astolot englyssh called gylford kynge lay castel soo whan kynge departed quene called sir launcelot said thus sire launcelot ye gretely blame thus holde yow behynde lord trowe ye youre enemyes myne saye deme noughte el see sire launcolot holdeth hym euer behynde kyng soo doth quene wold haue pleasyr gyders thus wylle saye sayd quene syr launcelot haue ye noo doubte therof pcapitulum ix madame said syr launcelot allowe wytte late come syn ye wy therfor madame tyme wille rulyd counceylle thys nyghte wylle take rest morowe tyme wyll take waye toward wynchestre pbut wete yow wel sayd sir launcelot quene iustes wille ageynst kynge ageynste al felaushyp ye maye doo ye lyst sayd quene counceylle ye shalle ageynst youre kyng youre felaushyp therin ben ful many hard knyghtes youre blood ye wote wel ynough hit nedeth reherce pmadame said syre launcelot praye yow ye displeasyd wille take aduenture god wylle sende soo vpon morne erly syre launcelot herd masse brake fast soo toke leue quene departed thenne rode soo moche vntyl came astolat gylford hit happed hym euentyde cam old baron place hyght sir bernard astolat syre launcelot entryd lodgynge kynge arthur aspyed hym dyd walke gardyn besyde castel took lodgynge knewe hym ful wel pit wel sayd kynge arthur vnto knyghtes hym gardyn besyde casstel haue aspyed one knyghte wylle playe playe iustes whiche gone toward vndertake wil merueils pray telle v sayd many knyghtes tyme ye shal wete said kynge tyme soo kyng smyled wente lodgynge soo whan sire launcelot lodgynge vnarmed hym chamber olde baron heremyte came hym makynge reuerence welcomed hym best maner old knyght knewe sire launcelot fair sir said sir launcelot hooste wold praye yow lone shelde openly knowen myn wel knowen sir said hoost ye shalle haue desyre semeth ye one lykelyest knyghtes world therfor shall shewe frendship sire wete yow wel haue two sone late made knyghtes eldest hyghte sir tirre hurt day made knyghte may ryde sheld ye shalle haue knowen dare saye place el yongest sone hyght lauayne yf hit please yow shalle ryde yow vnto iustes age stronge wyght moche herte gyueth vnto yow ye shold noble knyyte therfor praye yow telle name said sir bernard sayd sire launcelot ye must holde excused tyme yf god gyue grace spede wel att iustes shalle come ageyne telle yow praye yow said sir launcelot ony wyse lete haue youre sone sire lauayne maye haue broders shelde alle shalle done said sir bernard pthis old baron doughter tyme called tyme faire mayden astolat euer beheld sir launcelot wonderfully book sayth cast suche loue vnto sir launcelot coude neuer withdrawe loue wherfore dyed name elayne le blank soo thus cam fro soo hote loue besoughte syr launcelot vpon hym iustes token pfaire damoysel said sir launcelot yf graunte yow ye may saye doo youre loue euer dyd lady damoysel pthenne remembryd hym wold goo iustes desguysed cause neuer fore tyme borne noo manere token noo damoysel pthenne bethoughte hym wold bere one none blood myghte knowe hym thenne said faire mayden wylle graunte yow token vpon myn helmet therfor shewe sir said reed sleue myn scarlet wel enbroudred grete perlys soo brought hym soo syre launcelot receyued sayd neuer dyd erst soo moche damoysel thenne sir launcelot bitoke fair mayden shelde kepyng praid kepe vntyl came ageyne soo nyghte mery rest grete chere euer damoysel elayne aboute sire launcelot alle whyle myghte suffred capitulum x soo vpon daye morne kynge arthur al knyghtes departed theire kynge taryed thre dayes abyde noble knyghtes soo whanne kynge ryden sir launcelot sire lauayne made hem redy ryde eyther hem whyte sheldes reed sleue sir launcelot lete cary hym soo tooke leue syr bernard old baron att doughter faire mayden astolat thenne rode soo long til came camelot tyme called wynchestre grete prees kynges duke erles baron many noble knyghtes sir launcelot lodged pryuely meanes sir lauayne ryche burgeis man toune ware soo reposed til oure lady day assumpcyon grete feest sholde soo thenne trumpet blewe vnto felde kynge arthur sette hyghe vpon skafhold beholde dyd best frensshe book saith kynge wold suffer syre gawayn goo hym neuer sir gawayn better sire launcelot felde many tymes sir gawayn rebuked whan laucelot cam ony iustes desguysed thenne som kynges kynge anguysshe irland kynge scottes tyme torned vpon syde kynge arthur p thenne party kynge northgalys kymge honderd knyghtes kynge northumberland syre galahad haut prynce thre kynges duke passyng weyke holde ageynst kynge arthur party hym noblest knyghtes world soo thenne withdrewe hem eyther party euery man made hym redy best maner doo myghte pthenne syre launcelot made hym redy putte reed sleue vpon hede fastned fast soo syre launcelot syre lauayne departed wynchestre pryuely rode vntyl lytel leuyd wood behynde party held ageynst kyng arthur party helde stylle tyl partyes smote gyders thenne cam kynge scottes kyng irland arthur party ageynst came kynge northumberland kynge honderd knyghtes smote doun kynge northumberland kynge honderd knyghtes smote doune kynge anguysshe irland thenne syre palomydes arthur party encountred syre galahad eyther hem smote doune eyther party halpe lordes horsbak ageyne soo began stronge assaile vpon bothe partyes thenne came syr brandyles syre sagramor le desyrus sire dodynas le saueage sir kay le seneschal sir gryflet le fyse de dieu sir mordred sir melyot de logrys syr ozanna le cure hardy sir safyr sir epynogrys syr galleron galway alle xv knyghtes knyghtes table round soo moo came gyders bete bak kynge northumberland kynge northwalys whan sir launcelot sawe houed lytil leued woode thenne sayd vnto syre lauayn see yonder company good knyghtes hold gyders bore chauffed dogges trouthe said syre lauayne pcapitulum xj sayd syre launcelot ye wille helpe lytel ye shalle see yonder felauship chaseth men oure syde shal go fast bakward wente forward sir spare said sire lauayne shall doo maye thenne sire launcelot sire lauayne cam thyckest prees syre launcelot smote doune syr brandyles syre sagramore syre dodynas sir kay syr gryflet alle dyd one spere sire lauayne smote doune sire lucan de buttelere sir bedeuere thenne sire launcelot gat another spere smote doune sir agrauayne sire gaherys sir mordred sir melyot de logrys sir lauayne smote doune ozanna le cure hardy thenne sir launcelot drewe suerd smote ryght hand lyfte hand grete force vnhorced syr safyr sire epynogrys sir galleron thenne knyghtes table round drewe abak goten horse wel myghte mercy ihesu said sire gawayne knyyte yonder doth soo merueyllous dedes armes felde wote sayd kynge arthur att tyme wille name hym syre sayd sire gawayne wold say syr launcelot rydynge buffet see hym dele euer semeth shold bereth reed sleue vpon hede wyst hym neuer bere token iustes lady gentilwoman lete hym said kynge arthur wille better knowen euer departe thenne party ayenst kynge arthur wel comforted thenne helde hem gyders hand sore rebuked thenne sir bors sir ector de mary sir lyonel called vnto knyytes blood sir blamor de ganys syre bleoberys syr alyduke sir galyhud sire galyhodyn sir bellangere le beuse soo nyne knyghtes sir launcelots skynne threste myghtely al noble knyghtes grete hate despyte vnto hym thoughte rebuke noble knyght sir launcelot sire lauayne knewe hem soo cam hurlynge gyders smote doune many knyghtes northgalys northumberland whanne sire launcelot sawe fare soo gat spere hand encountred hym al attones syr bors sir ector sire lyonel alle thre smote hym atte one speres fors self smote sir launcelots hors erthe mysfortune sir bors smote syre launcelot thurgh shelde syde spere brake hede lefte stylle syde whan sir lauayne sawe maister lye ground ranne kynge scottes smote hym erthe grete force took hors brought hym syr launcelot maulgre al made hym mounte vpon hors thenne launcelot gat spere hand smote syre bors hors man erthe wyse serued syre ector syre lyonel syre lauayne smote doune sir blamore de ganys thenne sir launcelot drewe suerd felte hym self sore hurte wende haue dethe thenne smote sire bleoberys suche buffet helmet felle doune erthe swoun wyse serued sir alyduk sir galyhud sire lauayne smote doune syr bellangere sone alysaunder le orphelyn sire bors horsed thenne came sire ector syr lyonel alle thre smote suerdes vpon syre launcelots helmet whan felte buffet wounde whiche soo greuous thought doo myght whyle myght endure thenne gaf syr bors suche buffet made hym bowe heed passynge lowe al raced helme myght haue slayne hym soo pulled hym doune wyse serued syre ector sire lyonel book saith myghte haue slayne whan sawe vysages herte myght serue hym therto lefte hem p thenne afterward hurled thyckest prees alle dyd merueyloust dedes armes e er man sawe herde speke euer sire lauayne good knyghte hym sire launcelot suerd smote doune pulled doune frensshe book maketh mencyon moo thyrtty knyghtes moost party table round sire lauayne dyd ful wel day smote doune ten knyghtes table round pcapitulum xij mercy ihesu said syr gawayne arthur merueil knyghte reed sleue syr saide kynge arthur wille knowen departe thenne kynge blewe vnto lodgynge pryce gyuen herowdes vnto knyghte whyte shelde bare reed sleue thenne came kynge honderd knyytes kynge northgalys kynge northumberland sir galahaut haute prynce sayd vnto sire launcelot fayre knyght god blesse moche haue ye done day v therfor praye yow ye wille come v ye may receyue honour pryce ye haue worshipfully deserued faire lordes saide syre launcelot wete yow wel yf haue deserued thanke haue sore bought hit repenteth lyke neuer escape lyf therfor faire lordes pray yow ye wille suffer departe lyketh sore hurte take none force none honour leuer repose lord alle world al groned pytously rode grete wallop away ward fro vntyl came vnder woodes syde whan sawe felde nyghe myle sure myghte sene thenne said hyy voys gentyl knyght sir lauayne helpe truncheon oute syde stycketh sore nyhe sleeth myn owne lord said sir lauayne wold fayn myyt please yow drede sore pulle oute truncheon ye shalle perylle dethe charge said sir launcelot ye loue drawe hit oute alle descended hors ryght soo dyd sir lauayn forth al sir lauayn drewe truncheon syde gaf grete shryche merueillous grysely gro e blood braste oute nyghe pynt one last sanke doun vpon buttoks swouned pale dedely allas sayd sire lauayne shalle doo thenne torned sir launcelot wynde soo laye nyghe half houre ben dede laste syre launcelot caste vp eyen sayd lauayn helpe hors fast within two myle gentyl heremyte somtyme fulle noble knyghte grete lord possession grete goodenes hath taken hym wylful pouerte forsaken many landes name sire baudewyn bretayn ful noble surgeon good leche lete see helpe vp euer herte gyueth shalle neuer dye cosyn germayns handes thenne grete payne sir lauayne halpe hym vpon hors thenne rode grete wallop gyders euer syr launcelot blodde ranne doune erthe fortune came hermytage whiche vnder wood grete clyf syde fayre water rennynge vnder thenne sire lauayn bete gate spere cryed fast lete ihesus sake came fair chyld asked hem wold faire sone said syr lauayne goo pray thy lord heremyte goddes sake lete knyghte ful sore wounded day telle thy lord sawe hym dedes armes euer herd say ony man dyd soo chyld wente lyghtely thenne brought heremyte whiche passynge good man whan syr lauayne sawe hym prayd hym goddes sake socour knyght sayd heremyte hows kyng arthur wote said sire lauayne name wel wote sawe hym doo merueylously daye dedes armes who party sayd heremyte syre said syre lauayne daye ageynst kynge arthur wanne pryce alle knyghtes round table haue sene daye sayd heremyte wolde haue loued hym werse cause ageynst lord kynge arthur somtyme one felauship round table thanke god otherwyse disposed lete see hym thenne sir lauayne broughte heremyte hym pcapitulum xiij whan heremyte beheld hym sat lenynge vpon sadel bowe euer bledynge pytously euer knyghte heremyte thoughte shold knowe hym coude brynge hym knouleche cause soo pale bledynge knyght ye sayd heremyte ye borne fayre lord sayd syre launcelot straunger knyghte auenturous laboureth thury oute many realmes wynne worship thenne heremyte aduysed hym better sawe wound cheke syr launcelot allas sayd heremyte myn owne lord layne name p sothe oughte knowe yow ryyt ye moost noblest knyghte world wel knowe yow sire launcelot sire said sythe ye knowe helpe ye may goddes sake wold oute payne one outher dethe lyf haue ye doubte sayd heremyte ye shall lyue fare ryght wel soo heremyte called hym two seruauytes seruauntes bare hym hermytage lyghtely vnarmed hym leyd hym bedde thenne anone heremyte staunched blood made hym drynke good wyn sir launcelot wel refresshed knewe hym self dayes guyse heremytes dayes none heremytes tho dayes ben men worshyp prowesse tho heremytes helde grete housholde refresshyd peple distresse pnow torne vnto kynge arthur leue sir launcelot hermytage p soo whan kynges comen gyders bothe partyes grete feeste shold holden kynge arthur asked kynge northgalys theyr felaushyp knyghte bare reed sleue brynge hym afore may haue lawde honour pryce ryght thenne spake sir galahad haute prynce kynge honderd knyghtes suppose knyghte mescheued neuer lyke see yow none v alle grettest pyte euer wyste ony knyghte allas sayd arthur may soo hurte name sayd kynge arthur truly said knowe name whens cam whyder wold allas sayd kynge werst tydynges came seuen yere wold alle londes welde knowe wete noble knyght slayne knowe ye hym sayd al pa sayd arthur whether knowe hym knowe hym ye shal knowe man almyghty ihesu sende good good tydynges hym soo said alle hede said sire gawayn yf soo good knyghte sore hurte hit grete dommage pyte alle land one noblest knyghtes euer sawe felde handle spere suerd yf maye founde shalle fynde hym sure ny f r fro towne bere yow wel sayd kynge arthur ye may fynde hym onles suche plyte may welde hym self ihesu defende sayd sir gawayne wete shalle may fynde hym ryght soo syre gawayne took squyer hym vp hakneis rode al aboute camelot within vj seuen myle soo came ageyne coude word hym thenne within two dayes kynge arthur alle felaushyp retorned vnto london ageyne soo rode waye hit happed sir gawayne astolat lodge wyth syr bernard syr launcelot lodged soo sire gawayn chamber repose hym syr barnard old baron came vnto hym doughter elayne chere hym aske hym tydynges dyd best turnement wynchester soo god help said syre gawayne two knyghtes bare two whyte sheldes one hem bare reed sleue vpon hede certaynly one best knyghtes euer sawe iuste felde dare say sayd sire gawayne one knyght reed sleue smote doune fourty knyghtes table round felawe dyd ryght wel worshypfully p blessid god sayd fayre mayden astolat knyght sped soo wel man world fyrst loued truly shalle laste euer shalle loue fayre mayde sayd sir gawayne good knyght loue certaynly sir sayd wete ye wel loue thenne knowe ye name sayd sire gawayne nay truly said damoysel knowe name whens cometh say loue hym promyse god loue hym ye knouleche hym fyrst said sire gawayne pcapitulum xiiij thenne told hym ye haue herd fore houher fader betoke hym broder doo hym seruyse fader lente hym broders syr tyrreis shelde lefte owne sheld cause dyd said sir gawayne cause sayd damoysel sheld wel knowen amonge many noble knyghtes fayr damoysel sayd sir gawayne please hit yow lete haue syghte sheld syre said chamber couerd caas yf ye wille come ye shalle see hit soo sayd syre barnard tyl doughter lete nde soo whan sheld comen sir gawayne took caas whanne beheld sheld knewe anone hit sir launcelots shelde owne armes ihesu mercy sayd syr gawayne herte heuyer euer tofore sayd elayne haue grete cause sayd sire gawayne knyght oweth shelde loue ye truly said loue god wold loue soo god spede sayd sire gawayne fair damoysel ye haue ryght loue ye loue moost honourable knyghte world man moost worshyp thoughte euer said damoysel neuer tyme knyghte euer sawe loued neuer none erst pgod graunte sayd sire gawayne eyther yow maye reioyse grete aduenture truly said sir gawayne vnto damoysel ye may say ye haue fayre grace haue knowen noble knyght four twenty yere neuer day none knyghte dare make good sawe herd saye euer bare token sygne lady gentilwoman ne mayden iustes turnement therfor fayre mayden saide sire gawayne ye ar moche beholden hym gyue hym thankes drede sayd sire gawayne ye shalle neuer see hym thys world grete pyte euer erthely knyght allas sayd may slayne say soo said sire gawayne wete ye wel greuously wounded alle maner sygnes men syghte lykelyer dede lyue wete ye wel noble knyghte sire launcelot sheld knowe hym allas said fayre mayden astolat maye hurte truly said sire gawayne man world loued hym best hurte hym soo dare say sayd sir gawayne knyghte hurte hym knewe veray certaynte hurte sire launcelot wold moost sorowe euer came herte fair fader said thenne elayne requyre yow gyue leue ryde seke hym el wote wel shalle go oute mynde shalle neuer stynte tyl fynde hym broder syre lauayne doo lyketh yow sayd fader sore repenteth hurte noble knyghte pryghte soo mayde made redy syre gawayne makynge grete dole thenne morne syr gawayne came kynge arthur told hym fonde sire launcelots shelde kepynge fayre mayden astolat alle knewe afore hand sayd kynge arthur caused wold suffer haue adoo atte grete iustes aspyed said kynge arthur whan cam tyl lodgynge ful late euenynge astolat merueille haue said arthur euer wold bere ony sygne ony damoysel neuer herd say knewe euer bare ony token none erthely woman hede said sir gawayne fayre mayden astolat loueth hym merueyllously wel meaneth saye ryden seke hym soo kynge alle cam london sire gawayne openly disclosed alle courte sire launcelot iusted best pcapitulum xv whanne sir bors herd wete ye wel heuy man soo alle kynnesmen whan quene gueneuer wyste syre launcelot bare reed sleue fayre mayden astolat nyghe oute mynde wrathe pand thenne sente syr bors de ganys alle hast myghte soo whanne sire bors come fore quene thenne sayd sire bors haue ye herd say falsly sir launcelot hath bytrayed allas madame said sire bors aferd hath bytrayed hym self v alle force said quene though destroyed fals traytour knyghte madame sayd sir bors pray yow saye ye wete yow wel maye suche langage hym sire bors sayd shold calle hym traytour whan bare reed sleue vpon hede wynchestre grete iustes madame sayd syre bors sleeue beryng repenteth sore dar say dyd none euylle entente cause bare reed sleue none yf blood shold knowe hym thenne none v alle neuer knewe euer bare token sygne mayde lady ne gentylwoman fy hym said quene yet pryde bobaunce ye proued self better nay madame saye ye neuer soo bete felawes myghte haue slayne v wold fy hym sayd quene herd sir gawayne saye bifore lord arthur merueil telle grete loue bitwene fayre mayden astolat hym madame saide syre bors maye warne syr gawayne say pleasyd hym dare say lord syre launcelot loueth lady gentil woman mayde loueth lyke moche therfor madame said sir bors ye may saye ye wylle wete ye wel wille haste seke hym fynde hym someuer god sende good tydynges hym soo leue speke sire launcelot lay grete perylle soo fayr elayne cam wynchestre soughte al aboute fortune syr lauayne ryden playe hym enchauffe hors anone elayne sawe hym knewe hym thenne cryed loude vntyl hym whan herd anone came thenne asked broder dyd lord sire launcelot told yow syster lordes name sir launcelot thenne told hym sire gawayne sheld knewe hym soo rode gyders tyl cam hermytage anone alyghte sir lauayne broughte sire launcelot whanne sawe hym lye seke pale bedde myght speke sodenly felle erthe doune sodenly swoun lay grete whyle whanne releuyd stryked saide lord sire launcelot allas ye plyte thenne swouned ageyne thenne sir launcelot prayd syre lauayne take vp brynge whan cam self sire launcelot kyst said fair mayden fare ye thus ye put payne wherfor make ye nomore suche chere ye come comforte ye ryyt welcome lytel hurte haue shal ryghte hastely hole grace god merueylle sayd sir launcelot told yow name thenne fayre mayden told hym alle sire gawayne lodged fader sheld discouerd name allas sayd sir launcelot repenteth name knowen sure wille torne vnto angre thenne sir launcelot compast mynde syre gawnyne wold telle quene gueneuer bare reed sleue whome wyst wel wold torne vnto grete angre soo mayden elayne neuer wente sir launcelot watched hym day nyght dyd suche attendaunce hym frensshe book saith neuer woman dyd kyndelyer man thenne sir launcelot prayd sir lauayne make aspyes wynchestre sire bors yf came told hym token shold knowe hym wound forhede wel sure sayd sire launcelot syre bors wille seke good knyyt hurte pcapitulum xvj torne vnto sire bors de ganys cam vnto wynchestre seke cosyn syre launcelot soo whanne cam wynchestre anone men sire lauayne made lye watche suche man anone sir lauayne warnynge thenne sire lauayne came wynchestre fond sir bors told hym whome name pnow fayr knyghte said sire bors requyre yow ye wille brynge lord sir launcelot syre sayd sir lauayne take hors within houre ye shall see hym soo departed came hermytage pand whan sir bors sawe sir launcelot lye bedde pale discoloured anone sir bors lost countenaunce kyndenes pyte myghte speke wepte tendirly grete whyle thenne whanne myght speke said thus lord sire launcelot god yow blysse send yow hasty recouer ful heuy mysfortune myn vnhappynes may calle self vnhappy drede god gretely displeasyd wold suffre haue suche shame hurte yow ar alle oure leder alle oure worshyp therfor calle self vnhappy allas euer suche caytyf knyghte shold haue power vnhappynes hurte moost noblest knyghte world soo shamefully set vpon yow ouercharged yow ye myghte haue slayne ye saued dyd blood yow vtteraunce merueyle sayd sire bors herte blood wold serue wherfor lord sir launcelot aske mercy fair cosyn said sire launcelot ye ryght welcome wete ye wel ouer moche ye say please whiche pleaseth haue sought wold pryde haue ouercome yow alle pryde nere slayne myn owne defaute myghte haue gyue yow warnyng beynge thenne noo hurte old sayd sawe hard bataille kynne frendes doo bataille eyther ageynste maye mercy mortal warre tlerfor fair cosyn said sir launcelot lete thys speche ouerpasse alle shalle welcome god sendeth lete v leue mater lete v speke somme reioycynge done maye vndone lete v fynde remedy soone may hole thenne sire bors lened vpon beddes syde told sire launcelot quene passynge wrothe hym cause ware reed sleue grete iustes sir bors told hym alle sir gawayne discouered hit youre sheld ye lefte fayre mayden astolat thenne quene wrothe said sir launcelot therfor ryght heuy deserued wrath alle dyd cause wold knowen ryght excused yow said sir bors alle vayne sayd largelyer tha yow said sire bors besy aboute yow men calle fayre mayden astolat said sire launcelot meanes putte shold ye putte said sire bors passynge fayre damoysel wel bisene wel taughte god wold fayre cosyn said syre bors ye coude loue may dare counceyle yow see wel sayd sir bors dylygence aboute loueth entierly repenteth said sir laucelot syr sayd syr bors fyrst hath loste payn vpon yow pyte soo talked many moo thynges soo within thre dayes four sire launcelot bygge stronge ageyne pcapitulum xvij thenne sire bors told sire launcelot sworne grete turnement iustes betwixe kynge arthur kynge northgalys sholde vpon al halowmasse day besyde wynchestre trouthe said sir launcelot thenne shalle ye abyde styl lytyll whyle vntyl hole fele self ryght bygge stronge blessid god said syr bors thenne nygh moneth gyders euer mayden elayn dyd euer dylygente labour nyghte daye vnto syr launcelot ther neuer child wyf meker fader husband fayre mayden astolat wherfore sir bors gretely pleasyd soo vpon day assente syr launcelot syre bors syre lauayne made heremyte seke woodes dyuerse herbes soo sir launcelot made fayre elayne gadre herbes hym make hym bayne meane whyle syr launcelot made hym arme hym alle pyeces thoughte assaye armour spere hurte soo whan vpon hors stered hym fyersly hors passynge lusty fresshe cause laboured moneth afore thenne syr launcelot couched spere reest courser lepte myghtely whan felte spore vpon hym whiche noblest hors world strayned hym myghtely stably kepte stylle spere reest ther syre launcelot strayned hym self soo straytly soo grete force gete hors forward buttom wound brast bothe within withoute alle blood cam oute fyersly felte hym self soo feble myghte sytte vpon hors thenne syr launcelot cryed vnto syr bors syr bors syr lauayne helpe come myn ende felle doun one syde erthe lyke dede corp thenne syr bors syr lauayne came hym sorowe makyng mesure soo fortune mayden elayn herd mornyng thenne came thyder whan fond syr launcelot armed place cryed wepte ben woode thenne kyst hym dyd myghte awake hym thenne rebuked broder sir bors called hem fals traytours wold take hym bedde cryed sayd wold appele deth came holy heremyte syr bawdewyn bretayne whan fond syr launcelot plyte sayd lytel wete ye wel wrothe thenne bad hem lete v haue hym alle bare hym vnto hermytage vnarmed hym layd hym bedde eu r wound bledde pytously stered lymme hym thenne knyghte heremyte put thynge nose lytel dele water mouthe thenne sir launcelot waked swoune thenne heremyte staunched bledynge whan myghte speke asked sir launcelot putte lyf ieopardy sir said syre launcelot cause wende ben stronge also syre bors told shold al halowmasse grete iustes betwixe kynge arthur kynge northgalys therfor thoughte assaye hit self whether myght syr launcelot sayd heremyte herte courage wille neuer done vntyl last day ye shal doo counceylle bete sire bors departe yow lete hym doo turnement may grace god sayd knyghte heremyte turnement done ye come hydder ageyne syr launcelot shall hole ye soo wil gouerned capitulum xviij thenne sire bors made hym redy departe syre launcelot thenne sire launcelot sayd faire cosyn syr bors recommaunde vnto alle vnto whome oughte recommaunde vnto pray yow enforce self iustes ye maye best loue shalle abyde yow mercy god tyl ye come ageyne sir bors departed came courte kyng arthur told hem place lefte syr launcelot repenteth said kynge syn shall haue lyf may thanke god syre bors told quene ieopardy syre launcelot whanne wold assaye hors alle dyd madame loue yow cause wold haue ben turnement fy hym recreaunt knyghte sayd quene wete ye wel ryght sory shalle haue lyf lyf shalle haue said syr bors wold wyse excepte madame ben blood shold helpe shorte theire lyues madame sayd syr bors ye haue ben oftymes displesyd lord syr launcelot tymes ende ye fynde hym true knyghte soo departed thenne euery knyghte round table tyme present made redy iustes halowmasse thyder drewe many knyghtes dyuerse countreyes al halowemasse drewe nere thydder came kynge northgalys kynge honderd knyghtes syr galahaut haute prynce surluse thydder came kynge anguysshe irland kynge scottes soo thre kynges came kynge arthur party soo daye syre gawayne dyd grete dedes armes began fyrst herowdes nombred sir gawayne smote doune xx knyghtes thenne syr bors de ganys came tyme nombred smote doune twenty knyghtes therfor pryce gyuen betwixe bothe began fyrst lengest endured palso syr gareth book sayth dyd daye grete dedes armes smote doune pulled doune thyrtty knyghtes whan done dedes taryed soo departed therfor lost pryce sir palomydes grete dedes armes day smote doun twenty knyytes departed sodenly men demed syre gareth rode gyders somme maner aduentures soo whan turnement done syr bors departed rode tyl syre launcelot cosyn thenne fonde hym walkynge foot ther eyther made grete ioye sire bors tolde syr launcelot iustes lyke ye haue herde merueille said sir launcelot syre gareth whan done suche dedes armes wolde tary therof merueyled al saide syr bors yf yow syr tristram syre lamorak de galys sawe neuer knyyt bere doune soo many lytel whyle dyd syr gareth anone gone wyste hede said sir launcelot noble knyghte myghty man wel brethed yf wel assayed said sir launcelot wold deme good ynough ony knyghte bereth lyf gentyl knyghte curtois true bounteuous meke mylde hym maner male engyn playne feythful trewe soo thenne made hem redy departe heremyte vpon morne took horse elayne le blank whan came astolat wel lodged grete chere syre bernard old baron sir tyrre sone vp morne whan syr launcelot shold departe fayre elayne brouyt fader sir lauayne sir tyrre thus said capitulum xix lord syr launcelot see ye wylle departe fayre knyghte curtois knyghte haue mercy vpon suffer dye thy loue wold ye dyd said syr launcelot wold haue husband sayd elayne fair damoysel thanke yow said syr launcelot truly sayd cast neuer wedded man thenne fair knyght said wylle ye peramour ihesu defende said syr launcelot thenne rewarded fader broder ful euylle grete goodenes allas sayd thenne must dye loue ye shal said syre launcelot wete ye wel fayr mayden myght haue ben maryed wolde neuer applyed maryed yet cause fair damoysel ye loue ye saye ye doo wille good wylle kyndenes shewe yow somme goodenes someuer ye wille beset youre herte vpon somme goode knyghte wylle wedde yow shalle gyue yow gyders thousand pound yerely yow h yres thus moche gyue yow faire madame kyndenes alweyes whyle lyue owne knyghte pof alle saide mayden wille none yf ye wille wedde ellys peramour leest wete yow wel sir launcelot good dayes done fair damoysel sayd sir launcelot ij thynges ye must pardonne thenne shryked shyrly folle doune swoune thenne wymmen bare chamber made ouer moche sorowe thenne sir launcelot wold departe asked sir lauayn wold doo shold doo said syre lauayne folowe yow yf ye dryue yow commaunde goo yow thenne came sir bernard sir launcelot sayd hym see doughter elayne wille dye sake maye doo alle said sir launcelot sore repenteth reporte youre self profer fayre repenteth said syr launcelot loueth doth neuer causer hit reporte youre sone erly ne late profered bounte faire byhestes said sir launcelot dare alle knyght shold doo clene mayden bothe dede wille ryght heuy distresse ful fayre mayden good gentyl well taughte fader said sir lauayne dar make goood clene mayden lord sir launcelot doth doo sythen fyrst sawe lord sir launcelot coude neuer departe hym nought wylle maye folowe hym thenne sir launcelot took leue soo departed came vnto wynchestre whan arthur wyste syr launcelot come hole sound kynge maade grete ioye hym soo dyd sir gawayn knyytes round table excepte sir agrauayn sire mordred palso quene gueneuer woode wrothe sir launcelot wold meanes speke hym enstraunged self hym sir launcelot made alle meanes myght speke quene hit wolde pnow speke fayre mayden astolat made suche sorowe daye nyght neuer slepte ete drank euer made complaynt vnto sir l uncelot thus endured ten dayes febled must nedes passe thys world thenne shryued clene receyued creatoure euer complayned stylle vpon sire launcelot thenne ghoostly fader bad leue suche thoughtes thenne sayd shold leue suche thoughtes erthely woman alle whyle brethe body may complayne byleue doo none offence though loue erthely man take god record loued neuer none sir launcelot du lake neuer shall clene mayden hym alle sythen hit sufferaunce god shalle dye loue soo noble knyghte byseche hyghe fader heuen haue mercy vpon sowle vpon myn innumerable paynes suffred may allygeaunce parte synnes swete lord ihesu sayd fayre mayden take record neuer grete offenser ageynst thy lawes loued noble knyght sire launcelot mesure self good lord myght withstande feruent loue wherfor haue dethe thenne called fader sire bernard broder sir tyrre hertely praid fader broder myght wryte letter lyke endyte hit fader graunted whan letter wryten word word lyke deuysed thenne prayd fader myght watched vntyl dede whyle body hote lete letter putt ryght hand hand boude fast letter vntyl cold lete putte fayre bedde alle rychest clothes haue aboute lete bedde alle rychest clothes laide charyot vnto next place temse lete putte within barget one man suche ye trust stere thyder barget couerd blak samyte ouer ouer thus fader byseche yow lete hit done soo fader graunted hit feythfully alle thynge shold done lyke deuysed thenne fader broder made grete dole done anone dyed soo whan dede corp bedde alle ledde next way vnto temse man corp alle put temse soo man styred barget vnto westmynster rowed grete whyle fro ony aspyed hit pcapitulum xx soo fortune kynge arthur quene gueneuer spekynge gyders wyndowe soo loked temse aspyed blak barget hadde merueylle mente thenne kynge called sire kay shewed hit hym sir said sir kay wete wel newe tydynges goo thyder sayd kynge sir kay take yow sire brandyles agrauayne brynge redy word thenne four knyghtes departed came barget wente fond fayrest corp lyenge ryche bedde poure man sittyng bargets ende word wold speke soo foure knyghtes retorned vnto kyng ageyne told hym fond fayr corp wylle see sayd kynge soo thenne kyng took quene hand went thydder thenne kynge made barget holden fast thenne kyng ye quene entred certayn knyytes wyth sawe fayrest woman lye ryche bedde couerd vnto myddel many ryche clothes alle clothe gold lay though smyled thenne quene aspyed letter ryght hand told kynge thenne kynge took sayd sure letter wille telle come hydder soo thenne kynge quene wente oute barget soo commaunded certayne wayte vpon barget soo whan kynge come within cha ber called many knyghtes aboute hym saide wold wete openly wryten within letter thenne kynge brake made clerke rede hit entente letter moost noble knyghte sir launcelot hath dethe made v two debate loue louer men called fayre mayden astolat therfor vnto alle ladyes make mone yet praye soule bery atte leest offre ye masse peny last request clene mayden dyed take god wytnes pray soule sir launcelot thou art pierles alle substance letter whan redde kyng quene alle knyghtes wepte pyte doleful co playntes thenne sire launcelot sente whan come kynge arthur made letter redde hym whanne sire launcelot herd hit word word sayd lord arthur wete ye wel ryghte heuy dethe fair damoysel god knoweth neuer causer dethe wyllynge wille reporte broder sir lauayne wille saye nay sayd syre launcelot bothe fayre good moche beholden vnto loued mesure ye myght haue shewed sayd quene somme bounte gentilnes myghte haue preserued lyf madame sayd sir launcelot wold none wayes ansuerd wold wyf outher el peramour two wold graunte proferd good loue shewed thousand pound yerly heyres wedde ony manere knyghte coude fynde best loue herte madame said sir launcelot loue constrayned loue loue muste aryse herte constraynte trouth sayd kynge many knyghtes loue free hym selfe neuer wille bounden bounden looseth hym self thenne sayd kynge vnto sire launcelot hit wyl worshyp ye ouer see entered worshypfully sire sayd sire launcelot shalle done best deuyse soo many knyghtes yede thyder behold fayr mayden soo vpon morne entered rychely sir launcelot offryd masse peny knyytes table round tyme offryd syr launcelot thenne poure man wente ageyne barget p thenne quene sente syr launcelot prayd hym mercy ben wrothe hym causeles fyrste tyme said sir launcelot ye haue ben displeasyd causeles madame euer must suffre yow sorowe endure take force soo paste alle wynter alle manere huntynge hauffyng iustes torneyes many betwixe many grete lordes euer al place sir lauayne gate grete worshyp soo nobly renomed amonge many knyghtes table round capitulum xxj thus past tyl crystmasse thenne euery day iustes made dyamond iusted best shold haue dyamond syr laucelot wold iuste yf grete iustes cryed syr lauayne iusted alle crystemasse passyngly wel best praysed fewe dyd soo wel wherfore alle manere knyghtes demed sir lauayne shold e made knyghte table round nexte feeste pentecost soo crystmasse kynge arthur lete calle vnto hym many knyghtes aduysed gyders make party grete turnement iustes kynge northgalys sayd arthur wold haue party kynge anguysshe irland thekynge honderd knyghtes kynge northumberland sire galahad haute prynce soo foure kynges myghty duke took party ageynst kynge arthur knyghte table round crye made day iustes shold besyde westmynstre vpon candylmas day wherof many knyghtes glad made redy iustes freyssheyst maner thenne quene gueneuer sent syr launcelot said thus warne yow ye ryde ny iustes turnementys youre kynnesmen may knowe yow thise iustes shall ye shalle haue sleue gold pray yow sake enforce self men may speke yow worship charge yow ye haue loue ye warne youre kynnesmen ye wille bere daye sleue gold vpon helmet madame said sir launcelot shalle soo eyther made grete ioye whan syre launcelot sawe tyme told sir bors wold departe haue hym sir lauayne vnto good heremyte dwellid forest wyndsoore name sire brastias thoughte repose hym take alle rest myghte cause wold f sshe daye iustes soo sire launcelot sire lauayne departed noo creature wyst become noble men blood whanne come hermytage wete yow wel good chere soo dayly syr launcelot wold goo welle fast hermytage wold lye doune see welle sprynge bu byl somtyme slepte p tyme lady dwellid forest grete huntresse dayly vsed hunte euer bare bowe men wente neuer alwayes wymmen shoters coude wel kylle dere bothe stalke trest dayly bare bowes arowes horne wood knyues many good dogges strynge bate hit happed lady huntresse abated dogge bowe barayne hynde barayne hynde took flyghte ouer hedge woodes euer lady part wymmen costed hynde chekked noyse houndes haue mette hynde somme water soo hit happed hynde came welle sire launcelot slepyng slomberynge soo whan hynde came welle hete wente soyle lay grete whyle dogges came vmbecast aboute lost veray parfyte feaute hynde ryghte came lady huntres knewe thy dogge hynde soyle welle cam styfly fonde hynde put brode arowe bowe shot atte hynde ouer hotte hynde soo mysfortune arowe smote sir launcelot thyck buttok ouer arbys whanne sir launcelot felte hym self hurte hurled vp woodely sawe lady smyten hym p whan sawe woman sayd thus lady damoysel thow euylle tyme bare ye bowe deuylle made yow shoter pcapitulum xx mercy fair sir said lady gen tilwoman vseth forest huntynge god knoweth sawe yow barayn hynde soyle welle wend haue done wel hand swarued allas said syre launcelot ye haue mescheued soo lady departed sir launcelot myghte pulled oute arowe lefte hede styll buttok soo wente weykely hermytage euer bledynge went whan sir lauayne heremyte aspyed sir launcelot hurte wete yow wel passynge heuy sire lauayne wyst hurte whome thenne wrothe mesure thenne grete payne heremyte gat oute arowes hede oute syr launcelots buttok moche blood shedde wound passynge sore vnhappyly smyten suche place myght sytte noo sadyl mercy ihesu said sir launcelot may calle self moost vnhappyest man lyueth euer whan wold faynest haue worshyp befalleth euer somme vnhappy thynge soo ihesu helpe said sir launcelot yf man wold god shalle felde vpon candelmasse daye iustes someuer falle hit soo alle myght goten hele sir launcelot psoo whan day come sir launcelot lete deuyse arayed sir lauayne horse thouy ben sarazyns soo departed cam nygh felde kynge northgalys honderd knyghtes hym kynge northumberland broughte hym honderd good knyghtes kynge anguysshe irland brought hym honderd good knyghtes redy iuste sir galahalt haute prynce broughte hym honderd good knyghtes kynge honderd knyghtes brought hym many alle proued good knyghtes thenne cam kyng arthur party came kynge scottes honderd knyghtes kynge vryens gore brought hym honderd knyghtes kynge howel bretayne brouyte hym honderd knyghtes chalaunce claraunce broughte hym honderd knyghtes kynge arthur hym self came felde two honderd knyghtes moost party knyghtes table round proued noble knyghtes old knyghtes sette skaffoldes iuge quene dyd best pcapitulum xxij thenne blewe felde kyng northgalys encountred kynge scottes kynge scottes falle kyng irland smote doune kynge vryens kyng northumberland smote doune kynge howel bretayne sir galahaut haute prynce smote doune chalenge claraunce thenne kynge arthur woode wroth ranne kynge honderd knyytes kyng arthur smote hym doune spere kynge arthur smote doune thre knyghtes thenne whan spere broken kynge arthur dyd passyngly wel soo alle came syr gawayne sir gaheryse sire agrauayne sir mordred eueryche smote doune knyghte sir gawayne smote doune four knyytes thenne beganne stronge medle thenne came knyghtes launcelots blood sir gareth sire palomydes many knyghtes table round beganne holde foure kynges myghty duke soo hard discomfyte duke galahad haut prynce noble knyght myghty prowesse armes helde knyghtes table round ayte ynough alle doynge sawe sir launcelot thenne came felde syr lauayne hit ben thonder thenne anone syre bors knyghtes blood aspyed sir launcelot said alle warne yow beware hym sl ue gold vpon hede hym self sir launcelot du lake grete goodenes si bors warned syr gareth wel apayed said sir gareth may knowe hym sayd alle rydeth hym aray good gentyl knyght sir lauayne said sir bors soo sire launcelot encou tred sir gawayne force syr launcelot smote doune sir gawayne hors erthe soo smote doune sir agrauayne sire gaherys also smote doune sir mordred alle one spere pthenne sir lauayne mette sir palomydes eyther mette soo hard fyersly bothe horse felle erthe thenne horsed ageyne thenne mette sir launcelot sir palomydes sire palomydes falle soo sir launcelot euer stynte fast myghte gete speres smote doun thyrtty knyghtes moost party knyytes table round euer knyghtes blood withdrewe made hem adoo place sir launcelot came thenne kyng arthur wrothe sawe sir launcelot doo suche dedes thenne kynge called vnto hym sir gawayn sir mordred sir kay sir gryflet sir lucan butteler syre pedeuer sir palomydes sir safyr broder kynge nyne knyghtes made hem redy sette vpon sir launcelot vpon syr lauayne alle aspyed sir bors sir gareth drede sore said sir bors lord syr launcelot wylle hard matched hede sayd syr gareth wylle ryde vnto lord sir launcelot helpe hym falle hym falle may man made knyghte ye shalle soo said sir bors counceylle onles ye desguysed ye shalle see dysguysed said syre gareth al aspyed walysshe knyghte repose hym sore hurte afore hurte syr gawayne hym syre gareth rode praid hym knyghthode lene hym shelde wille wel said walysshe knyghte whanne sir gareth shelde book saith grene wyth mayden semed hit thenne syr gareth came dryuynge sir launcelot al myghte said knyghte kepe thy self yonder cometh kyng arthur nyne noble knyytes hym putte yow rebuke come bere yow felaushyp old loue ye haue shewed gramercy said sir launcelot syr sayd sir gareth encountre ye sir gawayne shalle encountre syre palomydes lete sir lauayne matche noble kynge arthur pand whan haue delyuerd hem lete v thre hold v sadly gyders thenne come kynge arthur nyne knyytes hym sir launcelot encountred sir gawayne gafe hym suche buffet arson sadel brast syre gawayne felle erthe thenne sir gareth encountred good knyghte sir palomydes gaf hym suche buffet bothe hors dasshed erthe thenne encountred kynge arthr sire lauayne eyther hem smote erthe hors alle lay grete whyle thenne sir launcelot smote doune syr agrauayne syre gaheryse syr mordred syr gareth smote doune syr kay syr safyr syr gryflet thenne syr lauayne horsed ageyne smote doune syre lucan butteler syr bedeuer thenne beganne grete thrange good knyghtes thenne syre launcelot hurtlyd racyd pulled helmes soo tyme myght none sytte hym buffet spere suerd syr gareth dyd suche dedes armes men merueylled knyghte grene sheld smote doune daye pulled doune moo thyrtty knyghtes frensshe book sayth syr launcelot merueylled whan beheld syr gareth doo suche dedes knyghte myghte syr lauayne pulled doune smote doune twenty knyghtes palso syr launcelot knewe syr gareth syr tristram de lyones outher syr lamorak de galys ben alyue syr launcelot wold haue demed ben one tweyne soo euer syr launcelot syr gareth syr lauayn faughte one syde syr bors syr ector de mary syr lyonel syr lamorak de galys syr bleoberys syr galyhud syr galyhodyn syr pelleas wyth moo kynge ban blood foughte vpon another party helde kynge honderd knyghtes kyng northumberland ryght strayte pcapitulum xxiiij soo turnement iustes dured longe tyl hit nere nyghte knyghtes round table releued euer vnto kynge arthur kynge wrothe oute mesure knyghtes myght preuaile day thenne sire gawayne said kynge merueile alle day syr bors de ganys felaushyp syre launcelots blood merueylle day aboute yow hit somme cause sayd syr gawayne hede said sire kay syre bors yonder day vpon ryghte hand felde ther blood done worshypfully doo may wel sayd syr gawayne drede euer gyle payne lyf said sir gawayne knyghte reed sleue gold hym self sir launcelot see wel rydynge grete stroke knyghte colour good yonge knyght sir lauayne also knyghte grene shelde broder syr gareth yet hath desguysed hym self man shalle neuer make hym ageynst sir launcelot cause made hym knyghte hede said arthur neuewe byleue yow therfore telle youre best counceyll sir said sir gawayne ye shalle haue counceylle lete blowe vnto lodgynge syr launcelot du lake broder syr gareth hym helpe good yong knyghte syr lauayne trust truly wyll bote stryue yf shold falle ten xij vpon one knyghte worship shame ye saye trouthe sayd kyng saye sothe said kynge shame v soo many sette vpon ony wete ye wel sayd kyng arthur ben thre good knyghtes namely knyght sleue gold thenne blewe vnto lodgyng forth kyng arthur lete sende vnto four kynges myghty duke praid hem knyghte sleue gold departe fro kyng may speke hym thenne fourthe alle kyng arthur alighte vnarmed hym took litill hakney rode sir launcelot euer spye vpon hym soo fonde hym amonge four kynges duke kyng prayd em alle vnto souper sayd wold good wylle whan vnarmed thenne kyng arthur knewe sire launcelot sir lauayne sir gareth syre launcelot sayd kynge arthur daye ye haue heted knyghtes soo yede vnto arthur lodgynge al gyder grete feest grete reuel pryce gyuen vnto syr launcelot rowdes named hym smyten doune fyfty knyghtes sire gareth fyue thyrtty sir lauayne four twenty knyghtes thenne sir launcelot told kynge quene lady huntresse shote hym foreste wyndesoore buttok brood arowe wound therof tyme syxe inch depe lyke longe p also arthur blamed syr gareth cause lefte felaushyp helde sir launcelot lord sayd sir gareth maade knyghte whanne sawe hym soo hard bestadde thought worshyp helpe hym sawe hym soo moche soo many noble knyghtes ageynst hym whan vnderstood sir launcelot du lake shamed see soo many knyghtes ageynst hym alone truly sayd kynge arthur vnto syre gareth ye saye wel worshypfully haue ye done self grete worshyp alle dayes lyf sayd kynge arthur vnto sir gareth wete yow wel shalle loue yow truste yow better euer sayd arthur hit worshypful knyghtes dede helpe worshypful knyghte whanne seeth hym grete daunger euer worshipful man lothe see worshipful shamed worship fareth cowardyse neuer shall shewe gentilnes maner goodnes seeth man ony daunger thenne euer wylle coward shewe mercy alwayes good man wille doo euer another man wold ben done hym self soo thenne grete feestes vnto kynges duke uel game playe al maner noblesse vsed curt true feythful frende tyme cherysshed pcapitulum xxv thus past candylmas vntyl ester moneth may come whan euery lusty herte begynneth blosomme brynge forth fruyte lyke herbes tree bryngen forth fruyte florysshen may lyke wyse euery lusty herte ony maner louer spryngeth floryssheth lusty dedes gyueth vnto al louers courage lusty moneth may thyng constrayne hym maner thyng moneth ony moneth dyuerse cause thenne alle herbes tree renewen man woman lyke wyse louers callen ageyne mynde old gentilnes old seruyse many kynde dedes forgeten neclygence lyke wynter rasure doth alway rase deface grene somer soo fareth vnstable loue man woman many person stabylyte may see al day lytel blast wynters rasure anone shalle deface lay parte true loue lytel noughte cost moch thynge wysedome stabylyte feblenes nature grete disworshyp someuer vseth therfore lyke may moneth floreth floryssheth many gardyns soo lyke wyse lete euery man worship florysshe herte world fyrst vnto god next vnto ioye promysed feythe vnto neuer worshypful man worshipfull woman loued one better another worshyp armes may neuer foyled fyrst reserue honour god secondly quarel must come thy lady suche loue calle vertuous loue dayes men loue seuen nyyte must haue alle desyres loue may endure reason ben soone accorded hasty hete soone keleth ryghte soo fareth loue dayes sone hote soone cold noo stabylyte old loue men wymmen coude loue gyders seuen yeres lycours lustes bitwene thenne loue trouthe feythfulnes loo lyke wyse vsed loue kynge arthur dayes pwherfor lyken loue adayes vnto somer wynter lyke one hote cold fareth loue dayes therfore alle ye louers calle vnto remembraunce moneth may lyke dyd quene gueneuer whome make lytel mencyon whyle lyued true louer therfor good ende pexplicit liber octodecimus foloweth liber xix pcapitulum primum soo befelle moneth may quene gueneuer called vnto knyytes table round gafe warnynge erly vpon morowe wold ryde mayeng woodes feldes besyde westmynstre warne yow none yow wel horsed ye alle clothed grene outher sylke outher clothe shalle brynge ten ladyes euery knyght shalle haue lady behynde hym euery knyghte shal haue squyer two yomen wyll ye alle wel horsed soo made hem redy fresshest maner name knyghtes sir kay seneschal sir agrauayne sir brandyles sir sagramor le desyrus sir dodynas le saueage sir ozanna le cure hardy sir ladynas forest saueage sir persaunt inde syre ironsyde called knyghte reed laundes sire pelleas louer ten knyghtes made hem redy fresshest maner ryde quene soo vpon morne toke horse quene rode mayenge woodes medowes hit pleasyd hem grete ioye delytes quene cast haue ben ageyne kyng arthur ferthest ten clok soo tyme purpoos thenne knyghte hyghte mellyagraunce sone vnto kynge bagdemagus knyghte tyme castel yefte kyng arthur within seuen myle westmynstre knyghte sir mellyagraunce loued passynge wel quene gueneuer soo done longe many yeres pand book sayth layne wayte stele away quene euermore forbare cause sir launcelot wyse wold medle quene sir launcelot company outher el nere hand tyme suche customme quene rode neuer withoute grete felaushyp men armes aboute many good knyghtes moost party yong men wold haue worshyp called quenes knyghtes neuer batail turnement iustes bare none hem maner knoulechynge owne armes playne whyte sheldes called quenes knyghtes thenne whan happed ony grete worshyp noble dedes thenne next feest pentecost yf ony slayne dede none yere fayled somme dede thenne chosen stede dede moost men worshyp called quenes knyghtes thus came vp alle fyrste renoumed men worship sire launcelot alle remenaunt knyyte sir mellyagraunce aspyed quene well purpos sir launcelot man armes ten noble knyghtes arayed grene mayeng thenne purueyed hym xx men armes honderd archer destroye quene knyghtes thoughte tyme best season take quene pcapitulum secundum soo quene mayed alle knyghtes alle bedasshed herbys moss floures best maner fresshest ryghte came oute woode syre mellyagraunce eyghte score men wel harnysed shold fyghte batail reeste quene knyghtes abyde maulgre theyr hedes shold abyde traytoure knyghte sayd quene gueneuer cast thou doo wolte thow shame thy self bethynke thou arte kynges sone knyghte table roud thou aboute dishonoure noble kynge made knyghte thow shamest alle knyghthode thy selfe lete wete shalte thow neuer shame leuer cutte myn owne throte tweyne rather thou sholdest dishonoure alle langage sayd sir mellyagraunce may wete yow wel madame haue loued yow many yere neuer coude gete yow suche auauntage doo therfor wylle take yow fynde yow thenne spake alle ten noble knyghtes att one sayd syr mellyagraunce wete thow wel ye ar aboute ieoparde worshyp dishonour also ye sast ieoparde oure person ben vnarmed ye haue v grete auayle hit semeth yow ye haue layd watche vpon v rather ye shold putte quene shame v alle leef departe oure lyues yf wayes dyd shamed euer thenne sayd sir mellyagraunce dresse yow wel ye kepe quene pthenne ten knyghtes table round drewe swerdes lete renne speres ten knyghtes manly abode smote awey speres spere dyd none harme thenne lasshed gyder swerdes anone syre kay sir sagramor sir agrauayn sir dodynas sir ladynas syr ozanna smyten erthe grymly woundes thenne sir brandyles sir persaunt ironsyde syre pelleas foughte longe sore wounded ten knyghtes euer layd ground slewe xl men boldest best soo whan quene sawe knyghtes thus dolefully wounded nedes must slayne last thenne pyte sorowe cryed syr mellyagraunce slee noble knyghtes wille go vpon couenaunt thou saue hem suffer hem hurte ledde wyth someuer thow ledest wylle rather slee self wylle goo onles thyse noble knyghtes maye presence madame said mellyagrauce sake shalle ledde yow myn owne castel ye wylle ruled ryde p thenne quene prayd four knyghtes leue fyghtynge wold departe madame sayd sir pelleas wille doo ye doo take force lyfe deth frensshe book sayth sir pelleas gaf suche buffet none armour myghte holde hym pcapitulum tercium thenne quenes commaundement lefte batail dressid wounded knyghtes horsbak syttyng somme ouerthwarte horse hit pyte beholde thenne sir mellyagraunce charged quene al knyghtes none al felaushyp shold departe ful sore dradde sir launcelot du lake lest shold haue ony knoulechynge alle aspyed quene pryuely called vnto child chamber swyftly horsed whome sayd go thow whan thou seest thy tyme rynge vnto sir launcelot du lake praye hym loueth wylle see rescowe yf euer wille haue ioye spare thy hors said quene nouther water neyther lond soo chyld aspyed tyme lyghtely took hors spore departed fast myghte whan sir mellyagraunce sawe hym soo flee vnderstood hit quenes commaundement warne sir launcelot thenne best horsed chaced hym shot hym hem alle child wente sodenly thenne syre mellyagraunce sayd quene madame ye aboute bitraye shalle ordeyne sir launcelot shall come lyghtely yow thenne rode alle castel alle haste myghte waye sire mellyagraunce layd enbusshement best archer myghte gete coutrey nombre thyrtty awayte vpon sir launcelot chargyng yf sawe suche manere knyghte come way vpon whyte hors ony wyse slee hors manere wyse haue adoo hym bodyly ouer hard ouercomen soo done comen castel wyse quene wold neuer lete none ten knyghtes ladyes oute syghte alwayes presence book sayth sir mellyagraunce durste make maystryes drede sir launcelot soo moche demed warnynge soo whan child departed felauship syr mellyagraunce within whyle came westmynstre anone fonde sir launcelot whanne told message delyuerd hym quenes rynge allas sayd syr launcelot shamed euer onles maye rescowe noble lady dishonour thenne egerly asked armour euer child told syr launcelot ten knyghtes foughte merueyllously sir pelleas sire ironsyde sir brandyles sir persaunt inde fought strongly namely sir pelleas myghte none withsta de hym fouyte tyll last layd erthe thenne quene made apoyntement saue lyues goo syr mellyagraunce allas sayd syr launcelot moost noble lady shold destroyed leuer said sir launcelot alle fraunce ben wel armed soo whan syre launcelot armed vpon hors prayd chyld quenes chamber warne syr lauayne sodenly departed cause praye hym loueth wylle hyhe hym stynte vntyll come castel sir mellyagraunce abydeth dwelleth sayd sire launcelot shalle man lyuynge re owe quene ten knyytes whiche traitoursly hath taken shalle preue vpon hede alle hold hym p capitulum iiij thenne sir launcelot rode fast myghte book saith took water westmynstre brydge made hors swymme ouer temse vnto lambehythe thene within whyle came place ten noble knyghtes foughte syre mellyagraunce thanne sir launcelot folowed trak vntyl came wood strayte waye xxx archer bad sir launcelot torne ageyne folowe noo lenger trak commaundement haue ye ther sayd sir launcelot cause knyghte round tuble leue ryghte way way shalte thou loue outher el thow shalt goo thy foote wete thou wel thy hors shalle slayne lytel maystry sayd syre launcelot slee myn hors self whan hors slayne gyue ryght nought yow ye fyue honderd moo thenne shot sir launcelots hors smote hym many arowes thenne syr launcelot auoyded hors wente foote soo many dyches hedge betwixe hym myghte medle none hem p allas shame said launcelot euer one knyght shold bitraye another knyght hit old sawe good man neuer daunger whan daunger coward thenne sir launcelot wente whyle thenne fowle combred armour sheld spere alle longed vnto hym wete ye wel ful sore annoyed ful leue ony thynge longed vnto hym drad sore treason sir mellyagrauce thenne fortune came hym charyot cam thyder fetche wood say carter said syr launcelot shal gyue suffre lepe thy charyot thou brynge vnto castel within two myle thou shalt come within charyot said carter sente fetche wood lord sir mellyagraunce hym wold speke thou shalt go said carter thene sir launcelot lept hym gaf hym suche buffet felle erthe starke dede thenne carter felawe ferde wende haue gone way thenne cryed fair lord saue lyf shal brynge ye wil thene charge sayd syr launcelot thow dryue thys charyot euen vnto sir melliagaunce yate lepe vp charyot sayd carter ye shalle anone soo carter drofe grete wallop sir launcelots hors folowed charyot xl arowes brode rough hym houre half dame gueneuer awaytynge bay wyndowe ladyes aspyed armed knyghte standynge charyot see madame sayd lady rydeth charyot goodly armed knyghte suppose rydeth vnto hangyng sayd quene thenne aspyed shelde hym self sir launcelot du lake thenne ware came hors euer charyot euer trade guttes paunche vnder foot allas sayd quene see well preue wel hym hath trusty frend pha moost noble knyghte sayd queue gueneuer see wel thow arte hard bestad whan thow rydest charyot thenne rebuked lady lykend sir launcelot ryde charyot hangynge hit fowle mouthed sayd quene euylle lykened soo lyken moost noble knyght world vnto suche shameful dethe ihesu defende hym kepe hym said quene alle mescheuous ende thys sir launcelot comen gate castel descended doune cryed alle castel range arte thow fals traitour sir melliagraunce knyght table round come forth thou traytour knyyte thou thy felauship sir launcelot du lake shal fyghte yow bare gate wyde open vpon porter smote hym vnder yere gauntelet neck brast sonder pcapitulum v whanne sir mellyagrauce herd sir launcelot ranne vnto quene gueneuer felle vpon knee sayd mercy madame put holy grace eyleth yow sayd quene gueneuer sothe myghte wel e somme good knyyt wold reuenge though lord arthur wyste youre werke madame said sir mellyagraunce alle amys parte shalle amended ryghte self wille deuyse holy putte grace wold ye dyd sayd quene wold said mellyagraunce ye wold take alle owne handes ye wille rule lord sir launcelot suche chere maye made hym poure castel ye shalle haue vntyl morne thenne may ye alle retorne vnto wesimynster body haue shal putte rule ye saye wel sayd quene hetter pee euer werre lesse noyse worship thenne quene ladyes wente doune vnto knyghte syr launcelot stood wrothe oute mesure inner courte abyde bataille euer thou traytour knyghte come forth thenne quene came hym sayde syre launcelot ye soo mo ued ha madame sayd sire launcelot aske ye question semeth said sir launcelot ye ouyte wrothe ye haue hurte dishonour wete ye wel madame hurte lytel kyllynge mare sone despyte greueth moch alle hurte truly sayd quene ye saye trouth hertely thanke yow sayd quene ye muste come peasyble al thynge put hand alle euylle shalle best knyghte ful sore repenteth hym mysauenture befallen hym madame saide sire launcelot syth soo ye ben accorded hym may ageyn sir mellyagraunce hath done ful shamefully cowardly pa madame said sir launcelot wyst ye wold haue ben soo soone accorded hym wold haue made suche haste vnto yow saye ye soo sayd quene doo ye forthynke self good dedes wete well sayd quene accorded neuer vnto hym fauour loue vnto hym laye doune euery shameful noyse pmadame said syr launcelot ye vnderstande ful well neuer willynge gladde shameful sklaunder noyse neyther kynge quene ne knyght bereth lyf excepte lord kynge arthur yow madame shold lette shold make sir mellyagraunce herte ful cold euer departed hen wote wel said quene wille ye ye shall haue alle thynge rulyd ye lyst haue madame said syr launcelot soo ye pleasyde care parte ye shal soone please ryghte quene took syr launcelot bare hand put gauntelet soo wente hym tyl chamber thenne commaunded hym vnarmed thenne syr launcelot asked ten knyghtes wounded fore shewed vnto sir launcelot ther made grete ioye comynge hym sir launcelot made grete dole hurtes bewayled gretely sir launcelot told cowardly traytourly mellyagraunce fette archer slee hors fayne putte hym self charyot thus complayned eueryche ful fayn wold haue ben reuengid peaced self cause quene thenne frenssh book sayth syr launcelot called many day le cheualer du charyot dyd many dedes grete aduentures soo leue tale le cheualer du charyot torne tale psoo syr launcelot grete chere quene thenne syr launcelot made promys quene nyghte sir launcelot shold come wyndowe outward toward gardyn wyndowe bareyd yron sir launcelot promysed mete alle folkes slepe thenne came syr lauayne dryuynge gate cryeng lord syr launcelot du lake thenne sente sir lauayne sawe sir launcelot sayd lord fond well ye hard bestad haue fonde hors slayne arowes sayd syr launcelot praye yow syr lauayne sprke ye mater lete ye passe shalle ryghte hit another tyme beste may pcapitulum vj thenne knyghtes hurte serched softe salues leyd woundes soo hyt past tyl souper tyme alle chere myght made done vnto quene knyytes thenne whan season wente vnto chambres wyse quene wold suffre wounded knyytes fro layde within draughtes chamber vpon beddes pylowes self myght see wanted thynge soo whan sir launcelot chamber assygned vnto hym called vnto hym sire lauayne told hym nyght must goo speke lady dame gueneuer sir said syr lauayne lete goo yow hit please yow drede sore treason sir mellyagraunce nay sayd sir launcelot thanke yow wille haue body thenne sir launcelot took suerd hand pryuely went place aspyed ladder fore hand took vnder arme bare thurgh gardyn sette vp wyndowe anone quene redy mete hym thenne made eyther complayntes many dyuerse thynges thenne sir launcelot wysshed myghte haue comen wete ye wel said quene wold fayne ye ye myghte come wold ye madame said syre launcelot youre herte yow ye truly said quene shalle proue myght said syr launcelot loue thenne set handes vpon barres yron pulled suche myghte brast hem clene oute stone walles one barres yron kytte braune handes thurgh bone thenne lepte chamber quene make ye noyse sayd quene wounded knyghtes lye fast passe vpon tale syr launcelot wente vnto bed quene took force hurte hand took plesauce lykynge vntyll daunynge daye wete ye well slepte watched whan sawe tyme myghte tary lenger took leue departed wyndowe putte hit gyder wel myghte ageyne soo departed vnto owne chamber told sir lauayne hurte thenne sir lauayn dressid hand staunched putte vpon gloue shold aspyed soo quene lay long bedde vntyl nyne clok thene sir mellyagraunce wente quenes chamber fond ladyes redy clothed ihesu mercy sayd sir mellyagraunce eyleth madame ye slepe thus longe ryght alle opened curteyn beholde thenne ware laye alle shete pylowe bebled blood sir launcelot hurte hand whan sir mellyagraunce aspyed blood thenne demed fals kynge wounded knyghtes layne alle nyghte madame said sir mellyagraunce haue founden fals traytresse vnto lord arthur proue wel nought ye layd wounded knyghtes within bandes chamber therfore wille calle yow treason lord kynge arthur haue proued yow madame shameful dede ben fals somme wylle make good wounded knyghte nyght hath layne yow fals sayd quene wyl reporte vnto alle thenne whanne ten knyghtes herd sir mellyagraunce wordes spak al one voys sayd sire mellyagraunce thou sayst falsly wrongfully puttest vpon v suche dede wil make good ony v chese whiche thou lyst v whan hole oure woundes ye shal said syr mellyagraunce away proud langage ye may alle see sayd sir mellyagraunce quene nyghte wounded knyghte hath layne thenne al ashamed whan sawe blood wete wel syr mellyagraunce passynge glad quene suche auauntage demed hyde treson soo ramoure came syr launcelot fond al grete araye pcapitulum septimum araye sayd sir launcelot thenne syr mellyagraunce told hem fonde shewed hem quenes bed truly said syr launcelot ye dyd part knyytly touche quenes bedde whyle drawen lyeng therin dar say lord arthur hym self wold haue displayed courteyns beyng within bed onles pleasyd hym haue layne doune therfor ye haue done vnworshipfully shamefully selfe wote ye mene sayd syr mellyagraunce well sure ther hath one wounded knyytes layne nyyte therfor wil proue handes traytresse vnto lord arthur beware ye said launcelot ye say ye preue wil taken handes lord sir launcelot said sire mellyagraunce rede yow beware ye thouy ye neuer good knyght ye wote wel ye ar renomed best knyyt world yet shold ye aduysed batail wrong quarel god wil haue streke euery batail sayd syr launcelot god drad saye nay playnly nyyte lay none ten wounded knyytes wyth lady quene gueneuer wil preue handes ye say vntruly hold said sir mellyagraunce gloue traytresse vnto lord kyng arthur nyghte one wounded knyytes lay receyue gloue sayd sir launcelot sealyd sygnettys delyuerd vnto x knyytes day shal batail gyders said sir launcelot day viij dayes said sir mellyagraunce felde besyde westmynstre agreed said sir launcelot said sir mellyagraunce sythen must fyyte gyders pray yow ye noble knyyt awayte treason none vylony meane whyle none yow soo god help said sir launcelot ye shal ryyte wel wete neuer suche condycyons reporte al knyytes euer haue knowen ferd neuer treason loued neuer felauship man ferde treson thenne lete v go dyner seid melliagrauce dyner ye ye quene ye may ryde alle westmester wylle wel sayd sir lau celot thenne sir mellyagraunce sayd sir launcelot pleaseth yow see estures castel good wylle sayd sir launcelot thenne wente gyders chamber chamber sir launcelot drad noo peryls euer man worshyp prowesse dredeth lest alwayes peril wene euery man ben euer fareth treason putteth ofte man grete daunger befel vpon sir launcelot peryl dredde wente sire mellyagraunce trade trap bord rollyd sir launcelot felle doune ten fadom caue ful strawe thenne sir mellyagraunce departed made fare nyst whan sir lau celot thus myssed merueylled bycomen thenne quene many demed departed wonte doo sodenly syr mellyagraunce made sodenly putte awaye syde sir lauayns hors myght alle vnderstande sir launcelot departed sodenly soo past tyl dyner thenne sir lauayne wold stynte vntyl ordeyned lyttyers wounded knyghtes myghte lad quene al bothe ladyes gentilwymmen wente vnto westmynster knyytes told kyng arthur hou mellyagrauce appelyd quene hyghe treason sir launcelot receyued gloue hym daye eyghte dayes shall doo batail fore yow hede sayd kynge arthur aferd syre mellyagraunce hath taken vpon hym grete charge syr launcelot sayd kynge sir sayd alle wote deme ryden somme aduentures oftymes wonte doo hath syr lauayns hors lete hym saide kyng wylle founden yf trapped somme treason pcapitulum octauum soo leue syr launcelot lyenge within caue grete payne euery day ther came lady brouyt hym mete drynke wowed hym haue layne hym euer noble knyghte syre launcelot sayd nay sir launcelot sayd ye ar wyse ye maye neuer oute pryson yf ye haue helpe also lady quene gueneuer shalle brente deffaulte le ye daye bataille god defende sayd syr launcesot shold brente deffaute yf hyt soo said sir launcelot maye hit shalle wel vnderstande bothe kynge quene wyth alle men worshyp dede seke outher pryson alle men knowe wille saye somme euyl caas day wel wote somme good knyghte outher blood loueth wylle take quorel hand therfor said sir launcelot wete ye wel ye shalle fere yf wymmen alle land ye wil haue adoo yow thenne arte thow shamed sayd lady destroyed euer worldes shame ihesu defende dystresse welcome euer hit god sendeth soo came hym day batail shold sayd sir launcelot thynketh ye hard herted woldest thow kysse one shold delyuer thyn armour best hors within sir mellyagraunces stable kysse yow said sir launcelot maye doo lese worshyp wete ye wel vnderstood ony disworship kysse yow wold doo hit thenne kyssed thenne gat hym broughte hym armour whan armed broughte hym stable stood xij good courser bad hym chese best thenne syr launcelot loked vpon whyte courser whiche lyked hym best anone commaunded kepers faste sadle hym best sadel werre soo done badde thenne gatte spere hand suerd syde commaunded lady vnto god sayd lady good dede shal doo yow seruyse yf euer hit power pcapitulum nonum leue sir launcelot wa op alle myghte speke quene gueneuer broughte fyre brent sire mellyagraunce sure hym thoughte sir launcelot shold att bataille therfore euer cryed vpon kynge arthur doo hym iustyce outher el brynge forth syr launcelot du lake thenne kynge al courte ful sore abasshed shamed quene shold brente defaute sir launcelot lord arthur sayd sir lauayne ye maye vnderstande wel lord syr launcelot lyue soo seke outher pryson wete ye wel wold ben neuer herd ye euer failed part whome shold doo batail therfor sayd sir lauayne lord kynge arthur byseche yow gyue lycence doo batail day lord maister saue lady quene gramercy gentil sir lauayne sayd kyng arthur dar say alle sir mellyagraunce putteth vpon lady quene wronge haue spoken al ten wounded knyghtes one hole able doo bataille wold preue vpon sir mellyagraunce body fals putteth vpon quene soo shal sayd sir lauayne defence lord syr launcelot ye wylle gyue eue gyue yow loue sayd kynge arthur doo best dar wel say treason done sir launcelot thenne sir lauayne armed horsed sodenly lystes ende rode performe bataille ryghte herowdes shold crye be le aler ryghte soo came sir launcelot dryuynge alle force hors thenne arthur cryed ho abyde thenne sir launcelot called horsbak tofore kynge arthur told openly fore kynge alle sire mellyagraunce serued hym fyrste last whanne kynge quene al lordes knewe treason sir mellyagraunce alle ashamed behalfe thenne quene gueneuer sente sette kynge grete truste champyon thenne el say syr launcelot sire mellyagraunce dressid vnto bataille took speres soo came gyders thonder sir launcelot bare hym doune quyte ouer hors croupe thenne sire launcelot alyghte dressid sheld sholder uerd hand sir mellyagraunce wyse dressid hym vnto hym smote many grete stroke gyders laste sire launcelot smote hym suche buffet vpon helmet felle one syde er thenne cryed vpon hym alowde moost noble knyghte sir launcelot du lake saue lyf yelde vnto yow requyre yow ye knyghte felawe table round slee yelde ouer comen whether shalle lyue dye put kynges handes thenne sir launcelot wyste doo leuer good world myghte haue ben reuenged vpon syr mellyagraunce sir launcelot loked vp quene gueneuer yf myghte aspye ony sygne countenaunce wold haue done thenne quene wagged hede vpon sir launcelot though wold saye slee hym ful wel knewe sir launcelot waggynge hede wold haue hym dede thenne sir launcelot bad hym ryse shame performe bataille vtteraunce nay said sir mellyagraunce wylle neuer aryse vntyll ye take yolden recreaunt shalle profer yow large profers sayd sir launcelot say shall vnarme hede lyfte quarter body alle may vnarmed lete bynde lyfte hand behynde soo shalle helpe ryghte shall doo bataille yow thenne sir mellyagraunce starte vp vpon legges sayd hyghe lord arthur take hede profer wille take hit lete hym dysarmed bounden accordynge profer saye ye sayd kyng arthur vnto syre launcelot wille ye abyde youre profer ye lord sayd syr launcelot wille neuer goo fro haue one sayd thenne knyghtes parters felde disarmed sir launcelot first hede sythen lyfte arme lyfte syde bond lyft arme behynd bak without sheld ony thyng thenne put gyders wete wel many lady knyyt merueylled sir laucelot wold ieopardy hym self suche wyse thenne syre mellyagraunce came suerd hygh sire launcelot shewed openly bare hede bare lyfte syde whan wende haue smyten hym vpon bare hede thenne lyghtly auoyded lyfte legge lyfte syde put ryght hand suerd stroke soo putte syde grete sleyghte thenne grete force syr launcelot smote hym helmet suche bu et stroke kerued hede two partyes thenne doo drawen oute felde grete instaunce knyghtes table round kynge su red hym entered mencyon made vpon hym slewe hym cause slayne thenne kyng quene made syr launcelot du lake cherysshed euer afore hand pcapitulum x thenne frenssh booke maketh mencyon good knyghte land hongre name syr vrre aduenturous knyghte al place myghte ony dedes worshyp ther wold soo happend spayne erles sone name alphegus grete turnement spayn syre vrre knyghte hongry sir alphegus spayne encountred gyders veray enuy soo eyther vndertook vtteraunce fortune sire vrre slewe syr alphegus erles sone spayn knyghte slayne yeuen syre vrre euer slayne seuen grete woundes thre hede four body vpon lyfte hand syr alphegus moder whiche grete sorceresse despyte sone dethe wrought subtyl craftes syr vrre shold neuer hole euer woundes shold one tyme feyster another tyme blede shold neuer hole vntyl best knyghte world serched woundes thus made auaunt thurgh knowen syre vrre shold neuer hole thenne moder lete make hors lytter put hym theryn vnder two palfroyes thenne took syr vrres syster hym ful fayr damoysel who name felelolye thenne took page hym kepe horse soo ledde sir vrre thurgh many countreyes frensshe book sayth ledde hym seuen yere thurgh alle landes crystened neuer coude fynde knyghte myghte ease sone soo came scotland
