bandes england fortune came nyghe feeste pentecoste vntyl arthur courte tyme holden carleil whan came thenne made openly knowen come land hele sone pthenne kynge arthur lete calle lady asked cause broughte hurte knyghte land moost noble kynge sayd lady wete yow wel broughte hym hydder heled woundes alle seuen yere myghte hole thenne told kynge wounded whome moder discouerd pryde wroughte enchauntement soo shold neuer hole vntyl best knyghte world serched woundes soo haue passed thurgh alle landes crystned haue hym heled excepte land yf fayle hele hym land wylle neuer take payne vpon pyte good knyghte grete noblenes name sayd arthur good gracyous lord sayde name syr vrre mounte good tyme sayd kynge sythe ye come land ye ryght wel come wete yow wel shal sone helyd euer ony crysten man may hele hym gyue alle men worshyp courage self wille assay handle sone soo shalle alle kynges duke erles ben presente tyme therto wylle commaunde wel wote shalle obeye doo commaundement wete yow wel sayd kynge arthur vnto vrres syster shalle begynne handle hym serche vnto rower presumyng vpon soo worthy hele youre sone dedes wille courage men worshyp doo wylle doo thenne kynge commaunded alle kynges duke erles alle noble knyytes round table tyme presente come medowe carleil tyme honderd ten roud table xl knyghtes tyme awey soo muste begynne kynge arthur kyndely begynne hym moost man worshyp crystned tyme pcapitulum xj thenne kynge arthur loked vpon sire vrre kynge thoughte ful lykely man whanne hole thenne kynge arthur made hym take doune lytter layd hym vpon erthe layd cusshyn fo gold shold knele vpon thenne noble arthur sayd fayr knyghte repenteth thy hurte courage alle noble knyghtes wille praye softly suffre handle woundes moost noble crystned kynge sayd vrre doo ye lyste mercy god commaundement pso thenne arthur softely handelyd hym thenne somme woundes renewed vpon bledynge thenne kynge claryaunce northumberland serched wold thenne sir baraunt le apres called kyng honderd knyghtes assayed fayled dyd kynge vryence land gore soo dyd kynge anguyssaunce irland soo dyd kynge nentres garboth dyd kyng carados scotland soo dyd duke galahalt haute prynce soo dyd constantyn sir carados sone cornewail soo dyd duke challyns claraunce soo dyd erle vlbause soo dyd erle lambaile soo dyd erle arystause thenne came syr gawayne thre sone sir gyngalyn syr florence sir louel two begoten vpon sir dyd erle lambayle soo dyd erle arystause pthenne came syre gawayne thre sone syr gangalayne syr florence syr louel two goten vp syr brandyles syster al fayled thenne cam syr agrauayne syr gaherys syr mordred good knyyt sir gareth veray knyghthode worth al bretheren soo came knyghtes launcelots kynne syr launcelot tyme courte tyme vp aduentures thenne syr lyonel syr ector de mary syr bors de ganys syr blamor de ganys syr bleoberis de ganys syr gahalantyne syr galyhodyn syr menadeuke syr vyllyars valyaunt syr hebe le renoumes al syr launcelots kynne alle fayled pthenne came syr sagramore le desyrus syr dodynas le saueage syr dynadan syr bruyn le noyre syr kap named la cote male tayle syr kay seneschal syr kay de strau ge syr melyot de logrys syr petypase wynchelsee syre galleron galway syr melyon montayne syr cardok syr vwayne le aduoultres syr ozanna le cure hardy thenne came syr astamor syr gromere grummors sone syr crosselme sir seruause le breuse callyd passynge stronge knyghte book sayth chyef lady lake feested syr launcelot syr seruause le breuse whan feested hem bothe sondry tymes prayd hem gyue bone graunted thenne prayd syr seruause wold promyse neuer doo batail ageynst syr launcelot du lake wyse prayd syr launcelot neuer doo batail ageynst syr seruause soo eyther promysed frensshe book sayth sir seruause neuer courage lust doo batail ageynst man yf ageynst gyaunts ageynste dragon wylde beestes soo passe vnto att kynges request made hem alle hyy feest knyytes table round serche sir turre entente kynge dyd hit wete whiche noblest knyghte amonge pthenne came sir aglouale sire durnore sir tor bygoten vpon aryes couherdes wyf begoten afore aryes wedded kynge pellenor begatte hem fyrst syre tor syre aglouale syr durnore syre lamorak moost noblest knyghte one euer arthur dayes worldly knyghte syre percyual pyerles excepte syre galahad holy dedes dyed quest sancgreal thenne cam syr gryflet le fyse de dieu sir lucan botteler syre bedeue broder syr brandyles syr constantyne syr cadores sone cornewayl kynge arthur dayes syre clegys syre sadok syr dynas le seneschal cornewaile syre fergus syr drya n syr lambegus syre clarrus cleremont syr cloddrus syre hectymere syre edward canaruan syre dynas syre pryamus crystned syr tristram noble knyghte thre bretheren syr hellayne de blank sone syre bors begat hym vpon kyng brandegorys doughter syre bryan de lystynoyse syre gautere syr reynold syr gyllemere thre bretheren syre launcelot wanne vpon brydge syre kayes armes sir guyart le petyte syre bellangere le beuse sone good knyghte syr alysander le orphelyn slayne treason kynge marke palso traytour kyng slewe noble knyghte syre trystram sat harpyng fore lady la beale isoud trenchaunt glayue who deth moche bewaylynge euery knyghte euer arthur dayes neuer none bewailed syre tristram syr lamorak traytoursly slayne syr trystram kynge marke syr lamorak syr gawayne bretheren syre bellangere reuenged deth fader alysander syr tristram slewe kynge marke la brale isoud dyed swounyng vp crosse syr tristram wherof grete pyte alle kyng marke consentynge deth syr tristram slayne syre andred many thenne came syr hebe syr morganore syr sentrayle syre suppynabylis sire bellangere le orgulous good knyghte syr lamorak wonne playne batail syr nerouens syr plenorius two good knyytes syr launcelot wan sir darras sir harre le fyse lake sir ermynyde broder kyng hermaunce whome syre palomydes foughte att reed cyte two bretheren syr selyses dolorous toure sir edward orkeney syre ironsyde called noble knyyte reed laundes syre gareth wanne loue dame lyones syr arrok de greuaunt syr degrane saunce velany foughte gyaunt black lowe syr epynogrys kynges sone northuberland sir pelleas loued lady ettard dyed loue ben one ladyes lake name dame nymue wedded sire pelleas saued hym neuer slayne ful noble knyghte sire lamyel cardyf grete louer sir playne de fors sire mellcaus de lyle sir bobart le cure hardy kynge arthur sone sir mador de la porte sir colgreuaunce sir heruyse de la forest saueage sir marrok good knyghte bitrayed wyf made hym seuen yere werwolf sir persaunt sire pertilope broder called grene knyght sir perymones broder bothe called reed knyght sir gareth wanne whan called beaumayns alle honderd knyghtes ten serched syr vrres woundes commaundement kynge arthur pcapitulum xij mercy ihesu sayd kynge arthur syr launcelot du lake tyme thus stood spak many thynges wa aspyed syr launcelot came rydyng toward told kynge pee sayd kynge lete er thynge sayd vntyl come v soo whan syr launcelot aspyed kyng arthur descended hors came kynge salewed hym anone mayde syre vrres syster sawe syr launcelot ranne broder lay lyttar sayd broder come knyghte herte gyueth gretely vnto fayr syster sayd syr vrre soo dothe herte lyghte ageynst hym certaynly hope heled hert yeueth vnto hym tha al yt haue serched thenne sayd arthur vnto syr launcelot ye muste doo haue done told syr launcelot hadde done shewed hym alle serched hym ihesu defende sayd syr launcelot whan soo many kynges knyghtes haue assayed fayled shold presume vpon encheue alle ye lordes myghte encheue ye shalle chese sayd kynge arthur commaunde yow doo alle haue done renoumed lord said sir launcelot ye knowe wel dar may disobeye commaundement myghte durste wete yow wel wold take vpon touche wounded knyghte entente shold passe alle knyghtes ihesu defende shame ye take wrong sayd kynge arthur ye shal presumpcyon bere v felaushyp soo moche ye felawe table round wete yow wel sayd kynge arthur ye preuayle hele hym dare say knyghte thys land may hele hym therfor pray yow doo haue done thenne alle kynges knyghtes moost party prayd sir launcelot serche hym thenne wounded knyghte syr vrre sette hym vp weykely praid sir launcelot hertely sayeng curtois knyghte requyre goddes sake hele woundes thynketh euer sythen ye came woundes greuen fayre lord sayd syr launcelot ihesu wold myghte helpe yow shame sore shold thus rebuked neuer able worthynes doo hyghe thynge thenne sire launcelot kneled doune wounded knyghte sayenge lord arthur must doo commaundement whiche sore ageynst herte thenne helde vp handes loked eest sayenge secretely vnto hym self thow blessid fader sone holy ghoost byseche thy mercy symple worshyp honeste saued thou blessid trynyte thow mayst yeue power hele seke knyghte thy grete vertu grace good lord neuer self thenne sir launcelot prayd sir vrre lete hym see hys hede thenne deuoutely knelyng ransaked thre wou de bled lytyl forth alle woundes fayre heled semed ben hole seuen yere lyke wyse serched body thre woundes heled lyke wyse thenne last alle serched whiche hand anone heled fayre pthenne kyng arthur alle kynges knyghtes kneled doune gaf thankynges louynges vnto god blessid moder euer syre launcelot wepte ben child ben beten thenne kynge arthur lete araye preestes clerkes moost deuoutest manere brynge sir vrre within carleil syngynge louynge god done kyng lete clothe hym rychest maner coude thoughte thenne fewe better made knyghtes alle courte passyngly wel made bygly arthur asked syr vrre felte hym self good lord sayd felt self neuer soo lusty wylle ye iuste doo dedes armes sayd kyng arthur sir sayd vrre longed vnto iustes wold soone redy pcapitulum xiij thenne arthur made party honderd knyghtes ageynste honderd knyghtes soo vpon morne iusted dyamond iusted none daungerous knyghtes soo shorten thys tale syr vrre sir lauayn iusted best day none hem ouerthrewe pulled doun thyrtty knyghtes thenne assente alle kynges lordes syre vrre sir lauayn made knyghtes table round sir lauayn caste loue vnto dame felelolle sire vrres syster thene wedded gyder grete ioye kyng arthur gaf eueryche hem barony landes sire vrre wold neuer goo sire launcelot sir lauayn awayted euermore vpon hym courte acounted good knyghtes full desyrous armes many noble dedes dyd wold haue reste euer soughte aduentures thus lyued courte wyth grete noblesse ioye long tyme euery nyghte day sire agrauayne syr gawayns broder awayted quene gueneuer sir launcelot du lake putte rebuke shame soo leue tale ouer hyp grete bookes sir launcelot du lake grete aduentures dyd whan called le cheualer du charyot frensshe booke sayth cause despyte knyytes ladyes called hym knyghte rode charyot lyke iuged galhous therfor despyte named hym soo caryed charyot twelue moneth lityl slayne sir mellyagraunce quenes quarel neuer twelue moneth came horsbak frensshe book sayth dyd twelue moneth xl batails cause haue lost mater la cheualer du charyot departe tale sir launcelot goo vnto morte kynge arthur caused syre agrauayne pexplicit liber xix pand foloweth moost pytous history morte kynge arthur whiche xx book pcapitulum primum may whan euery lusty herte floryssheth burgeneth season lusty beholde comfortable soo man woman reioycen gladen somer comynge hys fresshe floures wynter rouy wyndes blastes causeth lusty man woman coure sytte fast fyre season monethe may byfelle grete angre vnhap ynted til floure chyualry alle world destroyed slayn alle long vpon two vnhappy knyghtes whiche named agrauayne sire mordred bretheren vnto sir gawayne sir agrauayne sir mordred euer preuy hate vnto quene dame gueneuer syr launcelot dayly nyghtly euer watched vpon sir launcelot soo myshapped syr gawayne alle bretheren kynge arthur chamber thenne sir agrauayne sayd thus openly counceylle many knyghtes myghte merueylle alle ashamed bothe see knowe sire launcelot lyeth dayly nyghtly quene al knowe shamefully suffred v alle alle shold suffre soo noble kyng kynge arthur soo shamed pthenne spak sir gawayne sayd broder sir agrauayn pray yow charge yow meue suche mater afore wete ye wel sayd syr gawayne wylle counceylle soo god help sayd sir gaherys sir gareth wylle knowynge broder agrauayne dedes thenne wylle sayd syre mordred leue well sayd syre gawayne euer vnto alle vnhappynes broder syr mordred wille ye graunte wold ye lefte alle made soo besy knowe sayd syr gawayne wylle falle hit falle hit falle may sayd syr agrauayne wille disclose kyng counceylle sayd syr gawayne rys warre wrake betwyx syr launcelot v wete wel broder many kynges grete lordes hold wit syr launcelot also broder sir agrauayne sayd sire gawayne ye must remembre oftymes syr launcelot hath rescowed kynge quene best v ben ful cold herte rote sir launcelot ben better hath preued hym self ful ofte parte sayd sir gawayne wylle neuer ageynst sir launcelot one dayes dede whan rescowed kynge carados dolorous toure slewe hym saued lyf also broder sir agrauayne sir mordred lyke wyse sir launcelot rescowed yow bothe thre score two sir turquyn thynketh broder suche kynde dedes kyndenes shold remembryd doo ye lyst sayd syr agrauayne wylle layne lenger pwith wordes came kynge arthur broder stynte noyse sayd syre gawayne wylle sayd syr agrauayne sir mordred wylle ye soo sayd sir gawayne thenne god spede yow wil tale ne counceyll wyll sayd sir gareth sir gaherys wyl neuer saye euylle man cause sayd syre gareth syr launcelot made knyghte manere owe say ylle hym al thre departed makynge grete dole allas sayd syr gawayn sir gareth realme holy mescheued noble felaushyp round table shalle disparplyd soo departed pcapitulum ij thenne sir arthur asked hem noyse made lord sayd agrauayye shal telle yow may kepe noo lenger broder syre mordred brake vnto broder syr gawayne syr gaherys syre gareth knowe alle syr launcelot holdeth quene hath done longe syster sone may suffre lenger alle wote ye shold aboue syr launcelot ye kynge made hym knyghte therfor wille preue hit traytoure persone yf hit soo sayd syr arthur e yow wel none wold bothe begynne suche thynge myght haue preues vpon hit sir launcelot hardy knyghte alle ye knowe best knyghte among v alle yf taken dede wylle fyghte hym bryngeth vp noyse knowe knyyt able matche hym therfore sothe ye saye wold taken dede frensshe book sayth kynge ful bothe therto ony noyse shold vpon syr launcelot quene kynge demynge wold hit syr launcelot done soo moche hym quene soo many tymes wete ye wel kynge loued hym passyngly wel lord sayd syre agrauayne ye shal ryde morne huntynge doubte ye syr launcelot wille goo yow thenne whan draweth toward nyghte ye may sende quene word ye wil lye oute alle nyghte soo may ye sende coke thenne vpon payne deth shalle take hym nyght quene outher shal brynge hym yow dede quyck wille wel sayd kynge thenne counceylle yow sayd kynge take yow sure felaushyp syre sayd agrauayne broder sir mordred wil take v twelue knyghtes round table beware sayd kyng arthur warne yow ye shalle fynde hym wyghte lete v dele sayd sir agrauayne sir mordred soo morn kynge arthur rode huntynge sente word quene wold oute alle nyghte thenne sir agrauayne sire mordred gate twelue knyghtes dyd self chamber castel carleyl name syr colgreuaunce syr mador de la porte syre gyngalyne syr melyot de logrys syre petypase wynchelsee syr galleron galway syr melyon montayne sir astamore syre gromore somyr ioure syr curselayne syr florence syr louel twelue knyghtes sir mordred sir agrauayne al scotland outher syr gawayns kynne outher wel willers bretheren soo whan nyghte came sir launcelot told syre bors wold goo nyghte speke quene sir sayd syr bors ye shal go nyghte couce l sayd sir launcelot sir sayd sir bors drede euer sir agrauayn way eth yow dayly yow shame v al neuer gaf herte ageynst goynge euer ye wente quene soo moche mystrust kynge oute nyghte quene cause perauentur hath layne somme watche yow quene therfor drede sore treason haue ye drede sayd syr launcelot shalle goo come ageyne make noo taryenge sir said sir bors repenteth drede sore goynge oute thys nyghte shalle wrathe v alle fair neuewe sayd sire launcelot merueylle moche ye saye thus sythen quene hath sente wete ye wel wille soo moche coward shalle vnderstande wille see good grace god spede yow wel sayd sir bors send yow sound sauf ageyne pcapitulum iij soo sir launcelot departed took swerd vnder arme soo mantel noble knyghte putte hym self grete ieopardy soo past tyl came quenes chamber thenne sir launcelot lyytely putte chamber thenne frensshe book sayth quene launcelot gyders whether bedde maner disportes lyst herof make mencyon loue tyme adayes p thus gyder came sir agrauayne syre mordred twelue knyytes round table sayd cryenge voys traytour knyghte syr launcelot du lake arte thou taken thus cryed loude voys alle courte myghte hit xiiij armed al poyntes shold fyghte bataille allas sayd quene gueneuer mescheued bothe madame sayd sir launcelot ony armour within chambre myght couer poure body al yf ony gyue hit shalle soone stynte malyce grace god truly sayd quene haue none armour sheld swerd spere wherfore drede sore longe loue come myscheuous ende theire noyse ben many noble knyghtes wel ote ben surely armed ageynste ye may make resystence wherfore ye lykely slayne thenne shalle brente ye myghte escape said quene wold doubte ye wold rescowe daunger euer stoode allas sayd syr launcelot alle lyf thus neuer bestadde shold thus shamefully slayne lack myn armour euer one sir agrauayne sir mordred cryed traytour knyghte come oute quenes chamber wete thow wel thou arte soo besette thow shalte escape ihesu mercy sayd sir launcelot shameful crye noyse may suffre better deth one thus endure payne thenne took quene armes kyste sayd moost noble crysten quene byseche yow ye haue ben euer specyal good lady al tymes true poure knyghte vnto power neuer fayled yow ryghte wrong sythen fyrst day kynge arthur made knyghte ye wylle praye soule yf slayne wel assured sir bors myn neuewe remenaunt kynne syr lauayne syr vrre wylle fayle yow rescowe yow fyre therfor myn owne lady recomforte self someuer come ye go sire bors neuew sir vrre wylle doo yow alle pleasyr may ye shall lyue lyke quene vpon landes nay launcelot sayd quene wete thow wel wyll neuer lyue thy dayes thou slayne wyl take deth mekely ihesus crystus sake euer dyd ony crysten quene wel madame sayd lau celot sythe hit soo day come oure loue muste departe wete yow wel shall selle lyf dere maye thousand fold sayd syr launcelot heuyer yow self leuer lord al crystendome sure armour vpon men myghte speke dedes euer slayne truly sayd quene wold myghte please god wold take slee suffer yow escape shal neuer sayd sir launcelot god defende suche shame ihesu thou sheld myn armour pcapitulum iiij syr launcelot wrapped mantel aboute arme wel surely thenne geten grete fourme oute halle rasshed dore fair lordes sayd syre launcelot leue noyse rassyng shalle sette open dore thenne may ye doo lyketh yow come thenne sayd alle hit hit auayleth stryue ageynst v alle therfor lete v chamber shalle saue thy lyf vntyl thow come kyng arthur thenne launcelot vnbarred dore lyfte hand held open lytel one man myghte come one soo came strydyng good knyghte moche man large name colgreuaunce gore swerd strake syr launcelot myytely put asyde stroke gaf hym suche buffett vpon helmet felle grouelynge dede within chamber dore thenne syre launcelot grete myghte drewe dede knyght within chamber dore syr launcelot helpe quene ladyes lyghtely armed syr colgr uaunce armour euer stode sir agrauayn sir mordred cryenge traytoure knyghte come oute quenes chamber leue noyse sayd syr launcelot vnto sir grauayne wete yow wel sir agrauayne ye shall prysone nyghte therfor ye doo counceylle goo ye alle chamber dore make suche cryeng suche maner sklaunder ye doo promyse knyghthode ye wil departe make noyse shal morne appiere afore yow alle kyng thenne lete sene whiche yow outher el ye wille accuse treason shal ansuer yow knyghte shold hydder cam quene maner male engyne wyl preue make hit good vpon yow handes fy traytour sayd sir agrauayn sir mordred wylle haue maulgre thy hede slee yf lyste lete wete haue choyse kynge arthur saue slee sir sayd sir launcelot none grace thenne kepe self soo thenne sir launcelot set al open chamber dore myghtely knyghtely strode amongest anone fyrst buffet slewe sir agrauayne twelue felawes within lytel whyle layd hem cold erthe none twelue myghte stande sir launcelo one buffet palso syr launcelot wounded syr mordred fledde alle myghte thenne syre launcelot retorned ageyne vnto quene yd madame wete yow wel oure true loue brought ende wille kynge arthur euer foo therfore madame lyke yow maye haue wyth shalle saue yow alle manere aduentures daungerous best sayd quene semeth ye haue done soo moche harme wylle best ye hold yow stylle yf ye see morne wylle put vnto dethe thenne may ye rescowe ye thynke best wyll wel sayd sir launcelot haue ye doubte whyle lyuynge shalle rescowe yow thenne kyste eyther gaf rynge soo lefte quene went vntyl lodgynge pcapitulum quintum whan syre bors sawe syr launcelot neuer soo gladde home comynge thenne ihesu mercy sayd syr launcelot ye armed meaneth sir sayd sir bors ye departed v alle ben youre blood youre wel wyllers soo dretched somme v lepte oute oure beddes naked dremes caughte naked swerdes handes therfor said sir bors deme grete stryf hand thene demed ye betrapped som treason therfor made v thus redy nede euer ye fayre neuewe sayd sir launcelot vnto sir bors shal ye wete al nyyt harder bestad wan euer lyf yet escaped told hem alle maner ye haue herd fore therfore felawes said sir launcelot pray yow ye wylle good herte nede someuer stande warre come v alle sir sayd sir bors alle welcome god sendeth v haue moche wele yow moche worshyp therfor wille take wo yow haue taken wele therfore sayd alle many good knyghtes loke ye take discomforte ny bandys knyghtes vnder heuen shalle able greue moche maye v therfor discomforte self maner shalle gadre gyders loue loueth v ye wil haue done shalle done therfor syr launcelot sayd wil take woo wele graunt mercy sayd sir launcelot good comforte grete distresse fayr neuewe ye comforte gretely moche beholdyng vnto yow thys fayre neuewe wold ye dyd al haste ye may forth dayes ye wille loke lodgynge ben lodged nyghe aboute kynge wyll hold whyche wylle wolde knowe whiche frendes fro foe sir said syr bors shalle doo payne seuen clok shalle wete suche ye haue sayd wil holde yow pthenne sire bors called vnto hym sire lyonel syr ector de mary sir blamor de ganys sir bleoberys de ganys syre gahalantyne syr galyhodyn sir galyhud sir menadeuke sir vyllyers valyaunt sir hebe le renoumes sir lauayne syr vrre hongry sir nerouneus sire plenorius pthese two knyghtes sire launcelot made one wanne vpon brydge therfor wold neuer ageynst hym harre le fyse du lake syre selyses dolorous toure sir melyas de lyle sire bellangere lebeuse syr alysanders sone le orphelyn cause hys moder alys la beale pelleryn kynne vnto sir launcelot held hym p soo came syre palomydes sir safyr broder hold syr launcelot syre clegys sadok syr dynas syr claryus cleremont two twenty knyghtes drewe hem gyders thenne armed horsbak promysed sir launcelot doo wold pthenne felle northwalys cornewaile sir lamoraks sake sire tristram sake nombre four score knyghtes pmy lordes sayd syre launcelot wete yow wel haue ben euer syns came countrey wel wylled vnto lord kynge arthur vnto lady quene gueneuer vnto power nyghte cause lady quene sente speke suppose made treason hit dare largely excuse persone withstandynge ther fore cast nere slayne ihesu prouyded escaped alle theyir malyce treason pand thenne noble knyght sire launcelot told hem al hard bestad quenes chamber manere escaped therfore sayd sir launcelot wete yow wel fayre lordes sure ther ny werce vnto myn cause haue slayn nyghte knyghtes wote wel sire agrauayne syr gawayns broder leste twelue felawes cause sure mortal warre knyghtes sente ordeyned kynge arthur bitraye therfore kynge wylle hete malyce iuge quene fyre maye suffre shold brente sake may herd sufferd soo taken wyll fyghte quene true lady vnto lord kynge hete drede wylle take oughte taken pcapitulum vj lord syre launcelot sayd sir bors myn aduys ye shalle take wo wele take hit pacyence e god hit pand sythen hit fallen hit counceylle yow kepe youre self ye wylle self ther felaushyp knyghtes crystened shalle wrong also wyll counceyll yow lord syr launcelot lady quene gueneuer distresse soo moche payne sake ye knyghtly rescowe ye dyd wayes al world wylle speke yow shame worldes ende moche ye taken whether ye dyd ryghte wrong parte holde quene slayne put mescheuous dethe soo dye shame shalle ihesu defende shame sayd syre launcelot kepe saue lady quene vylony shameful deth neuer destroyed defaute wherfore fayre lordes kynne frendes sayd sir launcelot wylle ye doo thenne sayd wille doo ye wylle doo putte yow sayd sir launcelot yf lord arthur euyll counceyll wyll morn hete putte lady quene fyre brente praye yow counceylle best doo thenne sayd alle one one voys syre v thynketh best ye knyghtly rescowe quene soo moche shal brente youre sake suppose ye myghte handelyd ye shold haue dethe shamefuller dethe syre say al ye haue many tymes rescowed dethe men quarels v semeth youre worshyp ye rescowe quene perylle soo moche hath sake pthenne sir launcelot stood styl sayd fayre lordes wete yow wel wold lothe doo thynge shold dishonoure yow blood wete yow wel wold lothe lady quene shold dye shameful dethe hit soo ye wylle counceylle rescowe muste doo moche harme rescowe peraduenture shal destroye somme best frendes shold moche repente peraduenture somme coude wel brynge aboute disobeye lord kynge arthu wold soone come whiche loth hurte yf yt rescowe shal kepe shal leste care v alle sayd sir bors dyd noble knyghte sire tristram good wylle kepte wyth hym la beale isoud nere thre yere ioyous gard done elthers deuyse place owne lyke wyse may ye doo ye yst take quene lyghtely away yf soo kynge wylle iuge brente ioyous gard ye may kepe longe ynough vntyl hete kynge past thenne shalle ye brynge ageyne quene kynge grete worshyp thenne peraduenture ye shalle haue thanke bryngynge home loue thanke shalle haue maugre hard doo sayd sir launcelot sir tristram maye haue warnynge whanne meanes treatyce syr tristram brought ageyne la beale isoud vnto kynge mark ioyous gard loke felle ende shamefully fals traitour kyng marke slewe hym sat harpynge afore lady la beale isoud groundyn glayue threst hym behynde herte hit greueth said sir launcelot speke dethe alle world may fynde suche knyghte alle thys trouthe sayd syre bors one thynge shalle courage yow v alle ye knowe wel kynge arthur kyng marke neuer lyke condycyons neuer yet man coude preue kynge arthur vntrewe promyse soo make short tale alle consented better outher worse yf soo quene morne broughte fyre shortly al wold rescowe soo aduyse syr launcelot putte hem enbusshement woode nyghe carleil myght abode stylle wete kynge wold pcapitulum vij torne ageyne vnto syre mordred whan escaped noble knyghte sire launcelot anone gat hors mounted vpon hym rode vnto kynge arthur sore wounded smyten alle forbled told kynge alle hit alle slayne sauf hym self al ihesu mercy maye said kynge toke ye hym quenes chamber ye soo god helpe sayd sir mordred fonde hym vnarmed slewe colgreuaunce armed hym armour alle told kynge begynnynge endynge pihesu mercy sayd kynge merueyllous knyghte prowesse allas sore repenteth sayd kynge euer syr launcelot shold ageynst sure noble felaushyp round table broken euer hym wille many noble knyghte holde fallen soo sayd kyng may worshyp quene must suffer dethe soo thenne made grete ordynaunce hete quene must iuged deth lawe suche tho dayes someuer estate degree yf fonde gylty treson shold none remedy dethe outher men takynge dede shold causer hasty iugement ryghte soo ordeyned quene gueneuer cause sir mordred escaped sore wounded dethe thyrtten knyghtes round table preues experyences caused kyng arthur commaunde quene fyre brente thenne spake sir gawayn sayd lord arthur wold counceylle yow ouer hasty ye wold putte respyte iugement lady quene many cause p one though sir launcelot fonde quenes chamber yet myghte soo came thyder none euylle ye knowe lord said syr gawayne quene moche beholden vnto syr launcelot vnto ony knyghte oftymes hath saued lyf done batail whan al courte refused quene parauenture sente hym goodenes none euyl rewarde hym good dedes done tymes past peraduenture lady quene sente hym entente syr launcelot shold come good grace pryuely secretely wenynge hit best eschewyng dredyng sklaunder oftymes doo many thynges wene best yet peraduenture hit torneth werst dare say sayd syre gawayne lady quene yow bothe good true sir launcelot sayd sir gawayne dare saye wylle make hit good vpon ony knyghte lyuyng wylle putte vpon hym self vylony shame lyke wyse wylle make good lady dame gueneuer byleue wel said kyng arthur wil way sir launcelot trusteth soo moche vpon handes myghte doubteth man therfore quene shalle neuer fyghte shall haue lawe yf maye gete sir launcelot wete well shal haue shameful dethe ihesu defende sayd sir gawayn may neuer see saye ye soo sayd kynge arthur soth ye haue cause loue sir launcelot nyghte last past slewe broder sir agrauayne ful good knyghte al moost slayne broder sir mordred also slewe thyrtten noble knyghtes also sir gawayne remembre ye slewe two sone sire florence sir louel lord sayd sir gawayne alle thys haue knouleche who dethes repente sore moche gaf hem warnynge told bretheren sone afore hand wold falle ende soo moche wold doo counceyll wyl medle therof reuenge thynge dethes told hem bote stryue wyth sir launcelot sory deth bretheren sone causers theyre owne dethe oftymes warned broder sir agrauayne told hym peryls ben fallen pcapitulum viij thenne sayd noble kynge arthur syre gawayne dere neuewe pray yow make yow redy best armoure youre bretheren syre gaherys syre gareth brynge quene fyre haue iugement receyue dethe p nay moost noble lord sayd sir gawayne wylle neuer doo wete yow wel wylle neuer place soo noble quene lady dame gueneuer shalle take shameful ende wete yow wel sayd sire gawayne herte wylle neuer serue see dye shalle neuer sayd euer youre counceylle dethe thenne sayd kyng syr gawayne suffer broder syr gaherys syr gareth lord sayd sire gawayne wete yow wel wille bothe present cause many aduentures whiche ben lyke falle yonge ful vnable saye yow nay thenne spak sire gaherys good knyghte sire gareth vnto syre arthur syre ye may wel commaunde v wete yow wel shalle sore ageynst oure wylle youre strayte commaundement ye shall playnly hold v excused wyl peasyble wyse bere none barneis warre vpon v name god sayd kynge thenne make redy shalle soone haue iugement anone allas sayd syr gawayne euer shold endure see woful daye soo sir gawayne torned hym wepte hertely wente chamber thene quene led forth withoute carleil despoylled smok soo thenne ghoostly fader broughte shryuen mysdedes thenne wepynge waylynge wryngynge handes many lordes ladyes fewe comparyson wold bere ony armour strengthe dethe quene thenne ther one sire launcelot sente vnto place aspye tyme quene shold goo vnto dethe anone sawe quene despoylled smok soo shryuen thenne gaf sir launcelot warnynge thenne sporynge pluckynge vp horse ryghte cam fyre stood ageynste slayne myghte none withstande sir launcelot bare armes withstoode hem slayne ful many noble knyghte slayne sir bellyas le lous sir segwarydes sir gry let sir brandyles syre agloual syr tor syr gauter sire gyllymor syr reynolds iij bretheren syr dama syr pryamus syr kay straunger sir dryaunt sir lambegus syr hermynde syr pertylope syre perymones two bretheren called grene knyght reed knyghte soo rassynge hurlyng syre launcelot thrange myhapped hym slee gaherys syr gareth noble knyghte vnarmed vnware frensshe booke sayth syr launcelot smote syr gareth syr gaherys vpon brayne pannes thorou slayne felde hit veray trouthe syr launcelot sawe hem soo fonde dede amonge thyckest prees pthenne whan syr launcelot thus done slayne putte flyghte alle wold withstande hym thenne rode streyghte vnto dame gueneuer maade kyrtyl gowne cast vpon thenne made sette behynde hym prayd good chere wete yow wel quene gladde escaped dethe thenne thanked god sir launcelot soo rode way quene frensshe book saith vnto ioyous gard kepte noble knyghte shold doo many grete lordes somme kynges sent syr launcelot many good knyghtes many noble knyghtes drewe vnto sir launcelot pwhan knowen openly kyng arthur sire launcelot debate many knyghtes gladde debate many ful heuy debate pcapitulum ix soo torne ageyne vnto kynge arthur whan told hym maner wyse quene taken awey fyre whan herd deth noble knyghtes especyal syr gaheris sir gareths deth thenne kyng swouned pure sorou whan awoke swoun thenne sayd pallas euer bare croun vpon hede haue loste fayrest felaushyp noble knyghtes euer helde crysten kynge gyders allas good knyghtes ben slayne aweye within two dayes haue lost xl knyytes also noble felaushyp syr laucelot blood may neuer hold hem gyders worshyp allas euer werre beganne fayr felawes sayd kynge charge yow man telle sir gawayn dethe two bretheren sure sayd kyng whan sir gawayne hereth telle sir gareth dede wyll goo nyghe oute mynde mercy ihesu said kyng slewe syre gareth sire gaherys dar saye syre gareth loued sir launcelot aboue al men erthely trouthe sayd knyghtes slayne hurtlyng sir launcelot thrange thyck prees vnarmed smote hem wyst whome smote soo vnhappyly slayne dethe sayd arthur wyll cause grettest mortal werre euer sure wyste sir gawayne syr gareth slayne shold neuer haue reste hym tyl destroyed syr launcelots kynne hym self outher el destroye therfor sayd kynge wete yow well herte neuer soo heuy moche soryer good knyghtes losse losse fayre quene quenes myghte haue ynowe suche felaushyp good knyghtes shalle neuer gyders company dare say sayd kyng arthur neuer crysten kynge helde suche felaushyp gyders allas euer syr launcelot shold debate agrauayn agrauayn sayd kyng ihesu forgyue thy sowle thyn euyl wyl thou thy broder syre mordred haddest vnto syr launcelot hath caused al sorowe euer amonge complayntes kyng wepte swouned pthenne ther came one vnto syr gawayne told hym quene ladde awaye syr launcelot nygh xxiiij knyghtes slayne ihesu defende bretheren sayd sir gawayne ful wel wyst syr launcelot wold rescowe outher el wold dye felde saye trouth ben man worshyp rescowed quene day moche shold haue ben brente sake sayd sir gawayne hath done knyytly wold haue done self stand lyke caas ar bretheren sayd sir gawayne merueyll hem truly sayd man sir gareth syr gaherys slayne ihesu defende sayd sir gawayne alle world wold slayne especyal good broder sir gareth syr sayd man slayne grete pyte slewe hym sayd sir gawayn sir sayd man launcelot slewe hem bothe may byleue sayd syr gawayne euer slewe broder syre gareth dar say broder gareth loued hym better alle bretheren kynge bothe also dare say sir launcelot desyred broder syr gareth hym wolde haue ben hym ageynst kynge v al therfore may neuer byleue syr launcelot slewe broder sir sayd man noysed slewe hym pcapitulum x allas sayd sire gawayne ioye gone thenne felle doune swouned long lay ben dede thenne whanne roos swoune cryed oute sorowfully sayd allas ryyte soo syr gawayne ranne kynge cryenge wepynge kynge arthur myne vnkel good broder syr gareth slayne soo broder syr gaherys whiche ij noble knyghtes thenne kynge wepte bothe felle swounynge whan reuyued ne spak sir gawayne syr wyl go see broder syr gareth ye may see hym sayd kynge caused hym entered syr gaherys bothe wel vnderstood ye wold make ouer moche sorowe syghte sir gareth shold haue caused double sorowe allas lord sayd syr gawayne slewe broder sir gareth myn good lord praye yow telle truly sayd kyng shal telle yow told syre launcelot slewe hym sir gaheris bothe allas sayd sire gawayne bare none armes ayenst hym neyther hem ote said kynge sayd sire launcelot slewe bothe thyckest prees knewe therfor lete v shape remedy reuenge dethes kynge lord myn vnkel sayd sire gawayne wete yow wel shal make yow promyse shalle holde knyghthode day shalle neuer fayle sir launcelot vntyl one v haue slayne therfore requyre yow lord kynge dresse yow werre wete yow wel reuenged vpon sire launcelot therfor ye wylle haue seruyse loue haste yow therto assaye frendes promyse vnto god said sir gawayne dethe broder sir gareth shalle seke syr launcelot thorou oute seuen kynges realmes shalle slee hym el shalle slee ye shall nede seke hym soo ferre sayd kynge saye sir launcelot abyde yow ioyous gard moche peple draweth vnto hym saye may byleue sayd sir gawayne lord sayd assaye frendes wyll assaye myn shalle done sayd kynge suppose shal byg ynouy drawe hym oute byggest toure castel thenne kynge sente letter wryttes thorou oute alle englond bothe lengthe brede assomone alle knyghtes soo vnto arthur drewe many knyghtes duke erles soo grete hoost whan assemblyd kyng enformed hem syr launcelot berafte hym quene thenne kynge hoost made hem redy laye syege aboute sir launcelot laye within ioyous gard therof herd sir launcelot purueyed hym many good knyghtes hym helde many knyghtes owne sake somme quenes sake thus bothe partyes wel furnysshed garnysshed alle maner thyng longed werre kyng arthur hoost soo bygge syr launcelot wold abyde hym felde ful bothe doo batail ageynst kyng syre launcelot drewe hym strong castel al maner vytail many noble men myghte suffyse within towne castel thenne came kynge arthur sire gawayne hughe hoost layd syege al aboute ioyous gard towne castel made stronge werre bothe partyes wyse syre launcelot wold ryde oute go castel long tyme neyther wold none good knyghtes yssue oute neyther none towne castel vntyl xv wekes past pcapitulum xj thenne befel vpon daye heruest tyme syr launcelot loked ouer walles spak hyghe vnto kynge arthur sir gawayne lordes bothe wete ye wel al vayne ye make syege wynne ye worshyp maulgre dishonoure lyste come self oute good knyghtes shold ful soone make ende werre come forthe sayd arthur vnto launcelot thou darst promyse shalle mete myddes felde god defende sayd sir launcelot euer shold encountre moost noble kyng made knyghte fy vpon thy fayre langage sayd kynge wete yow wel trust thy mortal fo euer wylle deth daye thou hast slayne good knyghtes ful noble men blood shal neuer recouer ageyne palso thow hast layne quene holden many wynters sythen lyke traytour taken force moost noble lord kyng sayd sir launcelot ye may say ye ye wote wel youreself wil stryue ye say slayn good knyghtes wote wel haue done soo sore repenteth enforced doo batail hem sauyng lyf el muste haue suffred hem haue slayne lady quene gueneuer except persone hyhenes lord sire gawayne noo knyghte vnder heuen dar make good vpon euer traytour vnto youre persone hit please yow saye haue holden lady youre quene yeres wynters vnto shal euer make large ansuer preue hit vpon ony knyghte bereth lyf excepte youre person sire gawayne lady quene gueneuer true lady vnto persone ony lyuyng vnto lord wylle make good handes hath lyked good grace haue chyerte cherysshe ony knyghte vnto power ageyne haue deserued loue oftymes lord ye haue consented shold brente destroyed hete thenne fortuned doo batail departed aduersary confessid vntrouthe ful worshypfully excused suche tymes lord arthur sayd sir launcelot ye loued thanked whan saued quene fyre thenne ye promysed euer good lord thynketh ye rewarde ful ylle good seruyse good lord semeth lost grete parte worshyp knyghthode suffred lady youre quene haue ben brente soo moche shold haue ben brente sake sythen haue done batails quene quarels myn owne semeth ryght doo batail ryghte quarel therfor good gracyous lord sayd syr launcelot take quene vnto good grace bothe fayr true good fy fals recreaunt knyght sayd sire gawayne lete wete lord myn vnkel kynge arthur shalle haue quene maulgre thy vysage slee yow bothe whether please hym may wel sayd sire launcelot wete ye wel lord sire gawayne lyst come oute castel ye shold wynne quene harder euer ye wanne stronge bataille fy thy proude wordes seyd sir gawayne lady quene wil neuer saye shame thow fals recreaunt knyghte saide syre gawayne cause haddest thow slee good broder syr gareth loued al kynne allas thow madest hym knyght thyn owne handes slewe thow hym loued soo wel excuse sayde sir launcelot helpeth ihesu feyth owe hygh ordre knyythode shold good wylle haue slayne neuewe sir bors de ganys ye tyme allas euer vnhappy sayd laucelot ye sone syr gareth sir gaherys thow lyest recreaunt knyght sayd sir gawayne thow slewest hym despyte therfore wete thou wel shalle make warre alle whyle may lyue repenteth said sir launcelot wel vnderstande helpeth seke none accordement whyle ye syr gawayne ar soo mescheuously sette yf ye wold doubte haue good grace lord arthur byleue wel fals recreaunt knyght sayd sir gawayne thow hast many longe dayes ouer ladde v alle destroyed many oure good knyghtes ye saye pleaseth yow sayd syr launcelot yet may neuer sayd openly preued euer cast treason slewe good knyghte lord syre gawayne ye haue done soo dyd neuer defense dryuen therto sauynge lyf pa fals knyghte sayd syre gawayne thow menest syre lamorak wete thow wel slewe hym ye slewe hym youre self sayd sir launcelot hit ben ouer moche hand yow haue slayne hym one best knyghtes crystned age grete pyte dethe pcapitulum xij wel wel sayd sayd sir gawayne launcelot sythen thou enbraydest sire lamorak wete thow well shalle neuer leue tyl haue suche auaille thou shalte escape handes truste yow wel ynough sayd syr launcelot ye may gete gete lytel mercy frensshe book saith noble kyng arthur wold haue taken quene ageyne haue ben accorded syr launcelot syr gawayne wold suffer hym maner meane thenne syre gawayne made many men blowe vpon syr launcelot one called hym fals recreaunt knyght thenne syr bors de ganys syr ector de mary sir lyonel herd oute crye called syre palomydes sir safyrs broder sir lauayne many moo blood alle went vnto sir launcelot sayd thus lord sir launcelot wete ye wel haue grete scorne grete rebuke herd gawayn saye yow wherfor pray charge ye wille haue oure seruyse kepe v noo lenger within walles wete yow wel playnly wille ryde feld doo bataille hem ye fare man aferd alle fayr speche wil auayle yow wete yow wel sire gawayne wille suffer accorded kynge arthur therfore fyghte youre lyf ryghte ye dar allas sayd syre launcelot ryde oute castel doo batail ful lothe thenne syre launcelot spak hyghe vnto syr arthur syre gawayne lordes requyre biseche sythen thus requyred coniured ryde felde neyder lord kynge arthur syre gawayne come felde shal doo thenne sayd syr gawayne kynges quarel fyghte quarel fyghte syr laucelot cause deth broder syre gareth thenne muste nedes vnto bataill said syr launcelot wete wel lord arthur syre gawayne ye wil repente someuer doo bataylle soo thenne departed eyther thenne eyther party made hem redy morne doo batail grete purueaunce made bothe sydes syr gawayne lete purueye many knyghtes wayte vpon sir launcelot ouersette hym slee hym morne vndorne syre arthur redy felde thre grete hoostes thenne syr launcelots felaushyp came oute thre gate ful good araye syre lyonel came formest batail syr launcelot came myddel syre bors came oute thyrd gate thus came ordre rule ful noble knyghtes alwayes syr launcelot charged knyghtes ony wyse saue kynge arthur syr gawayne pcapitulum xiij thenne came forth sir gawayne kynges host came proferd iuste sir lyonel fyers knyghte lyghtely encoutred syr gawayne sir gawayne smote syr lyonel thurgh oute body dasshed erthe lyke ben dede thenne syr ector de mary bare hym castel thenne beganne grete stoure moche peple slayne euer syr launcelot dyd myghte saue peple kynge arthur party syr palomydes syr bors syr safyr ouerthrowe many knyghtes dedely knyghtes syre blamor de ganys syr bleoberys de ganys sir bellangere le bewse syxe knyghtes dyd moche harme euer kynge arthur nyghe aboute syr launcelot haue slayn hym syr launcelot suffred hym wold stryke ageyne soo syr bors encountred kynge arthur spere syr bors smote hym doun soo alyghte drewe swerd sayd syr launcelot shalle make ende werre mente haue slayn kynge arthur soo hardy sayd syr launcelot vpon payn thy hede thou touche hym wille neuer see noble kynge made knyghte neyther slayn ne shamed al syr laucelot alyght hors tooke vp kynge horsed hym ageyn sayd thus lord arthur goddes loue stynte stryf ye gete worshyp wold doo myn vtterauce alweyes forbere yow ye none forbereth lord remembre haue done many place euylle rewarded thenne whan kyng arthur horsbak loked vpon syr launcelot thene teres brast eyen thynkyng grete curtosy syr laucelot ony man therwith kynge rode wey myghte lenger beholde hym sayd allas euer werre began thene eyther partyes batails withdrewe repose buryed dede wouded men leid softe salues thus endured nyyt tyll morne morne vndorne made hem redy doo bataille thenne syr bors ledde forward p soo vpon morne came syre gawayne brym ony bore grete spere hand whan sir bors sawe hym thoughte reuenge broder syre lyonel despyte syr gawayn dyd hym daye pand knewe eyther feutryd speres alle theire myghtes horse hem self mette gyder soo felonsly eyther bare thorowe soo felle erthe thenne batails ioyned moche slaughter bothe partyes thenne sir launcelot rescowed syr bors sente hym castel neyder syr gawayne syr bors dyed woundes alle holpen thenne syr lauayne sir vrre prayd syr launcelot doo payne fyyte done see ye forbere spare doth moche harme therfor praye yow spare youre enemyes noo done yow allas sayd sire launcelot haue herte fyghte ageynst lord arthur euer semeth doo oughte doo lord sayd sir palomydes though ye spare alle day neuer conne yow thank yf may gete yow auayle ye dede pso thenne syr launcelot vnderstood sayd hym trouth thenne strayned hym self dyd afore hand cause neuewe sir bors sore wounded thenne within lytel whyle euensong tyme sire launcelot party better stode horse wente blood past fytloks soo moche people slayne thenne pyte syr launcelot withhelde knyghtes suffred kynge arthur party withdrawe syde thenne sir launcelots party withdrewe hem castel eyther partyes buryed dede putte salf vnto wounded men soo whan syre gawayne hurte kyng arthur party soo orgulous fore hand bataill erre noysed thorou al crystendome last noysed afore pope consyderyng grete godenes kynge arthur sir laucelot called moost noblest knyghtes world wherfore pope called vnto hym noble clerke att tyme presente frensshe book sayth hit bisshop rochestre pope gaf hym bulles vnder lede vnto kynge arthur englond chargynge hym vpon payne enterdytynge al englond take quene dame gueneuer vnto hym ageyne accorde syr launcelot pcapitulum xiiij soo whan bisshop come carleyl shewed kynge bulles whan kyng vnderstood bulles nyst doo ful fayne wold haue ben accorded sir launcelot sir gawayne wold suffre hym haue quene ther agreed wyse syre gawayne wold suffer kyng accorde syr launcelot quene consented thenne bisshop kynge grete seal assuraunce true ennoynted kynge syre launcelot shold come sauf goo sauf quene shold spoken vnto kynge none thynge done afore tyme past alle appoyntementes bisshop broughte hym sure assuraunce wrytynge shewe sir launcelot whan bisshop come ioyous gard shewed sir launcelot pope wryten arthur vnto hym told hym peryls yf withhelde quene kyng neuer thoughte saide laucelot withholde quene lord arthur soo moche shold haue ben dede sake semeth parte saue lyf putte daunger tyl better recouer myghte come thanke god sayd sir launcelot pope hath made pee god knoweth sayd syr launcelot wylle thousand fold gladder brynge ageyne euer takyng away maye sure come sauf goo sauf quene shal haue lyberte neuer thynge hath ben surmysed afore tyme neuer fro day stande peryll el sayd sir launcelot dare auenture kepe harder shoure euer kepte shal nede yow sayd bisshop drede soo moche wete yow wel pope muste obeyed pope worshyp poure honeste wete yow distressyd neyther quene neyther perylle shamed thenne shewed sir launcelot alle wrytynge bothe pope kynge arthur sure ynough sayd sir launcelot ful well dare trust lordes owne wrytynge seale neuer shamed promesse ptherfore sayd sir launcelot vnto bisshop ye shall ryde vnto kynge afore recommaunde vnto good grace lete hym haue knowlechynge daye eyghte dayes grace god self shall brynge lady quene gueneuer vnto hym thenne saye ye vnto redoubted kyng say largely quene shalle none excepte drede fere kyng hym self lord sire gawayn kynges loue hym self soo bisshop departed came kynge carleyl told hym alle sir lau celot ansuerd hym thenne teres brast oute kynges eyen thenne sire launcelot purueyed hym honderd knyghtes alle clothed grene velowet theyr horse trapped heles euery knyghte helde braunche olyue hande tokenyng pee quene four twenty gentylwymmen folowyng wyse sir launcelot twelue courser folowynge hym euery courser sat yonge gentylman alle arayed grene veluet sarpys gold quarter hors trapped wyse doune helys many ouches sette stone perlys gold nombre thowsand sir launcelot clothed whyte clothe gold tyssew ryght soo ye haue herd frensshe book maketh mencyon rode quene ioyous gard carleyl syr launcelot rode thorou oute carleyl soo castel alle men myyt beholde wete wel ther many wepynge eyen thenne syr launcelot hym self alyghte auoyded hors toke quene soo led kynge arthur seate syre gawayn sat afore hym many grete lordes soo whan syre launcelot sawe kynge syr gawayne thenne lad quene arme thenne kneled doune quene bothe pwete yow wel thenne many bold knyghte ther kynge arthur wepte tendyrly though sene alle kynne afore soo kynge sat stylle sayd word whan syre launcelot sawe cou tenaunce arose pulled vp quene hym thus spak ful knyghtely p capitulum xiiij moost redoubted kynge ye shalle vnderstande pope commaundement haue brouyt yow lady quene ryghte requyreth yf ony knyghte someuer degree excepte persone wylle saye dar say true clene yow self syr launcelot du lake wylle make good vpon body true lady vnto yow lyars ye haue lystned hath caused debate betwixt yow tyme hath ben lord arthur ye haue ben gretely plesyd whan dyd batail lady youre quene ful wel ye knowe moost noble kynge hath ben put grete wrong tyme sythen pleasyd yow many tymes shold fyghte semeth good lord cause rescowe fyre soo moche shold haue ben brente sake told yow tho tale lyers soo felle vpon lykelyhode myght god ben myghte neuer haue endured fourten knyghtes armed afore purposed vnarmed purposed sente vnto lady quene wote cause soone within chamber dore anon syre agrauayn syr mordred called traytour recreaunt knyghte called ryght sayd syr gawayn pmy lord syre gawayn said syre launcelot quarel preued hem self ryght wel wel syr launcelot sayd kyng haue gyuen cause thou hast done haue worshypped thyn ony alle knyghtes good lord sayd sire launcelot soo ye displeasyd ye shalle vnderstande myn haue done yow ofte better seruyse ony knyghtes haue done many dyuerse place ye haue ben ful hard bestadde dyuerse tymes haue self rescowed yow many daungers euer vnto power glad please yow lord syr gawayne bothe iustes turnementes batails sette bothe horsbak foote haue often rescowed yow lord syr gawayne many moo knyytes many dyuerse place wil make auaunt sayd sir launcelot wyl ye al wete yet fonde neuer maner knyghte ouer hard hym done vtteraunce tha ked god haue ben matched good knyghtes sir tristram syr lamorak euer faueour vnto demyng take god record sayd syr launcelot neuer wrothe gretely heuy good knyghte sawe hym besy aboute wynne worship glad euer fonde ony knyghte myghte endure horsbak foote hou sir carados dolorous toure ful noble knyyte passynge stronge man wote ye lorde syr gawayne myghte wel called noble knyghte whan byfyne force pulled youre sadel bonde ouer warte afore hym sadel bowe lorde syre gawayne rescowed yow slewe hym afore siyte also fonde broder syr turquyn lyke wyse ledyng sir gaherys youre broder bouden afore hym rescowed broder slewe turquyn delyuerd thre score foure lorde arthur knyghtes oute pryson dare say sayd sir launcelot mette neuer stronge knyghtes wel fyghtyng sir carados syr turquyn fought vnttermest therfor saide sir launcelot vnto syr gawayne semeth ye ought ryghte remembre myyt haue good wil wolde truste god haue lorde arthur goode grace pcapitulum xvj kynge maye doo wylle sayd sire gawayne wete thow wel syre launcelot thow shalle neuer ben accorded whyle lyue thou hast slayne thre bretheren two ye slewe traytourly pytously bare none harn ageynst none wold bere god wold ben armed sayd sire launcelot thenne ben lyue pand wete ye wel syre gawayne sire gareth loue none kynnesman moche dyd hym euer whyle lyue sayd sir launcelot wille bewaile sir gareths deth al grete fere haue yow many cause causen sorouful one made hym knyghte another wote wel loued aboue alle knyghtes thyrd passynge noble true curteys gentyl wel condycyoned fourth wyst wel anone herd sir gareth dede shold neuer haue loue euerlastynge werre betwixe v also wist well ye wold cause noble lorde arthur euer mortal foo ihesu help sayd syr launcelot slewe neuer sir gareth sir gaherys wylle allas euer vnarmed vnhappy daye thus moche shalle offre said sir launcelot yf hit may please kynges good grace yow lord sire gawayne shalle fyrst begynne sandwyche ther shal goo shert bare foot euery ten myles ende wylle founde garmake hows relygyon ordre ye wyl assygne hole couent synge rede day nyghte especyal syr gareths sake sir gaherys shal performe sand wyche vnto carleil euery hows shal haue suffycyent lyuelode shal performe whyle haue ony lyuelode crystendom ny none al relygyous place shal performed furnysshed garnysshed alle thynges holy place oughte promyse yow feythfully pand sir gawayne thynketh fayrer holyer better soules ye noble kyng yow sire gawayne warre vpon shall ye gete none auayle thenne alle knyghtes ladyes wepte madde teres felle kyng arthur chekes sire launcelot sayd sir gawayne haue ryghte wel herd thy speche thy grete profers wete thow wel lete kynge doo hit pleasyd hym neuer forgyue broders dethe especyal deth broder syre gareth yf myn vnkel kynge arthur wylle accorde shalle l se seruyse wete thow wel thow arte bothe fals kynge sir said launcelot bereth lyf may make good yf ye sir gawayne wylle charge soo hyghe thynge ye muste pardonne thenne nedes muste ansuere yow pnay sayd sir gawayne past tyme caused pope hath charged myn vnkel kyng shalle take quene ageyne accorde syr launcelot season therfor thow shalte goo sauf thow camest land thou shalte abyde past xv dayes suche somons gyue soo kyng consented accorded thow camest el sayd syre gawayne wete thow wel thou sholdest haue comen yf hit maulgre thy hede yf pope commaundement sayd syre gawayne shold bataille myn owne body ageynst thy body preue vpon thow hast ben bothe fals vnto myn vnkel kyng arthur bothe shalle preue vpon thy body whan thow arte departed hen someuer fynde pcapitulum xvij thenne syr launcelot syghed teres felle chekes thenne sayd thus allas moost noble crysten realme whome haue loued aboue al realmes haue geten grete parte worshyp shalle departe wyse truly repenteth euer came realme shold thus shamefully bannysshed vndeserued causeles fortune soo varyaunt whele soo meuable ny none constaunte abydynge may preued many old cronykles noble ector troylus alysander myghty conquerour many moo whan moost royalte alyghte lowest soo fareth sayd sir launcelot realme worshyp myn alle hole round table hath ben encrecyd worship myn blood ony therfor wete thow wel sire gawayne may lyue vpon landes wel ony knyghte yf ye moost redoubted kynge wylle come vpon landes syr gawayne werre vpon must endure yow wel maye yow sir gawayne yf ye come pray yow charge treason felony ye doo must ansuer yow doo thou thy best sayd sir gawayne therfore hyhe fast thow gone wete thou wel shalle soone come breke strengest castel thow hast vpon thy hede shalle nede sayd sir launcelot orgulous sette ye wete wel shold mete yow myddes felde make thow langage sayd syre gawayne delyuer quene pyke lyghtely oute courte wel sayd syr launcelot wyst shorte comynge wolde haue aduysed twyes comen hyder quene soo dere ye noyse durst haue kepte felaushyp best knyghtes vnder heuen thenne syr launcelot sayd vnto gueneuer heryng kynge hem madame muste departe noble felauship euer sythen soo byseche yow praye saye wel yf ye hard bestad ony fals tonges lyghtly lady sende word yf ony knyghtes handes may delyuer yow bataill shall delyuer yow sir launcelot kyst quene thenne sayd al openly lete see place dar saye quene true vnto lord arthur lete see speke dar speke ther broughte quene kyng thenne sir launcelot toke leue departed ther neyther kyng duke ne erle baron ne knyghte lady gentylwoman alle wepte peple oute mynde excepte sir gawayn whan noble sir launcelot took hors ryde oute carleyl sobbynge wepynge pure dole departynge soo took way vnto ioyous gard thenne euer called dolorous gard thus departed sir launcelot courte euer soo whan came ioyous gard called felaushyp vnto hym asked wold thene ansuerd holy gyders one voys wold wold doo fayre felawes sayd syr launcelot must departe oute moost noble realme shalle departe hit greueth sore shalle departe worshyp flemyd man departed neuer oute realme noo worshyp heuynes euer fere dayes men shalle cronykle vpon flemed oute land el fayre lordes ye sure dred shame lady quene gweneuer shold neuer haue departed thenne spak many noble knyghtes sir palomydes sir safyr broder sir bellangere le bewse sir vrre sir lauayne many sir ye disposed byde land wyll neuer fayle yow yf ye lyst abyde land ther ny none good knyytes ben fayle yow many cause one ben blood shalle neuer welcome courte sythen hit lyked v take parte yow youre distresse heuynesse realme wete yow wel shall lyke v wel goo countreyes yow take suche parte ye doo fayre lordes sayd sir launcelot wel vnderstande yow thanke yow ye shalle vnderstande suche lyuelode borne vnto shal departe yow maner wyse say shalle departe alle lyuelode alle landes frely amonge yow self wylle haue lytel ony haue suffycyaunt may longe person wylle aske none ryche araye truste god mayntene yow landes wel euer mayntened ony knyytes thenne spap knyghtes one haue shame wylle leue yow alle vnderstande realme wyll quyete euer stryf debate felauship round table broken noble felaushyp round table kynge arthur vp borne noble kynge alle realme quyete reste grete parte sayd cause noblesse pcapitulum xviij truly sayd sir launcelot thanke yow alle youre good sayenge wote wel alle stabylyte realme myght dyd deuoyr wel sure knewe many rebellyons dayes peased trowe alle shalle hem shorte space sore repenteth euer drede sayd syr launcelot syr mordred wille make trouble passyng enuyous applyeth hym trouble accorded go sir launcelot landes make shorte tale trussed payd alle wold aske hem holy honderd knyghtes departed sir laucelot one made auowes wold neuer leue hym wele wo shypped cardyf sayled vnto benwyk somme men calle bayen somme men calle beaume wyn beaume saye sothe syre launcelot neuewes lordis alle fraunce alle landes longed vnto fraunce kynred reioyced alle thurgh syr lau celots noble prowes thenne sir launcelot stuffed furnysshed garnysshed alle noble townes castels thenne alle peple tho landes came syr launcelot foote handes soo whan stabled alle countreyes shortly called parlement crouned syr lyonel kynge fraunce sire bors crouned hym kynge al kynge clandas landes sir ector de mary sir launcelot yongest broder crouned hym kynge benwyk kynge alle gyan sir launcelot owne land made sir ector prynce alle thus departed thenne sir launcelot auaunced alle noble knyghtes fyrste auaunced blood syr blamor made hym duke lymosyn gyan sir bleoberys made hym duke poyters sir gahalantyn made hym duke querne sir galyhodyn maade hym duke sentonge sir galyhud made hym erle perygot sir menadeuke made hym erle roerge sire vyllyars valyaunt made hym erle bearne syr hebe le renoumes made hym erle comange syr lauayne made hym erle armynak sire vrre made hym erle estrake syr neroneus made hym erle pardyak sire plenorius maade erle foyse sir selyses dolorous toure made hym erle masauke sir melyas de lyle made hym erle tursank sir bellangere le bewse made erle laundes sire palomydes made hym duke prouynce syre safyr made hym duke landok syr clegys gafe hym erldome agente syr sadok gaf erldom rlat sir dynas le seneschal made hym duke anioye sir clarrus made hym duke normandye thus syr launcelot rewarded noble knyghtes many mo semeth longe reherce pcapitulum xix leue syr launcelot landes noble knyghtes hym retorne ageyne vnto kynge arthur syr gawayne made grete hoost redy nombre thre score thousand al thynge made redy shyppyng passe ouer see soo shypped cardyf kynge arthur made sir mordred chyef ruler alle englond also put quene gueneuer vnder gouernaunce cause syr mordred kynge arthur sone gaf hym rule land wyf soo kynge passed see landed vpon syr launcelots landes brente wasted thurgh vengeaunce syr gawayne al myghte ouer renne whan word came syr launcelot kyng arthur sir gawayne landed vpon landes made full grete destructyon waste thenne spake syr bors sayd lord sir laucelot shame suffre hem thus ryde ouer landes wete yow wel suffre ye hem longe ye wille doo yow faueour may handle yow thenne said sir lyonel ware wyse lord syr launcelot wyll gyue counceylle lete v kepe oure stronge walled townes vntyl haue hongre cold blowe nayles thenne lete v fresshely sette vpon hym shrede hem doune shepe felde alyaunts may take ensample euer lande vpon oure landes thenne spak kynge bagdemagus syre launcelot syre curtosy wyll shende v alle thy curtosy hath waked alle sorowe thus ouer landes ryde shalle processe brynge v alle noughte whyles thus hole v hyde thenne sayd syre galihud vnto sir launcelot syre ben knyghtes come kynges blood wyl longe droupe within walles therfor gyue v leue lyke ben knyytes mete feld shalle slee shal curse tyme euer came countrey p thenne spak seuen bretheren northwalys seuen noble knyghtes man myghte seke seuen kynges landes myghte fynde suche seuen knyghtes thenne said one syr launcelot crystes sake lete v oute ryde sir galyhud neuer wonte coure castels noble townes thenne spak sir launcelot mayster gouernour alle fayre lordes wete yow wel full othe ryde oute knyghtes shedynge crysten blood yet lendes vnderstande ben full bare susteyne ony hoost whyle myghty warres lome made kyng clandas vpon countrey vpon fader kyng ban myn vnkell kyng bors tyme kepe oure strong walles shalle sende messager vnto lord arthur treatyce take better pee allwayes warre sir laucelot sente forth damoysell dwerfe requyrynge kynge arthur leue warrynge vpon landes sterte vpon palfroy dwerf ranne syde whan cam pauelione kynge arthur alyghte ther mette gentyl knyghte syr lucan butteler said fair damoysel come ye syr launcelot du lake ye syr sayd therfor come hyder speke lord kynge allas said sir lucan lord arthur wold loue launcelot sir gawayne wyl suffer hym thenne sayd praye god damoysel ye may spede wel alle ben aboute kynge wold sir launcelot dyd best ony knyght lyuynge lucan ledde damoysel vnto kynge sat sir gawayne wold saye soo whan told tale water ranne kynges eyen alle lordes ful glad aduyse kynge accorded syr launcelot sauf al syre gawayne sayd lord myn vnkel wyl ye doo wil ye torne ageyne ye past thus fer vpon iourney alle world wylle speke yow vylony nay sayd arthur wete thou wel sir gawayne wylle doo ye wil aduyse yet semeth sayd arthur fayre profers good refused sythen comen soo fer vpon iourney wil ye gyue damoysel ansuer maye speke pyte profers ben large pcapitulum xx thenne sir gawayne sayd damoysel thus damoysel saye ye sir launcelot wast labour sewe myn vnkel telle hym wold haue made ony labour pee shold haue made tyme telle hym late saye sir gawayn soo sende hym word promyse hym feythe owe vnto god knyghthode shal neuer leue hym tyl haue slayne hym soo damoysel wepte departed many wepyng eyen soo sir lucan broughte damoysel palfroy soo came syr launcelot among knyghtes syr launcelot herd ansuer thenne teres ranne doune chekes thenne noble knyghtes strode aboute hym sayd sir launcelot wherfor make ye suche chere thynke ye men lete v noble knyghtes matche hem myddes felde maye lyghtely done sayd sir launcelot neuer soo lothe doo batail therfore praye fayre sir ye loue ruled wylle haue yow wylle alweyes flee yt noble kynge made knyghte whan may noo ferther muste nedes defende wyll worshyp v alle compare noble kynge whome haue alle serued thenne helde theire langage nyghte tooke rest vpon morne erly daunynge daye knyghtes loked oute sawe cyte benwyk byseged round aboute fast beganne sette vp ladder thenne defyed hem oute towne bete hem walles wyghtely thenne came forth sire gawayne wel armed vpon styf stede came chyef gate spere hand cryenge syr launcelot arte thow none proude knyghtes dare breke spere thenne sir bors made hym redy came forth oute towne sir gawayne encountred syre bors tyme smote sire bors doune hors al moost slayne hym soo sire bors rescowed borne towne thenne came forth sir lyonel broder syr bors thoughte reuenge hym eyther feutryd speres ranne gyder mette spytefully sir gawayn suche grace smote sir lyonel doune wounded hym passynge sore thenne syr lyonel rescowed borne towne sir gawayne came euery day fayled smote doune one knyghte soo thus endured half yere moche slauyter peple partyes thenne hit befelle vpon day syr gawayne came afore gate armed alle pyeces noble hors grete spere hand thenne cryed lowde voys arte thow thou fals traytour syre launcelot hydest thow thy self within hole walles lyke coward loke oute thow fals traytour knyghte shal reuenge vpon thy body dethe thre bretheren alle langage herd sir launcelot euery dele kyn knyghtes drewe aboute hym alle sayd one sir launcelot p sir launcelot must ye defende yow lyke knyghte el ye shamed euer ye called vpon treason tyme yow stere ye haue slepte ouer longe suffred ouer moche soo god helpe sayd sire launcelot ryghte heuy sire gawayns wordes charged grete charge therfor wote wel ye muste defende el recreaunt thenne syr launcelot badde sadel strongest hors bad lete fetche armes brynge alle vnto gate toure thenne sir launcelot spak hygh vnto kynge arthur sayd lord arthur noble kynge made knyghte wete yow wel ryghte heuy sake ye thus sewe vpon alweyes forbere yow wold haue ben vengeable myghte haue mette yow myddes felde haue made boldest knyghtes ful tame haue forborne half yere suffred yow sire gawayne doo ye wold doo may endure lenger muste nedes defende self soo moche syr gawayne hath apeeled treason whiche gretely ageynste euer shold fyghte ayenst ony blood maye forsake hit dryuen beste tyll baye thenne sir gawayne sayd sir launcelot thou darst doo batail leue thy babblynge come lete v ease hertes thenne syr launcelot armed hym lyghtely mounted vpon hors eyther knyghtes gat grete speres handes hoste withoute stood stylle parte noble knyghtes came oute cyte grete nombre moche whan arthur sawe nombre men knyghtes merueylled sayd hym self allas euer sir launcelot ageynst see hath forborne couenaunt made shold man nyghe hem dele hem tyl one dede yeldin pcapitulum xxi syr gauwayn syr launcelot departed grete waye sonder cam gyder al hors myght myght renne eyther smote myddes sheldes knyghtes soo stronge theyr sperys bygge horse myyt endure buffettes horse fyl therthe auoyded horse dressyd sheldes afore stode gyders gaf many sad stroke dyuers place theyr bodyes blood braste oute many sydes place thenne syr gauwayn suche grace gyfte holy man gyuen hym euery day yere vnderne tyl hye none hys myght encreaced thre houres moche thryse hys strengthe caused syr gauwayn wynne grete honour pand hys sake kyng arthur maad ordenaunce al maner bataylles ony quarellys shold done afore kyng arthur shold begynne vndern al done syr gawayns loue lyklyhode yf syr gauwayn one parte shold haue better batayl whyle strengthe endured thre houres fewe knyghtes tyme lyuyng knewe aduauntage syr gauwayn kyng arthur allonelye thus syr launcelot faught syr gauwayn whan syr launcelot felte hys myght euer encreace syr launcelot wondred dredde hym sore shamed frensshe book sayth syr launcelot wende whan felte syr gauwayn double strengthe ben fende none erthely man wherfore syr launcelotte traced trauersyd couerd hym self wyth shelde kepte myght brayde duryng thre houres whyle syr gauwayn gaf hym many sadde br te p many sadde stroke al knyghtes behelde syr launcelot meruaylled myyt endure hym ful lytell vnderstood trauaylle syr launcelot endure hym pand thenne whan hit paste none syr gauwayn noo hys owne myght thenne syr launcelot felte hym come doun stratched hym vp stode nere syr gauwayn sayd thus lord syr gauwayn fele ye haue done lord syr gauwayn must parte many grete greuous stroke haue endured day grete payne sir launcelot doubled stroke gaf sir gauwayn suche buffet helmet fyl doun syde syr launcelot wythdrewe hym fro hym withdrawest thou sayd syr gawayn torne ageyn fals traytour knyght flee thou leue thus whan hole shal batayl wyth ageyn shal endure syr goddes grace wyt thou wel syr gauwayn wyl neuer smyte fellyd knyght syr launcelot wente cyte syr gauwayn borne kyng arthur pauyllyon lech brought hym serched salued softe oynementes syr launcelot sayd haue good day lord kyng wyt wel ye wynne worshyp wally yf wold knyghtes oute brynge ther shold many man deye therfore lord arthur remembre olde kyndenes euer fare ihesu gyde al place pcapitulum xxij ala said kynge euer vnhappy warre begonne euer yr launcelot forbereth al place lyke wyse kynne sene wel thys day neuew syr gauwayn kyng arthur fyl seek sorowe syr gauwayn sore hurt cause warre betwyxt hym syr launcelot kyng arthur partye kepte syege wyth lytel warre withoutforth withinforth kepte theyr walles deffended whan nede thus syr gauwayn laye seek thre wekes tentes wyth al maner leche crafte myyt assone syr gawayn myyt goo ryde armyd hym al poyntes sterte vpon courser gate spere hande came rydyng afore chyef gate barwyk cryed heyght art thou sir launcelot come forth thou fals traytour knyyt recreante sir gauwayn wyl preue say alle thys langage sir launcelot herde sayd thus sir gawayn repentys foule sayeng ye wyll sease langage wote wel syr gauwayn knowe myght alle ye may doo p wel ye wote syr gauwayn ye may gretelye hurte come doune traytour knyght sayd make good contrarye wyth thy handes myshapped laste bataylle hurte thy handes p therfore wyte thou wel come thys day make amendys wene thys day laye lowe thou laydest ihesu deffende sayd syr launcelot euer ferre daunger ye haue ben myn dayes doon syr gauwayn sayd syr launcelot ye shal thynke tary longe sythen ye vnknyghtelye calle treson ye shalle haue bothe handes ful syr launc lot armed hym al poyntes mounted vpon hors gate grete spere hys hande rode oute gate bothe hoostes assembled hem wythoute wythin stode raye ful manlye bothe partyes charged holde stylle see beholde bataylle ij noble knyghtes thenne layed speerys reystys came gyder thondre syr gawayn brake spere vpon syr launcelot hondred pyeces vnto hande syr launcelot smote hym wyth gretter myght syr gauwayns hors fete reysed hors fyl erthe p thenne syr gauwayn delyuerlye auoy ded hors put shelde afore hym eygyrlye drewe swerde bad syr launcelot alyghte traytoure knyght yf thys mary sone hath faylled wyt thou wel kynges sone quenes sone shal faylle p syr launcelot auoyded hors dressyd shelde afore hym drewe hys swerde soo stode gyders gaf many sad stroke men bothe partyes therof passyng grete wonder p whan syr launcelot felte syr gawyns myght soo meruayllously encrees wyth helde courage wynde kepte hym self wonder couert myght vnder shelde trasyd trauersyd breke syr gauwayns stroke courage syr gauwayn enforced hym self al myght power destroye syr launcelot frensshe look sayth euer syr gawayns myght encreased ryght soo encreasyd wynde hys euyl wylle thus syr gawayne dyd grete payne vnto syr launcelot thre houres ryght grete payne deffende hym whan thre houres passyd syr launcelot felte syr gawayn comen hys owne propre strengthe thenne syr launcelot sayd vnto syr gawayn haue prouyd twyse ye ful daungerous knyght wonderful man myght many wonderful dedes haue ye doon dayes myght encresyng haue dysseyued many ful noble valyaunte knyght fele ye haue doon myghty dedes wyte wel must dedys pand thenne syr launcelot stode nerre syr gauwayn thenne syr launcelot doubled hys stroke syr gauwayn deffended hym myghtelye neuerthelesse syr launcelot smote suche stroke vpon sir gauwayns helme vpon olde wounde syr gauwayn synked doun vpon hys one syde swounde anone dyd awake wauyd foyned syr launcelot laye sayd traytour knyght wyt thou wel yet slayn come thou nere perfourme thys bataylle vnto vttermyst pi wyl nomore doo haue doon sayd syr launcelot whan see fote wyll doo bataylle vpon alle whyle see stande foot smyte wounded man may stonde god deffende suche shame thenne tourned hym wente waye toward cytee syr gauwayn euermore callyng hym traytour knyght sayd wyt thou wel syr launcelot whan hoole shal doo bataylle wyth ageyn p shal neuer leue tyl one v slayn thus thys syege endured syr gauwayn laye seek nere monthe whan wel recouerd redy wythin thre dayes te bataylle ageyn wyth syr launcelot ryght came tydynges vnto arthur englond made kyng arthur al hoost remeue phere foloweth xxi book capitulum primo syr mordred rular alle englond dyd make letter though came beyonde see letter specefyed kynge arthur slayn bataylle wyth syr launcelot p wherfore syr mordred made parlemente called lordes togyder made chese hym kyng soo crowned caunterburye helde feest xv dayes afterward drewe hym vnto wynchester took quene gueneuer sayd playnly wolde wedde hyr whyche vnkyls wyf faders wyf soo made redy feest day prefyxt shold wedded wherfore quene gweneur passyng heuy durst dyscouer hyr herte spake fayre agreyd syr mordredes wylle p thenne desyred syr mordred goo london bye alle manere thynges longed vnto weddyng cause hyr fayre speche syr mordred trusted hyr wel ynough gaf hyr leue goo soo whan came london took toure london sodeynlye alle haste possyble stuffed hyt wyth alle manere vytaylle wel garnysshed men soo kepte hyt p whan syr mordred wyste vnderstode begyled passyng wrothe oute mesure shorte tale make wente layed myghty syege aboute toure london made many grete assaultes therat threwe many grete engynes vnto theym shotte grete gonne alle myght preuaylle syr mordred quene gueneuer wolde neuer fayre speche foule wold neuer truste come hys handes ageyn pthenne came bysshop caunterburye whyche noble clerke holy man thus sayd syr mordred syr wyl ye doo wyl ye fyrst dysplese god sythen shame self al knyghthode kyng arthur vncle ferther moders broder hir hym self kyng arthur bygate vpon syster therfor may wedde faders wyf syr sayd noble clerke leue oppynyon shall curse wyth book belle candell thou thy werst said syr mordred wyt thou wel shal defye sir sayd bysshop wyl wel shal fere ouyt also ye noyse lord arthur slayne therfore ye wyl make foule werke londe pee thou fals preest sayd syr mordred thou chauffe ony shal make stryke thy heed bysshop departed dyd cursyng moost orgulist wyse myght doon syr mordred sought bysshop caunterburye haue slayne hym bysshop fledde toke parte goodes hym went nygh vnto glastynburye preest eremyte chapel lyued pouerte holy prayer wel vnderstode myscheuous warre honde syr mordred sought quene gueneuer letter sondes fayr meany foul meany haue hir come oute toure london al auaylled answerd hym shortelye openlye pryuelye leuer slee hyr self maryed wyth hym came worde syr mordred kyng arthur araysed syege syr launcelot comyng homeward wyth grete hoost auenged vpon syr mordred wherfore syr mordred maad wryte wryttes al barownry thys londe moche peple drewe hym comyn voys emonge wyth arthur none lyf warre stryffe wyth syr mordred grete ioye blysse thus syr arthur depraued euyl sayd many ther kyng arthur made vp nought gyuen landes myght say hym good worde lo ye al englissh men see ye myschyef moost kyng knyght world moost loued felyshyp noble knyghtes hym al vpholden myght englyssh men holde contente wyth hym loo thus olde custome vsage londe also men saye thys londe haue yet loste ne foryeten custome vsage ala thys grete defaulte v englysshe men may thynge plese v noo terme soo faryd people tyme better plesyd sir mordred kyng arthur moche peple drewe vnto sir mordred sayd wold abyde hym better werse soo syr mordred drewe grete hoost douer herd saye sir arthur wold arryue soo thoughte bete owne fader landes moost party alle englond helde sire mordred people soo newe fangle pcapitulum ij soo sire mordred douer host came kyng arthur grete nouye shyppes galeyes carryks syr mordred redy awaytynge vpon ondage lette owne fader la de vp lande kyng ouer thenne launcynge grete botes smal ful noble men armes moche slaughter gentyl knyghtes many full bolde baron layd fullowe bothe partyes kynge arthur soo couragyous myght maner knyghtes lette hym lande knyghtes fyersly folowed hym landed maulgre sir mordreds alle power put sir mordred abak fledde alle peple soo whan batail done kyng arthur lete burye peple dede thenne noble syr gawayne fonde grete bote lyenge half dede whan syr arthur wyst syre gawayne layd lowe wente vnto hym kyng made sorowe oute mesure took sire gawayne armes thryes swouned thenne whan awaked sayd allas sir gawayne systers sone thow lyggest man world loued moost ioye gone neuewe syre gawayne discouer vnto persone syr launcelot moost ioye myn affyaunce haue lost ioye bothe wherfor alle myn erthely ioye gone myn vnkel kyng arthur said sir gawayn wete wel deth day come alle thorou myn owne hastynes wilfulnes smyten vpon thold wounde sir launcelot gaf whiche fele wel must dye sir laucelot ben vnhappy werre neuer begonne alle causer sir laucelot blood thorou prowes helde alle cankeryd enemyes subiectyon daungere sayd sir gawayne ye shalle mysse sir launcelot allas wold accorde hym therfor sayd syr gawayne praye yow fayre vnkel may haue paper pen ynke may wryte syre launcelot cedle myn owne handes thenne whan paper ynke broughte thenne gawayn set vp weykely kynge arthur shryuen lytel tofore thenne wrote thus frensshe book maketh mencyon vnto syre launcelot floure alle noble knyghtes euer herd sawe dayes syre gawayne kynge lotte sone orkeney syster sone vnto noble kyng arthur sende gretynge lete haue knowleche tenth day may smyten vpon old wound thou gauest afore cyte benwyck thorow woud thou gauest come dethe day wil alle wo ld wete sir gawayne knyghte table round soughte dethe thorou thy deseruynge myn owne sekynge wherfor byseche sir launcelot retorne ageyne vnto realme see tombe praye prayer lesse soule day wrote sedyl hurte dethe wound whiche thy hand syr launcelot nobler man myghte slayne also sir launcelot alle loue euer betwyxe v make taryenge come outer see al haste thow mayst thy noble knyghtes rescowe noble kynge made knyghte lord arthur ful streyghtly bestadde fals traytour half broder syr mordred hath lete croune hym kynge wold haue wedded lady quene gueneuer soo done put self toure london soo x day may last past lord arthur alle landed vpon douer putte fals traytour syre mordred flyghte mysfortuned stryken vpon thy stroke date letter wryten two houres half afore dethe wryten myn owne hand soo subscrybed parte hertes blood requyre moost famous knyghte world thou wylt see tombe thenne sir gawayne wept kynge arthur wepte thene swouned whan awaked bothe kynge made syr gawayn receyue saueour thenne sir gawayne praid kynge sende sir launcelot cherysshe hym aboue alle knyghtes houre none syr gawayn yelded vp spyryte thenne kynge lete entiere hym chappel within douer castel yet alle men maye see sculle hym wound sene syr launcelot gaf hym bataill thenne told kynge syr mordred pyghte newe feld vpon baramdoune vpon morne kynge rode thyder hym grete bataille betwixe moche peple slayne bothe partyes last syr arthur party stode best sir mordred party fledde vnto cau turbery pcapitulum iij thenne kyng lete serche townes knyghtes slayne enteryd salued softe salues sore wounded thenne moche peple drewe vnto kynge arthur thenne sayd sir mordred warred vpon kyng arthur wronge thenne kynge arthur drewe hym hoost
