doune see syde westward toward salysbury ther day assygned betwixe kyng arthur sire mordred shold mete vpon doune besyde salysbury ferre see syde day assygned monday trynyte sonday wherof kyng arthur passyng glad myghte auengyd vpon sire mordred thenne syr mordred areysed moche peple aboute london kente southsex surrey estsex southfolke northfolk helde party sir mordred many ful noble knyghte drewe vnto syr mordred kynge loued sir launcelot drewe vnto syr mordred soo vpon trynyte sonday nyghte kynge arthur dremed wonderful dreme hym semed satte vpon chaflet chayer chayer fast whele therupon satte kynge arthur rychest clothe gold myghte made kyng thoughte ther vnder hym fer hym hydous depe blak water alle maner serpentes wormes wylde bestes foule horryble sodenly kynge thoughte whele torned vp soo doune felle amonge serpentys euery beest took hym lymme thenne kynge cryed lay bedde slepte helpe thenne knyghtes squyers yomen awaked kyng thenne soo amased wyst thenne felle slomberynge ageyn slepynge thorouly wakynge kynge semed veryly came syr gawayne vnto hym nombre fayre ladyes hym whan kynge arthur sawe hym thenne sayd welcome systers sone wende thou haddest ben dede see lyue moche beholdynge vnto almyghty ihesu fayre neuewe systers sone ben ladyes hydder come yow sir said sir gawayne alle ben ladyes whome haue foughten whanne man lyuynge alle tho dyd batail ryghteuous quarel god hath gyuen hem grace grete prayer cause dyd bataille hem shold brynge hydder vnto yow thus moche hath god gyuen leue warne yow youre dethe ye fyghte morne syre mordred ye bothe haue assygned doubte ye ye must slayne moost party peple bothe partyes grete grace goodenes almyghty ihesu hath vnto yow pyte yow many moo good men shalle slayne god hath sente yow specyal grace gyue yow warnynge wyse ye bataille morne ye take treatyce moneth day profer yow largely morne putte delaye within monethe shalle come syr launcelot alle noble knyghtes rescowe yow worshipfully slee sir mordred alle euer wylle holde hym thenne syr gawayne al ladyes vaynquysshed anone kyng callyd vpon hys knyghtes squyres yemen charged wyghtly fetche noble lordes wyse bysshoppes vnto hym whan come kyng tolde hem auysyon sir gawayn tolde hym warned hym yf faught morne shold slayn pthan kyng comaunded syr lucan de butlere broder syr bedwere two bysshoppes wyth hem charged theym ony wyse myght take traytyse monthe day wyth syr mordred spare proffre hym londes goodes moche ye thynke best departed came syr mordred grymme hoost hondred thousand men entreted syr mordred longe tyme laste syr mordred agreyd haue cornwayl kente arthures dayes alle englond dayes kyng arthur pcapitulum iiij condesended kyng arthure syr mordred shold mete betwyxte bothe theyr hoostes eueryche shold brynge fourtene persones came wyth thys word vnto arthure sayd glad thys done wente felde whan arthure shold departe warned al hys hoost see ony swerde drawen look ye come fyersly slee traytour syr mordred noo wyse truste hym lyke wyse syr mordred warned hoost ye see ony swerde drawen look ye come fyersly soo slee alle euer stondeth wyse wyl truste thys treatyse knowe wel fader wyl auenged soo mette theyr poyntemente agreyd accorded thorouly wyn fette dranke ryght soo came adder oute lytel hethe busshe hyt stonge knyght foot whan knyght felte hym stongen looked doun sawe adder drewe swerde slee adder thought none harme whan hoost bothe partyes saw swerde drawen blewe beamous trumpettes horne shouted grymly bothe hoostes dressyd hem gyders kyng arthur took hors sayd allas thys vnhappy day rode partye pand syr mordred like wyse neuer seen doolfuller bataylle crysten londe russhyng rydyng fewnyng strykyng many grymme worde spoken eyder many dedely stroke euer kyng arthur rode thorugh oute bataylle syr mordred many tymes dyd ful nobly noble kyng shold al tymes faynted neuer syr mordred day put hym deuoyr grete perylle p thus faughte alle longe day neuer stynted tyl noble knyghtes layed colde erthe euer faught stylle tyl nere nyghte tyme hondred thousand layed deed vpon thenne arthure wode wrothe oute mesure whan sawe peple slayn hym p thenne kyng loked aboute hym thenne ware al hys hoost al good knyghtes lefte moo lyne two knyghtes one syr lucan de butlere broder syr bedwere ful sore wounded ihesu mercy sayd kyng al noble knyghtes becomen ala euer shold see thys dolefull day sayd arthur come myn ende p wolde god wyste traytour syr mordred hath caused alle thys myschyef thenne kyng arthure ware syr mordred lenyd vpon swerde emonge grete hepe deed men gyue spere sayd arthur vnto syr lucan yonder haue espyed traytour alle thys woo hath wrought syr late hym sayd syr lucan vnhappy yf ye passe thys vnhappy day ye shalle ryght wel reuengyd vpon hym p good lord remembre ye nyghtes dreme spyryte syr gauwayn tolde nyght yet god grete goodnes hath preserued hyderoto therfore goddes sake lord leue thys blessyd god ye haue wonne felde ben thre lyne wyth syr mordred none lyue yf ye loue thys wycked day desteynye paste tyde deth betyde lyf sayth kyng see hym yonder allone shal neuer escape myn handes better auaylle shal neuer haue hym p god spede wel sayd syr bedwere thenne kyng gate hys spere bothe handes ranne toward syr mordred cryeng tratour thy deth day come whan syr mordred herde syr arthur ranne vntyl hym swerde drawen hande kyng arthur smote syr mordred vnder shelde wyth foyne spere thorughoute body fadom whan syr mordred felte hys dethes wounde thryst hym self wyth myght vp bur kyng arthur spere right smote fader arthur wyth swerde holden bothe handes syde heed swerde persyd helmet brayne panne therwythall syr mordred fyl starke deed erthe nobyl arthur fyl swoune erthe swouned ofte tymes syr lucan de butlere syr bedwere oftymes heue hym vp soo waykely ledde hym betwyxte bothe lytel chapel ferre see syde whan kyng thought hym wel eased thenne herde people crye felde goo thou syr lucan sayd kyng wyte bytokenes noyse felde syr lucan departed greuously wounded many place yede sawe herkened mone lyght pyllars robber comen felde pylle robbe many ful noble knyghte brochys bedys many good rynge many ryche iewel deed al oute slewe theym theyr harneys theyr rychesse whan syr lucan vnderstode thys werke came kyng assone myght tolde hym al herde seen therfore rede sayd syr lucan beste brynge somme towne wolde soo sayd kyng pcapitulum v bvt may stonde myn hede werches soo syr launcelot sayd kyng arthur thys day haue sore myst ala euer ayenst haue dethe wherof syr gauwayn warned dreme syr lucan took vp kyng one parte syr bedwere parte lyftyng kyng sowned syr lucan fyl sowne wyth lyfte parte guttes fyl oute bodye therwyth noble knyghtes herte braste whan kyng awoke beheld syr lucan laye foomyyg mowth parte guttes laye foot p ala sayd kyng thys ful heuy syght see thys noble duke soo deye sake wold haue holpen nede helpe ala wold complayne hym hys herte sette helpe ihesu haue mercy vpon hys soule syr bedwere wepte deth brother leue thys mornyng wepyng sayd kyng al wyl auaylle wyte thou wel myght lyue self deth syr lucan wolde greue euer tyme hyeth fast sayd kyng therfore sayd arthur vnto syr bedwere take thou excalybur good swerde goo yonder water syde whan thou comest charge throwe swerde water come ageyn telle thou seest lord sad bedwere commaundement shal doon lyghtly brynge worde ageyn syr bedwere departed waye behelde noble swerde pomel hafte al precyous stone thenne sayd hym sef yf throwe ryche swerde water therof shal neuer come good harme losse thenne syr bedwere hydde excalybur vnder tree sone myght came ageyn vnto kyng sayd ben water throwen swerde water pwhat sawe thou sayd kyng syr sayd sawe thynge wawes wyndes vntrewly sayd sayd kynge therfore goo thou lyghtelye ageyn commaundemente thou arte leef dere spare throwe syr bedwere retorned ageyn took swerde hys hande hym thought synne shame throwe awaye nobyl swerde efte hydde swerde retorned ageyn tolde kyng ben water done commaundemente sawe thou sayd kyng syr sayd sawe thynge water wappe wawes wanne traytour vntrewe sayd kyng arthur hast thou betrayed twyse wold haue wente thou bast leef dere thou arte named noble knyghte wold betraye richesse swerde goo ageyn lyghtly thy longe taryeng putteth grete ieopardye lyf haue taken colde yf thou byd yf euer may see shal slee myn owne handes thou woldest ryche swerde see dede p thenne syr bedwere departed wente swerde lyghtly took hit vp wente water syde bounde gyrdyl aboute hyltes thenne threwe swerde farre water myght cam arme hande aboue water mette caught shoke thryse braundysshed vanysshed awaye hande wyth swerde water syr bedwere came ageyn kyng tolde hym sawe palas sayd kyng helpe hen drede haue taryed ouer longe syr bedwere toke kyng vpon backe wente wyth hym water syde whan water syde enyn fast banke houed lytyl barge wyth many fayr ladyes hit emonge hem al quene al blacke hoodes al wepte shryked whan sawe kyng arthur pnow put barge sayd kyng dyd softelye receyued hym thre quenes wyth grete mornyng soo sette hem doun one lappes kyng arthur layed hys heed quene sayd dere broder haue ye taryed longe ala wounde heed hath caught ouermoche colde soo rowed londe syr bedwere behelde tho ladyes goo hym p syr bedwere cryed lord arthur shal become ye goo leue allone emonge myn enemyes comfort thy self sayd kyng doo wel thou mayst truste truste wyl vale auylyon hele greuous wounde p yf thou neuer praye soul euer quenes ladyes wepte shryched hit pyte assone syr bedwere loste syght b arge wepte waylled took foreste wente al nyght mornyng ware betwyxte two holtes hore chapel ermytage pcapitulum vi syr bedwere glad thyder wente whan came chapel sawe laye heremyte grouelyng al foure fast tombe newe grauen whan eremyte sawe syr bedwere knewe hym wel lytel tofore bysshop caunterburye syr mordred flemed syr sayd syr bedwere man entred ye praye fast fore fayr sone sayd heremyte wote verayly demyyng thys nyght mydnyght came nombre ladyes broughte hyder deed cors prayed berye hym offeryd hondred taper gaf hondred besauntes palas sayd syr bedwere lord kyng arthur lyeth buryed thys chapel syr bedwere swowned whan awoke prayed heremyte myght abyde wyth hym stylle lyue wyth fastyng prayer hen wyl neuer goo sayd syr bedwere wylle al dayes lyf praye lord arthur ye welcome sayd heremyte knowe better ye wene doo ye bolde bedwere ful noble duke syr lucan de butlere broder thenne syr bedwere tolde heremyte alle ye haue herde tofore bode syr bedwere hermyte tofore bysshop caunterburye syr bedwere put vpon hym poure clothes seruyd hermyte ful owly fastyng prayer pthus arthur fynde neuer wryt n boookes ben auctorysed veray certente deth herde neuer redde thus ledde aweye shyppe wherin thre quenes one kyng arthur syster quene morgan le fay quene north galys thyrd quene waste londes also ynyue chyef lady lake wedded pelleas good knyght lady doon moche kyng arthur wold neuer suffre syr pelleas noo place shold daunger lyf lyued vttermest dayes wyth hyr grete reste deth kyng arthur coude neuer fynde ladyes brought hym buryellys suche one buryed hermyte bare wytnesse somtyme bysshop caunterburye yet heremyte knewe certayn verayly body kyng arthur thys tale syr bedwer knyght table rounde made wryton pcapitulum vij yet somme men say many partyes englond kyng arthur deed wylle lord ihesu another place men say shal come ageyn shal wynne holy crosse wyl say shal rather wyl say thys world chaunged lyf many men say wryton vpon tombe vers phic iacet arthurus rex qondam rex que futurus thus leue syr bedwere hermyte dwellyd tyme chapel besyde glastynburye ermytage lyuyd theyr prayer fastynges grete abstynence whan quene gueneuer vnderstood kyng arthur slayn al noble knyytes syr mordred al remenaunte quene stale aweye v ladyes wyth hyr soo wente almesburye let make hir helf nonne ware whyte clothes blacke grete penaunce toke euer dyd synful lady thys londe neuer creature coude make hyr mery lyued fastyng prayer almes dedes al maner peple meruaylled vertuously chaunged p leue quene gueneuer almesburye nonne whyte clothes blacke abbesse rular reason wolde torne hye speke syr launcelot du lake pcapitulum viii whan herde contreye syr mordred crowned kyng englond maad warre ayenst kyng arthur owne fader wolde lette hym lande hys owne londe p also tolde syr launcelot syr mordred layed syege aboute toure london cause quene wold wedde hym syr launcelot wroth oute mesure sayd kynnesmen ala double traytour syr mordred repenteth euer escaped handes moche shame hath done vnto lord arthur alle fele doleful letter lord syr gauwayn sente who soule ihu haue mercy lord arthur ful harde bestadde ala sayd syr launcelot euer shold lyue moost noble kyng maad knyght thus ouersette wyth subiecte owne royame p doleful letter lord syr gauwayn hath sente afore deth prayeng see tombe wyt wel doleful wordes shal neuer goo myn herte ful noble knyght euer borne vnhappy houre borne euer shold haue vnhappe slee fyrst syr gauwayn syr gaheris good knyght myn owne frende syr gareth ful noble knyght ala may say vnhappy sayd syr launcelot euer shold thus vnhappely ala yet myght neuer haue happe slee traytour syr mordred leue complayntes sayd syr bors fyrst reuenge deth syr gauwayn hit wyl wel done ye see syr gauwayn tombe secondly ye reuenge lord arthur lady quene gueneuer thanke sayd syr launcelot euer ye wyl worshyp made redy al haste myyt e shyppes galeyes wyth syr launcelot hoost passe englond passyd ouer see tyl came douer landed wyth seuen kynges nombre hydous beholde syr launcelot spyered men douer kyng arthur became peple tolde hym flayn syr mordred c thousand yed day sir mordred gaf kyng arthur fyrste bataylle landyng good syr gawayn slayn morne syr mordred faught kyng vpon baram doun kyng put syr mordred wers ala said syr launcelot heuyest tydynges euer cam fayr syrs sayd syr launcelot shewe tombe syr gawayn certeyn peple towne brouyt hym castel douer shewed hym tombe syr launcelot knelyd doun wepte prayeed hertelye soule nyght made dole al wold come moche flesshe fysshe wyn aale euery man woman xii pen come wold thus owne hande dalte money moornyng gowne euer wepte prayed hem praye sowle syr gawayn morne al preestys clerkys myght goten contreye sange masse requyem offeryd fyrst syr launcelot offred c pounde seuen kynges offeryd fourty pounde pee also knyghtes eche hem offred pounde offeryng dured fro morne tyl nyght syr launcelot laye two nyghtes tombe prayer wepyng thyrd day syr launcelot callyd kynges duke erles baron knyghtes sayd thus fayr lordes thake al comyng contreye came late shal repente whyle lyue ayenst deth may man rebelle sythen sir launcelot wyl self ryde seke lady quene gueneuer say hath grete payne moche dy ease herd say fledde weste therfore ye alle shal abyde yf come ageyn wythin yv dayes take shyppes felawshyp departe contraye wyl say pcapitulum ix came syr bors de gauys sayd lord syr launcelot thynke ye doo ryde royame wyt wel ye shal fynde sewe frendes may sayd syr launcelot kepe stylle wyl forth iourney noo man chylde shall goo bote stryue departed rode westerly sought vij viij dayes atte last cam ntrye quene gueneuer ware sir launcelot walked cloystre whan sawe hym swouned thryse al ladyes ientyl wymmen wer e ynough holde quene vp whan myyt speke callyd ladyes ientyl wymmen hir sayd ye meruayl fayr ladyes make fare truly said syght yonder knyght yender standeth wherfore praye al calle hym whan syr launcelot brought hyr sayd al ladyes thorowe man hath al warre wrought deth moost noblest knyghtes world tho ugh loue haue loued gyder moost noble lord slayn therfor syr launcelot wyl thou wel sette suche plyte gete soule hele yet truste thorugh goddes grace deth haue syght blessyd face cryst dome day sy te ryght syde synful euer sayntes heuen therfore syr launcelot requyre beseche hertelye al loue euer betwyxte v thou neuer see vysage comande goddes behalfe thou forsake companye thy kyngdom thou orne ageyn kepe wel thy royame warre wrake wel haue loued myn hert wyl serue see thorugh flour kynges knyghtes therfor sir launcelot goo thy royame take wyf lyue hir ioye blysse praye praye lord may amende myslyuyng swete madam sayd syr launcelot wold ye shold iorne ageyn vnto cuntreye wedde lady nay madam wyt wel shal neuer shal neuer le soo fal haue promysed deystenye ye haue taken wyl take vnto plese ihesu euer cast specially praye yf thou wylt sayd quene holde thy promyse may neuer byleue thou wylt torne world ageyn wel madam sayd ye say pleseth yet wyst neuer fals promesse god defende shold forsake world ye haue quest sank greal fosaken vanytees world lord ben yf done tyme wyth herte wylle thought passed al knyghtes sanke greal excepte syr galahad sone therfore lady sythen ye haue taken perfeccion must nedys take perfection ryght take recorde god haue myn erthly ioye yf founden dysposed caste haue myn owne royame pcapitulum x bvt sythen fynde thus desposed ensure faythfully oyl euer take pen unce praye whyle lyf lasteth yf may fynde ony heremyte graye ce whyte wyl eceyue wherfore madame praye kysse neuer nomore nay sayd quene shal neuer absteyne suche werkes departed neuer harde herted man wold haue wepte see dolour made la mentacyon stungyn wyth sperys many tymes swouned ladyes bare quene hir chambre syr launcelot awok went took hors rode al day al nyyt forest wepyng atte last ware ermytage chappel stode betwyxte two clyffes herde lytel belle rynge masse thyder rode alyght teyed hors gate herd masse sange masse bysshop caunterburye bothe bysshop sir bedwer knewe syr launcelot spake gyders masse whan syr bedwere tolde tale al hole syr launcelottes hert almost braste sorowe sir launcelot threwe hys armes abrode sayd ala may truste thys world knelyd doun knee prayed bysshop shryue hym assoyle hym besought bysshop myght hys brother bysshop sayd wyll gladly put habyte vpon syr launcelot seruyd god day nyyt prayer fastynges thus grete hoost abode douer sir lyonel toke fyftene lordes hym rode london seke sir launcelot syr lyonel slayn many lordes thenne syr bors de ganys made grete hoost goo hoome ageyn syr boor syr ector de mari syr blamour syr bleoloris moo syr launcelottes kynn oke hem ryde al englond ouerthwart endelonge seek syr launcelot syr bors fortune rode longe tyl came chapel syr launcelot syr bors herde lytel belle knylle range masse alyght herde masse whan masse doon bysshop syr launcelot sir bedwere came syr bors whan syr bors sawe sir launcelot maner clothyng preyed bysshop myght sewte habyte put vpon hym lyued prayer fastyng wythin halfe ye come syr galyhud syr galyhodyn sir blamour syr bleoheris syr wyllyars syr clar sir gohaleamyne al vij noble knyytes abode styll whan sawe syr launcelot taken hym suche perfeccion last departe toke suche habyte thus endured grete penaunce syx yere syr launcelot took thahyte preesthod bysshop twelue monthe e sange masse none knyghtes redde bookes holpe synge masse range b llys dyd odoly al maner seruyce soo horse wente wolde toke regarde worldly rychesses whan sawe syr launcelot endure suche penaun e prayer fastynges toke force payne endured see nobleste knyght world ke suche abstynaunce waxed ful lene thus vpon nyght came vysyon syr launcelot charged hym remyssyon synnes haste hym vnto almysbury thenne come thou shall fynde quene gueneuer dede therfore take thy felowes pareuey hors bere fetche thou cors hir burye hir husbond noble kyng arthur auysyon came launcelot thryse one nyght pcapitulum xi syr launcelot rose vp day tolde heremyte wel done sayd heremyte ye made redy ye dyshobeye auysyon syr launcelot toke vn felowes hym fore yede glastynburye almysburye whyche lytel xxx myle within two dayes wayke feble goo whan syr launcelot come almysburye within nunerye quene gueneuer deyed halfe oure afore ladyes tolde syr launcelot quene gueneuer tolde hem al passyd syr launcelot ben preest nere twelue monthe hyder cometh faste may fetche cors besyde lord kyng arthur shal berye wherfore quene sayd heryng hem al beseche almyghty god may neuer haue power see syr launcelot wyth worldly eyen thus said al ladyes euer hir prayer two dayes tyl dede syr launcelot sawe hir vysage bat wepte gretelye syghed dyd al obseruaunce seruyce hym self bothe dyryge ne sange masse ordeyned hors bere wyth hondred torch euer brennyng aboute cors quene euer syr launcelot viij felowes wente aboute hors bere syngyng redyng many holy oryson frankensens vpon corp encensed thus syr launcelot eyght felowes wente foot almysburye vnto glastynburye whan come chapel hermytage dyryge wyth grete deuocyon morne heremyte somtyme bysshop canterburye sage masse requyem wyth grete deuocyon syr launcelot fyrst offeryd al eyght felowes wrapped cered clothe raynes toppe xxx folde put webbe leed coffyn marbyl whan put therth syr launcelot swouned laye longe stylle whyle hermyte came awaked hym sayd ye blame ye dysplese god suche maner sorow makyng truly sayd syr launcelot trust dysplese god knoweth myn entente sorow ony reioysyng synne sorow may neuer haue ende whan remembre hir beaulte hir noblesse bothe wyth hyr kyng wyth hyr whan sawe corp hir corp lye togyders truly myn herte wold serue susteyne careful body also whan remebre defaute myn orgule pryde bothe layed fullowe pereles euer lyuyng cristen people wyt wel sayd syr launcelot remembred kyndenes myn vnkyndenes sanke myn herte myyt susteyne self frensshe book maketh mencyon pcapitulum xii thene syr launcelot neuer ete lytel mete dranke tyl dede seekened dryed dwyned awaye bysshop none felowes myyt make hym ete lytel dranke waxen kyhbet shorter peple coude knowe hym euermore day nyyt prayed somtyme slombred broken slepe euer lyeng grouelyng tombe kyng arthur quene gueneuer comforte bysshop syr bors none felowes coude make hym auaylled soo wythin syx wekye syr launcelot fyl seek laye bedde thenne sente bysshop heremyte al trewe felowes syr launcelot sayd wyth drery steuen syr bysshop praye gyue al ryghtes longeth crysten man shal nede sayd heremyte al felowes heuynesse blood ye shal wel mended grace god morne fayr lordes sayd syr launcelot wyt wel careful body wy therthe houe warnyng wyl say therfo gyue ryghtes whan howselyd enelyd al crysten man ought ha prayed bysshop felowes myght bere body ioyous gar e somme men say anwyk somme may say hamborow sayd syr launcelot repenteth sore made myn auowe somtyme ioyous garde wold buryed cause brekyng myn auowe praye al lede thyder wepyng wryngyng handes among felowes seson nyght al wente theyr beddes alle laye one cham mydnyght ayenst day bysshop hermyte laye bedd slept fyl vpon grete laughter therwyth felyshyp awoke came bysshop asked hym eyled ihu mercy sayd bysshop dyd ye awake neuer al lyf mery wel ease wherfore sayd syr bors truly sayd bysshop syr launcelot mo angellis euer sawe men one day sawe angellys heue vp syr launcelot vnto heuen yates heuen opened ayenst hym dretchyng sweuens sayd syr bors doubte syr launcelot ayleth thynge good may wel sayd bysshop goo ye hedde shall ye proue soth whan syr bors felowes came bedde founde hym starke dede laye smyled swettest sauour aboute hym euer felte wepyng wryngyng handes grettest dole made euer made men morne bysshop dyd masse requyem bysshop al ix knyghtes put syr launcelot hors bere quene gueneuere layed tofore buryed soo bysshop al togydere wente wyth body syr launcelot dayly tyl came ioyous garde euer c torch bernnyng aboute hym within xv dayes came ioyous garde layed corp body quere sange redde many saulters prayes ouer hym aboute hym euer vysage layed open naked al folkes myght beholde hym suche custom tho dayes al men worshyp shold lye wyth open vysage tyl buryed ryght thus theyr seruyce came syr ector de mari vij yere sought al englond scotlond walys sekyng brother syr launcelot pcapitulum xiii whan syr ector herde suche noyse lyghte quyre ioyous garde alyght put hors hym came quyre sawe men synge wepe al knewe syr ector knewe wente syr bors vnto syr ector tolde hym laye brother syr launcelot dede syr ector threwe hys shelde swerde helme hym whan behelde syr launcelottes vysage fyl doun swoun whan waked harde ony tonge telle doleful complayntes made brother launcelot sayd thou hede al crysten knyghtes dare say sayd syr ector thou sir launcelot thou lyest thou neuer matched erthely knyghtes hande thou curtest knyght euer bare sheld thou truest frende thy louar euer besteade hors thou trewest louer synful man euer loued woman thou kyndest man euer stroke wyth swerde thou godelyest persone cam emonge p knyghtes thou mekest man est euer ete halle emonge ladyes thou nest knyght thy mortal soo euer put spere este wepyng dolour thus kepte syr launcelots corp xv dayes buryed grete deuocyon leyser wente al bysshop canterburye ermytage gyder monthe syr costantyn syr cadores sone cornwayl chosen kyng englond ful noble knyght worshyp fully rulyd royame thys kyng costantyn sent bysshop caunterburye herde saye restored vnto bysshopryche lefte ermytage syr bedwere euer stylle heremyte lyues ende syr bors de ganys syr ector de mari syr gah lantyne syr galyhud sir galyhodyn syr blamour syr bleoberys syr wylly t de balyaunt syr clartus clere mounte al knyytes drewe theyr contreyes kyng costantyn wold haue wyth hym wold abyde royame al lyued cuntreyes holy men somme englysshe bookes maken mencyon wente neuer oute englond deth syr launcelot fauour maker frensshe book maketh mencyon auctorysed syr bors syr ector syr blamour syr bleoberis wente holy lande ihesu cryst quycke deed anone stablysshed theyr londes book saith syr launcelot commaunded euer passyd oute thys world foure knyghtes dyd many bataylles vpon myscreantes turkes ded vpon good fryday goddes sake ende booke book kyng arthur noble knyghtes rounde table whan hole togyders euer c xl ende deth arthur praye ientyl men ientyl wymmen redeth book arthur knyghtes begynnyng endyng praye whyle lyue god sende good delyueraunce whan deed praye praye soule book ended ix yere reygne kyng edward fourth syr thomas maleore knyght ihesu helpe hym hys grete myght seruaunt ihesu bothe day nyght pthus endeth thys noble ioyous book entytled le morte darthur notwythstondyng treateth byrth lyf actes sayd kyng arthur noble knyghtes rounde table theyr meruayllous enquestes aduentures thachyeuyng sangreal thende dolorous deth departyng thys world al whiche book reduced englysshe syr thomas malory knyght afore sayd deuyded xxi bookes chapytred enprynted fynysshed thabbey westmestre last day iuyl yere lord cccc lxxxv p caxton fieri fecit
